description:
Came by for lunch with a friend on a Friday. Place had a crowd but plenty of tables. Service was very friendly the entire time and very attentive (to a point where they gave us water on the table but they came and refilled ours cups anyway). 

For our meal my friend and I got the following:
1) Ceviche trio which comes with shrimp ceviche w/ rocoto pepper sauce, shrimp octopus ceviche in aji amarillo sauce, and leche de tigre w/ halibut ceviche. My favorite ceviche has always been the classic leche de tigre and this was a solid version of it. Halibut wasn't overmarinated and "overcooked" by the acid. The sauce wasn't spicy and had a thicker consistency which would make it a great sauce to dip extra chicken into. My second favorite was the rocoto pepper though I liked the aji amarillo almost the same amount. Neither was spicy but the peppers definitely mellow out the tart sauce more which is why I prefer the leche de tigre (plus I prefer shrimp over fish though the shrimp was cut very well and fairly tender). Nice trio dish with good portions. The creaminess and sweetness of the non-roasted choclo was nice though my friend preferred the roasted ones. (4/5)

2) Dark chicken w/ tacu tacu and sweet potato fries w/ aji amarillo sauce: Friend's main entree. The chicken was good and the seasoning on the skin was great but overall not much better than a Costco rotisserie chicken. The sides on the other hand made this dish. The tacu tacu is salty but so delicious. So much flavor and not too heavy on the beans but enough to give the whole thing a slightly starchier and moist texture. The sweet potato fries are average but gawd I love aji amarillo sauce and I haven't had it in so long. It's an addiction (no joke I smuggled a bag full of sauce packets last time I went to Peru). I will smother it on everything. The one here is delicious though a bit salty. That won't stop me from drinking it like water though. (3.75/5)

Overall, my friend and I enjoyed our meal here. Everything was solid. The chicken dish isn't pricy but not necessarily something good enough to warrant a trip here. Would definitely come back for the tacu tacu and aji amarillo sauce though.
author: Vivian C.

description:
I really want to like this place, in fact, I do like this place but the sub par service left a bad taste in my mouth. BUT, aside from the service, the food was good.

I came here for dinner on a Friday evening. Reservation was already made which is great because this place gets so crowded on the weekend, that it seems almost impossible to get a seat without reservation. Reservation was at 7:15pm. I came at 7:20pm. I remember at around 7:22pm, the hostess came over and asked us if we are giving up our seats. I was a little perplexed. Who said anything about giving up our seats? Then she proceeded to say if we don't sit down then we will lose our seat. Usually, restaurants has a 10-15 mins buffer period of how long they'll hold the reservation for. I honestly like we we were being rushed and almost booted. That was a pretty rude. My friend was there on time and I was only 7 minutes late. 

Once we got seated, we were placed in a very crowded area. Other people kept bumping into this. While, we were enjoying our drinks and eating our appetizer, the waiter came over and asked if we could move. Come on...Seriously? Is this how this place treat their customers? The waiter was very nice though. He explained it's because there is a large party and if we would be kind enough to move then they could combine those two tables. Yes, I was very annoyed but we were nice people so we decided to move for them.

Not only that, the food came out very sporadically. First, they forgot to give us our sauce for the yuca fries then we forgot to give us our sauces for our chicken. We had to ask several of times for them to give us what we needed.

I understand the restaurant can get very crowded. And, the waiter was doing his best in such busy traffic hours. But the constant lack of service did leave a bad taste that supersedes the quality of the food. The food was good but the service was very lacking that evening. I will give this restaurant another try and hopefully, the next time I come back, I will have a better experience.
author: Ngoc P.

description:
Love this place! Even though it is quite loud, the atmosphere is fun and the food and drinks are really good. The only downside is how busy it is, but hey, that's just how it is.
This place is packed for dinner on a Friday night! Fortunately, my bf and I were able to get seats at the bar after waiting for a couple to leave. This place seems like a great place for parties and big groups-- there were several celebrations going on.

Ceviche mixto: the fish were actually raw. YES. The marinade isn't too sour (we had the classic marinade), and the taro chips that come with the ceviche were thin and crispy. Great Peruvian ceviche. (5/5)

Lomo saltado: really flavorful and overall delicious. We've never had a dish like this before (fries stir-fried with veggies and meat?) and we're so glad we tried it! (5/5)

I'll definitely be back for more.
author: Christina W.

description:
Are you tired of those hipster places on Valencia st?

Limon Rotisserie is nothing like that. In fact, it has been around for years and I'm glad they're still busy, busy, busy! Their famous free range whole rotisserie chicken is a steal at $29 and it comes with two sides (get the green beans and sweet potato fries)

Even though I wanted to keep dinner to be reasonably doable (which is very possible at Limon), it was girl's night out so half the bill was alcohol! Patron tequila shots at $13 each, a pitcher of sangria at $35 (a creeper according to my gfs!) and a few other cocktails. If you stick with classics like a margarita, then you're safer than their cocktail menu offerings. 

Since we were fatties, we ordered twice the amount empanadas than we should've! 2 orders of the carne, queso and pollo empanadas. Keep in mind that an order already comes with TWO deep fried stuffed pastries, so be careful. You would be remiss not to order the ceviche mixto, a generous sampling of any of the ceviches on the menu at $18. (take that La Mar!) I also loved the arroz con mariscos, even though the presentation could've been better if it was served in a paella pan.

We LOVED Maya as she was such a sweetie and catered to our every request. Yes, GNO mean multiple photo requests that have to be re-taken at least 3x! WTH, I said to my friends. Isn't that what filters are for? * rolls eyes *

Start your Saturday night out at Limon, you'll be guaranteed reasonably priced food, free flowing sangrias and such a great time, you might not even make it to the other bars you planned for the night.
author: Janice C.

description:
Probably my favorite Limon location. We had a large party and they sat us upstairs. I called Saturday day-of for a dinner reservation for 8. Even though there was nothing available online, the host was super accommodating about me changing the reservation time around.

Favorite food items:
- the chicken - YUM. I mean why else come to Limon ROTISSERIE
- yuca fries
- the paella! my favorite

Okay but not musts:
- empanadas - they're fine but not special
- jalea - everything was fried and tasted kind of bland
- ceviche - everyone else liked the ceviche but I think it's just okay. You can find better elsewhere
author: Sophia L.

description:
That's some freaking fantastic chicken. 

Service isn't the greatest (forgot our waters), but the chicken easily makes up for it. We ordered the whole chicken, which came with 2 sides (~$30), and we left the restaurant STUFFED. 

It was the best rotisserie chicken I've ever had - moist, tender, and perfectly seasoned with a bit of citrus-y flavor. The sauce was also crack...I would've slurped it up with a straw if I were looking for 5000 extra calories. SO GOOD. We got the yuca fries on the side, which were also incredible - crispy and salty as good fries should be. Overall, a pretty healthy meal if you discount the fries, chicken skin, and sauce we had.... :)

Our part of 2 came here on a Sunday night and this place was packed, so try to make a reservation (Open Table) if you can.
author: Amy T.

description:
I came to San Francisco to visit my best friend for her bday and she brought me straight to this great restaurant. We both love Peruvian food and had been craving it since we both moved from Orange County (they have our favorite Peruvian restaurant). The place was really cute and super busy... a little loud for my taste. While we waited for our table we ordered a pisco sour and it was delicious. Once we got seated I ordered a pescado a lo macho. Our waiter was incredible and we both loved what we ordered. The pescado a lo macho exceded my expectations. I can't wait to come back! 

Tip. They should ad chupe de camarones to the menu!
author: Yashila S.

description:
Yikes. Limon was not what I expected at all. This restaurant came highly recommended & sorry to say, but it disappointed! First off, make reservations or else you will be waiting upwards of about 1-2 hours. The crowd cleared after 9ish well duh cause who has dinner that late? It is VERY, VERY loud in the restaurant. Felt like I was at a concert where I had to yell at my GF in order for us to have a conversation. They need to think about the spacing of the furniture and give people room to breathe. Our waiter was okay. He was friendly enough and was quick to apologize when something we ordered was not available.  

APPS: Ceviche Mixto [$17.95] The app was probably the best part of the meal... The mixto consisted of the "catch of the day," calamari, shrimp & octopus. Great combo of flavors, but was a tad spicy for me. Would've enjoyed it more with chips, but sadly they ran out.

ENTREES: LENGUA [$13.95] came with 3 small pieces along with mashed potatoes. I've had plenty of lengua before & this dish was the worst I've had. They overcooked the tongue to where it straight up tasted like an Argentinian steak. Tongue is suppose to be softer & more tender than steak & this was not. The tongue was dipped in aji panca sauce (orange Peruvian pepper) which I disliked. Best thing about the plate was the mashed potatoes. I wanted rice for a side, but our waiter suggested TACU TACU [$4.95] which is rice & beans--I liked it! But not enough to raise the rating. It was was exactly what you think rice and beans would taste like mixed together. LOMO SALTADO [$20.95]  Had better. Meat was tough, but the sauce was good. Tasted like Beef Steak (Bistek for all you Filipinos out there) sauce.

All in all, I wouldn't recommend Limon for Peruvian eats. I'm sure there's better restaurants out there. With the crowd, the noise and the odd tasting dishes, it's just missed every mark it was suppose to hit. Don't do it.
author: Rana R.

description:
When I heard dinner was going to be at Limon Rotisserie, I was ecstatic. I recently experienced Limon at the Van Ness location and this place immediately became one of my SF favorites!

The go-to and absolute must is their signature chicken. The boyfriend and I shared the Half Chicken ($18.95) with Chifa Green Beans and Papas Fritas, Pollo Empanadas ($8.95), and Truffle Mac and Cheese ($10.95). The half portion of chicken is perfect for two with two pieces each. The green beans should definitely be the #1 pick for the side here too. I love how flavorful and crispy the green beans are along with the chicken. There's such good and saucy flavor in the seasoning of their ingredients. Of course, don't forget to dip literally everything in the aji amorillo huacatay sauce --so damn yummy! 

I was pretty excited to try the mac and cheese this time, but found it a-okay. The flavor was good, but it definitely could've been cheesier. The sauce was rather watery, which made the dish seem soupy. Even though that was disappointing, I was surprised with the empanadas. As someone who isn't a huge fan of them, the ones here was stuffed with delicious meats in a crispy and light pastry --loved it! I was a bit intimidated by the ingredients in the carne one with things like raisins, boiled egg, and olives, but was rather surprised that it was boldly meaty of beef inside instead.

Lastly, our party of 6 went through three pitchers of sangria ($35 each). It turned out pretty pricey in the end, but great for sharing and groups. The pitcher served a good 8 glasses, so it was worth it. Overall, yummy and tasty Peruvian food with amazing rotisserie chicken. A bit pricey, but worth the splurge every once in awhile.
author: Cindy Z.

description:
Open table will only take reservations up to 6 people so I had to call in for a party of 7 and they were able to accommodate with ease. We decided on family style dinner and ordered 6 dishes to share with a bottle of wine which was perfect for our party. 

Overall food and service was great!
author: Carter L.

description: The rotisserie chicken was so good! I got a quarter dark chicken. I picked yuca and green bean for my sides.  The food definitely reminded me of Peru.  My friend and I didn't order any appetizer. The portion was perfect for myself.  I will definitely come back to try the ceviche.
author: Rachael C.

description:
Stopped in on a busy Friday evening and snagged two seats at the bar. To keep things short, we thought the food was good but very overpriced (as others have hinted at). The service at the bar was pretty poor, which is crazy since usually sitting at the bar means you get the best service! 

Sangria was awesome. 
Chicken was really good.
Green beans were good. 
Yuca frites were good.
Sauces were good. 

If it was a little cheaper and the service slightly better, it'd be a 4 star place.
author: Erik Y.

description:
Excited to finally make it to the city to try Limon, me and my bf had high hopes for this place. The reviews for both location aren't outstanding, but we went purely from word of mouth. Parking was none existent at the old location, as we circled the building ten times and gave up and came to this location. Again, parking was a B and it took some time. About twenty minutes later, we decided to go to the parking garage and just walk. As we turned the corner we found a parking space. $10 later, we were finally on our way....
It smelt so bad on the streets, as the streets were filled with a bunch of homeless people and human feces... We passed a bunch of furniture shops as well as other latin joints that were filled for the Saturday lunch hour. We had arrived to the pinpointed location on yelp, but no limon in sight. I had to ask the lady who was outside hosting for another restaurant. She pointed two doors down and said that was limon. We had passed it up acouple times because of the construction that was happening from what appears to be apartments/condos above the building. There was no signs outside the door to indicate that this was indeed Limon. Enough with that, we were greeted by the host who was quick to get us seats. There was only one other couple at the restaurant so I was a bit skeptical at this point. As my bf got up to go to the bathroom, I kindly asked the waitress if they did anything for birthdays. She said yes and asked which dessert I wanted and said they'd write happy birthday on it. 
Soon after, what appeared to be our server came out to take our order. He started with our drinks in which I got the coffee liquor special, not sure of the name. Bf went with a guava lime mule. The bf got half chicken with two sides. We decided on soy sauce green beans and sweet potato fries. I went with the traditional Lomo Saltado. Mac n cheese for sharing to complete our order. 

Everything came out as planned. My bf's mule was excellent. My coffee was good, but the liquor infused whipped cream threw the drink off. 

My lomo saltado was overly salted and the jasmin rice was over cooked. There is always something wrong with my plate! The meat itself was cooked in soy sauce. It was basic and topped off with red onions to make the dish appear like I got a good portion. For $20something, I would pass on this the next time I am here.

$30 Half chicken was so soft that the ones fell right out. The green beans had a great crunch to them and the sweet potato fries were cooked just right.

Mac n cheese was just so cheesy. (my fav). It was worth the $10! 

During the entire time, our server was stuck behind the bar. We finished our food and just sat and waited. I didn't want to make a scene that we were waiting for the birthday surprise. They finally brought it out. No happy birthday on it. (I hate when people tell me they'll do things, but they don't) The brownie was soft and not overly sweet. It was served with a side of ice cream. 

As the bill came out, I was not expecting to pay for the little brownie. When I ask if the restaurant does anything for birthdays, it's typically complimentary. Anyway, not a big deal, but would have been nice if that was mentioned. It took a while for the server to come back to pick up the check. The food was good, but the service was a bit lacking, espically because the restaurant wasn't busy.
author: Emily L.

description:
30 Sec Review: I see why people love it but overall I find it hit and miss. Great atmosphere, cool food choices, some bomb ceviche, but inconsistent experience from one plate to another.

Pros:
Trendy atmosphere. Variety.

Cons:
Hit & miss on food and drinks.

Food guide:
-Chicken (white meat) - Tasty, pretty solid chicken. Average.
-Ceviche Mixto - This was a winner! Very tasty, is a must.
-Chicharron de Pollo - No thanks. I know it's in a lot of reviews but for me, this was just dry chicken pieces too far gone to really enjoy.
-Avocado Toast with Jamon - Very tasty, but I don't see it on the online menu... might have to ask for it or it's seasonal. 
-Sangria - Really tart and rather off putting really. For me anyway.
-Pico Sour - The egg whites are kinda a turn off for my friend, but to each their own. I wasn't a fan either.
author: Anh N.

description:
NomNomz: 5/5
Cocktails: 4/5
Service: 3/5
Ambiance: Trendy, casual

I don't know how this place doesn't have more 5 stars. I'm definitely biased because of so many great memories at this restaurant with great new friends in a new city. SF  is such an amazing foodie place, and this should be on every tourist list for hidden neighborhood local gems, if it's not already. Prepare yourself for some mouthwatering dishes with insanely good flavors.

I've had just about everything on the menu, and you really can't go wrong. The place is served family style, typically, so everyone can try each dish (highly encouraged). 

Nomz: Start with the Ceviche de Pulpo y Camarones ($17.95) - actually, all the ceviches are amazing - so take your pick. Definitely order a few empanadas ($8.95), and some Yucca Fries ($4.95). We usually split either a half or full chicken depending on party size ($18/$29). So tender and juicy, it's one of the best chickens I've ever had. Hands down. The Paella is on point so definitely add that in the mix. Poke Loko ($14.95) is a tasty cold dish to get, and don't forget the chimichuri sauce on the side - it seriously goes good with every dish so get a few for the table. 

Note: the plates aren't too large, so make sure to order double if you start going through the dishes. Your waiter will most likely recco that if you had a certain amount of people.

Drink fave: They have their signature red Sangria ($7/glass, $35/pitcher) but definitely try at least one Pisco Sour ($13). Their signature Peruvian drink, and they have 3 flavor options. 

Tip: You can bring your own wine if you want, corkage few $15/bottle.

This place is also great for lunch, too. Totally different scene when the sun is out (or Carl, for that matter) and it's more relaxing. Sit up at the bar and you'll get all your dish served as they come out, and the bar tender will make you something yummy/mouth watering for a mid-day drink.
author: Julia N.

description:
Ate here for lunch after running a 5K. Food was delicious!

Ordered Half chicken with yuca fries and tacu tacu (beans and rice), Jalea: crispy seafood mix with corn and yuca with House tartar sauce, and Ceviche de tigre clasico (diced seafood and corn in a citrus marinade) with chips. 

Loved the flavors. Great place!
author: Angelica G.

description:
Came here for a Sunday dinner with family.  We had a larger group, but fortunately, we were able to reserve a table by calling ahead.  

Everybody was hungry, so a large number of plates were ordered so everyone could share the food, family-style.  Service was friendly and prompt, and the food was fantastic.  Group favorites were the ceviche, lomo saltado, and of course, the rotisserie chicken.  The house sangria and agua fresca were great too.  

Place was definitely busy and popular.  Come early or make reservations to enjoy your visit to Limon!
author: G C.

description:
Delicious Peruvian rotisserie chicken and other specialties in the Mission.

Very busy so be sure to make a reservation if you have a larger party (ours was 9). We still had to wait around 15 minutes but the food was completely worth it.

Very loud so don't expect to have an intimate conversation.

Would definitely go back as it is a fun restaurant and all of the apps and entrees (and drinks) we had were tasty.
author: Jesse B.

description:
Really great food, but I chose the wrong place on a wrong day. Let's take things in that order?

Peruvian food was all the hotness a few years back, and I'm glad that it was given more attention. Some of the nuanced, regional dishes are still harder to find, and who even knows if you can get chifa (but then again, I'll take straight-up Chinese over the Peruvian stuff any day) but you're probably still going to find the staples--the pollo a la brasa, lomo saltado, anticuchos--at a lot of the new crop of Peruvian places.

We ordered some of that pollo, because it seems a crime not to. Rotisserie chicken did me right. So juicy, so flavorful, and I love the salty outside and sweet, tender inside. I as puzzled at the truffle mac n' cheese. Is this a Peruvian thing? I dunno, but I heard it was good so we ordered it. Confirmed.

Here's the real rub, though. Maybe I was a little tired from travels, but I was eager to leave when my meal was done. It's SO LOUD in there, and they pack in the tables really close together. Where I was catching up with a friend, it was just the wrong choice. But I'm having a hard time imagining when it would be the right choice. Have I turned into that old man? I'd like to think I can still hang with the hip crowd; I've spent many a night in loud establishments hanging with homies. But this was too much, and the hustle of the people needing to turn tables, and the fact that I was elbow to elbow with the next table... I was glad to get back out to the street.

In off hours, this would be a great spot. That chicken. But if it's a bumpin' I think I'd save my saltadito appetite for another day.
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
This place definitely gets busy in the afternoon! Luckily got there a little bit before the rush, around 12pm and didn't have to wait to be seated. tldr; get the truffle mac and chee

Food:
Truffle Mac and Cheese (6/5): Honestly my favorite mac and cheese that i have ever had. There was the right amount of cheese and it was realllll gouda (idk if they used gouda cheese, just saying it for the pun, sorry). The truffle taste really accentuated the fish and ugh the texture. I'd want to eat this for all three meals, because dang, my mouth is watering just recounting the mac and cheese. So yeah, I highly recommend getting this. 

Ceviche Mixto (4/5): refreshing, there was a good mix and interesting flavor to this dish. The sauce offered a slight sour and acidic taste that went well with the ceviche. It wasn't quite my cup of tea, so I don't think I would order it again, but if you like ceviche, then this would be a good pick!

Lomo Saltado (4/5): the sauce on this was so good, it made me even eat the cooked onions and tomatoes (which i normally don't do, whoops). The beef tenderloin was also amazing and not dry at all, a good amount of chewy and melt going on with it. Oh and the fries, I mean, I can't hate on the fries, they were such a twist, but in a great way. The only downfall of this dish was the rice, it was slightly mushy and took away from the flavors of the dish, and just didn't taste quite fresh unfortunately. 

Service was nice, but we did have to wait awhile for our truffle mac and cheese and I had to ask, after we had almost finished our first two dishes, on whether or not we were getting it (i'm very glad that we got it, because oh my was that the highlight of that meal). It also got a bit hectic later in the afternoon because of the lunch rush and getting the bill back took a little bit too, but overall quite good!! Would definitely come again (esp for that truffle mac and cheese)!
author: Jennifer Y.

description:
We came here on Cinco de Mayo and the place was happening.  We had the empanadas the trio of ceviche the fried seafood half a chicken yucca fries, green beans and mango panna cotta - everything was highly satisfactory!  Our waitress was a sweetie pie!

The only thing that could've been better was if the noise level was one notch down.  we basically had to scream so we could hear each other but overall the experience was delicious and so much fun. it's no wonder they have four restaurants across the bay area the food was very delicious and reasonably priced!

I would recommend coming back here.
author: Meme E.

description:
This is a great place to go for group meals because they have large tables and you get to share a variety of items from the menu. The prices are very reasonable and I enjoyed every dish we ordered.
- Whole Chicken (8 pieces): the chicken was cooked super well and was flavorful
- Limon's Ceviche Trio: I really liked the shrimp and octopus ceviche. The red snapper ceviche was ok but I could've done without it
- Lomo Saltado: the beef tenderloin was so tender and delicious, I'm definitely ordering this again
- True Mac & Cheese: unless you hate truffles, you HAVE to order this. Possibly the best mac & cheese I've had in SF
author: Helen P.

description:
My go to date night spot! The chicken is phenomenal. Recommend getting the ceviche mixto with yuca chips as well as the green beans and sangria pitcher. 

Making a reservation in advanced is always helpful
author: Kendall C.

description:
I've had the most expensive chicken in San Francisco, but Limón's chicken is still my favorite! The sauces are a big part of what makes their chicken taste so good. I also like their ceviche mixto for the lemon juice -- it leaves a tasty feeling in my mouth.

The only bad part is that they raised their prices and got more crowded since I first came here. Otherwise, I would probably eat here more often.
author: Andrea T.

description:
I have been here couple times and everything was good, but I was disappointed yesterday (08/06) by the service and food which is called a signature dish. 
I had the ceviche mixto with classico sauce. I wouldn't get it again. 
I sat at the bar. The Bartender/ Waitress didn't give me a fork, knife, plate and napkin.I had to ask it to the busboy who brought my food. She was busy to chat with the other workers. 
Also,nobody refilled my water. I had to request more water from another busboy. I asked a box for my leftover, she brought me a box which was wet and not really clean. 
Lastly, she gave the bill without saying "thank you".
author: Öznur Y.

description:
I came here on a Monday evening to catch dinner with a friend. We ordered empanadas to share. I ordered a ceviche for my entree and my friend ordered a separate entree. The empanadas came out fast and my ceviche right afterwards. We sat for at least twenty minutes with my food (waitress already removed the empanadas plate) waiting for my friends entree to arrive. We finally flagged down the waitress who clearly forgot to submit my friends order. She asked what she had ordered and I subsequently watched her enter the order into the machine. When my friends food came she never apologized or admitted to forgetting the ordered. After dropping off my friends entree the waitress never came back to check on our food. We were clearly done with your plates for quite a while and had to ask another waiter to give us our check. 

I am very disappointed in the extremely poor quality of service. We were not compensated for any food or drinks. The service completely ruined our night and for $50/person this is not ok.
author: Sierra L.

description:
Yet again, another great meal at one of my favorite restaurants in the Bay Area. They were nice to hold my reservation, even though my friends were 20 minutes late! 

Started off with a pitcher of their tasty margarita. For 4 people, everyone gets one full glass each. For food we got the mushrooms and the half chicken with tacu tacu and green beans. Mushrooms are the perfect appetizer dish! The creamy sauce is so tasty, we made sure to save it to dip our chicken in. Chicken is cooked perfectly and a half is the perfect size for 2 people. Crispy skin and moist chicken meat, you have to get it! 

Ive never had a bad service experience here. They always try their best to make everyone's experience amazing! I'll be looking forward to my next visit!
author: Courtney N.

description:
Been to Limon a couple of times now. Having also recently traveled to Peru, I've decided Limon is pretentious and overpriced for Peruvian food.

Usually order:
-whole chicken: these are the teeny tiniest chickens you'll ever see, and kind of dry
-green beans and tacu tacu: salty AF
-sangria: watered down
-ceviche trio: this is actually quite fresh and delicious, request more chips when you run out 
-paella: mushy, I preferred the hard crusty-bottom and this variation without was mediocre at best
-poke: good! A rare larger serving size

The worst part of my recent experience at Limon was the unexpected cake cutting fee! I had bought and brought a cake for my friend's birthday dinner at Limon. And when we asked for a knife to cut it, they told us about the cutting fee. 2 dollars per slice! It seemed outrageous and unwarranted. 

Also!! They charge $3 for taro chips. WHICH YOU NEED AS THE VEHICLE TO MOVE CEVICHE INTO YOUR MOUTH. Ugh.

I won't be back.
author: Cindy T.

description:
One of my Chef friends suggested we check out limon and true to form, it was fantastic.  Firstly get a reservation cuz it gets packed.  Secondly upstairs for the Valencia location is way louder than downstairs.

Super friendly service greats you and everything although busy was efficient 

Now the food was on point.  We had the roasted chicken which was a 3.5 to 4 lbs variety.  Brined, roared and juicy.  Also got the fish and calamari platter.  This was soooooo good as the fish was juicy and succulent.  The trio of ceviches come w various levels of heat.  If you haven't JD Peruvian food and think you can handle spicy.  Step up to rocoto then see haw ya do.  Not going to say too spicy but you've been noticed. 

Bathrooms: Hella nice.  Leave a little Oakland there to keep it real.
author: Dude D.

description: The food was really good, it was just the service that wasn't that great it took us at least 35 mins to get our food so we were kinda just waiting. saw other people that arrived after us eating and we had to ask our server twice to check on our food. So if you have time sure wait but other wise it's not worth it!
author: Jasmine B.

description:
The first time I came here, I was sad because I gave up meat for 40 days and I couldn't eat the chicken. I don't remember much except that the mac n cheese was super good (I mean, anything with truffle is heaven).
 
Fast forward to many years later and I finally tried the chicken! So juicy and delicious. Our party of 4 got the whole chicken and it was perfect. We also really liked the green beans; had a bit of a kick to it but it was nice & crispy. The Leche de Tigre ceviche was so bomb but so SPICY... it's a bummer that their chip to ceviche ratio was a little low. They only gave 2 chips, what the heck?! And then you're charged extra when you ask for more. Please serve more chips with your ceviche!!!!

I do agree with some of the yelpers - it's really loud in there. And it's so cramped; I couldn't get up to use the restroom without asking the person behind me to move. 

Anyway, great food overall and the servers are nice and prompt. Just remember to come here when it's NOT lent and order the chicken!!
author: Arielle G.

description:
Omg. Now I know why everyone loves Limon. The food here is amazing!! And I don't give many 5 stars. 

What we had: 
*Ceviche Mixto - so fresh and used the leftover juices to top on our chicken 
*Chicken Empanadas - this was bombb. We kept the sauce to dip the chicken after too! 
*Tuna tartare - also so good. Def recommend 
*Half chicken with rice and green beans - so juicyy. Dip in the aji amarillo sauce or ceviche sauce!! 
*Yuca fries - good too, but don't need to get as a separate side. 

Great service as well. Took 20 minutes after our reservation but they gave us sangria on the house for making us wait. And it was delicious too, thanks Limon!! Their pisco sour was really good and strong too. 

My friends who also love this place mention that their lomo saltado, fried pig, paella, and ribeye were their favorites. So looks like I have to come back!!
author: Raquel Y.

description:
I seem to remember this place being much better when I've been before, but maybe I was misjudging it coming from being at Dolores Park and drinking all day...but then again, I came from there this past time too! Perhaps, I just was less tipsy...I came in a group of four both times after making last minute reservations and ordering a whole rotisserie chicken, sides, drinks, and plates to share. 

First of all, we were ready to order for 15 minutes before somebody approached us and we could order. When the chicken came out, we questioned whether it was a whole chicken because it looked much smaller this time around and it wasn't as juicy as I remembered either. The sides were okay; i suggest the rice and beans and the fries out of everything. The sangria here is also way too sweet, so just stick with a wine if that's what you're feeling. 

I consider the chicken to be the best main course on the menu and it really disappointed me. This was my third time at this chain of restaurants and I think it will also be my last - Hawker Fare down the street has been more crave-worthy and a lot more satisfying after a day at the park!
author: Samira I.

description:
They ask if you want the chips for the table - always say yes! So good :) 
We loved the ceviche classico. The rotisserie chicken was great as was the sauce that came with it. You have to plan ahead because this spot is always super crowded but if it were easier to find a spot, this would be our go-to for a causal dinner in SF. Definitely recommend!
author: Radhika K.

description:
Found a gnat in my food when I was eating chicken. I let the waiter know and he acted like this was totally ok because it didn't come from the food preparation on purpose. They didn't give any apology, discount, new food, nothing. He asked very briskly if I needed something because it's not their fault.

This kind of attitude really irritates me. They know their a big restaurant with plenty of customers so they can get away with it. In other restaurants, people have offered something, or many things, for finding a mistake. Instead he made me feel immediately like a jerk for bringing it up. 

If you want to risk having bugs in your food with no apology then go for it.
author: Kara C.

description:
OMG some of these yelp reviewers are completely clueless. The "Chicharron de Pollo was too fried and crispy". Perhaps you could have considered that before ordering Chicharron de Pollo aka Fried chicken bites. LoL

Some of the others are so pretentious that I want to throw up. I could only image how horrible these people are in their day to day life.

I was there a couple years ago and am headed back tonight. Please don't sit our table by "elite yelpers" thank you!
author: Allen A.

description:
Really liked this place. Tried the half chicken with all four sauces, yuca fries and tacu-tacu which was their marinated rice and beans. Of course this is their signature dish, what people crowd this place for and Of course delicious. My favorite actually was....lengua a la Parilla. Grilled beef tongue. Sounds gross...draws up  images...but went for it. I'm adventurous.  And loved it!!! Slightly chewy texture with a crunchy exterior. So good! Would order again without a doubt. For drinks had their sangria, which how can you go wrong with sangria..They put extra cinnamon which made it even more perfect. Would def come back. Place gets packed and fills up quick, even on weeknights. Upstairs dining available. Waitstaff super friendly and efficient. 
Love it here.
author: Linda H.

description:
Came here for a late dinner last Friday and was pleasantly surprised by how good everything was. The service was good, the margaritas were decent, and the food was great. 

I would have loved some A/C, but it's not the restaurant's fault we had a horrible heatwave that weekend. 

We ordered Carne Empanadas, Sweet Potato Fries, Tacu Tacu, Polli Papa, and a full rotisserie chicken. Oh and a pitcher of margaritas to boot. 

The empanadas were okay. Not the best (not enough cumin in my opinion). The best empanadas I've had in the city were at Porteño's in the ferry building. 

The sweet potato fries were surprisingly good. Not because I didn't think the food would be good but I generally don't put Peruvian food and sweet potato fries together (my mistake 10/10 would order again). 

The tacu tacu was really good. The beans and rice were cooked exceptionally. 

The polli papa (aka Peruvian poutine) was awesome. The sauce it comes with is really really great. 

Lastly, the rotisserie chicken. Oh my, the rotisserie chicken!! It was sooooo good. Can't say enough how much I want to eat more of this. I will definitely be back.
author: Nick D.

description:
I've been to Limon several times and I never had a bad experience. The first time I had Limon was actually at the location in Fresno when my boyfriend and I accidentally stumbled across it. We were so happy when we found out there are multiple locations near home! I have got to say Limon is one of my favorite restaurants.

Food - I have tried multiple dishes and they are all really good! I love their starchy Yuca fries and some of the dishes I tried and love are:

*Pollo A La Brasa (Limon's signature marinated chicken)
*Ceviche
*Lomo Saltado - Cubed beef with fries, soy sauce, stir fried veggies
*Arroz Con Mariscos (Paella)

Drinks - A pitcher of Sangria is $35 and a pitcher of margarita is $40! Perfect to share with yoru party.

Service - Service is usually quick and the food is always consistent.

Ambiance - This location has a bar and there is additional seating upstairs. I usually come here on a weeknight and the restaurant is pretty full. I recommend making reservations! It is a great place for a big or small group dinner and over drinks!
author: Allie Y.

description:
MAKE RESERVATIONS! I cannot stress this enough, especially for the weekend. The atmosphere of this place is trendy but also laid back. Would be good for a date or for a girls night. 

We got a half bird, which was crisp and well seasoned. However, the stand outs for me were the truffle mac n cheese and the ensalada rusa. The salad was refreshing - I don't normally care for beets but I liked them here! The truffle mac n cheese was very rich and filling. We also got vegetarian empanadas, sweet potato fries, and yucca fries, all of which were good. Get the tres leches for dessert! It's small enough to be eaten by one but also good for a few shared bites with friends.
author: Maria Kim N.

description:
I have been to Limon a couple of times and the experience was always the same, great food with mediocre service. I decided to give them another chance and came in for dinner to celebrate a very special occasion for myself and my better half. Oh my god!!!! This time was even worse. Our sever Alejandra had a pathetic attitude to begin with, al she ever did was take our order and process the payment, at no point she check on us. Whenever she brought anything to the table she would just dropped it like she had an Agenda to make us feel uncomfortable. We order dessert at the end of the meal and she just put down the plates with a look on her face like she was disgusted with us being there. I felt like screaming and saying something but my husband told me not to say anything, he works in the service industry so he does not like to complain about anything.
Overall this is a good place to eat but be prepare you will not get any service. They should just built a counter where you can just order your food and don't have to deal with servers who seem to hate their job or hate costumers.
author: Gloria M.

description: My favorite restaurant in SF. Great food and really nice cocktails. I always get the chicken. Great date spot.
author: Jason G.

description:
I absolutely loved this place! We came with a group of 11 and we all enjoyed our food! It's a fun place to come with friends, but during dinner time the place got really loud. We were nearly yelling at each other. Maybe not a good place to go with someone you want a quiet night with? 

The food was delicious! You can get a chicken place with 2 sides for a good price ($12 for quarter dark or white)! The green beans and sweet potato fries were the pick of the night!

The restaurant is set up nicely and bathrooms are clean :) overall the experience was great and the location is ideal if you're planing on going out to the bars in the mission afterwards!
author: Mako U.

description: As always, Limón is a great place for groups. Each year we have our National Game Watch event at Limón and we are never disappointed. The food, cocktails, and the service definitely earns five stars consistently.
author: Danielle S.

description:
Hey! 
It's my first time coming in, and I had legit the best experience... the bartender was so helpful, sadly I cant remember his name but had a sick set of braids... will definitely be back soon! 
Thank you 
Sincerely yours 
Ale
author: Alessandra K.

description:
Pollo A La Brasa w/ Yuca Fries & Sweet Potatoes (5/5):  The chicken was juicy and the skin was very flavorful. Yuca Fries were delicious and the mustard aioli dipping sauce was phenomenal.

Lomo Saltado (2/5):  The meat was perfectly medium-rare and I would enjoy it as a steak, but it was drenched in soy sauce without much else to balance out the saltiness from the soy sauce. There were two pieces of tomatoes and everything else was fully covered in soy sauce. For $19, it wasn't very filling or satisfying. I would not order this again.

Overall, it was a decent experience. Service was good, but the lomo saltado wasn't very good.  I had a headache right after this meal and I think it was because of the sodium from the lomo saltado.
author: Vu P.

description:
Would heavily argue for a solid 4-star rating here. Although definitely pricey, the ambiance, presentation, and food quality overall earn Limón a 4. 

*Tip* They accept call aheads, so plan to call around 30-45 minutes before to put your name on the list. We called ahead on Saturday and put our name on the ~1 hr wait list.

Our meal included the half rotisserie chicken (their signature), Ceviche trio, queso empanadas, and ahi tuna salad. We pretty much loved all the dishes, but my one reservation would be that the ceviche trio came with a lot of shrimp (not complaining just thinking bang-for-buck), so it may make sense to go with one of the other single ceviches. However, the chicken that comes with two sides lived up to the hype along with the sweet potato fries and green beans. I also personally loved the ahi tuna salad, which they had in place of the poke--added greens to our meal. Then the empanadas while delicious, were pretty much just breading and cheese (again, not complaining), but think there are more "signature" empanadas we could have tried. 

Would come back, just hopefully on someone else's dime next time :) !
author: Kyle S.

description: Limon's Ceviche Mixto would be my last meal on death row. It's that good. I've been to this location probably a dozen times and have always had a great experience, both with service and food. Also highly recommend the yuca fries and the lychee sour.
author: Vika M.

description:
I was with my colleague for work in the Valencia area and saw Limon with no lines outside.  Yes, we immediately took front center and ate at the bar.  LOL  :p (no I didn't order whiskey though very tempted)  Heck, it was in the middle of the day....  Hahahah

I really love their mac and cheese.  Their empenada was also delicious.  Not bad on their Half chicken tacu tacu with veggies.  Very flavorful.  I love the presentation, the service was great, and I would highly recommend you come here around 3ish when the lunch crowed has returned to their cubicles, so you can enjoy your meal and sit at the bar.  :p

Cheers!
author: Edwin R.

description:
Limon has been one of my favorites for the past few years. Their flavor is always consistent and never disappoints. This last experience, however, left much to be desired. 

First, I wish they never closed the third street location because it was much more family friendly. The Valencia location is EXTREMELY loud! It was quite nerve racking and didn't make for a very pleasant eating experience. 

Second, the presentation and portions of food felt like a joke. The Lomo Saltado we had in the past did not have French fries tossed in. It looked like something that was just thrown together. 

If you get chicken, get the whole chicken! Anything less wont be enough to feed anyone, they're WAY TOO small.

Overall, they have a lot to improve on to get back to how good they used to be.
author: Ryan A.

description:
We haven't been here for a while and its still an excellent choice.

We started with the Limon cerviche trio - Great Sampler

1) Loma Saltado was good.  - they overcooked the tenderloin.  I should have asked them to prepare it medium rare.  my fault

2) Pecado a la Macho - excellent

3)  quarter white chicken - how can you go wrong.


Desert: Panna Cotta de Mango.   You can't leave without having this desert!

What makes the restaurant good. Peruvian Spices and a great kitchen staff to prepare your meal
author: Mark S.

description:
Limon was one of the first restaurants to represent Peruvian food in a fine dining atmosphere in SF. 
The menu options are what you'd expect- Pisco Sours, Lomo Saltado, ceviche... but the flavors are exponentially better than you can imagine! 

They have 2 types of chicken- both are amazing, teeming with juicy flavors. 
One is slowly roasted over open flame and the other is fried to crispy perfection. The flavor comes from the delicious marinade and the accompanying aji and chimichurri dipping sauces. 

The Pisco Sours are beautiful and tart. My favorite part is the velvety egg white on top for an extra layer of sophistication. There are 3 flavors: classic, passion fruit, and lychee. 

Fun fact: They make a truffle mac n cheese that's out of this world. 

Also, if you like Mexican ceviche, try the Peruvian version- they're not the same. The preparation and flavors are unique, in a very good way. 

There's so much more on the menu so make sure to book a table soon!
author: Mitzi G.

description:
We came on a Wednesday evening, it wasn't too crowded and we had a good time.

The Truffle Mac & Cheese for $9.95 was OK, and we passed it around to share.

The Lomo Saltado for $19.95 was good; the sauce was a bit too salty for me; but, I'd order it again. I'd recommend getting a side of Chimichurri sauce for $2 to dip the meat in.

The side of Yuca Fries for $4.95 were good.

Overall, I'd give it a 4 star experience.

Someday, I'll have to go back to try the Chicken...
author: Roy C.

description:
We made reservations on a Wednesday night, the place was FULL. Great atmosphere, super friendly staff. They do like to take orders quickly, due to them being busy.  The drinks are okay, a bit on the sweet side. Food was good for Peruvian style. I had the Lomo, which I recommend if you want steak ( medium rare ) rice, veggies. I wouldn't order the yuca fries, you can always buy that at taquerias and still taste the same. They have no special flavor.... the truffle Mac and cheese was alright...... wouldn't order it again...... we ordered the churrasco, as well ( sorry no pics ) that was YUMMY. Get it medium rare! Staff was friendly and super fast w everything. 
Thanks, for a great experience Limon!!! 

Pictures below are drinks we had, the Lomo, Mac and cheese, yuca and veggies.
FOOD WAS GOOD, but a party of 7, they automatically charge a 20% of gratuity ... when did gratuity became 20%
author: Melissa H.

description:
Very disappointing! 

My family and I were thoroughly enjoying my birthday dinner celebration when the waitress interrupted our conversation and told us in a surprisingly aggressive manner that we needed to leave the table so another party could be seated. My first reaction was that we must have lost track of time, and we were being rude for taking too much time at our table. 

I quickly realized that it was the waitress who was being rude. 

The timeline is important here: 
 * Our reservation was for 8:00 PM. 
 * We were seated at 8:10 PM.
 * We finished our dinner and paid at around 8:50 PM.
 * We were told to leave at 8:55 PM.

If you are considering Limon for a relaxing dinner with friends or a special occasion, let that sink in. We were being told to leave 45 minutes after we had been seated and within 5 minutes of paying our bill. If she had only waited 5 or 10 more minutes, we would have left as happy customers likely to return.

One more thing, there was only one party of four waiting for a table and multiple tables who were finished with their dinners. That party's wait would not have been long even if we had been allowed to finish our conversation.

Ours is not an isolated experience. Many of the 1- and 2-star reviews for this restaurant complain about the owner's obsession to turn tables at the expense of basic hospitality. 

I won't be back.
author: Jim K.

description: This place is really good.  My friend wanted me to try it out, and I left wanting another trip to this restaurant.  Apparently, this place is normally pretty crowded.  I started at the bar since there was a wait, but was later seated with my part.  The energy was nice, and the interior decor gave off a pretty relaxing vibe.  I ordered duck curry, and t was really good.  I tried my friends orders and everyone's food was delicious.  I would recommend this place to anyone.
author: Bradley S.

description:
This place is right next to my old office and we brought new hires here often because the food is really good. Many people complain about the long wait (duh, good places have long waits) and the aggressive turning of tables, but I've not felt like they kicked me out of my table early.  

-Rotisserie chicken is delicious, very juicy and flavorful. 
-Lomo saltado is amongst the best I've had
-Ceviches: I've tried all of their variety of ceviches, which have been from good to great.  
-Pulpo (octopus) is generally very good too, I only once had it when it was slightly over cooked. 
-Mac & cheese: it's really good but why do they have this at a Peruvian restaurant? 

Cocktails are good if a bit pricey for the size. Service is generally ok...efficient and focused on quickly turning tables.
author: Dave R.

description: Came for dinner and we had made reservation ahead of time.   We ordered their popular chicken rotisserie dish and a beef dish.  For drinks we had inka cola and ginger twist hot tea.  Foods were delicous and drinks were refreshing.  Service was quick and friendly.  We had an awesome dinner overall.  Atmosphere was lively and warm.  Price is reasonable for the type of dishes they served.  Parking is bad so we used public transportation to avoid parking overall.
author: Sydney T.

description: They have the best chicken ever. I went for a girlfriend's birthday and we ordered a bunch of different plates and everything was delicious, especially the chicken!!! And wow the sauces were also amazing.
author: Lillian W.

description:
Pleasure pleasure pleasure. It is a small crowded place all the time but with great surprise I manage to get a table as we walked in. Just 2 of us made it easier. 

Super delicious ceviche. Very well done and big portion. 

The chicken was superb as also the paella. 

Service super nice and fast. 

It is a famous name which keeps striking it. Well done
author: Gianguido G.

description:
WHY WE WENT HERE:
- cousin's birthday dinner
- the Valencia St location was chosen because it was more accessible for everyone in the party (i.e. to drive in, be dropped off, or BART-able)

THE LOOK (FROM THE OUTSIDE/INSIDE):
- modern-looking signage
- large window front allows you to see the intimate-lit interior with both main floor seating and overflow upstairs seating
- partial view of the food being prepared in the back right 
- modern decor
- bathrooms are VERY clean and smell good! (be mindful these are single person restrooms)
- reggaeton played, but was very difficult to hear because of how loud it can get in the restaurant unless you were in the bathroom

THE MENU (DRINKS):
- pisco sours
- sangria
- margarita
- cerveza
- chilcanos
- vinos
- specialty cocktails
- non alcoholic drinks

THE MENU (FOOD):
- el pollo a la brasa
- ceviches
- el chef
- aji sauces
- hot plates
- cold plates
- sides
- empanadas
- limon specials

WHAT WE ORDERED (below is what I tasted; other things were ordered by the party that I didn't partake in):
- pitchers of Limon's Red Sangria
- lengua a la parilla
- truffle mac & cheese
- carne a la parilla

THE TASTE:
- everything was AMAZINGLY good and presentation was fantastic
- majority of us in the party haven't been to Limon before and were unaware of the small portion size; so I'd highly recommend on sharing dishes with one another and ordering multiple things in order to get your fill

CUSTOMER SERVICE:
- we had one server who was the real MVP with regards to everyone's orders (various food and adult beverage orders)
- everything came out in a timely fashion
author: Sarah-Lorraine L.

description:
How is this place only 3.5 stars?  I didn't pay for the dinner (I was treated very generously by family members), but maybe it was the price.  The food here is amazing. The roasted chicken, the ceviche, the Mac and cheese.  Everything was good.  

We came here with seven people no reservations. We're seated after waiting about four minutes.  The food came out after about five minutes.  The service was perfect.  I'll come back for sure.
author: Richard T.

description:
Veryyyy delicious.... I groups of my very close girlfriends made reservations here for my birthday dinner and I must say we all were very pleased. 
I really enjoyed the se I de cosillas and the ceviche mixto. 

I highly recommend!
author: Krystal R.

description:
Food and service were fabulous!! We ordered the truffle mac and cheese; the paella; limon ceviche trio and lomo saltado!!! We also ordered a pitcher of sangria. The rest of the table
Had Pisco sour and It looked divine. Definitely will return!!!
author: Michelle D.

description:
Chicken was indeed delicious when accompanied by Aji sauce. An order of a whole chicken can feed two people with two sides. We weren't too happy with the service at the end when I questioned the waitress about the "surcharge" on the bill, not to mention there is already SF mandate 4% charge on the bill. The waitress gave us an attitude and said "it is mandatory by the city" in a bad tone. 

Tables were right next to each other and wasn't too comfortable.
author: Carrie Z.

description:
Make a reservation because this places gets extremely busy and after eating here, now I know why!

5/5: Amazingly delicious food. Tapas and large plates for individual meals or to share family style. Our group ordered the half chicken with rice and green beans, chicharron with beans and rice, grilled octopus on top of a bed of mash, paella, 2 carne empanadas with their house yellow sauce and bread pudding.

Everything was made to perfection. The chicken was full of flavor and very moist. The chicharron had a terrific crunch with a tender inside. The octopus was grilled enough where it was crisp and not chewy. The paella melts in your mouth like butter.  The empanadas had a flakey dough with a wonderful filling.  The yellow dipping sauce was out of this world.  The bread pudding... well let's just say I didn't share it!!!

5/5: Service was quick. Food and drinks, sangria, came out just minutes after ordering.

4/5: Ambiance is loud so it's hard to have a normal conversation without having to raise your voice.
author: J B.

description:
I am a lomo saltado lover. My co-worker had recently been telling me about this amazing Peruvian place that makes delicious lomo saltado (for $17.95) and it happened to be the very place I had on my bookmark list for months. 

Since my lunch is only an hour we decided on take out. When I first opened up my to-go box, it really didn't look very spectacular and the portion was on the smaller side. However, my first bite was addictingly magical.  The rice was cooked perfectly and absorbed the delicious meat and sauce juices. The sirloin steak was juicy, the bell peppers, tomatoes, French fries, and sauces married so well!  This dish was delicious. Like one of the best lomo saltado dishes I have had. The only minor detail was that it was on the salty side for me, but thankfully the jasmine rice was a nice neutral carb to soften the saltiness. Overall, great dish that I would love to come back for. Next time I would love to sit in the restaurant as it has great ambiance with an open kitchen and bar so that you can really immerse yourself and soak up the scene.
author: Melissa N.

description: This an amazing place! The food is just delicious And they serve a good amount the steak is really amazing And the ceviche too! The paella is the best! Service is good too! 5 stars
author: G R.

description: Terrible experience at this restaurant. I love Peruvian Food and came in for the Lomo Saltado, but this was over priced for the quality, portion and overall experience. The ambience is overwhelming. Too much noise, the server was slow and the bartender did not get my simple drink done correctly. I usually never review on Yelp but this was one to be shared. Overall, I do not recommend this restaurant, if you want authentic Peruvian food, other options are available! This restaurant is also notorious for bringing down their bad Yelp reviews! So hopefully this one doesn't.
author: Darling P.

description:
arrived at 9:15(they closes at 10) for table of 2, there was a table by the window but the host said that's a 4 person table and walk us to sit at the lower bar, that 4 person table end up with nobody, and come on, it's 45 minutes before closing. the lower bar was so tall with their lower chairs designed for their own tables, our entire meal is awkward. we asked for 3 dishes, one of them is mushroom, the bartender(not the best server) ordered mac and cheese for us, the entire time he was washing things and trying to close his bar(basically ignoring us), asked him for ketchup and hot sauce, but he never gave us, too busy cleaning his bar. I asked the guy who bought out our food, he only bought out ketchup and no hot sauce, had to ask him again. all of this bad service and in the end, the bill came and they charged us $2 for hot sauce? are you freaking kidding me? no thanks, I will not return! If it wasn't for all the bus boys and kitchen staffs I would leave ZERO tip!
(on the side note, I wonder if we were not Asians they'd give us the table we asked)
author: Jordan D.

description:
Heard good things about Limon Rotisserie so decided to check it out with the family on Friday night. Ordered a whole roast chicken and enjoyed watching the roasts rotate in the open kitchen's oven. We began with fresh ceviche and two Pisco sours, Peru's national drink. The chicken came tender and with nicely browned skin - enough to feed three adults. The tangy aioli conidiment, made from Peruvian yellow chili peppers, was a welcome accompaniment. Green beans and papas fritas rounded out the meal. 

Yes, the atmosphere is loud and raucous. We ate in upstairs with its no-frills décor but a nice overview of the buzzing main dining room. Service was fast; we were in and out the door in 65 minutes to catch a nearby show.
author: JD L.

description: Love the food  drinks are amazing  and service is the best waitress always smiling and checking on us we  need anything.
author: MARIA T.

description: Came here on a whim for brunch. Originally we were a little disappointed they didn't have any "brunch"/breakfast options, but the food we did order quickly made up for it. We got the pulpo a la parilla and the jalea to split, and both were really delicious. The pulpo a la parilla was honestly one of the best octopus dishes I have had - it was perfectly cooked and flavorful. I would definitely come back.
author: Mia S.

description:
Solid choice for a group dinner. Warning - they put most large groups upstairs and due to the building's structure, it gets very very noisy. However, it's great this restaurant is able to accommodate such large groups. We did a walk in with 12 of us (yes, a bold move) and they were still able to seat us within an 1.5hr on a Saturday night. 

As for the food, they definitely have some decent options. The cerviche is pretty up to par, and the fries are pretty tasty, as well as the empanadas. Of course, the rotisserie chicken is also pretty yum if you're interested in that. However, we ordered a set meal (as we were such a big group). I thought most items were good but the value could have been better. Although we had quite a few drinks, I thought what the bill tab was pretty expensive for what we got. 

Overall, a pretty good, but not amazing choice for dinner. If you have large group, go for it. You'll get a good dinner and a restaurant that will accommodate for the madness. However, IF you are looking for something low key for a small to mid sized group, I would suggest maybe searching for something else.
author: Grace A.

description:
The chicken is really good
Sangria is amazing
Prices are very reasonable

If you are hungry and want something tasty without breaking the bank...
author: Shay M.

description:
Lunchtime experience on a Thursday - 

Came here with my co-workers at around 12:30PM-ish and there was absolutely no wait at all. The waiter/host sat us down and gave us menus immediately. There was no rush to decide on what to order and once we knew, we flagged down the waiter with ease. Even had some questions if he knew about some things on the menu (gluten free and etc). 

Food - 

Truffle Mac & Cheese - Wow so creamy and rich. I always feel like I'm devouring some type of delicacy or a dessert that's full of rich flavor.

Lengua a la Parilla - Literally marinated and plated to perfection, with yummy Yukon mashed potatoes dressed with chimchurri and aji panca sauce. Each piece of lengua is so tender and delicate (Three long pieces of lengua). A must for lengua lovers like myself.

Camote Fries - Basically sweet potato fries. It was pretty good but nothing spectacular.

Yuka Fries - Now these are worth getting. Long, fried, crispy cassava fries that will keep you wanting to reach in for the next one right after the first. Wondering if blue cheese dressing sauce would go well with this.

Tried someone else's chicken and wow, it was totally tender and juicy. A must try for next time and yes I know its their staple. 

Dessert - 

Co-worker said the bread pudding was a must and it certainly was. One of the better bread puddings I've had and definitely takes care of craving for one. It was baked with care and skill as it was still very most inside and had a surprisingly terrific crunch on the outer layer. It also comes with refreshing vanilla gelato on top. We left no trace of its existence in couple minutes.

I'm trying to find a fault here but I really can't. Had amazing food, super attentive service and enjoyed what Limon had to offer. Will be coming back.
author: Brian L.

description:
Food is good....but $2 for sauces that should come with your meal? no thanks! The container of sauce is literally no more than 2 oz and similar to a cup you get at Mcdonalds to fill your own sauce from the counter.

I honestly wouldn't mind paying for sauce but when you're already charging me $22 for an entree (lomo saltado) at least provide some sauce with it and not charge $2 for a tablespoon of it.  Soooo annoying. 

It's like going to a chinese restaurant and getting charged for soy sauce.
author: Ann B.

description:
Sooo good!!! I come here every time I visit SF!!! Half or Whole Chicken, Beef Empanadas and Sangria  

Call ahead of time to make a reservation otherwise you may have to wait 40-60 mins 

Servers are always kind, the overall vibe is casual. If you're planning on coming here to discuss private matters I would suggest choosing a different place, it gets pretty loud in there! :) The bartenders are amazing and brunch is just as delicious as lunch and dinner! Love Limon!!
author: Lea C.

description:
I enjoyed myself here and am sure I'd be back around for an encore. 

I feel like I got one of the signature dishes here, Pollo a la Brasa, with salad and sweet potato fries (there are other sides, but these were the two free sides I chose). The chicken tasted great, but the sauces definitely stepped it up. However, I feel like there have been times I have had something which tasted a little zestier but that's just being subjective. 

We also got the Yuca Fries for the table which were definitely top notch! These were actually my favorite part of my meal and I wish I didn't have to share this one haha! 

I'll remember to come back around :)
author: Atif K.

description:
This was my first time in San Fran and my friend chose this restaurant. I am still a little tipsy from their special cocktails, so please forgive me... lol. It was 8:16pm Saturday night 3/24/18 and as we walked through the doors of Limon we knew that this was the restaurant to be at. As the  hostess informed me that the wait time was 1 1/2 hours I wanted to say peace out  but people kept pouring in not caring about the wait and looking at all the the clean plates, I decided I will stay. Why not wait after driving this far from our hotel and I didn't want to regret it heading back to LA. Don't get me wrong we were tempted to try the Mexican restaurant 3 doors down "West of Pecos" as Yelp reviews was pretty good as well. We were waiting outside in the cold, slightly rainy weather which I now have a cold from:( After an hour and 45min we were finally seated. Thank God because my back was killing me. 

FOOD
Veggie Empanada (mushroom, spinach, cheese) paired with a delicious dipping sauce :5 stars MUST GET

Beef Saltado (Stripped beef, French fries, tomato and onions): 5 stars MUST TRY

Mac&Cheese: 4 stars Great MUST TRY

Rotisserie Chicken with sweet potato fries and green beans : 3.5 stars Good

Alcohol Beverage:
Don't remember the names but their drinks are pretty strong and good. The bartender is not stingy with the alcohol here so prepared to get tip after one drink.

Non- alcoholic drinks 
Water great to hydrate me after that light bulb drink lol

Service & ambience: good service, trendy and the place to be when in San Fran.
author: Rushie B.

description: Horrible service! Was waiting for more than an hour and not one single person came to check on us, not even for some water ! I used to work at a Peruvian restaurant and I totally understand it can get busy but the whole staff ignore us, at least come and give some water or let me know you'll be back in a minute. Never coming back! Not sure how the host here works but I used to sit people and give them their menu, the host here just told us to take a sit at the bar, didn't even sit us or give us a menu, the bartender had to give us one.
author: Marianna Z.

description:
I've been to every Limon location at this point, so I thought it was about time to write a review!

Definitely the must order is the rotisserie chicken. I normally like to get the quarter chicken (comes with two sides) and share the mac and cheese with someone else. I prefer dark meat (which is $1 less, a nice little side bonus) which is always tender and comes with a yummy sauce for dipping. For one of your sides I definitely recommend the green beans, I got those for the first time recently based on the waitress' suggestion, and let's just say there's a reason why it's one of the most expensive sides.

Once when I ate here we ordered everything family style, so I also recommend the ceviche, the seafood paella, and the empanadas... basically everything haha.

Definitely recommend giving Limon a try, the food is delicious and the drinks are bomb too!
author: Tracy C.

description: I haven't been to Limon in several years. I took 2 friends visiting from Ohio one of which had never eaten Peruvian food. I was very happily surprised at the delicious flavors, presentation and quality of the food. Also one in our party has celiac disease so could be life threatening to eat gluten. The server didn't blink an eye and told us which items were gluten free or possible cross contaminated with gluten. She even offered to make the lomo saltado with gluten free soy sauce and without French fries that could cross contaminate. We had the ceviche trio sampler which was perfectly spicy and fresh. The meat in the lomo saltado had the char you taste in Peru. The pollo a la brasa was flavorful and moist. Piaco spurs were delicious and not skimpy. Then to end our delicious meal we had the uniquely Peruvian lucuma ice cream that delighted my guests. As a native born Peruvian I was so proud to introduce my guests to authentic and delicious food at Limon!
author: R D.

description:
1 piece chicken with 2 sides cost me $12. First side is Yuka fries, blend like frozen chicken tender. Tacu Tacu was super salty. Service-wise, one waitress was attending 11 tables. Took her 15 minutes to get us water.

The grilled chicken was lovely. Seasoning was perfect and cooked to perfection. Unfortunately that's the only high note of the night.
author: Judson C.

description:
I made a smart move last night and came here for Happy Hour!  
It wasn't packed yet and I learned all about their menu from a very helpful gentleman.  My menu choice was excellent - Peruvian ribs and the wine was great too. I made some new friends sitting at the bar and bartenders were great too!  I'll be back for dinner.
author: M L.

description: Food is really good here, but I don't have time for really snooty hostesses giving my me and my friends their attitude when we ask to order food 15 minutes after being seated. Will not recommend - sort it out please.
author: James M.

description: Brought my bf here the first time and he didn't like it over a year ago. Now we came back he loved it!!! Everything they changed is so much better really enjoy it
author: Jess S.

description:
Brunch was just a-ok. I've have Limon (at another one of the restaurants) and the chicken is delicious.

We decided to get the pollito con papas manaero (Crispy Peruvian fried chicken, french fries, aji amaraillo huacatay, rusa dressing, two fried eggs & parmesan cheese). It was pretty good, but it's not the best I've ever had. The boy got the chicken breakfast bowl (Chicken braised in aji panca estofado sauce served with borracho beans, steamed rice & two fried eggs. Garnished with salsa criolla & parmesan). Also pretty good, but not amazing. 

Overall, good brunch, but not the best in the area.
author: Nina Y.

description:
Food: half rotisserie, cut in 4 $17.5 with choice of 2 sides, yucca and rice. If I would've known only 4 yucca came out for the side, I would've ordered double yucca. We ordered an extra side. The sauce was delicious! And we tried it on top of rice too. 

Drinks: kiwi something from Brazil was good! Hangar one and soda. Way to support the locals! Best vodka out!

Ambience: small, quiet and quaint. There is an upstairs seating which is semi hidden. Nice front street window. 

Staff: nice and friendly. A little different, but cool. They made sure we were taken care of. 

Overall Experience: we were hopping through the city and planned to eat at the one one van ness. This one suited just as nice. We had a good time. There are 2 tv's showing sport events
author: Nicole G.

description: The service can be hit or miss at times, especially if they are busy.  So you're better off ordering a pitcher so you don't have to wait too long for drinks   The food is sooo yummy!  Juicy chicken, the salad is refreshing and empanadas I can do everyday!  I haven't found a place yet on the east coast to compare!  So every time I'm back in the Bay, Limon is always on my dining list
author: Aileen C.

description: Always good food and good drinks here. Good location for more fun after. Staff is very attentive and makes sure you have what you need. The yellow sauce they have that comes with the chicken is really good. The ceviche they have is flavorful as well. And a good variety of them. Has a good amount t of seating to accommodate multiple party sizes. But the bar area itself is a little small and feels a little in the way.
author: Franklin L.

description:
I love this place. The staff is always super nice and the food is great. 
That mango panacotta on the picture is amazing. You should definitely give it a try. 
If you're not sure what to eat, they'll recommend you something that's gonna fulfill your expectations for sure. I love the sweet potato fries. Next time I'm gonna try the ceviche. It looked delicious! 
I ordered the merlot before ordering food (I was gonna eat some meat), but then I decided to get fish. The waiter offered me to change the wine (but I just kept it) and then he brought me an amazingly refreshing white. 
5 star service. 
Thank you guys!
author: Diana F.

description:
Most favorite restaurant in SF, the service is impeccable. We fell in love with one of the waitress called Maya she has a heart of gold and a smile to match. 

The rotisserie chicken is a divine treat. Remember to call for reservations before the wait depending on day of week ranges from 15-45 mins. Totally worth it I promise you.
author: David K.

description: The Lomo Saltado (Beef with rice and fries) was way too oily and salty. I've had this dish before but don't remember it being like this. I'm a little disappointed.
author: Amanda K.

description:
The only reason I'm giving this place 2 stars is because the staff was very friendly and tried their best to be accommodating. I've heard good things about this place and decided to try a classic Peruvian dish that you can get in any restaurant that serves food from Peru (Lomo Saltado)
To say I was disappointed is an understatement, it was the saltiest lomo I've ever had, not to mention he most expensive as well.
author: travis m.

description:
Limon blew me away. That's right, their food, service, and quality was highly deserving of 5 stars.

I came in with my boyfriend without a reservation, but we were seated right away. We sat right next to a large window that opened to the sidewalk. I really loved the ambiance at the restaurant. It was very simple and classy!

We ordered the steak empanadas, the lomo saltado, and the quarter chicken with yucca fries and tacu tacu.

Steak empanadas: YUMMY! They were crispy on the outside and very flavorful on the inside. They tasted great with the dipping sauce it came with!

Lomo Saltado: Oh the classic peruvian dish. Ive had true Lomo Saltado during my trips to Peru, so this dish really brought back some nostalgic memories. The Lomo Saltado was really good, but a bit more salty than I would have liked. It was still really great and I do still recommend that you try this dish. I would rate it 4/5

Quarter Chicken: You would probably think there wouldnt be anything too special about a piece of chicken. But WOW their chicken was so soft and tender. The meat just melted in my mouth. You can choose between dark and white meat for the chicken. We got the dark meat, so Im not sure if the white meat will be as soft, but the dark meat was great. Yucca fries were perfectly crispy, yet not overly done. At first, the tacu tacu was eh to me but once I paired it with the chicken, it was pretty good!

All in all, I had a great experience at Limon. I highly recommend if you want to try some delicious, up-scale Peruvian food!
author: Joan Y.

description:
What a deluxe food experience! The service was spectacular, our server was so kind and attentive. As soon as we arrived, our server came over introducing himself and asking our drink order. We then found it difficult to pick a dish since so many of them sounded amazing. My friend chose the chicken and I chose the special of the day (it was a whole lot of seafood and rice) which was exactly what I wanted. Our server brought us a vase of water to the table but still filled our glass if it was low when he walked by. Everything tasted amazing and was perfectly cooked. The atmosphere of the restaurant was classy but still laid back, very hip.

I definitely recommend making a trip to this place. There is a parking space around the corner that charges $10 if you can't find street parking.
author: Estela D.

description: I think this place definitely deserves higher than the 3.5 it's currently at. The Lomo Saltado had amazing flavor. I couldn't help but lick the plate after finishing. I'd love to come back and try more of the menu, but I don't know if I could pass on ordering the Lomo again after how much I enjoyed it!
author: Michael S.

description:
This is one of my favorite restaurants in the city. I absolutely love Limon and I especially love this location of it. 

Location: Located in the Mission, this location is different from the other one because it feels a lot more spacious. The other location has a small dining area on top with a larger area underground (with no windows). However, this location feels much more spacious and trendy in its decor. It has a nice, long bar and an upstairs area. 

Food: The food is amazing!! We love to order family style when we come. For a party of 6, we ordered 
Ceviche- The shrimp was really fresh. It has a bit of a kick to it with spice. 
Half-Chicken with Sweet Potato Fries and Regular Fries- Juicy and moist rotisserie style chicken. 
Arroz con mariscos- This paella is full of flavor and has tons of seafood including squid, scallops and shrimp. 
Empanadas- A MUST! We love to get the pollo. The cheese is just filled with gooey cheese. If you're looking for something simple and just want cheese, you should try this one!

Overall, such an awesome spot, especially for a large group. They take reservations and a meal for our group of six was under $100 without drinks. Such a great deal for incredibly delicious food!
author: Courtney O.

description:
I've been here several times now and it never fails. We had the rotisserie with several other dishes and all were outstanding.
