Here's what makes Limon great. It's size is open enough so each table has space, yet small enough for the waiters to be attentive. They have a mix of salsa and cha cha music playing which sets the vibe and gets you in zone.

Service here is top notch. Friendly, accommodating and attentive.

Great job Limon SF, I'm going to Limon Walnut Creek today and I can't wait!
author: Philip O.

description: Ceviche de Camarones in Crema de Aji Amarillo was the highlight of my lunch here!  Fresh ingredients and very generous portion sizes.  The sauce was very flavorful, I ended up sipping on the rest because why not.  We also ordered their half chicken and Queso Empanadas!  Loved the Aji Amarillo Huacatay sauce that comes with it, went great with the empanadas as well. Would definitely recommend!
author: Jann B.

description:
Overpriced for the portions they give you.

The worse part was the waitress being spiteful. My credit card was charged for my friend's dish and vice versa just because I wanted to pay for my own meal. You think it's my imagination? You had to be there. She didn't seem happy to separate the charges in the beginning; she hesitated when I nicely asked her (yes, I did ask nicely), then after bringing the cards back she darted off like she was fleeing a scene. If it were a problem, she should have said so in the first place. I didn't ask them to void the charges and re-run the cards because I needed to go. Service was quite slow from start to finish. The bitch is lucky I gave her any tip at all. And yes, I was clear - "Can you please charge the lomo to the card on top?" Simple. We each ordered only one thing. Like I said, you had to be there.

The business owner can respond here; it'll be something like "sorry blah blah blah it wasn't intentional blah blah blah mistakes happen blah blah blah." Whatever. Go ahead and waste your time writing something. In the end it doesn't matter. I'm not giving you any more money.

UPDATE: I checked my credit card statement, and THEY CHARGED ME MORE THAN WHAT I AUTHORIZED. Yes, I checked my statement explicitly to make sure they didn't screw me. Well, they did. I'll be calling my credit card company in the morning to dispute that. LIMON HAS BEEN BUSTED FOR STEALING.

UPDATE 2: The card company will credit me for the difference rather than pursue a dispute. As a result, Chase will eat that cost, which is wrong. Bad behavior should be called out, so ANGELICA, thanks for making yourself an example to all the servers out there who think about stealing from customers. 

I normally don't go this far to make a point, but this warrants it.
author: Opal L.

description:
One of my favorite restaurants, and a must restaurant when in the beautiful city. Food is delicious, service is great!  We have been there during lunch hour and it gets very crowded and loud. So if you like more of a quiet atmosphere stay away during lunch hour. 

We've been to both locations in SF however we like this one best because there is parking around the corner.  It is $11 but I'd much rather pay than drive around and around looking for a spot to park.
author: Dee G.

description:
Been here many times and the flavor has just gone down and changed. After many years, have finally decided to write a review.

I always come here with a group of 5 or more, so we order everything from the menu. If you are thinking of sharing food, you'll need to order 2 of everything, the portion and price ratio are mismatched, so Yelp should update to three dollar signs.

The ambiance is weird, they'll play hip-hop/top 40 music which is unwanted and unexpected for a Peruvian restaurant. They have 1.5 floors, a bit dim, tables are small and when they bring your order, they force everything onto the table leaving no room at all.
Other restaurant kitchens are smarter, will think about this, and only serve what can fit on the table. Then make the rest so it's freshly made.

Very casual place, decent for kids, but can get incredibly loud; so, not very good for a first date or private conversations.

Things are decent from the menu, but stay away from...
- Lomo Saltado. It's always overbearingly smoky and w/ a strong "vinegary" flavor, tastes nothing like the real thing.
- Ceviche is hit or miss many times, never consistent (avoid the Mixto and get the pescado/fish).
- Arroz con Mariscos, flavor is there, but many times encountered raw/hard rice.
- Empanadas, nothing to write home about, but it is missing filling.
- Yuca Fries, they used to give sauce with this, not anymore, expect to pay $2 per condiment/sauces or bring your own.
- Pollo a la Brasa, it's alright, a bit dry at times. If you want rotisserie chicken try it from Morning Due Cafe, it's delicious.

If you really want to try Limon, go to the one on S. Van Ness (a bit better). But don't expect true Peruvian flavors.
Reason I keep coming here is because it is close to where I live.

Note: I'm Peruvian/Chinese.
author: Aaron C.

description:
I'd like to preface my review by sharing the following: I'm 100% Peruvian.  My mama's cooking(and that of my tias) is on point all day erryday. In the last two decades, as americanos discovered our cuisine, I've held my breath that our food wouldn't be rendered bland or deconstructed beyond recognition in an effort to appeal to the masses.  Limon has kept our flavors intact while providing an upscale experience.  
One of my closest friends recently wanted to treat me to a celebration dinner.  When I suggested the Mission location, she made a reservation via Open Table so mini-me and I headed into the City for a girls' night out.  Though we couldn't be seated until our party was complete(my friend's work meeting ran late) and the little wasn't comfortable sitting at the bar, we had a dinner to remember.  We began with drinks including the evening's special, a strong Pina Colada.  The little one had chicha morada. I ordered chicken empanadas as our appetizer. Usually my daughter dislikes the meat pies; she says they are large and heavy.  These were small, light, and airy. The chicken was tender and well-seasoned and the aji amarillo was mild but tasty.  Needless to say, my daughter has become an empanada fan.  
Then dinner arrived. My daughter had the truffle mac and cheese but once she tried my arroz de mariscos, she was happy to share.  Our server checked in often to make sure our cocktail was adequately strong, made our waters were full, and even took my friend's fries back as they had been slightly cool.  
The crowd is a mixture of hipsters on dates, families, and large parties celebrating birthdays or chilling after work.  Still, there is a distinctly down to earth vibe.  Definitely reppin Peruvian cuisine for the SF foodie scene in a way that this Peruvian-American digs.
author: Julie C.

description:
Absolutely delicious. I wasn't expecting too much from this place but now I can see why there are so many reviews. Came for a friend's birthday and shared three dishes, family style. We ordered a whole chicken (with yuca fries and veggies for our sides), truffle mac n cheese, and lomo saltado. Also ordered a pitcher of sangria. Everything was good. The chicken was tasty and came with a sauce that I loved. The truffle mac n cheese was also good, although I do wish it was more cheesy as opposed to a wet creamy texture. The beef in the lomo saltado was excellent. I liked how it was cooked medium rare and so chewy. Very saucey too. 

For dessert we ordered the mango panna cotta and that was the perfect thing to end our meal. Definitely coming back.
author: Annie H.

description:
Limón Rotisserie is a place best known for their chicken. While I did not have their rotisserie chicken, I did have their Chicharrón de Pollo and Polli - Pappas. 

The food rating of this restaurant is a 3.5. The chicken was fried well and not greasy. The accompanying sauce for the Chicharrón de Pollo was a limón soy sauce, which was a little sour and salty, and went well with it. The Polli - Papas was the same fried chicken, but tossed with french fries, cheese, and a muddled spicy peruvian aioli mustard. The french fries were a little soggy, and the sauce a little heavy. I have no complaints about the chicken however, there was a decent amount and it was good quality. It seems like good bar food, to accompany a beer or something similar. Don't go here expecting a full meal, it is more of a casual "peruvian" after-work spot to grab drinks and some munchies. 

The value rating of this restaurant is a 3. The dish sizes were not worth the prices, as they are expected to be ordered "family style" to offer a variety to a party of multiple people. 

I find this location of Limón Rotisserie to be a little cramped and loud, I was barely able to hear my girlfriend from across the table.

Overall, don't come here looking for a meal, think more a casual gathering with drinks and snacks. I would come back considering their chicken, but recommend their other location on Van Ness Avenue, SF instead.
author: Ryan D.

description:
I've been coming here for years it's wonderful. I really enjoy their rotisserie chicken as it full of flavors you will love. The ceviche is outstanding as there's not many other places who can compare. 
If you in a group of 2 or more I say go for the pitcher of sangria I get it every time I come here. 
This place is great for lunch or a girls night out . This is one of my favorite restaurants in the mission a must go.  I would always suggest calling a head for a reservation as it can get busy.
author: Angie A.

description: Can get very busy and you might have to wait for a table, but good food! Good place to try if you're out on the west coast.
author: Tilisa P.

description:
4 stars for food, 3 stars for service. 

Food
- Be aware: hot plate portions are pretty small and are meant for sharing. Our friends who picked their meals from that part of the menu left hungry. 
- I had the Pescado a lo Macho, and it was delicious and the perfect portion! My friend got the Arroz con Mariscos and raved about it. 
- Had a Maracuya Sour and the Sangria. The drinks were okay, but didn't feel worth it for what I paid. Also found the bartender's hair in my Sour. 

Service
- Service was extremely slow, especially considering the restaurant was half empty and there was plenty of staff around. Towards the end of the meal, our server was straight up ignoring us and we had to flag down other staff multiple times. 
- Bills can only be split 4 ways
author: Stephanie Y.

description: Go during their happy hour M-F from 3-5 pm; best bang for your buck. Order the ceviche mixto and the polli papas to get started. After you finish the ceviche mixto, pour the left over juice on top of the polli papas. Tastebud explosion! If you want to get real crazy, substitute the fries for sweet potato fries.
author: Lauren P.

description: By far my favorite restaurant in the city. I had heard of it because it has gained a good reputation and I finally had the chance to try it last night. Thankfully I went to my foodie best friend who was willing on trying a bunch of dishes from the menu (specially because we were starving). We had the trio ceviche, the pulpo a la Parrila, de truffle mac and cheese and the lomo salteado! WOW JUST WOW! Out of this world. I loved every single part of it, the flavors, the freshness, the latin taste. The service was also amazing and fast. Officially my favorite restaurant. I extremely recommend.
author: Sophie E.

description:
I really like tapas-style restaurants because you get to try a little bit of everything! I highly recommend the arroz con mariscos, tacu tacu, lomo saltado, and the truffle mac and cheese. My group also ordered the whole chicken, which was good but a little too salty in my opinion. 

One thing to note is that this restaurant has two locations - one on Valencia and one on Van Ness. I didn't realize this when I made my reservation and then ended up at the wrong location. Luckily, they have second floor seating and was able to accommodate our large group on a Sunday night.
author: Alice S.

description:
My friends have never had Peruvian food before, and they wanted to go as I had raved about the food at Limón after a recent visit. Double date at Limón on a Friday night? And just maybe a trip to Tartine for dessert after? My husband and I were totally game! 

We had the foresight to reserve a table on Yelp and I'm glad we did! The place quickly filled up around 6:30 and you'd be waiting for a while if you did not have a reservation. I'm also glad we chose the Limón on Valencia, as it is bigger and brighter than the one on South Van Ness. We were relegated to the basement when we ate at SVN location and that to me was not ideal. 

For drinks, I ordered a Pisco Sour, my friend the Lychee Sour and her husband one of the Peruvian beers. The Sours were quite good and boozy to my surprise. My friend and I really enjoyed our cocktails.

For food, we ordered a few things and ate them family-style. I loved the Tartara de Tuna last time, so that and the Mushroom Empanada were our starters. Unfortunately, we felt the Tartara de Tuna was a bit deficient in flavor. Very muted flavor, so I didn't love it this time. The Mushroom Empanada, on the other hand, was wonderful! It is fried, not baked, but it was good. It was crunchy and lots of mushrooms inside. Our friends loved this. It came with one of their sauces, so dip it in the sauce by all means. So good! 

We ordered half of the Pollo a la Brasa and the Lomo Saltado for our mains. My friends loved both. They didn't think that rotisserie chicken can be that interesting, but they felt that Limon's version is definitely something special, especially with the sauces it came with. So glad we ordered the Tacu Tacu and vegetables for our sides with the chicken this time around. The veggies were very tasty and the Tacu Tacu was great. We all loved the Lomo Saltado too. Chunks of nicely seasoned beef on top of fries and drenched with a gravy--what's not to like? 

It was a great double date at Limón! We skipped dessert as Tartine was calling me. But maybe next time, we'll try their dessert. We'll definitely be back Limón!
author: Hazel C.

description: Went there for dinner. It was smack you in the face it was so good.  However, the server seemed to get annoyed when I was asking about the different types of food and when asked for his recommendations,  his generic answer was its all good. Had to take a star away because of the server.
author: Tajster H.

description: My favorite restaurant! Snapper ceviche and passion fruit pisco sour yum!!! It's usually pretty busy in there but the ambiance still feels chill with beautiful lighting and fun music. If your with more then 1 other person, expect a wait!
author: Jena L.

description:
Definitely make a reservation, this place was packed :) (you won't be seated until your whole party is there)

Ambiance and food was definitely amazing!

We ordered the ceviche mixto, which was delicious. We ordered the quarter chicken, white meat, with two sauces. (also delicious) The truffle mac + cheese was yummy and very "truffle" esk haha.

The highlight dish of the night was definitely the Arroz con Mariscos. Tasty, savory and the rice was perfect.

We were seated at the 2nd floor, which had absolutely no reception, but no complaints because that's not what dinner is for anyway! It was beautiful, service was friendly and I loved the food. Try this place out! :)
author: Melanie T.

description:
Although the wait time for a table was outrageously, ridiculous (roughly around 1hr & 30 mins)...I would still recommend this place because the food is thaaaaaat good.

The highlight for me is that this place plays really, really awesome music- therefore really makes your dining experience fun! If you like dance/electro aka "unce-unce" music, then this is the place for you! 

Okay, so now let's talk food. (Speechless)- it's that good!!! Seriously, I can't stop raving about the good food served here. Everything and anything you order is going to be delicious. Check out my pictures, 'cuz that is all you need to know/see.
author: Lene N.

description: Really top notch peruvian food. Rotisserie is a killer. Small succulent birds marinated with soffrito. Empanadas are great too.
author: Pramod G.

description:
Lots of food for $100!

Make a reservation or be prepared to wait. We got here around  630pm and it was 3/4 full. We left around 745-8pm and it was packed. Go figure...it's the mission.

All items tasted great, but the lomo saltado was on the salty side.
author: Angelica C.

description:
One star for the hostess and 4 stars for the food. I wanted to celebrate my birthday here bringing my children, for they've never tried this place. My son was running late, though there was 4 of us and I wanted to order, the hostess on 8/24:2017 at 6:30 could not seat us. Instead, she gave the table I requested becuz my son was 5 minutes away and was seated upstairs. Dear Limon, customer service is what matters. Disappointed that my table was given away, though they could've seated those people upstairs for you knew I was there and present. 
So, zero stars for lady hostess and 4 stars for food! It was a birthday celebration that you just ruined!
author: Doris U.

description:
Our organization was having a staff appreciation event, and ordered take out from here. I ordered an Arroz con Mariscos--basically their Paella. 


BRAVO:

Generous portions of seafood--3 huge snappy shrimp, 2 plump mussels, 2 briny clams, about half dozen chunks of thumb sized delicate white fish and about a dozen small tender squid rings.

The rice was still al dente and well flavored with seafood stock.

The seafood was cooked spot on--not overdone despite being in the take out container. 

The dish was not over seasoned. 

Presentation was gorgeous.


NOT-SO:

The flavor palette lacked cohesion--the component flavors seemed to clash and not harmonize into a savory Symphony. 

The rice lacked crust from caramelization that I expect from a Paella cooked correctly. I am confident they cooked the rice separately from the rice and assembled it at the end, so there is no valid excuse. 


LE-VERDICT:

In the end, I picked my take out box clean. 

Anytime a restaurant crafts seafood that is not overcooked and is well assembled for takeout, I am impressed. The reason it is not 5 star is for the 2 cons. I am very opinionated about Paella. One of Paella's iconic features is caramelized rice from baking it in the pan it was served in. 

Still, I am a fan of this place largely because of the sturdy execution of the meal.
author: Lu-Shien T.

description:
I have been going to Limon since I can remember. It has always been great food and service. Well, that was until yesterday. What happened? Are you understaffed? Why were the police there? What a complete shit show.

First, the waiter gets my order wrong. I ask a quick question about the short ribs and Sole. He recommends the Sole, and I order it. Then the short ribs show up. I explain I didn't order them.  Then the waiter comes over and tries to force the short ribs on me. I reminded him of our conversation and his Sole recommendation and my order. He then remembers, oh yeah you did order the Sole...wtf that was a waste of 10 minutes. So, I watch my friends eat while I am starving. 

Then, my delayed order shows up half way through my friends meals.  It is pretty bland, so I ask for hot sauce. Never comes. Had to ask two different staff members twice to get the sauce. Now, my food is cold and my friends are done with their meals.  Then I spend another 15-20 minutes trying to get more sauce. It was a nightmare.

Finally, when we get the bill. We find two charges for hot sauce that took forever to get and caused me to eat cold seafood. Are you serious? I went to a nice meal that I ended up eating cold and alone and you charge me for shifty hot sauce!

Absolutely terrible service. Wrong order, cold food and waiting for very expensive and not so good hot sauce. And, no disclosure that they charged for sauce, particularly after making me starve and eat alone -- totally why you go out with your friends for dinner.

What a waste of time and money. Guess watching the random police action was entertaining too?! No longer a go to spot:(
author: Kiki I.

description:
This is a great spot to come for dinner! Came here with a group of friends and we all loved the food. I ordered the 1/4 chicken that comes with two sides. It was a ton of food, I could not even finish it. There are also options of 1/2 or a whole chicken. 

Only negative is that the wait can be long if you don't have a reservation. Also the room can be really loud so it's sometimes hard to have a conversation.
author: Megan R.

description:
Delicious Peruvian rotisserie chicken!  The yucca fries are like big french fries - get extra sauce and dip them!

Sadly, no Papa a la Huancaina - boiled yellow  potatoes and eggs with a spicy, creamy cheese sauce.  But they have plenty of fresh ceviche options.
author: Sondra H.

description:
BOMB ASS FOOD - HANDS DOWN

Chicken, ceviche, Mac n Cheese, salad, tacu taco, I could go on! And that Sangria is FIRE! My go to every time I'm in the mission!!!
author: Ceci B.

description: Great atmosphere, food taste bomb! If you want to portal into  for a moment, hope in and try it out. Will not disappoint.
author: Thomas M.

description: Had a great meal with friends from faraway places (China and Malaysia)!  We ordered just about everything on the menu.  The cerviche stood out as exceptional-we got the 3 style serving and I enjoyed them all. Coming here and starting the night with a Pisco Sour ensures for a great night.  I heard that the acoustics were too loud, but did not feel that was the case at all.  Service was attentive-atmo was great!
author: Derald C.

description:
Limón chicken is the real deal! Consistent delicious chicken, for lunch or dinner. Every part of the chicken is well flavored and juicy. No parts had preferential treatment; each bit was consumed with love. The awesome aji sauce that comes with it? It's just a bonus. 

Another notable thing is their yuca fries. I've tried yuca fries in many places, and it was never satisfying. Sometimes I wonder why people forced to make fries out of them. But Límon does it right; thick, crispy and moist -- a mouthful of indulgence. Let's not forget to dip it in the aji sauce!

Lomito Saltado(aka Lomito Sodiumado) was super disappointing. I grew up eating lots of dishes that is soy sauce based and over rice. Now, this dish reminds me of those, but an inferior and lazier version of it. The sauce was too simple, too salty and just not tasty. With just the first spoon, my body recognizes the unworthy sodium entering in. Worst of all, the dish was drowned by it. I heroically finish my portion. Don't be a hero.
author: Jason A.

description: This restaurant is phenomenal  Absolutely recommend it to natives and travelers. The Mango flan is to die for. The entire cuisine is delicious. Will visit again when back in town!
author: Gabriela Z.

description:
Limon is one of those staple restaurants that is sometimes forgotten amongst all the new, flashy hyped-up spots in San Francisco, but it has a special spot in my heart because my family is Peruvian, because this was where my boyfriend and I came on our second date. It's reasonably priced, the quality of the food is great (the rotisserie chicken is the best) and you don't have to give away your first born to get a reservation here.

There are 2 Limon's in SF. The one in Valencia has a slightly more upscale, modern atmosphere and is great for a date or a quick dinner with friends. They also have an upstairs part for private functions. The one on Van Ness seems more casual and a bit smaller and focuses more on the rotisserie chicken and a more limited menu than the Valencia location.

We always get the ceviche (it's great, but I wouldn't say it's mind-blowing), and we always get the rotisserie chicken. It's moist, flavorful and comes with the aji amarillo sauces. You get 2 sides with the chicken, and I always love the yucca fries. They are crispy on the outside, fluffy and soft inside, and fresh. We've gotten the salad as one of the sides too, but I don't think I would recommend this as a side - it's basically the spring mix you buy at Costco for $4 with some dressing.

We have also had the empanadas but they were just okay - I prefer the ones from El Porteno.

All in all, a solid place for dinner and always happy to come eat here!
author: Christina L.

description: Randomly stopped here for lunch after being drawn in by the menu. We got a the chicken and the Pescado a lo Macho. Both were AMAZING. The chicken was perfectly cooked, green bean side is unreal. Fish in the Pescado a lo Mach was so so so good. Everything was perfectly cooked. So happy we stumbled on this place. We will definitely be back.
author: Rachel P.

description: If you like Peruvian food - this is the place! Food - grilled octopus is the must try! Veggie empanadas, beet salad, truffle Mac cheese!! Drinks - lychee sour!  Atmosphere- very noise! Reservation- must!  Love this place!
author: Liza P.

description: I love this place. The restaurant is nice and the food is really good I love the paella I recommend it .
author: Kenia X.

description:
Limón Rotisserie is one of those places with fancy decor and good service that builds your expectations when you go in.

The food served is tasty. However, the namesake chicken is mediocre - it's a simple rotisserie chicken that happens to be served at a restaurant (for 3x the price). The sauces are nice, though.

To be fair, the food isn't bad, but it's certainly pricey for what you're getting.
author: Jeremy C.

description: Ordered arroz con mariscos( paella), champinones anticucheros (mushrooms), Mac & cheese & limo Saltado. They're all good but most outstanding is the paella. It's the best I've tasted so far because it's not too dry. You can taste it's sauce. Negative on this place is the attentiveness of server. Check your bill  she mistakenly put another menu on Check & water was slow to arrive on a slow day. Mango juice is great. Next time I'll try the Burlingame branch.
author: Sonny Q.

description:
I've been to Limon a couple of times in the past and it's always been a decent experience, but this last time I went, it left a bad taste in my mouth. 

I walked in for dinner and the host said the wait was going to be around 30 minutes. I saw at least 4 open tables and there was nobody else waiting for a table so I was really confused. My boyfriend and I had plans for the night so we couldn't wait 30 minutes for a table and we started walking towards the exit. Then, the host stops us and asks if we can finish eating within an hour because "they're packed tonight" and we said yeah. It didn't bug me right away but as I was eating dinner, I was talking to my boyfriend about how rude it was for her to ask us to finish within the hour especially since there were clearly open tables. Even if they were reserved, there was a steady flow of people in the restaurant finishing up dinner and leaving throughout the time we were there.....so why would we have to finish within an hour?? That's just not good customer service. 

Food is decent. We ordered the ceviche mixto, chicken empanadas, and the rotisserie chicken. I wasn't a big fan of the chicken but everything else was good. I don't know if I'll come back to this location.
author: Cindy F.

description: Best place in SF. It's delicious.. lomo saltado is a must. Tucu tucu which is rice/beans is probably the best side you'll ever taste
author: Missi B.

description:
Fancy Nancy!! 
Nice place to have lunch/dinner. Pricey but worth it!! I recommend it 100%
author: Fernanda A.

description:
SF lacks the choices you can get Peruvian Rotisserie Chicken aka Pollo A La Brasa joints where you can quick casual take out as well....baby steps SF....baby steps.....

Really this your only option here.  Thankfully Limon opened here a few years back when I was in town.  It's without question my favorite place to dine in the Mission District.  Just stick to the Pollo a la brasa with the Yucca Fries and Vegetales Salteados for the sides.  I've had one of the ceviches once but not that I can remember to give a writeup from what I remember.  

The bird is consistent and seasoned perfectly.  If you get a piece of white Or dark that's a bit over cooked just send it back.  Never had issue here if your not happy.  Very attentive service all the way.  Save room for dessert and get their chocolate cake as well.

There is more seating here vs the location a few blocks away on S. Van Ness.  So come here if your have more than 6 in your group.
author: David C.

description:
Good happy hour with pisco sour on the list. I would have ordered more drinks but the bartenders only tend to pay attention to people they know. Ceviche great portion size but so much lime juice that's it's hard to eat more than a couple bites.
Great pisco sours keep me coming back, but only for one drink each time since it's hard to get anyone's attention to get another.
author: amber k.

description: Food was decent but very over priced even for sf standards. The portions were tiny but the thing that did it for me was that they charged for hot sauce. Really?
author: Jay S.

description:
Super yummy half chicken ! 

Flew into town Thursday and had dinner and was not disappointed. I will definitely be back !
author: Felicia T.

description: The ambiance is nice and the food is pretty decent, but it's really overpriced. There are much better places in the mission that are both more tasty and better value,so I don't think I'll be coming here again.
author: Kavita P.

description:
Had a bit of a disappointing experience there this past weekend. Food was overall good, but found the restaurant to be extremely overpriced for the size of the portions. Lomo saltado was ok, but small portion and not even compared to the same dish at Fresca, for example. 
Also had the pescado ceviche which was ok- not sure how fresh the fish was. 
Fried yuka and some other dishes were good.

Unfortunately I got extremely sick towards the end of my dinner ( I believe that ceviche wasn't the best) and had leave the restaurant to go home right away.  Felt sick all night so I think I might have been food poisoned.
author: Paula C.

description: Food was bomb! Waiter was very patient with our large indecisive group. They accommodated our group with new seating that was in a more comfortable area than what they originally gave us. Parking is hard to find in this area. Will be back.
author: Gloria G.

description: I love this place and the food they serve is very tasty. However,  on my last visit, the waiter made me feel very uncomfortable with the amount I tipped. While I get that they are expecting over a 15% tip, the server shouldn't come up to question the tip and ask "Is that how bad we treated you?" As customers shouldn't we be free to tip what we please? Unacceptable!
author: Andrea E.

description:
Mhmmmm....Honey, I love myself some Limón said the middle aged woman at the bart. So my friend and I followed her and pleasantly enjoyed our meal and sangria. Limon is a great mix of classy and casual so I guess you can call it classual. 

To start, the chicken at Limon is a MUST - and also the best for big groups. Depending on how big your group is, you can get half a chicken to a full chicken and 2 sides (4 if you have a bigger group). The chicken is seasoned well and can be a little salty for some peoples palate but it goes very well with their sauces! Also highly suggest the yuca fries and veggies to cut down the heaviness of everything. 

Besides their chicken, the ceviche is just okay and the arroz con mariscos (basically their paella) is a very great portion but it can sometimes have a weird consistency. Again, I highly suggest washing down everything with some sangria or one of their beverages, but Limon is a great date night or group dinner kind of place. Servers are nice and reservations are recommended  - unless you go before 7.
author: Eric Joseph D.

description: First and last visit!!! I wanted to try some peruvian food in my last trip to SF and since LaMar closed early for lunch i decided to go here( big regret) , first they don't welcome you !! Looked like waiters were in a hurry and in a bad day, very rude people!! Food is not great at all as they advertised it, very small portions for the price, they only had mango lemonade,COME ON!!! It supposed to be Peruvian restaurant so where is the Chicha morada or Maracuya!!!????? My daughter wanted some mayonnaise ( thats how real peruvians eat Pollo a la brasa) they didn't have it,overall it is just a a restaurant trying to be gourmet but far away from it!! Need to work with waiters for better service and come on ,make some chicha morada!!!!!
author: Jonnathan L.

description: lucked out and got rock star seating for our party of six. excellent food and service...our puerto rican friends loved it.
author: Torrpedo T.

description:
This is great spot to come with a group and order lots of flavorful dishes.

My party of 6 had a great time. Naturally our orders started with pisco sours. I had the lychee sour and it was amazing. Definitely a tasty beverage.

We ordered two different ceviches. This was my fiance's first time trying ceviche and he loved it. We did a mixed fish one and a shrimp one. I loved both, but my favorite bite was the calamari in the mixed dish.

We ordered the chicken which was very flavorful and cooked to perfection. I prefer that dark meat though and the chicken breast wasn't remarkable. Is chicken breast ever remarkable though?

I loved the sides of rice and yucca fries. These were so tasty! I wish I could have eaten more, but I was definitely slowing down. 

We ordered two of the truffle macs. Not peruvian, but come on, it's truffle mac. And they make a great one!

Lastly, we ordered the lomo slatado. I thought the meat was flavorful and tender.

My only complaint was that we felt a little rushed. Our food came out in what felt like 10 minutes. While I was happy to eat, we felt that it was a little too fast to be able to enjoy our dinner together.
author: Lacey M.

description:
I love limon, been to this restaurant several times and hasn't disappointed. This is my first time at the Valencia location, tho. 
I feel like the vibe and atmosphere is a little different.. more glaring eyes and staff feels like they don't want to be there. 
Food is great as always..
We got 
1. Half chicken and we chose our two sides to be 
a. Yucca fries, perfectly fried.. light crispy outside and soft & fluffy inside. 
b. Grilled vegetables, they were a bit too oily but definitely had a great grilled taste and seasoned perfectly. Had a nice blend of onions, red peppers, & zucchini. 
2. Shrimp & fish ceviche, I love the crunch that comes from the corn nuts and the salty, savory crispness of the seafood. 
3. Truffle Mac n cheese, this is an indulgence. It's so buttery and cheesy.. and so damn good. The truffle makes this dish a must order every time we come here. 
4. Pitch of sangria, will not get you buzzed but will definitely quench your thirst. 
The food is great, but I would most likely go back to the Van Ness location, just because I like the atmosphere better and the crew seems more welcoming and attentive. But if definitely will be back!
author: Maria C.

description: I don't know where to start. I'm a little ashamed to say I'm a San Francisco native and didn't know about this place. But y'all. It's amazing. It's super loud and hot but the food made up for it. I'm someone who prefers calm and quiet places but when I tried the empanadas and ceviche and paella--I didn't care about the noise anymore. Crazy expensive and loud, but food is worth it.
author: Jenny B.

description:
This was my 4th time (I think) at Limon and it was just as amazing as always. Brought my dad here, along with 3 friends for dinner Saturday night. We started off with a pitcher of red sangria which was perfection. 

I love that the place is family style so you can order a bunch of entrees, apps, etc. and eat a little bit of everything. We ordered a whole chicken (juicy, delicious, amazing, unreal), 2 truffle mac and cheese (Don't even get me started, i ate a whole one by myself), all 4 kinds of empenadas (chicken, beef, seafood, queso - all really tasty), grilled mushrooms, and a side of rice and beans. SO. MUCH. FOOD. comfort food is the best food though. amiright?! 

if you take away one thing from this review. Order the truffle mac and cheese plz
author: Ilana B.

description: Food is good, but I was not happy with my waiter; as he cared less about what I was asking about the menu items. I probably would come back because the food is good, but hopefully i won't have the same waiter!
author: Susan C.

description: I'm a huuuuuge fan of Peruvian food and thru the years I've always wanted to try this place but never had the chance. Finally...success! After hopping from restaurant to restaurant I arrived here and the main focus was the ceviche! The ceviche was so so...I've had better from Peruvian moms and pops spots. To be honest I was disappointed in the ceviche due to the years of photos I've seen of the food here. Now I know the food here is more photogenic than delicious.
author: Marcus M.

description:
Food was okay, and service was ridiculously bad. The bartender approached me lukewarm when I walked in. I asked to sit near places where I can charge my laptop, and he told me that there's is no outlet anywhere in this restaurant. Once I sat down, I immediately saw an outlet right next to the front desk. I asked if I can sit there instead and charge my laptop during the meal, and he responded that those outlets were for the front desk AND don't usually work. There's nothing plugged into those outlets, and it's 1pm so no one was even there or anywhere in the restaurant. He was simply being unhelpful and rude. 

And I had to ask the waitress twice to get my water; also had to ask twice to get my check. 

Chicken has gone down in size too. Will not return. There are many way better places for lunch in mission!
author: Suchee H.

description:
I came here twice & would love to come back again. The line is long, you should reserve your table in advanced. The noice is a lil bit too much in peak hour. But overall I love the food & the service is on point.
I tried half chicken & ceviche, awww yummy! Yuca fried is a must.
author: ThuyTien N.

description: This restaurant is very popular. I came here with my friend David to celebrate my birthday. I had the half chicken with tacu tacu and vegetales salteados. I had some of his mac and cheese and tuna tartare. The food is good. Not too pricey. The atmosphere is modern. We were kind of jammed with seating, but it was a good restaurant outing for my bday. Thanks David.
author: Denise C.

description:
Nice place, went on the recommendation of my friend!

We went as a group of 5, luckily the place was fairly empty thus no wait and was able to seat all 5 of us. 

The food is pretty tasty. We ended up getting various things and splitting it among the 5 of us. The three most notable being the full chicken, truffle mac and cheese, and yuca fries. We also got some vegetable dish. The chicken was nicely cooked and just split among us. Nicely tasty and moist.The truffle mac and cheese was definitely worth it.  Could have ate more but it is okay. My favorite part was Yuca fries with the Trio Aji Sauces. Those sauces were DELICIOUS and I still have no idea what they were but regardless, with the tasty fries they were the best thing there. I would definitely go back for more fries and to try the other stuff on their menu.

The place itself, given we went in the middle of the day, the lights were off and the location was slightly dark. The seats very comfy and the staff very nice. They set us up well. I am excited to go back and try more food and drinks next time!
author: Akash P.

description:
They've improved their game since the last time I dined here (years...as in 10). I hadn't been back, because 10 years ago, their game was weak and tired. 

Round 2: I had a glass of Nero de Avola (fav Italian wine)+queso Oaxaca empanadas. My mauf exploded. Such an amazing cheat meal. I also had the mixed greens salad. Although all the veggies were fresh, they skimped on the dressing. Meh. Mind not blown. However, I'd def go back for another glass of vin-oh and empanadas! Queso Oaxaca, you own me.
author: Gabriela W.

description: Limon is my all time favorite Peruvian restaurant. Definitely call for a reservation because this place is always packed. The food is very high quality and reasonably priced. So much bang for your buck here. For beginners I recommend a whole chicken with two sides. My favorite side dishes is the taco tack and the yuca fries. The chickens are full of flavor and come with three Peruvian sauces. Their ceviches are excellent. They offer traditional Ceviche mixto with hominy, slices red onion, and sweet potato. I also like their leche dectigre ceviche. Secos de costilla is my second favorite entree. Their bartenders prepare excellent drinks, I personally recommend anything with mezcal. I always recommend Limon for a fun group of friends to unwind at after a long week.
author: Amber V.

description: Hmmm okay.. not impressed. The ceviche was ok, the chicken was ok.. pallella was good, Pisco sour was good. They did seat us pretty quickly on a Sat night and the staff was nice but food wise not impressed
author: Sarah K.

description:
I was so excited to finally try out this place. I've heard so many positive things and I love Peruvian food, especially Lomo Saltado. Yum!

For the food, we ordered the Rotisserie Chicken, Lomo Saltado, and the Truffled Mac & Cheese. For the chicken, I thought it tasted a bit dry and reminded me of the $5 Rotisserie Chicken you can find at Costco. I will definitely pass on this dish next time and didn't think it was anything special. As for the Truffle Mac & Cheese, I wasn't impressed and thought the noodles were undercooked. The best dish of the night was definitely the Lomo Saltado. The steak was cooked perfectly and tasted divine with the spicy green sauce. I just wish the portions weren't so small.

We also ordered a pitcher of the Red Sangria and I was disappointed. The Sangria tasted diluted and barely had any alcohol. It tasted more like juice, not worth it.

I will have to give this place a second try. Overall I wasn't impressed and found it really overhyped.
author: MyTien P.

description:
Came here with a reservations and still ended up waiting over an hour for a table. So had reservations and when we all arrived we told we had to wait so ended up going to the bar for drinks due to the temperature inside and out. It was a warm Saturday night and a steam oven inside due to the lack of air conditioning. 

So we sat at the bar and ended up getting 3 pitchers of sangria before we were finally seat. When seated the table for 4 was more for a table for 2, there was no room for anything after we each had a glass and utensils in front of us. 

So we just ended up ordering a few ceviche due to limited amount of room. So 3 plates came and they were already small, having smaller portions of food. Yelp stated that this place was $$, when the bill arrived it was more like $$$$.
author: M C.

description:
I have been to Limon twice now. Both times were a great experience with awesome service in both an intimate setting and a large group setting. 

The Sangria is something that I order every time that I go. I simply love it. In a group we always get 2 or 3 pitchers, and it has always been a hit. 

I love the chicken, either the half or the whole, depending on if I want to take leftovers or how hungry I am. I have nothing bed to say about any of the dishes. I really have enjoyed them all.

A Limon has recently opened up closer to me, in Walnut Creek and I am excited to visit it soon!
author: Danielle A.

description: This is a great lunch stop! Prices are reasonable and the food has been great so far! I've only been twice so far and had the same thing each time. The chicken is well-seasoned. The yuca and sweet potato fries are perfect. The service is quick and the wait staff very professional. I must treat myself to dinner soon so the bartender and I can get acquainted!
author: Tony B.

description:
I was a very unhappy customer by the time I sat down at Limón. We had set a reservation for 5 at 7:30 on a Monday evening, and were left waiting an entire HOUR before we were seated. The entire time we were waiting, the hostess only apologized once at the end -- one cursory "sorry" when she called us to finally be seated. 

But... I have to say that I left Limón feeling happy, warm, and satisfied with my new food baby. I really can't give this place a terrible rating because all the other workers were incredibly friendly, and the food was just SO FRICKIN GOOD. Don't leave Limón without ordering the famous Pollo a la Brasa. It's tender, flavorful, and juicy. YUM! We ordered a half chicken and it was enough for everyone to sample a good amount of meat. 

We also ordered the following:  
- Pitcher of Sangria: awesome. The drink service was TOO good -- they kept refilling our glasses to the brim, but some of our party wanted to drink less than others so we had to re-adjust the amounts afterwards. 
- Chicharron de Pollo (crispy pieces of chicken): a bit dry, but the sauce was flavorful and complemented the chicken. 
- Empanadas: Pollo and Queso -- warm, rich, and crunchy/creamy in all the right places. 
- Ceviche Mixto (fish, calamari, and tiger shrimp): fresh and flavorful! 
- Lomito Saltado (stir-fry sirloin strips with fries and onions): good flavor, but chewy and a bit salty -- probably from the soy sauce. Make sure to eat this one fast because the fries get soggy from all the juice! 
- Polli-Papas (crispy pieces of chicken with fries and cheese): greasy and cheesy -- reminded me more of bar food, but delicious in its own right. 

For the sides, we got yuca fries and Tacu-Tacu. Both. Are. Delicious. 

They also forgot about our half chicken order and we had to remind them 45 minutes after we started eating before they finally brought it out. When they did, the server profusely apologized and took the charge off our order, which I highly appreciate. 

An hour-long wait for a reservation is very, very unimpressive, but since the food was so good, I'll probably be back again soon -- although maybe I'll check out the other location on South Van Ness.
author: Christine L.

description: I really enjoyed the ambiance of Limón. I ordered their octopus for dinner and it was amazing!
author: Lauryn H.

description: This establishment has gone down hill.  Ordered the chicken and the "signature" lomo saltado, the saltado was overly salty, like literally doused with soy sauce.  Furthermore, the beef was chewy and there were very few pieces of it.   Very disappointing.  The chicken was good, but there are no longer any lunch specials or specials of any kind.   It is apparent that this small chain has decided to focus on bottom line rather than serving the quality fare that got me interested in Peruvian food in the first place.  Finally, i have just returned from Peru, so i also think everything here is overpriced.  Do yourself a favor and just stick with the chicken here....at least that is still good.
author: Jason C.

description: Came here for date night and had such a great experience. It was super easy to make a reservation on Thursday evening for 6pm on a Friday. We were seated and greeted right away. Our server, Carlos, was extremely helpful and attentive! He recommended the lengua a la parilla and we loved it. We also went with: the ceviche trio, quarter chicken with arroz and yuca fries, and sangria. Everything came out in a timely manner and tasted amazing. Can't wait to go back!
author: Matt W.

description:
I loved every single food item we ordered (chicken, "Lomito" Saltado, ceviche de pescado). It was very well seasoned and the beef ("Lomito" Saltado) was tender and cooked perfectly.

Just make sure that you arrive as a group because they don't seat you if you are not complete.
author: Michèle S.

description:
I've had traditional Peruvian food before and this is definitely not what I expected to be.  I would consider this real Americanize Peruvian food.  

We started off with some Red Snapper Ceviche; overall good start, but would rather have had  the Shrimp.  Next came our Rotisserie Chicken, Truffle Mac & Cheese, and Fried Yuccas.  Overall, the chicken was cooked to perfection; juicy and tender to every bite with a crispy skin!  We shared a whole chicken and was enough for about 4-6 of us.  The mac & cheese was different, the macaroni was a tad bit under cooked with the oozy cheese and hint of truffle oil really brought this side to delight.  The Yucca fries were phenomenal!  Unlike most fries, this had some girth and meatiness. 

In the end, Limon delivered to my palates.  The place was hoping and full of life throughout our entire stay.  Next time I'm in town and in need of some Yucca fries and Chicken, I know where to stop by! - Enjoy!
author: Bao H.

description:
Order their rotisserie chicken! All portions of their chicken come with two sauces, both of which are yummy, but the chicken is so juicy and flavorful that you could probably go without them and still enjoy your meal. 

My boyfriend and I also picked the sautéed vegetables and the yuca fries as our sides with the chicken, and we were really impressed with both. We actually only ordered the vegetables because we felt like we should have some fiber in our dinner, but they were cooked so well and had a ton of flavor from the seasonings. 

Even after eating a whole chicken between the two of us, we still had some room left. 
(Note: I don't think this is reflective of most people. A half chicken or even a quarter chicken would satisfy most appetites. Portions are great!)
We ended up ordering the Polli-Papas afterward, which was just okay. The crispy chicken was a little too over-fried, and the meat tasted like it was a lot lower quality than the rotisserie chicken. Plus it was heavy with the papa fritas (which btw is just fries). It was more like bar food than anything else. I probably would've enjoyed it more if I was drunk.

Anyway, I'll be back for their rotisserie chicken! Or just order a bunch of their cocktails with their other dishes.
author: Sara L.

description:
Its hard to choose how many stars ... I think 3.5 but there is option so I give 4 

Food was 4 ( Portions was 2 -very small plates; Taste was 5 delicious {2+5= 7/2= 3.5}  I jump food to 4 because at the end was a delicious food)
Price was 3 (due to portions - I think they can do more) 
Service was 3.5 (they should be friendly in the beginning not until the end)

I will have to comeback; not a problem to give a second try and see if move up or down.
author: William H.

description: While the service was mediocre, the food was top notch. My husband and I shared a half chicken with sweet potato fries and the rice and beans. The empanadas were delicious as well! If you're looking for a good cocktail, I recommend the Cholo Lindo.
author: Samantha B.

description: I'd heard excellent things about this place and thought I'd try it out. The most popular item is the rotisserie, by far. I went once and tried the dark meat rotisserie chicken with two sides: yuca fries and the bean/rice mixture. I found the sides to be good, but the chicken to be a little bland. I decided to try it one more time. The second time, I got the white meat, with the same sides. This time, it was extremely dry, and still tasteless. No wonder it's always empty at lunch.
author: Ali K.

description:
Meh. Not really impressed. Nice design and set up, courteous service, but the food wasn't all that great. It was ok, which made the price not worth it. 

Might try the other location I've read people mention in their reviews, but don't think I'll come back here.
author: Janina M.

description: This place is incredible!! It deserves 6 stars! I've been to Peru and i must say the food is very authentic. The pisco sours are delicious too! Harry was our bartender, so sweet and had amazing customer service. Definitely recommend this place to every single person in the world.
author: Veronica M.

description:
Came for a late late lunch around 3pm with 2 friends & was seating immediately. Staff was friendly, offered up suggestions on the menu, and took our drink orders.

We decided to share a quarter chicken (that comes with 2 sides) - we chose the Yuca fries & Tacu Tacu, Taratara de Tuna, and Paella. 

My favorite of the 3 would definitely be the paella - had great flavor, included a bunch of great seafood & wasn't cooked too soft (my biggest pet peeve). 

We weren't stuffed, but satisfied with the 3. Would want to come back and try something else, but might also be worth mentioning it's a bit pricey if you're lookign for something more casual.
author: Carrie L.

description:
Chicken is amazing and I'm normally not that keen on chicken. I like the tacu tacu and green beans as sides;they are delicious. The ceviche is so fresh and has great flavors. I have been here several times and I always order the same thing because it is so good. The drinks are also good. I've had the sangria, margaritas, and the la bomba. I would recommend them all. 

The ambiance is a little louder than I would prefer and the tables are close together, but I don't even care because I love the food.
author: Megan B.

description: OMG the food here is sooooo good. They do have a few gluten free options like the rotisserie chicken, dark or white meat, side salad with gluten free dressing and the rice and beans. I think the ceviche is gluten free as well. The fires are gluten free but are cooked in the same fryer as things that are not so yeah.
author: Holly I.

description:
We have always enjoyed Limon and have been to all three locations but the one on Valencia is still our favorite. Easy reservations, great service and a well deserved 20% added to the bill. Even though it is loud in the dining room the vibe is excellent. It was Memorial Day weekend and my daughters were all back we had a pack people so we ordered almost one of everything on the menu. This is what we ordered:

Leche Tigre my personal favorite and usually keep the sauce for the Chicken.
Ceviche Mixto
Ceviche Pulpo y Camaron
Empanada de Carne
Empanada Pollo
Empanada de Vegetales
Whole Pollo a la Brasa
Lomito Saltado
Lengua
Truffle Mac & Cheese
Arroz co Marisco
Rocoto Molido
Profiteroles
Panna Cotta 

The Pitcher of Sangria goes great with all the food. $260 including tip. Parking is always a problem but there is a paid lot on 16th St. and Valencia. $10. near all the scary riff raff.
author: George F.

description:
I had a great meal at Limon- the food and drinks were wonderful. However, I want to share a bit about my experience there so that people will think twice before deciding on it as a venue for a special occasion.

It was my step mom's birthday, and her and my dad were in SF for the weekend. She likes Peruvian food, so we thought Limon would be a good fit for her special day. We were seated at our table, and within 60 seconds the waitress asked us if we knew what we'd like to drink. We hadn't seen the menu yet, so asked her for a minute more. We ordered the sangria, and then she was back literally another minute later asking us what we wanted for dinner. We weren't ready yet (we'd been in the restaurant for about 5 mins at this point) and she stomped off frustrated without saying a word. At this point we all figured she must have has a hard night, and left it at that.

50 minutes later (so, 55 minutes into our reservation) our bill came, which we signed immediately. The total was $230 which is expensive, but expected for a party of 6. Less than 5 minutes later another waiter came by and told us that, "they had many other reservations and would appreciate it if we would hurry up." They were kicking us out, and we hadn't even finished our drinks yet, let alone been there for an hour!

In all of my years of living in SF and LA, I'd never been as embarrassed as I was in that moment. It put a serious damper on the night, and even after talking to the manager he was unapologetic and frankly didn't care that we had just been booted from the restaurant before we were done with our meal.

Everyone please be aware of this restaurant, especially during busy periods. There are many places with great food, but experience is everything.
author: John M.

description:
I'm a fan, but it's truly 3.5 instead of a 3/5

Peruvian cuisine is one of my favorites for it's ability to be so simple, but extraordinary in flavor. I've had it countless times and I was expecting this restaurant to be mediocre because of it's trendiness and atmosphere, but it pleasantly surprised me. 

We ordered a chicken and a half for four of us with rice and beans, salad, sweet potato fries, and yucca. The sides (all except sweet potato fries) were really small, so we kinda had to ration it for all of us to enjoy. 

I did really like the chicken, although I have had much better in other Peruvian restaurants. This was my first time trying Peruvian in SF. The chicken was tender and salted nicely with enough flavor that still manages to beat out all other rotisserie chicken. I have no idea how this country and its people have made chicken to be so magical!

Disappointed that their green sauce is just meh. But you do get three different kinds of nice choices for your chicken and fries!

Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed my meal and thoroughly licked all my fingers.

Also, I feel like this would be a nice place for happy hour dranks.
author: Priti K.

description: Amazing food and drinks, energetic atmosphere and nice staff! Without reservations, the wait can be a little long, but it's definitely worth the wait! :)
author: Leila S.

description:
This is a fun casual restaurant with good food.

Tip: don't let them seat you upstairs in the back-- where i've been seated twice. It's dark, hot and noisy up there. Most recently I had a 7:30 Saturday night table and got put up there next to a overly-lively large table celebrating a birthday.

Wait staff is friendly and capable, but that upstairs space, try and avoid.
author: Shanan D.

description:
I'd been to the other one on Van Ness before which was about the same experience.  It's so incredibly loud in here and difficult to have much of a conversation.  

We had half a chicken which was good but not as impressive as I expected given it's their specialty here.  It lacked lively flavors although cooked nicely.  The dipping sauce helped, but Safeway and Costco definitely do it better.  The mash potatoes that came with were yummy as well as the sweet potato fries.  The octopus was soft, pliable and tasty.  We enjoyed the yucca fries too.  The short ribs were pretty good but tougher than expected.  The sangria was refreshing but seemed a bit watered down.  Our server was friendly and pretty attentive.  They're efficient with getting the food out and clearing the dishes.

Limon is definitely a festive restaurant with good service and food, but in comparison to many other restaurants, it doesn't stand out from the rest.
author: Elizabeth S.

description: Great place , good value for money . Rotisserie chicken and lomo saltado 2 must haves . Fries and sweet potato fries crispy and perfectly done.
author: Paula L.

description: As a vegetarian I had my reservations going to this place for work holiday dinner but I have to say they went above and beyond to accommodate vegetarians. I had vegetarian empanadas and salads were mostly vegetarian. Service was absolutely fantastic. Their bottomless sangria is definitely delicious and worth trying. Can't wait to go back!
author: Suprita K.

description: My go to in San Francisco. Food is great, crew is friendly and quick and all reasonably priced.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
Yes, the food is good as other Limon's, but we came with a large group and they force you to get the fix price menu, which doesn't go for less than $31/person.

After finding out no one in our group could order anything but the fix price. We order the fix price and comes only 3 plates of each appetizer for 12 people! 

Totally rip if
author: Marcia d.

description:
Very disappointed took our nephew who came to sf and really wanted to love it chicken was dry 
When the first open the place was packed 
Guess it also needs a new cook in the kitchen !
author: Paula O.

description: I ate sautéed mushrooms and ensalada rusa. Both were so yummy. But mushroom needs rice or bread with it and I ordered one. Rice and mushrooms were so good, we ended up eating it all together. Place is little noisy. Waiters were so good too. I definitely go Limon Rotisserie again.
author: Simbel G.

description:
Way way back when Pablo "Panda" Sandoval was a beloved SF Giant,
you would occasionally see him here hanging behind the bar (some times standing underneath his framed jersey) or just chillin'.

Then he went to Boston
(where he will be now called Pandarrr)
which wasn't the best news but also wasn't the worst - he could've gone to LA.

Then he went on to shit talk the Giants's organization
and that changed things.

So in honor of Mr. Panda's disconcerting revelations about his relationship with his teammates, allow me to name my two favorite dishes at Limon
Not that I dislike the other menu items, but these two just happen to be the staples almost every time I go.

The rotisserie chicken:
beautifully seasoned, slow roasted, and always juicy and succulent.  It's a must try.

The ceviche de pescado y camaron:
the flavors bright without being too citrusy, the seafood fresh, and the hint of heat are why this is my favorite spot for ceviche.

Dinner at Limon is a fantastic way to start your night out on the Mission but it also makes for a great lunch spot.  My only problem with having lunch here is I find it difficult to return to work after and would prefer to continue lounging in the cozy confines of the restaurant - much like a certain Panda use to (wenk wenk).
author: Dan B.

description:
Limon has been a family favorite for years and never ceases to please.  I'd recommend the Prix Fixe menu for large groups (particularly convenient with group seating at the Van Ness downstairs location). 

The ceviche is perfection.
author: Beth P.

description: I highly recommend this location, very good service even though i order to go, i love the ceviche which is from now on my friday thing, thank you to the lady who helped me today, i believe she is manager, you are awesome,thank you for the sauce !! See you soon
author: Karlie R.

description:
Amaaaaaaazing chicken with even better sauces to top it off. I'm a huge fan of mustard especially the ones that are a bit tangy-er and Limon has definitely got it right. It's also super affordable if you order a half/whole because it comes with extra sides that are just as deliiiicious!

Beware of the lines. Reservations can be made in advance to skip!
author: Loan L.

description: Wonderful food and buzz - not so much the bathrooms though. We went here to celebrate a birthday. The food was stellar and the staff very competent and friendly. Service was not super quick but it was a busy Saturday night so was to be expected. My one quibble was the men's bathroom. Paper towels on the floor, bad smell and obviously had not been cleaned in hours. I hope the ladies was better, this was a bathroom to escape quickly! Bar that a trendy tasty restaurant.
author: Tom M.

description:
Very popular place with long wait, I highly suggest making a reservation--and maybe call them directly instead of reserve through Yelp. We had the incident where they didn't seem to find online reservation, but the hostess still gave us our seats.

I love Peruvian and was craving for it. Chicha Morada (blue corn juice) is a must! Limon's in a bottle, and with it's own blend of other fruits and spices, more cinnamon than what I had before. We also ordered pisco, and it was strong and delicious!

Famous rotisserie chicken was okay, but the sides: yuca fries and stir-fried vegetable were absolutely amazing--!  Ceviche mixto and Lomito saltado were both delicious as well. 

The atmosphere is really, really loud. You sort of have to shout to each other, but this does not undermine the food ;) Overall, I think the food is very good and price is pretty good for SF too!
author: Ya K.

description: Made last minute reservations for two and glad I did. Dinner was at 7:00pm. The restaurant is live and the food is amazing. I had the picudo which was amazing hit all the right buds. For dinner we had a whole rotisserie chicken, papa fritas and vegetables. We had half for dinner and reminder for breakfast the next day. Chicken tasted even better the next day
author: Lorna N.

description: I don't even know where to start! We were a party or 15 and the service was so bad and poor! I wish they have no starts here because the food options for big services is just unbelievable bad and sad!!! The food is expensive to consider the quantities and also forced you to order from a separate menu. Very bad signal and no wifi as well... 4 out of 15 had headaches and stomachache after eating there... don't waste your time and money
author: Maria Y.

description: Love this place I love the ceviche and the empanadas...great music that makes the right atmosphere highly recommended:)
author: Harel A.

description:
I love everything about this restaurant. The craft cocktails are delicious, try their mojito or Peru's pisco sour (they recently took off my favorite, La Selva, and I'm hoping it comes back eventually. In the meantime I've replaced it with their amazing mojito). The sangria is a little too sweet for my liking, but if that's your thing, definitely check it out, or get a pitcher for the table.
Their food is on par with my grandma's homemade Peruvian cooking. If you go you have to try their empanadas, lomo saltado, championes anticucheros, and their tacu tacu. 
My only complaint is their menu lacks the popular Peruvian huancaina sauce, but the rest of their menu is filled with such amazing food I've stopped hoping for it. 
The restaurant itself is a bit noisy, but the food is good enough to make you forget. If noise bothers you, try sitting outside and enjoy the quieter end of Burlingame Ave. If you sit on the California side you'll get less foot traffic.
Be careful trying this place out because you won't be able to stop coming back!
author: Shannon H.

description:
The food was DELICIOUS.  The service was mediocre.  
We ordered ensalata mixta, the half chicken, and one of the steak dishes.  We couldn't stop eating because it was so tasty!!!  I think the waitstaff seemed a little bored and more interested in watching the football game at the bar then serving us, but they weren't rude.  Not a big deal compared to the cleanliness of the restaurant and how good the food was.
author: Natalie C.

description:
Delicious Peruvian food! Came here to celebrate residency match day with a group of 9 friends. Just because this place is known for its rotisserie chicken, doesn't mean it isn't vegetarian friendly! Half of our group was vegetarian and we were stuffed to the brim. We had delicious empanadas, a great beans/rice mix, ceviche, macaroni and cheese, sautéed mushrooms, a salad, and split two pitchers of margarita and sangria.

The only downsides were the bill added up quite a bit (ended up being $45 a person) and it was very loud- we had to shout at each other to talk just across the table. BUT still totally worth it.
author: Lindsay L.

description:
I'm currently on a mission to find the best Peruvian food in the bay area. I went into the Van Ness location for a valentine's day lunch with my boyfriend. Due to a "technical difficulty" at the location, the hostess sent us over to the Valencia location and assured us we'd be seated. I was so hungry, but had set my heart on the menu at Limón. Took us about 15 minutes to walk over. We were seated within 10 minutes on a busy afternoon.

Food: We started with the Ceviche Mixto and Empanadas de Pollo. My boyfriend wasn't in the food for seafood, so I killed it by myself. Really fresh and delicious. Great presentation and attention to detail, but even more attention to the robust flavors. The seafood medley was extremely fresh & juicy. However, it ironically lacked, "limon." I asked for extra lime. I really liked the nuts, it gave the dish greater texture. The empanadas were good, but I wish they had more pollo. I ordered the Arroz con Mariscos, which is like a Peruvian style paella, but so much better than paella. The rice for one is a lot more buttery, without being super oily. It's not sticky or mushy, just perfectly cooked. It comes with shrimp, mussels and some veggies. Extremely savory & full of flavor. I highly recommend this dish if you're a seafood aficionado. My boyfriend ordered the seco de costillas, boneless beef short ribs with potatoes & carrots.. it was essentially a beef stew. This was probably the only dish we didn't like. We couldn't really figure out what the broth was supposed to taste like, because it was overly salty. I had to douce this dish was lime in order to create some balance. The meat was tender and juicy, but a bit fattier than we'd like. I'd pass on this one next time. 

Service: The food was great, but service was not. They were very busy, however, I had to ask three different people for water three different times. 20 minutes later, my water came, because my boyfriend got up and asked for it. I guess standing up is key. My server never brought me half of what I asked her for, we had to have the busboys get it for us (after 2-3 times of asking). I understand that it was v-day and it was busy, but we felt extremely neglected the majority of the time we dined. 

Price: Great food, but portions are not the greatest. I did order multiple seafood dishes, but my main entree could have came with more seafood for the price I paid. Larger portions, please.

Ambiance: Larger than the Van Ness location. Clean, modern, simple & lively environment overall.

Overall: Limón has a wide menu with tons of apps, small plates & main entrees... and if you want to drink, the entire backside of the menu is just for drinks. Although prices are steep, the food is absolutely delicious & authentic. Aside from the terrible customer service experience, I'd come back for the food & hope that I'm acknowledged more by my server.
author: Astrid Z.

description:
My friends and I had a reservation here for 6:45pm. As soon as we got seated in the basement of the restaurant, a lady came over to tell us we had until 8:30pm to "chit chat and chill." We were also waiting on our 4th friend; however, the waiter came over to 3 times within 5 minutes asking if we were ready to order when our friend had not even arrived yet and also when our friend had 2 seconds to look over the menu. 

It was hard to focus on the food when we felt like we were being rushed out the door. This was my first experience ever being given a time limit at a restaurant and feeling like I was imposing. 

The tuna tartar was good. It had a spiciness to it that I personally enjoy. The chips served with it were a bit salty but thin. The quarter chicken combos are probably the most worthwhile things on the menu as it comes with 2 sides and 3 sauces for $11.95.
author: Lillian C.

description: Food great.   Service like a restaurant in Lima    But you ve got to adapt no - even if your re Peruvian no?
author: Chris S.

description: Pollo a la braza, pretty good, not too dry, good to share among 3-4 people. Lomo saltado was good, strong flavors, could be a little salty. The truffle mac and cheese was delish! I loved it the best
author: Jeana Y.

description: The food is fabulous.... everything was just yummy.  The service on the other hand is total opposite. We visited on a Friday night, we waited one hour to sit. Almost 25 minutes to have a waiter approach the table.  Another 10 minutes to even get water. The food came quick. But my daughters meal we kept asking and asking and never came. We all finished eating and no meal for her. Than they served he meal to go since we were ready to go. No apologies nothing. The manager was condescending when I approached him.  He expressed how he gave me the "Birthday dessert free". I don't need a free dessert which by the way is free to everyone celebrating birthdays there.  An apology would have sufficed.  I will make sure to visit one of the other two locations in SF instead. Hopefully my experience will be better.
author: Zuly G.

description:
Popped in again last night for drinks after dinner elsewhere (my partner was craving a burrito). 

The Maracuya ("passion fruit") Sour has long been my go-to cocktail at Limon but I spotted some other cocktails on the menu with passion fruit and after consulting with the bartender, received a recommendation for the La Bomba del Amor ("Love Bomb" in English). 

I now have a new favorite cocktail at Limon! Very happy with the bartender's recommendation. 

Per the menu, the La Bomba del Amor consists of vodka, orange liqueur, lemon juice, prickly pear and passion fruit. It's deliciously smooth and fruity, with a sourness level approaching that of a Jolly Rancher watermelon hard candy, but with tropical notes from the passion fruit.

Hard to describe but I would say it's somewhat similar to Original Joe's untraditional interpretation of a Hurricane cocktail, albeit much more natural-tasting (Limon likely uses better and fresher ingredients) and is thus less treacly/sugary/artificially syrupy (but yeah, it's undeniably on the sweet side). In a nutshell, liquified boozy candy, in the best possible way. So good!

My one and only criticism would be with *how* it was served. La Bomba del Amor really ought to be served chilled, without ice, in a martini glass (or at least more elegant glassware and not something that I associate with Lipton Tea (see photo)). 

Regardless, I'll definitely be ordering the La Bomba again during return visits (and there will be many!) and maybe the bartenders will be willing to oblige if I ask for it served chilled with no ice in a different vessel :D. 

We also had a pitcher of the house sangria; delicious as always and reasonably priced. Smooth but packs a punch.
author: Maya B.

description: The food was ok. However, this is one of those ridiculous SF places where you have to wait until everyone is here to have a table Even if a table is available and three out of four people are - you have to wait. Will I go back after  this service- no.
author: Julia D.

description:
Eh, the Van Ness location is way better.

The host quoted us 45mins-1 hour wait for a table. We waited at the bar for half an hour before checking up again. The host rudely blew me off saying, "Oh you don't have a reservation right? It's gonna be two hours." I know I didn't have a reservation, but there's no reason to be rude to a customer. I only asked because we were debating if we should just eat at the bar since we wanted to watch the game.

The chicken came out a little dry at this location. I tried the ceviche mixto here, and it wasn't that great. The pieces were bigger than the regular ceviches, and it didn't come with tortilla chips. The sangria isn't recommended either. Everything else like the vegetables and beef tongue tasted like the Van Ness location, which was good.

I won't be coming back to this location until they decide to stop hiring those "good looking," yet brainless girls in the front who can't properly host even when there's four of them.
author: Derek T.

description:
I found out my cousin was going to be in town for one night only, and she wanted to catch up over dinner.  First of all, I haven't seen this particular cousin since she was a fetus, so it was definitely time to find a restaurant where we could take our time and catch up.

I made a reservation at Limon for 6pm and was a bit early when I got there at 5:30pm.  I was welcomed by the host and other staff as soon as I walked in the door.  Although I was a bit early, I was still sat immediately.  The Valencia location is pretty big!  There's a fancy upstairs and plenty of seating downstairs with a bar.  

Limon's plates are meant to be like tapas, so, plates that are ordered up and shared amongst your party.  We got the tuna tartare (A. Bourdain would kill us), vegetable empanadas, and a half rotisserie chicken with sweet potato fries and rice.  All the food was really good and the portion sizes are generous.  The chicken, of course, was the best dish on the table.  Super tender and flavorful.  Next time I would opt for dark meat only, as the white meat, although tender, was a bit dry.

Lastly, the cocktail menu (the most important thing, naturally) was substantial and the drinks were well balanced.  It was really great catching up with my cousin over some delicious Peruvian food.  Can't wait to come back again.
author: Josh S.

description:
I actually made the reservation here thinking it was another place...( my mistake). It had been a couple years since I was in the area and wanted Peruvian food so I forgot about this place.
Its funny I stayed since on a previous time I visited I told myself I wouldn't come back... yet I was there. It was raining and it was a Friday night and I was treating a friend I hadn't seen in a year+. So I wasn't going to be super picky or be a grump about it. She was out finding parking while I waited...and waited....
It took her about 15 minutes, meanwhile I was standing, not greeted for a while, or offered to be seated- I would have ordered a drink or 2 while waiting.

Once seated, our waitress was great! Her service was great.
The food was good, my only complaint is that my ceviche mixto was not as good as other places I've had it at. I felt it needed something...can't quite pin point it.. But yea, the drinks were great- tasty and on point.
Overall, what is going to stop me from coming back is the service, rather lack or it.
author: Leticia B.

description:
My friends & I were craving Peruvian food as it was a beautiful 80 degree day in San Fran , decided to give "Limon" a try. No regrets what so ever with this choice. Has a very Latin / Miami vibe inside with a full bar & upbeat music . We started off with a pitcher of the house margarita. They definitely didn't skip out on the tequila , one glass in and we were definitely feeling festive . 

Limon has a variety of hot plates / tapas , ceviches & entrees . We decided to order a mix. The "Leche Tigre Cocktail" was made freshly and tasted up to par with other ceviches I've had in the past ( very small in comparison to other places) wished it was larger , as it was tasty. The "Chicharron de Pollo" hit the spot (crispy & succulent pieces of chicken). The "Polli-Papas" were the same pieces of "Chicharron" atop papas fritas ( thinly sliced French fries) topped with an aioli / Parmesan cheese . I would have to say the "Polli-Papas" was my favorite. Lastly we had a side of the "Yuca fries" which blew my mind with the combination of sauces/ aiolis provided as dipping sauces. Yuca fries were thick and cooked to perfection . 

Will I be making another stop at "Limon"!? Most certainly yes! My mouth is still watering!
author: Portia S.
