description: This is my third or fourth time to go over there.I love their chicken!! The chefs seasoning the chicken so well that I feel like I want to have the whole chicken by myself. The service is good, food is amazing! I will definitely come back with my friends again.
author: Gloria Y.

description: Food is good! But damn do they nickel and dime you here. Ceviche does not include chips. Who wants ceviche without chips. Strange. Extra for hot sauce too. Went for the poke bowl, pescado ceviche, glass of wine, and pisco sour for about $80. It's just too much for what you are getting even in sf. They will not seat you without your whole party even if a party of two. They also ask you if you made reservations when they have an empty restaurant and look at you with disdain when you say no. Overall experience is a one star but food is good.
author: Lauren R.

description:
Visiting from NY, wanted to find a good, affordable, fun place to eat while visiting someone. I had their Mac n Cheese which was AMAZING. The garlic really made it perfect and the cheese was excellent as well. Had their regular fries, also amazing. The person I went with had the beef tongue and skirt steak and also seemed to enjoy it - I had his potatoes (beautiful purple potatoes) and also tasted amazing. No complaints on my end :) 
The place itself was also nice, the neighborhood it's in is trendy which may or may not be a good thing depending on your preference - for a NYer reference, kind of reminds you of Williamsburg or whatever area hipsters are invading now.
author: Eszter H.

description: My friend used to work here and even after he stopped working there some of the staff remember me. Everyone is friendly and professional . I had the empanadas and chicken rotisserie almost every time. I find the restaurant perfect for a date night and the service was amazing as always.
author: Moe C.

description:
I was really excited to try this place but it was sort of a let down. Now don't get me wrong, the chicken was fabulous. The cebiche was very good. But over all the rest of the food was okay and the service was lacking. 

We had a large party which I think may have been part of the reason we had bad service. We ordered sangria for the table but they took an hour or so before they brought any water out and when they did, they didn't give us glasses. 

We were at a networking event and instead of politely informing us that dinner was about to be served they ordered us to take our seats which I found strange and rude. They brought a good variety of their food which included salad, chicken, cebiche, fries and some other plates. They didn't explain what any of the dishes were. They just sat them down. There was one dish that looked like chicken but was pretty tough. It was also extremely salty. 

The chicken was moist and flavorful. The fries were luke warm and when we asked for ketchup they said they didn't have any. It was very strange. 

Over all I felt the experience was just ok.
author: Jordan M.

description:
Never understood why this only gets 3.5*!

This place has awesome food, is very well priced and has good cocktails. Lively atmosphere that's great to go out with friends and service is super fast. Really can't go wrong.

Some food favorites:

1. Chicken - have to get the full chicken (or smaller depending on how many people)
2. Short ribs - melt in your mouth
3. Mac and cheese - they have an awesome truffle mac and cheese. Def worth ordering. 
4. Tacu tacu and other sides - great sides; love the sweet potato fries and the tacu tacu

Their piscos are great and so are their whiskey drinks. 

For the price, it's too good!
author: Farid V.

description: Great food and very quick to come out. My only gripe was our waiter's inattention, but I think he was discouraged to come to our table because I was dining with a big group of girls for a bachelorette. Can hardly blame him for not wanting to come over to our annoying table so much!
author: Stacy P.

description: Okay ceviche and rice, but the overly spicy octopus left much to be desired--i.e. it was barely edible--and the paella was just kind of bitter and boring. The chicken tasted like chicken, and not in the good way, but in the 'chalky' way. It was also unpleasantly noisy. I don't think I would go here twice.
author: Amitabho C.

description:
I came here for Sunday brunch and reserved in advance, but would probably have been ok without a reservation cus it wasn't crowded at all. Not the best waiter service, but the food was pretty good. 

We ordered the mac & cheese and the tuna tartare. Pretty small portions, but surprisingly filling. The fried chip things that came with the tuna was really good. Everything went well together, but the fish itself didn't have a very fresh taste.
author: Juliana P.

description:
Mac and cheese (I didn't really like it). Peruvian chicken (asked for dark and double halves -the sauces are bomb with it). I could order that all day here. sweet potato fries, ensalada rusa, yuka, lomo saltado were all pretty good. Chicks morada was ok. Not a fan of cinnamon unless it's fireball but I can drink this again. 

The chicken is really good here. I used to eat a lot of Peruvian chicken in VA and this place tops many of those places including super chicken.
author: Rocky B.

description:
I have been here many times but last night for my birthday I decided to go again. 

One of my favorite restaurants and the food is delicious! I was not disappointed.
author: Ashley T.

description: Very tasty.  We had the half chicken, beef tongue, sweet potatoes fries, fish and calamari, green beans.  Dessert was mango and chocolate cake!
author: Portia C.

description:
I don't eat potatoes and they don't do substitutions, so I ended up ordering two entrees.

The tongue and skirt steak were very good, but I don't think some greens or salad or vegetables, in place of the potatoes is a lot to ask.  The end result is that I end up with potatoes that I can't eat and a double portion of meat, which I probably shouldn't eat, but one portion isn't very filling in and of itself.

Even with potatoes, this place isn't doing your colon any favors.


4/19:
Thanks Laurina.  If I ever want to consume something even less filling than your available entrees or if I ever decided to slowly funnel my bank account into your establishment in order to sit in a loud, crowded hole-in-the-wall that charges for, rather than simply substitutes $1 worth of vegetables; I will be sure to do that!  -1.
author: Eric L.

description: I had dinner with family here. Not sure if the server was having a bad day, but he was short and rude. My family was visiting from Canada. Not a great experience. But the Limon on South Van Ness very friendly and great customer service!!!
author: ana l.

description:
Have been to Limón twice now and they certainly don't disappoint. The lomo Soltado is a hit along with the tacu tacu and the chicken empanadas!!!
Will return again for sure!!!
author: Hovik A.

description: Delicious experience from start to finish-beautiful drinks and desserts included. Service was very good too and our wait time shorter than expected. Chicken was super tender and juicy. Watching the cooks working in the open kitchen from our table in loft was fun. Wow, those guys were hustling to get that amazing chicken and those yummy yucca fries out! My husband's second time there, will be back again for sure.
author: Jutta F.

description: This place used to gave a terrific happy hour with great food and reasonable prices but just went to a limited menu and prices jumped over 30% in one shot. Too bad.
author: James D.

description:
solid food. 

not one of my favorite places but definitely consistent. the ambiance is just a bit different than what i'm looking for.
author: Vanessa S.

description: One of my favorite restaurant in SF! The hype is real, really juicy delicious chicken. Food is the bomb, really amazing service. Though it can get busy, food comes out really quick! Kudos to the staff & management
author: Taryn M.

description: I have very mixed feelings regarding the dining and service. The food, although pricey, was quite good. I've eaten there before and always enjoyed the food. However, the atmosphere is a bit off-putting. We were sat in the middle of a section where the tables were so close that it was difficult to get through and you were forced to hear your neighbors. There were plenty of other seats available so, we requested a change because it was difficult to hold a conversation. The hostess stated that they could not move us because the seats were reserved. I have worked as a hostess and I understand that sometimes you can't seat people where they want but in an empty restaurant, making zero effort to accommodate started off the meal on a unpleasant note. Our server was very nice and the food came quickly. However, our meal was completely spoiled by a drunk couple groping eachother and making out loudly in a table close by. My partner couldn't look at me without seeing them behind us and we both lost our appetites. Usually the behavior of other customers would not impact my feelings about a place but the hostess refused to move us or say anything to the couple even after multiple tables asked.
author: Mimi G.

description: Came here with coworkers and everyone had a great time. It's really a great place for groups and it's super affordable. Only critique is that they wouldn't accept Amex. I would imagine a lot of companies eat or order from here so that was very surprising. Not ideal and we all had to pay with our personal cards. Please fix this so we can come more
author: Laura D.

description:
"WHAT!?  SAY THAT AGAIN?!"

Those are the words I said multiple times in Limon during dinner.  I felt like Colin Kapernick calling plays in Seattle with the 12th man.  I know that a lot of the hipptity-doo-da restaurants are all like this now but I don't know how or why this decimal level is appropriate for dining. 

That being said I came with a group of 7.  Limon has the main floor and also a second loft floor so there is plenty of tables and seating for large groups.  We were provided with menus and our drinks orders were taken very soon after.  As far as food we ordered:

Chichirron de Pollo:  this little deep fried pieces of chicken were tasty.  Some were a bit dry so a dipping sauce would help.  But a great starter dish.

Truffle Mac n Cheese:  my wife and the rest of our group liked this dish.  I'm a tough judge when it comes to mac n cheese,  I'll just say it's ok.

Lomo Saltado:  Everybody's go-to dish at a peruvian restaurant.   Limon's version is decent but comes in a small portion for $13.95.

Ceviche: as Popeye would say "I am what I am."  The ceviche is what is it is..

The service was lacking at different times during our ordering and meal.  But one aspect that left a sour taste in my mouth besides the ceviche was that the guy busing the table was clearing out the table while we are all sitting down eating.  He proceeded to spill some of the liquid on one of our entrees all over my wife's dress.  When I said something to him he acted like he could care less.  

The food at Limon was decent tasting.  I found the dishes to be overpriced for what we got and quality-wise.  The volume of the restaurant for me was uncomfortable and as mentioned earlier the service was poor.  Overall I can pass on coming to Limon again.  There's too many good restaurants in the area to give them my business again.
author: Michael L.

description: This review is for both of their locations. The service and food here are amazing. I'm not a big fan of rotisserie chicken (which is what they specialize in) so I usually get the Carne a la Parilla and Ceviche. The carne is delicious- it is my go to meal every time I'm in the city craving steak. Also, if you want to get the whole Peruvian experience, you have to start out with one of their pisco sours. I recommend the Maracuya sour if you like something on the sweeter side!
author: Lore O.

description: What is wrong with people?  I am standing in front of the host and visibly one can see I am missing a arm and he asked "Is that a service animal and do you have a disability? ". Then proceeded to ask for my paperwork.  I think missing an arm makes it very obvious I have a disability
author: Brad B.

description: I love how Laurina comments on on the good reviews, but not the bad which goes to show the service and staff need to be refreshed, according to other Yelp reviews. 2.5 stars because the ceviche is tasty. However, my friend and I arrived at 5pm on a Friday without a reservation. The host said that we would need to let our table go in an hour and fifteen, so we sat at the bar because my friend and I had not seen each other in a while and did not want to be rushed. Jokes on us. Somehow the bartender/server came up to use rudely about 5 times in 5 minutes to pressure us to order. This is after we order sangria/ceviche immediately after sitting down. Like dude, chill we haven't even had a sip of sangria. Mind you the bar is first come first served and not reserved. He went on break and the following women was just as rude. We literally cancelled our second app and just wanted to get out of there, so we did. Go to a million of the other places around there with better food and service.
author: Zack V.

description:
We were looking for a place to celebrate a special birthday, my BF's mom! Reservation accommodations went from a party of 3 to a party of 6 & a baby, so we had to change up our restaurant last minute. On a Monday night around 4pm, I was able to call Limón and make a reservation for our party at 6pm.

I had never before experience Peruvian (tapas) before so I didn't really know what to expect. But literally all the dishes we ordered were DELICIOUS, we couldn't stop talking about how everything was amazing. 

The birthday celebrant, BF, and I started with a glass of white sangria each [$6/glass] - wish it was stronger, but I'll try the red one next time. For the food, we started the ceviche mixto as an appetizer - mix of fish, calamari and shrimp - with the most tasty lemon and juice mixture [$14.95] - amazing, fresh, and delicious. 

We then went ahead and order the white half chicken (4 pieces) with 2 choices of sides and the "aji" sauces [$16]. For the sides we went for the yuca fries and tacu-tacu (sauteed rice & beans). The chicken was surprisingly moist and tender and went well with the sides, for the sauce, my favorite was the green one (chimichurri). 

To pair with the chicken, we ordered the Arroz con Mariscos - Peruvian style paella made w/ safffron rice, mixture of seafood, aji amarillo pimento sauce [$17.95] - one of the best paella's I've had in life, we ordered it twice. The rice was cooked thoroughly so it wasn't hard, but not overcooked where the rice was mushy. The seafood was plentiful in the dish and fresh.
We then turned to the small hot plates, and asked our server how many each plate feeds - he mentioned 3 or 4 depending on serving sizes. So we went ahead and ordered 3 different plates: 
1) "Lomito" Saltado - dish with stir-fried sirloin strips, onions, tomato, soy sauce, & french fries [$13.95] 

2) Jalea - mixture of crispy seafood, yucca, salsa criolla served with huacatay tartar sauce [$13.95] - this was basically peruvian style calamari, delicious! 

3) Chicharron de Pollo - crispy pieces of chicken marinated in soy sauce, Garlic, Aji Amarillo, served with salsa criolla [$11.95] - slightly salty, but tasty nonetheless (you definitely need floss after this one)

Lastly, we went with the empanadas based on the yelp reviews, and went with the veggie empanadas (mushroom, spinach, choclo and mascarpone cheese) [2 pieces for $8.95]. Glad we got the veggies since everything else we ordered had some type of protein in it. These were crispy on the outside and flavorful on the inside. 

To end our delicious meal, we went ahead and ordered dessert - the bandido which was basically chocolate cake and ice cream [$9.95] and the mango panna cotta [$9.95] which was like a flan with mango puree, just not as sweet (which I loved). 

For all of this, and a few dishes we ordered a 2nd time, our check came out to about $250 w/ gratuity included. 

All in all, our dining experience at Limón was delicious. Though I wished our server, Angel, interacted with us more, especially since we were a larger party, the food made up for the service.
author: Kathleene E.

description: Loved everything! Drinks, ceviche, chicken, steak. No complaints and I like to complain
author: Dustin H.

description: I come her for my Peruvian fix. I like this place because I can always count on a solid meal. I usually try to get a nice sampler of everything. I like the ceviche mixto as a starter; it's light, refreshing  and a good mix of flavors. The veggie empanadas are always a winner: the mushrooms, cheese and veggies mesh very well together. The yuca fries are delicious and I always find myself getting another order; the sauce they come with is such a good addition. The lengua a la parrilla is outstanding, the beef tongue is both crispy and tender and a very unique mix of tastes. The chicharron de pollo is very well nuanced and a great entree as well. The rotisserie chicken is something they're well known for and a no brainer. If you haven't tried their drinks; those are very well made too. The servers and bartenders are always friendly and attentive. If you haven't tried Limon, you've gotta; it's an SF staple.
author: Beth G.

description: I was really looking forward to dining here since I had heard so many good things about it. I went with two friends who live in the neighborhood and they highly recommended it. Unfortunately it was one of the worse experiences I have ever had. After being seated. Our waiter took our order but seemed irritated the entire time. Two of the three dishes came right away and then the third dish came much later. We kept trying to find our waiter but he was no where to be found. In fact he never came back. We had to ask a waitress for the remainder of the service. We even asked her what happened and she responded that he must have gone on a brake. Seriously, I don't remember poorer service. The food was good but you can find good food at a lot of places on Valencia Street that will treat their patrons better. I would think twice about returning.
author: Philip V.

description: This is a usual place for me to go, and last week I went and order my usual yuca ( commonly accompanied by a dip yellow sauce) when the waitress came no sauce!! I don't care to pay, but please do not make your plates smaller or remove items because costumers know what they order and it is annoying to see you are being ripped off. Charge me !! Trust me I don't mind if you raise your prices 75 cents but dont do that, that's cheap and even disrespectful for the people who goes to your places often. So sad!
author: Daniela J.

description: Ceviche mixto Classico... so good! Also shared a half chicken and those two were enough to share for two people. Food is fresh and expertly seasoned. Decor is unpretentious. Will definitely be back!
author: Janie S.

description:
It's very disappointing on a Tuesday night. 

I used to love coming here because the Rotisserie chicken comes with three amazing sauce. People that never been here can try it. Now they got lazy . Dump the chickens and the side in a pan. Put in the same sauce in it to. 

Tuna tar tar , wow looks like leftover food. My friend said there's a lot of avocado than the tuna. 

Truffle mac and cheese and Ceviche Mixto was still good at least.

Not taking my friends here again. Super sad with the quality of the food.
author: Miri L.

description: Great food, great service.  Portion sizes not huge, but most of them aren't too small.  Desserts were small.  A bit overpriced...surprised to even be charged $2 for a couple tablespoons of chimichurri sauce.  Recommended overall.
author: David H.

description: Awesome food! Good service. Very flavorful love their empanadas, ceviche, and pollo a la Brasa ( very well seasoned) their yellow sauce is super tasty! Can't wait to try their lomo saltado!
author: Dea G.

description:
Mere hours after landing in SF, my local gal pal and I had made plans to meet up and rekindle our friendship, forged the previous year over games of Cards Against Humanity and drinking Pisco Sours. Given her South American heritage I was thrilled when she strongly vouched for Limón Rotisserie - a Peruvian gastronomic experience.
 
Due to the haphazard and uncertain nature of our planning, we decided to roll the dice with this place, make reservations first (we got 9PM unfortunately) and show up early to see if we could score a seat at the bar or swipe that of a no-show. The latter of which was a laughable thought, as folks in SF don't miss out on their resos at Limón I learned, so we arrived and were fortunate enough to grab a seat at the bar.

It's a hive of activity to put it mildly, even on a Sunday evening the tables are packed, and the line up of folks trying to get a seat is lengthy. Aesthetically the place is uber modern and aside from the Latin American influences behind the bar and on the menu, you'd be hard pressed to distinguish this spot from any other über modern restaurant spot. All the same, it's definitely a "hot spot" and very contemporary.

Enough story, now what about the food and drink. Well I let me dc lead the way and order us a round of Pisco Sours to start ($10 each). Now I must say that heavy citrus-based alcohol beverages do wreak havoc on my acid indigestion, so if you're like me, I'd steer clear. Despite being a delicious palate pleaser; by the end of my first drink I was feeling the burn (literally). My next drink choice, and the one that got me through the rest of my meal, was a glass of their sangria ($6), which I found to be made with a great easy drinking red wine and was chalk full of ice and fruits, always a fave of mine.

Limón has a wide array of tapas style sharable plates so we decided to share 3 dishes and see how we felt after. We started with the Lomito saltado ($12.95), and while I remember it being delicious, sadly I cannot remember for the life of me what was in it. Following that we had the Ceviche mixto ($12.95) which I can clearly recall all the wonderful raw fish elements in it but specifically liked the scallops covered wonderfully in traditional Ceviche lime juices and herbs. Then came the third tapas which was a plate of Truffle Mac & cheese ($6.75). What more can I say about this dish... Mac & Cheese done with truffle oils and thick, delicious cheese sauce. Damn. Definitely NOT a Peruvian dish by far BUT hearty and delicious in a stick to your ribs kinda way - YUM-O!

By the time this final plate was done, we were stuffed. I think 3 plates is the perfect number for 2 guests and I would recommend upping your plate total from there accordingly for every guest in your party.

Eatcrest Out!
author: Kris U.

description: Was looking for some good Mexican and stumbled into this Peruvian restaurant by chance and was quite happy I did. We ordered chicken and cheese empanadas as appetizers and the half rotisserie chicken, pescado a lo macho, polo-papas, and Loma saltado for entrees. Everything was delicious.
author: Chris E.

description: My friend and I knew how annoying it was for the staff to have us dine in 5 minutes before the restaurant closes, but this place informed us in a very professional way that we could still get served at the bar. Their bartender Jorge is extremely nice and makes outstanding cocktail drinks! Also, the ceviche mixto and bread pudding is to die for! Will definitely come back! Next time with a reservation lol
author: Kevin S.

description: I would highly recommend limón! Smaller portions but the taste is well worth the smaller size. Really flavorful food and great service!
author: John Michael N.

description:
Oh Dios mio, this was so good! My spouse was born in Peru and loves Peruvian food, and I've grown to love it, too. He got one of his favorites, lomo saltado, and the meat was out of this world. Tender and flavorful. He gave it a big thumbs up....but wouldn't admit it was better than his dad's. ;)

I got the 1/4 rotisserie chicken, which came with 2 sides. I chose veggies and yuca fries with different sauces. Holy shit, those were the best yuca fries I've ever had. That's all I even remember!! I was blinded by yuca!! Yuca fries are usually a bit tough, even fibrous--but they were tender and.....creamy? God god, I was raving about them. I'd go back again just for those damn fries. Oh, the chicken was good, too. :)
author: Kelly O.

description: Lomo saltado is delicious!!! Always have the same thing each visit. Only complaint is portion size. For the price, the dish is on the small side.
author: Jonathan M.

description:
Went there last night and the food was absolutely amazing. Normally Tapas places have a long wait for paellas but I don't remember waiting a particularly long time for the paella. Yuca fries were on point and I recommend getting all three dipping sauces. We also got pitchers of the white sangria for $30. A good price when split between 4 people. 

I am giving this place a lower rating because of my experience. a large party was sat by us, overall they were fine but the leader of the group definitely altered our experience. He was riding a Segway type thing around the restaurant and calling the hostess sugar tits. When we asked the hostess about him and voiced our concerns, she said that everything at their table had been paid for and that he was brought in for promotional reasons.

I understand that a restaurant wants to bring attention and publicity to their restaurant, but allowing a guest to affect other patrons' experiences is unacceptable. I also understand that sometimes restaurants can't control who comes in, and for that reason I wouldn't have let this guests behavior affect the rating had he just been another guest. However, since he was there for promotional reasons and the restaurant chose for him to be there, this is another story.

I hope that Limon keeps this in mind for the future. I don't know if and when I'll be back but I hope that this is not indicative of Limon's normal clientele:
author: Rachel M.

description:
I came here for dinner with two other people around 5 PM on a weeknight. There was no wait as we were seated right away. It's a really nice restaurant - minimal decor, good service, pretty simple menu.

The menu consists of tapas for sharing, bigger plates like paella & ceviche, and a pretty extensive drink menu. Between the three of us, we ordered three small plates and one entree of paella. 

Small plates: chicken empanadas, braised beef short ribs, and mushrooms. The empanadas were the star of the meal - super well-cooked and a really yummy sauce. I wish there were more empanadas instead of just two in an order! The beef was okay. I'm not a great judge of beef, but it was very tender and not too salty. The mushrooms were just okay. I thought they could have been seasoned better. 

The seafood paella was a little too sauce-y for my taste. And since it was seafood paella, the fishy taste pervaded the whole entree. There was a good amount of seafood in it, so you get your money's worth, but the fishiness was a little too overpowering even for someone who enjoys seafood. 

Nothing too special that stood out in my opinion.
author: Steph V.

description:
Solid joint. Their most ordered dish is their slow roasted chicken, which we got a half order of to share with yuca fries and vegetales saltado for our sides. The chicken size you order also affects the size of the two complementary sides you get. The dark meat of the chicken was delicious, but the white meat could've been executed better. It was a bit dry, but definitely still delicious thanks to the sauces they bring for the chicken. This was the very first time I've had Yuca fries and they were SO good!! Lightly fried, crunch yet soft in the middle - this is my ideal fry. The vegetales (veggies) were fine. Nothing special. 

We also ordered truffle Mac and cheese, which was really good as well and would recommend as a small plate to have next to the chicken. My one disappointment with this dish was that it got more watery as I kept eating it, think the sauce got diluted on the bottom... but minor detail. 

Lastly - drinks. Probably the most disappointing part of my meal. We got a red and white wine sangria respectively and it was very watered down. My hypothesis is that a lot of ice melted already prior to serving... Bummer. 

Overall, this isn't the best Peruvian food I've had, but would come again for the nice atmosphere, friendly servers and tasty food.
author: Claudia C.

description: Excellent Peruvian food, love their ceviche, lomo saltado and yuca fries. A must try!
author: Carlos A.

description:
Went here on a Friday night. Seated right away and the hostess was great. Took a few minutes for the waiter to come, we ordered, and everything seemed good. Our food came really quick and was delivered by a food runner. We ordered water earlier and had empty glasses at this point.

The food was good. We enjoyed the tastes.

We never received a refill on our water and no one ever came around and asked how we were doing, etc. We waiting about 15-20 mins after finishing our food for our server to come back, but he never came. We finally had to get up and ask the hostess for our check. She brought the check to us promptly,  but we still never saw our server again. We could see him standing towards the back chatting, but never came to our table again.

Likely will never return.
author: Dustin S.

description: Chicken was good! The white meat was more dryer than the dark meat. Had the fries and they were great. The sauce that the chicken comes with is really good, and you can buy 3 more sauces too!
author: Sujen S.

description:
My friend and I came here for a late dinner after a long day at work. Let me just tell you this hit the spot right on! I got the "Lomito Saltado" which was amazingly tender and full of flavor. My friend got the "Carne a la parilla" and he loved it as well. Great drinks as well, we ordered their sangrias and finished of with the best dessert "Mango Panna Cotta" which I highly recommend. 

The service was mediocre. We noticed we were kind of ignored, the rest of the guests seemed like they were visted by their waiter and the Manager more often than us. 

Overall our visit was ok, but the food was amazing so this is why we are rating .
author: alvaro v.

description: OMG amazing little gem!! The food is so flavorful. The chicken melts in your mouth literally. Service was great and the restaurant was packed! I cant wait to come again!
author: Ashley E.

description: Food was good and a great spot on the corner. The portions were average size, and the drinks were a little overpriced. With that being said, Limon has great rotisserie chicken, rice and beans, and the empanadas were fantastic!
author: Ross S.

description: Waiter was offended that we pointed out he gave us the wrong check and he had to go back and get us the right one (we were over charged). So entitled and wrong
author: ferhat n.

description:
TASTY PERUVIAN FOOD IN A LIVELY SETTING

Located near the always busy intersection of 16th and Valencia, Limón is always bustling with customers. The interior is modern with cramped seating. I am so glad we made a reservation.

We decided to share the following:

Polla a la Brasa-The rotisserie chicken was perfectly seasoned and the sauces on the side added a nice contrast to the crispy skin. This is a must order dish!

Ceviche Mixto-The fish, calamari, and shrimp was fresh and carefully composed but the portion was petite.

Lomito Saltado-Stir-fried sirloin strips, onions, and tomatoes served with fries and rice was delicious. I know the dish has two carbs but somehow it works.

Jalea-A mixture of crispy seafood, yucca, and salsa served with tartar sauce. Again, the serving was miniature.

I felt the servings were smaller than average but the food was very good. Our server was very attentive and we never felt rushed.

Food:  A, portions are on the small side
Service:  A, attentive and efficient
Décor:  B
author: Rob L.

description: Ordered a quarter rotisserie chicken with rice and beans, and fried yuka.  The chicken was cold.  When I complained, the kitchen staff started to complain. Then they put a peace of chicken in the microwave for 3-5 minutes.  Talk about SYNICAL over kill.  Server brings back the chicken boiling hot.  And killed the flavor.  Thanks for the great customer service! Put a fork in it!
author: Ramsey A.

description:
food: 2 stars
service: 2 stars
drinks: 4 stars
This Peruvian establishment has the decibel levels of a very busy bar. Definitely one of those places where you have to shout across the table to speak. People must really like their drinks or the lounge-y vibe because this place is thriving and it's not because of the lackluster food.   
The food looked tasty on the plate but it was just really uninspired and lacked flavor. Maybe we should have ordered the pollo a la brasa because none of the dishes we ordered really stood out. We got "the usual:" lomo saltado, leche de tigre, emapanadas and a seafood paella. The paella tasted pretty gross btw. The rice was hard (undercooked) and it didn't seem like the flavors had sunk in yet. I would not recommend this dish to people who like rice and paella dishes.    
I was a bit surprised and disappointed that they didn't have aji de gallina on the menu... It's my favorite Peruvian dish and I have seen it at every Peruvian restaurant I have been to: both chain Peruvian places and mom and pop places. 
Service was atrocious. Our server (girl with dyed blonde hair who was in charge of the upstairs area on Saturday night) took our orders, but pretty much disappeared until it was time to bring the check... Other people brought out our food and we had to ask for water refills twice. (Their water cups are super tiny). I wanted to order a second lychee pisco because the first one was so good, but we couldn't find a server and the bussers who bring your food come and go so quickly you don't have time to say "otro Pisco por favor."
author: Lani G.

description:
Enjoyed some of the food we had for dinner, liked the ambiance and decor of the place, but the service left much to be desired.

We got the chicken, which was great. Really flavorful, tender, and moist. A half chicken was enough to share as an entree between two. One of the sides we got was rice and beans, a bit on the bland side, wouldn't order again. The mac n' cheese was also tasty. We got one of the ceviches, it had some type of nuts or grains in it, wasn't a huge fan. I got the lychee pisco sour, didn't like it at all and ended up not finishing it. My friend got the regular pisco sour, and it was much better. Had a glass of the Malbec that was very nice, and very reasonably priced at $10.

While the food was overall enjoyable, the service was pretty terrible. We were sitting at the bar for dinner. Had to ask the bartender several times to get a glass of water. At one point he was on the opposite side of the bar talking to another staff member for several minutes and couldn't get his attention. Asked a passing waitress for the drink menu, and she replied that we would have to get it from the bartender since we were seated at the bar. After telling her  the bartender was being unresponsive, she reiterated we would have to wait for him. Ended up having to get up and walk over to the bartender to get his attention. Definitely a lower level of customer service than I would expect for a restaurant like this.

The ambiance is trendy and had a lot of energy. Was a great spot for a post-work Friday night dinner, but might be a little loud if you are trying to have an intimate conversation. Bathrooms were top notch, very nicely decorated, clean, and smelled great.
author: Michael S.

description: Ok first of all the food was delicious, seco  and lomo saltado and empanadas can't complain about the food, drinks were weak, but the service leaves a lot to be desire, first me and my husband get there at 4 and ask for reservations for 6 for 4 people we were meeting another couple at 6, the host told us no same day reservations, ok, then we came back around 5:15 to wait at the bar having drinks and ask for a table for 4 when our friends get there, they couldn't hold a table until everyone was there and because we didn't have reservations we will have to eat in an hour. Are you kidding me?? Well when our friends got there another host just took us to a table with no problem so the first host was a useless person.
author: Angela E.

description:
This is such a fun spot. Their sangria and caipirinhas are great (highly recommend both) and it's easy to come with a group and eat family-style. 

One word of caution for groups though: our waitress was nice and let us split the bill between 6 since we stayed late and things were quieting down (9pm on a Tuesday), but they can't always split the check that many ways when they're busy. 

For good, try the paella, ceviche, empanadas and, of course, some rotisserie chicken!
author: Sophie B.

description:
Food was edible not out of the world.....one thing totally unacceptable...we were a group of 7 celebrating a birthday, we were not loud. As music was blasting but since our waitress was off, taken care d our bill gave her her tip....we were given 5 minutes to leave. (By a diferent waiter) never i mean NEVER has anyone asked us to leave because we were not "their" table any longer...will NEVER RETURN!!!!  AGAIN food wasn't even that great. 

Got one star because no choice
author: Hope M.

description:
The chicken is as good as everyone says - moist, full of flavor, and hearty portions for a great value.  I didn't love: (1) sangria - way sweet for me!  (2) the lomo saltado - while the portion was hearty, the flavor paled in comparison to the chicken; and (3) the queso empanada - two empanadas for $9. It's a good option as an appetizer, but it was a little too oily and not particularly impressive given the price. 

We made reservations on Yelp -so easy!  The restaurant is loud and music was blasting.  Seems like a particularly fun atmosphere for celebrating a birthday dinner or hanging out with the girlfriends.  Would definitely recommend a visit.
author: Kimya P.

description:
PSA - website says they're open until 10PM on Sundays. But not this past Sunday...

I was returning from a long road trip (LA) and searched for restaurants open after 9pm on a Sunday.  I was excited that Limon was open until 10 since I LOVE the food. 

I arrived at this location at 9:22pm and was told the kitchen was closed.  Really disappointed, not to mention HANGRY, with the early closure. 

To add insult to injury, they referred me to the next location down the street--- giving me their phone number --- and the kitchen was closed there too. 

If this is the norm, change the hours on the website and Yelp...
author: Risa G.

description: In love with this place. They've been fantastic every time I've been there. Food is the best Peruvian food I've had in a long time.
author: L L.

description:
I am a human with a human sized appetite and a human sized salary, thus tapas usually annoy the ish outta me.  Tiny baby food+full sized prices = grumpy me that usually needs to stop at Arinell in order to contain my inner Godzilla. 

HOWEVER.  Enter Limón, with it's half chicken and truffle mac and cheese.  I know this is not the appropriate context for this, but YASSSS QUEEEN.  Tasty food, reasonable price, convenient location!
author: Amber M.

description:
Finally tried out Limon Rotisserie for my hipster lunch after going to the FourBarrelCoffee party.

It was pretty quiet during my lunch since it was after 1pm.  I ate at the bar.  Had to ask for napkin & silver wear.

Tried out:

Ceviche cocktail $6.95 - a bunch of ceviche, cornuts, 2 taro chips to eat them with.  Sauce is super salty & full of lime.  They don't have bread which I really wanted, oh well.  It was ok.

Got a quarter chicken dark meat that comes with 2 sides $9.95.  I picked vegetables & salad.  Vegetables were fine & stir-fried.  Salad was way boring, had to use my chicken sauces to give it some taste.  Chicken was juicey, nothing special though.

Total before tip $18.38.  Charged it.

Separate bathrooms in the back.
author: Ann L.

description: During our week in San Francisco, this was my favorite restaurant. We had the whole Pollo a la Brasa, mac & cheese, tacu tacu, and Camote Frito. Nothing disappointing at all. We serious contemplated eating there more than once during our trip.
author: Alonzo T.

description:
A less elaborate, et still amazing in flavor of the more known Peruvian fare.
Delicious and not expensive ...
author: Augusto R.

description:
Wanted to try something new so I came upon this place with my friends. I ordered the Lomo Saltado which is french fries with steak and onion. Pretty good but it was $14 for some french fries.. I don't know how I feel about the price. It was delicious though. The mac n cheese were also on point and a must try. That's another $8 or so.
My friends and I shared the mango mousse and it was the most delicious mango mousse I've ever tried. That costs $8.
Overall, tasty food but definitely on the pricier side.
author: Julian Y.

description: Great place for groups, down one star for hostess doesn't do the best with sitting people even when they have reservations.
author: Sergio S.

description:
Maybe I messed up by not getting the chicken, but we ordered a variety of dishes and not only was I not impressed by any of them, I was still hungry after. 

We got:

- Lomo Saltado - I personally find the soy sauce flavor to be incredibly salty and overwhelming, but maybe that's how the dish is supposed to be?
- Seco de Costillas - The best thing we got. Tender short ribs in a tasty sauce. You only get 2 small pieces of short rib though.
- Pollo Empanadas - These were pretty good, but not super memorable
- Pulpo a la Parilla - The biggest rip off ever - $16 for 4 tiny slivers of octopus with a spoonful of mashed potatoes. Don't get this.
author: Amy Y.

description:
Limon Rotisserie is incredibly popular and LOUD.  There are three locations in San Francisco.  I believe this one, in the Mission, is the original.  This is a modern Peruvian restaurant.

After over 1,200 Yelp reviews, I've never used the term "trendy hot spot" to describe any business... until now.  I think Limon fits the bill, even though it's not a new restaurant.  Many of the customers look like they're ready for a big night on the town.

This is a casual sit-down restaurant with a bar, open kitchen, and contemporary design.  The furniture, art, and decor is bright, colorful, and Peruvian-themed.  There are two floors.  I recommend sitting on the second floor because it can provide a nice view of all the activity below (bar, kitchen, etc.).

If you couldn't guess from the name, Limon specializes in rotisserie chicken ("pollo a la brasa").  Expect to spend about $20 for a whole chicken, $12 for a half, and $10 for a quarter (white or dark meat).  The rest of Limon's menu consists of small, shareable plates, like tapas.  These plates typically range from $7 to $10 each.  It's affordable, which is one reason why so many people like coming here.

I've tried the following items, all of which are generally pretty good:

Tartara de Tuna - ahi tuna tartare, roasted peppers, pinenuts, rocoto, sesame seed oil
Ceviche de Pescado - fresh red snapper
Jalea - mixture of crispy seafood, yucca, salsa criolla, huacatay tartar sauce
Chicharron de Pollo - crispy pieces of chicken marinated in soy sauce, garlic and aji amarillo, served with salsa criolla
"Lomito" Saltado - Peruvian dish of stir-fried top sirloin strips, onions, tomato, soy sauce, fries

The tuna tartare is soft and succulent.  This dish is prepared with rocoto, which is a type of pepper from Central and South America.  The tartare patty is garnished on top and lays atop a few slices of cucumber.  A side of potato chips is served with this dish to provide a starch and crispy texture.

Many consider the ceviche a must-order.  It is very good and prepared Peruvian style.  This means the seafood is accompanied with sliced onions, corn, and sweet potato.  I had the red snapper version and the fish was fresh.  Well-marinated, tangy, and refreshing.

Jalea is a Peruvian dish made of fried seafood.  In this case, fish and squid (similar to fried calamari).  It's lightly breaded.  It comes with salsa criolla, which is South American salsa composed of sliced onions, cilantro, and peppers, yucca root, and huacatay tartar sauce.  Huacatay is a type of herb which is turned into a paste and used in Peruvian cuisine.  Bits of crispy, roasted corn also accompany this dish.

The chicken chicharron is delicious and highly recommended.  These are like chicken nuggets or chicken tenders, but way better.  The breading isn't as heavy and is a darker golden brown in color.  Each piece of chicken is flavorful and tender.  A light, tasty dipping sauce comes with.

The "lomito" saltado dish is a cross between the lomito sandwich and the lomo saltado Peruvian sirloin dish.  This dish is a mish-mash of marinated sirloin strips, French fries, and sliced onions.  It's one of the heartier dishes on the menu with good chew and flavor.  The fries are soft/soggy because they've soaked up many of the plate's juices and sauce.

The presentation of the dishes is simple, stylish, and visually appealing.  A common theme among several of the dishes is the use of the aforementioned South American salsa criolla.  In fact, I think they may overuse it.

Service is fine.  Reservations are highly recommended.  Because of the popularity of this restaurant, you may not get seated immediately at your reservation time, but you do have priority over walk-ins, of which there are many.

Street parking can be a nightmare in this part of town, so consider parking at the garage at 42 Hoff Street, between 16th and 17th Streets.
author: Daniel B.

description: Came here for a double date dinner. First off the drinks are amazing!!! The empanadas are outstanding!!! Dinner was perfect. I had the pollo and papa, my partner had the chicharon de pollo with rice and the other couple had pollo a la brasa. The food was so juicy and tasted so good. We can't want to come back. We were able to have a conversation even tho it was loud and packed in there. I look forward to visiting soon!!!
author: America R.

description:
Now I can definitively say what is the worst restaurant I have eaten at. The experience was horrible and I do not know where to start. The menu said corkage fee was $15 but the waiter and others insisted it was $25. I ordered the paella with two sides. The sides came with desert. The bus boy spilled water on my friends wife- a lot of it to the point that she had to go to the car and change. My wife had the steak and she commented that it was the worst steak. The kids hated their food too. I am delighted that they will open a store in Burlingame since it will go bankrupt very soon.
Food: 1
Atmosphere:1
Parking:1
Service:1
Value:1
Overall:1
author: Rocker 1.

description:
When my first lunch option was over 90 min, we walked over here instead. Yelper Kristin F. had advised me that the mango lemonade here was stellar so I had to go check it out. the place was actually half empty when we came in but filled up quickly thereafter even though we came in later. Got:

-Quarter roast chicken
-Ceviche Mixto
-Antiuchi de Lengua
-Seco de Costillas
-Carne La Parilla

Everything was pretty tasty. The line is pretty quick and the food came out fast. I think we were there no longer than an hour. Outside of the Limon's here I'd been to the one in Fresno (the owner has family there) but this is the first one I've hit in SF. I guess Ill have to hit the other two in town and compare to see how they hold up. Oh and the Mango Lemonade is good (Hi Kristin!)
author: Kim N.

description: I came here on a Sunday afternoon for brunch/lunch. I heard the rotisserie chicken was the best so I ordered a quarter chicken with two sides. The food was underwhelming. I thought the chicken was too salty and Lacked real flavor. Keep in mind the quarter chicken was too small for a very hungry person. The roasted veggies were cooked well with good flavor but It was inconsistent because my friends veggies were soggy and over cooked. I also had the mango lemonade which I would not recommend. It was just meh. We ordered two desserts, the bread pudding and chocolate cake with coffee ice cream. The breeding pudding was decent, nothing special. I did not like the chocolate cake, it was hard, stiff, and dry. I just ate the coffee ice cream. I felt disappointed since it was like I paid $10 for a scoop of coffee gelato. Maybe I should have tried the tres leeches. The service was fair/good. Our food came out in a timely manner.
author: Djerica L.

description:
Possibly one of the best date night meals I've had since moving here. They get super busy,  so the service can get a little overwhelmed. But the wonderful food more than makes up for it. 
-the best octopus I've EVER had
-good wine selection without breaking the bank
-perfect chicken
-the loveliest hostess who was so accommodating on such a busy night.
author: Keeks M.

description:
Great Service!!
Over priced for the size of the food portions, and meat quality, red meat not beat quality.
Ceviche, not what expected for Peruvian Ceviche! Won't return there.
author: Leticia Z.

description: Friendly and attentive service. Strong margaritas, though a little sweet for my taste. The ceviche trio we ordered was delicious, and the pulpo was decent but a little tougher than I'd like. The seafood plate was disappointing. Rice was way too salty, and the clams that were included were all inedible, including one that had sand and grit in it and totally ruined my husband's dinner. We were worried about him getting sick for the rest of the night. We mentioned this issue to our waitress, hoping she would take it off the bill or at least comp us something off the bill, but she did not.
author: S M.

description:
Limon is one of my favorite restaurants to go to whenever I want to catch up with friends and chit- chat. I guess you can say it's the hot spot! I've had two meets-ups here and am looking forward to planning another dinner meetup with my co-workers in the next few weeks. 

Why do you ask? Please let me indulge you. There are three locations in the city and each one has it's own vibe. The ambiance on Valenica Street in particular is bustling with live conversation, the drinks are great, and the food is amazing. I guess you can get that anywhere, but for Peruvian food and the price- this just does it for me! 

The first time I came here with friends, we had the Sangria pitcher and it was so good. I mean it was so awesome. I had to watch myself though because I was beginning to feel like I was slurring my words, but never drunk lol. I've gotten the Polli=Papas and have yet to be disappointed. I enjoy it so much. The mustard sauce and Parmesan cheese on top is pure fire!!-- I mean that in a good way!
author: Tammia H.

description: This place is on point. Drinks are delicious and we've never ordered anything that was less than amazing. Service was fast and friendly.
author: Karen L.

description:
Are you kidding me?!  The food here is AWFUL!!!

I will semi-apologize ahead of time for not ordering the rotisserie chicken which everyone raves about.  But if that's the only thing a Peruvian restaurant can get right, they should just rename the restaurant to "Only Rotisserie."

I started out with the carne empanadas which are two pieces of about 3" long and cost $7.95.  Pretty hefty for the dinky little things.  I'll admit the accompanying garlic aioli is good and you can save it for your other dishes if they don't snatch it off your table.  These were quite tasty but all I tasted was meat and no hard boiled eggs or raisins.

Next was the Chicharron de Pollo ($11.95) which was overcooked and incredibly salty.  It comes with a tart dipping sauce which might be vinegar based which enhances the saltiness even more.  This was really bad.

After this, we got a very standard Peruvian dish: Lomito Saltado ($11.95).  We asked if the french fries could be replaced with yuca fries but the server told us this wasn't possible because the yuca fries would disintegrate.  I've had yuca fries before and they aren't this weak... so I think he just didn't want to make the change for us.  We asked for the sirloin pieces to be cooked medium and it was cooked medium well and came out chewy.  This dish was also a bit on the salty side.

Because of all the salt, I was in desperate need of a salad so I ordered the Ensalada Mixta as an afterthought.  There were only two to choose from but this one sounded lighter. The description says you get roasted red beets which, on paper, is the highlight of this salad but you literally get TWO thin slices.  I thought that was a joke.  Other than that, this is your regular side salad with cucumbers, tomatoes, and two slices of avocado.  And yes, it's $7.95!

Our waiter did his job well but he was very matter of fact and not a personality I'm dying to experience again.  Ambiance is nice with high ceilings and there's a long table in the middle that would be great for a birthday dinner but do you want your guests to celebrate your birthday with bad food?  If there is any possibility of me coming back again, I'll promise to order the chicken and ceviche.
author: Shannon L.

description: Feel like this place has gone down hill . Got the chicharrón de pollo and the chicken was dry and hard as a rock . Chicharrón is supposed to be crispy but this just tasted like it was cooked a while ago then refríes to heat up till it was one dry. Pollo a la brassa was tiny looked like 1/4 chicken when 1/2 chicken was ordered way smaller than other Peruvian rotisseries ive been to. Service was extremely slow but had a full staff and it was not a busy time.
author: C R.

description:
Quite yum but I would have to agree that the chicken is probably overpriced (compared to a whole roast chicken from the grocery store for $9) however it comes with 2 sides and 3 sauces.
Loved the Lomito saltado -- the flavors were yummy and reminded me of one of my favorite noodle/beef dishes from Aux Delices.
Overall a good and relatively inexpensive (and fast!) meal. Would recommend!
author: Siv L.

description: Came from Puerto Rico and the food was one of the best in Cali. The tacutacu was great, highly recommended. Great service.
author: Angel I.

description: Went here with a group of 15. That octopus- OMG- delicious - and I'm not even a huge fan of octopus. Venue is extremely loud, though, so was hard to talk amongst ourselves. Apparently they have 3 locations.
author: Rob M.

description:
This is my boyfriend's favorite restaurant so we have been there few times.

The restaurant on Valencia St is always crowded so make a reservation if you can. It's also pretty loud.

What we like:
- Sangria red
- Chicken (really tasty)
- Sweet potato fries
- Lomito saltado (the meat is incredible)
- Carne empanadas

The so-so:
- Polli-papas: I am not crazy about this dish, too greasy
- Queso empanadas

Leave room for dessert! Their chocolate bandido and panna cotta de mango are perfect to share!
author: Coralie S.

description:
I made reservations for last Friday for 10 people for what should have been a pleasant celebration of a 10 year wedding anniversary of friends of us. I was told to get my  people there all together on time. So I pestered my friends to be ahead of 8pm with me. We arrived at 8:03, and the table was nowhere ready. Even more, there were other big groups waiting to be seated. It was a mess, very unprofessional. So we walked out. We were extremely disappointed and this experience put a real downer on our night that should have been a great experience.

I got an email from their customer representative that didn't give me the feeling she understood what had happened or would change her process to prevent this from happening again. Looking at the other reviews, it is common at Limon to keep you waiting while you have made reservations
author: Dirk d.

description:
The first time I visited Limon was in 2003 at their old location at Mission/19th. It was a smaller, basic space with more families and less diners from outside the neighborhood. The current spot is a little more expensive,  and a lot fancier. The food is still just as good though.  
The ceviche and Lomo Saltado are the stars on the menu, and always have been. I have not had the chicken because that seems like the most boring thing you could order at any restaurant, and I can make chicken myself.  Have a Pisco Sour to complete the meal. 
Only complaints (minor ones) would be the timing. Some entrees come out quicker than the rest and at this point you have an awkward decision: Eat in front of the rest of your party, wait for theirs to arrive, or share. The restaurant is also very loud making conversations as difficult as in a club. This is probably due to the design of the place, and there is not much that can be done about it now. In any case this is a very common issue with restaurants in the City. The only important thing for me to judge a restaurant by is the food and I have not had a bad meal here yet. 
This stretch of Valencia is a lot different than when Limon first arrived in 2004, but still a favorite choice for when I want to sit-down  dining experience in the Mission as opposed to the many casual takeout places in this neighborhood.
author: Kevin S.

description:
Came in for dinner on a Friday night. Portion sizes can be a little small so it's best to order a couple of dishes to share. My group got a full chicken (dry and salty), which came with two sides. We choose Yuca fries (pretty good) and the Tacu-Tacu (sautéed rice and beans), which was beyond salty. t also came with a couple of sauces for dipping - the chimichurri stood out to me as the best sauce. We also ordered the Tartara de Tuna (fresh, light, and delicious), "Lomito" Saltado (probably the best dish that we ordered - it was like a poutine with steak). Overall, the food just didn't live up to all of the hype. 

Also, parking is very difficult to come by in the neighborhood - you're better off just parking at the 21st Street garage or uber or lyfting to the restaurant.
author: Jojo P.

description:
After circling the premises to find parking for a good 15 minutes, we finally found a spot not too far from the restaurant and headed to Limón Rotisserie. 

My first impression of the restaurant was that it had to be good because the restaurant was overflowing with people. Some were waiting at the door for an open table, but because my friend had made a reservation, we were quickly seated and catered to. The staff members are all incredibly friendly and helpful; I have never been that happy with customer service in a while.  

We ordered some appetizers and a half chicken, which I was expecting to taste like Safeway's rotisserie chicken because honestly, I have low standards for food so I won't be disappointed. The chicken was amazing. Limón Rotisserie took it to a whole different level, especially with the three special sauces that came along with the dish. I was very content and will definitely be referring others to come here. 

The only issue I had was the noise level, but it's something you can't control. It wasn't ideal for a first date, especially since I felt like I was screaming over the voices of others to be heard by my friend. Poor guy hahah. However, with an ambiance as great as Limón Rotisserie's, I'm not surprised people come here to socialize. You can't predict when large tables of drunk people will be standing up in the middle of the restaurant to take selfies, but the restaurant staff handled them pretty well and controlled the situation as gracefully as possible.
author: Emily F.

description:
Now that is a place that has delivered consistently good food (in all of their locations)!

The waiter accommodated our requests in no time, and they were overall just really friendly. We have been and will be coming back! 

-----following are not negatives(obviously), just give you a better idea of what to plan for when you go for the first time. Kinda the things I personally look fro in reviews!------

Parking situation - San Francisco :) nuff said.
No outdoor. No pooches.
author: Matea F.

description: Love this place, totally worth the drive. Parking is horrible but then what isn't in SF. Little pricy, loud with tons of young energy. Small set up but good food, service, drinks and good energy. Empanadas are my favorite
author: Mia V.

description:
Made reservations here to meet up with an old worker for lunch.  Weird thing is this restaurant opens at 12 on weekdays!  More start-ups are opening in Mission so I find it a little odd that they don't open at least at 11:30.  Anywhoo, my co-worker and I were waiting for him at our table since he was running late.  One of the waiters approached us after another waiter did and said something like, "The restaurant gets really busy, are you sure that you don't want to put any order in now?"  There were only about two other occupied tables, that was a little odd.

I decided on getting the 1/4 dark meat with my two accompanying sides being the sauteed veggies and the papas fritas.  My dining companions got the 1/4 white meat with yucca fries and rice.  They accidentally brought me white meat, but because I feared that it would be a little dry, I told them of this and they switched it out  accordingly.  My chicken was moist and the side portions were plentiful at least mine was.  The guys' yucca fries looked a little stingy.  We all liked the dipping sauces as well.  My coworker told me that his white meat wasn't that dry, so I'm assuming it could have been juicer though.  Not a bad option for lunch in the Mission for around $10ish.  But with so many options in the Mission, I wouldn't make a special trip out for it and not sure if I'd come back.
author: Cat C.

description: Everything is delicious and the atmosphere is perfect for a lively dinner with friends.  I've tried the ceviche, chicken, empanadas, and paella and all have been delicious.  The ceviche de camarones is by far my favorite. The sangria is light and fruity.  It can be loud and you may be in close quarters to other diners, but it adds to the wholesome vibe (if you are prepared for it). I've been to both this location and the Van Ness location and they were both comparable food quality-wise.
author: Katie J.

description:
My friend swears they use a heavy hand of Maggi seasoning here but with all the good experiences I've had here, Limon has seldom done me wrong and thus is one of my favorite eateries in the city. 

It can get packed so I recommend reservations and on that note, I would request sitting on the first floor because the second/loft area has pretty low ceilings which means sound reverberates quite a bit which makes it hard for conversation on busy nights. Weekday lunch is completely different story though - relaxed and chill. 

I've tried quite a bit on the menu so let's just highlight the stars:
1. Chicharron de Pollo. You MUST order this small plate. Crispy fried chicken served with a dipping sauce made of a super concentrated reduction of chicken jous and limes. So delicious and satisfying. 

2. Ceviche Mixto. I like the ceviche here because it has a nice balance of acidity while keeping the seafood fresh with the right texture. It's always a light and refreshing way to start a meal here. 

3. Mac and Cheese. I know it's weird to highlight a side dish but it does hold it's own. Pasta is nice and al dente while it's luxuriously coated in a truffled cheese sauce. 
 
4. Snapper - think this is no longer on the menu but there was this really delicious pan fried snapper dish served during lunch accompanied by some sautéed greens and sauce. 

Other than the ones mentioned above, I've had the lengua, beef heart, short ribs, and Ensalada Rusa here. All decent in their own right but the stars for me are the small plates listed above. Those are reasons in their own right to return to Limon.
author: Jon L.

description:
Came on a Friday after my graduation . Place was packed but we were still seated and served in  such an amazing and fast way that I couldn't believe it. 

Please DO try the chicken empanadas! Absolutely worth it! The dipping sauce that come with it was very delicious as well. Served pipping hot just like empanadas should be
author: cristina s.

description:
Disclaimer: This one star is for the service at the end of our meal. 
3 stars for food. 

After spending a couple hundred dollars on our meal, with drinks in hand, sitting at our table talking, the waiter asks us to take our drinks to the bar because they need to keep the table open for customers. We understood, so we took our drinks and walked over to the bar. We take a look around and there are SEVEN tables open for seating!! A table for a large party upstairs (i think it could've sat 8 people), 2 tables for 2 upstairs, two tables for 2 downstairs, and two tables for 4 people. We finished our drinks and went to another place for more. It's really unfortunate because the food is not bad and the service in the beginning of the night was not bad either. It just leaves a bad taste in the mouth when a good night ends bad.
author: Tea Lyves ..

description:
Ok let's start off by saying this is not the place to eat at if you are looking for service. Prepare for your table to be ready at least 20 mins late and your order about another hour. I've experienced this at both Limon locations numerous times. (More than 10x) haha
The bussers, waiters and especially the hostesses are really not that attuned to your needs. You'll most likely have to flag them down if you are looking for extra things to order.. Food , drinks , heck even water refills or silverware for your food. 


The only thing saving this place is the quality of food which is 5 star. I love the chicken, yuca fries and ceviches. 

If you want to skip all the nonsense of sitting and dealing with said staff , sit at the bar. Bartenders at both locations hustle their butts off and make things happen. 

Limon owners, if you are reading this, step your service game up!!!!  It lacks big time !!
author: Alvaro C.

description: Authentic to the core!!! Great place if you're looking to try Peruvian food for the first time. Took my girlfriend out for a dinner date. I wanted to try something new and was recommended here by a friend but we both had never tried Peruvian food prior. Didn't know the place would be so busy, unfortunately we couldn't get a table so they sat us at the bar instead very quickly. Bartender was very fast and friendly!!! We were both amazed by the plates we order, very rich with tremendous flavors. Definitely will be returning here in the near future to try a different dish!
author: Davonte J.

description: We celebrated the anniversary of the proposal.  The whole cast played their role in making tonight the best night ever.
author: Bryan I.

description:
came for a birthday dinner so we did the prix fix

-tuna tartare

-mixed ceviche: sweet potato was a good addition

-mixed green salad

-peruvian salad

-lomo saltado

-chicarron de pollo: gotta love some crispy chicken

-empanadas

-roast chicken: the chicken really is good as they say

-chocolate bandido: i love it when you break it open and the sauce just oozes out.. take a spoon of that with some ice cream followed

-tres leches: so moist and wet 

-bread pudding: another good dessert.. can you tell i love sweets?

-mango panna cotta: i like mango and i like panna cotta.. both of them together, it's just yum
author: Raquel T.

description:
Friendly and professional staff. 
The half chicken was as good as you can find it in Lima. 
Eating in front of roasting chicken is more interesting than the sport on the screens ;-)
author: Vincent D.

description: At this location I've never had a problem I've been there several times to celebrate. It is chic, great sangrias's, and the food is to die for. You should have a reservation before you go. The staff is great at this location. The chicken that sauce so good. Also their chicken chicharon, Ceviche, l go on and on.
author: Carolyne R.

description:
The first time that I came here a few years ago I really enjoyed the food and the service. This time I only enjoyed the food, but not enough to come back again. 

It started with the bartender, who gave my friend attitude when she asked for a higher quality of gin in her cocktail. She was willing to pay for it and explained that well gin gives her headaches, but higher quality gins don't. He interrupted her and said "no, it's the sugar" and she politely said, no, that's not it, I'd prefer a better quality gin, thank you. He scoffed and walked away, then came back with a awful drink that none of us liked. We gave up. 

We were seated and sat for a while until the waitress came by and asked what she could get us. 

We had to ask for menus. 

I asked for a glass of white wine, a Godello from the part of Spain where my family lives. The waitress actually tried to correct my pronunciation of the wine (which she got wrong, but who cares? I was just trying to order wine!  En serio, no jodas, nena) She then came back and said that they were out of the Godello and asked what else I might like. I said "Galician whites" and she paused like she had no idea what I was talking about, then when I mentioned the Albariño, she tried to describe it to me like she had no idea what I had just asked for.  

The food was amazing. If you don't mind the service, get the ceviches, the chicken, and the yucca fries. I asked for chimichurri sauce with the chicken, but she forgot to bring that out. 

The waitress then brought the check without asking if we wanted dessert. We were celebrating a dear friends' birthday and wanted her to have something sweet. We tried waiting for the waitress, but she was nowhere to be found. So one of us got up and asked someone for a dessert menu. 

The tres leches cake was amazing.  But not enough to go back. I hope things get better for this place.
author: Michelle P.

description: This was my first real experience with Peruvian food and I was not at all dissatisfied. During my visit I tried the grilled beef tongue, the rotisserie chicken with tacu tacu, and the lomo saltado. All of these dishes were so good they had me thinking of them days after my meal! I recommend making reservations and asking to be seated downstairs where it is less busy and crowded.  Ps if you like cocktails get the Pisco Sour. You're welcome.
author: Betty V.

description:
3.5 stars
Service good
Food pretty good
Value/portions okay
Ambiance good

Went for an early dinner on Monday and the place was empty around 5:30 but was full when we left around 7. Service was courteous enough. I wished they gave a little more food for the price...a little on the pricey side. The food taste was above average but nothing memorable. The experience wasn't bad though and I'd probably eat here again if the occasion called.
author: Jackie T.

description:
OMG I love this place. 

One of my girlfriends and I were running errands in the area and since we are in varying degrees of wanting to eat healthily, we decided to pass on our usual taquerias and bars and head to Limón Rotisserie as per her suggestion.

At first when I looked at the menu I thought the prices were a bit high - but honestly, the portions and what we ordered were the perfect amount of food for the two of us. In our recent past life we've been known to put away embarrassing amounts of carby cheesy things and more glasses of wine than I care to admit, so I was really proud of us for not going overboard today. 

We had:

Ceviche de Pescado / Camaron ($13.95) - I could eat this all day. I wish the portion was a little bigger though, especially for the price. 

Half Chicken ($14.95) - A mix of white and dark meat. Seriously, this was some of the best chicken I've ever had - I don't usually fuck with white meat (giggity) but since my friend prefers thigh and wings, I had the chicken breast with skin on and it was tender, juicy and flavorful. Comes with two sides - we chose salad (skip next time) and sautéed vegetables (definitely get this). 

Lomito Saltado ($13.95) - I don't know how they can describe this as a "small hot plate" because the portions were super generous. The sirloin was perfectly cooked and I couldn't get enough of the accompanying vegetables. 

In the interest of being a supportive friend we skipped on dessert but for the next time I have my eye on the Panna Cotta de Mango (panna cotta topped with mango jelly and served with fresh fruit). 

The portions look small but don't be deceived; we were definitely satisfied. Love!
author: Aivy C.

description: Loved this cute ass restaurant! The lengua, shrimp ceviche, lomo saltado, and rotisserie chicken were sooo yummy. Vibe is very nice in there! Great service and atmosphere. I'll definitely be back to try more!
author: Daisy S.

description: We ordered NY steak, lomo salteado and the Paella. Everything was really good. Flavor and seasoning don't lack in here. The Chalaca Mulle was amazing. Drinks are very good. To new comers I would say call in advance for a reservation.
author: Ibelig V.

description: Have visited this location on multiple occasions in the past. Secluded and hidden on The main street makes it an interesting find. I am half peruvian so finding authentic comida peruana is an adventure to say the least. I brought my mother, grandmother, sister & aunts here for mothers day praying it was what I read it would be! Well success!!! Tapas style lunch with pollo a la brasa, paella, tacu tacu, empanadas, pisco sour & cafesito...mind blowing and delicious! Our waiter spoke spanish and understood the menu very well and made recommendations, we got to converse with the chef and we sat in the front table which had a panorama window that opened up to the hustle and bustle of mid day Valencia St. I love that Limon brought me back to my childhood of eating Peruvian food & mothers day was success.
author: Joshua L.

description: Love love love this place!!!!! Sooooo good! Try the dipping sauces with the sweet potatoes fries! Chicken is everything!
author: Jasmine K.

description: After a long, six-hour drive from LA I needed a bite, so my friend recommended Limon. The place looked daunting at first because it was packed to the hilt, only standing room at the bar. Very friendly hostess was able to take us down and seat us within 10 minutes. We tried a couple of ceviches, a rotisserie chicken, and their Peruvian meat empanadas. The service was probably the most stellar part of the experience though the food was great as well as the drinks. The fare was a bit pricey but that's to be expected in the area. Think I've definitely come back for that rotisserie chicken.
author: Matthew R.

description: Excellent sangria! Snapper ceviche was great. And I don't even like chicken and never order it at restaurants but the rotisserie was amazing. I would not recommend the fried chicken dish however. It was super deep fried and had really strong flavors. Couldn't eat more than a few bites. But I still have to give this place 4 stars for service, ambience, great drinks, great pours, great ceviche and great rotisserie chicken!
author: Melissa W.

description: Food here is delicious. Went here on a Saturday night and it was super crowded. Recommend making reservations if you can.
author: Tina R.

description:
If you're looking for a good, yet quick, sit down affair this is the place for you. I came in with a friend on a Thursday night for dinner and were sat immediately. The ambiance is very open, family style, comfortable and cute. 

We ordered two red sangrias right away which were fabulous. Then we ordered our food and were super surprised when it came out 5-10 minutes later. Since they have a family style menu and specialize in roasted chicken, it is probably super easy for their kitchen to just constantly be preparing large portions of the majority of the menu. 

The truffle mac n cheese is TO DIE FOR. Seriously, yum. I will never go here and not order that. The roasted chicken was good, but for it being the specialty I didn't think it was that amazing. We ordered the half chicken which was more than enough for two people. It includes two sides as well! We got a side of salad, which is really only enough for one, and sweet potato fries. The fries were hot, crispy and fresh. We finished up quickly and paid which probably allowed our table to turn in 30 minutes. Service was great as well. I'd love to come back with a large group and try more menu items!
author: Mandy A.

description:
Limon is actually one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco. I eat here all the time and always bring groups here, and everyone always loves the food. It is delicious. 

They have fantastic cocktails. When getting Peruvian, a Pisco Sour is a must. Theirs is delicious

The Chicken is amazing. I love all the sauces they provide. They are so good. 

I've had multiple ceviches and have liked them all, but always get the Tuna Tartare over the ceviche. The Tuna Tartare is fantastic here. 

I've had the pollo, carne, and queso empanadas. Their pollo empanadas are literally the best empanadas I have ever had. I love the.

The octopus is also great. It is very thinly sliced and extremely citrusy, which I love.

Overall Limon is fantastic and a really fun spot for a group of friends.
author: Gabrielle C.

description: All I can say is Wow!!! All the food on the menu is amazing full of flavor and there cocktail menu is also great. Me and my family ate here last night and was highly recommend by my sister and her boyfriend who are from LA. Will be back again
author: Frank C.

description:
I was a bit surprised when I returned to Limón lo these many years later to find that it's become a doppelganger of the more recent Limón Rotisserie on Van Ness. Yes, in a shrewd business decision that recognizes our country's overall economic malaise, the owners have decided to abandon the restaurant's original upscale Peruvian culinary concept in favor of repeating their likely more profitable rotisserie chicken concept. And why not? They still serve ceviche and some small hot tapas, but the centerpiece is the chicken and a fine roast chicken it is. It's the Pollo a la Brasa, and for $10.95, Jamie W. and I were able to get a half-roaster cut in four pieces (see photo).

Deliciously succulent as only a slow, long rotation on a spit can produce over a open flame. For our two automatic sides, we first went for the basic Ensalada, which was a nice size with shredded carrots and slices of radish and cucumber canvasing the deep greens underneath and doused with a light vinaigrette (see photo). The second was the Vegetales Salteados, marinated vegetables dominated by green and yellow wax beans with a lot of snap still (see photo). As an additional side, I wanted to try the Ensalada Rusa, a house specialty that looks and tastes like a picnic potato salad but with a little more versatility with beets, turnips, choclo (hominy), peas and green beans all slathered with a creamy mustard dressing (see photo).
