And somehow a chicken dinner doesn't feel complete until you add Papas Fritas, or as we call it in the corn belt, French fries, complete with a trio of aji sauces that suited both the fries and the chicken (see photo). Quite a feast all things considered. The place was bustling as it always has been every time I walked by on that busy block of Valencia. We both felt the service was on the clipped side, but we weren't bothered that much by it since the chicken was providing enough warmth for the both of us. In fact, we plan to come back for our poultry fix since the only other slow-roasted chicken that made us swoon recently was served at Il Pollaio up in North Beach.

FOOD - 4 stars...first-rate, slow-roasted chicken is the main event now, and that's OK by me
AMBIANCE -3.5 stars...pretty crowded most of the time but nor unbearable
SERVICE - 3 stars...efficient but a bit too curt even for insensitive types like myself
TOTAL - 4 stars...cluck-cluck
author: Ed U.

description: Celebrated bday lunch with my girls & we had the Mediterranean grilled octopus, roasted chix, lomo saltado, braised short ribs & yucca fries. Everything was delicious here.  I will come back again!
author: Cris M.

description:
the chicken we ordered was Ok,but the sides we ordered one of them was wrong and it came by the time we finished our food.We had to remind the waiter 2 times
The Paella was Great would come back for again
author: Robert C.

description:
It's been a year, but I just "HAVE TO" write this out. Their waiters would CHANGE YOUR TOTAL AMOUNT ON YOUR CHECK. PLEASE KEEP YOUR RECEIPT AND DOUBLE CHECK YOUR BANK ACCOUNT!! I WARNED YOU.

I know we should've denied the charge on the back account but this has been so long ago and it was only a difference of cents. But just imagine their people stealing cents from 100+ customers a day! 

We did call for their manager or Laurina M from below response, were told that she was not in the office and left a message for a call back. 

OF COURSE, no one did call back. 
Not surprising.
author: Leilani B.

description: Food was decent. Location is small and compact, however it's San Francisco. If you like to indulge in alcoholic beverages La Bomba Amor was amazing. Also the rice and beans are very flavorful.
author: Lawren F.

description:
It's a little too noisy for me with loud Latin music and TV screens with sports but aside from that unnecessary stimuli, I really enjoyed the food.

We shared mushroom empanadas, salad, and yucca fries. I am hooked on yucca fries now. The Peruvian beer was a lovely way to wash it all down. 

Next visit I'll try one of their interesting cocktails or pisco drinks.
author: Leslie K.

description: I found this place on yelp. Food is great! We order the juicy tender half chicken dinner with fresh fries, awesome seasoned veggies and truffle Mac and cheese. Parking is hard to get, but it's SF soooo g00d luck. Will return to the restaurant.
author: Tye H.

description:
It was the end of a solid week of getting stuff done and my pals and I wanted to decompress with some great SF fare.  My buddy suggested that we try a place called Limon in the Mission and said they served up an awesome roasted chicken.  I love the stuff so we grouped up and BARTed down to 16th in hopes of securing a seat.  On arrival, all the tables had been reserved for the night, but we were allowed to sit down on condition that we ate quickly.  I'm personally not a fan of a rushed meal, but we agreed to the deal so that we can sample the food.

We ordered two half chickens with sweet potato fries, mac and cheese, salad, and salted vegetables, beef empanadas, and fried yucca to share.  I must admit that the chicken was very tender and fell right off the bone.  The mac and cheese was my personal favorite, but the salted vegetables were great too.  The meal was great overall and I would definitely come back.  The drinks sound delicious too!

Service was very attentive and friendly, and we got our food not 5 minutes after ordering.  I guess most of the food is pre-made or queued up in order to turn tables quickly.  The rushed nature of the meal was really my only negative comment and it would have been nice to hang out a bit longer.

Food: 8/10

Service: 8/10

Price: $$

Atmosphere: 8/10
author: Joe M.

description: We love this place. Great service and quality. We come here to celebrate specials occasions with loved ones. I highly recommend the chicken, paella, truffle mac and cheese, also the stewed short ribs.
author: Francisca C.

description:
I grabbed dinner here with a couple of friends on a Saturday night. We made reservations beforehand, but there were several empty tables when we arrived. I've been to the location on Van Ness several times now, so I knew what was good here. 

The best things to get here are the chicken, truffle mac and cheese, and sangria. The chicken is always so juicy and flavorful. The 3 sauces that it comes with only enhances the flavors even more. A whole chicken was a good size for my party of 4. The truffle mac and cheese is so heavenly. I always wish I don't have to share the side with anyone else whenever we order this. Also, don't forget to get a pitcher of their sangria to share. 

I would pass on of the Tartara de Tuna; it's not good. The chicken empanadas we got had really dry shredded chicken; definitely another pass. The food at this location is just as good as the on Van Ness. However, the wait staff is much left attentive and the restaurant itself feels cramped. Nevertheless, the food at Limon is delicious.
author: Melanie H.

description: I've been here a few times now and EVERY SINGLE TIME - the service is amazing! Seated right away around 10pm on a Saturday. Diego came to the table right away, took our order, was extremely helpful and personable. Their Lomo Saltado is delicious, full of flavor! Drinks are strong and tasty! Honestly not sure why this place has only 3.5 stars! I recommend it HIGHLY!
author: Lo T.

description: Delicious Chicken, Yucca Fries, Fish Ceviche, Flank Steak. This place is good. Not sure what else to say as I'm looking forward to eating here again.
author: Willow O.

description: Love love love! Excellent food, drinks, and staff. Good vibe and great location. We got the yuca fries and holy wow those were good.
author: Cassie B.

description: Don't get the paella.  Mushy rice, mix 2 shrimp, a few  pieces of fish,  2 mussels,  takes 10 minutes to arrive at the table with enough salt for the daily allowance. Service is sparse.  You can count 6 appearances.  1 to take your order, 2 to serve the food, 3 to take away empty plates, 4 to bring the check. 5 to take the credit card, 6 to bring back the card. Towards the end you see them more.  The meal took less than one hour.  No special treat for someone celebrating their birthday.  Yuca fries are my favorites.  Beef tongue was tender.  Every table had chicken, go figure.  This will be my last time here, not enjoyable, not memorable.
author: Helen L.

description: The food is awesome here, love how they serve you lunch box style . The chicken is so tender and I love the salad . Only thing is that we were rushed be the servers as if they were ready to go home
author: Zoe L.

description:
On a casual night on Valencia St, I stopped in here to check out the rave reviews of the Limon Rotisserie slow-cooked chicken. Situated down the street from the 16th and Mission BART station, Limon Rotisserie is a nice spot for a casual dinner on Valencia. Like most places on Valencia, there is usually a long wait for those who do not have a reservation so I highly recommend reserving a table on OpenTable. 

First impressions when walking in: Very lively atmosphere, but also super loud. It also seemed to be a popular family dinner spot since there were many families with little children seated around us. For the amount of people in the restaurant, it definitely seemed like there was not enough waiters since we waited nearly a half hour before someone came over to take our order. 

Of course because of the previous reviews, we had to try out the rotisserie chicken along with sangria and some appetizers. When we got our order, I was severely underwhelmed by the chicken. While it's certainly not supermarket rotisserie chicken, I wasn't particularly blown away like some of the other previous reviewers. The chicken was cooked well, but I just didn't find it to be particularly flavorful (tasted very much like lean chicken). 

Overall I really have to say I wasn't particularly impressed by my visit to Limon Rotisserie. The service was meh and the food was meh as well. If I had to provide some feedback to management, I would say that they should really consider scaling back the amount of seating in the restaurant. The seating was pretty cramped and it was fairly evident that the servers were having trouble keeping track of all of the customers in the restaurant.
author: Derek L.

description:
Honestly, the first thought that crosses my mind when I think about rotisserie chicken is dry meat, but Limon has definitely changed that impression. 

Babe and I ordered the whole chicken to share and the 2 sides that we picked were Papa Fritas (fries) and the Yuca Fries (yes, more fries, jumbo ones this time)

The chicken was very flavourful and juicy. The order filled up 2 people and we were even able to take a few pieces of chicken back home because we were pretty stuffed. Yuca fries were definitely a treat and really fun to snack on. 

I definitely wouldn't mind coming back for more rotisserie chicken :)
author: Harriet W.

description:
Limon de mi corazon 
It's a shame that people give it such amazing review it wasn't bad but if you've had real Peruvian food you'll know this food is subpar .

The people were so nice but really they could work on their spices it did not taste authentic
author: Laura G.

description:
I liked this place! The poor staff there were struggling to accommodate me and my flaky friends (well only 5 of us can come, so we'll make a reservation for 5. But wait, everyone brought a friend, so now we have 9, but actually, 3 of them are late, so only 4 of us are here right now-- I'm pretty much every restaurant owner's nightmare). The food was pretty average I thought though, maybe it was because of how much hype this place got beforehand, but I wasn't particularly impressed by the food here.

It was tasty, me and a friend split a half chicken with some greens and some rice on the side, and it was good! But it didn't really taste any different than what you could make at home really. I think maybe we ordered incorrectly to get the full Peruvian experience? But that was what they recommended on the menu, so, who knows. 

Drinks are good though, and this place definitely gets pretty packed (its not that big) at night, so make sure to make reservations or get there earlier :)
author: Lai-Nin W.

description:
Awesome ambience. 
Paella was delicious and so was the ceviche
But more importantly they had the most delicious empanadas I have ever had in my life!!!!!!!! The veggie one was UNREAL. We got the beef after but it wasn't as good as the veggie.

I will literally go back here forever just for the cheesy warm delicious empanadas.
author: Connie W.

description:
Had the slowly roasted chicken "Pollo a la Brasa!" It was very tasty and tender. The  calamari was good nothing special. You can't go wrong with the "Yuca fries" (fritta)! It's Yuca. We also ordered the "Lomito Saltado" it sirloin with onions, tomatoes it was ok. 

The drinks were awesome though...
Pisco Sour(s) you gotta try them all.

I would say that when "limon" says, that their plates are served family style they should really say, "Tapas". The portions are very small. When you tell me, "family style" I think huge Italian portions, lol. This place is ok, its more of "the hype" for sure.
author: Carla F.

description:
Amazing, amazing, amazing!

The food is perfect, there is nothing I would change. I got the paella and was very much satisfied! My friends each got the chicken and their meals were enough to feed a family. The service did not rush you despite the crowd that was forming.

When I'm back in SF I will be sure to visit here again.
author: Krisha C.

description:
I don't really enjoy eating chicken - but the chicken here was delicious and very memorable. Very tender, juicy, and FLAVORFUL.

Lomo Saltado was also really good, and it's enough to be a small-ish entree for one. 

Not a fan of their ceviche. It was really fishy.

The sangria was excellent.

The "small plates" come in various sizes so maybe clarify before ordering.

This location is great...spacious, brightly lit, with much shorter lines than the one in the Mission
author: Jessica C.

description: I would love to give this place a better rating. The food was good.  Too loud in the basement seating. The service was Eh. We were that "forgotten table." Empty water more than half time, missing/late food items and servers serving everyone around us. The night was topped-off when I went to use the restroom. One of the table bussers walked out and went right back to work without washing his hands. Y u c k.
author: Ernesto M.

description: Came here with a group of friends and split a whole chicken, truffle Mac and cheese, yuca fries, & veggies.  The atmosphere was dark and classy, definitely made us feel a lil bit fancy.  The rotisserie chicken was mm mm good especially with all the sauces. Yuca fries and truffle Mac and cheese were both very worth, both melted in our mouths.  Finally even the veggies were nicely seasoned.  Overall, I would definitely come again and especially when splitting with friends, it is not too expensive at all.  Maybe we should have ordered two chicken though haha :),
author: Nina W.

description: Amazing food!!! As a Peruvian girl who knows how to cook and eat good food I totally recommend this place! Sweet tasty and our favorite dishes are lomo saltado , seco and ceviche ! And the chicha morada ... my kids love it!!!
author: Blenda M.

description:
I may be biased as I have a soft spot for Latin American food. But Limon came very highly recommended and it did not disappoint!

We were a big group and thankfully this meant I had a chance to try our many of the menu items. My faves included:

- Carne empanadas - so good I had to get two orders! I think they are twice deep fried but so so so delicious and full of flavour 
- truffle Mac and cheese - ok so maybe not the most authentic Latin fare but it was so creamy, simple, and delicious 
- 

Top it off with a great cocktail menu (I love me some Pisco sour) and a really hip vibe, and another visit is definitely in my future soon. 

There were a few "big group" glitches -forgotten orders,  a couple mistakes on the bill, and 20% auto gratuity? So close to being a 5 star rating! But this is not a deterrent at all.
author: Cristina P.

description: I fricking hate yelpers!  But I get it!!  We get sat at 9pm drink order taken at 9:05?by 9:20 no drinks no server back for water, drinks or food order?  The manager and server and floor manager was fawning all over the big titted girls table next to us but not a f-in word or a look our way.  Walking out we tell the the hostess that we're leaving because of no service and the classic response "ok".  Received a going away gift certificate for $150 what a waste I would have been better off a Nazario's extra large pizza and two beers gc!
author: Ed G.

description: My friends and I went here for girls night and we had a blast. Everything we ordered here was great. No complaints on the food. Our waiter was very busy and you can tell on her face. And it was hard to flag her down. But the food and the drinks compensated for that. Will come again!
author: Kristine D.

description:
Location: This place is located in the mission in San Fransisco. It is not the safest or cleanest of surrounding areas so be careful. It is nestled in a cozy spot along Valencia St. near 16th. Luckily, we found a parking spot nearby, but there are street parking stalls nearby (obey the times!) and a pay lot as well if you decide to drive.

Food: We had the whole chicken (which they are famous for). It was absolutely delicious! I highly recommend it. It was fully of juicy flavors, and there is both dark and white meat. We also had some of the sides, their yuca fries were not the best but when you're hungry (which we were) anything tastes great. 

Service: The service was only okay. When we arrived we had a table for 5 people, and despite 3 of us being there they wouldn't seat us until all 5 of us arrived. Luckily there was some space at the bar so we ordered a drink while we waited. The bar has an assortment of wines and liquor. The waiter was really nice when he was around, but he didn't come around too often so we had to wave him down a couple of times which was a little annoying.

Expert Tip: Make reservations because its gets crowded! We went on a Wednesday for dinner and still and to make reservations, and they were at full capacity the whole time we were there.
author: Rayfe G.

description: 5th time here. Food  has always been pretty good. Love the sweet potato fries and chicken dishes. The problem today was with a waiter. No water refill and an extremely rude waiter when I asked him twice for water. Response from the waiter was " I heard you". Wow! I'm only asking for water.  There are only 4 tables of customers and three people at the bar. Not like they were extremely busy. How hard can it be to get a water refill.  No apology from the rude waiter,  but the manager on duty did apologize for the waiter. Will not be going back. Thinking management needs to retrain the staff. There are too many food choices out there to have this type of service.
author: L R.

description:
Long wait, but definitely worth it. The chicken is cooked to perfection. We also had the ceviche mixto with tiger prawns, fish and calamari great flavor! Our chicken empanadas were so good we decided to try the Oaxaca cheese empanadas. Couldn't decide on which was better so can't go wrong with either. The Tacu Tacu and Yuca fries were a great compliment to the chicken. 

The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Music was great. Place is a little loud bit I enjoy the atmosphere and liveliness. 

5 stars...
author: Jorge G.

description:
Absolutely adore this place!

Anytime I have friends visiting the city I love taking them here.  This food is amazing, the staff is extremely knowledgable on their menu, they have top notch customer service and you get a lot more than what you're paying for.
author: Azadeh Z.

description: We had a great dinner here. The pisco sours are wonderful. Had to ask for them because they were never brought out but it was worth the wait. Definitely share multiple plates because you'll want a bite of everything!
author: Rachel K.

description: 5 stars, hands down.  The ceviche is amazing... Get it with a side of taro chips.   Lomito soltado, and chichiron de pollo is a must.  The empanadas are Mac n cheese are off the hook too.  My only advice to management is to work on the service.
author: David S.

description: Small portion. Good food.  Good hang out place. Good sangria.  I recommend the chicken but not the seafood paella
author: Janita s.

description: The food was amazing! I just wish they gave you more than 3 sticks of yucca fries because they were so good!
author: Salma M.

description: I would give this place a 3.5. The food isn't anything special. The half chicken is good, tender and flavorful. We sat on the first floor/main level if you go try to get a seat downstairs the ambience is better.
author: Nazneen S.

description: Trendy-hip ambiance.  Did love the ceviche. (Late post: 06/07/15)
author: Mia Z.

description:
Limón recently changed their flagship space on Valencia into the 3rd Limón Rotisserie with lower prices and simplier menu featuring Pollo a la Brasa (Peruvian rotisserie chicken).

We started with Ceviche de Pescado y Camarones (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chWLsfWUJ5k8-73t9FOM9A?select=J_AzoDQ2l4XPcgtIATU1Fg) which had thin sliced snapper and shrimp cut lengthwise along with a slice of sweet potato and corn. Fresh and delicious with the characteristic heat of the leche de tigre marinade.

1/2 Pollo a la Brasa  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chWLsfWUJ5k8-73t9FOM9A?select=fWOW6is1E4YNtRhgK-U-ZA) very moist and flavorful throughout. Excellent on it's own or with any of the 3 sauces provided with the chicken (aji amarillo, huacatay, rocoto). I was hoping for crispy skin, but still one of my favorite dishes of the night.

All the Pollo a la Brasa options (whole, half, 1/4) come with two sides and we chose Tacu-Tacu & Yucca Fries. Tacu-tacu is a rice and bean mixture http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chWLsfWUJ5k8-73t9FOM9A?select=FiAyhjuvnPq9j-qxKpVsiw) topped with salsa criolla (pickled onions & peppers) which I really liked, but they were overshadowed by the yuca fries which had a crisp hard outer shell filled with creamy yuca flesh inside. 

The "Lomito" Saltado (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chWLsfWUJ5k8-73t9FOM9A?select=4ifpdTOw3qHG1kTip_hLSg) was very tender and medium-rare as requested. A bit salty and the way the meat and fries were mixed really soggified the fries.

Chicharron de Pollo (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chWLsfWUJ5k8-73t9FOM9A?select=IJrhz_H0mX36SWa32ArMPQ) was deliciously seasoned with aji amarillo and garlic. Crispy outer layer and mostly moist inside. Some thinner sections were overcooked and dry.

Truffle Mac & Cheese was good, though I do prefer a thicker cheese sauce and some browning on top. They didn't overdo it with the truffle oil.

They were pretty slammed at 8pm on a Saturday and the service was efficient, if not particularly friendly.
author: Andrew C.

description:
Okay look, if you ever come to SF and want amazing chicken here you go. The service is great. Our hostess, Lori Ann is so amazing by giving us a table so quickly on a Friday at 8pm! Also what topped it off was the manager, Evelyn, asking us how everything was going. Take note people. That's great management skills. 

The food is great! You should always seek out their chicken and Yacu Yacu!
author: Vinson H.

description: I came to Limon with a friend who highly recommended the place. I was so impressed I brought my wife today. Excellent rotisserie chicken and great drinks. Thank to all the staff for the great service and wonderful food.
author: Salman S.

description:
MUST GET THE FOLLOWING:
-lomo saltado
-chicken
-truffle mac

SOOO YUMMY!! I love this place! Wish the place and portions were bigger!
author: Alyssa C.

description: Great food but was here tonight and the power went out and the top floor was filled with smoke. Everyone was coughing and trying to evacuate and a sever used his body to block customers from leaving when they promised they would wait to pay. He proceeded to write down people's card numbers and security codes on a post it note --extremely unsecure. The manager got in a fight with us saying that it was more important for him to find out if other businesses had their power out over evacuating people who were trapped in the smoke and coughing. Terrible experience
author: Anna C.

description: Absolutely dee-li-cious.  From the chicharonnes de pollo to the chocolate bandido.  Everything was so flavorful. My taste buds were happy and belly full.  Very satisfied customer.
author: Angelica S.

description: The food is delicious. My only complaint is that the restaurant is really loud. It's hard to hear people if you're trying to have a conversation.
author: Grace D.

description:
I came here for a foodie meet-up and I was not disappointed.  I've been wanting to come here for awhile and heard good things about their chicken.

I had the ensalada rusa, ceviche misto, jalea, truffle mac and cheese, pollo a la brasa, yucca fries, carne de parilla ribeye, and profiteroles.  I enjoyed everything on the menu, with the exception of the ceviche.  I liked it, but I wish it had more acidity.  But I really like my ceviche bursting with lemon/lime flavor.  I didn't get that with this ceviche.

I enjoyed the ensalda rusa, which had beets.  And the chicken was so moist and had a lot of earthy flavor from the herbs it was dressed in.  And the truffle mac and cheese was balanced in richness.  I had a little bit of the ribeye because I stopped eating red meat two years ago.  It was cooked perfectly and makes me want to eat red meat again!  The profiteroles were the perfect way to end the meal.

They have a decent wine selection, but for this place, I suggest going for cocktails and spirits.

Service was quick and friendly.  We sat on the second floor, and when I looked down to see the chefs make empanadas (which looked huge btw!) they all looked up and waved back!

It's a lively atmosphere, so be prepared to talk a bit louder than usual to your party.  I will definitely come back for the chicken and to try the empanadas.
author: Vira P.

description:
People rave about this place so I was pretty amped to finally try it. I came with a party of 12 on a Monday night for dinner at 7pm. They seated us when 7 people in our group arrived. Service was pretty attentive during the meal but it took a while for them to get us our bill. 

Pollo a la Brasa -  all portions come with 2 sides and the trio of Aji sauces
Whole Chicken - The skin was crispy and the meat was tender. I personally prefer dark meat bc it's a lot juicier. The sauces steal the show easily. Use sparingly because extra is gonna cost ya.

Sides
Yuca fries - Golden and crisp on the outside, soft on the inside. Perfect!
Tacu-Tacu (Sauteed rice & beans) - Very mushy and not memorable. I was not feelin the texture.
Truffle Mac & Cheese - Creamy and satisfying, but I've had better.

Small Cold Plates
Leche Tigre Cocktail - Pretty standard ceviche served with one large taro chip. Nothing to write home about.

Small Hot Plates
"Lomito" Saltado - Stir-fried sirloin strips, onions, tomato, soy sauce, & french fries. The beef was tasty, but the french fries were pretty soggy, so that detracted from the experience.

Empanadas
Carne - sirloin, sauteed onions, hard boiled eggs, olives & raisins. I've heard good things about these but they turned out to be really dry.

Pretty disappointed overall. If you want some bomb Peruvian food, I recommend La Fusion in FiDi.
author: Lucy N.

description:
Best roasted chicken ever!!!! The food is flavorful, fresh, and doesn't weigh you down. Great atmosphere for friends and family. Drinks are on point. I will be back. 

I usually only eat dark meat but the waiter made a mistake with my order and got me white meat instead. The chicken breast was a pleasant surprise, it wasn't dry like most chicken breast and bold with flavor, so I can only imagine how good the dark meat was.

If you try the 1/4 dark meat you might end up ordering 1 more order of 1/4 dark meat cause it's that good, lol it's less dense than the white meat. Both my brother and sis in law ordered more after the first round.

Price is super fair for the quality of food you are being served
author: Vidith E.

description:
Stay away!! I've ordered take out and eaten in at this restaurant and both times the service has been absolutely terrible. 

When I ordered takeout, it took 20 mins long than the quoted time of 15 mins for the food to be ready. When the food was finally ready, no one apologized for the long wait.

When we ate in at the restaurant, we had to ask a busboy if our server was around, had to specially request water, and our waiter never came back to our table for the rest of our meal -- the food and check were brought by busboys.  We only got the check after we asked someone once we had been done with our meal for at least 10 mins.  

Terrible service and mediocre food = NOT worth eating here.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
These five stars are dedicated to the bar tender, Eric, who happened to be making drinks in the rain on a Sunday afternoon. A friend and I had a daytime show to attend to at The Chapel, but first decided that we were in dire need of half of a chicken and some delicious drinks.  The good news is, both are available at Limon.

This was my first trip during the day and I much prefer it for lunch or a late afternoon meal.  However, for either lunch or dinner, the food never, ever disappoints.  The chicken is amazing to share with a friend or a few and comes with two sides and sassy sauces that really understand my taste buds.  I love the sweet potato fries particularly and dearly.  

Dinner time at this establishment can be noisy and nagging and overwhelming.  Visiting during lunch and sitting at the bar proved to be a completely different experience.  Food was in my face before I had finished half of my delicious egg yolk drink and Eric joked with us while I embraced my inner Cro-Magnon and picked at the chicken caucus.

I left the time wishing that all of my alcoholic beverages were delivered to me with smiley face in them and wondering how many chickens were consumed on a weekly basis at Limon.
author: Allyson D.

description:
I got take out, and it was pretty empty at lunch.  The guy who helped me was really friendly and offered some water while I waited.  The food actually came out really quickly. 

A quarter chicken is probably the least worth it for the value, but I like the option of white meat only ($11.95 for this, $22.95 for a whole chicken, $14.95 for a half chicken).  Each order of chicken comes with 2 sides and aji sauces.  

- The sweet potato fries (camote frio) were a little thicker than I like but had good flavor.  
- The salad was pretty standard and made me feel a little less guilty about the fries
- Chicken: not dry at all, good rotisserie char, very flavorful (lots of cumin).  It didn't even really need the sauces, but the Aji Amarillo Mustard and chimichurri were pretty good.

This made for a good lunch, and it was relatively healthy (minus the fries..).  One hiccup was that they forgot to give me a fork for my to-go order.

Visa and MasterCard only.
author: Marilyn H.

description:
Nothing but amazing food and service!!! 
My partner and I had dinner there a couple of weeks ago and we both had a fantastic dinner. I can't wait to go back to the Bay Area and repeat the experience !!
author: Roberto F.

description:
One of the best meals and dining experiences I've had in a while! 

Food: we had the half chicken and two sides (rice/beans and sweet potato fries). We also had a delicious ribeye and potatoes/green beans. The chicken was cooked perfectly and really well seasoned. Loved the accompanying dips. The ribeye was Divine--seriously good! 

Service: even though they were busy, the service was really excellent. We made a reservation but arrived early and were able to get seated right away. 

Love the family style theme. My friend had the pisco sour and it was really good, must try!
author: Semuteh F.

description:
I wish I could give this place a better review but, the service was unforgivable. The food is six stars and the service was one star. 

This is a terrible place to try and relax and enjoy your food. We made reservations on Friday and they were 30 minutes behind on seating us (I understand this happens) but, from the moment we got our food they were trying to take it off the table and push us out the door. After the 10th time of them trying to bring our bill within our 40 minute stay and them taking the plate out of my hand I left disappointed.

The ribs may have been the best I have ever had but, I wouldn't go any where to be treated like that.
author: Kristen R.

description: This is an amazing restaurant. I don't know where  to begin. The restaurant has two levels,  with the uppermost level overlooking the first. The kitchen has no roof, so you can watch the cooks at work with their open fire cooking. The food is amazing and fresh,  and you don't have to wait even ten minutes to be served. The prices are outstanding.  You can get food of equal quality at other places for a 33% higher price.  Beat that!  With something for almost anyone, I strongly recommend this extraordinary place.
author: Josh J.

description: First time ever trying Peruvian food. Soooo amazing! The drinks, the food, the service. My new favorite type of food.  I'm pleased.
author: Cassandra M.

description:
Delicious food! Superfast service. 
Me being from Europe a bit too fast though. We ordered food and it was served within 5 minutes and we were out within an hour while we were celebrating a birthday. 
We moved from upstairs down because it was too cold upstairs and the atmosphere was much better downstairs as well!
author: Christy V.

description:
Situation:
- Friday night with 6 people
- Ordered a Pork Chop with Bacon
- Friends ordered various Chicken and Beef dishes

Pros
- The Chicken was great
- Great service
- Clean bathrooms

Cons
- The Pork Chop was okay, it tasted a bit too salty
author: Dipesh G.

description:
YUCA FRIESSSS. Some of the best yuca fries I've had & my absolute favorite item here. They're like crispy clouds - crispy batter on the outside and kinda fluffy on the inside. 

The chicken is also super flavorful and tender. Pieces fell right off the bone! Comes with a trio of dipping sauces.

Things that were just oh-kay:
- Vegetales Salteados (sauteed veggies in soy sauce). Too oily and nothing special. Would not get order it again. 
- Ceviche Mixto, essentially a STACK of fresh seafood pieces. Love the seafood, but the lime-lemon juice was a tad too strong for me. Solid, but not the best ceviche I've had. 
- Kinda loud, especially during the dinner rush

Make a reservation or else.
author: Samantha C.

description: Absolutely amazing meal.... Five of us ordered a little bit of everything rotisserie chicken beef chicken and veggie empanada crispy ceviche traditional mix seafood ceviche steak and fries dish in vinegar based sauce... Paella and second dirty rice type dish with beans mixed in... One other beef dish in brown sauce.... I'll update this review after looking at menu again... Emanates and the steak meat with the fries in vinegar sauce were my fave.... Sneaky limón was not that Sneaky and more pink than I expected so my second drink was the Peruvian beer they had not called Cristal
author: Josh G.

description:
I'm Peruvian 100% , I've my experiences in a 20 Peruvian restaurants , I think this is a complete restaurant and it has a very good costumer services ,nice team ;but the food was to salty  
I got the pollo alabrasa with the respective sauces 
Chicken salty,not crispy skin ; the sides were OK ,salsa of wuakatay was not good it all ,
I also got a ceviche mixto that I think  it lacked lemon and surprisingly salt.
I was just expecting a lot more
author: Maricruz F.

description:
Bummer!
I always see huge crowds here & at the location on South Van Ness... not really sure why :?
If you want authentic Peruvian don't go here! I love the hipster crowds that the restaurant draws to my neighborhood but there is waaay too much hype!
clean atmosphere service was okay... if that's the best I can say about a place that's not a good thing!
author: Ashley G.

description:
My overall impression of this place is that they need to provided more value for their really good food. They are pretty stingy with their portions and this was clearly a decision on the management's part. This is more of a tapas-style place, with each small (emphasis on small) plate costing close to $10 and all not all worth the cost.

Yelpers got it right (at the time of this writing). 3.5 stars.

4 for the food
3 for the very loud, hard-edged ambiance
2 for the value.
4 for the service.

Successes:

--The 1/2 Pollo a la Brasa was very moist and tender--even the white meat was juicy. Simple but very good. Their chickens are not particularly large so 1/2 chicken will give party of 4 a sampling. Served with two sides: (we got the Tacu Tacu a wonderful scoop of seasoned mashed canary beans mixed with rice and exactly 4 perfectly crispy fried chunky sticks of Yucca) and three Aji sauces: 

--Ceviche de Pescado & Camaron: their red snapper and shrimp was the hit of the evening. Fresh, perfectly seasoned and so delicious with a perfect little spice kick. If you like ceviche, you will really love this version as we did.

-- Chicharron de Pollo: a small portion simply deep-fried, un-breaded, chunks of chicken with a clear sauce that really was needed to pep-up these crunchy-moist-tender chunks.

--Seco de Costillas: a small portion of braised boneless beef short ribs in a thin stew with carrots and potatoes. A real disappointment. While tender, the beef was overcooked and dry making it not worth the cost.

Desert too was unimpressive. Their deserts are all over-priced at $7-8 each, even the sorbet. Their Chocolate Bandido was an attempt to be a chocolate melting cake but did not succeed and had very little of the rich chocolate flavor that it deserved.

The hard-edged lines of this place also made for a very loud experience as more people arrived. But service was really attentive, friendly and prompt.

So if you know what to order and what to expect, this could be a good place with lots of delicious sounding options--we were certainly full when we left but not completely pleased with everything served. The cost for the above with tip for two with no drinks was $35.
author: Glenn H.

description:
The food is good, although the portions have become smaller over time. Lomo Saltado used to come with rice, now it's Lomito Saltado and no rice for the same price. If this review were just for the food I would give it a solid thee stars.

It's not just about the food though is it? It's the experience too. I'm a new mother to a five month old and I needed to change baby's diaper, but there was no changing table anywhere. When I asked the manager about it he said "the owner doesn't want it". Well, what does the owner want? What is the alternative? My car was parked so far I would have been gone for half an hour if I went back there to do it. Pretty sure people would freak if I did it at the table (it crossed my mind), maybe I should put baby on the bathroom floor, probably not. 

I ended up dragging my friend to the restroom to help and did the change on the sink. Needless to say, I won't be back.
author: Kara A.

description:
I was very impressed by my meal here. The portions were great and the prices were very reasonable. 

We started with the Ceviche de Pescado y Camaron and it was amazing. It was fresh and very zesty, which I love! Oh, and those Peruvian corn nuts they add are delish!

Then we split an order of the Lomito Saltado which came with a generous serving of French Fries and tomatoes. It was served a beautiful medium rare.

We also had a half Pollo a La Brasa with a side of Yuca Fries and my new favorite thing, Tacu Tacu, which is sautéed rice and beans. I seriously loved that stuff!

As for the Aji Sauces the chimichurri and rocotto molido were great on the chicken! Definitely get the molido it is not spicy but adds flavor.

As a side note this place has really tight seating so don't expect to have a deep and private conversation because you are sitting elbow to elbow with your neighbors. But what this place lacks in intimacy it makes up for in vibe, decor, and flavor.
author: Caro S.

description: love this place! Was showed to my by a few friends and havent been disappointed in any way since going back a few more times. Food is hot, fresh, and flavorful. Love love love the chicken :)
author: Frances K.

description:
This is a place that gets high marks for vibe, food, layout, decor, the whole shebang.  I attended a 20 person birthday party, which occupied about 30% of the loft space overlooking the dining area - which had a nice effect giving the party a cool, suite-like celebratory feel, not quite VIP but definitely an "above" feeling.  There were several other tables celebrating as well.

Food was delicious, price fix...stuffed ourselves...

Only thing - service was a little lacking, but I'll cut them some slack.  There were 60 people up there and keeping drinks filled required a trip to the bar and up and down stairs...it was going to be slow.

I will point out that its plenty loud during a saturday night, so expect the need to lean and speak....

We had a great time, I look forward to going back with my wife and getting one of the more intimate tables.
author: Jason J.

description:
Not impressed. Just so so food at high prices. I don't think the place lives up to the hype.

Also, I was not pleased with the server. I asked if they do anything for birthdays and he said he'd check. Next thing, he brought out a little dessert and tacked on a 9$ charge to the bill without saying a word to me. I think that "I'll check" implies that you'll actually consult with the customer instead of simply ordering an item from the menu for them...
author: Nina M.

description:
They may have scored more points had they had our table ready. We had Open Table reservations and it took them 10 minutes to set up. And no, we weren't early, right on the dot actually.

   Costillas Nikkei: Delicious. The soy sauce glaze added a real nice sweet taste to the ribs.
   Leche de Tigre Cocktail: Could do without it, wasn't anything special. If you want some seafood, get their Ceviche Mixto as it's a little bit better.
   Chicharron de Pollo: Another alright dish, but its one of their plates that has more on the plate vs other plates like the Costillas Nikkei.
   Lomo Saltado: Don't get, for 18 bucks you'd think you'd be getting one of their tastiest dishes but it was one of my biggest let down. Nothing I couldn't make better at home.
author: Dan N.

description: Had lunch there for the first time yesterday, not having tried Peruvian food before. Loved loved loved the food! Everything we ordered was tasty and satisfying. We ordered the quarter chicken, the beef tongue and the paella (our favorite!) to share among the two of us. Portion was good and the service was attentive and great. Too bad we are leaving SF in a few days but we'll definitely come back the next time we're back in t
author: Rebecca T.

description: I wanted to like this place! The food was good the service was pretty awful. We were a party of 8. After an hour and 15 minutes of being there we were asked to leave because there was another reservation behind us. We were given the bill (over $500) but no offer of dessert, another round of drinks or even the time to finish the drinks we had. 10 minutes after the first request the server came over and more aggressively told us to leave....really?? I commented to the hostess on the way out that we were disappointed with how we had just been treated. She gave attitude and a smug reply. I get that the public can be difficult to deal with but my concern was not unreasonable. Someone from our party asked to speak to the manager. His solution to poor service was to offer a free drink.
author: Lizzy B.

description: New nice and trendy place in the City.  We've ordered lots of dishes they all tasted great and fresh.
author: Maryanna K.

description: Never had peruvian food, it was wonderful! I had the whole chicken, lomo saltado, inca cola, and inca blue lemonade. All was excellent, the saltado a little salty, but was served with a side of white rice which balanced it out. This fed 2 people and we were full by the time we left. Love the decor inside and atmosphere. Good service, clean restaurant. Good for groups.
author: Robyn N.

description:
Constantly being trolled by these guys.

BF got takeout this time. Asked for 1 whole chicken with the -FOUR- -UNIQUE- SAUCES to clarify. I was looking forward to deliciousness.

Got: 

a) 2 different sauces (none of my fav chimichurri or the hot one), 3 of each after bf asked to make sure during pickup. What. the. fk. Strike two.

b) Did not get a freaking whole chicken. I am pretty shocked. You get the whole chicken to get all the tasty parts and to share equally. WE GOT 1 DRUMSTICK AND 1 THIGH, THE REST BREAST MEAT. WHAT KIND OF MUTANT CHICKEN IS THIS. WE ARE NOT BOOB PEOPLE, we basically got 2 tiny pieces we actually like. (Ok, the breast is good for breast, but why am I going here to get tasty chicken bits I like then? I could just get a Costco chicken with all the parts)

Yes the food is tasty, but despite trying to fix the previous takeout mishap and getting the same result/worse, I can't recommend takeout unless you go and inspect everything on the spot and moan till you get what you m-fking paid for. ^_^

====

The experience is COMPLETELY different if you actually sit inside. It's almost like the staff care about you. I recently also went with a couple friends, and the guy explained all the sauces thoroughly (yes, ALL FOUR SAUCES) and gave us nice pieces (I was really surprised by this based on my previous invisibility/gtfo vibe of getting takeout). 

Still, they do mess up and completely forgot my bf's order. After most of us finished eating, his small cube of fish arrived, was bland, and he left hungry and sad.

So it may just be that we (the bf and me in particular) have horrible luck with them.
author: Xue H.

description:
This restaurant is a good, reasonably priced choice. They have good ceviche (I like the mixto) and lots of choices for pescatarians, vegetarians, gluten- free, carnivores etc
Their sangria is pretty good, and it's a fun place for a big group/ family style meal (with whole chickens etc). The only thing I really hate is that you can't seat until your whole party is there- makes sense on busy Saturday nights but on a weeknight when your friend is late and all you want to do is sit down, it's super annoying to have to wait. They also once kept out group of 10 people waiting almost an hour past our reservation time (even though we were all there), because they have mismanaged and overbooked. They can definitely be better with service (feels like a bit of a factory), but overall is good food at a reasonable price
author: Allie M.

description: Our 2nd time to visit and It never fails me and my family. Brought our extended families from SoCal to this place and they just loved the chicken rotisserie. My son also loved the truffle mac and cheese. Price is reasonable, but it can be crowded, so reservation is a must.
author: Liza M.

description: The chicken is so tender and juice as it just melts in the mouth. It's a perfect dish with sangria...
author: Krishna K.

description: I'm Peruvian, and this place is as close as I've gotten to legit Peruvian food in the city. Portions could be bigger, but I'm still a big fan!
author: Ricardo H.

description:
Good, yes but not as great as the other LR  on Mission.
The pollo a la brasa never fails to disappoint though.
I liked the sangria and the beet/potato salad as well, but overall the other location has such a better vibe. The service though was better here than the Mission location.
author: Kinjal N.

description: Great, tasty food.  Don't be scared of ordering out of your comfort zone!  We so enjoyed this place!!
author: Paul B.

description: Went for lunch and ordered the half chicken which comes with two sides. We opted for yuca fries and the veges. Everything was delicious.  It was enough for two. I had a Sangria which was very good!  It was not a cheap lunch but not too expensive either.
author: Susan F.

description:
Even though there's almost 2,000 reviews, mine will hopefully prove the food has stayed consistent!

Our meal..
Appetizer:  Tartar de Tuna 
Main dishes: Half Chicken & Truffle Mac & Cheese 
Sides: Tacu Tacu & Papa Fritas

Favorites of the evening...
Truffle Mac & Cheese
Tartar de Tuna 
Chicken

What I will for sure order when I return..
Truffle Mac & Cheese

... along with Ceviche & Empanadas!
author: Geraldine R.

description:
Having heard the focus now is their wonderful rotisserie chicken as what's served at the South Van Ness location, why not come and try it here too?

We had a reservation for four at 5:30pm last night.  Folks must eat late since the restaurant didn't fill up until like 8:30pm.  We were able to eat and sit for 3 1/2 hours with no pressure for our table.

We ordered family style.  Ordered the whole chicken.  Options of cutting it up into four pieces or eight.  We opted for eight.  The chicken was very good.  Breast meat very tender.

Also ordered lots of small tapas and sides.  Everything we had we enjoyed although a few were very salty.  Especially the boneless short ribs.  That was our least favorite.

Besides the chicken, I enjoyed the yucca fries and the anticuchos.

Desserts we shared - the chocolate bandido and the profiteroles.  Both were yummy.  We also ordered coffee to go with our desserts.  

For beverages, my friends has the mango lemonade and I had the pisco sour cocktail.  

We ordered lots of food to taste, and leftovers bagged.

Tax and tip $28 p/p. Very reasonable.

If you're deciding which Limon to eat at, I would say for conversation, come here, but if the chicken is your focus, go to the South Van Ness location.
author: Shirley N.

description: Great place for a small office Holiday dinner and the food was amazing too!
author: Kathleen J.

description: I was excited to try this place for the first time because I love Peruvian chicken but they fell short on my expectations. First, my boyfriend scheduled a reservation using the Yelp App for an 8pm dinner. When we checked in the lady said "I don't see your name". My boyfriend showed her the text reservation we received confirming our reservation that day and the front lady said "We don't make SAME day reservation." I got a little ticked off, I mean what restaurants don't take same day reservations? Plus, why didn't the lady honor our reservation since we had proof on our phone. She decided not to honor our reservation we booked online and proceeded to tell us it would be an hour and a half wait. I kind of wanted to tell my boyfriend to just go to Pícaros for dinner, but since we were there specifically to have dinner we went ahead and waited an hour and a half.  My chicken was quite pleasant and reasonably priced at $18 for half a chicken, my only complaint is if the restaurants offers french fries and sweet potato fries then why doesn't this place offer ketchup or mustard to go with it? In Peru, all chicken rotisseries offer ketchup and mustard. I feel like this is Limon's  way of forcing you to pay an additional al $3 for sauces. We also ordered ceviche, but the portion was extremely small. It had 3 shrimps, 3 octopus, a few cuts of fish. Our lomo saltado was pretty tasty too. So, I guess all I have to say is bring your own ketchup and mustard for your fries and don't order ceviche. It was literally like 3 table spoonfuls of ceviche. The waitress was nice and sweet
author: Joanna G.

description: Food and service were good but the moment we paid the check we were asked to leave because they were busy and needed the table. So not cool.
author: Lou S.

description:
Great place to grab a drink and a bite before taking the party out on the town. 
Sit down have a drink and some ceviche. The service is excellent which is why you're seeing a crowd. You should've made a reservation. Parking will be a challenge too. Still worth it.
author: Norris T.

description: This may be the best chicken I've ever eaten. The service is excellent the presentation is great, I can't believe how amazing this places. There you go fries are awesome as well
author: David L.

description: We had an amazing dinner, the food was top notch and service was great until a waiter came up to the table and basically asked us to leave because he said there were lots of people waiting.  It wouldn't have felt so rude if the six of us were indeed lingering.  We had t even even been there an hour and we were still finishing our drinks.
author: Janice P.

description:
Although my standards were high, I definitely plan on coming back (for the Lengua) and try out a few other dishes. Overall, I'd rate my experience as a 4, but the food about 3.5 stars

Antichucho de Lengua - $10 (5/5). Definitely the high point of the night! Would recommend everybody try this dish - rich and fatty, but not off-putting.

Quarter Chicken Dark with Yuca Fries and Vegetables - $10 (3/5) It wasn't the same as what I've had from my friend's mom's home cooking, which left me a bit disappointed. However, the meat was nice and juicy - cooked perfectly.

Tuna Tartar  - $10 (3/5). Average compared to the other's I've tried. Can't complain.

Truffle Mac & Cheese - $7 (2/5). Unfortunately, this was a disappointment. 

Panna Cotta - $8 (3/5). Maybe it's because I haven't had enough panna cotta in my life, but I thought this was exactly what it should be. It wasn't mind-blowing, but it did leave me feeling a bit unsatisified.
author: Gabriel C.

description:
I take my family to this place and we re happy with the food and the service
I recomend this place
author: Eros G.

description: The food here is amazing.  Must have the fish and shrimp ceviche with taro chips.  The mac and cheese is amazing.  Lomo soltado... So flavorful. And lastly, fhe chicharon de pollo.  Order these and you wont be disappointed.  To top it off its a nice restaurant. Service is good not great but who cares.
author: Nazanin R.

description: The host and the servers were so rude. 0 points for service. The host sat us down and said that we had 1 hour time limit! Seriously? Is that the first thing you tell a customer? Then the waiter showed up with menus and immediately asked us if we were ready with orders. Really? So they want us to pay for premium service in the minimum time possible? Shame! I've come here before. These guys suck now. Typical place in sf that got famous and now is on their path to failure. Goodbye!
author: Vibhore S.

description:
I've heard so much about this place and finally decided to stop in and give it a try.  It was a hot day, I was craving the exotic taste of ceviche.  Peruvian ceviche happens to be some of the best out there and passing the facade of the business I decided to walk in and try it out.  

Much to my surprise, despite the small size, it was quite tasty and filling.  All the flavors pop out at you and the fish and shrimp were fresh and cooked by the citrus juices perfectly (keep in mind this is a raw fish dish). The accompaniment of roasted maize, fresh boiled maize and sweet potato were really nice parings to have floating around in the citrus juice. 

I was quite pleased with the ceviche, my only suggestion would be to have the red chili emulsified into the citrus liquid rather than sitting open face on the fish, however this is purely personal preference. 

My second dish was the macaroni and cheese which was really tasty. 

My choice of wine paired with the ceviche was a white pinot grigio.  

In the near future, I'm looking forward to coming back for a full course lunch or dinner. Care to join me?
author: Dan R.

description:
Pros:
Service
Wait (even at 8pm)
Drinks
Cevichee 

Cons:
Saltado really salty
Pricey

Overall I would come back but order something different.
author: Matthew G.

description:
I set my expectations low because a coworker said the Valencia location is subpar and 'nothin to rave about'. 

But I must say, the food really hit the mark - great flavors, tender meat, and very reasonable prices. 

I made a reservation via Yelp for a Wednesday evening. We came in with an extra person and got seated right away anyways! No hassle. Great staff.

Between three petite Asian girls, we order half a chicken (with sweet potatoes and stir fried veggies on the side), the Crispy Ceviche, and the Panna Cotta for dessert to share. Perfect amount of food!

Half chicken ($10.95) - tender, great sauces to accompany it. Sweet potatoes could be crispier.

Crispy ceviche ($12.95)  - not much ceviche but lots of crispy! Basically batter fried fish. Tasty though!

Panna cotta ($8.95) - loooved it! But too pricy for my comfort.

Overall, good food and service. Fun area to walk around after dinner. Good for dates or small groups. Prices are decent!
author: Teresa T.

description:
Two stars for service: I had to check in with the hostess twice. In the middle of dinner the waiter told me there was a time limit on the table and that we'd get kicked out in 10 minutes. We had literally just ordered a second serving of chicken. The waiter later apologized, but it really put the group in a sour mood. The restaurant was also incredibly noisy, and we could barely hold a conversation. 
The food is delicious despite the horrible service (so I added a star): pollo a la brassa, tacu tacu, and empandas are the highlights.
author: Kelly H.

description: This is one of the best restaurants in the city. Diego, our waiter, suggested their known roasted chicken with an array of sauces. An amazing start of fish, and the music was authentic and wonderful. A great place
author: Trish B.

description:
Lots of deliciousness coming out of this joint!

I don't think you can go wrong with any choice you make on the menu.

My favorites would have to be the empanadas and truffle mac and cheese so far.

Drinks, hands down, the Maracuya Sour!


The staff was also very attentive and yay to reservations!
author: Michelle T.

description:
Limon is one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco. The chicken is unforgettable - I can taste it as I think of it. 

The ceviche is fantastic as well!
author: Bob J.

description: The food isn't that good. Drink aren't good at all. I didn't know pisco sours are pre made in a blender. I thought it would be a good drink seeing it's a Peruvian drink and it's a Peruvian restaurant. The ceviche is decent but had better Peruvian ceviche other restaurants.
author: Ree G.

description: We hosted a 26 person party here. Everything was great and everyone was really friendly and accommodating. The food was delicious.
author: Julie F.

description: Good food but... the service is poor. We informed our server that one of us is gluten free. It was clear she knew nothing about allergens at the time so we asked her to check with the kitchen. It's our assumption this never happened and sadly our gluten free guest spent the next day very ill in bed. The mystery was solved after calling the restaurant when the chef confirmed one of the dishes - the mixed vegetables - are cooked in soy sauce. Gluten free folks beware... Check check and double check, probably worth having a manager confirm as our server was neither informed or to be trusted. Sad really as the food is lovely.
author: Marsh M.

description:
--- melt in your mouth chicken---

Cousin introduced me to this place 

Very reasonable 

Amazing flavor with the roasted chicken

Pisco sour amazing drink !
author: Evan W.

description:
I've been to this restaurant on dates, with friends and with colleagues. Overall, it's an okay experience. The food is delicious, yet the portions
are so tiny for the price you're paying. I love love love the 'lomo saltado' and I always end up wanting to order another plate. Note: I have a relatively small appetite. So are the portions worth the price? Probably not.

As far as customer service, I'm going to say it's just OK. The servers are always alternating between tables, so it's hard to develop that server/customer relationship which makes great customer service. All 
the servers are nice enough, yet many times they'll seem occupied to the point where you're wondering when they're going to come to your table. 

Now, regarding the ambiance...this is where people have different opinions. Well here's mine: IT'S SO LOUD IN HERE, I LITERALLY HAVE TO SHOUT ACROSS THE TABLE. Yes, I know it's a small location and it's always pretty packed, so it makes sense for the restaurant to incredibly loud. So if you're going on a first day or a dinner meeting with collegues, this is definitely not the place. Yet, if you're going with your best friends and you all like to scream! and shout! this is the place to go.
author: Stefany Z.

description:
The only reason I give it two stars is because the food was decent.

1)so we call and make reservation for 8 people. We call again to change the number of people for our party and they told us we didn't have any reservations in the first place. Even though right after making out reservation we received an email that confirmed our reservation and gave us info on their pre- fixed menu.

2)We walked in 5 minutes prior to our reservation and we still had to wait for 20minutes.

3) we had to wait another 15 minutes just to place an order for drinks. And when we order a pitcher of margarita the server goes "we only have four glasses". Okay, how is that relevant we didn't ask you how many people it is for or if we want Extra glasses etc. we were anyway going to split if four ways since the rest of the people ordered cocktails. Also, would there be an issue if we wanted five glasses.

Anyway, food is good. Everything else is meh. There are so many more good restaurants in the city that have good food and customer service!

I heard the other location is better, so we may go check it out.
author: K S.

description:
Yuca fries were sensational-  crispy on the outside, fluffy and airy on the inside.  

A word of caution- we went on a Saturday night and it took us an hour to get seated upstairs.  With the low ceiling upstairs and a few rowdy birthday groups, it was extremely loud and we had to almost shout across the table.  It didn't bother us, but you may want to go elsewhere if you're looking for something more mellow on a Saturday night.
author: Rushil R.

description:
Terrible terrible service.  After being seated and promptly having our drink orders taken, we waited... and waited... and waited.  The waiter brought water and said the drinks were coming.  We waited... the waiter stopped by and said the drinks were on the way and that he'd take our order in a minute.  We waited... finally we gave up left without ordering or getting our drinks.

We were already turned off because this place is deafeningly loud.  I expect this in a bar, but to sit with friends and barely be able to hear one another talk without shouting is not my idea of a pleasant dinner.

I heard the food is good, but I'm never going back to try.
author: Jeff D.

description: I enjoyed my night there with my boyfriend. Not necessarily a romantic dinner place because it's so loud but food is pretty good! We had the half chicken and steak - both tender and delicious.
author: Crystal W.

description: Always ask if they're going to charge for the yuca sauce.. bcz the bartender said "depending on people  behavior" we charge the yuca sauce.. yuca$4... sauce$3 .. OMG! So unprofessional! Never coming back.
author: Elaine B.

description:
Late review!

Came in with 6 of my coworkers to celebrate late xmas get together on Dec 27, saturday. We made reservations in advance. The food was great but the service was sooo bad.

We were just there for about 45-50min. Once we finished eating and they took away our plates they asked us if we could get up because they have people waiting. We didnt even pay the bill yet nor did they ask us if we wanted dessert. There was three groups who was there way longer than us and their tables was empty and they were just chatting but they did not ask them to leave. 

When the waiter asked us if we could get up and we told him we didnt get the bill yet he had the nerve to say "you should have asked for it" when he is the one telling us to get up. The experience was not worth the $400 we paid. 

Maybe we should have just stand up and left without paying the bill. 

Thank god for Roberto, one of their serving staff, noticed we left so soon and said apologize about the whole incident.
author: Romeo M.

description:
I went here with a friend and we each got a Pisco Sour ($9.50, very strong!) and split the Queso and Pollo Empanadas(~$8 for a serving of 2 empanadas). The empanadas were absolutely delicious and the dipping sauce was even more amazing! 

The waiters were super friendly and very patient. There was a soccer game being shown and the interior décor really set the mood. We got a great table by the street so we also got to do some people watching! 

I had an overall amazing experience and I definitely want to come back with more friends next time!
author: Erika S.

description:
The food was great, but the service sucked! 

The Ceviche de Pescado and rich and creamy Truffle Mac and Cheese are definitely my two favorite dishes. I would have given 4 stars except our waiter was hella rude! He was really impatient throughout the night and acted like we were wasting his time when we were ordering. Throughout the night he never came back to check on us. It was always someone else who came to refill our waters or bring us our food or bring dipping sauces. When it came time to pay the bill he literally wasted no time reaching right over my friend immediately when she closed the bill holder. RUDE.

Also be aware if you come here with  large group, you are REQUIRED to do the Prix Fixed menu which is $27 per person! You might get lots of food, but I would never spend $27 on food for just myself here. On our visit here, my husband and I shared the Chicharron de Pollo, Ceviche de Pescado, and Truffle Mac & Cheese for a total of ~$30. If we had done the prix fix our bill would have been double! No thanks!

The food is good, but not good enough to bring me back to endure the terrible service. Take your business elsewhere!
author: Henna P.

description:
Had reservations for 7pm.   At 7:10 was asked to leave there waiting square and hang out at there bar to be out of the way.   Nice touch.  

Waiting for last 2 drinks to be made in the group and now we are told our table is ready.   The hostess then seemed to be annoyed to have to wait do us to get the last 2 drinks.   I finally left my party and followed her to our table.   

It is a decent value and I do like the food.   Chicken , yucca fries, lomo saltado all very good.   Problem is if you want to talk and here conversation this is not the place for you.    Felt like I was screaming.   Never so glad to get out.    

Restaurant is all hard surfaces with no sound deadening.    Fail.
author: Mike E.

description:
I had a Groupon.  Yeah, I know it's my goal this year to finish all my Groupons and not have any expire....Anyways, I made a reservation after my Endless Slop lesson so that I could eat post workout.

Location:
The location of the restaurant is in the middle of foodie town.  You know, it's just a few blocks from Tartine, a short walk from Ti Couz, etc.  The parking is atrocious, though we were lucky to find street parking just around the corner, but it's expensive parking at a meter. 

Limon Ceviche - ***
Definitely a good ceviche, nothing compares to one I've had in the Mission, but this holds its own.

Lomo Saltado - ***
Meat on fries. Could you ask for more? It was good in quality, but the portions are definitely less than what I've experienced.

Panna Cotta - ****
Definitely the highlight of our meal.

Strawberry Mojito - *
Disappointing. I wished it had more strawberries or had more sweetness to it. You can definitely tell that the strawberries were not in season.

I'm not sure if I'd come back again.
author: Carolen M.

description:
I love Peruvian food, but I wouldn't really classify Limon Rotisserie as Peruvian. It's a little too Americanized--the flavors are blander, less spicy, tart and all around exciting than what you'd experience in the actual country. That said, it's still delicious.

Ceviche Mixto: A must for novices and aficionados, as the way to see if a Peruvian restaurant passes muster is to judge it by its national dish. I almost always get the Mixto wherever I go so as to try as many different kinds of seafood as possible. LR's was tasty but not milky enough, in my opinion. While it had the right accompaniments, the onion/pepper/garlic flavors appeared to have been lost. However, the cuts of fish were quite generous. 4/5

Truffle Mac 'n' Cheese: Not Peruvian by a long shot, and not very good either. The cheese was too thick and completely flavorless. Forget truffle salt, I don't think they even put regular salt in the dish! 1/5

Half Chicken: I love chicken done Peruvian-style. Tender, juicy, rotisserie-style with a crush of exotic herbs and spices. LR did this right. 5/5

Sweet Potato Fries: I don't like sweet potato, so I was meh about this, but my friends all seemed to love it. 3/5

Lomo Saltado: One of my favorite Peruvian dishes of all time and a must-order wherever I go. Limon Rotisserie's version was very tasty, but I don't think they did it quite right. You're supposed to taste a subtle, yet noticeable layer of soy sauce in each bite, as Lomo Saltado is one of Peru's "chifa" dishes (Asian-influenced dishes; Chinese speakers: Yes, "chifa" is a transliteration of "eat rice" in Mandarin). I couldn't really taste the soy sauce here. 3/5

Tacu Tacu: Rather bland and forgettable. 2/5

My friends and I also ordered several cocktails and of the ones we tried, the Sneaky Pisco was definitely the favorite. All in all, I'm glad I chose Limon Rotisserie as my first meetup dinner with my friend who was visiting from Boston. He had never had Peruvian food before and loved everything we got. We all liked the super-friendly service from our flamboyant waiters and the lively music/atmosphere.
author: Josephine L.

description:
I love Peruvian food (especially after going to Peru to see Machu Picchu in '06)!!  Ahhh...ok, focus focus.  We came here for a late lunch to use my friend's $20 for $40 Groupon worth of food/drinks at Limon - yay!  We ordered:

* Chicha Morada (ooo, get this!  It's non-alcoholic, sweet and tea-like - yummm, loved it!!)
* Lomita Saltado (super tasty sirloin strips with tomatoes, onions and fries, love how the fries soak up the flavors and juices!)
* Fried chicken pieces (good, loved the sauce you pour over it)
* Ceviche Pescado (not too spicy, tender, healthy, light, lovely!)
* Yucca Fries (my friend was late so I ordered these first while waiting for her, there were 6 fries and I ate 4 - I couldn't help myself! Loved the two sauces, especially the orange tangy one!)

I would totally come back to Limon - it's a *HIT* in my book!!  :)
author: Maile N.

description:
We've been to their Van Ness Ave and Fresno locations so we knew we were in a for a treat. You're in the City so of course parking is garbage and so is the neighborhood. We had reservations and though we were a bit late, they were able to quickly accommodate us. I am not sure if this place is bigger than their Van Ness location but it does have seating upstairs in a loft type setting. Seating is cramped and not private. Again, typical SF. 

Our waiter Alejandro made sure everything went smooth.

Sangria Pitcher $25 - I'll admit though tasty, this one wasn't as tasty as I remember.

Ceviche de Pescado Y Camarron $10.95 - Yum..delicious. That fish just melts in your mouth and their citrus marinade is addicting.

Lomito Saltado $10.95. Though I loved the flavor, I felt that the meat was too chewy. Not enough meat and too much of those drenched French fries.

Chicharron de Pollo $8.95 - There is no doubt that the flavor of this chicken is amazing but it tasted like it wasn't made to order. I know it's chicharron but it was too dry. Wifey didn't agree with me :)

Costillas Brasa $9.50 - I LOVE Pork Ribs and these did not disappoint. So meaty and juicy. Nom NOmz..GET THEM!


We were stuffed and had no room for dessert.  We had leftover ribs and they tasted just as good, if not better, reheated. Overall, I felt our experience at their other locations was better. But, without a doubt, Limón is one of my fave restaurants in the City. I can't wait to return and check out their Third St. location. BOOKMARKED!


*3.5 Stars
author: Rav V.

description: I love me some lomo saltado!!  For the price, I've had bigger portions, but the flavors were great and the ingredients seemed fresh nonetheless.  One thing though, I asked for aji sauce and at the time I didn't know what it was called and called it "green sauce".  Our server was a little confused and brought out chimichurri sauce.  When we got the bill, we were charged $3 for it!  anyways, my rating doesn't reflect the miscommunication.  Just be careful when asking the aji sauce!
author: Dorothy L.

description: Amazing place to hang out, have great food, unforgettable experience, I loved the sangria. Food its fresh, tasting, amazing. Highly recommend.
author: Nere H.

description:
This restaurant has a good roasted chicken, but so does costco! - i'm just saying. The restaurant is a classy but casual area in an okay neighborhood in San Francisco. I was excited about their Peruvian Ceviche selection but wasn't wowed. 

Please look at my Panca Restaurant review, that would show you what a real peruvian restaurant should be.

Also, I have yet to try Le Mar (sp)
author: Jan R.

description: Amazing food, great service and very accommodating to our large group! The chicken is succulent and cooked to perfection. Will definitely come back again.
author: Gary G.

description:
We split the Leche Tigre Ceviche and Quarter DARK chicken with regular sauce, sweet potatoe fries and veggies. Sauce was great with the chicken and fries. My date also had a Peruvian beer (which the waiter forgot). The ceviche was more of a soup and had a lemon taste that could kick you in the face! Very strong and tart. 

Overall, I don't think we'd come back. The waiter forgot our drinks and when I paid our tab in cash, he never brought back the change (granted I was going to give the majority to him, but I wanted a few dollars/coins for parking meters). The food didn't match the price. This is a good third or fourth date place, but expect to pay a pretty penny.
author: Nhi T.

description:
I'm NOT impressed,  the ambience is very nice. My experience with the server was terrible. Sat at the bar hoping to get faster attention. He treated me as if I was invisible,  he walked past me several times before offer me a menu or ask to see if I needed anything. After I ordered the food. I was totally neglected the whole evening. 
The food was just okay, the chicken is a little on the salty side. 
Nice place , average food, service was terrible. Wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.
author: Khai B.

description:
Was here last night and the rib eye was so delicious! And the chicharon de pollo was also yummy!
Late post *****
author: Sabra T.

description:
I chose this location thinking it'd be good for a nice group dinner, but dang this place is loud at night. Apparently the S. Van Ness Limon is a lot quieter.  

I'd heard so much about Limon before coming, but thought it was just average. The portions are small and the food is heavy. The Chicharron de Pollo is similar to chicken karaage, but with more of a burnt taste (and too many tendons!). I preferred the Pollo a la Brasa. Wasn't a fan of the Ceviche Mixto.
author: An Y.

description:
My bf and I came here for our anniversary dinner and left satisfied, however I take away one star since I felt the Rotisserie chicken was a tad dry...it was good with the side sauces but I wish the chicken was a bit more moist. 
We ordered some other dishes here that were good: Lomo saltado, truffle mac and cheese, sweet potato fries and beans/rice. The saltado was my favorite and I was craving more! The sizes of the small plates was just right, we had plenty to share between us and left full.
Service here was fine also, food came out fast and our server filled out water glasses frequently. 
This location is nice, theres alot of Pablo Sandoval autographs and memorabilia in the front also. 
Prices were reasonable also, not too steep and just right for tapa style. I wouldn't mind returning again but would definitely make sure the chicken tasted more to my liking.
author: Miss H K.

description:
Deliciously tender rotisserie chicken! The sauces that come with the order go well with the entree. A half chicken is enough for two, with side dishes. 

We ordered a Lomito Saltado with sirloin strips, which was good as well. However, I recommend finishing any other small plates with meat before eating the rotisserie chicken. It's hard to switch to anything chewy during the same meal. Chicken's that tender!! 

The Ceviche Mixto is a fresh-tasting opener for the meal. I'd try another ceviche at the next visit. 

If you're looking for a non-alcoholic beverage, try the mango lemonade. The drink washes down the food nicely. 

This will be my go-to restaurant for rotisserie! Great, loud atmosphere and good for groups. We saw what looked like company holiday parties. 

The restaurant is located on a block with many well-rated restaurants. Take a stroll after dinner; it's a nice neighborhood!
author: Vivian V.

description:
Was there Thursday night for dinner but arrived earlier so decided to take advantage of the Happy Hour at the bar but the bartender was far from Happy no greeting just shoved the happy hours drink menu & walked away, like he did want to be there had to get his attention to get a couple of drinks and the bar was NOT even crowded. He then slapped the bar check & when I paid did not return the change assuming I left him a tip. 
We were seated for dinner the waiter was friendly the opposite of our early experience with the unfriendly bartender. The food was great and the portions  perfect so the restaurant manager better watch out if walk-ins are treated by the bartender in a cold manner they might not want to experience the restaurant thinking the poor service is carried out  in the restaurant.
author: Meena Khan K.

description: Excellent!  Everything about this place is amazing. When I travel from L.A. to San Francisco I ALWAYS make sure I come here!
author: Monica R.

description: Wow! This place is mind blowing. We ordered several plates: truffle Mac n cheese - a creamy classic, chicken empanadas, an unlisted dish (it was fries with crispy pieces of chicken but it was the option that was NOT marinated in soy sauce under hot plates), and their octopus dish. Everything was spot on - including their service. You must try this food. Must must must.
author: Sara T.

description:
The chicken/ceviche are both good, but it was the lengua dish that really sold me on Limon. Nice and rich without being so gelatinous in a way that occasionally puts people off when they're eating tongue.

The wait is long and there's 2 of them so make sure you're meeting your friends at the right one. I definitely started out at the one on S. Van Ness and had to hoof it to Valencia.
author: Misha T.

description: A friend from the area took us here during our vacation and it did not disappoint! The prices are pretty good relative to the size of the dishes and despite being busy, we got seated and served pretty quickly. I had the chicken empanadas, which I really enjoyed, while my girlfriend got the half chicken with yuca fries and rice. I found the chicken to be very flavorful and also enjoyed the texture and taste of the rice and fries. I would definitely check the place out if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Jared G.

description:
Went here on Valentine's day with a friend. The ceviche was delicious and lime-y, the salad with beets was delicious, and the sweet potato fries were really good too. Kind of small portions, but it was enough to feel satisfied. 
One thing to note though was that the bathroom was dirty and the sink was clogged and over flowing with paper towels. Kind of a turn off for such a nice restaurant.
author: Lilja I.

description:
5 stars for food:
This place has the best rotisserie chicken I've ever had and the salad + veggies are delicious.

5 stars for service:
