This place can get busy, but they've always delivered my food EXTREMELY fast and every time I'm pleasantly surprised.

I have never been even slightly disappointed here and will continue coming back when I'm in the area.
author: Isis A.

description:
damn. I really like the food at this place, but it really bums me out that the service was so bad. I came here with a small group of friends for a birthday dinner before going out for drinks, and we felt rushed the whole time we were there. It was pretty nice that they were able to serve us so quickly, but the waitstaff made it clear that they would like to move us out with the same expediency that they move chicken to our table. 

Chicken is great. Ceviche pescado is excellent. But dude, not a fun dining experience.
author: Aaron S.

description: A fantastic place, if you're looking for a great plate of chicken. I look forward to returning and trying the paella and empanadas, cause those looked damn good. Service at the door was disorganized, so I suggest grabbing a seat at the bar.
author: Lauren D.

description: The food was good but the service ended being terrible; the waiter knocking the table to basically tell is to leave and saying "vamonos". Really rude, I won't go back, at least not to this location.
author: Morgane M.

description: We had reservations for 14 of us and were seated as soon as all of us arrived upstairs where it was nicely air conditioned.  We ordered the $30 fixed price menu family style which consisted of the following:  Tartara de Atun (tuna tartare) which yummy chips which was delish; Ceviche Mixto which was very tasty; Ensalada Mixta (mixed green salad), good; Ensalada Rusa which was tasty.  However, getting to the meats we had a different story.  The meats were a little dry:  Lomito Saltado, top sirloin marinated with soy sauce and other ingredients which some crispy fries; Chicharron de Pollo (fried chicken which was very dry); Empanadas (veggie) which was good; Pollo a la Brasa, meaty but dry.
author: Karen W.

description: While in town for work, came here on a friend's suggestion.  I had the quarter chicken with yuca fries and veggies and the Pisco Sour to drink.  Everything was yummy however, I am not a huge fan of having to have sauce on everything and it seems that was what you needed for your chicken, fries, etc.  I guess that is what the place is about though.  definitely worth a second shot next time i am in town
author: Susan M.

description: Place was amazing! Best ceviche I've had in a while. We also ordered paella, chicken, and steak and all of it was amazing. Service was a bit slow, but our server was super nice, and the quality of food more than made up for a slight delay. I will definitely go back for another memorable meal!
author: Victoria W.

description: T H E B O M B!!!!!! truffle mac & cheese, saltado, rice, 3 sexy sauces, roasted chicken, empanadas, sangria, veggies, and pure happiness after leaving this place. I have only ate at the other location 3 times but around 20 at the valencia one! hahaha clearly i love this place & peruvian food! i even came on my birthday with alot of friends! it is so delicious & flavorful, please trust me!
author: May G.

description: Chicken is yummy!! Reviews are so right!  But I must say I was disappointed when I parked outside the next morning to run an errand on busy Valencia St, and witnessed the manager (a rubust looking youngish guy) drive up front, get out of his car, and stick a disabled sticker in the windshield so he could park all day for free while the rest of us taxpayers dutifully feed the meters.  He certainly didn't appear disabled as he hopped into the restaurant to open up and greet the staff.  Really a shame when people game the system to take advantage.  Lowers the appeal of the restaurant, in my eyes at least!  But food is really great!
author: fred w.

description:
This is definitely one of my favorite restaurants. It's great for medium or smaller sized groups. Although the small plates don't look like much, a lot of the plates are really rich and heavy. I have taken multiple people here who are not adventurous eaters and are really picky (i.e. my grandparents), but everyone I've brought here always loves it. The most recent time I was here was in a group of four. We split a pitcher of sangria, half a roasted chicken, the lomo saltado, empanadas, the macaroni and cheese, yuca fries, and rice. It came out to be $20 (without tip) each. I definitely recommend everything I just listed. The food is SO good. From flavors to texture, everything is cooked perfectly and delicious. I didn't get dessert this time, but in the past I've gotten the mango panna cotta and it was GREAT. 

Limon is has a really nice atmosphere too. The full bar (woohoo!) and art are beautiful and it makes the restaurant feel more like fine dining, but it's actually very casual and loud. I also think it is some of the best service you will ever get. The staff is extremely attentive and accommodating. It's nice to go to an authentic, nice Latin/South American Restaurant that isn't just a hole in the wall.
author: Isabella G.

description: This is our preferred Peruvian restaurant. We take friends here for the sangria and the ceviche. Small portions but they are very flavorful.
author: Yeni M.

description:
i came here because I was impressed by the menu, and I was craving Latin fare. I arranged to meet my sister and her husband--whom I hadn't seen in over a year--there. I liked the ambiance. It's a great place to meet up with friends after work or on the weekend. I had the Ensalada Rusa Classic ( a Peruvian salad of beets, baby yukon potatoes, carrots, choclo & peas tossed with Aji Amarillo aioli). It was phenomenal. The empanadas were delicious.The lengua a la parilla (marinated & grilled beef tongue, baby yukon mashed potatoes, Aji Panca sauce) was splendid. 

I'd give this place five stars, if not for one reason: the service was sub-par. What does it take for waiters and waitresses to smile? I felt rushed--as soon as we finished our meal, we were given the check. I was deep in conversation with my sister, as I hadn't seen her in a while and realized that an hour (...or two) had passed, and we were politely asked to leave. Bad restaurant etiquette. Bad.
author: Ang M.

description: We had a great time at Limon. It was a fun place with a lot of energy and people. The food was excellent and the waitress very knowledgable. They modified a dish to accommodate my food allergies. I'll definitely go again.
author: Gayle R.

description:
I love this place. When I went to San Francisco a few years ago, one of my first places to eat was this restaurant, and it has been a go-to spot whenever I come up north. The "lomito saltado" is a great dish that everyone should try at least once. It is basically a Peruvian version of steak and fries. I would also recommend the rotisserie chicken and yuca fries.

I am a big fan of Peruvian food and I can honestly say this is one of my favorite places to get it. I only wish they had a location in southern California!
author: Philip R.

description:
Came here for our second annual work dinner, and this place is awesome!  We got the prix fixe menu.

Their rotisserie chicken is soooo delicious and tenderly cooked just right.  The three sauces they give you really make the chicken as delicious as it is.

The yuca fries are fried just right, where it is lightly crispy on the outside and super soft and warm on the inside.  With those sauces to dip it, they are mouth-wateringly good.

The ceviche mixto is yummy, but I love, love the tartara de tuna, which is basically tuna seasoned with sesame oil (among others) that you eat with a root veggie chip.

The empanadas are also tasty!!

The only thing I did not like was the lomo saltado (the beef was a little tough).
author: Lily N.

description:
Okay... I don't give a sh*t if the gay waiter was rude to my partner and I... and I dont care how horrible that one drink with the egg whites were...

This place is worth coming back over and over just for the HEART!!! The chicken is tasty as well and I'd recommend having just one to fill you up... but the heart!!! Order like 10... most the drinks were nice as well...
author: Nathan D.

description: Incredible flavor in the roasted chicken. It seriously has blown my mind two times now. Amazing sweet potato and yuca fries too. Nice service and a beautiful atmosphere located in the heart of the mission.
author: Joey S.

description:
The ONLY thing I didn't like was the soggy sweet potato fries. The veggies were ok, just a bunch of green beans, 3 slices of onion, and 2 slices of tomato...I suppose the sides were eh. 

The chicken (whole) was small, to me it was, as i was able to finish it with my bf. I have to say it's the BEST chicken I had ever hands down..

The ceviche mix was really good. It's super small, but comes with fish, shrimp, and squid. The sauces was also really good, though I didn't taste the 'kick' they mentioned.

Service was a bit slow to get us water and serve us, but overall not bad, and would come back.
author: Minerva L.

description: One star only. It's a shame because the hostess was pleasant, food was decent, but the waiter was not someone you want serving your food. We paid the bill and afterwards offered advice to our server to make sure the food comes out hot. Our main entree was served room temperature. He began to make a scene, stating loudly the noumerous he checked to our table asking how our food was. Problem was, after he set the main course down he never came back. Simply put, all he had to do was apologize and make sure it didn't happen again. I assume it's the customers fault for not sending the dish back. Wrong waiter, wrong night. Still, probably never going back. Not worth the risk.
author: Joe D.

description:
I really, really do LOVE the food here. The food is delicious and every time I leave I crave more. 

The reason I'm giving this place 3 stars is because of the service. I have to say, every time I come to this place the service is poor. I feel extremely rushed with my food and almost feel like i'm being booted out.  Every few minutes servers were coming up to our table grabbing plates that still had food on it asking if they could take it away. Going to dinner should be relaxing and enjoyable. This experience was FAR from that. I understand this restaurant is busy and usually has a wait, but it's quite apparent that they are pressing for you to quickly finish your food and get out.
author: Tina J.

description: Loved the food here!!! I recommend the ceviche and the chicharron de pollo (the sauce it came with was sour and complimented the chicken perfectly), but really everything we tried was amaze! We also had pitchers of the white sangria which were alright. The atmosphere was really fun and upbeat. Service was excellent- our waiter was so nice and recommended some great dishes. Family style.
author: Jacie N.

description: Consistently delicious! Only thing we haven't liked were the chicharrons de pollo. Ceviche: good, yes. Rotisserie chicken: Oh yes. Braised short ribs: yes. Sangria, beef tongue, empanadas, paella, polli-papas....yes...ALL GOOD! Not the place to go if you want a quiet romantic date, though.
author: B. M. C.

description:
What's not to like here?
Only the fact that the music is ridiculously loud. Which makes having a conversation with friends very difficult.

We swung by without any reservations on Saturday night. And got seated in like, 20 mins. That almost never happens apparently.

The food was fabulous!!
Their signature chicken was very melt-in-your-mouth awesome. The perfect amount of basting and marinading and what not.
The fish ceviche was also very tasty. And it did not taste fishy!
The vegetables, cheese empanadas & chicken empanadas were also good. Not too oily. 
And then there's Yuca fries. THAT the place serves Yuca fries warrants one whole star!
Sangria... where there's Sangria, there's a happy me :)

Prices are also reasonable.

Now, if you would just lower the volume pls...
author: Ranjani S.

description: I went here with a friend that works in the area and goes all the time, the environment was cool with a full bar... The Rotisserie chicken was SCREAMIN! I cannot wait to take my wife!
author: Robert O.

description:
The Paella was quite delish, but low on seafood me thinks. I like the way the chicken is done--it's perfectly grilled or bbq'd. So they used to serve 3 sauces with the chicken, now it's down to 2 and you have to pay for that third one, it was some type of green sauce. It was nice, but I didn't want to pay for the extra sauce. Food is good, but I have to say it's gotten quite pricey for what you're getting--it's not like uber gourmet or anything--it's nicely grilled chicken. 

I'm gluten free so there were options for me and the waitress was helpful. I'd come back.
author: Eldar B.

description: The food was pretty good and reasonably priced.  I had a salad and empanadas that were reasonable in size and tasty.  The rotisserie chicken was moist and had a good flavor to it.  I thought the service was great, but the noise level is pretty high so if you're trying to have a conversation it is tough.
author: Tony K.

description: The food here is amazing. The pulpo (octopus) was a favorite, along with the other small hot plate with papas fritas and crispy fried chicken, can't remember the name and don't see it on the Yelp menu. Also tried the mac & cheese and an empanada which were good but nothing to write home about.
author: Bobback T.

description: A bit pricey or my taste but the food does taste amazing and is well worth. A few items on the menu seem too be over priced with the portion size given. Other than that the ceviche is bomb and the sangrias are even greater. Hostesses are always extremely friendly
author: Derek S.

description: Went with a group of 10 with a reservation. After 20 mins past our reservation time and we still had not been seated we gave up. It was packed and they were a mess.
author: Murray N.

description:
I haven't had many experiences where I feel I should review, let alone leave no stars (one star) but tonight's service at Limon in the mission certainly pushed me to do so. The waiters/busboys are so motivated on getting the next table seated that they didnt let anyone finish their meal before asking (sometimes twice) to take the dish away. We were not lingering way after the check was paid talking, though out of town friends should be able to do so if they wanted. This isn't a fast food restaurant is it? Then why treat people as if it is? The craziest part is that we noticed only 2 people waiting at a time and multiple open tables. 
The only taste left in my mind from this experience is that I'd rather spend my money and time somewhere else. What a waste.
author: Sara N.

description:
My old roommate and I had dinner here on a Thursday night. We started with a large pitcher of delicious red sangria. Robust red wine, and delicious fruit...it was pretty strong. Then we ordered three dishes to share. Our ceviche mixto contained fresh fish, squid & shrimp marinated in tigre de leche. The chicken was roasted perfectly where the inside is still juicy and tender. It was served with two sides of our choice. I picked tacu tacu, which is simply beans & rice, and sauteed vegetables. Lastly, we had empanadas of mixed vegetables encased in a buttery pastry. We thought three dishes would be perfect, but it was more food than we can handle.

The service was friendly, and the food was great!
author: Leslie P.

description: Hostess was rude and slow. Good thing the men that worked there of all roles were all proactive and attentive and got the job done. It's a casual place. Dessert was quite expensive for the quality.
author: Gloria T.

description: I only like this location. Service is always nice and friendly. Drinks are always on point and delicious and the food has never been bad. The chicken is drool worthy and the sauces are the best part. The chimichurri...well we fight over it. The chicharonnes are some of the crispiest I've had in the city, so thank you. the ceviche is pretty good as well. It is worth the wait and always a good time. we've been here several times, consistenly happy and satiated.
author: Zara S.

description:
Dinner 8/25/12

Came here with guests from out of town for a more diverse dining experience. Reservation for 7:30 but we didn't get seated until 7:50. That we were seated at the far corner booth made up for the delay.

Food is always delicious here. The pollo a la brasa is available in full, half, and quarter portion. We opted for the white meat quarter option so we could try other dishes. Lomito saltado is just as savory. The medium rare strips of sirloin was cooked in a soy sauce with tomato and served over fries. My dining companions loved the truffle mac & cheese. 

Service was whole different story. The server piled all the food on our table almost as soon as he took our order---before our drinks arrived. And halfway through our meal, while we were chatting and sipping our wine, another server (Limon doesn't follow the traditional way of waiting table with one server) asked if we were done. Hello?

This is why I'm thoroughly divided with Limon. I absolutely like their food but they really need to have a reality check with their service. I felt rushed during the whole meal. I understand they were very busy with at the same time it's not a fast-food chain. The music is crazy loud that any attempt of a conversation at normal level was thwarted. My friends were gratefully polite and understanding. At least they enjoyed the food.

So I'm not sure about recommending this restaurant. Fresca serves just as delicious food but my experience is more superior there.
author: Matt Y.

description:
The ambience was nice a bit loud 
Great location and the food was good but a bit pricey and the drinks are expensive. The service was ok a bit pushy although it's a fast pace restaurant
author: Irving S.

description: This WAS my favorite Peruvian restaurant and one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco. I come to the Bay Area every couple months and limon is always a must . Very disappointed horrible service with horrible very poor quality food. Hope they go back to better quality and service and might give it a chance till then . Never again !!!!! Don't come here
author: Gabriela G.

description: Love Limon!!! It's always delicious and the service is always good! Excellent sangria and food options. The only downfall is that it is pretty busy all the time and the tables are so close together it can be a little awkward to eat. Other than that it's amazing!! Definitely would recommend to anyone and everyone!!
author: Sam V.

description:
I really enjoyed Limon. Ignoring the 40 minute wait which was ultimately 65 minutes, the food was delicious and had a great ambiance. Great place to take a date or have a celebration & the servers were really helpful, especially regarding the dessert. 

Totally look forward to visiting this restaurant again & would highly recommend it.
author: Juan T. K.

description:
Edit: I forgot about one important detail that knocks this place down to 2 stars.
We saw an inch-long cockroach crawling on the booth seat looking for yummies. Any visible bugs in a restaurant in this part of world is simply not ok to me.

:start rant: 
We had a huge party and they refused to sit us until we're all there..well, ok, until we were down to waiting for 1 or 2 people (out of a group of more than 10!) and I got a little bit impatient. Seriously, if you take reservations you can start seating people earlier.
:end rant:

Otherwise, this is a solid Peruvian place. We all got the $30 prix fixe menu due to the huge party size, but it was really nice for me since I got to try a variety of foods. We started with the ceviche, tuna tartare, salad and potatoes. Everything was really good -- the ceviche was tart, tuna tartare was fresh, the salad was really well dressed, and the potatoes creamy.

Then we got chicharron, saltado and empanadas. The chicharron is always a guilty pleasure, but the saltado was delicious as well!

Of course, how can we go without the famous rotisserie chicken. The chicken itself was so flavourful it really didn't need any of the sauces (too overpowering, I guess), and if I didn't eat so much of the previous dishes I would have had more pieces of the juicy, tender chicken.

With all these wonderful food options available, the cocktail list was certainly disappointing. The pisco sours were ok but there wasn't much depth to them, and the pisco cocktails were sickening sweet. Sweet than cosmo sort of sweet. Sangria was decent I guess...but I was hoping for better pisco cocktails. It's Peru's national drink dammit! =p

Overall it was a decent dinner. The prix fixe menu was definitely a winner, especially if you want to try a variety of things.
author: Alice C.

description: The food is amazing. The chicken is amazing and you will not regret coming here. The only thing that sucks is the cramped nature of the seating and the wait times.
author: Bimbo B.

description: Wow, haven't been here for a couple years and came here after everything else in the neighborhood was an hour wait and they could seat us immediately.  That was one plus.  Ordered the beet salad - boring! It tasted like it came straight out of a can - seriously.  I'm hypertensive and watch my salt but this was even tasteless for me.  Empanadas were tiny and mostly some breaded mystery filling.  Tried to fill up on the macaroni and cheese - is that Peruvian?  Sangria was good but I already had a serious drink at the Elixir, so who cares.  Not coming back here anytime soon unless I have to wait somewhere else for an hour.
author: Joseph S.

description:
Fantastic for groups. I went with a reservation once and a six-person walk-in another time. Both times the group was treated kindly and the hostess seated us asap. That being said, definitely try to make reservations if you're a group of 3 or more. This place gets crowded on the weekends.

Service was great both times--food comes out really quickly b/c they're trying to turn tables fast. The servers will be very friendly and won't try to rush you, though.

As for the food, it's fantastic. I've had the mac n cheese, ceviche, yuca and sweet potato fries, the chicharonnes (spelling?) and a couple of other dishes that were de-freakin-licious. Chicken is out of this world moist and flavorful--not hot if you have a heat-averse crew. My only beef was that the sangria was a bit too sweet for my liking.

For ordering, grab a whole chicken and one side per person. After your meal, explore the Valencia street area--there are a ton of neat bars (Casanova, Elbo room) and interesting places to pop in.
author: Claire S.

description:
This message is directed to the manager of Limon Rotisserie: 

Your food and service is wonderful. However, one policy MUST change. After spending more than $300 on dining, as soon as the credit card slip was signed, we (party of 6) were asked to leave as the staff needed our table. Our group wasn't lounging; heck, the ink wasn't even dry on the credit card receipt. We were waiting for a member of our party who was using the restroom. A bad policy is bad for business.
author: John Q. P.

description:
Memo to my nephew who just graduated from Law school.  You win.  Now that you're an adult, I have to let you in on a secret.

I always let you win.

Yes, I missed that shot on the basketball court on purpose.  Yes, I did let you score that goal fashioned by traffic cones in the driveway.  And sadly yes, I did stumble on purpose when you and I were side by side near the finish line.  Our dinner at Limon will be the last "I let you win on purpose event". 

After finding out that Limon was your favorite place, I'll let you win and will give it one extra star.  I'll ignore my contorted body position caused by the tables being way too close together - my back was actually up against the diners behind me.  I'll ignore the veggies that were a bit overcooked and flavorless.  I'll ignore the salty fries that made my blood pressure temporarily rise.

But...I'll remember the chicharon chicken.   I'll remember the signature roasted chicken with the trio of sauces on the side.  And I'll remember the sangria that quenched my thirst.

Just remember...this is the last time I give you one.  Remember that...and congratulations.
author: Ron L.

description:
I came here with a group of friends for my birthday dinner on a Saturday night. I called to push my 6:30 reservation back by 15 minutes and we were seated as soon as we walked in. Not having to wait is always a plus.

We ordered a pitcher of sangria which is super yummy and split a whole chicken between four girls (and had leftovers!). Get the sweet potato fries as a side. I'm not the hugest fan of seafood but the ceviche is good as well. It was pretty busy but our waiter was really nice and attentive.
author: Jessica R.

description: Like everything good in SF, this place is almost always packed. If you can get a table on a Saturday night, the food is fantastic and perfect for sharing. Call ahead and make a reservation!
author: Farah E.

description:
This place is consistently good. It's not overly pretentious or trendy, which many SF restaurants easily fall victim to. They have been around for awhile, so you can count on it. They aren't trying to sell you overpriced grilled cheese or toast that you can make at home. You can eat well and not cry over your bank account later. It's pretty easy to get into and the wait staff is solid. 

If you're looking for a meal that will blow your mind and inspire you to start your own food blog, it probably won't be Limon, but that doesn't mean this place isn't worthy of 4 stars. It's all relative. 

The chicken is an entire freaking chicken, it's well seasoned and not overly dry. I love the beet salad. Their ceviches are tasty. Their sauces are addictive.
author: Tori M.

description:
Agh, I love this place. Love. This. Place.
I had this for dinner last night and craved it for breakfast this morning. Yes, literally I was willing to eat a half rotisserie chicken for breakfast this morning because it was so dang good! Props to Limón for the mad flavor action going on for all their dishes. How much I liked this place definitely surprised me!

I had the:
(+) 1/2 rotisserie chicken.
TO DIE FOR OMG. Who would have thought a simple rotisserie chicken could be made so well? So flavorful, so delicious. Served with 3 'aji' sauces that I am now realizing you can choose - when I visited the waiter did not present this option, so I think the standard trio aji was brought out to us. pretty good sauces none the less- the 2 cream sauces that come in the trio just reminded me of flavored ranch. the highlight was the chimichurri. I would definitely recommend choosing your own options instead. 
(+) tacu-tacu.
ordered this as a side to the 1/2 chicken. SO AMAZINGLY good. They describe tacu-tacu on the menu as sautéed rice and beans, but it is so much more than that. Don't think rice and beans like rice and beans you get as a side with your burrito. Think of it as a rice, with the beans smothered into it so the consistency is almost like that of a sticky rice. So. much. flavor.
(/) yuca fries.
solid side option, but nothing too fantastical here. just some well-fried yuca for the eatin'.
(/) lychee pisco.
solid cocktail, but again, nothing special. I did come on new years eve though, so the bartender took the time out to write happy 2015 on the drink. 
(-) "Lomito" Saltado.
"A traditional Peruvian dish of stir-fried sirloin strips, onions, tomato, soy sauce, & french fries" I had *such* high hopes for this dish because 1. I love fries. love. and 2. it was on the highlights list for Limón. Alas, the fries/ sauce were a bit on the salty side for my liking and the sirloin strips were so tough they were hard to eat.

Highlights:
(++) the service.
the waiters and waiteresses here are attentive beyond belief without being overbearing. They serve water in a pitcher here, but the waiters walk around all the time and refill your glasses for you. You are constantly checked on (sometimes the waiters just walk by an look to make sure everything looks alright on the table) and dishes are cleared quickly. Sauces go on everything, including the table, and the waiters are quick to wipe things up if it gets messy.

Super props to the waiter who seems to be the manager or something who was attentive working at the door, at the table, and even tried to help out with the ladies room bathroom line situation. You can see him running around like crazing tending the tables, so I am super impressed that he has time to stop and do some quick chatting with his customers and is able to make everyone feel like he is really there for them! Never really had service so "ravable" over in SF, so this is definitely a HUGE plus for me!

Other notes:
I have had some friends tell me of different experiences here though, so a word of caution. I will update with news from my second dining experience here when it happens, which I am sure will be soon!
author: Patricia K.

description:
The food was delicious! I had the chicken with a salad and yucca fries. Very delicious. It's pricy, but when I did the math it's actually less pricy than the equally delicious food truck down the street. The sangria was a little too sweet for my taste, but my friend loved it. My only regret is not getting a bunch of little plates to share. The menu is made for that and I hear the ceviche is pretty good. 

Service was definitely a con. Really slow and not very friendly. The guys next to us got greeted before us even though we were there first. I couldn't get anyone's attention for a long time (at least 15 minutes). It wasn't even busy yet. Took a long time to get our check. Thankfully the busser came by again and he made sure our server eventually brought our check (took two tries). I wouldn't come back on my own but if if I did, 6PM on a weekday is a good time. Any later, and it'll be harder to get a table.
author: Carolina P.

description:
Food are pretty good in general. Cocktails are good but a bit strong even we asked for a lighter version. 

Ceviche Mixto - Gosh! It's awesome!
Lomito saltado - The dish was a bit weird for me. Just OK
Rotisserie Chicken - The piece I got was very dry. To be honest, I think Costco has better rotisserie chicken. 
Beet salad - Good
Chichirron de pollo - Good
Mushroom spinach empanadas - My friends love it. 
Paella - very salty
Fries - They have pretty good fries.
Chocolate Bandido - Just OK
Profieroles - Very good. Not super sweet.
author: J L.

description:
We really enjoyed our meals here when we started coming in 2014. Our last meal here (last week) was kind of terrible!
We sat at the bar and the bartender's service was very good, but our dinner was a disaster. The sides we had ordered to go with our entree came first, and about 30mins later our appetizers arrived with the main meal. The people sitting next to us on either side seemed to receive their dinner in the proper order so it could have just been our bad luck.
But when our entree came (after a really long wait) the yucca fries were still frozen solid?! We couldn't even bite into them.
To Limon's credit, the rest of the food did taste very good.
What really helped end the dinner on a bad note was the dessert we had: the Chocolate Bandido. When we used to come here, it was like a molten chocolate lava cake with an amazing crunchy cookie thing and ice cream. What it is now is a flavorless microwaved dry chocolate muffin kind of thing - worse than your store bought Two-Bite-Brownie (no exaggeration). It's also much smaller than before, and the transparent light-brown color belies its lack of quality chocolate content. For $10, it's simply a rip-off and you'd be better to get dessert somewhere else after your dinner.
So, overall the food is still good here, but we were pretty disappointed this time.
author: Dire S.

description:
IT'S SO LOUD IN HERE!

you can't partake in any conversation unless it's to the person sitting right next to you.  forget about group dinners, go to the one on s van ness instead.

but the food and service are still great!  and you have access to pre and post dinner drinks nearby.
author: Josie M.

description: Lomo Saltado, Chicharron de pollo, and Ensalada Rusa were amazing!! Flavors on point! Had a party of 6 and would recommend making reservations as they are always busy. Friends got Carne a la Parrilla that was perfectly done as well. Great place for food and had no problems with service.
author: Jan K.

description:
I finally made it here after 5 years in the city. And... I wasn't impressed.
The service was really really slow, the acoustics were terrible- it was so hard to hear anyone and talk over the noise, and the portions were tiny for the price.  

I came with 4 friends Wednesday night at 830pm in reservations.  The place was quite packed and we got seated quickly.  We shared the chicken, yuca fries, salad, lomo saltado, ceviche pescado, and the beef empanadas.  Yes the chicken and ceviche were delicious, but the empanadas were really dry and totally not worth what they are charging.  The portions were smaller than I expected for the price and the food just wasn't outstanding.  I've been to Peru and had some amazing food there.

Lastly, the service was sooo slow...

So after writing this review, Limon commented publicly. I really appreciated that - it was very nice of them.

But, I also got this oh so strange message from a user that is pretty obviously related to the restaurant, saying: 
"Why Asian always complain about sizes! You're always look for cheap food! Sad!!"

Dear whoever wrote that, Yelp should be about candid reviews. I am not hear to boost your ratings and make you look good. I paid for my dinner and experience, and what I wrote was how I felt. If you want better reviews, improve your service and stop harassing Yelpers.
author: Skye W.

description:
Had a delicious dinner tonight here with my gal pal! The Pisco sour was delicious. Sangria tasted great but wasn't mind blowing (standard sangria).

Our waiters were all so wonderful, great service all around. Thank you, gentlemen!

Great dishes: our waiter actually recommended the cheapest ceviche as his favorite - we went with it and it was fantastic... I am sure they are all great!

We also ordered the chicken, it was excellent, and the lomito saltado - delish! 

Would come back!!
author: Lillian S.

description:
If Limon Rotisserie is Pablo Sandoval Approved that should say something! I actually had no idea that he was a fan of Limon but coincidentally it has been on my list and our first choice closed right as we got there.  

We decided to order Pollo a la Brasa (whole) $20. For our sides, we chose the Arroz and Vegetables Salteados plus an additional side of Yuca Fries. 

The chicken was moist and had a rich blend of spices and herbs. With each bite, I tasted something different which was fun but also a little perplexing on my palate. Combined with the trio of sauces and my poor taste buds could barely figure out what I was tasting! Thankfully, I enjoyed what I was tasting!

As for our sides. the Yuca fries had a great crisp exterior while retaining a light airy interior. I thought the rice and vegetables were cooked well and complimented the chicken well.

Overall Thoughts

The only thing I know for sure is the food is good, a little pricey for a roast chicken but it's definitely not your standard  run of the mill roast chicken.
author: Eddie W.

description: Brought a large group (35+ people) for dinner and couldn't have been happier with the service or the food. The private space upstairs is a wonderful spot to entertain.
author: Christie M.

description:
Once I was taken here, I knew I'd be coming back for more.
I usually get half of a chicken or depending on how hungry the other person is, we may do a whole chicken but despite the size, it's always so moist and perfect on seasoning.
I always get the sangria or a glass of Riesling. Both are delicious and subtlety sweet.
As sides I like to get yuca fries, vegetales saltados, and the truffle oil Mac and cheese that is to die for. As your Mac and cheese girl.. I give this place the Mac and cheese a thumbs up on the grounds that I would likely lick the pot and spoon it's made with. 
The atmosphere is nice and social on busy nights. Actually, I don't think I've gone when they aren't busy. 
A place I'd definitely recommend to anyone.
author: Eff B.

description:
Ambiance: Dimly lit, loud, and social. If you have a larger (4+) group, I would recommend to make a reservation to avoiding the long wait time. We got a seat at the bar so that we did not have to wait 35-45 minutes for a table. 

We ordered the whole chicken with yuca fries and vegetables salteados for two. The chicken was delicious and juicy and definitely more than enough for the two of us! I really enjoyed the yuca fries, which were crunchy on the outside and gooey on the inside. Also, the yuca fries are much thicker than the typical thin and stringly french fries. The vegetables salteados are salted and grilled mixed vegetables. It was nice to have a veggie component in our meat and carb heavy meal, but I would opt for another side next time.
author: Angel G.

description: The food at Limon is so good, I always bring friends from out of town here.  The food is that good, everyone I've introduced to Limon finds themselves coming back. I regularly come here to stuff my face and it's always silence at the table due to everyone devouring the food like animals.  The rotisserie chicken, truffle mac and cheese, and ceviche mixto are a must!  Don't forget to drown your chicken in the huacatay trio sauce.  Life changing experience!  The restaurant is super loud during busy times so when you're not chewing, be prepared to scream across the table during conversations.
author: Ciplada R.

description:
The Good:

The food was solid. The ceviche mixto was delicious, beef tongue was tender, the empanadas just "ok", and the short ribs tender and saucy. The pisco sour was potent to say the least, bright in flavor and went down easy.

The Bad:

We were seated in a very very small corner. My friend who is 6'5 and I weren't gonna fit, so we stared at the little corner table, and then the hostess, then back at the table and laughed. We were promptly reseated, only to wait another 10-12 minutes for a drink order to be taken. 

The Ugly: 

I had to ask someone working there to wash his hands after changing in the bathroom stall. Fine, he may not have touched anything otherwise, or our food, but each dish, when received, made me remember him rushing out of the bathroom to start his shift. Bah, no thanks, no side of hep-A with dinner, but thanks

Management: I recommend a tune up in this department. Also, after having mentioned this our server appreciated the gentle reminder, but a comped drink would have been a nicer way to show me you care.
author: Vittorio L.

description:
Limon makes an art form out of mediocrecy. The quality of food is mediocre. The sangria mediocre, at best. The quality of beef in the Lomita saltado was grossly disappointing.  The sauce overly soy-ed. The chicken was kind of gross and cold, and the chimichuri was...  mediocre as well. The tacu-tacu was redish and mushy, and way too salty, a far strech from the flavorful nd textured tacu-tacu im familiar with. 

And the service was neglectful beyond belief, most likely because they already planned to add a 20% gratuity without telling us. 

How this place survives and has grown only enlightens me to the uncultured palate of the fratty techies moving in. Peruvians should not be caught dead in here. The ceviches here are an insult to to Peruvian cuisine. Nothing tasted fresh. And they use snapper....snapper?  A chewy fish is not to intelligent choice for ceviche.

Honestly The wine we got was the only enjoyable part of our meal. For that I reserve an extra star. Their wine list is decent .
author: Caitlin S.

description: Always consistent in flavor! Everytime I come here i'm never disappointed! Limón has tasty cocktails. I like there ceviches, empanadas, jalea, lomo saltado  just to name some.
author: Marson G.

description: Fun and lively Valencia neighborhood restaurant. The Rotisserie Chicken was very tasty, hot and delivered fast.  Prices are very reasonable here as compared to typical SF restaurants.  Bar was a little overwhelmed but still got the job done.
author: Paul S.

description:
This place was really good. The service was on point, the food was SO good and the Sangria kept flowing. There was plenty of seating and my party and I did not have to wait to be seated. 

Favorites were the grilled octopus and the rotisserie chicken.
author: Madison O.

description:
This place sucks, waited for over an hour for take out, and I called it in before hand.  Can't imagine eating there in person and waiting over an hour for your food.  

I guess the worst part is the "well there's nothing we can do" response.  I mean really WTF, I know they didn't have to slaughter and defeather the chicken back in the kitchen, and the I am sure they didn't have to churn the cheese for empanadas.
author: Alan P.

description: Since we got here the waiter was rushing us out. He said we had to be out in an hour. I came here with 8 people and he did not want to give me a separate check despite of asking him upon arrival.  The food was very good.
author: Carol R.

description:
I associate small plates with diet food. My skinny girl dinner consisted of vodka sodas (low in calories) and conservative nibbles of Ceviche Mixto, which was lemony and spicy - just the way I like it. Then I savored tiny bites of my favorite Peruvian dish, Lomito Saltado, a stir-fry of beef sirloin, onions, tomatoes and french fries. Unfortunately, that was where the dainty eating ended. I ruined my night by continuing on to devour Jalea (a smorgasbord of deep-fried seafood and starch), pollo empanadas (not worth the calories), and an amazing mango panna cotta.

FAIL.
author: Suany W.

description: My friend and I went to Limon this evening as we had heard the Rotisserie Chicken was one of their signature dishes. We were seated quickly and at a table that we requested. The waitstaff were pleasant. The noise level was so intense that we literally could not carry on a conversation. We ordered the chicken with a side of yuca fritas and mixed rice and beans plus a salad; all of which we shared. The food came quickly. The chicken was disappointing as it was dry and not well seasoned. It came with a tasty 'amarillo' sauce that was good for both the chicken and the yuca fritas. The rice and beans were meh. The salad was fresh and the dressing ok but nothing special. The  best dish was the dessert which was Panna Cotta de Mango. Beautifully presented and very light and tasty. Ive been to their restaurant on South Van Ness and felt that the chicken was much tastier. I probably will not return.
author: Roseann G.

description:
Came here in a group of 3 around 7pm on a Saturday and we didn't have to wait to get seats at the bar, yay! They said it would have been around an hour wait to get a table.. I guess we got lucky.

The food here is family style. We ended up ordering some Pollo a la Brasa with yuca fries and arroz, the Ceviche Mixto, and the "Lomito" Saltado.

The ceviche came out first. It came with some giant corn, which was delicious. It was super lemon-y tasting but... it also had chopped up cilantro in it. :( I think I liked the shrimp the best out of the three different types of seafood. Corn was the highlight for me though.

Our chicken and sides came next. I was kind of disappointed because the arroz was just plain white rice. I was expecting The chicken skin was lemony and had lots of flavor.. it was kind of salty though. However, the actual meat wasn't as flavorful. Good thing we had the sauces to dip them in (Chimichurri was a bit too oily but I liked the other two sauces). Or if you eat a little bit of the skin with the chicken it has about the right flavor/salt level. 

The "Lomito" Saltado says that it comes with fries but the fries are actually soaked in the sauce. The meat was good but the sauce was a bit on the salty side as well. This also had cilantro in it :(

Servers were really nice and the dishes looked small but were quite filling. I would give it 3.5 stars if I could but rounding down because it was on the salty side.
author: Sophie Y.

description:
We came here for a birthday celebration.  The restaurant was completely packed and oh so noisy.  Consequently, people could hardly hear one another.  I found the food to be good, but not anything really special.  If roasted chicken is your thing, then you will love the tender meat.  Our orders did come quickly and the servers were helpful.

I must say, the drinks where great.  No skimping on the Grey goose vodka in my martini!

Buen provecho!
author: Rose J.

description:
I've come to this place in 3 different occassions (not by choice) and was not impressed by it. I've had the opportunity to taste about 90% of their menu and have been dissappointed by most of it; hence the 2-star rating. Not sure how people dare to give more than 3 stars to this place when the food and the service are sub-par. 

Yes, the yuca frites and papa fritas are good, but how hard is it to deep fry yuca or potatoes??? The Pollo a la brasa is good, not great, just good. All other dishes lack the seasoning and flavor that is characteristic of Peruvian cuisine. The drinks are ok, but nothing that deserves more than 3-stars at best.

Also, $9 for an empanada? really? If I'm paying that much for an empanada, I'd expect it to be filled up with good meat and a rich-in-flavor sauce and some other ingredients. But no, for $9 you get dry ground meat with no flavor... and let's be honest, who charges $9 for an empanada? empanadas in latin america are supposed to be cheap-street food. Anyone paying $9 for a "gourmet" empanada expects a tasty, delightful piece of pastry full of flavor, not a dull piece of dough with dry ground beef... not worth it at all!
author: R S.

description: Really good food and reasonable prices (which many others have described, so I won't bore you with repetition), but on a recent visit with a friend from out of town, the service was really scattered, slow and disorganized. And when we attempted to order coffee with our dessert, they'd run out! It wasn't the very end of the night either, this was at barely 8 o'clock. Still love the food, but they need to get their act a little more together.
author: Bruce M.

description:
Limon captures the whole essence of Peru, their authentic food is memorizing.
Ambiance- great blend chic, sophisticated and avant garde ready to service
Customer service-Pleasant
Drinks-Full bar
3 Locations- Valencia st, South Van ness, and on Third st, SF
Favorites: appetizers Ceviche Limon & Cocktail de Leche de Tigre
Tapas: Tartara de Tuna, Chicharron de Pollo, Pescado Limon, Chicharron de Pollo
Main Entree's: Carne a la Parrilla & Lomo Saltado
Sides: Yuca Fries / Truffle mac -n- cheese
Drinks: SANGRIA freshly made
Dessert: Profiteroles

I won't spoil you by telling you how delicious and creative their dishes are, so you'll have to find out yourself.
author: Kathy V.

description: Best restaurant in the 16th and Valencia area. The food is fairly priced and its exceptional. I highly recommend the chicken, try out a few sauces. This is the bar for Peruvian food for me.
author: Clovis M.

description: Delicious place to eat, a bit busy and noisy. Our waiter suggested a half chicken was enough for three people, but it's not. The sides could use a little more work. You can get fries, yuca fries, rice & beans or salad. All of which are pretty tasteless and can use some revamping. Same with the truffle mac & cheese. The aji that comes with the chicken is amazing! The chicken is also super rich, moist and flavorful. All in all, I would come back here again for that chicken, the ambiance, but the wait staff could use a little more finesse and the sides could be worked on.
author: Sia P.

description:
Food is great -- can't speak badly about the food. The service on the other hand is awful, particularly if you order pickup/takeout. I've ordered pickup ~4 times and every single time I'm told the wait will be 25-30 mins and when I head in 50 mins later, I'm told the wait will be about 15 more mins. I then see the chef swap tickets since mine had been sitting at the back the whole time. This has happened many times. I'm offered drinks while I wait when really all I want is the damn food. It's unfortunate since the food is pretty tasty. They need to realize that folks picking up food are just as important as customers that eat in the restaurant. I haven't written a review for them yet because I was hoping to see an improvement, but unfortunately that has not been the case. 

Thus, this negative review is for the service.
author: Jessica A.

description: Excellent flavors! We ordered the half chicken, empanadas, yuca fries & tacu tacu. Aside from the delicious chicken, the empanadas were second favorite! Verrrry tasty. We ordered the chicken flavored ones first & had to get a second order of the cheese ones.
author: Sara C.

description:
I want to disagree with the "vegetarians go nuts for this spot" tag on yelp. I came here with a veggie friend and although the dishes we had were good, there were like 4 options to choose from. I wish there were more interesting choices. I definitely will be back to try the meat options - the chicken looked so good on the rotisserie! 

The tables are super close together and the restaurant is loud. The Le Patron cocktail is delicious with bits of kumquat!
author: Annie C.

description:
This is one of those clean, spacious yuppie restaurant/bars that are incongruously taking over the Mission District.  I must emphasize that there was absolutely nothing wrong with my meal or with the service, but I had to wonder, "Why am I eating here, when I could get better food for less money at the crowded taqueria around the corner?"

Limon's specialty is rotisserie chicken.  This is well-cooked, about 85% of the way to perfectly tender, fairly small and consequently intricately bony (and thus only partially edible with knife and fork), only a little seasoning on the skin.  It comes with small but adequately-sized cups of sauces with a spoon that you can ladle over the chicken.  These sauces took some getting used to.  I liked the oil sauce with cilantro better than either of the creamy ones, which were a bit strange by my tastes.

Two side dishes, your choice from a list, come with.  These were fairly generously-sized.  I was slightly surprised that what was listed as arroz was plain white rice with no seasoning, but it was delicious plain white rice.
author: David B.

description:
Warning:  If planning to go to Limon during peak evening hours (& double warning if it's a lovely evening in the Mission), prepare yourself as if going to a Grateful Dead concert (especially during the days of the late, great, Jerry Garcia), cuz it's hella LOUD!!!  And if you don't know who the Grateful Dead are, ask your parents.  :)  I say this, because Limon is clearly frequented by the new hipster generation, as most of the food establishments now are in the Mission.

I visited Limon years ago when it first opened on So. Vanness & then on Valencia St. with my husband (btw, we are in the "50 is the new 40" age group!), & back then, we experienced an intimate dining experience.  We returned this past Saturday night (yes, it had been awhile!), & by the time we left the restaurant, we were deaf & hoarse from yelling in order to hear each other above the racket (just like after a rock concert!)!

So, why am I giving Limon 4 stars?  Despite the chaos, we were seated promptly (we did have reservations, but sometimes that doesn't matter), & the service was very pleasant & attentive.  Most importantly, however, the food was delicious!!  We ordered a few items, but the one that stood out was the Arroz con Mariscos (it's like a paella).  It was PERFECT!!  Being Latina, I've tasted my fair share of seafood rice plates & I know what a challenge it is not to over cook them to the point of sogginess--to maintain that crisp, crunchy, texture, without serving it raw.  I can honestly say, I've only tasted Arroz con Mariscos done right a couple of times--this past Saturday night at Limon being my second time.  Congratulations, Limon!
author: Elizabeth C.

description: Yum! Love Limon! Such great food. I have liked everything I have tried. The Yuca fries are so good! Love the empanadas as well and definitely must get the truffle mac n cheese! Go here with a group and try everything. Make sure to get a Pisco Sour! The Maracuya Sour is also bomb!
author: Natalia H.

description: Fast, delicious, great price, fun... came for food and stayed for sangria and drinks. The barista (I forgot his name because he gave us so many drinks haha) was so great!! The maracuya sours were O.M.G. so so so yummy. The food was great too, but definitely 5 stars for the drinks. I think the food is 4 stars. Try the yucca fries though.
author: Marisol S.

description: Host was so rude. Reservation was @6:00 pm. I arrived @ 5:38. Doesn't  by want me to be seated until the party are all there. I asked where can I wait. No chairs outside. Restaurant is not busy empty tables and chairs. I was advised to sit on the bar with a high chair. I'm old and can't reach the high chair. Sit my self and ordered a drink. Still I was told I can't wait. I told her they're parking. Left the place annoyed and frustrated.
author: Peepeye L.

description: I recommend this location as opposed to the one on south vanness. The people here are friendly, i recommend the carne empanadas with extra yellow sauce mmmmm and the veggie empanadas. The lomo saltado and the dessert is AMAZING! Highly recommend!
author: Noe O.

description:
I've been wanting to check this place out for a while now and I finally got around to coming here for dinner last night. My date took the reins on ordering and pointed out all the signature dishes but most of them revolved around meat. I'll eat meat only if its something I've never had before so beef heart it was. 

Ceviche Limon - This was the last to come and we were completely stuffed already. This dish is fucking huge. We probably only got through half of it but it was all very tasty. It comes with a shot glass of what I assume is the marinade and you pour it all over the seafood. 

Ceviche Trio - The waiter just chose the ones for the trio for us since he said the first three on the menu were basically the same or something. The ahi tuna one was the best out of the three. I think it was the Ceviche de Pescado. Omnomnomnom. The sweet potato in all the dishes was really good too but I also just really fucking love me some sweet potato. 

Anticuchos de Res - Beef heart! It was extremely tough and chewy. I'm not sure if it was worth breaking my fairly strict pescetarian diet but my date was surely satisfied he got me to eat meat (that sounded way dirtier than intended). 

Veggie Empanadas - My date said it was the best thing he ate out of everything served. The sauce was amazing but I thought there was too much dough and not enough filling. 

Cocktails - I already forgot what we got but I hate their limited variety. The Pisco Sour was terrible but thats purely just because I hate tequila and it tasted a lot like tequila. I think the waiter got our drinks confused and gave my date my drink order but it was fine since I tasted it and it was terrible anyways and the one he gave me was pretty good.

My date showed up late and then all of a sudden wanted to leave to go drinking somewhere else so we didn't get to see the dessert menu or anything pssssh dick. The service here is really slow and wasn't the best but the host is fantastic. I love the ambiance. Nothing like dim lighting and good food! We ordered way too much food and we were both hungry to begin with so don't let those seemingly small portions fool you!
author: Tiffany V.

description: First time here last night, ordered what our server Eric suggested - the service , textures and  flavors were outstanding - Julio kept our table clean & clear making room for more plates and kept our sangria/wine glasses full ! We were seated right away ( with reservations) The prices were reasonable $100 for 4 people family style + $15 cork fee , all we shared at least 6 menu items. Minus a star only because it's very loud and a little cramped and parking is always tricky ... but once u start eating you are in your own little world.
author: Wendy F.

description: Amazing Peruvian food.  Great atmosphere.  Like a gastropub environment and feeling.  The food is small plates so def sample and share with everyone.  We had a mixture of like 8 things and let me tell you....all were quite amazing.  The Peruvian beer Cristal is very light & refreshing!  Awesome...awesome.
author: Kim H.

description: The Arroz con Mariscos was really good and I recommend it and also the Lomo Saltado. The service in general is not the best and they pretty much ignore the customers. The ceviche was okay I guess.
author: Stephanie C.

description: I had the truffle mac and cheese because I thought it sounded like a fun spin on traditional mac and cheese but I have made better mac and cheese at home at times. I'll probably be back to try some other dishes out.
author: Aniyah C.

description: First off the food was delicious. If I could rate this place on food alone it would get five stars. The chicken, was nicely cooked, tender and flavorful. The yuca fries were alright, I'm sure they're probably cooked right, but it wasn't my thing. The rice mashed with beans was interesting, it had a nice subtle taste to go with the stronger flavor of the chicken. My friend ordered the skirt beef with sautéed mushroom/onions and mashed potatoes. Beef was cooked exactly medium rare as we wanted and the whole dish was packed with flavor. The portions were smaller compared to the price but that's how it is with an upscale restaurant like this. If I could take the food to go then I wouldn't have had to deal with the service. I get that it was packed at 9pm on a Saturday and we were a couple compare to the bigger tables, but most of the 1.5 hr we were there we only saw our waiter three times: at beginning for water/ordering, an early water refill at start then at end after we had to flag him down for the check. He was absent for so much of the time I forgot what he looked like. I might have even flagged down the wrong person for the check at the end. This isn't an economical place where you can expect to be ignored, but rather a lot of the money for the price is the cost of good service. I feel ripped even paying 15% tip but I never go below. Saturday upstairs, 2030-2200. I recommend the food for sure.
author: Sithu K.

description:
Had chicken and cerviche mixto, with tacu tacu and yuca fries for sides. pisco sour and maracuya sour for drinks. everything except for the tacu tacu was excellent. tacu tacu was mediocre. sauces that came with chicken were also great! 

service was attentive, until it got a little packed later on when it was harder to catch the servers attention. ambience was a little loud but wasn't overwhelming for me. 

overall, i highly recommend a visit. just make sure you come early or make reservations, it gets packed.
author: Anthony C.

description:
I've been here a few times, once for dinner and had the pargo rojo (the fried snapper) and it was very good. Presentation was wonderful with the bone fried into a basket. 

But I'm going to talk about the more recent visit to Limon with my friend for brunch... since I actually remember that one haha. 

I had the Pescado Limon- Snapper fillet, over crispy potatoes and spinach. The fish was nicely seasoned and moist. The crispy potatoes and spinach add great flavor and texture, it all pulls together really well. The sauce was a little too lemony but it was still very yummy.

My friend had the lomo saltado, For brunch they serve it with an egg on top, a little different from the dinner version. He seemed to enjoy it. The meat was very tender. A tad salty alone but with rice and the egg it was great.
author: Beanne N.

description: Many thanks to the host who did his best to move up our reservations for 6 on a very busy Sunday. The food was excellent, the service efficient, the portions ample and the prices reasonable for the area. I enjoyed my Pisco Sour, empanadas and Salad Rusa. The others raved about the paella and the short ribs. My only complaint was how loud the music was. With the din of the dining room, it was often difficult to converse. But we all enjoyed our meal and I will definitely return.
author: Suzanne M.

description:
If it weren't for the great food, Limon would've been a 2-3 star rating for me. I'm not quite sure what happened, as the hostess and manager weren't really communicative, but we didn't get seated for our 5:30 reservation until close to 6 (despite checking in at 5:15). On top of this, many others who came after us were seated before us. All the while, tables that already had some drinks were being shifted around and there were a few empty 4 tops that could have easily accommodated 3 of us. They ended up comping us with an order of the chicken empanadas (which were great), but we kind of expected our drinks to be taken care of after the manager hinted at it.

With all that out of the way, the food was great! We had the ceviche mixto, steak plate, lengua, cocktails, and paella, all of which were cooked excellently and tasty!

I'd probably opt for walk in next time if I'm having a dinner at 5:30. We would've been in and out 30 minutes quicker.
author: Jeff N.

description: Its was great, had the leche tigre ceviche and the short ribs. Its was all great! We even got their right when they were closing, and everything was prepared very fresh!!  Eric was our server and was awesome!!
author: Paul R.

description: We came here on Saturday night because the one on van ness was closing soon. We ordered our food and drinks and everything was great at that point. I ordered the lomo saltado and my boyfriend order the Pollo a la brasa. My lomo saltado was a tad bit on the salty side so I wanted to order another side of rice and another round of drinks but our waiter was no where to be found. We saw the manager walking towards our section but he completely ignored us and only cared about the couple seating next to us. It took 15 minutes for one of the other waitresses who had a different section to notice us. Even when trying to get the hostess attention she would pretend as if she didn't see us. When the waitress came by and took our order you can tell that she was even looking for our waiter to let them know that we were waiting. I understand people go on breaks but at least let the customers know. I think I'll just stick to going to the van ness location.
author: Cynthia P.

description:
FOOD:
1.) half chicken- the secret is dipping in the middle sauce and it will be delish
a.) salada side - this was good but nothing too special
b.) sweet fries side - mm yum esp also dipped in that middle sauce 
2.) Carne something - had onions n stuff w chunks of steak .. Good but chicken is where it's at, of course at a place known for the chicken

SERVICE:
Good

ATMOSPHERE:
Small casual cozy 



9.8.13
author: Angela L.

description:
Had pisco sours, a whole rotisserie chicken, Yuca fries, sauteed veggies, and their ceviche!! OMIGOSH, their ceviche, tho!!

Best seafood ceviche I've had yet..

Definitely going back...
author: LC B.

description:
I came here for dinner with a couple of friends on a Friday night with a reservation. We learned that the full party must be accounted for before you can be seated. In the meantime, you are able to chill at the bar and order drinks while you wait for your guests to arrive. There is an upstairs and downstairs seating area. During the daytime, the upstairs may provide more of an intimate setting, while the downstairs area may provide more lighting and activity.

Once we were seated, we were greeted by a friendly waiter and received menus and waters very promptly. We ordered an assortment of dishes (including mac and cheese, which was very flavorful and the tuna tartare, also very fresh and juicy), but my favorites were the chicken (their specialty!) and the lomito saltado! The chicken was very tender, juicy, and full of flavor, while the lomito saltado (has french fries on it!) was cooked to perfection and had a perfect balance of textures (fries vs. meat). The fries were not soggy, which is my main thing. We had our waters filled promptly and were able to catch the attention of the wait staff quickly, despite the business of the place. I would definitely come back again! My tip is that if you are coming during rush hour, make a reservation to be safe. This place can get pretty busy!
author: Hurnan V.

description:
Dead serious, this is my favorite restaurant. A lil pricey, but it's worth it. 

The pisco sours are great but I love the maracuya sour. Some of the best ceviche I've ever had too! I had some ceviche throughout SF, most too citrus-y or not citrus-y enough. Limon's is perfect! Also, their steak dish with potatoes is everything! My post really isn't doing it any justice. 

The restaurant generates a younger/middle-aged crowd I suppose. It is a bit noisy but then again, you should be more focused on those you came with. 

My experience is always a good one.
author: Brandon B.

description: One of my favorite places in the Mission. I personally love tapas, although the portions are very generous for tapas. My favorite dish is the ceviche mixto. The chicken and sweet potato fries are also delish!
author: Kimmy P.

description: Great peruvian food for a good price. The rotisserie chicken is one of the best. Can host large groups as well.
author: Haris I.

description:
Food and drinks worth 5 stars.

The waiter spilled my drink on me and I had to ask him for another.  We were charged for the extra drink.

As soon as our party of 8 paid the $600 bill, the waiter asked us to leave because there was another party waiting for our table. NOT OK.
author: Oliver F.

description:
I'm not going to comment on the food here, except to say that it's great... and you should definitely order the lomo saltado.

What I will say, is that this location is SO LOUD. I much prefer the other limon locations because of this... do not come here with a date - in fact, don't come here if you want to talk to your company instead of yelling across a table all night.
author: Erica W.

description: The place was packed on a Mother's Day evening and glad we made reservation earlier. The gum chewing host (1 star fell)sit us about 15 minutes later our reservation time. The signature chicken which I heard about was just okay. Maybe a little flavor upgrade as obviously been marinated with more spices ; but overall , if it's worth $23 dollars ...nahhh. I didn't even find the ceviche to be top of the notch as well. I would not say the service was totally bad but our server forgot a couple of our orders and was the hurrying type . The dining experience was not relaxing and in fact, aside from the loud vibe of the place, watching the kitchen/chefs below (we were seated in the mezzanine ), it was stressful and just can't wait to finish our meal then go ...Street parking was a bit of a challenge too.
author: Jed D.

description:
Awesome restaurant for large groups!  Conveniently located a block away from 16th street Bart station, this little gem boasts bold flavors of authentic Peruvian cuisine. The restaurant isn't very spacious but it's big enough to exude that warm cozy feel. We came with a fairly large party of 15 people and they seated us right next to the window. With parties of 10 or more, they have a prefixed menu. Fortunately we had an amazing server who proposed an even better plan.. A special menu highlighting all of Limon's signature dishes for just under $25 a person! We had probably 10 courses of food if not more. Of course ceviche and sangria are a must but don't forget to try out their paella and beef dishes as well.  Can't go wrong with a pisco sour either. Everything was flavored to perfection and the meat was succulent and juicy.  I don't think I had anything I disliked.  I can't wait to come back again!!

Some tidbits:
- They will only seat you if your entire party has arrived. 
- Parking is a pain in the mission so take public transit like Bart. 
- Reservations are highly recommended.
author: Cecilia S.

description:
The 2 stars is for the service.
But 3.5 for the food.

First and foremost the food was good, but not great. There was artistic culinary flare to the presentation, which compensated little for the bad service you will receive when you get there. 

Our waiter had the attitude that he just wanted to serve you only to keep you quite.  No smile or care, just a task oriented person is all you will get.I would imagine that you will receive better service when business is slow, (so I'll give them that much). Beware when you go on Saturdays because it will be busier than normal. This is when the servers will begin to fumble and lose integrity. I asked for water 5 (five) times to 2 different people, and never received it from either one. 

 I was about to ask my server if it was ok to bring water from the "outside" because I was ready to leave the restaurant to buy water from a nearby liquor store since no one brought us water. I was literally getting dehydrated. There was another gal who approached us twice, asking if everything thing was good, and those times I asked for water, but never received it.

To make a long story short, their service does not the match the culinary level they are trying to portray. Unfortunately their service brought down what could have been a good dining experience.
author: Rock A.

description: Very good, I'd strongly recommend the short rib, everything about it was amazing. I just can't imagine someone ordering that and not coming away happy and satisfied with the quality.
author: greg s.

description: Tasty food. The fish ceviche was delicious. Drinks are so good. Wish it was a little less loud. But will definitely come back again.
author: Rachel T.

description: Great spot and awesome chicken.  We only ordered a half chicken and wanted to try a lot of the other dishes but the chicken was by far the favorite.  It was juicy, crispy, and the sauces it came with were great too.  Yuca fries were on point, fish ceviche was good but the truffle mac and cheese was just ok.  With dinner we had a pitcher of white sangria which was pretty sweet but good.  Besides the chicken, our service was great!  Will definitely come back
author: Chris S.

description:
Love the food BUT service with Carlos was ridiculously rude!!!! 
He got my order wrong and made me feel like it was my fault!
author: Emma M.

description: Half chicken,  tartare,  ceviche,  sangria.  I always order those when I go here.  Half chicken is very popular here. I wish theyd serve their sangria in a bigger glass.
author: Pam Y.

description: I think I found a new go to bar! My co-workers took me here for my last week at work. We made a reservation for 17 people and everyone was very satisfied with the service and food. The workers were very accomodating and friendly. I love their sangria! Ive tried sangria from other places but the sangria here is the best. The food was tasty especially their roasted chicken. Definitely coming back!
author: Nicole D.

description:
I really enjoyed coming here. The sangrias are fantastic! Sweet, fruity, and perfect. I decided to order close to a third of the menu because, well, that's what happens when super indecisiveness kicks in; which happens quite too often for me, I'm afraid to admit.

I enjoyed the yuca fries, however, the cebiches were a tad bit too salty, as was the rotisserie chicken. The jalea was a mixture of fried calamari, fish, and shrimp which tasted great with the dipping sauces.

Overall, the dishes were great portions and were very satisfying. The customer service was polite and accommodating. 

Looking forward to another round!
author: Ann S.

description:
I'm Peruvian so I probably have unusually high standards for Peruvian food.
Everyone's knows its hard to beat Tica's cooking!! 

Well I've only been here twice and here's what we ordered:
-ceviche de pescado - Good, fresh & limey
-lomo saltado - too much soy sauce, not my fave.
- jalea - loved it..especially the aji that comes with it. Nice & crispy!
- seco - did not love it. I feel they tried to make it too fancy..if it's not broke, don't fix it.
- panna cotta - loved it..it was so creamy, good texture
- sangria - deelish!

Unfortunately, I did not get a chance to try the pollo a la brasa but I've heard good things so I'll definitely be back!!
author: Luz T.

description:
This restaurant was recommended by a colleague of mine when I was visiting San Francisco.  The food was really good so was the beer and dessert!  
The only negative thing was the group of people sitting next to our table. They were so loud it was impossible to have a conversation. Besides that, I would definitely recommend this restaurant.
author: Janne Rud H.

description:
We ate here with a group of friends while we were visiting the Bay Area. My husband is Peruvian so we know what good Peruvian food is. We had a table for six and the place was so small we felt so crammed. The food was good but was more pretty than anything. Portions were small and a bit overpriced. My husband was shocked when he asked for ketchup for his fries and they didn't carry ketchup. 
WHATTTT! !! What kind of restaurant doesn't carry ketchup??? Come on guys..that's restaurant 101.

Oh and our friend doesn't eat red meat.. We thought that they carried pollo saltado but they don't even carry that..just Lomo. .booooo!!
Pollo a la brasa took a long time to get to the table.
It was a bit dry.
Can't go wrong with inka cola!
author: A. N.

description:
Chicken: Delicious, absolutely delicious, skin was crispy and the meat was tender and awesome

Aji: very very good, my favorite was the chimichurri and the Hot one

Yuca Fries: Delicious, but nothing special

Lomito Saltado: Very salty I know it is supposed to be a salty dish but it was a bit over seasoned. 

Tuna Tartare: Meh, this was the only thing I did not like it was boring and had no real flavor to it.
author: Charles W.

description: Great location. Very packed usually. The chicken is quite delicious. We had big party last time and we were feeling like the waiter was rushing us in the end since they had another big party they wanted to fit it. We were not even there for too long. Hope next time you take reservations you make sure people have enough time to eat.
author: Tracy D.

description:
Food was underheated, lukewarm at best.  Clearly not freshly prepared.

I think they just served us leftover chicken from lunch.  We actually asked the waiter and he said yes. I'm hoping he didn't understand the question.
author: Jennifer F.

description: Horrible restaurant.   Avoid it.  Yesterday,  our group of 6 people was at this restaurant for dinner.  Toward the end, a mentally ill, filthy,  homeless person walked in.  The front desk person made no attempt to stop her.  This homeless person came to our table, harassed us for food, andl proceeded to grab our chicken and devoured it right there.  Meanwhile,  the manager and staff did nothing,  not until we yelled for help.  They made a lame effort to escort her out.  A short while later, this homeless person came back for the second time,  once again,  unnoticed by this oblivious staff.  She began to harass the people at the next table.   I had to yell our to the staff to do something about it.  They made all sorts of excuses of why they couldn't do anything, taking no responsibility for either our safety and experience while dining in their restaurant.   They would not provide a credit for either the stolen food or the bad experience.  We do not recommend this restaurant to anyone, unless you're ok with having your food grabbed and eaten with random homeless people.   The restaurant won't do anything to protect or compensate you.  It was the most unpleasant,  disgusting dining experience I've ever had.
author: Alain T.

description: I literally come here about twice a week since I work a block away! Its so great and they never let me down! Definitely get their chicken and Truffle Mac n Cheese (absolutely amazing)! My favorite drink there is  Dulce Amor!
author: Alexis G.

description:
My girl friend and I were starving so we decided to go all out, and order 3 things! Oh my!  We got the:

Ceviche Mixto- 4 stars. Super fresh, and the portion was totally enough
Lomito Saltado - 3 stars. I felt like it tasted like Chinese stir fry and they called it Peruvian stir fry.
Pollo - 4 stars again. So so tasty. Perfectly roasted and flavored. Plus all the sauces (i.e. chimichurri) they bring out with it are excellent.
Ambiance - 4 stars. Super cute, trendy, but not pretentious. 

I'll come back fasho.
author: Monica A.

description: Great food . The ceviche is great and must try .Meat options are plenty.Not much for vegetarians though.Overall great experience .Definitely coming back
author: Nupur S.

description:
We went here for a cocktail and a quick app before dinner at maverick.  The cocktail gurus here really pay scrupulous detailed attention to the craft of the cocktail. They were great.

We ordered 2 apps the beef empanadas (with an incredible sauce), and the truffle mac and cheese.  Both were great and very reasonable.  The mac and cheese was very creamy and truffle-y and a nice portion size for $6.95.  

My friend reallllllllly wants to go back for the chicken, I have been here before - I love the lomo saltido (not quite sure of the spelling) It is the stir fry beed with the french fries in it - how decadent is that?
author: Amy W.

description: Best Pisco Sour and Arroz con Mariscos of my life!  Highly recommend this place.
author: Jessica S.

description:
I moved to the Mission and San Francisco in June 2013. I have walked by Limon so many times and finally went in last week for lunch with a friend. We ordered the mushroom empanadas and the lomo saltado which were both delicious. 

So why only 2 stars?

Service is very important in a restaurant experience as are details. First, the restaurant was essentially empty at lunch and the server was kind and smiled but wasn't very quick. I know this is a small issue to most but I wanted anything with carbonation and their fountain was broken and had no bottles or cans of anything. Lastly, I hate getting nickel and dimed. The server actually charged us for the sauces when I asked for some hot sauce on the side. This felt like getting charged for ketchup or ice. The additional sauce charges came to $4-5 which was ridiculous. I mentioned my disapproval of this charge and only got a polite "this is what we charge." Wouldn't have spent an additional $5 on tiny sauces if it was disclosed upfront.
author: Itai B.

description: I love el lomo saltado but the white rice it came with was TOO salty! Also the service was not the best.
author: Marilynnn G.

description:
The food is delicious and worth 5 Stars!
The drinks are creative and the Sangria is also a 5 star choice.
