My only complaint is that twice I have had a bad experience with using a credit or debit card at this location.
Twice I have caught being wildly overcharged.  It's not an expensive choice but getting charged 50% or more over your bill is a bummer!
They are slow to respond to this problem but eventually it gets fixed.  
My advice~ PAY CASH!!  or everybody start checking your bills and complaining....
author: Chimene S.

description:
I've recently discovered the yumminess of Peruvian food.  I came here for a late lunch and we ordered the ceviche mixto (fish, calamari, and tiger shrimp), quarter chicken, lomito saltado (steak and fries).      

Highs:
- the food was delicious
- loved the ceviche

Lows:
- the price for lunch adds up quickly
- parking the in area can be difficult
author: Diane U.

description:
Dinned here 8+ times and probably had every single item on the menu so I have to finally write an actual review!
The food is always fresh, extremely flavorful and always delightful to the senses!
All the pisco drinks are amazing, the cheviche is a must try and DO NOT FORGET the chicken!!!! 
They prepare beef to perfection - steak, heart, tongue!
 The staff is fabulous- I've seen the same guys for the past three years so service is great! 
You can bring the kids too and they will love it!

To sum it up, as a friend described it ... "it was orgasmic!!!!!"

PS we like the Valencia location better as you can find parking more easily than at Van Ness.
author: Ana B.

description:
We had a dinner party for my friend's birthday at Limon a few Saturdays ago (reservation was for 8pm).  My husband and I hung out at the bar while waiting for the rest of the party/table.  The bartender was a rockstar.  It was extremely busy, but he was taking orders and making drinks for the patrons at the bar and for the servers with skill and style.  I asked for a smooth/light beer, and he recommended Cristal, which was perfect.  It really hit the spot.  We were joined by other members of our party as they arrived, and everyone was really impressed with their mixed drinks.  

For dinner, we ordered one of each empanada dish (chicken, beef, vegetable), a whole chicken, a few other entree dishes, and sides.  Everything was amazing and well seasoned.  All the meat dishes were super tender.  My favorite sides were the fried yucca and the macaroni and cheese.  The waitstaff were all friendly and fast.  I definitely recommend this place to anyone!!
author: Liz M.

description:
Do I think it's overpriced? Yes!

Do I think it's one of the best friggin chickens to have ever walked this Earth? Double Yes!

They're relatively crowded most of the times I've made it here but that can only mean good things, right? In this case, yes, apparently so.

I love their roasted chicken, something about those spices just make it tender, juicy and melt in your mouth delicious.

Also got the Leche Tigre cocktail. Mm, flavorful and it just bursts with flavor. Tart to allure your appetite.

Thinking about it is making me drool!!!
author: Winè C.

description:
I love this place, every time we go there we always come out with a full tummy and a big smile.

I would seriously recommend the tongue and the leche de tigre. Of course, the chicken is amazing!

Thanks!
author: Anabel V. D.

description:
Delicious!

Everything I ordered was so yummy. I would recommend the empandas and the seco de Costillas. Top it off with a Lychee Sour :)

My family made the mistake of making a reservation at the Van Ness location instead of the Valencia, so double check which location!
author: Kyla R.

description: I really really wanted to like this place.  Peruvian food - how can you go wrong?  But the hostess messed up my reservation badly (i.e pretty much did not have a table for me).  But more than that, they did not try to acknowledge it until my friend got fed up after waiting for an hour after showing up at"10 minutes before my reservation and pretty much told them in Spanish to get us drinks and give us the next table.  as for wanting to enjoy the food, Im sure it was great but all I could taste was the bad taste left at my mouth by the reservation system.  One star for the location, one for being Peruvian food.  But that's it.
author: Daniel Y.

description: Exceptional ceviche and the roasted chicken was perfect. Actually the entire menu was delicious so when it came to dessert we didn't think we can eat another bite but the bread pudding and tres leches was gone in 2 seconds. So I would say it is a must to try restaurant.
author: M.C Y.

description: I must tell you that I haven't dined here because I only do take out. Friends told me it was amazing but overpriced. Down the road, my boyfriend who is a "closeted yelper" decides to try Limon Rotisserie. I was SO excited that he shared with me (we don't share our food lol). But to my surprise, it was MEH. The steak wasn't that great. A little to hard for me and everything else I tried wasn't anything to write home about. But don't get me wrong, it is good enough that if I'll still eat it, I just don't love it.
author: Sweets N.

description: Oh man, this is my place to go. I've been in the city for over 4 yrs, and this is still my favorite place to go for food/drinks/ football!! I love the service- the guys are great- My partner and I know a few bartenders and servers for a while now, they never forget our face and it's like home every time we sit down. So to wrap it up- the service is wonderful and warm, the food is delicious, and if you can grab a seat at the bar before it's filled- it's prime seating for watching a mon/ thurs/ Sunday football game. :)
author: Ashley F.

description: This place is AWESOME! The Red Sangria, veggie empanadas, tuna tartare and the yuca fries were all incredible. I highly recommend a visit to this restaurant !
author: Rori B.

description:
Fantastic rotisserie chicken with an exceptional menu of sides that can stand on their own. All-around great restaurant and dining experience.

We ordered 1/2 chicken, sides of fries and ensalada, truffle mac and cheese, ceviche de pescado y camaron, and seco de costilla (beef short ribs with potatoes and peas). The signature rotisserie chicken was flavorful and juicy, with meat falling off the bone. The ceviche, infused with citrus, was full of flavor and refreshing. It is served in pure form, slices of fresh seafood (sans chips). Also of note were the hearty, stew-like short ribs, steeped in a rich, beefy broth.

Savory, complex, full-bodied flavors. This place packs a punch!
author: Jennie W.

description:
Everyone who eats at Limon needs to have one of their Ceviches.  It's a must.  If you're not a fish person then I would suggest other restaurants.  Even though Limon has options for just about every diner I wont let you eat out here until you've tried some kind of seafood cocktail.  Yum!

The atmosphere is always frantic and busy yet you can find your cool, calm, and collected romantic night if need-be.  There's always a packed house so make sure to grab a reservation if possible and get ready to eat some good Peruvian food.
author: Kevin J.

description:
This place is SO GOOD! 

I think I have a slight obsession with Limón!  The best chicken EVER and the BEST SANGRIA that I've had outside of Spain!  

We ordered a whole Rotisserie Chicken which is cut into 8 pieces.  There was only two of us, and yes, we ate the whole darn thing.  The seasoning is perfection and it so amazingly juicy.  The flavors just take over your mouth.  With the chicken, comes a choice of two sides.  We had the veggies and the yuca fries.  We decided that next time we're just going to get two sides of the veggies. They were SO delicious and the best part was that we did not expect them to be.  We also ordered the Truffle Mac 'n' Cheese - it was divine! 

The restaurant itself is laid back, the ambiance is great, and the service is excellent.  It's loud and fun! A great place for a date or a dinner with a group of friends.  I can't wait to go back and try the other tapas on the menu!
author: Suki B.

description:
I used to love this place. The chicken and their appetizer plates were all on point. But now, it's just not the same. It's always extremely crowded and noisy. Parking is horrible and the table spaces are way too small. Last time we were here the wait staff kept hounding us for our extra two chairs as one couple was late. Really??? Ask us once maybe but after that it's just annoying. 

The pork chop was good. It was juicy and cooked perfectly. Everything else was lack luster. The wait staff really just killed it and whatever opinion I could have had of the food was overshadowed by their annoying follow ups about the late couple. 

This is why I am dropping this once 4 to 2 stars.
author: Ryan C.

description:
The atmosphere in this place is great; the place is amazing but a bit pricey even it is is high end Peruvian food. I live their prefix menu, the ceviche mixto is pretty good too and so are the empanadas. Last time I was here, we had a table of like 15 people and each of us ended up paying about $80 bucks each. 
My favorite place for this (and I am not Peruvian is Destino on Market.
author: Moy V.

description:
Limon is full of deceptions. First, the dining room is larger than it seems.  Second, though the restaurant enjoys a constant stream of patrons nightly, waiting for a table is only a marginal nuisance thanks in large part to a friendly and efficient host staff.  And, finally, though Limon's food extracts much from Peru's rich chaotic blend of Ameridian, African, Spanish, Italian, Japanese, Chinese, and Arab cultures, its decor is simple, clean, and rather mundane with dark installations and hardwood floors splashed with accents of lime-colored knickknacks.  

Unfortunately, these contradictions appear to be the only interesting elements of Limon's dining experience as the restaurant is dulled by sub-par food and wait service.

Limon's seafood paella comprises of an authentic flavor profile with mussels, shrimp, peas, and lightly drizzled sofrito -- notably, sans fish.  Though the taste was well executed, both the rice and shrimp were overcooked as they gave off unpleasant rubbery textures.  

The chicken chicharron, one of Limon's so-called signature dish, is equally unimpressive.  Our bare portions were excessively dry and surprisingly overdone, resembling some sort of chicken jerky left overnight in a food dehydrator for a carnival food stand.  The accompanying limon-flavored sauce, though delicious, had the impossible task of making the dish edible.  Unless a line cook slipped this by the chef, I felt insulted being served something obviously misfired.  

Just to clarify, there are several variations of chicken chicharron in Peru -- fried skin (similar to pork rinds), batter-soaked and deep fried (similar to American fried chicken), and well-seared marinated chicken (carmelized outside with white moist inside).  Limon follows the latter incompetently.

One bright spot is the ceviche mixto, a beautifully plated mix of calamari, fish, and tiger shrimp garnished with voluptuous Peruvian corn kernels, herbs, and sliced onions.  Though the shrimp, again, was overdone, the dish worked well with a bit of salinity, sweetness, and acidity from the components.

The service here, though mostly courteous, is difficult to acquire regardless of the density level of the restaurant.  The members of the wait staff were noticeably absent during my recent two dinner visits: none of the waiters checked up on our food; only the runners tended to our table to settle the dishes.

I expected much more from a restaurant carrying so much hype.  With proper management, I suspect that Limon can fulfill the promise behind its hype or, at the very least, go much further than where it stands now.  And, where it stands now is deep mediocrity.
author: AC N.

description:
In two separate occasions, I had bad experiences with this restaurant. In both cases, my issue was not with the food (which was good), but with the customer service. They really need to spend more time on employee training.

First one: I celebrated my birthday at Limon with a party of 20 guests. The restaurant was great at accomodating us on the second floor. So I thought.. They started rushing us after about an hour and a half into the dinner.. The waiters kept coming back and asking when we will leave. This was the first time I was asked at a restaurant when to leave. Ok I understand you want to make more $$, but this is definitely not the right way to do so. Of those 20 guests who dined that night, not a single one was happy with the treatment they got. That is a big number of people to disappoint in one night...Bad business.

Second one: Recently I called them to make a reservation "reluctantly" after my first bad experience... and the person answering the phone was very unprofessional. As soon as I told him that I would like to make a reservation, he told me that they were very busy at the moment. After a moment of silence, I told him "ok.." still expecting him to put down my details for the reservation. But instead he told me to call back in 15 minutes. I politely told him no thanks. One thing this restaurant has to understand is that we are also very busy, and we just can't keep calling back. Obviously I moved on to our second option.
author: Jan K.

description:
Wow, I can't believe that when I first came here I wasn't a fan of wine!? What on Earth was I thinking!??!

The ceviche limon is still hands down my most favoritestestestestestestestestst thing here.  Also had another appetizer this last time around but I honestly can't remember what it was! Dammit!

Ordered the lomo saltado which was EXCELLENT. I've had really bad lomo saltado at another place before (and it's not defunct, thank goodness) so this made up for it. 

What I also really loved?? The bottle of  08 Tomero Malbec. MmMmMMm red wines are like my weakness now. 

Oh and the side of truffle mac n cheese that came with the pollo? SUPER DELISH ON HIT BOOM!
author: Susy C.

description:
Mmmm Peruvian Tapas...

I love me a good Peruvian meal.  My friend and I visited Colombia for the New Year, where we frequented upscale Peruvian restaurants (I guess that is the "thing" in Colombia), so he thought this would be a fitting choice for my visit to SF... and he was absolutely right.  The meal could not have been more perfect.

In LA, where I live, we have a lot of hole in the wall type Peruvian places, but not many nice, sit down places like this.  I loved the tapas style that enabled us to try a lot of different things:

Tartara de Tuna
Ceviche de Pescado y Camarron
Chicharron de Pollo
Truffle Mac and Cheese
Veggie Empanadas

Everything was really good, but the pollo was ammmaaazing.  It was so good that we promptly ordered another one and were still talking about it the next day.   The mac and cheese was also very good - a lot lighter than what you normally get when you order mac and cheese from a restaurant, which was a pleasant surprise. These two were my must-order dishes of the night, but really, everything was so good that I would get it again.

They were a bit anal about the whole party being there for them to seat us, and them giving the table away if we weren't all there within 15 minutes of the reservation.. but it's a popular place so I don't blame them. Just be sure to lie about the time of your reservation to your not-so-punctual friends ;)  It was late on a Saturday night so that might always be so crazy, but just a heads up.
author: Flora H.

description:
Food was good. The wait for the table and the treatment given by the hostess while waiting were terrible! I had a 8:30pm reservation and was not seated until 9:15pm. Meanwhile i saw at least 3 other big parties of 6+ being seated before us. I would ask for how long for the table to be ready and they would blame the costumers that were taking too long. I mean really?! If you have a booked reservation and still have to wait that long? I book all my reservations with open table and this one by far was the worst service I got! Then after the food, the waiter and some other guy- I'm guessing the manager kept coming over to our table every 3mins to ask if we wanted desserts. At least 15times and I'm not joking! Cutting out out conversation when we would repeat over and over that we needed more time. Seriously?! 

Not returning to this place! Fresca has much better food and service.
author: Tathi P.

description:
One word: CEVICHE, just order it. 

Items we ordered:
+ceviche de camarón y pescado
+cicharon de pollo
+yuma fríes (ask for the side sauces) yummmy

This place is trendy and cute. It is a little pricey but its very fun. Service was great Eric was our server and Javier made us some delicious drinks. We didnt try the sangría, we went straight for tequila. But the sangría looks fresh and a future "to-try" ítem. Food  is fresh, portions are a perfect size and I advise to order a few things and share with friends.
author: Priscilla N.

description: I had the short ribs, truffle Mac n cheese, chocolate cake and sangria and it was so good. This place definitely deserves more than 3 1/2 stars!
author: Aakash P.

description:
Make your reservations early here because it fills up fast!  In fact, when you're in SF, just plan to either wait a really long time for a good restaurant or make reservations.  You'll thank me later.  We were quoted an hour wait, but actually wait 15 minutes longer with no updates.  So the hostess service wasn't all that great, but the food service was.  The food here is absolutely amazing!  We ordered:

A whole chicken - good in itself.  I ate the dark meat.  It comes with 3 different sauces. 
The anticucho de lengua - super yum, but some parts were overly salty, so I had to drink a whole glass or water to wash it down.  Very tender and juicy.  Came with mashed potatoes too.   
Fries - nice and crispy 
carne empanadas - just ok, wasn't impressed.  I either don't like carne empanadas like I thought, or these ones just weren't that great.  
queso emapanas - very good and cheesy (Oaxaca cheese) 
Lomito Saltado - the best part!  Cooked to perfection and very tender meat.

We also had a pitcher of Sangria to share, which was very good also.  Boy was I full in the end!  I don't know about wait an hour and 15 minutes for this place, but the food  and Sangria here were a plus!
author: Diane V.

description:
As always-- awesome food and good service. Limon is a great 'go to' place with a fantastic bar. Additionally, their prices are still reasonable (many places on 
Valencia have becomes unreasonably expensive). 

The only negative-- it's a bit too loud for a conversation at Limon.
author: Matthew S.

description:
The food was a 3.5, and the service was a 1.  

We had a reservation for 6:30 pm on a Sunday night.  The place was busy.  We were seated at a choice table in the front (4 of us) and things were looking good.  We were given menus.  But after about 10 minutes we were starting to look around for our waiter.  Two tables were seated next to us after we arrived.  They got water, then drinks, then food.  We still had no drinks.  The waiter finally took our drink order.  Another 15 minutes later, no drinks and no waiter in sight.  I let the hostess know we are trying to get our drinks.  She lets a waiter/busser know.  Our waiter arrives a few minutes later with half of our drink order (the vodka rocks and a soda arrive, but no sangria and no malbec).  He offers to take our order while the bar is "working on" our drinks.  It was very annoying.  The drinks finally arrived, something like 30 minutes after we sat down.  I think what annoyed me the most is that the waiter was so unapologetic.  He would fit right in at the department of motor vehicles.  

The food was good.  Not great, not terrible.  For the price I think it's a good value.

But the service really sucks.  The staff, including the hostess, simply do not care.
author: Michael B.

description:
Ceviche! Ceviche!!

I'm cheering because this dinner has made me incredibly satisfied. :)

Heading out for a late dinner on Sunday night, we decide to try out this Limon place. Peruvian food sounds great. I looked online at their menu and the ribeye caught my eye. 

Very nice room, hints of lime green accents, a modern atmosphere. 

Upon arrival, we were notified that it was full at the moment, and we could wait at the bar for a bit. I got a mango mojito, and he got a beer.My mango mojito arrived in a larger glass than usual. I love it!  After 15 minutes or so, a table became open, and we were seated. 

Lots of different ceviches on the menu, I wanted to try them all! But he digressed, and so, we settled on the Oyster Shooter-Oyster in Leche de Tigre and the Cebiche Shooter-Finely Diced Seafood "Swimming" in Leche de Tigre. I've never had this leche de Tigre, so I was eager to try it out. 

For entrees, we got the Churrasco a la Parrilla-Grilled Boneless Ribeye, Roasted Purple Potatoes, Asparagus and he got the Lomo Saltado-Wok-Tossed Sirloin Fingers with Red Onion, Tomato & Soy, French Fries       

I was actually considering Pargo Rojo-Whole Crispy Red Snapper, Coconut Fried Rice, Rocoto-Curry Sauce, but needed some meat instead.

Our entrees actually arrived before the ceviches, which I thought was weird. The waiter also spilled one of the ceviches over, and didn't really bother to bring extra napkins or clean up, and just kind of disappeared. 

I especially liked the oyster ceviche, and the leche de tigre was interesting. The ribeye was done perfectly medium, tender and flavourful. It was a large portion!! It was just what I needed!

An interesting experience at our first trial at Peruvian food!
author: Vincci L.

description:
Absolutely incredible food.  I've been here multiple times and it never disappoints.

The rotisserie chicken is delicious with perfectly paired sides and sauces.  Coupled with their sangria pitcher and delicious small plates, you can rarely go wrong.  To add to it, the price point is undeniably reasonable for the portion sizes and quality of food.
author: Steve A.

description:
Two stars for the AWFUL service.  It's too bad the service sucked so much, because the food was really great.  Service this bad is the kind that leaves a bad aftertaste, no matter how tasty the food is.

First, they wouldn't seat us until most of our party was present.  My party and I had been sitting for less than an hour, probably about 50 minutes, and had just ordered another round of food, when the waiter came up and told us he was bringing the check in 10 minutes and told us that they needed the table.  Uh, hold on...WHAT?  Yes, they were kicking us out.  This is the first restaurant that has ever asked me to leave.  My friends and I all looked at each other and had no idea what was going on.  We thought that perhaps they were having a big party come in and needed our table.  But no, that was not the case, as there were several empty tables surrounding us and only small parties coming in.  And regardless, what restaurant kicks their customers out so rudely? 

So after about 20 minutes, the waiter came to apologize and said that they had made a mistake, they didn't need us to leave after all.  But based on that interaction, it was clear to me that this was part of their normal protocol: kicking guests out of their restaurant mid-meal.  Didn't even offer to compensate for the rudeness.  Will never go back.
author: Beth U.

description:
We got the half chicken (with yuca fries and vegetables salteados), truffle mac and cheese, and seafood paella to share between three people. Here's the breakdown.

The good: Amazing prices! We looked at the check and the first reaction was, "wait.. is this right?" It's surprisingly affordable for the location and the quality of food, which is always pleasant to see. The chicken was fantastic, as were the yuca fries and the sauces. The truffle mac and cheese was a good surprise, as well. When we saw that Yelpers suggested the mac and cheese, we hesitated, wondering how good could mac and cheese possibly be at a Peruvian restaurant. But the only word of advice, really, is: GET IT. 

The bad: Service really could be a bit better. We were unfamiliar with one of the sauce options, and when my friend asked what it was, our server simply said, "oh, you get all three sauces with your chicken." But.. that wasn't our question, was it now? We asked clearer once again, and only receive the same response. So that's great. 

The ugly: The paella tasted as if a whole bag of salt got dumped into the plate. No amount of water could have saved our tastebuds.
author: Floreta L.

description:
Limon is one of my favorite restaurants on Valencia Street. Rolled up on a Sunday night without reservations, the wait wasn't bad at all, we got seated after 10 mins.

The food here was standard, 3.5 stars. I liked the Ceviche Mixto and Lomo Saltado.

Ceviche Mixto was fresh and appetizing and consisted of layers of halibut, calamari, tiger shrimp accompanied by kernels of giant Peruvian corn. Ceviche Mixto was really a larger portion, meant to share. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chWLsfWUJ5k8-73t9FOM9A?select=xCG-Vb9OzFkORYlhhP-f_A

Lomo Saltado - I fell in love with this full-flavored dish right after having it. The Lomo Saltado is a rice dish with stir-fried sirloin and french fries. A classic chifa dish that fuses East and West. Dump the rice onto the Lomo Saltado and mix them together. The silrloin strips were succulent. I ordered Lomo Saltado to go for the next two days. Having Lomo Salado 3 days in a row didn't make me sick of it. Much love for Lomo Saltado. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chWLsfWUJ5k8-73t9FOM9A?select=ha8sLhWCZCSFvcZyoVbQrg

Aside from the good food, Limon is in a convenient location so you can have dinner here before you start bar hopping in the hipster hood.
author: Chloe B.

description:
Not being Peruvian, but having visited Peru for just over two weeks, I stand on my undeniable authority in being able to judge the authenticity of Limón's cuisine.

We had a prix fixe menu served family style and almost every item was tasty. Sadly the ceviche was a bit over salted and didn't include those deliciously spicy little orange chilies that are prevalent in the kinds served around Lima, but it was still passable. The Chicken Chicharones were addictive.

I'd recommend everything else we tried except the Pisco Sour. Honestly the egg smelled past its prime and ruined the flavor of the drink. It all worked out as I'm sitting here not dead from some kind of egg related botulism. Plus the sangria made up for it.

During dinner rush this place is deafeningly loud. I'd recommend going earlier or later than 8-9 on Friday/Saturday unless you aren't that interested in what your date has to say. In which case, again I'd recommend the sangria.
author: Stephen C.

description:
Came here for a birthday dinner with a group of 12-13. Everything was great! Food was delicious, service was quick and friendly. And yay for 2 bathrooms for women :)

+ Chicken + chimichurri sauce, sooooooo yummy!!
+ Yucca fries
+ Sangria was good, though I wished it was a little stronger
+ Ceviche
- Portions on the smaller end

It came down to $30 a person... not bad for all the food and sangria we ordered. Definitely a great place for a big group before going out. Get there early (our reservation was at 6), or be prepared for a wait.
author: Sherry L.

description:
Pros: Great blend of sauces and delicious rotisserie chicken.
Cons: Long waiting time for our food. Waiter charged us for items ordered by the adjacent table; please take care to check the bill.
author: Mayumi O.

description:
This was only my first time trying Peruvian food so I can't vouch for the authenticity of this place, but it was delicious, for sure.

My boyfriend and I walked in after an afternoon of walking down Valencia. It was around 6 PM on a Friday and we were seated without a wait (the restaurant was pretty full by 6:30, so reservations would probably be a good idea). The interior was very modern with lots of green, something you'd expect from an Asian fusion restaurant.

We ordered a quarter of the rotisserie chicken with tacu tacu and yuca fries on the side, ceviche mixto (shrimp, calamari, and red snapper), and the lomo saltado. The food came out so quickly! The ceviche first, and the others soon after. 

Ceviche: The broth was super lemony so I thought it was too much at first, but it went well with the other dishes. Super refreshing. 
Chicken: The quarter size came with a drumstick and a thigh. Very tender, super yummy with the chimichurri.
Tacu tacu: A mixture of rice and beans. Was a bit heavy, but so addicting. 
Yuca fries: Yum! Crisp and fluffy. A must order. 
Lomo Saltado: My favorite. It wasn't salty at all, and everything was delicious. Wish there was more meat though. 

Our bill only came out to be $30 (I guess we could've eaten more, though) - great food for reasonable prices. I definitely want to come back for the ahi tartare and the truffle mac and cheese!
author: Carolyn Y.

description:
Every time I've come here, I've had a great experience. The food is delicious. Of course, the chicken is the real deal, and it comes with sauces and two sides for a very reasonable price. I also really love the ceviche (any of them) and empanadas. 

The service is impeccable as well. I once came as a party of 9, and they took our orders and brought out our food in lightning speed. It only took them an hour from the moment we walked in to the moment we signed the check and were ready to leave. It can get crowded, so a reservation would be good to secure.
author: Charlotte H.

description:
Split the ceviche pescado and half chicken with fries and veggies on the side.
Amazing, my fiance doesn't normally eat chicken and she absolutely loved it. Ceviche was some of the best I've ever had. Fries were good, grilled veggies were awesome

Service could have been a lot better. Slow, didnt seem to care very much
author: David R.

description:
My stomach hurts. 

They lost our reservation so they ended up seating us by the door and told us we had to be out in 45 minutes. We ordered a variety of different things including Mac and cheese, chicken, salad and some other appetizers. Everything was brought at once. No one checked on us throughout our meal and then they brought us the wrong check. Do we sound slighted? The couple next to us had the same thing happen to them... 
I will not go back. Not only was it a bad night out, the food did not have great flavor and my stomach hurt for the rest of the night...
author: Anne D.

description: Delicious food / worse service ever !! It's too bad cause the food is always very good but unfortunately the 2 last times I was there the service was terrible :-/ waiting forever to have someone giving you a menu, then again for taking your order, then you wait again to get the food delivered ! I had to deal with at least 3 different servers.. I hope they will make changes in their management/service because it used to be one of my favorite restaurant in SF.
author: Stephanie R.

description: Really amazing food! Went with a group of six and we all shared a bunch of dishes including ceviche, the rotisserie chicken, polli papas, and two beef dishes. Everything was fantastic, and the service was pretty fast!
author: Emily P.

description: Fabulous is Lauriann welcoming and gracious cuisine is as great as it is served and full bar weekend B's
author: Sean P.

description:
We've been to Limon Rotisserie a few times now and have visited the Folsom location as well as this one on Valencia (just down the street from Craftsman and Wolves)...obviously this is our favorite location for that very reason.

We have tried quite a few things from the menu, standouts include: 

The Pollo a la Brasa- tender, moist, flavorful! Delicious.

Carne a la Parilla- My favorite! The smoky flavor meat acquires from an open flame is one of my culinary turn-ons. This plate has it! That flavor is accentuated by the beans and the sauce. Excellent.

Carne Empanadas- flaky but not dry. The meat filling is flavorful and moist. Really good.

I'm not a drinker but I really enjoyed the couple of sips from my partner in dine's Pa Bravo Yo. I look forward to ordering my own next time around. It was sweet but not overly so and not too strong.

We have tried other things on the menu but they are only "ok" to me. They weren't bad, I just was expecting a little more:

"Lomito" Saltado- The meat for this plate is sauteed, it's missing that "umph" that grilling would bring to it. The meat was tender but it's not infused with flavor, a little bland by comparison. I know I would have liked it more if it was grilled. I think the one at La Costanera is grilled. 

Chicharron the pollo- being from Guatemala I had a different expectation when I read "chicharron". I expected something crunchy, what we got was tender slightly crispy morsel of chicken. It was slightly redundant to order this and the Pollo a la Brasa.

Truffle Mac & Cheese- The truffles were buttery. I wasn't wowed by the cheese they used. A little "thin", I thought it would be richer.

Ceviche Mixto- It was pretty good, but didn't stand out from other ceviches I've tasted. I'm not a big fan of fish. The seafood tasted fresh and was served with a tangy marinade. 

The Sangria was one of the stronger ones I've tried. I would have liked it better if it had been sweeter.

Service has always been attentive. I like the set up at this location better. Seating at the Van Ness location is a bit claustrophobic. 

Parking can be tough. I'm tempted to try out the location on Third St. where I anticipate parking to be easier.
author: Jose U.

description:
I always hesitated to come here due to some of the reviews as it relates to the service at this location. SiMilar to the other locale, the food was perfection and service was not bad. I actually felt the service at the Other location was worse than at this one. The reason why I'm not giving five stars is because I felt rushed...very rushed during my late lunch at this location.

I ordered my favorites: half chicken with a side of white rice and yuca. Ceviche de pescado and Lomo Saltado. Flavors were delicious the meats were cooked to perfection the ceviche was fresh and tasty. No complaints. Servers were always checking in to make sure we were doing ok throughout the meal. I just felt everything was rushed...like they wanted us out of there fast! But other than that was a really good experience. We had some of the cream puffs for dessert, giving a nice ending to our first meal at this location.
author: Elizabeth D.

description:
Came here for the first time for my birthday lunch last Sunday.. and it was AMAZING!!! For a Sunday I was expecting it to be packed, but it wasn't too bad.
Our group tried a little bit of errythang:

Sangria was the best! It wasn't too heavy with the wine taste, it was light and refreshing.. it didn't taste like any sangria I've ever had..

Rotisserie chicken was so good... especially when you dipped it in the red and yellow sauce (I have no idea the names.. but the red one had a kick to it!) The chicken was perfectly seasoned - not too salty, and moist. ;)
It's served with 2 sides, we chose yuca fries  - bigger than I thought they would be.. they were more like wedges and I think there were only 4-5 pieces, and the sweet potato fries were hella good! Crispy, light and not oily..

We tried both kinds of ceviche:
The cold one with tiger shrimp and fish was so good. You could taste it's freshness and the lemon/lime juice it was prepared with was perfect. One of my favorite dishes!
Crispy ceviche was fried sole that wasn't overly battered that you could still taste the freshness of the fish... it was definitely top 5. 

Truffle mac n cheese  was a sleeper hit. It was creamy but not too cheesy.. And the taste was on point.

Lomito Salteado with the french fries and onions? BOMB. Make sure when you take a bite, it's with the onion, french fry and beef.. the mix of flavors and texture is perrrfect.

Chicharron was really good too. Crispy, not oily and mixed with those dipping sauces made it even better!

Empenada was probably my least favorite... don't get me wrong, it was good.. I've just had better.

I had a great experience here and I'd definitely be back.
Our server even gave me some birthday candle glasses - lol. A lady even stopped at our table to let us know her husband had turned 80 something and he didn't even get a pair! lol

Bonus point for the server for turning on the niners game for us!
author: Gizelle P.

description: Made a reservation for two for Limon on the recommendation of a friend who said this place was amazing. Unfortunately, it did not live up to expectations. Between the two of us, we split a half-chicken with Yuca fries and beans and rice, as well as an order of Paella. The chicken was decent, although definitely nothing special. The sides did complement it very well. The paella was decent, but definitely not as hearty as I was expecting. We were still hungry afterwards, and split two desserts, something we usually never have room for. The desserts (chocolate cake and bread pudding) were much more delectable than the main courses. We also drank a Pisco sour each, which was fairly decent.
author: Vishal K.

description:
Food = Very good

Service = Very bad

I'd give them one star but the food really is too good for that.  But I can't abide being ignored until I actually have to go up to ask why it's been half an hour since I ordered and nothing has appeared.  To top it off there was not even an apology, the waitress ran and hid for the manager to take over and he didn't bother apologizing either.  

I can't abide a place that thinks that because it's the hip fashionable place to be it can get away with poor customer service.  They'll be around for a long while I am sure but I won't miss them when their bad service finally catches up with them and they go under.
author: Alan S.

description:
LOVE this place! I tried this place out for the first time last weekend and it was an all around great dining experience! We order veggie empanadas, chicken ( which comes with 3 different sauces YUM!) sweet potato fries and yuka fries.We cleared every plate! Writing this review is making me want to head back down there this weekend! The place was packed but out waiter was attentive and friendly. 
 
Fantastic food, great service and fun atmosphere make this a 5 star place!!
author: Nicole H.

description:
Came here once on a Friday night without reservations and could not be seated because they were completely booked for the night. So the second time we decided to make reservations and come for an early dinner at 5:30pm with Hubby and his parents. The place was empty except for another couple and it didn't start getting busy until around 6:30.  

We got seated promptly upon arrival and our server was super friendly and great at recommending some dishes for us and answering all our questions about the food. I'm glad to say we were not disappointed! The food was delicious and reasonably priced. We also got a pitcher of sangria and it was very yummy!  

Hubby got the half chicken, which was delicious! Including the sauces it came with.  The inlaws got the chicken as well and the Lomito which was also delicious. The fried yuca was perfect.  I got the ceviche which was good but not impressive. I recommend the chicken and the Lomito instead and along with the  fried yuca and the grilled veggies as sides. We also had dessert and those were not actually Peruvian so that was disappointing but they were good. We got little cream puffs and this other mango custard thing. It was really sweet but we all shared it so it wasn't bad. I don't think I could eat that by myself. 

I will definitely come back here for the chicken and the Lomito. The only downside is they don't have a happy hour.
author: Ireri L.

description: I wish I can taste everything in one visit. All we have ordered was great specially the beef tongue, ceviche, Chicken rotisserie... We will be back soon and explore more of the flavors of Limon!
author: rey S.

description: FOOD POISONING. 'Nuf said. Plus overly acidic ceviche burned my lips and I love aji, rocoto, etc. Cute but dangerous place. Is give zero stars. Stay away. Find a better Peruvian spot.
author: Maria Elisa M.

description: Besides the fact that it was extremely loud and crowded, this place served as excellent food as always. Grilled chicken and ceviche...Life could be worse.
author: Linn L.

description: Love the food. Nice to be there with friends. Although I don't drink alcohol I was glad they had piscosour the melon one was tasty and they have outstanding desserts.
author: Serg L.

description: The ceviche is a must and so is the mango lemonade! The food and service is fantastic! Ask for Roberto!
author: Hoda T.

description: (See pics) Updated review. Great that now all Limon Rotisserie restaurants serve the same great rotisserie chicken and side dishes. The ambiance here is more upscale than the original one. Service and food are equally friendly and delicious, respectively.
author: T L.

description:
Three of us had dinner here on a Friday night.  We couldn't get a 6 p.m. reservation so we took a 5:30 p.m. reservation.
The restaurant was bustling when we arrived but not full.  We were given a table at the back near the stairs.
Our waiter arrived promptly and gave us water plus a pitcher of water.  He returned a few minutes later and took our order.
I wasn't very hungry so I just had a mixed green salad and chicken empanadas. My friend had fried calamari and chicharros as appetizers and paella.
Our meal arrived promptly and looked delicious.  I quickly discovered that the greens had not been shredded and when I tried to cut the salad with a knife and folk, the salad bowl tipped over.  So I used my bread dish for my salad.
The empanadas were crispy and hot, but the chicken filling was bland.  That surprised me because Limon specializes in rotisserie chicken.
But my friends like their appetizers and paella very much.  They also split a pitcher of sangria which was a lot for two people so they were pretty buzzed when we left.  I had a small sip and thought there was too much alcohol in the sangria.
So, two out of three of us really enjoyed their meal.  Next time, I will order something different.
author: Philip C.

description:
This used to be a really great place to eat. Now it has fallen victim to hipsters and skank. Don't eat here if you want to
Have a conversation. The music is at club level and it feels like you are dining in a bar. We lasted about 5 minutes. If you are 22years old and just want to cruise in a bar scene then this is the place to go. Anyone with good taste and self respect stay away.
author: Lori K.

description: The food is fine, the service is horrible. Four people for dinner. The main courses came out at 4 different times. We had 2 different servers for our table and neither knew when the other had taken an order. Too bad. It could be terrific. Not again.
author: Rich S.

description: Chicken combo was well seasoned, with great sides, the larger portions sizes are enough for 2-3 people depending on how much you can eat, but the sides are not very large overall.  The atmosphere was robust, with a lot of noise throughout the restaurant.
author: Jonathan C.

description:
Surprisingly cheap for the variety and quality of food that you get. I come here somewhat regularly, but had my last Birthday dinner at the Valencia street location. They were really accommodating given the fact that I kept changing my reservation on them (organizing friends for a birthday dinner is like trying to herd cats, people). 

We ordered the whole chicken, a couple pitchers of sangria (which was delicious by the way!) and several side dishes. The ceviche is a must-have. Everything I've tried so far has been tasty. Each person walked away with a $30 tab feeling pretty satisfied. I highly recommend for large groups! The service is quick too.
author: Patricia Q.

description:
Delicious food, we visited with my wife's family from Peru, and this food is really great..   my wife said "this food is from a restaurant that knows how to cook Criolla food... this is the closest to a good Real Peruvian food"

This is the 2nd restaurant we visited,  and so far the best.

We had Pollo a la Braza, and it was excellent. We also ordered Lengua a la parilla it was delicious,  Seco de Costilla really good, Saltado to de Lomo really good and Ceviche de Pescado Awesome! !!!

We will be back soon again!!!!


Highly recommended. (Si alguna ves quisiste comer comida Peruana que de verdad sea Peruana,  este es el lugar.)
author: Juan C.

description:
Love this restaurant.  We went here for dinner and ordered different appetizers and shared 2 entrees. Everything was delicious and superb. for 4 appetizers, 2 drinks each and 2 entrees our bill came out to 120 for 4 people. It's definitely affordable and so worth it.
I love thier Inka pisco sour! I can drive like 10 of those. Will definitely come back ehre again.
author: Claudine V.

description:
02.26.11

I'm a sucker for ceviche.  Ergo, definitely a sucker for Peruvian food.

Party of four, 3:00 p.m. on a Saturday.  Little did I know that Limon was going to be packed to the brim.

Took 15-20 minutes before I got my water.  This is after we got our food.  I know you're busy, but really?

The order:

One ceviche mixto (with fish, calamari and tiger shrimp).  $9.75

One chicharron de pollo - basically Peruvian fried chicken.  $9.75.  My fave!

One seco de costillas - boneless beef short ribs.  Two big pieces of tender meat.  $8.75.  Not really worth it.  The flavoring was a bit off.

One carne empanada.  Comes two per order.  Make with sirloin.  Yum to the max.  $7.75.

One calamares rellenos.  Calamari stuffed with tacu-tacu.  $9.75.

Side order of fries.  Add a coke and two mimosas.

Almost happy campers!

Total damage for four: $83 minus $40 groupon.
author: Jenny L.

description: Good place for dinner.  Extremely loud.  Chicken and the yucca fries were good.  Tuna tartare was also good....loved the taro chips.  The lomito saltado was good, minus the soggy fries.  Just eat the meat.  I wasn't super impressed with the Mac and cheese but I think I'm in the minority.  Just wasn't cheesy enough for me, too much on the creamy side, and definitely not enough truffle flavor.  That said, I'd still come here again to try other dishes.
author: Debbie L.

description: Haven't gotten my table yet but when putting your name down, demand to see the telephone number they put down so they can't use the wrong telephone number excuse to skip you.
author: Vance K.

description: Sooo good. The chicken with all the best sauces. Really good vegetables and the beans and rice mixed together for you! The crispy chicken on fries was on small plate menu but like a meal in itself. Good prices and great cocktails too!
author: Brittni Z.

description:
I have come to this restaurant multiple times now, i was never disappointed!

Try the yuca fries, and the papas fritas which are very good sides!
Get the mushrooms and truffle mac and cheese are delicious!
Sangria is good too!
For dessert, the Chocolate Bandido is a must eat if you like chocolate!
author: Arnaud H.

description: Came here Saturday 9/26 at 10pm, seated by an extremely rude hostess with shoulder length-black hair. She was easily the worst part of our experience, being short with us as we asked about a wait, and not acknowledging us as we left as she looked down pretending to be busy. This is the second time I've encountered snobby hostesses at this restaurant. The rest of the waitstaff was friendly, some more than others. I ordered the pollo a la brasa and the lomo saltado. The lomo saltado was very salty and hard to eat, and the pollo a la brasa was decent. As good if not better than most Peruvian restaurants I've been to in California, but as somebody of Peruvian descent, it's hard to say that it's great. I'll be back to try some other dishes, but the management seriously needs to get the front of house staff in check.
author: Emily A.

description: I came once and loved it. I came back to share with friends and the lady at the front door wasn't very pleasant so we left. I won't be back. Thankfully there are several locations lol
author: Eshawn S.

description: Good place to try Peruvian food in San Francisco. Lomo saltado, seco, tacu tacu, ceviche and yuca fried are my favorites for this place. Mushrooms, arroz con mariscos and octopus (a little bit chewy) are worth to try. For dessert, chocolate cake. I found tres leches uneventful.
author: Julian E.

description: This place gets NO STARS what so ever from me honestly, but I had to at least give it one just to post the review. First off. It took almost 10-15 minutes after being seated to even be asked if we wanted somethings to drink. After ordering, we still hadn't received our water, only food. We asked for the SECOND time and still nothing. The waiter decided to serve other people and just stand around chatting with the host at the front door. Also, when I finally Called the host over and she got us our water after asking for the THIRD time she had the audacity to not even properly poor the water away from the table and ended up spilling it all over AND IN MY FOOD. when I mentioned it to her she said " oh it did, I'll get my manager" didn't even apologize. Waited almost 5 mins and no manager came to the table nor did she touch base with us again. The same waiter who was originally suppose to bring us water checked on us and I brought it to his attention what the hostess did and he said he'd replace it... Brought me the food and after asking for it to go, I'm STILL waiting for a to go box .... Wow. By the way his name is John.... Or so he says.
author: Katherine S.

description:
I came here with my beautiful girls for quality time and fine dining. The place is really cute and cozy and the service was somewhat great. By somewhat I mean that our waiter felt like he wasn't really pleased to be working that night.

The one thing I loved the most was the Ceviche Nikkei de Atun! Definitely a must order!
author: Debra T.

description: Don't go to Limón expecting a real Peruvian experience. I would describe it more like a modernized version of Peruvian cuisine.  They offer a tapas concept, when in most Peruvian restaurants you get very large portions. In any case, the food is really good. The rotisserie chicken is amazing. I'd say the best I've tried in years. I liked it even more than most rotisserie chickens I've tried in Peru. Very good Pisco Sour too. I will definitely go back. Shame I don't live that close!
author: Moni D.

description: The food here is amazing and the service is great. This is one of my favourite places for lunch on the weekend because the food is outstanding. The one thing stopping this from being a regular place for me and giving this five stars is the very loud music, which makes it difficult to talk with friends and upsets for my baby. This place is not good for children because of the loud music.
author: L M.

description:
Baby it's cold.

Holiday favorite remix: http://www.amazon.com/Baby-Cold-Outside-Kooba-Remix/dp/B000QPIRO0

Unfortunate dining mix: Good food ruined by not so good pacing.

Almost a great meal highlighted by an excellent chicken soup, sweet potato fries, signature roasted chicken and pinenut accented tuna tartar.

If only each dish had been brought out with the right pacing. Everything came at once. Soup was prioritized. Everything else got cold.

Couldn't shake the feeling of being rushed and being subjected to a standard script by a seemingly friendly staff. Authenticity was somewhat hard to decipher.

Fortunately the company, table by the window and the house sangria were all top notch.

Just not enough to make up for an otherwise chilly experience.
author: Jason B.

description: I gotta say my first experience at limon was great. The food is so good, the rotisserie chicken is so tasty. Today though the service was below average, I was waiting sitting and flagging the guys down for a good 5-10 mins before anyone took notice. I gotta say the food is still really good but the service at this specific limon was below par. Definitely will not be coming back to this certain location.
author: Julius F.

description:
Won't be back.

If you want good Peruvian food in San Francisco, skip Limón & go to Fresca instead.

I've had my share of Peruvian food, and restaurants of this quality that I've been to don't last long.

They earned an extra star for being gluten educated & knowing not to put the béchamel sauce on the quinoa small plate dish, however.

We went on a Sunday night, without reservations (gasp, the horror).  The hostess said all the tables were reserved but offered us a seat at the bar near the entry door that kept opening and closing and letting the cold air in.  Since it was about 40 degrees outside we thanked her & were just going to head to our pre-selected "Plan B" - Frjtz down the street.

She then offered us another bar-type table  which we accepted, which was nice, another half star there.

But!  There were six tables upstairs that were never seated during our stay.  Maybe those are just for the Fri & Sat nite crowd? Or maybe the servers didn't want to go up & down the stairs.  Who knows?

My husband ordered the Lomito Saltado (cute: since it's a "small plate" item, I get it - Lomito instead of Lomo) Ha...not!

Again, their Gluten Free knowledge showed through by advising me it was made with soy sauce, but that was already indicated in the description, so it wasn't like added info or anything.  I was a bad Celiac & threw caution to the wind & tasted it anyway.

The fries were incredibly soggy and gross.  I spose it was from being stir fried in soy sauce. Ugh, the fries in Lomo Saltado should not be soggy and wet!  

Overall, the dish was salty, soggy and unappetizing.  There was no distinction between the fries vs. the meat vs. the onions.  Just one soggy, salty mess.

The Quinoa dish was tasty, as was the Ceviche Mixto, although they kept referring to it as Ceviche Limón, so I'm not sure what we actually got in the end, or if the name for the dish was interchangeable.  Weird.

But those two dishes alone would not bring me back.

I'm sorry I cheated on you, Fresca, I won't do it again.  Please forgive me....
author: Liz K.

description:
We had 8PM reservations for 6 at Limon on Saturday.  It was busy, yet not overwhelmingly so.  My friend asked us to be seated below because he was hoping to get the more lounge-y seats.  We were not so lucky.  Our seats were at the bottom of the stairs, which wasn't horrible, but towards the end of our meal, I was ready to go.  I started to feel claustrophobic and muggy.  As for the food, it was good, but not great.  We ordered:

whole chicken - good, but a bit too salty.  i couldn't eat the skin b/c it was that salty.  bummer b/c i looooove the skin.
ceviche de pescado y camaron - very fresh and tasty
chicken, beef, veggie empanadas - veggie and beef were the best
lomo saltado -eh it was mediocre.  wouldn't order it again
tacu-tacu - yummy!  i liked it b/c i needed some carbs 
yuca fries - always tasty

Overall I liked my meal here, but didn't love it.  Service was excellent as well.  I just felt very heavy after our meal due to what we ordered, lots of fatty, greasy, and deep fried items.
author: Susie K.

description:
Been here several times and so far everything I've had has been DELICIOUS! Last thing I had is the lomo saltado. Wow melt in your melt thinly sliced beef cooked with red onions, tomatoes and fries. I like to order a side of white rice with it as well. 

Like every other yelper has mention the sangria is theee besst! Way better than the overrated cha cha cha. And during happy hour the sangria is only $2.50.. Score!
author: Laura I.

description:
LOVED it. delicious food that was ready super quick.

Sangria was a little too sweet for me, but was still tasty!

Very cute spot, attentive waiter, not too busy on a Thursday at 8.
author: Christie B.

description: Stopped by for some drinks and light food. Got pisco sours, a salad and some ceviche. I just got back from a trip to Peru a few months ago and the pisco sours were just as good as in Peru! (they're all a little sweet for my taste however) The salad and ceviche were alright. I think their other menu items looked better. They're super busy though - so they must be doing something right.
author: Max K.

description: Trendy place with excellent service and great food.  Started with a Tiradito as an app, the mangos really gave this favorite dish a welcoming twist, very good.  Ordered fish of the day as the main course, filleted and deep fried Sole, and yuca with a red dipping sauce that sealed the deal, so good.  Will definitely be coming back!
author: Ruberli C.

description:
We went on a Monday night, and they were able to seat us without a reservation.  Ordered the whole chicken, which comes with two sides (truffle mac & cheese, and yucca fries), an order of ceviche mixto, a beef empanada and tacu tacu.  We also opted for an additional set of sauces.  We also ordered purple corn antioxidant juice, the name of which escapes me.

I do not know what they do to make this chicken sooo delicious, but I'm half-seriously wondering if it would survive being FedEx'd to the East Coast.  The chicken is remarkably tender- just tender enough that it's almost falling off the bone, but not so much as to be messy. (Not that we cared. There WAS licking of fingers at our table.)  

Our waiter was Harry;  he was very polite and attentive. The food came quickly, and Harry followed up to make sure we had everything we needed.  

There were two small items that made this dinner less than perfect. One was the noise level. Harry was being very kind to explain the various sauces, etc. as we hadn't been here before, but the noise level made it really hard to hear him.  That's a bummer, because he really seems to know and care about the food, and that's an important part of the dining experience.

The other was the young guy (possibly a host who had just come on duty?) who kept coming to the table asking to take our dishes while they still had food in them.  There were other tables open, so I'm not sure why he was so interested in us finishing up, but NO, you cannot have that last yucca fry, Host Guy! Get your own!

Going back. Totally going back.
author: AD J.

description:
Planned a birthday dinner for 10 around the holidays. Laurina, the coordinator, was very easy to work with and made the planning easy for me. I also had a cake that was delivered 2 hours before arrival and nothing went wrong, so I was very happy. 

We went with the $27 prix-fixe family style menu that consisted of:

Tuna Tartare
Ceviche Mixto 
Mix Green Salad
"Lomito" Saltado - top sirloin strips (yum)
Chicharron de Pollo - crispy pieces of chicken (a bit dry)
Pollo a la Brasa - roasted chicken (yum)

Overall, the dining experience was good. None of us had been here before and we enjoyed the food very much. But, even though we had a reservation and most of us were at the restaurant ready to be seated, we didn't get seated until 45 mins almost an hour later. My guests were getting impatient and hungry. They could work on this better. Other than this, I'd love to come back and try other dishes.
author: Cindy W.

description: They have amazing drinks and delicious ceviche!! The empendadas are also to die for!! I heard that they're supposed to be known for their rotisserie chicken but I personally didn't favor it as much as their other foods. The chicken was dry and though the seasoning was good, it didn't come off as being special.
author: Vanessa Z.

description:
Limon (both this location and the S.Van Ness location) are solid. I like this location because it never seems that crowded. The other location feels more packed in for my taste.

You can't go wrong with their sangria and ceviche. Otherwise I'm pretty sure I've always just gone with what the server recommends. I really liked their jalea (fried seafood dish) and chicharron de pollo. The only thing I didn't really like was their lomito saltado--I've had it twice and the meat, while tasty, is a bit tough/overcooked.
author: Christie C.

description:
I cant believe i havent reviewed this place yet!! Ok ive eaten a lot of things here but only a few really stand out:

1) the mother effing rotisserie chicken is truly a gift from god. I get it 1/2 size with the side of yucca fries and vegetales salteados. Then i pray i wont eat the entire half chicken by myself in one go, so i can have left overs the next day.

2) the ceviche is spot on

3) the mac'n'cheese. I know its random, but its great.

4) really yummy cocktails.

This place is UNBELIEVABLY affordable. I eat and drink  until im exploding and i still rarely pay over $20 

The ambiance is crowded and loud, so just be prepared for that!
author: Shayan S.

description:
Came here for my mom's birthday dinner after hearing great reviews. We had no trouble getting a reservation 1 week in advance for a Sunday night. Unfortunately, traffic was a little backed up due to the Folsom Street Festival so we were running late. I called the restaurant to let them know and the hostess made a big stink about it so we were really surprised when we showed up and it was not even close to full. Then, they refused to seat my mom and grandmother until we had all arrived (we dropped them off in front and went to park the car). I understand this policy for very busy times, but the restaurant was less than 50% full so that seemed a little ridiculous... And finally, they sat us upstairs even though there were plenty of tables downstairs. Since we had an elderly person, they definitely should have seated us on the main level without us having to say something. 

Now you're probably thinking: that sounds like a horrible experience! Why would you give it 3 stars? And the answer is simple, ceviche. The minute we took our first bite, all was forgiven.

The fish ceviche was phenomenal, the tuna ceviche was excellent - it was like happy limes dancing around in my mouth.

Paella was good, salads were good, sangria was great. But mostly it comes down to the ceviche.

Note: portions are small. For a party of 4 we ordered the ceviche trio, 2 salads, and the paella. We should have ordered 1 more thing.

Second note: the restaurant is noisy. Like, difficult to maintain a conversation noisy. 

Third note: parking is a huge pain in the butt.
author: Rachel E.

description: Great food.  The big negative is the level of noise in the restaurant.  It was so loud it was painful.  We will not be going back because of the noise. Maybe, we'll do takeout.
author: Todd G.

description: Really good girl drinks I got the passion fruit diva drink.  The appetizers are delish, really enjoyed the ceviche. I got the halibut as an entree but it was a tad small my friennds shared the whole chicken which was very well roasted.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
One of the most enjoyable Peruvian restaurants in the city. The atmosphere is always bustling, warm and toasty, and love the support for the GIANTS.

Drinks - best Pisco sours!
Food - my favorites are the ceviche de pescado, Chicharron de Pollo, and the empanadas (carne and pollo). The empanada sauces are a great compliment.
Service - always excellent! The front of the house staff took care of us and checked in a few times to see how everything was. Bartenders are friendly.

(My comments only apply for the bar area since I've only sat in the bar. Highly do recommend reservations as it does get busy in the evening especially if you have a group of 4 or more).

Enjoy!
author: Cindy A.

description: Great food. The sauces make it!
author: Todd K.

description: Ceviche and pisco; we took also fries and chicken and chocolate dessert, great choices!
author: Inés E.

description:
Great Peruvian food and great service.

We got here early (in SF, do early or late dinners to get good food without the long wait) and had a great time talking to our waiter (and the owner?) about our mutual love of Peru. 

Ordered Pisco Sours, chicha morada, empanadas, lomito saltado, anticucho de res, truffle mac n cheese, and seco de costillas. All were really delicious - you really can't go wrong - and when we accidentally got an unordered dish, we got it for free! 

Favorites: lomito saltado, anticucho de res, and the empanadas

Reminded me of my time in Peru (which was amazing, I miss it!), but I wish they could serve cuy (guinea pig) :)
author: Anna R.

description:
Good food . Small portions

Had various dishes to try out.

Ceviche - Great taste , fresh seafood , good heat

Truffle Mac and cheese - The dish that blew me away . The dish that we had to reorder again.

The main dish - the chicken was seasoned well but think that the other dishes are well worth trying instead of what this restaurant is claimed for.

Fried seafood platter - cant go wrong with it. crispy and lightly battered
author: Michael T.

description:
3.5 stars

Limon serves gorgeously prepared Peruvian fare. Although I enjoyed our dinner, there weren't many other menu items that floated my boat; the likelihood of me returning is very close to nil, but if you enjoy a variety of ceviches and seafood shooters, this may just be your new favorite haunt.

We ordered
- Quinotto de Vegetales ($10): a quinoa & veggie risotto cake topped with mini sweet potato chips. Flavorful, creamy & good for sharing.
- Pargo Rojo ($20): crispy red snapper & coconut rice. I didn't try it but my BFF said the sauce really made the dish. Interesting presentation. 
- Pollo Latino ($19): i prefer white meat chicken, so thankfully they were serving a chicken breast instead of their usual chicken thigh that night. Served with mashed potatoes, which I did not touch because I ordered a side of the most perfectly crisp, delicious sweet potato fries ($5)-- five stars for the fries! 

Limon's flavors danced on my palate, but their prices are a little steep compared to other Peruvian restaurants (i.e. Fresca, Mi Lindo Peru, etc.)
author: Fancypants X.

description: This is the favorite place of my husband to eat Peruvian food in SF , we came because the recommendation of a friend and we aren't disappoint at all... Empanadas are yummy and the only reason of why I don't put 5 stars is because the chicken is too salty.... The dipping sauces are my reason to always come back.. Service is very good as soon you get there you don't have to wait for eat!!
author: Celeste B.

description: This is a must stop place for rotisserie chicken in SF. Out of the 2 places( South Van Ness & Valencia) this place is more suitable for larger groups. I highly recommend the pollo a la brasa with aji sauce; get the whole chicken, it's worth it. Aside from that the lomito saltado and truffle Mac & cheese are amazing! Sangria here is pretty good but I'm more of a beer person.
author: Paul Keith R.

description:
I've never tried Peruvian food before, but I really enjoyed Limon. A friend of ours took us there on this trip and I'm  glad he did. 

You order a half or whole roast chicken (we split a whole between 5) and get sides.  The roast chicken was some of the best I've had. Moist and flavorful, just the chicken flavor itself with a little salt and pepper. The yucca fries were crispy and fluffy t the same time, the truffle Mac and cheese was quite tasty, although I could have done with a bit more truffle. The ceviche was excellent. 

My glas of Cava was the one sour point.  It was drinkable, but barely. It kind of tasted Kendall Jackson-y. Tried a sip of a pisco sour and it was delightful.
author: Clare F.

description: Fresh and delicious, amazing flavor combinations, everything is superb. From the cocktails to the chicken, this is one hell of a restaurant.
author: Laurence S.

description: Best rotisserie chicken in the city. Love their sweet potato fries and dips, all the dishes in the main course section, like their ceviche. Their mango pannacotta inspired me to try and make the dish at home. Highly recommended.
author: Balu V.

description:
After reading numerous bad reviews about Limon, I walked into Limon with low expectations.  I was pleasantly surprised by their good service and food.  With bare hardwood flooring and high ceilings, the room acoustics makes the place pretty laud, so I had hard time hearing people across the table from me.

FOOD:  I really loved their pork chop (chuleton carlitos) ($19.25)!  Seasoning and meat quality was excellent.  Maybe one of the best I've had in the city.  pargo rojo (deep fried snapper) ($24) was also very good and nicely presented.  Ceviche Platter ($24) was a bit expensive, but it allowed us to try various ceviches.  Calamares Limon ($11.25) is a braised whole calamari stuffed with aji Amarillo, shrimp, and bread crumbs.  This dish made me think that there are some subtitle similarities between Peruvian food and Japanese food.

All in all a solid restaurant.  I'll be going back here for their pork chop.  Having Bombay Ice Creamery (http://www.yelp.com/biz/3qDhJHZhgaRsDYg6dUjN1Q) a few doors down is also not a bad attribute.
author: トモ T.

description:
This is my first time at a Peruvian restaurant. Limon Rotisserie has definitely set the bar high!

The food is absolutely delicious. Every meal was made so well (my girlfriend and I packed away ceviche, steak, macaroni, fries, and more, lol) and served rather quickly. I also had a pisco mixed drink which was to die for!

The entire staff is attentive, respectful, and courteous. They made our experience very wonderful. They all regularly checked on us to see how we're doing, if our food was okay, if we needed more water, etc. At one point I had accidentally dropped my fork on the floor and a waiter had given me a replacement and picked up the one on the floor before I could! They're that good!

I was satisfied overall and look forward to taking my husband and daughter there soon!
author: Shizuka O.

description: I digged the Pollo a La Brasa and Pisco Sours. My wife wasnt pleased with her meal, however I cannot recall what she ordered.
author: Steve M.

description:
This review is for the location at 524 Valencia.  We went as a party of 12 and we could not order from the regular menu.  We were forced to pick from one of their fixed price menu which does not offer much variety.  I am normally a big fan of Limon, but they certainly deserve 2 stars for this experience.  Here is what they did wrong.

Not allowing us to order from the regular menu
-For people that never tried Limon, you are limiting your potential for them to come back in the future.  The fixed price menu does not have the variety that you can choose from on the regular menu.

Acting like you are doing us a favor
-At the end of dinner, some waiter came up to us and told us, you made a reservation for 15 people and I am only charging you for 13.  There is no reason for him to even mention that.  

Serving Fries and Lomo Saltado
-Not allowing us to order from the regular menu is absurd enough.  Serving lomo saltado and fries does not make sense.  Lomo Saltado already has french fries.  Why not serve Yuca Fries or Sweet Potato Fries?  Variety is good.  Let your customers try different options.

Limon serves good food, but this experience was unexpected.  I will definitely not come back to this particular location.  I will return to South Van Ness.
author: Ernesto F.

description: I've been here a number of times! There is absolutely nothing to complain about. The #1 dish is the chicken, if you only get a quarter, you'll regret it, go for the whole! Lychee pisco sour is the best drink there. Service is amazing, they clean your table so you won't have to sit and chat with a bunch of crumbs and droppings on your table top. Ambiance is loud, but how can it not be with the sangria to chill out the vibe.
author: Vic A.

description: Really tasty food with unique sauces! Their roast chicken was very juicy and flavorful, and the sangria was the best I've ever had! We also got some side dishes that were very good too, like stir-fried vegetables, flavored rice, and sweet potato fries (sorry it's been awhile don't remember them exactly).
author: Elly L.

description:
Lunch is quite tasty here. My friend and I stopped here based on my friend's recommendation. The lunch menu is reasonably priced and it's quite nice inside as well. 

I ordered a chicken dish whose  name escapes me. All I remember was the taste and the tenderness. We also split the grilled veggies which had tasted better than any other veggies I've ever had before. My friend got a seafood dish which he really enjoyed as well.

One of my other friends met up with us too and he said it reminded him of a place in Marin. Apparently, everyone was there to redeem their Groupon. Heh. I'll be sure to come back again if not for lunch, then maybe for dinner.
author: Amy J.

description:
I've said this before...I'm famous in Peru.  Love the place and the place love me.

Food was great here.  Ambiance was nice, modern clean but cozy.

Started with a pisco sour.  It was well done and reminded my of Lima.  It was $12 though, so that brought me back to SF quick.

Had some fish ceviche as an app.  Fresh fish and not too sour.  I love Peruvian ceviche.  

Also had to try the lomo saltado since it's my favorite.  How can you go wrong with french fries in stir fry?

For dinner I had the rotisserie chicken.  Was juicy tender and tasty.  

The only reason I didn't give it a 5 was the price.  I know, it's SF, but still...I've been to quite a few Peruvian spots in LA that were more reasonably  priced.

I'll be back.
author: Jay L.

description: I came here on Monday with a big group for lunch.  There were 10 of us.  We had reservations for noon and the table was all set when we arrived.  The service and food was excellent.  We ordered the Roast Chicken with Yuca Fries and Tacu-Tacu. OMG so good!  We also had the Ceviche Mixto, Seco de Costillas, and Carne a la Parrilla.  Two orders of each and it was just enough for everyone.  Perfect lunch!  I will definitely come back again.
author: P G.

description:
Being Peruvian, I am extremely picky about the Peruvian restaurants that I go to. I mean, hello, my mom's cooking? You gotta be AMAZING to compete with that magic! 

Anyway, a couple of friends took my partner and I out to dinner at Limon where neither of us had never been.  Our friends are also Peruano and swore that we would love the food at Limon. And let me tell you, they were RIGHT. Everything on that menu is DELICIOSO. We of course had the chicken, with ceviche, tacu tacu, emapandas, yucca, the list goes on. It was an unbelievable explosion of Peruvian goodness in my mouth and I can't WAIT to go back! 

Be sure to make a reservation and if you go during the weekend, be prepared to have the waiter hover over your table once you are done eating because there is a line out the DOOR of peeps trying to get their "Chimpum Callao" on.
author: Stefanie M.

description:
Their small plates are super filling and provide a mix of different flavors and textures. Overall the food was 4/5. To be frank, I've never really had Peruvian food before but I have had paella and their Arroz con mariscos was AMAZING. 
Their half chicken comfortably fed four people and was tender and juicy. 
Their empanadas are amazing. I recommend the Veggie. the sauce on the side provided a nice kick to it. 


THE NOISEE!!!- it was way too loud. We did come on a Saturday night around 7:30 but still, the place was extremely loud! my brother was 12 inches from me and I could hardly hear him. 

service- everyone was super welcoming! the food came and went by fast. it was frustrating not being able to hear our waiter though. 
The manager worked just as hard as the other staff. it was awesome to see him hands on at the restaurant
author: Tarlon K.

description:
This is a review on an experience Saturday, October 13th at 6:35pm. I write this in the hope that the restaurant manager will identify the hostess working that night.

My girlfriend organized an amazing surprise birthday party for me and ten friends. This had been planned for over two weeks. 

Upon arrival, we were informed that we were "inexcusably late" by the hostess (note we arrived at 6:35pm for a 6:30 reservation). She told us that she had stated on the phone earlier we needed to be at the restaurant at 6:30 on the dot. However, upon followup we found that "policy" was never stated - we were five minutes late and didn't think it would cause an issue.

Here is what ensued:
- I had to get involved (it was my birthday) and tell her we needed to be seated.
- Only upon threat of a bad Yelp review did she listen to us.
- Upon being seated, service was poor, taking our drink order over twenty minutes after initially being seated.
- We were also informed that, because we were "late," we would need to be out of the seats by 8:30. 

Note the last point was not a big issue, we can eat in two hours. But for them to give us such an attitude was unforgivable. The food was alright; it reminded me of a cheap quality (but overpriced) version of Fogo de Chau. 

It made no sense why you rushed us, Limon. You weren't even full on a Saturday. You ruined my birthday and I will be outspoken in my belief that you are a poor eating establishment. There are such better options in this area - avoid Limon at all costs.

Please speak with the server who was working at 6:30pm on Saturday, October 13th. Shame on you.
author: Andrew M.

description: Heard great things about Limon and have been looking forward to eating here for years... opentabled for a 5 top at 8pm for a 9:30pm showed up at 9:40pm to have then tell us the kitchen is closed. Website says open until 10:30pm and Yelp shows live time that they are open until 10pm. They could have rejected our reservation or called. Every business should honor their reservation especially I'd they are technically supposed to be urging for another hour. Bummer for them.
author: Shiho F.

description:
Meh. 

There, I just saved you three paragraphs. Keep heading south to Mi Lindo Peru at Mission & 30th. That's where you're going to find great Peruvian in the city. I had always been leery of Limon, which had all the gloss of a trendy Mission eatery, but not much to offer otherwise. A lack of locals is always a red-flag in my book, and so I passed by Limon every time, until tonight. 

My bartender kept flirting with the two single ladies seated next to me, but I had to practically throw my glass at his head to get any service. The food was spiced well, but ultimately uncreative, and the portions were incredibly small. I think they expect you to order family-style, but I don't think there was enough food on my plate to split, let alone for one person to eat and feel satiated. 

No matter what you're looking for, there are other spots that do it better. Want great Peruvian? Mi Lindo Peru. Want a flashy place in the Mission? There's plenty. Want a flashy place in the Mission that serves great Peruvian food? Open it yourself. I'm sure I'll be there.
author: Kevin B.

description:
This place quite honestly might be my favorite place in San Francisco to eat. Amazing latin cuisine but my favorite is without a doubt the Ceviche. The lime and spice is perfect and I could eat it all day every day. I've been coming here with my family and friends for over 8 years when they used to be a small hole in the wall off Mission street and i'm pretty sure i'll still be giving them my money for more of that ceviche.
