for good measure, the lomo saltado is my second favorite dish :)
author: Victoria K.

description:
Came here after making a reservation for a party of 8. Seriously good stuff at Limon Rotisserie. Our party split a carafe of the sangria, which is normally 6 servings, but they were kind enough to make 8 portions for us. 

We ordered the pollo a la brasa, lomito saltado, chicharron de pollo, ceviche mixto, seco de costillas, carne a la parilla, and the truffle mac & cheese. Beats me why they would have mac&cheese here, but it was delicious so I'm not complaining.

All the dishes were winners but my favorite was the chicharron de pollo. Also get the yucca fries
author: Eugene Z.

description: The chicharra cocktail is fruity slightly sweet and refreshing. The bartender is awesome he dances as he cleans to rock en espanol throughout his shift. I did not try the food but the cocktails and ambience were welcoming and warm.
author: Carlitos W.

description:
Great food. Try any of the ceviche, chicharrones de pollo, and of course the rotisserie chicken. The food came extremely fast. 

Our waiter was pretty nice and helpful. The hostess... not so much. Seemed to not care about anyone in the restaurant both times I've been here, and was noticeably rude. But 4 stars nonetheless because the food was so good.
author: Munaf A.

description:
A friend of mine was in town, and another friend of hers suggested dinner here. I honestly didn't think I was gonna like it, because I generally don't like tapas (there's something pretentious about it...I know douchey, right?). Anyways, I was pleasantly surprised and really enjoyed the dinner I had here. 

I'll pretty much eat anything so whenever I go out to a "shared" meal w/a group of people I make it easier and stay out of the decision-making process. That being said, food was ordered, it came to our table (at a pretty rapid pace I might add) and I devoured. At the time I didn't know exactly what was ordered off the menu (obviously I knew what I was eating), so I'll check out the menu now to refresh my memory and give a few notes: 

-Cerviche mixto (I'm pretty sure this is the cerviche we had...I know we did have a cerviche): Very good! I like cerviche in general and all the seafood in this one tasted fresh & the citrus wasn't overpowering. 

-Tartara tuna: I LOVE tuna tartar and when it's prepared properly/fish is fresh I'm easily pleased, and this one was yummy! 

-Cuasa de Pollo: Now this was something that was different & intriguing (to me anyways), and was DELICIOUS! The whole look of the dish certainly grabs your attention and the combination of flavors (chicken salad, potato, & avocado) went well together. 

-Costillas Nekkei: Beef on a bone is always delicious, and these ribs didn't disappoint. The sauce was tangy, but not overpowering. 

-Chicarron de Pollo: Probably my favorite dish we tried. I LOVE fried chicken, especially when it's really crispy, which was the case here! 

-Jalea: Fried food w/tartar sauce = yum. 

-Empanadas: This was the one dish I was a little disappointed with. I like empanadas, but I thought these ones were a little overcooked & the meat was kind of dry (we had beef). 

We ordered two portions of each of these to split amongst 7 people (we may have ordered one other dish that I'm forgetting), and I was pretty stuffed by the time we were finished (another reason I usually don't like tapas is because when I'm done I still feel hungry, but that wasn't the case here). In addition to the food we split a few pitchers of sangria. It was definitely delicious, but it was a little sweet. This is usually how sangria is at restaurants though, so I understand. 

The service & prices at Limon are great/reasonable as well. I would definitely consider coming back here with a large group when hanging out in the Mission. Oh...I should also note we did make a reservation here (the day of) and if it weren't for this we probably would have had to wait a long time, so if you're coming here I would do the same.
author: George A.

description:
One of our favorite places in San Francisco! We have been to all 3 locations in the city and love them all equally. The rotisserie chicken with papas fritas and sweet potato fries are simple, delicious and almost guilty-free! The ceviche mixto is juicy, spicy and just the way we love it! The Sangria is always amazing and we always get a pitcher.. or two ;) Love this place.

P.S. - You can often see the owner at the Valencia location, as well as the one in the Bayview. Really nice guy! It's nice to see that there are still restaurants that have not only nice staff but also nice owners.
author: Karina A.

description:
Had lunch here today  and loved it. The service was great. It wasn't too crowded at 1 pm and we had a nice table location.

I will say the only thing weird  was a waft of laundry odor, maybe fabric softener?  Every  20 minutes or so the smell seemed to permeate the restaurant. 

We had the red snapper ceviche, half a chicken, French fries and beans-rice side dishes as our chocies.   We really liked the trio of dipping sauces, too

This restuarant is a little nicer inside vs their other one (we had been to that one  three times). Same menu.  We liked all the Pablo Sandoval references.

November 2, 2013

We ordered a whole chicken, tuna tartare, beet and potato salad and the mushroom empanadas.  Everything was excellent.  The only neg this time was a HUGE wait between the appetizers and the chicken arriving. 

 It was weird cause people that arrived way after us received their food and left!  The manager kept apologizing.   Fortunately we were in no hurry

We had walked over after seeing Carrie The Musical, which was over the top awesome!  So we were in good mood!

P.s.  Did not smell fabric softener this time, but there was no soap in ladies room....

February 28, 2016

The service was dismal today.  And we smelled the laundry fabric  odor STILL (we smell it when we sit in the back part of restaurant). 

It's so annoying when they serve appetizers with the main course. And never refill your water.  The service is really out of it in here.

We liked the food tho.  Chicken with rice and beans and the sweet potato fries and the red snapper ceviche.  All good. All a little too pricey and now it's only TWO dipping sauces.
author: Foodlover B.

description: One of those unfortunate types of places in SF where you pay too much and leave hungry. Portions are really skimpy. Loud / noisy atmosphere. Ceviche (mixed) was regrettable. Signature chicken was simply not very good. Avoid.
author: Alex L.

description:
Peruvian - fresh - seafood - lime - 'pucker up' shooters - ceviche  

Lunchtime on Valencia started with trio shooters with lime juice that will get you ready for fresh seafood.

Snapper ceviche was excellent...not diced aka Poke style but slices of the freshest fish....nice presentation with large corn beans?

Red Snapper on bed of potatoes and freshly cooked spinach.  Excellent.

Chicken skewers were tasty, but I would stick to the seafood at Limon.

Worth a try.
author: Randall F.

description: My husband and I just celebrated Valentine's Day here on Sunday. Came to another Limon location without a reservation  lucky for us we only waited 15 minutes. Since we had already visited Limon I knew I wanted to try the Pollo A La Brasa so we got a whole chicken with side salad, rice, vegetables and French fries. The food was ok. The service was ok but the sangria was DELICIOUS! I honestly think this place doesn't pay attention to detail as much as it use to because of the high volume and turn over they have. I would have rather gone to the third street location.
author: Stephanie N.

description: Mmmmmm sooo goood. Small portions tho.  We had the roast chicken (of course), truffle mac n cheese, tacu tacu, yuca, chicken empanada, and ceviche mixto. Would def order mac n cheese and ceviche again. Also the chicken (of course). Pass on the empanadas. Good, but overpriced for nothing special. Drinks were tasty too, but again a rather small glass. Service was a little slow at first but once we ordered the food came out FAST. So I thought we'd have a somewhat leisurely dinner but we were pretty much stuffed in less than an hour. Wanted to lounge around and let our food settle but felt rushed. We were asked at least 5 times if we were done in the next half hour. Finally we said yes and check appeared in 2 seconds. For me, this would be a good special occasion spot, less so an any-night-of-the-week-dinner.
author: M S.

description:
4.5 Stars

I love Limon.  I have used them for catering orders in the past, but ate at the restaurant for the first time with my husband and 2 friends a few weeks ago. Wow. It is such a great deal for the quality of food. The atmosphere is bright & clean.  We were able to have dinner for 4 + drinks for under $100- which is hard to do in SF.  Our server was friendly & competent. I have nothing bad to say.
author: Christy L.

description:
Yummy rotisserie chicken--the dark meat falls off the bones. There's an industrial grill with chickens on the spit that keep turning non-stop so your order comes out in 10 minutes or less. Yummy sides--the tacu tacu (mashed beans and rice) was memorable, as was the mixed veggies.
Didn't try their small plates but I would come back and give it a go.

I was quite intrigued by their cocktail menu. I had the Divina (sp?) Passion, which was a semi-sweet blend of Huamani (Peruvian Brandy) with mint and lemon. Didn't try the Pisco sour so I can't speak about it but go ahead and give it a try--a Peruvian restaurant SHOULD make a decent Pisco sour, but I guess you don't know until you try...

Pretty cool hipster-y ambiance (it's the Mission, come on) and of course, park on the street if you can snag a spot. I'd recommend this place for a dinner with friends. Would have to talk kind of loudly if you're on a date here though.
author: Brandy A.

description:
We came to Limon on a rainy, busy Friday night, we had a reservation for 8pm. We were seated promptly by 8:10. We ordered the ceviche mixto, veg empanada, tuna ceviche and whole chicken. The food was excellent and so was the service. Our waiter was VERY attentive. In addition, the owner was circling the bar to make sure every table was ok. A nice touch. 

My only complaint which I hate to post since my experience was overall very positive. The food was brought out way too fast. We received our apps within 5 mins of ordering--which was great since we were hungry BUT the chicken came out before we were halfway done. It made us feel rushed and as though they were trying to get us in and out asap. As soon as the line died down they definitely relaxed a bit on the over zealous service. 

I am giving it a 3 and would be at least a 4 star otherwise--shame, damn shame
author: Ben K.

description:
"I dont always eat tapas, but when I do i prefer Limon Rotisserie" 

I know this place is a Peruvian restaurant, but it is tapas style servings. I came here last night for my BFF birthday. The parking was horrible, so i recommend having your driver drop you off! Once we got seated we spent the next 20 mins arguing on what to order. Thankfully Limon had a great staff that helped us order our food in a nice timely manor. 

We must of ordered all the dishes, so i am only going to talk about the ones that stuck out to me!

Rotisserie Chicken - Hands down this is the best rotisserie chicken i've ever had since i had my first rotisserie chicken from boston market. It was the 3 dipping sauce that put it over the top. 

Ribs - Meat falling off the bone - finger licking good. Maybe the best BBQ i had in the city. 

Mac and Cheese  - This one is iffy for some people, but i liked it for my sides. It taste nothing like mac and cheese. It taste like macarronii in a clam chowder sauce.  

This place was excellent. One of the finer dining experiences i've had in SF.  I recommend this place to Anyone 5 and older. 

Eat Responsibly My Friends.
author: Ryan R.

description: Please hirer a professional bartender that knows how to make drinks. When charging such high prices, the drinks should be made correctly. 12.00 for Skye vodka and soda is ridiculous. Skye is normally a house vodka. Plus please don't use crushed ice. Ice cubes are used in cocktails that cost that much. The food was great but why did my two bad drinks have to costs more than my dinner. Oh, I had two because the first was so poorly made.
author: SF Native T.

description:
If it weren't for a Groupon, I would have never found this restaurant so thank you Groupon! I got Lime and Limon confused when I saw the daily email come in so by a stroke of inconvenience turned luck, my boyfriend and I found ourselves at a pretty classy brunch place. The decor reminds me of trendier restaurants in the Bucktown area of Chicago and holds its own in the hipster ridden epic center of the Mission. 

We had a 2 o' clock reservation but found ourselves in the neighborhood earlier than anticipated and they accommodated us graciously anyhow. Sneaking a peak at their Open Table online reservation screen though, I could see that we were the only reservations that shift. The place was packed nevertheless so this must be a go to spot for the locals. There were double dates, business lunches and groups of friends everywhere with sangria and beautiful small plates that were tempting to the eye.

I guess I'd have to agree with some of the other reviewers when they say the service was a little scattered and mismanaged. Our server didn't know how to handle a Groupon from an iPhone app and even went so far as to suggest that it get printed from an internet cafe somehow instead of just taking the number down like he was suppose to. I imagined his managers didn't explain how Groupon worked so I couldn't really hold it against him this time. 

We ordered a mango lemonade and capirinha to start with sweet potato and truffled mac and cheese appetizers sides to go with the Ceviche Limon and the Pescado Limon. The mango lemonade tasted more like a watered down mango juice with no hint of lemon at all but still tasted wonderful anyhow. I can't comment on the capirinha 'cause it's not my drink of choice but it did look good. I will point out there was a hair on top of my glass which was a bit odd and I knew it wasn't my short black hair either...ewww. 

I will say the shining accomplishment of this place has got to be the ceviche though. It would be truly sad if a Peruvian place couldn't get their act together on ceviche and I wasn't disappointed at all. The cuts of fish were just the right size to not get drowned in lime juice but at the same time, soak up enough juice to get cured. I really shouldn't have ordered mac n cheese with cold fish but I couldn't help myself and I'll probably find myself doing that again next time. The mac and cheese is very very heavy so I'd advise everyone to eat the ceviche first.

I had just a taste of the snapper which flaked off in my mouth and was seasoned quite well. My only wish was that the portions were a little smaller like tapas that way I could order more plates and try out more ceviche dishes in the future.
author: Jessica K.

description:
I have been to Van Ness Limon Rotisserie before, am a big fan of the food of this brand. Their rotisserie chicken is a must try. Also strongly recommend Yuca Fries and Lengua a la Parilla.

However, the service in this Valencia shop, especially the front desk is a big disappointment. Not only did we wait more than doubled the time they told us (20 min claimed and 50 min actually), the waitress was also very impatient and full of attitude.
author: R.J. H.

description:
I've been here several times.  My favorite dishes are the ceviche mixto, saltado, and empanadas.  I pretty much order these every time I go to a Peruvian restaurant.  These dishes aren't extraordinary, but they are consistently delicious each time I come here.  I've also had the rotisserie chicken and the steak, which are both very good too.  This place is affordable and the waitstaff are very attentive and show lots of appreciation for my business.  The many guests I have brought here over the years have never been disappointed.  

Came here with my boyfriend last Friday night.  Left this place stuffed having spent less than $50.  Not bad for quality food in the city.
author: Gloria Y.

description:
The food was above average. We had a party of 7, so there was a nice selection of dishes to judge by. Two different types of Ceviche, the Whole Chicken, Arroz, Yuca Fries, Papas Fritas, Chicharron de Pollo, and Carne a la Parrilla - all decent. My favorite of the bunch was the Chicharron de Pollo. 

It's gets crazy crowded in there, but they do a great job of seating you pretty quickly and bringing your food out fast, probably because most of the food doesn't seem to be made to order. That's not a complaint, just an observation. 

My only real issue with Limón is that they rush you in and rush you out. They want to turn the table asap. They're at your shoulder moments after you sit down asking for you to place your order, and once they start cleaning your table, the check is in front of you immediately. With so many people waiting behind you to be seated it's understandable, but then no one likes feeling rushed. All in all, though, it was a positive experience.
author: Don W.

description:
Came here on a saturday night with two friends and didn't have to wait for a table. We got a pitcher of the sangria which was flavorful and had a good kick of brandy in it. It was a little sweet for my taste, but overall pleasant. 

Other things we ordered: (can't remember all- sorry!)
-Veggie empanadas: Warm, flaky, tasty
-Papata Fritas: I was expecting them to be more like a homestyle patatas fritas which I've had at other peruvian places. These were more like french fries... tasty, but nothing special.
-Truffle Mac-n-cheese: Not sure what about this was peruvian, but it was delicious!
-Chicharron de pollo- great crispy skin  with soft, moist chicken. Really loved the onion/pepper salad on top. 

The two dipping sauces were good. I preferred the green one. Not sure what was in them though.

Overall good place. 4 stars because nothing other than the macaroni WOWed me and the prices are a little high for tapas. 
(I really wish I could 3.5 star something)
author: Vinitha R.

description: I had a Lomito and it was awesome! Juicy and fresh and it tastes good. The place is nice and welcoming. I recommend this place.
author: Shiva G.

description: Great atmosphere and staff, excellent tapas and drinks...had the Sangria and Chalaca Mule.
author: Pam W.

description:
I adore this place. Never wrote a review or checked in before because my hands are always saucy and greasy from the deliciousness. By the time I'm able to touch my phone again, I've passed out in contentment. 
Reservations are recommended but they can usually squeeze you in. Service is very efficient and courteous. The food however will knock yer socks off. Might want to get the extra sauces 'cause you might fight over them. I pour them on everything.
author: Nicole O.

description:
This was my first time here and I dont usually write a review until after my 2nd or third visit. I decided to write one for Limon because I liked my first visit based on the food and service. Everyone loves this place so why shouldn't I?
I really loved the empanadas
author: Ray B.

description:
Limon is fantastic!

My boyfriend and I actually went there on our first.date.ever. back in November.  We both remember enjoying the food, but obviously with a first date situation, you're focused on other things.  So we wanted to give it another try, just to make sure our initial memories of the place were correct.

We went again last night with a friend, and we agreed that almost everything we ordered was amazing!  We started with the Chicharron de Pollo, red snapper ceviche, Lomo Saltado, sweet potato fries, veggie empanadas, and a pitcher of sangria.  The food came out SO quickly, it was almost alarming...but it was all perfectly seasoned, and perfectly cooked.  So their kitchen definitely knows what it's doing.  And our sangria was delicious!

My favorites were the Lomo Saltado and Chicharron de Pollo.  The Lomo Saltado had a soy-based sauce with french fries and onions, served with rice.  It was so good, I think I could have eaten the whole plate!  The only complaint was that I think there were only like 4 pieces of perfectly-cooked, medium, juicy steak in the whole dish....I thought it could have come with more, especially for $17.  But the dish was so good that I didn't mind.  The sweet potato fries were perfectly crispy but soft in the middle, and served with two delicious dipping sauces, and I spent awhile trying to decide which I liked better...they were both really good!

Anyway, after eating all of those things, we were a little bit hungry still, so we ordered the seafood stew.  Unfortunately, it was not our best dish of the night...which was too bad, because everything else before it was so fantastic!  Minus 0.5 stars for that.  It was mostly calamari, a couple of mussels and shrimp, and then just a salty broth.  I wasn't too impressed.

The busser was a little bit over-zealous...I had to tell the guy twice that we weren't finished eating a dish before he would have quickly swept away the last bites of my delicious Lomo Saltado!  Yikes.  After those two times though, he would make sure to look at me and ask before taking something away, so that was good, though slightly awkward.

I would say the service was just fine, but not anything special or over-the-top.  Our guy seemed friendly enough, but maybe could have come back a couple more times.  We didn't mind too much though, because we were so happily munching away on sweet potato fries.

This was the first time I sat upstairs, and it's a nice ambiance.  The ceilings in the loft section are a bit low, and the lighting was flickering a bit (I'm pretty sure that was on purpose), but it was trendy and all the groups seemed to be having a great time.  Good atmosphere, for sure.

We skipped dessert after looking at the menu, because nothing jumped out at us.  Also, Bi-Rite is only a few blocks away....so we went there instead. :)

I definitely don't understand the 3-dollar signs price on here.  Most small places were ~$7-13, and entrees were $17-25.  With 3 people and all that food + a pitcher of Sangria, we only paid ~$35 each including tip.

I would definitely come back here for the Lomo Saltado and the Chicharron de Pollo.  And the sangria.  Mmmm.
author: Caroline K.

description: Great place and they made a new fan out of me. Definitely get your meal started with the sangria. Our table ordered a bunch of plates; whole chicken, yuca fries, ceviche, lengua, and the seco de costillas. We enjoyed each of the dishes equally and wish the portions were bigger. We left with our bellies satisfied, but not full. The family style ordering definitely makes it possible to order a wider range of foods to share with one another, not to mention make it a more social dining experience.
author: Chris H.

description:
Came here with Edwin, Silvia, Richie and Justino after watching the Giants. 

Been to the one in S VanNess so I pretty much know what to expect.

5 star to the staff who waited on us, excellent recommendations...what with the Chicken, the sides, empanadas and desserts.

Will definitely comeback.
author: Malou C.

description:
On a spontaneous double date night, my group of four marched down Valencia for dinner at this "positively Yelp-reviewed" establishment. From the outside, the place looked bustling with patrons. Since we hadn't made reservations, we had to put our name on the wait-list and they let us know it would take about 25 minutes, which isn't too long considering it was a Friday night and we hadn't reserved a table. 

Valencia has all sorts of unique stores an avid window-shopper like myself can easily lose herself in so the 25 minutes of waiting went by rather quickly. Back at Limon, our seats were not yet ready, but there was room at the bar so we ordered drinks: sangria and Peruvian beer. 

The sangria was perfect: chunks of sangria-marinated apples and oranges floating in a swirl of burgundy bitter and sweet goodness. The Cristal Peruvian beer was refreshing, but as a fan of darker beers, it didn't hit the spot. It did pair very nicely with the fresh ceviche. 

When we were seated, the four of us went through the menu with a quickness (there were certain dishes that stood out with promises of palatability) and the server was attentive to our needs. 

We ordered: 

The Half Chicken with the Vegetables Salteados and the Tacu Tacu
Ceviche De Pescado Y Camaron
Chicharron De Pollo with the Yuca fries 

The white meat chicken was tender and juicy, full of flavor. The three aji sauces that come with the chicken were delicious to dip anything into. My favorite was the spicy, chipotle-esque sauce, but the biting cilantro and creaminess of the other two sauces were delicious to combine and dip strips of savory chicken into. The sauteed vegetables, mostly green beans, were delectable. I found myself picking off the tomatoes and red onions and swirling them in the aji sauces for a salsa in the my mouth. The Tacu Tacu was not especially unique to me, but perhaps mashed beans and rice don't compare too well with the spice and flavor of the chicken and the sauces. 

The ceviche was a favorite. Hours later, I can still recall the bite of that lime-infused  heaven. The shrimp was fresh and came in neat little slices that allow one to indulge in the flavor and quickly stick a fork in the dish for more. I ended up finishing off the ceviche, but I swear I was so tempted to hold the dish and pour the juice into my mouth for a refreshing spiced limeade. I would have done it, but table manners were recalled. 

As great as the ceviche was and as much as I had fallen in love with it, the Chicharron De Pollo brought me to palate paradise. Our boisterous, heavy laughter was immediately silenced by this miracle of heaven. Growing up with the Filipino cuisine, I was always tantalized by fried pork rinds, and I dared Ljmon's offering of chicken chicharron to bring me back to the crunch and flavor of my youth. It exceeded my expectations: the outside had the perfectly roasted texture and flavor but the inside was white meat tenderness.  Top that off with the Yuca fries, which my partner described as "fried mashed potatoes" (the Yuca root gives it that softened, mashed potato texture and when deep-fried, these fries are the gourmet version of potato fries). 

Since my group shared everything family style, we had enough room for dessert. My partner and I are big fans of panna cotta and I asked for the dessert menu, praying that they would have a form of panna cotta. 

Et voila! Panna Cotta De Mango. This light, creamy, gelatinous dessert was topped off with a mango jelly and displayed with ultra-thin slices of apple (which I believe were green apples because I tasted a little tart in there somewhere). 

The bill came out to $52 (yeah, we couldn't really believe it, it felt like we had dined royally!), and split that among four people and you've got a very affordable, extremely scrumptious meal!

The restaurant itself was crowded and a little too loud for quiet conversation, but you get your meal quickly (we got ours in less than five minutes) and I can't complain about the service. 

The four of us left the restaurant completely satisfied, but not bloated, and already making plans to try the "Lomito" Saltado with more Yuca fries and ceviche. 

After checking the Yelp reviews at the other locations (the Van Ness one seems to have higher ratings), it's shocking to think that it gets better because it was all awesome. Maybe I'll have to go to that location to compare, but I'll definitely be back for more!
author: Erika P.

description:
Rotisserie chicken and ceviche are great 
Can get quite busy so reservations are highly recommended
author: J D.

description:
I came here a couple of nights ago with a girlfriend after work to chill. I've been to the S. Van Ness location before, but not this one. When I got there, the hostess initially told me that the wait would be around 30 minutes since I didn't have a reservation. 20 minutes later, she called the two guys that put down their name right before I did. And after another 15 minute wait, I went and asked the hostess about how much longer and she told me there were still three groups before me. And then 5 minutes later she comes out to us and asks if we were the ones waiting for a party and when we said no, she asked for my name and then gave us a table immediately. There was a table of six that was empty the whole time when I was there. I thought maybe it was reserved, but in the end, they actually seated a party of four and then a party of two there. 

There was a soccer game the night we picked to go there, so it was actually extremely loud and very hard to have a conversation. But putting that aside, the sangria and the food was just as good as I remembered it. The half chicken was so tender and just fell right off the bones. So good. We also got the sweet potato fries and the rice with beans mixed into it. I am usually not a bean fan, but the rice mixed with it was so delicious. We also had the beef empanada. That tasted okay. However, I am a big fan of their mac and cheese. My friend even got it to-go for her sister. 

The food consistency was the same as the other Limón. And the location on Valencia is great. Lots of great activities. However, the service here isn't quite as good.
author: Jay L.

description: Went here for dinner this past Memorial Day weekend. Food was awesome! Had the chicharrone, ceviche, roasted chicken and lomo saltado. All full of flavor. Non are large enough for single person, but great to share. Just wish they had plantains..
author: Manny S.

description:
Was very disappointing. Walked in, sat down after 10minute wait (not bad?), 20 minute wait to order (okay, pretty long), and then after another 10min we were told there was no more chicken left... 

That's about it.
author: Jim C.

description: Just came here for my friends 33rd birthday and had a great time. They let me bring decorations before hand and set up. Service was a little slow but we were a large group. Props to the waiter who replaced my cocktail when I spilled it after taking just one sip. The delicious food doesn't hurt either. Just wish they served tostadas with the ceviche but I didn't ask, maybe they do
author: Alan M.

description:
Once again Limon pulls through - perfect shrimp ceviche in a red sauce that had a bit of heat, a side of cold veggies with goat cheese and had a few bites of the yummy steak.

But that shrimp ceviche was perfect for a hot SF day (yes, they really exist).
author: Jade W.

description:
The chicken are great. Will be happy to eat again. 

Another dish that I could not remember the name was also good. It's a small plate of seafood with spicy lime sauce.
https://s3-media2.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/Fb8t0czDFctqu7UED0XeXw/ms.jpg

The chocolate cake is also awesome. Our group of 6 finished the cake in 1 minute and ended up ordering another one.
author: Krist W.

description: The food is freaking delicious, the drinks are great. I'd give it five stars except for the fact that it's incredibly loud in the restaurant. I've been to two different locations and had the same problems hearing my date talking.
author: Mauna D.

description: This location of Limon Rotisserie is not worth the time. We got there and they said it would be an hour wait but kept pushing it back and ended up being over 2 hours and still no table. I think it's very unprofessional to keep your patrons waiting and not being remotely concerned about it. Avoid this location!
author: Rortanak S.

description:
fantastic service. a very well run restaurant. the food is good. i had the half roasted chicken with yucca fries and papa fritas. I should have gotten the sweet potato fries  instead of the yucca. the dipping sauces for the chicken were good. the sangria was fantastic. i thought it was way better than cha cha cha's. 

it is loud inside.

good value and a nice experience.
author: Henry Y.

description: They have incredible chicken!!!  And prices compare to other places on Valencia are much lower
author: Nataliya K.

description: I was lucky enough to walk in with a friend on a busy Saturday night and 2 seats at the bar were available for drinks and dinner.  We ordered a 1/2 chicken and an array of sides that were each amazing...especially the seafood side dishes.  The cocktails were great and I have already been back just for take-out.
author: Joshua G.

description: The best Peruvian carne I've ever devoured was here on a business trip to the bay area. I ordered the Carne a la Parilla and although the portion itself wasn't as big as i expectde, that was irrelevant to the amazing flavor packed into every bite of that carne. It was perfectly complimented by the tacu tacu, salsa criolla, and tasty sweet red wine sauce. The decor in the restaurant itself was nicely put together, good ambiance on a Sunday afternoon and let me not forget the Pisco sour was also very well mixed.
author: Leean O.

description:
The best chicken I ever tasted!!!!  And the yuka fries are amazing!!!  It is a bit busy and service varies, but the food is truly worth it.  It won't break your wallet either.
Don't try to get in without reservation, you'll be waiting for hours.   
Overall, Highly recommended!
author: Maya E.

description:
I came here for date night on Friday and had a fantastic time! 

Such a lively crowd and the food was incredible. The rotisserie chicken was moist and flavorful. I loved the sauces that came with it. The ceviche we ordered was perfectly sour and satisfying. The lychee pisco I ordered was so yummy. 

I love this place!
author: Casey M.

description:
I read the reviews, but ultimately persuaded by a friend of mine who gives me his best of the best check list for places to eat. I can defiantly see why this is in the top 20. 

Lunch on a sunny Friday, suave waiter comes to table and suggests items. My female companion is getting a glimmer in her eye, oh my my. I ask what he would order and make my selections based on that.

Starter:
Ceviche Limon, luscious/fleshy mini slabs of perch, callimari, shrimp and hominy in an incredible citrus and herb sauce. The mixture of the citrus brought out an amazing aftertaste that I couldn't put my finger on. I could have sworn it must of have coconut water. This was simply the best seafood that has gone past my lips in memory. Just give me a big bowl of this and I would be a happy camper.

Main:
Lomo Saltado, tender sirloin with onion, tomato and shoestring fries. Perfect and filling. Tomatoes were barley cooked and held it's texture without falling into mush. Chef knows what he's doing, flavors were balanced.

Dessert:
Profiteroles, OMG moment. These little puffs of heaven filled with a smooth creamy filling with a light caramel sauce.

Baros 20 year tawny was smooth with a nutty finish, a really nice pairing with the pastry. I was lucky to be the first pour from the bottle. Bartender poured another glass in which the staff took  small samples from. They smiled and nodded with approval. I liked seeing this, knowing that when future patrons ask they can actually give a real recommendation. 

I'm a big fan and will be back with friends.
author: Steve S.

description: My roommates and I come here for every special occasion. Our favorite items are the yucca fries and whole rotisserie chicken. My roommate Gina insists on getting an entire lomo saltado to herself - it's that good. And yes, we definitely down a few pitchers of Sangria! Nice atmosphere and service. Can get a little loud at night, but that's to be expected for the small space.
author: Rachel B.

description: I never complain about anything but tonight this guy got on my nerves. After my gig me and my friends were hungry and we wanted Peruvian food so we decided to go try Limon for the first time and also I wanted to see what's the hype all about this Peruvian restaurant, we get there and I asked the waiter if we can can get some chips or bread please and the guy said to me OH THAT'S A PERUVIAN THING WE DON'T DO THAT. I was like, I thought this is a Peruvian restaurant, he ignored my comment and ask what do you guys wanna drink. I wanted to be Like George Lopez and say FTP, my first and last time there. By the way I'm Peruvian (Lima - Jesus Maria)
author: Rich E.

description:
Busy Friday evening on Valencia...round and round we drove!

Doorman/manager (not sure who he was =) flagged us down on our third attempt and told us to take the front VIP spot. Wow, what a great way to start the meal before we even stepped in the door!!!

We were seated on the second level, right above the kitchen. Smells great for the first 5minutes, afterwards...not so sexy!!!

Food/drinks:
Sangria (fruitty and zesty)
Cecviche Mixto (seafood mix)...hmm hmm good!
Paella (tomato rice: absolutely devine) tho, it's a VERY small serving
Stuffed calamari...TORN: cuz I luv calamari BUT the stuffing was grainy =[
Whole Fried Snapper...not greesy at all, amazing!
Chocolate molten cake...one bite and your heart will melt!

Priced around $30 per person, not bad but this place still averaged a 3star for me...boohoo!
author: Vee V.

description:
4 of us came here for brunch on Saturday and the place was busy! Make reservations, otherwise you'll have to wait 40 minutes like we did.

We ordered a variety of their dishes, the shrimp and fish ceviche, beef, empanadas, lomito saltado, sweet potato and yucca fries, and a pitcher of sangria.

The sangria is really tasty and sweet. The food was pretty good and I liked the ambiance. Our waiter was a cutie too. The plates are pretty small for their prices so definitely expect to come out paying about $25-30 person for brunch.

Would I come here again? Maybe. Am I dying to come back? Not really. I feel like while the flavors were good they didn't tantalize my taste buds but if someone really wanted to try this place, I definitely wouldn't  mind coming again.
author: Betty C.

description: Luv the food! Lots of surprising bites! Have eaten here many times- first time upstairs. The noise level upstairs was off the charts as we were positioned between two large groups that were celebrating energetically!!!!!
author: Katherine T.

description:
Loved the fresh cerviche here, which may be the highlight of their menu. We ordered the red snapper, which looked better than it tasted. It was dry despite the sauce and didn't really have much taste. The sangria was delicious and STRONG enough that I couldn't finish my glass. 

This place is trendy with dim lights, good place for birthdays and dates. I am looking forward to going back!
author: Denise W.

description:
Fun n tasty foods.
Chicken
Vegetable
Rice
Beef tongue

Sauces were fun n real good

Service was good

Nice crowd
author: Sarah C.

description:
The ceviche mixto was fantastic! As a Peruvian who's eaten a lot of ceviche, this was amazing.

We also had the pollo a la brasa which was great with the sauces they give you. Their fried yuca was a great side.

The seating arragement was perhaps not the best. Our table was partly covered by a wall, but the eating experience was delicious enough for me to come back and give this place 5 stars.
author: Carlos E.

description:
I'd been wanting to try this place since forever and was finally motivated to drive out to the Mission by a Groupon. Overall, I'd eat here again but my most favorite Peruvian meals are best served at hole-in-the-wall establishments.  

I thought the Lomo Saltado  would be a standout but the beef wasn't very flavorful. The chunky tomatoes and onions were good. I just wish that their fries were thicker cut and not shoestring.

The Ceviche with fish and shrimp was yummy with plenty of lime but not overdone. Great aftertaste!  The Causado Pollo was okay at first bite until a few bites in and all of a sudden I tasted the flavor and richness of the potato. The chicken salad was simple but very complementary to the potato.  As for the Chicharon, how can you go wrong with deep fried chicken pieces?  The star here though is the dipping sauce making this a notch better.  I'd definitely pass on the out-of-place Truffle Mac and Cheese. It piqued my interest since who doesn't love a good truffle mac and cheese. But the key word is "good." And what business does this have on a Peruvian menu anyway? Hardly tasted any truffle nor saltiness in the cheese.

A few of these dishes are worth my return business so I'll be back Limon!
author: Anna R.

description: Limon is always good, no matter what you order. Ceviche is great, the steak is amazing, and the drinks are pretty damn good! I always make a reservation because it gets busy but they do require your whole party to be there before they seat you which is a bummer because you're basically waiting for a person in your party to park when you could be drinking! But aside from that, Limon is really great.
author: Chelsea R.

description:
Food is great, but CUSTOMER SERVICE SUCKS AND NEEDS MAJOR IMPROVEMENT.

Our waiter was SO rude upon first approach. We had to wait about 10 minutes before we could even order our main course.  We tried to look for another waiter, but none to be seen around our area. If we weren't so hungry, we would have gotten up and left. Throughout our meal, he did not ONCE check up on us to see how we were doing, ask if we needed a water refill (which we did), etc. Basically everything a good waiter should do, HE DID NOT.  So obviously I did NOT tip him because he didn't deserve it. I wish I had gotten his name to give to the manager so that he can be trained on how to provide better customer service.  I will not be coming back, and I will never recommend this place to my friends.
author: Janelle L.

description:
This is a Peruvian place I want to explore more. I think I had the more reserved items, chosen buy others, but I think I will like this place more if I pick my dishes next time. So I will give a min-review only...


Tiradito de Atun (sushi grade ahi tuna sashimi style in rocoto-ponzu sauce)
- very standard tuna app. Nothing special.

Pargo Rojo (crispy red snapper fllet, coconut fried rice & rocoto-curry sauce)
- this was a whole fried snapper, not just a filet. The presentation was so-so (fish on a plate) and the sauces were ok, but nothing spectacular.


The food was good, not great - but again - I did not get to pick. 

The other dishes looked very creative so I will go back and I have a feeling my rating on here will improve.
author: Aaron L.

description: Trendy restaurant with nice ambience. Signature dish is the succulent rotisserie chicken with flavorful sauces. Half chicken is just the right amount for two people and we even had some leftover. I don't usually enjoy white meat but it was juicy and sweet. The ceviche mixo is fresh and tangy, not too sour. The beef tongue is tender and flavorful. Delicious meal!
author: Cynthia L.

description:
The food was awesome. The only complaint from me is that we were seated in a small cove of the restaurant and when another table that was next to us opened that provided more space and would allow my GF and I to seat next to each, the waiter refused us to move seats. My GF also says the seats are too narrow (my GF is not fat FYI). 

Will definitely come back again thou, the food is fantastic and is very reasonably priced and is good place to take business clients and associates.
author: Mikee C.

description:
My partner wanted to take me for an afternoon drink. He said this is such a great place. We went in straight to the bar and ordered a drink. I told the bartender I wanted something sweet and he recommended a brandy based drink and I said I do not like brandy. The bartender said oh it's a great drink don't worry. He gave us our drink and needless to say we hated the drink. Now that is not why we are scoring so low just wait......
We told the bartender that we were not so excited about the drink and would he make us another. He said no problem. He than poured my drink into the pitcher and put my partners drink in the line up of other drinks. He than poured the pitcher into two other cups and served them to another guest. The guest saw the entire thing. Wow!!!! Needless to say the next drink was bad and we were unhappy and so was the other guests. Won't be back to this place.
author: Sammy H.

description:
Time to kill in the Mission? Looking to relax with a glass of wine and a quick bite?

Limon, go for it.

The bar stools here are the epitome of comfort and trust me I've rested atop my fair share of bar stools, I'm no Mormon. The cushions are like a foot deep, it's crazy. It cradled my ass like none other.

My brief taste and wine selection were on point. The servers I had interaction with were top notch, incredibly helpful and polite. They weren't disgruntled when it was clear I wasn't there for a full meal. Don't you hate that? You stop by somewhere and try and get a small appetizer and a beverage and the servers act like you're wasting their time? Not here, I was given bread and the full service just like I had ordered a five course meal.

Pure bliss if only for 20 minutes, my ass misses their heavenly bar stools. I'd come back just to sit there if they'd let me.
author: Justin N.

description: This is one of my favorite restaurants in the city. The best item on the menu is of course the rotisserie chicken. I always share a pitcher of sangria with friends. The price is reasonable.
author: Sal R.

description:
Being raised on Peruvian home cooked food, I'm a hard critic when it comes to eating out.  Well, I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of food and drinks served at dinner this week.

The plan was to order a snack and drinks and make our way down Valencia for a proper portion but the ceviche starter and pisco sour were so good, we decided to stay.  The ceviche mixto was just as my grandma serves it - fresh seafood, onions, lime juice, and just enough picante with corn and sweet potato on the side. It was fantastic! I wished the portion was larger.  We switched to sangria- again, just as my grandma serves it.  We also had the standard lomo saltado, which as a small plate doesn't come w/ rice so we went for tacu tacu.  All really, really tasty but I just wanted more.  Add great service from the hostess and waiter and they've easily sold me for another visit next time I'm in town.  I just wish we had this place in LA!
author: Tab G.

description:
One of my favorite places that's more affordable.

Incredible chicken and ceviche - especially for the price. Go with a large group and get the set menu if possible - or at least make sure to get the rotisserie chicken, ceviche de pescado, and chicharron de pollo.
author: Loren A.

description: The food and drinks were great and the service was good. The ambiance was comfortable, but what kinda blew was how darn packed the place is -- far from relaxing.
author: Bobby N.

description:
Do not go here if you have food allergies! I told the waiter about my allergy to peppers, and he gave me incorrect information about what was in the food. He did his best to make it up to me, but I was exposed twice. IdidnThe rest of the week was not a good time for my body as a result.

Limón, please train your staff better on this issue. If i had had an anaphylactic reaction this time, they would have learned the hard way.
author: Ingrid F.

description: Best sangria in all of San Francisco! Yes, I have tried lots of Sangria in San Francisco...
author: Mona T.

description: Portion size is a little bit small, but the food is awesome. All the staff are very nice and friendly. Must try their rotisserie chicken and lomito saltado. Jalea is one of my favorite in the restaurant.
author: Wilson W.

description:
I was with a couple of friends in the Mission district on this gorgeous Superbowl Sunday, trying to decide what to eat. One of them said that one of their friends raved about this place and that she always wanted to come here, so in we went.

Interior was on the darker side with neutral brown and green decor. A fresh ice display of oysters and crabs/lobster greet you next to the bar. 
After we got seated, trying to decide what to eat proved difficult because everything sounded delicious AND healthy. I noticed that a lot of their menu items had seafood in it, which proves to be a problem because I don't like seafood, but in the end decided to go for their butterleaf salad with shrimp. We even got a truffle macaroni and cheese to share amongst the three of us.

Let me tell you: if you don't know what to order there, GET the truffle macaroni and cheese. Elbow noodles were perfectly al dente. Perfect amount of truffle oil without being overpowering, with the perfect married amount of white cheese. Every morsel had a kick of flavor without being obnoxious. It was everything I had hoped truffle mac and cheese would be.

The butterleaf salad was great; came with little crispy pieces of potato(?) that stayed crunchy, despite being drenched in a delicious avocado ranch dressing. And the shrimp, though I really don't care for them, were clean and fresh. The girl who suggested this place got their ceviche which was incredibly fresh. She even made a comment of saying how she felt like we were at a restaurant off a warm beach eating the local catch; that's how fresh and clean it tasted. My other friend ordered the empanadas which ended up being a kind of disappointment; more of a tapas-sized brunch plate than an actual lunch.

Anyway, this place is a solid four. I've never had Peruvian food before, but I will definitely have more in the future, thanks to Limon.
author: Becky K.

description:
Never had a bad experience here.  All of their cevices are excellent.  My favorite dish is the Lomo Saltado, but every bite of food I've had at this place has been excellent.  

I've been there probably dozens of times over the years and I don't think I've ever had anything but a pleasant experience with the staff.
author: D D.

description:
Can't have a visit to SF without trying their chowder. Got the white clam chowder. My friend and I agreed that the broth was definitely awesome, but I think they needed to cook it longer because the celery was still crunchy. So when we would get a bite, it would be overwhelmingly celery-tasting.

Delish! If you get a sammy, be sure to get the chipotle mayo instead of regular.
There's a few resident pigeons both inside and outside the establishment but they don't bother anyone.
author: James T.

description:
Pro -  Great atmosphere and friendly staff.
Con - Portions are small and the food is just ok.
author: Mindy H.

description:
Fun place for a group dinner on Saturday night! The rotisserie chicken is fantastic, especially with the three dipping sauces (chimichurri and two aiolis). Two whole chickens for six people went fairly quickly, in addition to a bunch of sides and few other dishes. Lomito saltado was nice and savory, and I love yucca fries. The passion fruit pisco sour is delicious, as were many of my friends' drinks.

There were six of us for a later (9pm) reservation, but the food came out within 10-15 minutes and the drinks were flowing as well. Pretty good considering there were several other groups.
author: Aki N.

description: Honestly .. The BEST service I have gotten anywhere!! Very attentive ! I had the ceviche de pescado , yuca fries and tacu tacu! The food was amazing!!! The sangria was also very tasty!! I recommend this place to everyone! It's also not too expensive.. Reasonable for the the quality!!
author: Silvia S.

description: Every single item I ordered tasted amazing. The chicken, the yuca frita and the rice were delicious. The mac & cheese was out of this world. I ordered the pisco passion fruit drink, it was very tasty and we'll balanced.
author: Mandy B.

description:
Went to Limon on Friday. Surprisingly, at 7.30 pm to wait at all. 10 minutes later we would have waited for 30 minutes.
The four of us started with Pisco Cocktails and even though very strong they were fantastic and highly recommended by our fantastic waiter.
We tried their Ahi Tuna Tartar which was tasteless. Their Cebiche Mixto was amazing, pork ribs very good, Pollo a la brasa was well done and well marinated, "Lomito" Saltado - top sirloin strips was fantastic, the Chicharron de Pollo - crispy pieces of chicken was a tiny bit dry.
Dont choose this place if you want to enjoy chat as it is VERY VERY noisy

Overall a great place where we would go back.
author: Christophe K.

description: The chicken was melt in your mouth good. The truffle Mac n cheese is a must.Empanadas were also very yummy. Service however was bad they forgot my sangria twice.
author: Z W.

description: The chicken and sauces are outstanding!  Make a reservation though, as they get pretty busy!
author: Michelle D.

description: Always wonderful food. There chicken is the best. But avoid the weekends. Even with a reservation we felt hurried out. When they made a mistake with our order made me take the item off my child's plate to return to the kitchen. We had ordered vegetable empanada and was brought chicken instead. Found it to be rude that we were questioned if we had ordered the chicken by mistake. We had not. Was clearly there fault. Could have known what was in it till we cut it open. Will definitely go back but not on a Saturday night. BTW or reservation was at 5:30. Very early shouldn't have had someone coming every few minutes asking us if we were done with that.
author: Rebecca N.

description:
Came here with my girlfriend for dinner. Made a reservation beforehand. Restaurant wasn't too crowded when we arrived, but it was packed with a line out the door when we left a little past 8.

We ordered pretty much everything on the menu: ceviche, rotisserie chicken, empanadas, truffle mac and cheese, and lomito. EVERYTHING was great. I really enjoyed it. 

The only downside was our waiter (the servers were great though). We had to ask him for water 3 times and he was very uncaring. Other than him it was pretty much perfect. 

Spent about $30 per head.
author: Niran L.

description:
This is a great place to catch up with friends, perfect for groups of 4-6, but make sure you get a reservation because it's generally crowded and quite loud.

The food is all tapas-style, which makes it all the more fun to catch up with friends when you're sharing smaller plates.  And I've never had something there that I didn't like.  The sweet potato fries are fantastic.  The truffle macaroni and cheese is delicious.  The ceviches are fresh and tasty.  The lava cake, while not the best I've ever had, comes with a fantastic cookie and whipped cream.

Oh, and the sangria...yes.  Just yes.
author: Joëlle M.

description:
The food is 4 stars but the service is really a mixed bag.
Made a reservation for Saturday night at 6 so that my friends, husband, and I could meet up with my sister to celebrate our birthday (we share the same one!) My sister and her boyfriend were there on time and they would not seat her until the rest of us arrived. We ran about 10 minutes late, so we had our friend park the car while the rest of us got out and went to the hostess stand. There were two of them there, and they just kind of stared at me when I mentioned I had a reservation. They asked where the rest of my party was and I told them two were at the bar and the other two were literally right across the street parking. Again blank stares. I was not a fan of these broads, by any means, but they responded to my tone and seated us upstairs before everyone was there.
Our waiter was really great and took the time to go over the menu with us. We all had pisco sour mixed drinks and enjoyed them, although they weren't, by any means, the star of this place.
We enjoyed some empanadas, a chicken (of course), the lomito saltado, seco de costillas and some extra sides. The lomito saltado was really the best dish of the night, with tasty strips of beef on top a pile of onions and french fries. The empanadas were okay and the seco de costillas I was not a fan of as they tasted like crockpot stew to me (blegh - if I wanted that, I'd make it at home.) Others did like that, though. Sweet potato fries and rice & beans were good - wasn't a big fan of the yuca fries.
The chicken they are so famed for was pretty good, mostly juicy with some flavor to it. I really didn't think it lived up to the hype. I tried it with sauces to try to impart some more flavor to it but I didn't really think the sauces paired well with it. I was hoping for a more flavorful chimichurri sauce than what was served as well.
For 6 people, the food here went a long way, as the bill (including tip) was about 160. They add 15% gratuity here for parties of 6 or more, so we did not tip on top of that. I really hate when places add tip for you as I find it insulting. I always tip very well, but if you are going to add tip automatically, that's all you're getting. It is hard for me to believe that large parties come in an don't tip often enough to make it worth the 15% added tip policy. But apparently it does, as I know it is a very common practice (I just find it tacky.)
Our waiter was really nice and helpful, but after we were done eating, we started to get the "hint" that it was time for us to go. This, coupled with the hostesses, is what really soured me on this place. They came back, took our check. Five minutes later, came back, picked up the napkins off our table. Five minutes later, came back and grabbed water glasses off our table. I don't care how busy you are, that is just plain rude and bad service.
I will look for other Peruvian places.
author: Rachel B.

description: LOVE.  Sitting at the bar having a drink and eating empanadas is heaven.  I've been coming here for years and always have great food.
author: JJ M.

description:
Food is not that tasty 
Servers are good but really not impressive at all 
If you looking for something really good then this is not the place for 
I don't think I'll comeback
author: Michal S.

description:
Limon is awesome!  So much so that I insisted our annual extended family dinner be here this year.

Jose, the event manager, hooked us up with the prix fixe family style menu which includes most of the highlights on the regular a la carte menu.   Some of our party's favorites were the tuna tartare (we kept gobbling this up and asking for more!), chicharron de pollo, and pollo a la brasa with all the amazing sauces.  Don't forget to order a glass (or a pitcher) of the yummy sangria to wash everything down!

Desserts are not included in the prix fixe menu, but that didn't stop us from ordering multiples of the profiteroles, panna cotta de mango and chocolate bandido.  All were fabulous, but my favorite by far were the profiteroles.  Light and fresh, they were like little pillows of heaven!

Service was sort of spotty.  We didn't get a designated server even though our party was about 25 people.  I had to ask for my drink a few times before I was informed they didn't have the ingredients to make it.  However, the timing of the food was good.

Great place for some good eats and a nice place to have a shindig, especially around the holidays.  They don't have a minimum for groups, which most restaurants have around this time of year.
author: Sandee L.

description: Getting to be a regular here now! Their rotisserie chicken is the best thing ever, especially with rice and yummy yummy yuca fries. The sauces are soo good! We only ever order the chicken so can't comment on the rest of the menu - a reason to come back again :) only downsides are how noisy it gets and rushed service.
author: Pooja S.

description: I'm a big fan of Limón.  The food is really good, servers are attentive, and ambiance is relaxed.  My favorite items are the Championes, Chicharron de Pollo, Rotisserie Chicken, Lomito Saltado, and the Empanadas.  Perfect for a small group or date, or even just to grab a glass of wine and an appetizer.  Valencia street has some great restaurants, and Limón is definitely in the top 10.
author: Bud L.

description:
Very good food!
Service and atmosphere was excellent!
The whole chicken with the sides are a great meal to share. 

New favorite place!!!
author: Dawn C.

description:
Came here on a weeknight at around 6pm. We had a reservation but I don't think one was needed, it wasn't too crowded. (However, when we left at around 8pm, it was absolutely packed). 

Wait staff was very great - friendly and very attentive.  Multiple waiters helping each table. They gave great drink recommendations. 

We had the Ceviche de Pescado, Emepnadas de Carne, Sweet Potato Fries and a chicken dish. The only thing that really stood out to me was the Ceviche. It had a really nice flavor; very refreshing but with a little spice to it. There were nice sized chunks of meat it in as well, so I think you really get your money's worth. 

The Empenadas and Sweet Potato Fries were both good. Nothing worth raving about, but they were fine. The chicken dish, that I can't recall, wasn't very appetizing. It was very overdone and I felt like I was eating skin.. where was the meat?? 

I had a good experience here - great wait staff & delicious Ceviche!
author: Janine K.

description:
The food was ok.. but the reason I'm giving one star is because they charged $2 a person for cutting our cake. They didn't inform us of this charge until the bill came.  So there were 11 of us so thats $22 total for cutting a $10 cake. That's outrageous !?!??! That's bonkers !!!

Be Warned don't get your cake cut by them !!! Imagine if you had a party of 100.. lol
author: Benjamin L.

description: We have been waiting for a table for over an hour.  When we first arrived we were quoted a 30 minute wait.  After 30 minutes we were told it would be another 30 minutes.  After an hour and 10 minutes we were told it would be another hour.  I just checked OpenTable and there is a reservation available in an hour. 30 minutes is a big difference than 2 hours.  Don't waste your time.
author: Wesley W.

description:
My girlfriend and I were very excited to try Limon tonight seeing as we had heard so many good things about it! I usually never Yelp, but my girlfriend and I were so shocked at the hostesses rude behavior that we were compelled to write a review immediately!
We walk in at 9:20pm and the girl working tells that the kitchen closes at 9:30 and we cannot be seated. The restaurant is open till 10pm according to the hours listed online and it was only 9:20! We then asked the hostess if we could have a seat at the bar to have a few drinks. She said, "umm we close at 9:30", to which I replied, "is the bar closed at 9:30?". She tells me yes the bar closes at 9:30, she then looked at us and said "you can just go to Blondie's Bar next door..."
She was extremely rude during our entire conversation, it was very disappointing as we were so excited to try the ceviche. I recommend everyone go to Pasión in the inner sunset, as they have excellent customer service and do not turn away patrons before closing. 

To the hostess working tonight (Sunday 6/29/2014), you work in the customer service industry, you need to learn how to be polite and pleasant, not rude and unaccomodating. To Limon management, I wish you could have witnessed the encounter by your hostess, it was absolutely insulting. We will take our business to Pasión in the sunset district!
author: Amin K.

description:
Came here on a whim one night and luckily we didn't have to wait. I was looking forward to the causa de pollo (I love causa) but it was waaaaaayy too salty. The churrasco a la parrilla (ribeye), however, was tasty. We also ordered a carafe of sangria. Can't go wrong there :)

Limon tends to get crowded during dinner time though, so it's probably best to make a reservation.
author: Lily Z.

description:
Want to come back and eat the whole menu. Got the whole chicken for 3 people and we could have split it between 4 people. And it was $20! Absolutely delicious, the only problem was it took about an hour due to kitchen delays. The waiter apologized a few times and actually gave us free empanadas. 

Easy to spend a bunch of money and try everything but also possible to spend just a few bucks for delicious chicken.
author: Ojus P.

description:
Rolled in on a bustling Friday night w/ no res, so we were seated at the bar, which I'm not usually into, but we managed to have a wonderfully leisurely meal, despite the fact that people kept throwing money at me (which is no new phenomenon, let's be serious) in an attempt to reach the bartender--nice scene, lower hipster quotient that most Mission haunts, more gays and double date nights than anything--place is loud, sleek and sultry, so I was a happy kid.

Started w/ the sangria, which they are just pumping out there--sweet, cinnamony goodness, only compaint is excessive ice and fruit that's a bit small, but the flavor of the beverage is quite yum.

Had beasted a huge brunch at Half-Day earlier so we weren't starving--my lovely Julia went for sweet potato fries (thin but delicious) and the wok friend veggies (not exactly straight from Mama Peru, but both excellent nevertheless), and I hit the tres tiempos--ono, snapper, and ahi w/ three sauces--it was supper excellent--fish has great textures and the sauces were "eat this with a spoon when no more fish is present" good.  Also had the vegan ceviche, mushrooms, red onion, greenbeans (though it says asparagus on the menu), and hearts of palm in a super spicy, but 100% delectable, lime marinade.

Bartender was a lovely waitress, very helpful, and overall, for being at the bar on a slammin Friday night, we had great service.  The entrees looked delicious, but you can easily make a meal just sticking the ceviches, sides, and starters.

For 4 starters and a 1/2 carafe of the red stuff, it was $52 pre tip.
author: Rachel N.

description: Came in with my boyfriend on a very busy Wednesday evening.  We sat at the bar and was welcomed by Erik V. He was very friendly and asked if we had any questions about the menu.  I'm very picky about my margaritas and I told him what I wanted and he said I got you.  Very quickly he came back with an amazing drink.  He kept them coming as the bar and whole restaurant filled up!  I live in the city but will come back for a fabulous margie and excellent service from Erik V!  Thank you!!!
author: Kristi S.

description: Omg the mac and cheese doesn't even compare to any normal one! It's just so good, full of flavor and not too rich. It will make you so happy, even if you're anti mac and cheese! The rotisserie chicken is good but the Carne A La Parrilla is what I'd go back for. Perfectly cooked, big enough to share, and a really delish blend of chimichurri with traditional red wine steak marinate (or something along those lines). The service is always attentive and really quick, which is nice because it's always busy. I
author: Becca S.

description:
Five stars for the best damn pork chop you'll ever come across. I'll even swear my life on it. The meat is suuuuuuuuper juicy, tender, and always cooked to perfection! It sits on a nice bed of sauteed cabbage, minced bacon, cubed tender potatoes, & their special sauce. Out of the 6 people @dinner, the 4 of us ordered it because I absolutely SWORE my life on its goodness. We were all quite haaaaaaappy w/our order!

Another absolute "must try" are the glazed pork ribs (tender tender tender), empenada (tasty & filling), yucca fritas (crispy goodness), ceviche (very fresh), and most definitely a PITCHER of their sangria. It is sooooo refreshing and generous even, enough for @least 6 glasses. (Pass up on the pineapple martini; its nothing special.) 

TIPS:
-Don't opt for the center table upstairs. You're located right beneath the lights and it attracts sooooo much heat. You don't want to overheat while dining.
-Street parking is terrible around this neighborhood. Park straight into the parking garage on 16th, about a 5minute walk away from Limon.
author: Joy A.

description: Quick service.  CRAZY food.  The empanadas are indescribable.  Even the plate full of mushrooms was a real treat.  The dining room is very busy and loud, but it leads to a really fun atmosphere.   One of the best restaurants I've ever been to!!
author: William H.

description: Food is good, service is really unpleasant. Waiters don't give a shit, especially if you are a large group that will pay a 20% gratuity anyway
author: Guillaume S.

description:
Date night was at Limon before heading to trivia night and it was an excellent choice.  It is BYOB (for a $15 corkage fee), which was a big selling point for us.  The food....I haven't eaten chicken in months as I'm picking up the vegetarian lifestyle again but this place changed my mind.  Yum!  Once the hubz pulled it off the bone for me, I was in business...dipping away in all of the delicious sauces.

The reason it isn't a perfect 5 is because even though the prices are super affordable, I can't wrap my head around why it cost $1 per yuca fry.  Really!  If a 1/4 of a chicken with 2 sides is only $9.50 ,why on Earth is an order of those tasty, crispy, delicious Yuca Fries $3.95 when only 4 come in the order?

Despite the costly yuca, I will be back!
author: Vanessa L.

description:
I came here for a friend's birthday dinner and found the overall experience to be decent. The service was good, refilled our water and checked on us a few times. The lighting was dim, perfect ambiance for dinner; the utensils, silverware and overall place are clean, which is a requirement in my books. 

Everything was fine until it got down to the drink and food. The sangria was overly sweet, much more like a dessert wine. I had the Ensalada Mixa salad and the Arroz con Mariscos (Peruvian-style paella). The salad had the perfect amount of honey-Dijon dressing and the crunchy apples were a nice touch. However, the paella was the worst I've tried thus far.. it was not only was served in a small portion compared to other places, but the dish was extremely salty and the rice seemed undercooked. I probably just ordered the wrong thing at Limon, but their paella is not a good entree (especially considering it to be about the same price as Fresca or Esperpento who give much bigger servings).
author: K. N.

description:
Not that this place needs any more reviews, but...

We were a party of 5 for an early Saturday eve dinner at the Valencia location. Made a reservation earlier in the week and it was totally worth it. Place was hella busy.

Pollo a la Brasa - Other worldly. Tender, juicy, best with accompanying sauces.
Ceviche - Decent but overpriced for how little they serve you.
Yuca Fries - Meh...filler if you're still hungry.
Pisco Drinks - Never had one before but friends had and thought it was not sour enough. Waiter later recommended the Sneaky Pisco, which we all liked.
Chocolate Bandido - I didn't want to share, but then again I didn't pay.
Profiteroles - Ever had Beard Papas with chocolate sauce & choc chips? Yum.
author: Andy L.

description: Food was good but the service was not accommodating. The empanadas come as two of the same kind per order.  The waitress would not allow us to order one veggie and one chicken. It seems so silly no to fulfill such a simple request. I talked to the manager and He ended up allowing it after I told him I will write a review here. The empanada were good but very expensive, two small ones for $ 8.50. Any other place you find the same for no more than $ 2.90 for each one.
author: Silvia G.

description:
Very impressive Sunday brunch. We had a reservation, but I was quite late. No problem. We were seated promptly. 

My friend had the trio of ceviches and I had a veggie omelet with sweet potato fries. Everything was excellent!

We also had a Groupon, which made the whole thing much more affordable. 

Great food, great service, great ambiance. All in all, a terrific find for brunch!
author: Kim C.

description:
This is the second time I've been to Limon (different location). The rotisserie chicken is hands down the best I've ever had--perfectly seasoned and cooked to perfection. We had it with the tacu tacu an veggies, both equally delicious. The lomito saltado was great as well. We should have gotten a ceviche instead of the Jalea, but it was still great. 

For dessert, three of us split the chocolate bandido, a lava cake type dessert. The poor thing was devoured in less than 3 minutes. It was excellent!

As far as drinks go, it was the best sangria I've ever had and the morenita was nice and strong. I'll be back!
author: Catie T.

description:
We had half-roasted chicken with sweet potato & veggies for the side dishes, jaella, a beer & sangria for $40! Hard to beat that especially this place serves yummy food! 

Crowd is hip & cool.. Can get noisy though but it could be just my sangria hyper-stimulating my neurons! :)
author: ASIANDIVAH A.

description: Help doesn't give you the option to give no stars that's why it's even a 1 star.  Where should I start uggg I preorderd my plate for pick up I get there and still have to wait 10 minutes. I finally get the food and the portion was tiny and they didn't serve it with rice!  The prices are ridiculous!  The food tasted like vinegar overload . I couldn't even eat it so I gave it to my dog as you can see on my tip page and she wouldn't even take more than one bite. There are so many better Peruvian reasturant in the city that are really good and athuntic. This place was a big disappointment!! If your ever at city streets. Don't stumble. In here it is uppy  Peruvian food not athuntic
author: Tanya H.

description: This a good place to try Peruvian food. It's a little expensive, the atmosphere not so cosy but the dishes are tasty.
author: Laurie M.

description:
If you like roast chicken, Limon has to be at the top of your list.  The place is unreal.

First, the sangria is amazing, some of the best I've ever had.  You can tell that it's made with quality wine, and it's not overpriced.

But the meal is made by the chicken.  Not only is it cheap (3 of us split the $20 whole 8 piece chicken), and the sides are great, but the chicken is amazing.  Juicy and delicious.

I've been to the Valencia and S. Van Ness locations, and MUCH prefer the Valencia spot. If you're looking for the roast chicken, I'd recommend Valencia.
author: Will A.

description: Mother's Day May 8, 2016-my mother 89 yrs, me and my son enjoyed everything we ordered from the chicken w/2 sides and all the small plates. Everything was cooked to perfection. Oooh and the truffle Mac-n-cheese OMG! The beef tongue just melted in your mouth and the jalea  and the rest was delicious! Thank you to Limon's staff for the great service, patience and smiles!
author: Chris V.

description:
To start, I've been here once years before it sadly burnt down and a second time this year on my birthday.

It's a bit overpriced for the quantity of food given for each ceviche order.  I want to indulge in the healthy plate of raw fish.  Why give me just enough to leave me wanting more? Sad. But on the brighter side, they have amazing cocktails, with a secret ingredient (raw egg).  The service is great! Sadly I won't be going for a while.  In need of more authentic Peruvian flavors! More of a "Mom n Pop" restaurant, if you will!
author: SammyWammy S.

description:
Meh, I say!

Got the ceviche that everyone was raving about. It was good, but it didn't stand out. Also, I feel like the fish portions weren't cut properly. This made for an odd mouth feel.

The sweet potato fries with the sauce trio was the best thing in my opinion. The other stuff we ordered was okay, but nothing to write home about. Mac + cheese was a little watery. Beef thing was good but the french fries in it were kind weird.

Me and the dude were excited to try the beef hearts. We're unrepentant carnivores and have enjoyed the hearts of other animals so knew what kind of texture to expect. However, when they arrived, they smelled "not good" to me so I decided that I wouldn't eat them. The dude called me a pussy and ate them all himself.

Well, out of our party of 4, he was the only one who ended up getting sick later. So, I would recommend NOT ordering the beef hearts.

Other than that, the service is good. But, with so many more interesting food options nearby, I don't think we'll bother coming back here.
author: Rachel H.

description:
I think this may be the first 5 I've given, and I eat out a lot.  Too much if you ask my husband.  We were in town for a short getaway, and was luckily brought here by the cousin. We ordered the half chicken, Mac and cheese, chicken chicarron, ceviche, yucca fries, tacu tacu rice, and the beef and potatoes.  Oh, and two pollo empanadas.  For a party of six.

Everything was cooked to perfection, flavorful and well marinated.  Service was spectacular.  We were seated in their underground dining area, and our server/bartender was attentive and checked on us frequently.  Such a nice reprise from the so so food at Fisherman's Wharf.  Dinner with cockails totaled $128, tip included.  A steal for SF. Wish I lived closer.
author: Mai T.

description:
If you are looking for a place to have a nice dinner in a nice environment this is definitely not the place.The manager running the Valencia location is rude, and unprofessional.  We ordered ceviche as an appetizer, chicken and la parilla for dinner. The chicken, the sides for the chicken and la parilla came out within minutes of placing our order usually fast service would be great but we never got our appetizer.  We informed the server that the appetizer the crevice had yet to arrive. By chance the manager was standing there and instead of looking into the fact we never got the appetizer told us we should have read the menu the food is pre-made and comes out when ordered. We asked than why are items labeled as appetizers if they are not served first. He just looked at us smirked, told us you should read the menu again and walked away. 

The way the manager handled the situation was so appalling.  Even our server could not believe it and came over multiple times and apologized for how the manager handled the situation. We just asked the server to cancel the ceviche. I have never been to a restaurant where the appetizers come out with or after the entrées even if the food is served family style.  Maybe next time they will bring out dessert first than our dinner.
author: Kris S.

description:
Finally getting to it, as promised. I checked in so as to prove my visit. Let me start by saying - dudes, your food is fabulous. The tartare is always yummy. The short ribs with potatoes are to die for. The ceviche hits the spot too!!! Great great food. Great location. Great lighting. 
Now this is where things get ugly. I live on Valencia, a block away from limon. So when I'm feeling lazy and don't wanna wait for my scrumptious food - I do what any normal human being would do - get takeout. Now, the food - just as good. They package everything neatly. Everything has it's own little box and compartment. Nothing spills, etc. you get the point. 
Their service however.... Oh man. As my tip said - their service is terrible. Twice I've gone in (I kept my receipts and will add the photos for proof) and had to wait 30-45 minutes over their estimated wait time. Here's how it goes:
