1. Call limon and place an order for your take out. Takes 2-3 tries since it's always very loud. Make sure to get the tartare and short ribs. 
2. Hear the person say - okay, see you in 30! Now, for all you naysayers, I've tried this at 6 pm and 9 pm, so don't blame it on the number of people there. 
3. Head there in 45 mins because you know it won't be 30. See them look for my ticket, find it hanging somewhere, send it in and hear them say - "almost ready sir. Can I get you a drink while you wait?"  
One time they couldn't even find the ticket (they eventually found it 15 mins later). No sir, I don't want house sangria. No sir, you've already given me 2 glasses of water. No sir I will not move out of the way while I wait for my food. 30-45 mins later - get your food. 

What's worse is, they charge you BEFORE bringing you the food. So even if you want to walk out, you lose your money. Good trick!! I end up tipping every time and regret it 45 minutes later. 

So, in conclusion, limon, your food is so friggin great. But now your service... Remember, a take out customer is a paying customer and is less work than an eat in customer. The least you can do to take my hard earned dollars is be truthful and get your sh*t together. The end.
author: Aabhas S.

description: Loved, loved, loved the food at this charming restaurant.  We will definitely return.
author: Pamela D.

description:
I came here for dinner a few weeks ago after walking around the Disney museum and building up my appetite.  Our reservations were at 6:00, so it wasn't too busy yet.  We were seated upstairs, so I got a good view of the restaurant.

Our dinner consisted of the following:
~Sangria( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/LeZxLA7aB_UclKk8bmpzPQ/l )
~Tres Tiempos( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/tPvm_lL9SzE8-2v5nyUeUA/l )
~Empanadas de Carne( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/MwXOIWpkgaS1Touzsm9u3g/l )
~Chuleton Don Carlitos( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/K6afEOeP2ZWNu7chrCEoqQ/l )
~Lomo Saltado( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/OEYCEsv5l2rQjOFFze95iw/l )

All of the food was really good.  The sauces for the Tres Tiempos  had a nice, tangy citrus flavor.  I really liked my Lomo Saltado.  The meat was cooked perfectly and the fries were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.  I was too full after the main course, so we decided to skip dessert.

The service here is good.  They're very attentive and make sure to check on you every now and then.  Parking in the area is a bit tough, so leave yourself enough time to circle around.
author: Patra I.

description:
I went to Limon with a larger group for dinner based on a friend's recommendation. The restaurant has a positive vibe to it. The crowd was a mix of ages and ethnicities and everyone seemed to be having a good time. Even though it was bustling, you were still able to have a conversation without talking loudly.

The wine, beer and especially, the cocktail menu was interesting. Many of the cocktails were cool sour mixes.

Sadly, the food was sub par. The main adjective I have is salty. We ordered a variety of small plates and the consensus was that  the food was unnecessarily salty. The only bright exception was the Red Snapper which was accompanied by hominy-like side.

I'd recommend Limon for a place to have a drink, but would forego as a dinner destination.
author: Karen R.

description: Sangria was awesome! I also had the truffle Mac n cheese, tasted very earthy and I loved it! The Lomito Saltado was also very good. This was my first experience with Peruvian so I have nothing to compare to, but I did enjoy it.
author: Erica C.

description: Really good food (mostly chicken though). The chicken was great! One star off for they forgot to put us on the list, even though we were at the bar waiting for our table. Another star off for forgetting half of the food we ordered.
author: Ili V.

description:
This has been on our to-do list for what feels like forever now. 

I came, I saw, and I'd come again.

Thank you, Yelp, for once again not steering us wrong. The lomo saltado was outstanding, the ceviche was lemony and fresh, and the half chicken and accompanying sauces were heavenly. The mac and cheese was also good, though an interesting addition to an otherwise clearly Peruvian menu. We split the mac and cheese (along with everything else) between the 4 of us and it was perfect - but would have been too heavy to split between any fewer. We also had the roasted veggies since you know, our mothers taught us how to balance a meal. Naturally we finished with the Chocolate Bandido for dessert. Gone in 60 seconds.

For 4 people the bill came to $20 each, including tip. I would definitely recommend and come again!
author: Laura C.

description:
My boyfriend is Peruvian and loves to come here. Whenever we are in the area and are debating on what to eat, we somehow end up here. We have never had to deal with a wait, but that may have something to do with the time of day that we go. 
It is on a busy and main street so parking can be a hassle, so be prepared to park a couple blocks away.
Service has always been great. Waiters are always very attentive and not over bearing. 
The food is great! We have had so much from the menu, I can't even remember it all...but I do remember that it was all delicious. Judging by everything I have had there, I can only assume that the whole menu is amazing and wouldnt hesitate to try something new. Additionally, their drinks are great and mix traditional Peruvian cocktails with some sweeter flavors that are amazing. 

Must have:
Anticuchos de res
Ceviche mixto
Pollo a la brasa (of course)
Yucca fries (so perfectly cooked!)
and so much more!
author: Jazmin S.

description:
If Yelp would have 10 starts, I would give all 10 starts for Limon. I had been there many times, and each time was a very pleasant experience.

Food: Limon is very famous of their Chicken. Yes, it's a must to try. Perfectly cooked and perfectly served. I believe their Caviche is the best. I tried Ceviche at Fresca - not even close to Ceviche at Limon. The presentation of the dishes is very modern and stylish. And the food, of course, is delicious. 

Service: The staff is very friendly and welcoming. 

Restaurant: I admit the first/ main floor is tiny. If it's cold outside, and you sit in front of the door - it wouldn't very pleasant. They have a good size bar. However, they have two levels. They also can seat you in a lower level - basement. There are more space and also a bar. 

Location: There are couple of location; however, I consider Valencia St the best location. Yes, it's a little difficult to find parking, but the food is worth it. 

At Limon, you can see people different ages. They welcome everybody. 

Highly recommend - chicken and Ceviche.
author: Jenna F.

description: The Best Dinner Ever!! The chicken is consistently wonderful. The trio of sauces are great, my fav being the chimichurri!! Had the truffle mac n cheese -soo decadent! Yuca fries & papa fritas -so different & so good. We tried the "Lomito" Saltado -wonderful!! Ooh, the Tacu-Tacu was sooo good. I'm not a plain rice fan, & this was super flavorful! Gad we had a bottle of Blanco Nieva Verdejo to wash it all down! Too delicious! Finally, considering how crowded, there is enough staff to make you feel welcomed & help you with any request!
author: Noël V.

description:
Okay, I had no idea there was a Limon and a Limon Rotisserie. So when we walked out of Taqueria La Cumbre and saw "LIMON" across the street, I just assumed it was the Limon Rotisserie we had planned on going to next (we were in the midst of a food crawl). There was even a catering van with the words "Limon Rotisserie" parked in front! But hey, it's my fault for being lazy and not double checking the address. And the two restaurants are related, so I can't exactly accuse them of false advertising.

Anyhow, we actually got lucky because even though we didn't make a reservation, they had a table available as long as we were out within an hour and a half; no problem! 

Upon being seated, we were given a menu and we all looked for the dish we came to eat. After I went through it twice, I asked the server where the rotisserie chicken was.

"We don't have rotisserie chicken. That would be at Limon Rotisserie, which is a few blocks away."

OH. Good one Ken. You moron. (I was in charge of this food crawl.)

So now comes the dilemma: do we walk out of this nice restaurant, looking like fools, or do we just stay and try out this restaurant? We opted for the latter.

Since we had been on an eating binge, we just ordered two appetizers and a main dish among the three of us. I wasn't fond of the Anticuchos de Pollo; while the chicken itself was tender, the marinade was rather boring. And I've had much better sweet potato fries. The Costillas Nikkei (spare ribs), on the other hand, were the highlight of the meal IMO. "Crispy on the outside, tender on the inside" isn't exactly how I usually describe ribs, but that's what these were. The meat just slid off the bone with that sweet rocotto-soy sauce. Delicious. My friends kindly let me have a second rib (4 ribs for 3 people).

Finally, the Lomo Saltado was quite good. I've had better fries in Lomo Saltados, but there was no questioning the quality of the meat they used here. Medium-rare, juicy and tender. Enough said.

Not a bad place to check out, as long as your intention is to go to Limon (which is trendier) and not Limon Rotisserie.
author: Ken K.

description:
Nice restaurant. The star here is the roasted chicken. Unsurprisingly, it is quite good. However, it could never shine properly without the proper side dishes - which are, thankfully, quite good. The sweet potato fries were delicious, as was the fried rice/bean. They also give out three sauces to go with your chicken.

The result is a nice, but perhaps slighlty average and unmemorable dining experience. (but the side dishes and sauces are complimentary so the price/quality ratio is ON POINT)
author: Lena D.

description:
This place is sooo yummy. When we first walked in it smelled delicious. For our first visit, decided to share a whole chicken and get a couple of extra sides. It did not disappoint! Everything was very flavorful and im a condiment person so the sauces were great too. For three people with drinks and a shared dessert we got outta there for less than $30 per person.

Minus one star for crappy drinks, they should hook up with those bon vivant guys and fix that.
author: Alexis D.

description:
TASTY goodness is all I can say of this restaurant. The food was spectacular and so was the pitcher of sangria we ordered. The chicken (which is what they are known for) is by far the best. Very tasty and is accompanied by 3 sauces to dip in (which aren't even needed, but still good). Great ambiance and overall fun place for dinner in a group atmosphere. 

Tip: Make reservations; they are packed during peak dinner hours!
author: Lauren J.

description:
A relative recommended I try this place out, so I made a quick reservation (realized later I didn't need it) and came out here with the gf.  I ordered the Pargo Rojo (red snapper) while the gf ordered a Pollo Latino, both of which were pretty good.  The presentation of the food was really nice, along with the atmosphere of the restaurant, which was pretty trendy and modern.

I do agree with some people that it is a bit overpriced compared to other Peruvian places, but the decor definitely justifies the price I suppose.

Man, I'm craving some more ceviche though, mmm
author: Ren L.

description:
So I went here last year and have been meaning to review it but kept forgetting.  This place served what may be my all time favorite food I've ever had in my life.  Seriously.  The five stars are for the food only.  I can't even begin to describe the flavors...I had a beet salad of some sort, rotisserie chicken, sangria and some other things - all out of this world good and it came out in record time after ordering.  Prices very reasonable to boot. 
Now the bad - parking was a nightmare at peak dining time, but then again it is in San Fran.  They clearly make their money by turning tables quickly and so while you don't feel rushed by the wait staff, you do get the feeling that they don't want you lingering too long unless you're still ordering food and drinks.  They won't seat you until your entire party is there...so if you get dropped off while someone else finds parking, you'll have to wait until they get back which is annoying.  
Despite the few minor annoyances, the food completely makes up for it.  If you happen to be in the Mission area, make sure you check this place out.  You will be glad you did.
author: Leigh N.

description:
This Limon rocks!
The other one is good too.
This one just has more space to be comfy waiting and the civiche is often a touch better.

Almost everything on the menu is solid.
I love the yuca fries and lomito saltado.
author: Shane P.

description:
**Limon, you're now on my permanent Mi-ssi-on ro-ta-ti-on** 
(Forgive me Yelpers, you have to get to know me.  I'm just goofy)

Someone please kick me for not trying Limon before.  Really.  I used to walk by for years (before they closed) and wonder why it was so busy.  I guess I always assumed that Peruvian food had no vegetarian options, as my San Francisco experience had always proven that to be the case.

Better late than never though...

Shitake mushroom ceviche alone had me hooked.  It was all uphill from there.  Quinoa (with veggies) was the most impressive quinoa I've ever tasted.  It was so rich and I'm still trying trying to figure out how they cooked it.  Last thing for me:  Yuca fries.  With chimmichurri.  Need I say more?  

I had to go for one of the more exotic desserts:  coconut prepared three ways.  A little too sweet for my taste, but can you really go wrong with coconut?  Coconut maki was marvelous.  

Factor in yummy sangria, a sleek and lively atmosphere, excellent service, and whaddya know...we arrive at a five-star review!
author: Angella S.

description:
3.5 really!

Party cat had her birthday dinner here. NOMLICIOUS!!! 14 LOLCATS = required to order from the prix fixe menu. $25 menu + $15 Corkage (2 Bottles Max). FYI. We kind of showed up a little late, but once we were there, they seated us and the food and sangria was flowing! That's really helpful when you've got a large group and half the people are indecisive (read: probably just me). The pressure of choosing a dish causes me great stress sometimes (oh god, the waiter is almost here.. which one, whicH ONE?!?!) 


The NOMS:

Tartara de Atun/Tuna tartare served with chips. Not bad, but I've had better.
Ceviche Mixto/ Red Snapper, calamari, tiger shrimp ceviche. Delicious!! 
Ensalada Mix/ Mixed Greens. meh.

Lomito Saltado/ I don't even recall eating this, but I'm sure we did. 
Chicharron de Pollo/ tasty marinated chicken. yum.

Pollo a la Brasa/ Known for their rotisserie chicken. It was flavorful and juicy.

Rice/ hella good. It's flavored with lime apparently. YUMGASM! And it's just rice!


So, having 14 people get family style is kind of a nice relief AND you get to try a few signature dishes. WIN WIN?! The portions seemed a tad small, so we kept joking about getting cheap tacos nearby, but at the end of the meal, I was actually quite full. The waiters were very attentive and were refilling our glasses with Sangria and water. The food came out fast. Overall, a great experience. 3.5 only because of the portion because it seems a tad pricey.
author: Donna H.

description: How come this place has only 3.5 stars? They made me some strawberry Mojitos that were ridiculous! AND I DONT LIKE MOJITOS! I had 4! I had the chicken chicorron plate...awesome! steak cubes with the papas......had to order two!  I cant wait to go back to san Francisco so I could bring my parents! This place was great.
author: Michael S.

description: My nephew, who is 10, and I were going on a SF adventure today.  I do see him regularly, but this was something we started last year, just us.  He had been to this restuarant before and loved it, so that was our first stop for lunch.  It was not busy, and he made his recommendations.  Cervece, and the chicken.  Our waiter, was great, he wasn't demeaning to my nephew, but obviously knew I was the adult.  We had a wonderful lunch talking.
author: Erika H.

description:
I accidentally went here instead of the other Limon on Valencia.  I saw that one had a 4 star rating.

We arrived at about 7:30 on a Friday night.  The restaurant was busy, but we were seated shortly.  Not long after being seated our waiter came up and asked us if we would like something to drink.  He made a few suggestions for me when asked, went away and came back a reasonable amount of time later.

I arrived with a friend about 7:30 on a Friday night, yet we were seated after a very short wait.  We may have accidentally timed it just right as not long after it looked like the line started getting longer.

In short, this is a trendy bar with a lot of mixed drinks, some beed, and food on small plates like tapas.  My friend and I had two plates since he wasn't that hungry due to a late lunch.  I had one of their many mixed drinks (Maracuja sp?) and he had a few beers.  My drink was fine, nothing amazing although the waiter said they made their own citrus base.  The space was cute, it is probably a good date spot.

All in all the evening was fine and the space was fine.  I'd probably give it a 3.5 because I wouldn't bother to go back, but it wasn't bad.  There was nothing wrong with the place, the food was tasty and the server attentive, I just wouldn't bother to go back with all the other places around.
author: Lisa R.

description:
Great service, contemporary, clean decor, and yummy peruvian goodness! 

My gf and I had the sangria (really refreshing and tasty), cebiche limon, and the red snapper. The red snapper -- what a beautiful presentation! It was definitely fried to perfection!

On top of the excellent service and great food? The price!! Definitely affordable and worth every penny. I can't wait to go back with more girlfriends and try everything else on the menu.
author: Tammy S.

description: Loved it! The food here is always so good, fresh and fast. Chicken is moist, and you MUST get the TRUFFLE MAC AND CHEESE. It will change your world on things. The lomo saltado is amazing too. I'm hungry now...
author: Vanessa K.

description:
Most of the menu is drinks. There's nothing wrong with that...

Service was good. 

We had yucca fries. They were amazing. I would go back just to have a few orders of these. 

Lomo saltado: Peruvian stir fry with beef, onions, rice and fries. 

It was good but not WOW.
author: Sara P.

description: Awesome atmosphere, great service and lots of space. The dishes are small and expensive for the amount but the food is AMAZING. Definitely try the truffle mac and cheese. It's the best mac and cheese I've ever had. Their empanadas are really good also. One of the best restaurants I've ever been to.
author: Niraj P.

description: My first time having Peruvian food & I love it! Came here for a Holiday work dinner with my boss & co-workers. Our server Alberto was attentive and nice. He suggested some dishes for us to get. We got the pre-fixed stuff and everything came out great. The beef tongue was very tender. The chicken wasn't dry! I'm not a fan of wine but the sangria was good. I'll probably be coming back here :)
author: Sara L.

description: I am very picky when it comes to Chicken and Limon did not disappoint.  The real star of the meal, however was the Truffle Mac n Cheese side.  Truffle is a flavor that is easy to overdo, but the chef got it just right - the perfect balance of truffle and cheese.  The server was very attentive and kind, and the atmosphere was lovely.  Overall a great dining experience.
author: Haley G.

description: The chicken is tasty and good for sharing among friends. The serving size for the paella was smaller than I expected but it was reasonable given the price. The restaurant is a decent, fast casual choice among the row of restaurants on Valencia. Service is brisk, on the border of feeling rushed but pleasant staff nonetheless.
author: Warren C.

description: The food here is delicious, there's no way around that. Unfortunately, the service doesn't match. The busers were rude and handsy when we were waiting at the bar for our table, despite a reservation we waited 30 minutes, and we asked for water about 10 times, and finally got it after dessert. Get it together!
author: Emily K.

description: I'm rating this a two star for the service and the amount of food for a large party. Made advance reservations for 14 people on a Saturday afternoon choosing there pri fixed menu #3. Our server introduced himself and disappeared. We had to constantly flag him down and every time we did he had attitude. Food was delicious but for family style there portions were scarce. I had to keep asking "is this all" for a large party there needs to be larger portions not two bites per person with only 3 plates of each. So not pleased. For a full bar they didn't have a large selection of drinks after I had asked while making reservations if they served certain drinks and was told they did. Not pleased at all. Not planning on dining there again. Used to be a regular especially after I had my bachelorette dinner with a party of 20 and it went so well.
author: Karen S.

description: The food is excellent. The ambiance is very warm and welcoming. The happy hour is great. And the service is top notch. Fernando is a great bartender.
author: Harold H.

description:
Five stars for Armando, the best bartender ever, and the amazing food and drinks! Came here on a Saturday night with no reservations and ended up eating at the bar at the suggestion of Armando. Pretty much one of the best dinner experiences ever! We had the Carne a la Parilla (hangar steak), Tacu-Tacu, Yuca Fries, Veggie Empanada, and Rotisserie Chicken, all of which was cooked to perfection. For dessert, Armando suggested the Panna Cotta De Mango which was again absolutely delicious. Last but not least, we had some of the most amazing cocktails! I had the Chilcano De Uva, which was a mixture of grapes, basil leaves, lime juice, ginger ale, and Pisco Quebranta. I pretty amazed by the intricate process of making the drink and equally as blown away by the taste! Let's just say, I will definitely be back!

(They also have hooks under the bar for you to hang your purse, pretty cool!)
author: Connie C.

description:
I remember this night vividly.

I came here with a guy who is a regular at this spot. I think that's what he said. Something about walking in here was just something I wouldn't have done without the extra push. 

He wanted me to try some of his favorite drinks and he was also trying to see how drunk I could get. (Ladies, beware :) We had two or three of their pisco sours. All very good though not what I would consider authentic. We also had some of the appetizers and  though everything was incredibly tasty, my favorite part was getting dessert. Everything we had left me wanting more. I think the portions were simply small. 

You should have heard the kinds of jokes made from that hot fudge...you'd have to be 18+ to hear these jokes...

I was amazed at how big this place is. Walking down Valencia you only get to see a little bit from the window in.
author: Alexia R.

description: How about the fact that they hire people to come work construction between the hours of 11:30 pm to 1:30 am?! As a neighbor (I live right behind the restaurant) and former patron I don't feel very happy about power saws keeping me up so that I have barely 5 hours to sleep that night before I go to work. I'm wondering what kind of asshole the owner has to be to inflict this torture on his neighbors for nights on end. I went to speak to the manager - he had no idea what was going on. As for the food - it's OK.
author: Waves P.

description: I have been to both locations and have had great experiences every time. The chicken with 3 side sauces is great. The ribs are amazing. The ceviche is to die for! Every item that comes out is displayed with perfection! A perfect place for a first date or any date.
author: Roman J.

description:
Limon's is one of my favorites in San Francisco. Unpretentious , casual, and delicious.
Its the Chicken thats the star here, i just cant get by it to try something else. But its moist and perfectly seasoned and comes with 2 sides of your choice and 3 salsas.
This is the 2nd locations I tried of Limon 's . service great the Pisco sour yummy and food delicious. you cant go wrong.
author: Tropical T.

description: Best ceviche and Pisco sour I've ever had in my life. Bartenders and staff are amazing friendly and the atmosphere is perfect. this place is worth the drive and can't wait to go back.
author: Sarah G.

description:
My lord, gotta love the q-mark heads hating on this place.   I came here on a date seeking a change of pace in the Mission, and Limon really hit the spot.  Let's do the run-through:

Ceviche - Outstanding and the best I've had.   This is why you come here.   

Chicken w/ Mac and Cheese - Good chicken, great MnC.   Super creamy and rich with a slight stinkiness.  

Porkchop - Very salty, but can't complain.  The chopped cabbage and bacon underneath was a great complement.   

Drinks - Mojito was tasty, mule not so much.  Wish I were a wine drinker.

Desert - See pic.   Tastes as good as it looks.  

Atmosphere downstairs is great, so the bland upstairs is a little disappointing.   The concrete walls and door that won't shut combine for an echoey sound, so not the best for a group of you want to clearly hear everyone else.   Service was fine, but be forewarned there isn't much room here.   Cruising in on a Thursday night around 8, we got the last table upstairs.
author: John H.

description: Great and delicious restaurant for a reasonable price. We had the oyster shooters, mac n cheese, snapper, limo saltado, and drinks and all u can say is that I will be back. I like Peruvian food and this would be my favorite in the medium price range.
author: Minh H.

description: Love this place - my go to "catch up with my friends" and "date night" spot! And everyone I've taken there ends up falling in love with this place too! Highly recommend!
author: Ryan C.

description:
Peru yumminess  = Pure yumminess

Muy rica la cocina peruana. Y este restaurant me encanta. Son las impresiones de este chileno y latinoamericano radicado aquí en California.

Great to have a South American alternative to the taquerias that seem to be everywhere. Limon has excellent food and attentive service. A place with food and service you can enjoy over and  over. I highly recommend it.
author: Franz G.

description:
Group of 4 girls went there last night around 9:00pm. Actually we were not planned to go there but the one that we wanted to go was closed. And I tried The Limon Rotisserie before and like it a lot, so we decided to give it a try! We did not make reservation and good that we don't need to wait for a table. 

The atmosphere was great and fun. The service was pretty slow. We waited for 10 minutes to get the water and menu and another 10 minutes to order our food. 

Here are what we ordered: 

Ceviche Limon - mixed seafood ceviche (fish, calamari and shrimp) - very fish was very fresh and the lime juice was so refeshing

Ceviche Nikkei de Atun - Ahi Tuna with mushrooms and sesame seeds in soy cause - Again, the fish was very fresh. Personally I like the mixed seafood ceviche more 

Choros Limon - steamed mussels with bacon, spicy sauce and french fries - the mussels were okay... nothing spectacular compared to their ceviche dishes 

Pollo Latino - Roasted chicken breast with mushroom potatoes - chicken was tender and juicy but sauce was on the salty side. The mushroom potatoes were so good........I wish we could have more of that! 

Churrasco a la Parilla - grilled ribeye over sautéed veggies with crispy potatoes - I did not try this dish but my friends said the steak was even more salty than the chicken. The veggies were ok but the potatoes were surprisingly good! 

If I ever go back again, I will focus on their ceviches and appetizers. The main dishes? Not really...kinda overpriced and nothing special....
author: Liza T.

description:
Nice restaurant, great ambiance, lovely decor, delicious food!  Half chicken, pollo empanadas, and fish & shrimp ceviche...all you need to know.  Made reservations and the hostess hooked us up with a nice quiet table upstairs (with a view!).  Thank you for making this unplanned evening romantic  ;)

The chicken in the pollo empanadas had amazing flavor.  The trio of dipping sauces for the chicken - fantastic. Favorites were the garlic bell pepper one and the other yellow one (name escapes me).

Great service, good food, affordable, oh and clean bathrooms, will be back again.
author: Dee H.

description: Beautiful space, friendly service, great food, best sangria ever. Make sure to try their cervice. The sauce is just stunning.
author: Daniel W.

description: This place is great if you live Peruvian good - the chicken was flavorful and tender - the ceviche was done perfect - they had cusquena beer which made my night - service was good - over a great place - will definitely go back
author: S W.

description:
I have been to the other Limon locations countless amounts of time. However, this weekend was my first visit to this location. There was a crowd of people waiting to be seated (not to mention a large party). I will say that the staff is very accommodating and knows how to provide great customer service. 

Despite the issue of parking, I would consider coming back to this location.
author: Kristina S.

description: I was so looking forward to eating here but I was disappointed. The portions were small and every dish we ordered had soy sauce?? It was interesting to learn of the Asian influence on this food but the timing was not great as I'm not eating soy. The servers were excellent and if the food were better I'd go back. But that probably won't happen.
author: Cara G.

description:
Although the food was delicious, I saw two huge problems with Limon:

1.  They did not serve 3 of the magnificent dishes that are well advertised on other Yelp reviews (e.g., red snapper, pork chop, and grilled octopus).  This was even on a Saturday night, when a customer expects to see the full gamut on the menu!!!  Really a bummer, because the pics of all those dishes looked magnificent.

2.  The dishes were very small (albeit the presentation was a work of art), so it didn't feel like a bang for your buck.  Granted, most folks head to Limon for tapas style dining.  Still, if you are planning to go with a small group of friends, you better plan on order two of each plate to satiate your hunger.
author: Rick A.

description:
The food was authentic, delicious and the perfect size. I definitely recommend trying the lomo saltado or the truffle mac and cheese. Also, if you are with a decent sized group (or with at least one lush), get the pitcher of sangria.


The place, being 2 levels, makes it easy to spy on what's going on downstairs...which I did. Seems to be a little bit of a scene. 

My only complaint was that they wouldn't substitute the 2 sides on the 1/4 chicken dish for a different side that wasn't part of that plate. They wouldn't even come up with a new price for it. It wasn't my meal, but I did make a little bit of a stink about it and they wouldn't budge. 

All in all, it was a good experience.
author: Michaela L.

description:
Amazzzzzing secret restaurant. The lunch special for $15 is amazing. The most delicious Sangria! And the Lomo Saltado is breathtaking! Also, get a side of Yuca fries, they are heavenly! So,.food wise this is COMPLETELY a 5+ star restaurant!

Service wise, it deserves a 3. We waited wayyy too long for our main course. We had to ask the waiter if our order was even placed. And when it did come out there were no apologies. I wouldnt have had an issue if it were busy, but me and my date were 2 out of 5 people inside. So, they can work on service skills.

This is an amazing place and I cannot wait to go back!
author: JIBBY B.

description:
This is a difficult review to write. The first time I experienced Limon I was in love: The food was great, the drinks were strong but went down like Kool Aid, the service was perfect, and the mood was inviting.

The second time I went the food was mediocre at best, the drinks were drinkable, the service was slow, and it was so loud I had to scream conversation to the person sitting 2 feet from me.

I don't think I'll be back.
author: Brett P.

description: I'm sorry, but I was not impressed. After getting take out from the location on Van Ness and loving the food, I was anticipating that the "fancier" version would be even better..but no such luck.  The food was good (ordered almost everything on the menu), but nothing stood out.  I would have given more stars but the service was TERRIBLE.  We ordered a good amount of food and multiple drinks, but I think our waiter wouldn't have minded if we didn't have time to enjoy or get to eat anything just to get us out of the door so he could serve the next patron.  I will not return simply because I have never been so turned off by a wait staff.  I know you are a trendy place to eat, but so are 100 other restaurants in San Francisco with equally as enticing menus and beverages.  Shame, because I do love the location on Van Ness.
author: Raina D.

description: . . . san francisco is possibly one of the best places to experience great dining . . . i was with my girl at the time and she had mentioned that she went to 'limon' with a group of friends . . . thats when she recommended that we should eat there . . . checking out some of the reviews made me really excited to try this place . . . no diss but i would prefer the rotisserie chicken at sams club or boston market . . . way cheaper & tastier . . . their vegetables were good and i was not too keen on their yuca fries . . . to me in my opinion limon did not seem to offer a whole lot of options on the menu . . . idk it just did not seem worth my time . . . this place is just not for me . . . the one thing ill give props to is the inside of the restaurant . . . pretty stylish . . . its a place i would want to take a date to . . . other than that i preferably would like to go somewhere else . . .
author: D. L.

description: Good food, quick service, decent prices. The mac and cheese, red snapper, and empanadas are all highlights. It's a little loud on busy nights so hard to have conversation but overall good place to go to eat
author: Nishant S.

description: Amazing! Finally went after wanting to check it out for quite awhile and was not disappointed! Almost immediately upon ordering we were served, which was great. The chicken was of course amazing but don't skip on the truffle Mac n Cheese, it was hands down the best I've ever had!!
author: Casey G.

description: Out with my cousins and family ... Peruvian food deliciousness.  Get the empandas, we had the veggie one filled with spinach and lovely cheese.  Crispy yet light tasting, not to miss.  Get the ceviche!  Delicious tender fish with scallops and shrimp in citrusy goodness - chewing this was a delight.  Get the roast chicken, it's juicy, seasoned very well, and the skin was so good -- and I love chicken skin.  Can't go wrong.  I also had the tuna tartare which came with chips and sliced cucumbers, just lovely.  And looks like a good place for date night, even first dates =)
author: Emy B.

description:
I had been wanting to try this Peruvian place for quite some time after reading one of my friends reviews on here, so I was pretty happy when she told us that she wanted to have her birthday at this restaurant.  Me and my friends arrived early so we decided to get a drink at the bar. I got the Maracuya Mule, which is a drink with passion fruit. This was really really good. I always love when I find a great drink and this was one of those, I wanted more but I had to get to work the next day so I thought it best to control myself.

I ordered sweet patato fries and this were really good but what I liked even more was the truffled Mac and Cheese one of my friends had ordered! Delish!

I also ordered the Tres Tiempos which was a Sashimi platter. This was great, it had Shrimp, Snapper, and Octopus, I believe. And the three sauces it came with was really good too. I'm not sure what they were though. I tried a little bit of what my friends had and everything just tasted really flavorful, the fish was good and the steak was good. I had a pretty big lunch earlier in the day so maybe I wasn't as hungry as I should have been cause I got full quick without eating much at all. I will come back though because this is the kind of place I would take to impress a date.

The only thing I didn't care much about was the birthday cake that came for dessert, it tasted kinda stale to me, but all the appetizers and entrees that everyone ordered got everyone's approval.
author: Luis Q.

description: I went to eat to this restaurant and how disappointed I was, this restaurant was expensive for the for they serve and it wasn't even delicious I never seen anyone serve wine with ice and they fill it more with ice then wine and I waited for an hour for the food to be served ,I won't be coming back here at all ,they give the Peruvian food a bad name the only thing that was good was the customer service .
author: Pamela C.

description: I'm not usually much of a chicken girl, but this stuff rocks. The lomo saltado is also great. Fun vibe too.
author: Antonia T.

description:
This is a great place to go with a group. If you split a couple of plates, you'll be super full plus you'll get to try most of the menu! 

The roasted chicken is delicious and tastes so good with the three sauces they provide with it. Plus, definitely get the truffle macaroni & cheese -- so good. Everything we tried was very flavorful and the portions are pretty good sized. We got three hot plates, as well as the $20 chicken that came with two sides for five people and it was more than enough food. The prices are very reasonable -- it ended up being about $10 - $15 per person. 

Definitely recommended!
author: Alice W.

description:
Came here for a classy bachlorette dinner and it was a fantastic choice!

There were 20 of us and we had a set menu, which catered to meat eaters, vegetarians and vegans. The menu consisted of a ceviche starter (or salad for vegans), appetizer, entree and dessert. Each course had 3-4 choices and being the calibre of restaurant it was, I was surprised with the serving size and we were plenty full and padded for the night of drinking ahead of us.

Our group was seated upstairs, where there were several celebrations also  happening. A great crowd and it created a happy and cozy-loud type ambiance.

Outstanding dishes? I loved the limon ceviche, pumpkin ravioli (it had a little spice from ginger in the filling! Superb!) and the chocolate lava cake.

Will absolutely go back and damn, why haven't I come here sooner!!
author: Joyce L.

description:
Amazing food (in particular the rotisserie chicken, truffle mac & cheese, ceviche, and sangria) and attentive waitstaff.  I went with a group of four girls, with a reservation for 10pm, we stayed til 12am and they didn't try to hurry us out the door.
Only downside is the noise level, we had to yell to be heard until things starting dying down around 11pm.
However, the food more than made up for the noise - would go back in a heartbeat!
author: Jessie K.

description:
-friendly, professional and prompt service
-sleek comfortable upbeat atmosphere
-parking around this area is a bit difficult
-not so many vegetarian dishes but many tasty vegetarian appetizers. Oh yes... great sangria ;)
author: Giselle C.

description: Picked Limon since there was ceviche on the menu. Ceviche Mixto, among small cold plates, was great! However, on happy hour menu, Chicharron De Pollo was dry and overdone. Empanadas Pollo were pretty tasty while Empanadas Carne were meh.. The atmosphere is a bit boisterous in the evening, possibly due to good happy hour deals on drinks on weekdays.
author: Irina G.

description:
After reading this restaurant made the top 100 restaurants in the Chronicle and loving peruvian food, I made my way to this restaurant in the mission. I so wish that I hadn't found the parking space that I managed to eek my little rental into, but I couldn't have known that until I dined here. No reservation and a solo diner, I walked in and found a place at the bar. I figured starting with the trio of shooters would be a safe bet. Unfortunately, I could no longer taste anything afterwards. I am not afraid of hot dishes, but after just one of the trio, I could not feel my tongue it was so hot.

I moved onto the main course - the red snapper. Um sorry, but blech. It consisted of deep fried red snapper with a side of their coconut rice. It was utterly sweet, something I really don't like in a dinner. The dish did not match the description. I wished I'd ordered the lomo saltado, which from reading the other reviews, would have been safer.

The only thing I did enjoy was the mango mojito. A great drink.
author: Doreen E.

description: The pollo a la brasa (Rotisserie chicken)  that I got was dried and the french fries were old and cold as well. I haven't find a place in East Bay yet that makes the real Pollo a la Brasa from Peru with the regular sizes french fries.
author: Melis M.

description:
Solid Spot!

I was dining with 2 co workers while waiting for a red-eye and wanted to go some place in the mission.

This place is big, and you can get in with out much advanced notice.

Fantastic pisco drinks, get those.
Amazing civiche, so get that
And then the fried chicken was fabulous.

Great all around spot!
author: Michael E.

description:
The food here gets 3 stars but the wait staff was very friendly and gracious, so that tips the scale.

My husband, a good friend and I went to the Mission location of this restaurant on a Friday night. We each got a drink and then shared a couple ceviche's and small plates. 

The Nikkei ceviche and Ahi tuna tartare were AMAZING (caveat: I love raw ahi) and oh-so-flavorful. The Red Snapper was quite good as well although it definitely came in second place. Too bad our other two dishes didn't measure up. The beef short ribs (Seco de Costillas) were very tender but too salty. And, I was disappointed with the Chicharron de Pollo, which is touted as a house specialty/favorite. The pieces of chicken were dry and not terribly flavorful. 

Take-away: stick to the fish and you will have a phenomenal dining experience!

One complaint: please change your website so you can click "menu" and then location! The navigation is sufficiently confusing that I thought your website was broken!
author: Sydney L.

description:
I am happy to say that Limon gave me one of the best take-out experiences I've ever had.

I decided to order the quarter Pollo a la Brasa.  For my two sides I got the tacu-tacu and the vegetables.  The total was under $10 including tax.

The chicken was out of this world.  Easily the best chicken I've had in SF.  They gave me four small containers of this yellow dipping sauce.  I thought it strange they would give me four.  You want to know why they gave me four?  IT'S THAT GOOD.  No idea what was in this sauce, but you could seriously drink the stuff if you wanted to.

The tacu-tacu, which for those who aren't hip with Peruvian lingo is a sort of concoction of rice, beans, and other epicly tasting things, was absolutely incredible.  My goodness, I had no idea rice could be this good.

The sautéed vegetables were exactly what they should be.  They were perfect.

The proportions were HUGE.  For under $10 I was completely full and satisfied with super tasty food.

I will be going back to try some of the great looking drinks I saw the bartender making as I waited for my food.

Oh yeah, it did take a while to receive my food, but it was well worth the wait.
author: Javin L.

description: I've been going to this restaurant since it first opened on 17th Street and it just keeps getting better. I haven't had a bad meal there yet! I've been to all the locations. Food is fabulous!
author: maria o.

description: Took more than 30 minutes since we sat down for our drinks to arrive.  Food came out in no particular order, some got there entrees while others got an appetizer.  Water glasses remained empty for entire meal.  Finally, as I was about to finish my drink, the waiter asked if we could leave because they wanted the table. Exceptionally bad service.  Food was just Ok.
author: Kimberly B.

description:
I highly recommend Limón! The food is amazing; the short rib is so good. 
The customer service is 5 stars as well. I left already planning my next visit.
author: Ally K.

description:
So, this place used to be my favorite place. I would go here at least twice a month and splurge with my daughter and I.

I don't know what happened, but it seems like they have gotten too big for their britches.

My sister made a reservation for 10 people (8 adults and 2 kids) and they said with a party of 10 you have to have a prix fixe menu? I was completely dumbfounded when she told me because that has never been the case before.

I have had many parties there with easily 12 people and never had been thrown that requirement.

Secondly, and I want to premise this for ALL businesses; if you want to enforce something like that, why don't you put it on your website. Maybe in the section called "RESERVATIONS?" You could put a disclaimer that says parties of 10 or more are required for prix fixe menu?

What's the point in going to a place that uses small plates as a signature theme and then say you have to order a prix fixe menu? 

Limon, seriously, get your act together; you're losing brownie points fast!
author: Julie L.

description: I love the chicken, the sweet potato fries, ceviche mixto, beef tongue, panna cotta and pisco sour. And I usually hate chicken. This place is great. My only complaint is that they don't give you enough water.
author: Cindy C.

description: Their mixed ceviche was BOMB. Also got their chicken, which was pretty tasty but nothing too special. I thought their tapas version of lomo saltado was excellent as well as their paella. However I will say that there are cheaper places to get delicious peruvian food. With those dishes and a pitcher of sangria it came out to be 50+ for my friend and I each.
author: Samantha C.

description:
Came here as a party of four on a Tuesday night (had reservations, but probably didn't need them).  

We started with the sangria and an assortment of ceviche, all of which were excellent (I really liked the crunchy roasted corn used to accent a couple of the ceviche dishes).  We followed this with the fried chicken and tiger prawn appetizers, which together were probably the highlight of the meal.  We then split two entrees: the pescado and the lamb shank, both of which were also very good, if unspectacular.

The service was excellent, and the prices were quite reasonable.  All in all, a solid 5* experience.
author: Zain K.

description:
Go to place when my friend and I just want some good savory food.  Anytime I come here, rain or shine, freaking 5pm on a random Tuesday or so, there's always a wait, always a line.  So please definitely make a reservation!  Also parking can sometimes be difficult, but trust me you'd definitely want to circle a few times and even park just a little bit further.  You can walk off that food baby and it'll be worth it.

Don't usually have a preference for where I sit (because I'm just happy I'm seated and that much closer to eating)  There are both upstairs and downstairs restrooms so don't be silly and wait for the upstairs one when the floor below has additional stalls.  However I will say this, the downstairs seating is more spacious, can allow for a nicer but different atmosphere that's good for bigger parties.  

Sangria: Delicious, not too sweet, not too fruity.  It's really just right.  Definitely try to order a glass or two while you wait.  It makes the time fly by quicker.

Our usual food order:
1/2 order of the Pollo ala Brasa: Roasted Chicken that just falls off the bone.
Ceviche Mixto: the tiger shrimp, fish, and calamari.  I love Ceviche so I really enjoyed this mixed plate.  Their Ceviche is more lemon-y than expected but it goes well with the fries.
Lomito: Sirloin is nicely flavored
Anticuchos des Res: Beef hearts.  If you like chewy textured food this is for you!
Yucca Fries and Sweet Potato Fries!  It comes in 3 dips definitely try them all!

I am always happy after a meal here.  Always satisfied.
author: Carol V.

description:
Had a somewhat frustrating experience with one of the hosts. I left a review that mentioned this and Laurina reached out and was very thoughtful and accommodating in her response.

We love Limon Rotisserie and will continue to go back! Great food, well priced, nice atmosphere.
author: William D.

description: The location on South Van Ness was  way better.  The service here is pretty terrible.  Its very slow and not very attentive.  Limon use to be one of the best but now its one of the worst.  Sad.
author: Fatty A.

description: Lunch here today was my first experience with Peruvian cuisine. I came with a native Peruvian who praises this restaurant for its consistently tasty and authentic flavor. We ordered: lomito saltado, ceviche, rotisserie chicken, yucca fries, rice side, and green salad. Every dish tasted fabulous and I would gladly order the same again. Great experience all around!
author: Amy M.

description:
I came here with my family for my brother's med school graduation dinner. There was 8 of us and we ordered 3 full chickens, each came with 2 sides and we ordered a few other additional sides. 

The full chickens were cooked really well. They weren't dry and they came with three sauces. One was a olive oil pesto type sauce, another seemed like an aioli dip and the third I couldn't figure out. They went really well with the chicken. 

From what I remember, our sides consisted of the truffle mac and cheese, civiche mixto, sweet potato fries, regular fries, vegetales salteados, tacu tacu, anticuchos de res, costillas nikkei, carne empanadas and a soup. 

These are the reviews from what I ate:

Mac and Cheese: Really great. The oil wasn't too over powering like some truffle mac and cheeses I've tried before. The cheese was really light too. It wasn't super heavy. 

Civiche Mixto: The fish was really fresh. The lemony flavor was really light. I really enjoyed it. 

Swet Potato Fries and Regular Fries: They're just regular fries. Nothing special. 

Vegetales Salteados: Grilled veggies with a hint of salt. They really compliment the dishes well. They were slightly crunchy, not because they were burnt, but because they were only slightly grilled. I wish I had more. 

Tacu Tacu: Its like a rice and bean paste. Not memorable. 

Anticuchos De Res: Beef heart was surprisingly not bad. It doesn't have that gamey flavor I was expecting. I wouldn't eat too much though because its really high in cholesterol. 

Costillas Nikkei: I didn't get a chance to eat any. They were gone as soon as I considered trying it. Maybe that's a sign that they were delicious?

Carne Empanadas: Honestly my favorite part of the meal. They were really tasty. The sauce was so flavorful but not overpowering that you couldn't taste the flaky crust. They only come 2 per order so I suggest ordering multiple plates...or several...

Overall, the food here is good. The atmosphere is what you would expect a trendy place in the Mission to look like. The service was impeccable. Our waiter answered all of our questions with a smile on his face. The food came out really quickly and they took plates away quickly enough to make room for more dishes.
author: Eila S.

description:
I really wanted to like this place, I did...but in the end it really wasn't anything to write home about. Maybe it's because I came here for brunch -- apparently they just started serving brunch here. 

We shared the famous cebiche limon (featured on SFoodie's 92 list - http://blogs.sfweekly.com/foodie/2010/02/sfoodies_92_limon_cebiche.php), and I had the lomo saltado with eggs.

Here are my impressions:

- Cebiche limon: the fish itself was somewhat bland, but the lime juice was awesome...I wanted to drink it.
- Lomo saltado with eggs (beef steak cubes, onion, and tomato mixture -- also served with white herb rice) lives up to its name...it was definitely salty. A little too salty, I think. It was tasty, but not that memorable. 

I would still come back here to give it a second chance...maybe dinner next time.
author: Ted W.

description:
Dear new BFF,

You introduced me to Limon, and for that, I love you.  I experienced a full-blown mouthgasm upon tasting the Seco de Costillas (braised boneless beef short ribs with huacatay and cilantro, served with potatoes and carrot and english peas) and it was wonderful.  I will be back as soon as I possibly can to go on an adventure through all of the delicious-sounding morsels on the menu.

With gratitude,

Taylor L.
author: Taylor L.

description:
I had heard so much good stuff about this restaurant. I was waiting forever to eat there. My bf and I went there for dinner a couple months ago and was not so excited anymore. Limon was a little below decent in food and a little above decent in decor. So I gave it 2 stars at Average, but have had better. 

At first the ambiance and decor was fun, especially with the lime green accents. Their drinks looked yummy, although we don't drink so we ordered virgin drinks, which were not so great. Please don't try "chicha morada". It was a blue corn soda :/ ehh. 

Our food came out looking really pretty the display was on point, the taste on the other hand was a little bland. We love Peruvian food, but Limon is no offense but definitely what you don't call peruvian...it is a little washed out.
author: Muneera M.

description:
I had high hopes that Limon would deliver a fabulous dinner experience, especially given that it was my father's first foray into the world of Peruvian cuisine. However, they fell short.

The food was delicious, but nothing could ever make up for the atrocious service we received. The hostess was completely overwhelmed by the dinner crowd and despite having a reservation we had to wait for 30 minutes to be seated. The servers were equally overwhelmed, and couldn't balance the crowd. Ordering something as simple as water and a round of drinks for the table was unnecessarily laborious, and was an indicator of the evening ahead. To get the check at the end of a meal, we waited for over 15 minutes before it arrived, and my father had to get up and physically take the bill to the bar to get them to process payment. Embarrassing in every way, and I will not be going back any time soon.
author: Gigi B.

description: Want the best chicken in San Francisco?  Come here! It's amazing!  Not a huge fan of their ceviche for some reason. : (  They do a good job on Sangria too and I have always had great service.  Love this location!!!!!  Not a fan of the other one.   Service better here.
author: Coraly S.

description:
It's a tasty spot, for sure.

Though the quality is surely excellent, the drinks and dishes were a little pricey for the amount of food. If it was just a little cheaper I'd probably come a bit more often. As it is, I would generally opt to spend a little more and spring for La Mar downtown. It was tasty but very straightforward Peruvian food - no surprises here. Tasty, great food, yes, but not an interesting twist like you get at La Mar.

I got the Beef short ribs as well as Cabiche Classico, both were very nice. Maracuya Sour was an exciting prospect, but could have been more Maracuya-heavy. They didn't have any Chicha Morada when we were there, but I bet it's good and would be nice to try another time.
author: Mike J.

description:
This is not a review of Limon. This is a review of all the awesome Yelpers who yelped this place! You guys ROCK!!

Per your awesome reviews, we ordered the Ceviche Mixto and loved every bite. We also ordered the Chicharron de Pollo and had what I believe was a religious experience.

The Paella was a bit of a let down due to too much salt.

Once again, thanks to all you fabulous Yelpers for your incredible recommendations!
author: Nazanin A.

description:
A friend chose Limon Rotisserie via Open Table based on the filters: geography, 4+ stars, groups.

We had 9 for dinner on a Monday night.  We were seated pretty quickly once most of our group had arrived.  We ordered a bunch of dishes to share family-style -- roasted chicken (obviously), lomito saltado, chicharron de pollo, ceviche, truffle mac & cheese, veggie empanadas, and a couple of other things.  Basically the only thing we didn't finish easily was the truffle mac & cheese -- delicious but on the heavy side and not so Peruvian-seeming.  The food and drink were excellent, and the service was friendly (like, jokey-flirty friendly, maybe because we had an all-ladies' table). 

Several in our party ordered the sangria -- very tasty.  We ordered a couple mango lemonades (good) and strawberry lemonade (not so good).  Panna cotta mango dessert -- wonderful.

Given the amount of food and drink we ordered, we were all pleasantly surprised by the bill (which came out to $23 pp).

The only issue about bringing a group here is that groups are seated in the lower level (basement) of the restaurant, and on a Monday night, it got super loud! Such that you couldn't understand people talking a couple seats away from you, and table-to-server (and vice versa) conversations had to be repeated several times.   

I would definitely come back again though, just with a smaller party.
author: Elaine S.

description:
Oh Limon and your darn ceviche. I CRAVEEEE.

I've only been here once, but man... the food is soo good! Came here for my friends sweet 26th birthday and got to try a good amount of food off their menu (family style is the best btw). 

Pollo latino was tender and the mash potato was perfect!
Red snapper was delicious. Top notch fish sticks!
Limon ceviche... man.. thinking about it makes my mouth water. Mmm.

My friends also ordered the oyster shooters and they LOVED it. I'm sad I didn't get the chance to try it, but I'm going to convice my boyfriend to go there so I can get my ceviche fix and shoot up with those oysters!
author: Vivian T.

description:
75% sizzle, the rest steak, to wit:

$8 for two tiny, albeit tasty, empanadas
$20 for a small, tad salty, paella plate

Good service.
author: Inigo M.

description:
I love Limon - but the one on South Van Ness is better than this one. Same menu, nice staff at both, loud and busy always either place, but Valencia gets overheated more (the kitchen is right there) and a few times I've had dishes come out that didn't seem freshly prepared. And the chicken is just plain good here while at the other address it is great.

Walk the extra half-mile. And then go to Humphry Slocombe for dessert.
author: Will R.

description:
We haven't been back to Limon since a couple of years ago ('06) and not since before the big fire which put it out of commission for a couple of months...We were there with a largish group for a birthday (8 of us all told), and when the group was assembled, we were escorted upstairs to a table on the 2nd level.  We ordered several dishes to share - a number of the ceviches and crudos and a couple of orders of the empanadas before tucking into our mains.

The upshot - definitely stick with the ceviches (delicious, fresh fish, tender calamari - leche de tigre is a dazzling, perfect marinade ) - perhaps eschew the Tres Tiempos that boasted 3 fishes with 3 sauces but these turned out lacking in flavor.  The empanadas had a fantastic crust, and were filled with savoury cubes (rather than ground) of beef, served with a nice creamy dipping sauce. 

Blandness unfortunately returned with the mains - though the Whole Fried Fish was striking in presentation - the filleted carcass artfully used as a decorative serving vessel, in which nestled chunked fried fish flesh --  the dish, and its sauce -- lacked salt. The Chuleton Don Carlos pork chop was  thick, with a nicely frenched bone  - the server forgot to give me a steak knife and I had to ask for one, but even their version of a steak knife (practically unserrated) was not the best tool to cut through the chop, measuring just shy of an inch around... it seemed juicy but a bit tough and overcooked, and I missed the beautiful savoury meaty flavours from a Nopa or Blue Plate chop.  There was definitely something lacking in its pallid taste.  The dish could have also used a bit more of the cabbage and bacon accompaniment.

I did have a nice drink - a Soju Sour -refreshingly light, almost like a perfectly-balanced lemonade, not overly sour, not overly sweet.  If we were to return, we may just opt for a drink and focus on the ceviches and other smaller plates, skipping the mains.
author: Claudine C.

description:
Where do I begin with this place? Well let me start off by saying that I had a horrible waiter with no manners. What happened to good customer service? My food was not cooked right and my waiter was a complete a** hole! When I told the waiter that my meat was not cooked well since I asked for well done he gave me a plate of blood filled meat, he gave a disgusted look and when he came back wit my new plate he threw the plate on the table (rude). If the red blood in my food wasn't enough my second plate was burned to a crisp.I ended up telling the waiter to take my food back because I was so disappointed that I told him to forget it and that I didn't want anything. He brings me the check and tries to charge me for food I did not even eat! Eventually the bill is cleared and I leave hungry and upset after the horrible service here.

*For the restroom it was nice but dirty and the sink was broken, maybe they'll fix that one day, but Im NEVER coming back here again there are way better peruvian restaurants in the city and Limon is not one of them.

AVOID AT ALL COSTS!
author: Ella P.

description: Ceviche and arroz con Mariscos is really good, I will comeback soon!
author: Humberto O.

description:
Limon is your hot spot where you smooch with your lover over bites, or simply check out the scene in your new leather pants.  Very open and nicely lit space, with plenty of kitchen candy for those craving a great Peruvian taste.  I know, I know most of you love and swoon over La Mar, but to me thats all faux and not the real fur!  Limon comes the closest in my opinion to good peruvian food outside the home.  The drinks are stiffly made and always appealing on the eye.  Even the beer is poured sexy over here.  

Once your ready to bite down don't skimp, go crazy and order all the delish treats.  The Ceviche De Pescado is fresh raw fish marinated lightly in garlic, lime, and purple onion.  Taste very fresh, and you will enjoy every bite as if your where down in Mira Flores Peru on vacay.  You definitely wanna go with some Chicharron de Pollo, which is Chicken fried to perfection so it has that perfect crunch in every bite.  If you like spicy be sure to ask the waiter for "fresh Rocoto sauce", this stuff is so tasty you'll be addicted and searching where to get the ingredients to make it.  Don't mistake it for the 3 sauces they bring out for you in the beginning, those are Aji Amariilo, Chimichurri, and Rocoto Cream.  The Ahi Tuna is also tasty but its not some Peruvian staple so you can afford to pass.  The Jalea is also tasty and has a variety of seafood deep fried in a tasty lightly salted batter with purple onions over it.  Most of the bites here, are lick your lips good!

When ever in this hood stroll by, I sure do.  This spot is on hit!
author: Eryka V.

description: A month later I'm still ticked off. Just had a beautiful dinner in the Mission elsewhere and not once did two dishes arrive at the same time or overlap, the salad came first, and dessert was offered politely at the end, in a raging full fun restaurant. So it is possible.
author: Matthew O.

description: Service was great! But honestly the arroz con marisco was not good! It really taste like rice a roni with very little variety of seafood mixed in there. Tried many Puruvian restaurants so I know the difference.
author: Jeana E.

description: We came in pretty close to closing. They were understaffed and the manager was having to host and seat people. They were on a wait but made sure to seat is and serve us after they were closed. Everyone was very polite and wanted to make sure we had a great time even after they stopped serving. The limito and chicharones are amazing. Always get the extra sauce! Service was great and the manager was awesome. I love this place and will continue to come back and recommend this place to friends.
author: Brittany R.

description:
I wanted to visit this location, because I am a fan of the spot on Van Ness.  After visiting yesterday, I can definitely say that I prefer Van Ness.  I just didn't feel the "at home" vibe that I did at Van Ness.  Some traditional Latin food items on the menu also seemed to lack the traditional staples--I mean, who eats ceviche by its lonesome?  

Don't get me wrong, the food was tasty.  I think my favorite was the vegetarian empanadas.  Yummy!  (My strawberry mojito wasn't too bad either.)

For sure I'll visit Van Ness again, but not Valencia.
author: Felicia P.

description:
I went here on a date last night and have mixed reviews about this one.... Very cute place and a few great dishes.

Highly recommend the tuna tartar, the ceviche, and the beef heart! We also had the calamari, which was bizzarre.... they stuffed it with meat or something.

However, the waiter was difficult because he refused to let us order any more food after we had appetizers, because it was going to "get busy". Listen buddy, I've worked in a busy restaurant before too, and it wasn't busy!
author: Taylor L.

description: I waited over an hour to get seated despite having a reservation. Inconsiderate and they need better time management.
author: Meredith M.

description:
I had heard some pretty high praises of this place so maybe I went in with  unrealistic expectations, but my reaction to this place is "mehhh, it's good..." (READ: underwhelmed)

I came here with a few guys who were looking to start their night off with some delicious food and drinks.  We did not make reservations but were seated pretty quickly.  I must say I was sort of surprised at the attire at this place - we were in jeans and felt somewhat out of place (seriously? in SF?) and the hostess was acting a bit snooty... The place was pretty crowded and I think I got knocked by passing waiters about 12x while we sat there.  The drinks were good, but pretty weak, especially for the guys I was with and they were slow to come by and ask if we wanted another round.  

Of the food, we got several different things to share with varied success.  The short ribs and empanadas were actually VERY good. I would've probably gotten 2 orders of the short ribs had I known they were going to be so tender and delicious.  The quinotte de vegetables was alright... sort of dry for a risotto, but whatever... 

The loma saltado was also pretty good but not necessarily a "large plate" to share. I think it was nearly empty after only two of us had served ourselves. It also wasn't really mindblowing - it was good, but it's sort of a miracle that I even remember tasting it now that I think about it. 

Overall this place is pretty overrated and the menu doesn't seem to make too much sense. You can't really tell what they're going for and it was just a bit underwhelming in taste and service.  Bummer cause it's a great location and has a cool vibe when you look in walking by... Ohhhh well!
author: Elizabeth B.

description:
We ordered 3 cerviches and then the lunch specials (short ribs, pescado and a veggie dish).

The one w ahi tuna cerviche was delish. The other two were meh. The chicken soup that comes w the lunch special was too salty. The short ribs were too salty. The veggie dish was bland and under cooked. The pescado was ok. The salads were soggy - as if they rinsed it, didn't get all the water out, and then let the salad sit in the water for a while before serving.

Limon used to be better.  Now, the food is nothing to write home about.
author: Joyce K.

description:
Right from the start, this place was five stars! My daughter and I got there well before the rest of our party (and were greeted with grace and class), so we sat at the bar and had a drink: I had a Pisco Sour, my daughter had basically the same thing, but with cactus flower juice (can't remember what it was called) - both were delicious, and the bartender was sweet, charming and well-informed about what he was serving (always a nice touch!). (And...he was very handsome and well-put-together, but that's an entirely different review, isn't it?)

The wait-staff at this restaurant is nothing short of amazing - everyone (guy) is friendly, efficient, and, like the bartender about his cocktails, well-informed about the menu. We asked for recommendations on what to order and were given an honest list of dishes that are really small (too small to share amongst 5 adults) and dishes that are  favorites and/or the best items on the menu - we weren't steered wrong a single time.

And then, of course - bottom line - the reason we're all here in the first place, right? - there's the FOOD.  It's great. Period. Not in a Bobby Flay way, not in a Giada de Laurentis way.  But in a "Mom" way. The way Mom makes food for a huge party. The way Mom makes food when her kids aren't feeling well. The way Mom makes food for a special occasion. This is THE SHIT!!!  The real deal. The house specialty; the short ribs; the chicken "chicharon;" the yucca fries; ad infinitum. Everything we ordered was exceptional.  Really.  Order it.  Order it all.  Don't be afraid, just order it. 

This could be one of your best meals in town...Do it!
author: Teresa G.

description:
I love this place, the food is really tasty. 
I recommend Lomito Saltado, if you like steak.

I would love to give this place 5 stars, but the portions are really tiny.
Its maybe just me but I one portion wasnt enough for me. However, I would say thats one of the best restaurants in the city. Another thing, I would recommend you to make a reservation if you are planning a visit.
author: Kay E.

description:
Went out to Limon last night to celebrate my birthday.  The food and table service was excellent.  We ordered a variety of dished to share -- empanadas, paella, crab salad, beet salad, truffle mac and cheese, tuna tartare, stuffed chicken breat and tuna ceviche.  I love that the menu is designed to eat family style so you get to try lots of different things.  Our server was attentive and kept our water glasses full, even though it was a busy night.
One thing kept me from giving them 5 stars, and that was their process of "confirming" my reservation.  At 5:45, an hour before my reservation, I received a call saying that they were confirming my reservation.  He was a bit rude, asking if everyone in the party was coming (my reservation was for 6), and said that they were very busy and would give the table away if we were more than 15 minutes late.  I understand all of these things (I've worked in restaurants), but reservation confirmations should be done well before the time of seating.  The whole situation came off as an excuse to threaten to give our table away.  It put a damper on my celebratory mood, but we shook it off and got in the car.  
Unbelievably, I got another call on my water to the restaurant, this time just 30 minutes before my reservation.  The gentleman launched into his spiel of confirming my reservation because they were busy... and then asked me to hold -- putting me on hold just 10 seconds after getting me on the line.  He came back on and I told him that I had spoken with someone just 30 minutes earlier confirming my reservation.  He said, "Oh okay, we just want to make sure."  I was dumbfounded.  I feel like it's same to assume that another large party had walked in and they wanted to give our table away.  To be fair, I don't know that for sure, but I see no other explanation for 2 phone calls "confirming" our reservation so close to our seating time.
It was the night before the playoff game, so I understand that they were busy and the staff was stressed, but I really don't see any excuse for what happened.  With that said, the food was amazing, so I will be back -- just probably not on an evening when there's something big going on in the city.
author: Calee S.

description:
Yes, this place looks nice.  Yes, it looks fancy.  Yes, the food is good- yeah that's right, JUST good.  While there were some great items on the menu (like the shortribs), I just felt like I didn't quite get the best bang for my buck.  The dishes, while delectable, were quite expensive for the portions and I just wasn't too impressed.

Loved the decor inside and ambiance/location is great but would recommend Andolou or Cha Cha Cha for tapas/small dishes over Limon.
author: Natan O.

description: The lomo Saltado was delicious, more meat than there were vegetables, and the sliced steak was very tender, juicy and rich in flavor. The chicken was very rich in flavor as well...even their white rice was tasty yet subtle. I had a really good experience here.. It may be a little bit pricy for what they give you, but it's worth it because the food I had was really delicious.
author: Rochelle R.

description:
I really expected better with all the reviews. In some ways they were on top of it and in others they dropped the ball completely. So to be fair I will break it down.

Good:
The atmosphere is quiet nice a chill good music too and not too loud. The price for three people without drinks was $50, sweet! 
The service was pretty darn good and on top of it, plus friendly.
The seto was good and so was the fish dish. I love the small plates and large plates, making it easy to share and have the right size meal. 
The chocolate dessert was pretty good but also a standard of restaurants. 
OK:
The ceviche is not rocking like I thought it would be. The pieces of fish are so huge and chunky it is hard to get a bite of anything else, needed to be smaller. 
How it was dressed and paired with corn is OK. Needed more color or something to balance out the huge chunks of fish. Just lacking...
Bad:
The salad was over dressed and what is with the canned artichokes during artichoke season? Really!? Seems lazy and unhealthy. The salad was the worst dish and was supposed to be the healthiest. Disappointing! 
Ugly: 
They did not clean the intestine track of the shrimp. EW!
author: Natasha M.

description: I was there  Saturday 6/01/13 with 9 friends. We order pollo a la brasa, lomo saltado and ceviche. Everything was going well till we found a thing moving in the ceviche, it looked like a worm. Disgusting
author: Sahet J.

description:
I've been here a few times so I think it's time to write a review.

Must Try: truffle mac and cheese, lomito saltado, SANGRIA!

Last time we were there, I was with a group of 4 (2 of which were hungry men) and we ordered 7 food items, and 2 pitchers of sangria and it was an absolute feast!  Not too pricey either.

There are a lot of places to get great food in the mission, but I would recommend this place because of their atmosphere.  It feels trendy and cool but not stuffy at all... A great place to celebrate a special occasion with a group or just start off a fun night with a great meal.
author: Michelle F.

description:
Came here for a mid-afternnon pick me up and through a recommendation from a local boutique owner. We really only ordered a couple small plates, chicken & short-ribs, and drinks however everything was on point!

There were maybe two or three other parties in the restaurant when we were first seated which was nice. The space was a lot smaller than I thought it would be and I could only imagine how packed it gets during their busy hours, but strike that from the record. Just in inkling. I'm a total fan!
author: Desiree R.

description:
I will post pictures later but for now, I want to get the word out that Limon is the best place to go for tapas and conversation. 

You get to try a little of everything and it is all satisfying and comforting.  The servers are attentive without being intrusive.

We ordered the Jalea Fried Mixed Seafood, Cheese Empanadas, Seco de Costillas, Truffle Mac n Cheese, and a mixed salad that contained a nice balance of beets, potatoes, and hominy in a super tasty sauce.

The Jalea Fried Mixed Seafood came with a dill-infused tartar sauce that is simply divine. I wish they would sell jars of it.  I can never find a tartar sauce to match this one.

The cheese empanadas and seco de costillas were eaten in tandem.  Part of this is that I liked the flavorful sauce that the seco de costillas came in and drizzled it on the empanadas.

We are not huge fans of chocolate but the Chocolate Bandido is amazing! Just the right amount of sweetness and the texture allows for mess-free eating.

We have tried their chicken dishes and most of their hot plates.  All dishes are packed full of flavor and you will need to have a glass of water on hand to clear the palate for the next luscious morsel you try.
author: Gabriela S.

description:
My sister-in-law eats home-cooked Peruvian food cooked by her new Peruvian daughter-in-law.  She wanted to experience Peruvian restaurant cooking.

We dined in Limon last night.  The waiter was attentive.  We ordered roasted chicken, paella and a white fish dish.

Now the good things:  The sweet potato fries were delicious.  The fried yuca was lightly crisp on the outside and soft inside.  Unfortunately, these were the only good things last night.

The bad things:  SALT.  The chicken were salty and overwhelmed any other flavor.  The vegetables were very salty.  The paella rice was well cooked, but it was very salty.  We picked the fresh calamari and shrimp to eat, and left the rice on the plate.  The fish was swimming in a sauce as salty as the Dead Sea.

We all felt the food was too salty.  The opinion was unanimous.  We all rated the food one-star.  

If the cook was having an argument with the owner and sabotaged the food to get even, we the diners suffered.  If not, then the cook was ham fisted with the salt.
author: Robert W.

description: The four stars is for the great bartenders and the chicken, probably one of my favorites in the city. The sauces could be a bit more saucy.
author: H L.

description: This is my favorite restaurant in San Francisco!!! The chicken is great!
author: Laura F.

description: THOOPER GOOD FOOD. Well priced too. It's good to go in groups because you can get a bunch of dishes and pitchers of sangria to share. Every time I've gone there I've fallen victim to eyes-are-bigger-than-stomach syndrome, but I'm always happy to take home the leftovers. The main floor of the restaurant is lively and pleasant, but the floor below is less comfortable. Reminded me of something out of a crime show (like the cellar where the murderer decapitates his victims...you know what I mean). Concrete floors, fluorescent lights...no but other than that I love this Peruvian paradise.
author: Laura F.
