description: I love this place, The bartenders are hella koo and despite the place being crowded sometimes there is always room for everybody to have a pisco sour. Great staff and hostess who always carried a smile and had an answer to every question about the food and drinks. I gotta say its my fav peruvian place.
author: Anthony P.

description: OMG, I love this!  The food is hella delicious and the ambience is incredible.  Great for dates, family function(maybe), and a get together with friends.  I highly recommend it.
author: Alan T.

description:
I thought Limon was amazing. While we only tried two items, both were phenomenal! 

We started with the Chicharron de Pollo which was tasty. The dipping sauce was delicious!

For our entree, we split the Lomo Saltado which we loved and devoured. It has so much flavor and the meat was great. 

I can't wait to go back and try more dishes!
author: Jeanette L.

description: The Chicharon de Pollo, sweet potato fries, and grilled veggies sides were excellent. However, the roasted chicken while good had soggy skin -- which means it must have sat in a warmer oven for a while. If I go back, I'd try something other than the roast chicken.
author: Paul L.

description:
We had the good fortune of sitting at the window and watch the passerby's drool at our meal. 

The mojito Limon was top notch and I was surprised to find out that it was made with Sake instead of white rum but don't let that stop you, it was damn good.

I had the traditional Peruvian dish- Lomo Saltado which came nicely presented with steak, tomatoes, onions, cilantro, garlic in a soy sauce on french fries with a side of rice. The tastes all mixed well together. This is the meal to get if you cant figure out what to order. Also I had a chance to try the Pescado Limon (Snapper fillet) which was cooked perfectly. 

The prices are respectable and the place gets lively at night. Dont be discouraged by a few suspect characters walking by, you cant pass on this restaurant.

Will I go back?
Yeah, I gots to try the Ceviche and more mojitos!
author: Lou G.

description: Went there for my bday last night.  Service was really bad, didn't seem like they had any system or flow.  Waited 10min for the waiter to come over after flagging down the hostess.  Finally when we did let them know, they started to over compensate, everybody from the waiter to the bus boy to another server were asking us 3 times if we wanted more water.  Food and Sangria were good but definitely over priced for the quantity.  The Mariscos con arroz $17 for a small plate? The ceviche was decent, but again $13 for tiny plates.  I'm a big fan of Peruvian, but I'll be headed to staples like Fresca in the future.
author: Damon B.

description: Very Tasty! the mixed ceviche was right on point. Mushrooom Empanadas were perfect. Oh wow and their dipping sauces! Definately check this place out!
author: Richard P.

description:
Very lively environment.  This is a great brunch option for a group of four or less on a lazy Sunday.  That's when we went.  There are less expensive options in the Mission but the setting was clean and modern, and the service was good.  Our seating was available 20 minutes after our reservation though..  

All of the food we ordered was very good and a great introduction to Peruvian dishes: lomo saltado, chicken chicarron, seafood paella, yuca fries, and the mojitos.  Although the rice in the paella could be less salty.  Try the yuca fries - that was pretty unique and tasty.  I want to find some yuca roots at the supermarket now.

TIP:  The place was pretty loud, so raise your voice if you want to hear one another.  I couldn't hear the waiter well, so we had a difficult conversation.
author: Bonnie S.

description:
Limon is a cool little spot to have an intimate date or dinner with the girls before a night out on the town. We decided to do a girls night on a Sunday PM and the place still had an excellent crowd. The hostess was super cool in helping us find a seat that we were comfortable in. 

We ordered all the small tapa dishes and decided to share. The food comes out as SOON as you order it which is always a plus.
Food Rating as Follows:
Lemon Pescado A
Ceciche de Pescado y Camaron(SOOOO GOOD!! We ordered 2 of these!) A++
Causa de Pollo B+
Seco de Costillas(Short Ribs) A-
Empanadas B+
Paella B

I mean overall the food was not bad at all, but I think I am just spoiled because I have had authentic Peruvian food, this however is very close to it. I definitely recommend checking this spot out if you are ever in the mood for some yummy Peruvian food!
author: Hillary H.

description:
Well, I do like this place. Yes, I do. Ceviche is good. Ahi tartar, good. Empanada, good. Atmosphere, good. Service, good.

Then why only 3 stars?

I don't know...I guess it's "good" overall, but nothing really stands out for me...

When after everything else in the area closes after lunch, this place is like a savior.
author: Aya C.

description:
The sun was high in the sky and my wine glass was full of delicious sangria. After a glass I was a bit loosey goosey, but I am a light weight anyways. 

The Sangria went well with the Cerviche (of which Limon had 3 variations). The menu looked like it had many other tasty options.

For the main course we went with a chicken cut into 4 with the sweet potato  fries and some other sides. All was well in me belly.

A bit pricey and slow with the service, or else this could of been a 5-banger. Maybe next time.
author: Phil H.

description: Good Food. Poor Service. Had to actually get up and ask for another glass of wine as all the help was in the back and not paying attention. There was a gross smell like they were cleaning the bathrooms, not condusive to a great meal. Won't go back.
author: Nancy B.

description:
Do you LOVE when you go to a restaurant and nobody comes to bring you water, check in with you, or take your order during the first 10 minutes after sitting down? How about when food does start to come out, there is a 30 minute waiting time between dishes, and ALL the OTHER tables around you are getting their food, despite the fact that they ordered waaay after you? If you like this kind of service, then Limon is the place for you.

Limon was waaaay packed last Sunday. You definitely need a reservation; and even with a reservation you will be asked to wait a few minutes to be seated. 

The menu is simple and straightforward. Lots of different tapas to share. We actually enjoyed ALL of our selections: ceviche mixto, the fried chicken, lomo saltado, and the snapper. 


It was simply the SERVICE that upset me and left me with a sour taste in my mouth. Also, they refilled my soda, then charged me for it. Stupid.
author: Misha F.

description:
I've been here loooong time ago... I remember their ceviche... it's ok.

Came back here with friends that grew up in Peru.... they loved the chicken and they said their sauces are authentic and you can't get it anywhere else.  I am not from Peru, but the chicken are very tasty and tender.. sauces are special and tasty.. but that's an expensive chicken.. lol...  I can get 5 from costco for the price.  (I am not a huge fan of chicken..  for me chicken is not really a delicacy that I will pay so much for it.....)

They also love the ceviche which is good but they also say without the chicken, they had better Peruvian Restaurants to go to.... 

Their lomito saltado kind of sucks... everyone agrees that it was way too salty.  Nobody wants to finish it...

Yuca fries were great!
author: Jo L.

description: If you are looking for a hip, loud & happing place with good tapas, especially the seafood then head over to the Valencia corridor!! They are known for their rotisserie chicken, which was good but not WOW! Their ceviche is a must have. Their chicken empanadas are better than the beef especially with the tangy sauce that comes with it. Pass on the sweet potatoes fries- BORING, salad was average. They are known also for their sangria.....treat yourself and impress your out of town visitors11
author: marcus c.

description: Best Peruvian food ever! Though smaller in area than the other branch on south van ness, I like this place better for its quick service. Great food as ever.. I have been here multiple times and the pisco sour is amazing and my favorite.. Tried yuca fries, tigre cocktail, half chicken, sea food paella.. Their small plates are so good that you may end up ordering loads of food and it gets pricey too!
author: Madhuri S.

description:
We went here on the Monday night of Memorial day vacation weekend - we arrived without a reservation. The hostess offered us to sit at the bar or else wait to see if any of the number of reservations they had turned out to be no shows. 

We opted to sit at the bar and wait for a table. It turned out we didn't even get time to order a drink and she was ready to seat us.

The service was very polite and attentive, however, I did feel that it may have been almost too efficient that it gave the impression of feeling rushed.

For a place that is at the price point it is, I would expect not to feel too much like they just want to turn the table. It wasn't enough to truly bug me, but I thought I'd note it for fairness, because I'm about to RAVE about some of their food.

We ordered some mojitos to start which came quickly and tasted great. No too citrusy or too syrupy. A nice balance.

If you order anything at this place you MUST get the following:

Carne Empanadas - We order a second serve they were so good. The filling was so full of flavor and unique. YUM!!

Yucca Fries - Pica Pica down the road serves something similar, but these blow it out of the water. I'm a big fan of my fried foods and the texture of these things is just perfection - the dipping sauces are divine too.

Truffle Mac and Cheese - I'm a whore for truffle anything and mac and cheese is probably one of the worlds most perfect comfort foods. This dish is perfectly truffled and perfectly cheesy. Again, we ended up ordering another helping of this side - we are dubbing it "Crack and Cheese".

The other stuff we ordered was the fried chicken tenders and the calamares rellenos. The chicken tenders were OK, but I felt the chicken was sort of these straggly bits of chicken thigh that seemed a bit overdone (almost jerky like in some of the parts).

The calamares rellenos was really not my cup of tea. The dish wasn't "bad" -- it looked beautiful, but the flavor was very fishy and I guess it just wasn't me.

I felt the service could have been a little warmer and relaxed, but all in all I would definitely go back here.

4 stars!
author: Lachlan M.

description: LOVE Limon. Just moved to the neighborhood and Limon is definitely going to be a regular occurrence. The fair pricing and the sangria make the already delicious chicken even better.
author: Lauren O.

description:
This review is about the customer service and not the food as I never got a chance to eat there.  I made reservations for my birthday dinner. A party of 30 is hard to accommodate in the city.  I accidentally made reservations for both Limon restaurant and Limon Rotisserie, my mistake I understand.

Here is my problem with the restaurant.  We had checked in 15 mins prior to our reservation.   Over an hour later and we were still not seated.  It took 30 mins of complaining to the hostess to finally get the manager to come talk to us.  She then spent the next 30 mins walking from front of the restaurant to the back with the excuse of checking in on the table and towards the end to talk to the owner.   Final result was that they would try to seat us at the main level of the restaurant instead of the second level.  Problem was that we would have to wait for some tables to open up first.  

I understand there was some miscommunication with reservation; however they still had us down for the time slot we requested earlier when we checked in.  If the restaurant couldn't accommodate our party, they should have been honest with us in the beginning instead of stringing us along for over an hour.   Bottom line, this place will never get my business again.

Buyers beware if you are trying to reserve for a large party!
author: Steve O.

description:
Super-duper amazing! Not sure why i waited so long to go.... anyways all their drinks are Pisco sour based and the friends we went with did have to go through a couple of rounds to pick the one they liked, but definitely great. 
The vegetarian iptions were really good! I have been to Fresca, which my husband (a seafood lover) really enjoyed! bUt for a vegetarian there is literally one option and it was average. But the one dish that was indulgent and memorable were the truffle mac and cheese.  OMG - loved it!!! (and i am not even that big fan of truffle). 
Great service, amazing ambience, and great food options for all. and I HEART the Mission!
author: Sapna E.

description: Great place, good food, awesome drinks. Especially after work on Fridays... Must go!
author: Sharae B.

description: We went here with my wife, my son and a friend. We were seated upstairs, which is this dark, extremely noisy, no-decor, low-ceiling, unpleasant den. We ordered pisco sour, which were these watery concoctions tasting of some sort of artificial juice. We also asked for water, especially for my son, which never arrived (maybe they used it all in the pisco sours). We got to explore the $9-an-empanada menu for a very long time, since 10-15 minutes after the pisco sours had arrived nobody had come to take our order (or bring the water). When we finally caught a waiter, we paid for the pisco and left without eating.
author: Greg D.

description:
Food isn't authentic Peruvian.  Its tapas style, which a true Peruvian knows does not suffice for a hungry stomach.  But the food is very good.  The interpretations of the dishes are well made.  The Lomito Saltado was very good, again not traditionally made, but good.

The Ceviches were all done very well.  Tee Leche de Tigre has a kick, but it was delicious.  Service was very good too, attentive.  Was not able to try dessert.  I went during lunch time.

Pretty big space, looks like they have upstairs seating, maybe they open up more tables for dinner...again I was there at lunch.  Good to get a few things and share with a group, if you can get them all in there.  Noise level a bit loud, but its good for groups.
author: Jorge C.

description: I came to sf for Halloween weekend and decided to come here for dinner.  It was amazing.  We had the mixed ceviche, their famous chicken, the beet salad and their famous beef dish which was beef and fries.  All the dishes were delicious.  The ceviche was probably one of the best ceviches I have ever had.  Highly recommend.
author: Sarah F.

description:
This was so delicious.  Went Saturday night with my sister-in-laws. Small plate restaurants are always a great idea especially when you are trying to keep your portion sizes small!

It was pretty busy for 6pm already,the host took us upstairs and we sat at a table that looked directly out over the restaurant.  I especially loved being able to look down into the kitchen and watch all the prep!

We ordered a pitcher of Sangrias and they were so good.  Those little pieces of fruit in there be careful!  The alcohol infused in there really sneaks up on you, lol! So here is what we ordered:

Truffle mac and cheese
Ceviche Mixto (Fish, calamari and tiger shrimp)
Calamares Rellenos (tacu-tacu stuffed calamari sauteed with artichokes, english peas, and spinach in saffron sauce)
Lomita Saltado (Traditional Peruvian dish - stir-fried top sirloin with onions tomato and soy sauce and french fries mixed in)
Quinotto de Vegetales (quinoa, carrots, zucchini and mushroom risotto style with corn butternut squash sauce and crispy homemade sweet potato chips)
Empanadas

Everything was sooooo delicious.   I did not have any Empanadas as I am not a fan of them.  My favorite items were the Ceviche, loved the bright fresh flavors and the Quinotto.  Triffle mac and cheese well, what can I say but wow...so creamy, cheesy and full of that truffle flavor I love.  All  the plates were beautifully presented also.  We did not have any dessert as we oped to go to Frijtz just down the street and get some great big dessert crepes!  :)
author: Rachel C.

description:
This place is great.  Completely unpretentious and extremely reasonable in terms of pricing.  For 3 people, we ordered a full chicken, the fish and shrimp ceviche, and one of the steak dishes.  It was plenty of food with the sides that come with the chicken.  

The chicken and one of the ceviches are an absolute must.  We had sangria which I am usually weary of because it ends up being a cup of sugar, but it was surprisingly very good.  For dessert, the profiteroles and the chocolate bandido were delicious.  

Limon is one of those places that will enter my rotation of quick, easy, and fun places to go in the city.  For an intimate or group dinner, this place has become one of my instant favorites.
author: Karen W.

description:
Cool place. Stopped in with some fam for some quick bites and drinks. No happy hour is kind of weak. Pretty empty in there, but nice ambiance. Definitely feels very nice and is a little Oasis from the psychosis of 16th street. 

I had one Cristal and one Cusquena ($4 each). Love Peruvian beer. Both were delish. My fam were ordering some pink prickly pear drinks that they said were amazing. We got two orders of the empanadas, some kind of fried seafood combination thing, and the chicharron de pollo for about $8-9 each. 

The empanadas were really good. They were about average size, good amount of really flavorful beef inside of them. They came with a pretty good dipping sauce, but it did not blow me away. The seafood combination was not very good in my opinion. Just a bunch of pieces of fried calamari, shrimp, cod, and, of course, yucca. The yucca was out of place, the cod was not really seasoned. I didn't try the shrimp, but overall I could have done better at home. 

The chicharron de pollo stood out as clearly the best dish. It was a good sized portion, the flavor was amazing, and it came with a great dipping sauce. The chicken pieces were pretty crispy on the outside, but were still tender with an amazing glaze. I really liked this dish and thought it was worth the money. 

Overall, I would probably come back if they had a happy hour, but the prices were pretty steep for what you get. I think that I could probably get better for less money elsewhere, but if money were no object, I would definitely return. Until they have specials though, I think I will keep my distance.
author: Miguel V.

description: This is my new go to happy hour spot! 5 dollars ribs hearty enough to be dinner? Say no more! Eric is the BEST bar tender on Tuesdays! He's so attentive and THE BEST mixologist! We will be back!
author: Tiffany A.

description:
Everything about this place was excellent!  We came here with 12 people for a very special birthday feast and everything about this place was superb.  We have reservations at 7:30 so we decided to get some booze at Blondies next door (already one star for being walking distance to a cool bar).  We were sat promptly and we had to order from the prefix menu due to the large table. Everyone ordered everything off the prefix menu so I got to try a little something off everyone's plate:

1. Ceviche with fish, shrimp and squid:  without a doubt' the highlight of the meal. The lemon sauce was delicious and the fish did not have that "fishy" taste. I don't even eat seafood and I didn't even order it but I was able to jack a couple of pieces from around the table. 
2. Beef empanadas: not bad. Just got one and though it looked pretty sad, I ate the he'll out of it!  Beef was cooked right; the crust was crispy and light 
3. Sirloin and rice: so friggin good I almost wet my pants!  The steak was delicious and cooked just right but for some reason, the rice was like I was back at home with my moms cooking!  So good I had to ask for more rice and prayed to the gods that they would bring some soy sauce (maggi) 

The best part of the night wasn't even the food; it was the excellent staff and their ultimate friendliness toward our loud ass group.  Granted we had a large group and there were tons of loud ass people at the table, there was this old person come up to the table to tell us to shut up. Literally, he went to two tables and asked us to shut up because we were too loud at a mission restaurant. He even asked the wait staff to call the police on us.  Again, Mission Restaurant, Saturday night, loud tables everywhere, and you're asking us to shut it up?  I'm so happy the wait staffs told them to STFU and if you don't like it, go to another restaurant because this restaurant is only for fun people!  Even the other tables were laughing out loud and there was a nice camaraderie amongst all of the tables.   The wait staff + manager literally just got a lifelong customer after that fiasco.

Again, Quiet restaurant in Mission?  That is NEVER going to happen

4.5 stars for the food, if I could give 6 stars, I would for the superior service
author: Chris H.

description: The chicken is to die for!! Love the seasoning and how moist and tender it is when it comes to the table. The best dipping sauce is the light red one, reminds me of chipotle sauce. The ceviche mixto is great too,  love the red snapper and gotta try the mango lemonade!!! I am coming back for sure!
author: Monica L.

description:
Disappointments:

Lomo Saltado - Meat was chewy and overall dish was too salty for my taste. Not worth $20.00.

Causa de Pollo - Cold shredded chicken on top of cold mashed potato. My mistake for not asking our waiter if this was a hot or cold appetizer. 

I should have known better than to venture into the appetizer and entree territory. Next time I'll stick with their delicious ceviche and shooters, which never disappoint.
author: Robin K.

description: I took my mom here for a celebratory retirement meal and was not disappointed.  I've been here several times over 5 + years and have been lucky enough to have Limon catered at work once a month for over a year.  I love their rotisserie chicken.  It tastes so good, I don't understand why anyone would cook it any other way (with the only excuse being not having a rotisserie) or not order it when eating here.  As good as the chicken is, the sauces that accompany it are equally amazing.  One in particular is orange in color with herbs and is so addictive.  I'd use it as a dipping sauce for everything given the chance.  We also ordered their seafood paella and empanadas.  The paella was delicious and light and the empanadas had a good good dough with savory filling.  With each round of food we ordered various cocktails and wine.  In all, this meal left us all very satisfied.  In my opinion it is hard to go wrong here as Limon has such good price points and availability.  My only complaint is this place doesn't deliver.
author: Darin E.

description: Sangria was good, main dish alright, dessert delicious, and the ambience was enjoyable.
author: Manny C.

description:
Really great food although I prefer their other location, which is the rotisserie....

This is great, flavorful food with stuffy service. I didn't like the atmosphere very much, although it's a very nice looking restaurant. I usually equate Peruvian food with upbeat service/atmosphere but this was not that. 

Great food, a little pricey, no full bar :( but good none the less.
author: Caitlin F.

description:
We had a terrible experience at Limon last night, and will not be going back.
The food was fine, in fact great, but the service was like nothing else I have ever experienced in a restaurant. Clearly they have a policy to move people through the place as quickly as possible to maximize profits for the night. From the moment we sat down the waitress was on us every minute for us to order. This continued throughout the meal, along with the cheque, which appeared without asking as soon as the desert plates were taken away.
The starters came in literally 3 minutes and once any plates were even remotely finished they were whipped away in an instant. Waiter and table staff hovered continuously ready to snap up any empty dish or glass. At the end of the main course all the dishes were collected and the staff then tried to take my friends plate even though he was clearly not finished.
This reached a breaking point when one staff member, before anyone could even blinked an eye, grabbed several cocktails that were not even empty and carried them away. When we complained about this to the manager he seemed barely interested, and denied that we were being rushed. 
I have never been made to feel so unwelcome in a restaurant in all my life, and the level of stress that the constant pressure to order/eat/order/eat/pay/leave spoiled the evening. Added to this the Warriors basketball game was on the TV's above the bar (is it a sports bar or a restaurant?) which is tremendously distracting, and the roars and cheers made the already noisy room way too loud at times to hold a conversation.
I was surprised to get a table at Limon at short notice on a Friday night, although it was crowded when we got there, but I cannot imagine how a restaurant can survive by basically treating their customers like cattle to rush through like on a conveyor belt. I felt very sorry for the staff, who are obviously under great pressure to enforce this ridiculous policy, and are the ones who have to bear the brunt of their customers ire.
An incredible, almost surreal experience that I will never subject myself or my friends to ever again - there re too many other excellent choices to eat at in the Mission.
author: Stuart L.

description:
Holy wow! So great! Officially my first time to try Peruvian cuisine and I could not have asked for a better experience (unless of course, I had actually been in Peru!). Luckily I had my trusty foodie sidekick friend with me to order one million things in a matter of seconds, in a different language almost entirely. It was like sweet poetry to my ears and tummy!

& After a day of frisbee golfing, the three of us really chowed down hard. Roasted chicken, four sides (sweet potato fries, Yuca fries YUM!, arroz, truffle mac n' cheese), ceviche, and the best damn Pisco Sour I've EVER had. So frothy and refreshing! 

Service was flawless and the ambiance was very cozy and chill. 

Highly recommend!
author: Leigh W.

description: I prefer the bayview location. The chicken has been a bit dry for my liking the past two times I've been there. This place can be crowded, but worth the wait nonetheless. Try their chocolate dessert! Can feed 2 people for under $40. Affordable and delicious!
author: Lucy M.

description:
This place has been consistently good for me till today. I took a childhood friend who was visiting from out of state here for late lunch. When I checked-in on yelp, I was pleasantly surprised about the free lemonade deal. Even though the yelp deal says noon to 6 but the wait staff would only honor it from 4-6pm. Her unfriendly response was a bit disappointing. 

Nonetheless, the food was really good.
author: Eva Y.

description:
food was great! very flavorful and fast service!

lighting was very romantic..best place for dates. It could get loud.

make RSVP!

next time i'll try the rotisserie!
author: Sarah F.

description:
The chicken is solid here!! Slightly crispy on the outside (it ain't fried chicken, if that's what youre looking for!), juicy and tender in the inside. Cooked to perfection. 

GET the sangria. They're strong! :)
author: Rosie W.

description:
Disclaimer: I ordered to go.

Upon walking in, I was glad we weren't eating there.  Has a crowded super casual mission-type style that doesn't let me relax during a dinner.  They were running late with their order so I just stood in the middle of the tiny crowded walk space and felt uber akward- I should have just waited outside.  

The chicken was decent. it wasn't dry, but there were nothing to the flavors.  And no, the flavors didn't fall off during the trip to my friend's house, it was just never there.  Had veggies on the side and I remember putting it down after a bite. 

The food wasn't terrible, so maybe I would give it a try if a friend really wanted to go- but with the atmosphere, I don't think I'll be back.  It's wallet friendly tho.
author: Hannah W.

description:
A fiesta absurdly titled "B-Bop's Unofficial yet Official Birthday" was cobbled together to celebrate a much delayed, as in one month delayed, birthday of the mini caricature known as her Yelp ego of Betty W.  I was crushed to find out that the ill planning led to the demise of a most savory idea she floated of celebrating at Lime.  Even though it was an all girl's affair except me, much to B-Bop's displeasure, I was looking forward to downing bottomless mimosas and hanging with the band of merrymakers that make up the Castro.  Giggling at this prospect two days in advance and focusing my joy into dingling Clitter's clitoris, I immediately stopped strumming when I found  that last minute change predicated that this shindig would now be held at Limon.  While I knew nothing of this place, I knew it a) wasn't Lime and b) didn't have bottomless mimosas.

Arriving for brunch, Limon was aesthetically pleasing.  Our hostess smiled warmly and sat us, while a team of serveurs swarmed us with service.  Handed drink menus, I ordered the pineapple martini which turned out most thirst-quenching.  Waiting for the birthday girl and her troops, we partook in a B.Wong roast and exchanged her top 10 most shameful episodes.  I did not know any so I made up stories.  (jkjk...this did not happen).  When she arrived, the girl obligatories were done.  Hugs were given and the "you look so good", "you look so skinny" exchanges were done in a robotic, sluttish fashion well-versed due to repetition.  Because I was the lone guy, I blankly watched this spectacle sipping my martini, bemused and strangely felt left out.  We each ordered our own plates, but freely shared with each other.  I ordered the choros limon, steamed PEI mussels with bacon, spicy pimento sauce, onions and chimichurri french fries.  Limon is very prompt with their service and there was hardly any wait time.  My mussels were presented artfully.  I would hardly quantify my dish as a meal.  It was literally 12 mussels and a handful of fries.  I devoured this in about 5 minutes.  First off, my dish was extremely salty.  The bacon added to that.  As a result, I left this meal extremely thirsty and unsatisfied.  My french fries were made using extra small russell potatoes no doubt and were soaked by the broth for the mussels.  The should not have been paired and instead, should have been separated by a man made barrier or another dish perhaps.  Other dishes I tried:

1.  mac and cheese: Huckleberry Finn ordered this along.  All the girls were oo-ing and ahh-ing over this dish, however, to me, it sucked ass.  The cheese was good however the pasta used had a very hard consistency.  

2.  sweet potato fries:  Huck Finn also ordered this.  It was okay.  The fries here are cut super thin.  A forcep of your index and thumb will lift half the fries outta the dish.  I couldn't to avoid looking greedy.  Limon is very scant with their portions.

3.  The best dish was the Lomo Salado which was basically fajitas with 2 sunnyside eggs on top.  It was the most normal dishes and most hearty.  I wish I ordered this.  

4.  I don't know what my gf got but it basically looked like a mound of yack, shaped nicely.  It did not taste good at all. 
-edit- she got the quinotto de vegetales (still tasted like ass)

Limon is a classy joint that screams "come in me"  (hehe) when you walk by with an arm linked with yours.  If you are with the guys, you will mostly skip this place and head to Frijtz at the corner.  The food here is mediocre and over the top salty.  You might as well pour Mortons salt out of the carton down my throat.  The portions only give you enough fuel to last for a half-hour before you are beside yourself with hunger.  Damn this place.
author: Brian V.

description:
Great place for a group. We brought some family from out of town here on their first trip to San Francisco. When we were deciding where to eat, they jumped at the idea of peruvian. I made a quick reso on opentable and 30 minutes later, we were there!

There was a bit of wait even though we had a reservation.. but it was Friday night so no biggie. We got a nice booth towards the back of the bottom floor and were served quickly. 

Four of us ordered:
- limon ceviche: delicious... make sure to pour the leche de tigre on the ceviche and let it sit for 5 minutes to let it marinate a bit longer
- chicarrons
- seco de costillas: the beef was cooked perfectly and we used the sauce on top of our paella
- arroz con mariscos: not amazing but still good 
- sangria is REALLY good- do not leave without trying it.

When the bill came, we were all surprised how inexpensive it came out to be for the amount we ate and drank. Really good value for the quality and our guests said it was the best meal they had during their stay in SF!
author: Seema M.

description: Hands down beat tasting food I've had yet. The tapas style dishes Are very generous portions as well. We are like kings for $80 including cocktails (also excellent).
author: D G.

description:
Over aggressive wait staff trying to turn the table ruined a perfectly lovely dinner. 

Chicken and ceviche were good, but found the servers multiple attempts to clear our table rather rude. This was despite the fact that we had food on our plates and in the communal area.
author: Aman H.

description:
Delicious!!!!

lomo saltado - 5 stars ( best lomo saltado in sf)
Ceviche mixto - 3 stars ( la mar and el perol ceviche is better)
Quinoa - 5 stars !! Mm!
Pollo de chicharron - 4 stars 
Pescado - 4 stars 

sorbet trio - 4 stars 
Profiteroles - 4 stars
Panna cotta - 5 stars incredible!!! Smooth and tangy!!
Bandido - 5 stars delicious, melted in the center accompanied with the dulce de leche ice cream (but it's a very small scoop)!
author: Ana M.

description: This place is so Yummy!  The name is true most of the food is made with Limon, so if lemon is not your thing then just order the Lomo saltado and the empanadas those are off the hook. I have been here 3 times now and everything I have tried was so good. It is a bit pricey but if money is not an issue it is the perfect place. Bad part is it gets crowed and if you dont have a reservation on the weekends you will have to wait. But it's worth it!  Now i have to go just to try the Dessert looks so yummy.
author: Lisette C.

description:
LOVE this place!  The staff was very attentive and nice.  The food was great.

Took a friend out for her birthday.  Within the four of us we order 6 dishes, three drinks one dessert to share (bc we were stuffed) and our waiter even came out with a birthday ice cream.  He heard us giving her birthday wishes.  
I don't remember the extact name of everything we ordered...ceviche limon, braised short ribs, vegetables, chicken, fish, and calamari.  Chocolate cake for dessert.  I ordered one of the drinks with passion fruit (Oh it was delish).  Didn't taste strong but I felt it after I was done with it.

Oh the food was perfect to the taste and they are always checking on us and refilling our water and folding our napkins when we got up.  I give them an A+ for attention and smiles.  They don't set your table to one waiter, instead you have other waiters coming by to make sure you are ok and your plates are cleared away when you are done.

Would def come back as a date night with the hubby!
author: Teens F.

description:
My favorite place for Mojitos so far!
Best Ceviche yet; all the appetizers are definitely worth trying!
The dessert is absolutely orgasmic.  
I'd recommend this place over and over again. =)
author: farzana k.

description: We went their for lunch and loved the food. Their signature chicken was great and super tender, some of the best rotisserie chicken I have had.  The service was good and the food was reasonably priced.
author: Gaurav P.

description: Had a 4 course meal with 7 friends and family . Our waiter Alex was fabulous,  he knew all the dishes and every little detail about all of them.  The food was fresh and so flavorful I ate till I couldn't eat another bite.  I recommend this fun and festive place and with the food and service being top notch  I will be back.
author: Scott G.

description:
Food is delicious, the staff is so friendly and warm! Def coming back! 
They have small plates so be prepared to order alot of food to fill up!

Order the black truffle mac n cheese!
author: Yas G.

description: You cannot go wrong with there lomito saltado. (Apparently downgraded in size from the lomo saltado of yesteryear, sadly.) People rave about the chicken here; in my opinion, it's good, not great. The truffle mac and cheese... is... well, it's truffle mac and cheese, so it's really good, but I don't know that it's a stand-out.
author: Alan H.

description:
MAKE RESERVATIONS IN ADVANCE!

We stopped by for a drop in and had to wait 30 minutes on a Friday night just for a table of 2, VERY busy.  We got some really good food for a pretty reasonable price.

After we were seated, they promptly took our order.

- Red Snapper Ceviche
- Tacu-Tacu
- Yucca Fries
- Half Chicken
- Beef Spareribs

The food actually came out really fast.  Probably not more than 10 minutes.  Yucca fries were REALLY good.  Red Snapper Ceviche was the best part of the night, in my opinion.

Beef spareribs were like a beef stroganoff and was really good.

Tacu-tacu (deep fried rice and beans) was a little bland, it could have used a little sauce on top or on the side.

The chicken was good also.  Tender and juicy and came off the bone really well.  It came with 3 sauces (I have no idea what they were) two yellow and one green.  The green one was pretty tasty but the yellow ones weren't that good and both tasted the same.  

I would definitely come back again but make sure I have reservations in advance as this place gets packed.

Not recommended for big parties unless you have reservations.  Group of women who walked in with a group of 6 had to wait for over an hour and still couldn't get a table.
author: Kameron K.

description: I went to Limon again last week after about a year and I have to say, their food got better. The pork ribs, chicken and calamari were great. The paella was good, but not great. The ceviche was decent. Way to improve Limon!
author: Kerry K.

description:
I was really disappointed in Limon.  We came on a Friday night and service was terrible.  Our server forgot to put in our order for sweet potato fries and we waited the whole meal for a beer to arrive.  No one really checked on us for at least 15 minutes and when they finally did we told them about our missing items, they looked at us like we were crazy...as if they couldn't have made a mistake like that.  It turns out that they were out of the kind of beer we ordered and no one bothered to tell us.  Then they asked us if we wanted the sweet potato fries to go...but who likes cold fries?  

When we left the manager was apologetic, but we were already frustrated at how we were treated. The only good thing about the meal was the fried chicken. I won't be back.
author: Nita K.

description:
We had reservations at 7pm and I had hell of a time finding parking.  I circled for 15 mins and finally got lucky but this was a Tuesday night!  The restaurant wouldn't seat us until our entire party arrived, meanwhile there was big handful of empty tables...weird.  Anyway, take this review for what it is but I'm not a super fan of Peruvian food.  There was 5 of us and good thing I had a pretty delicious lunch at 3pm (UMAMI burger!).  It's small plates here so we shared multiple dishes - 
Ceviche Trio - Nikkei, Mandarin, Limon - L was my fave but all just ok
Empanadas - Beef & Veggie - V was way better, actually quite delicious!
Paella - eh I'd pass
Lomo Saltado - us Chinese girls thought it was in between tomato beef and xo sauce.  Ha!  for real.  It was very tasty, especially the fries w/ sauce.  
Warm chocolate cake - adequate

I had the Pa Bravo Yo cocktail.  It was on the sour side, and I had a headache after...I wouldn't recommend this cocktail.  

Dinner was relatively inexpensive - $20/pp.  Service was slow and our waiter wasn't very swift.  Oh well.
author: Meredith K.

description:
i used postmates to deliver limon twice in two days. 

i think i have a problem.

i always get the same 5 items too:
quarter chicken with veggies/sweet potato fries
leche de tigre
truffle mac & cheese
chicharron de pollo
panna cotta

thank you, limon, thank you.
author: Trisha S.

description:
Oh it's a scene baby, and the dining room even features two upstairs perches to keep an eye on all the action. However the entrance was cramped and offered no place to wait as the bar was completely full. 

We had a reservation for 9:30, but the hostess said she couldn't seat us immediately because the extra member of our party hadn't arrived (we knew he was going to be quite late). 20 minutes later that didn't stop her from giving us a table once she actually had one. Being a bit late on a reservation is okay, just don't blame it on me.

The tartara de atun was okay, the tuna was soft and fresh though the aji amarillo vinaigrette was too light. I did enjoy the lomo saltado, delicious top sirloin mixed with onions and fried potatoes.

I'll give it another shot...
author: Jeremy S.

description:
I love Limon, both this location and the one on South Van Ness. It's our go-to for reasonably-priced, crowd-pleasing food for groups when we have people in town or we want to celebrate. Sangria is amazeballs. Lomo saltado is good, but I think the short ribs outshine it. Love love love the ceviche, both the classic and the ahi.

Enjoy!
author: Abby P.

description:
First experience with Peruvian food. Loved it and would definitely try it again. 

The place is small and we were kind of cramped up.  But the food more than made up for these shortcomings.
author: R N.

description: Loved the food and excellent Sangria. Wish I could have it a second time before I left SF. Will definitely return when in town.
author: Lina D.

description:
We went here to burn a groupon at brunch. We had a reservation but still had to wait 15 minutes (seemingly a common theme)! Great mango and strawberry lemonade, but downhill from there. The experience was... strange. We were excited about getting small plates and sharing, however, after leaving none stood out! The food was unremarkable. Cool sauces and things, but I felt like I never really knew what I was eating. 

Not worthy for brunch; too expensive and too long of a wait!
author: Halley B.

description:
$1,000 bill and a punishing experience. We set up a simple pre-fix menue for a family style gathering of 22 people. We arrive at 6:50 for a 7:00 reservation and half of us are at the bar blocking the flow of the restaurant and want to sit down. The incredibly unfriendly and hostile hostess advises us we could be seated after half the party had arrived. As people started to walk upstairs she followed them up and made them come back down stairs because we had a reservation for 22 and only 10 wer present - I got reprimanded for not being able to count. 

When the Manager - an irrational angry little man, came to adress the issue he advised that the entire group had to be present prior to being seated so that "the level of service would not suffer" - It was a family style  serve yourself event mind you. He then went on to say that because it was now 7:10 and we were missing two people from our party we would only have an hour to eat because he had another reservation scheduled. He said to us after making our reservation wait 20 minutes "let me ask you a question - "are you respecting my time if your whole party is not here on time" -  At this point we are at a loss. The food was ok - the management, hostess and seating policies are completely asinine, especially for the SF dynamic. A terrible place to host a group dinner.
author: Jesse L.

description: What a wonderful treat for my wife and I on a summer day in San Fran. Valencia is a fun street to hang out and Limon is the perfect spot to enjoy a delicious meal. My wife loves ceviche de pescado and she was delighted with the whole meal. We left entirely satisfied.
author: Tony L.

description: Came here this past Sunday to enjoy a meal to kick off the week..  EVERYTHING here was good, from their ceviche to their Lomo Saltado, and of course.. To their chicken! Everything was delicious! Make sure to make a reservation or expect a wait... I always hear that the van ness one is a little better but I can't imagine there to be THAT big of a difference.. Pretty noisy atmosphere but still a great spot for dates or to just share a meal with a friend
author: James H.

description: We recently has a very nice lunch at Limon.  We enjoyed a fish ceviche, a fried chicken dish (don't remember the name, but it was recommended by the staff), empanadas, and a tuna appetizer.  Everything was tasty, enjoyable, but I wish I could tell you more details about the items we ordered however nothing was that memorable.  The prices were reasonable, service was fine, and I have no complaints.  I may go back, but if I really have a Peruvian fetish I will go to La Mar, which I find to be exceptional on every visit.
author: Andy S.

description:
If dining at Limon is anything like a trip to Peru I need to plan a trip there and soon!

NICE SCENERY:  Limon's space has a nice loft-y feel, citrus colored walls and 2 dining areas (ground floor and upstairs).  We were there on the earlier side of the evening so we scored a spot on the balcony which I would recommend.  It gets you away from the craziness near the bar / front door, the noise from the first floor and gives you a nice view of all the action in the open kitchen.

WARM HOSPITALITY:  This is an understatement!  From the nice hostess who encouraged us to pick whatever table we wanted, to our skilled, friendly server, to the bussers who were constantly wiping down our table - everyone at Limon made us feel right at home.  When we left, about 4 of Limon's employees thanked us for stopping in. 

DELICIOUS FOOD:  The sangria was good but the food was even better!  We started off with the Ceviche de Pescado (halibut marinated in lime juice, with yam and Peruvian corn).  It was one of the best ceviches I've ever had and it was a good sized portion.

I ordered the Pargo Rojo which was beautifully and creatively presented.  It came on a square plate with greens in one corner, coconut rice in another, a wonderful chili curry sauce in another, and then the fried red snapper in the last one.  

My friend had the Pollo Latino (pan roasted chicken breast with mac & cheese, broccoli, and aji Amarillo jus) and liked it.

So the next time I want to take a mini trip to Peru, I'll come back here and hopefully this time I'll have room for dessert!
author: Amy C.

description: The food was good but the service was super shitty. They kept rushing us with our food, asking if we were done when we clearly weren't. Then they brought us the check and we asked for the dessert menu. The idiotic server had the nerve to tell us we couldn't get dessert because another group was waiting for a table. Iv waited for a table before and it sucks but the restaurant should manage expectations, not rush paying customers. Apparently there are other customers who experienced the same treatment. Someone from limon responded to those comments apologizing and saying she would pass on the comments to the staff. Either she didn't or they don't care.
author: Nisa Q.

description:
*The Experience*:
I came here for a friend's birthday and had dinner with 5 other people. The staff were polite and attentive, without being overly in your face. We were seated at one of their bigger tables and the ambiance was perfect for a birthday celebration or a nice dinner out.

*The Food*:
I'm a sucker for ceviche and Limon's ceviche was fine/decent and satisfied my ceviche-taste-buds. We ordered a whole mix of foods like beef, fish, chicken, and the truffle infused mac-n-cheese and all the food was ok. I can't really remember what we ate (except the mac-n-cheese and ceviche), so that shows what I thought about the food.

*Would I Eat Here Again?:
I would not mind coming back if and only if my friends had a hankering for Limon. There are other great places for ceviche and peruvian food like La Mar.
author: Patricia S.

description:
With its delectable cuisine, attentive service, and stylized decor, Limon definitely won't leave a sour taste in your mouth like this pun probably has.

Our meal started with the Ceviche Limon, a combination of shrimp, fish, and calamari so fresh you'd swear your waiter dumped it on the table with a fishing net. The citrusy tartness of the ceviche was mellowed nicely by the smooth and understated sweetness of some of the best sangria that I've ever tasted Seriously the stuff was so good, if the folks at Limon filled a bath tub with sangria, and said the only way I could enjoy it was drinking from a thimble, I'd still go to town. I highly suggest forgoing the glass and opting for the carafe, a perfect size for sharing with that special someone.

Next up we had the Quinotto de Vegetales, a delightful risotto style mixture of quinoa, carrots, zucchini, and mushroom. Quinoa may be a pseudo cereal, but the taste sure is real. Real good. The feast was rounded out by the Lomo Saltado, a tender and juicy wok-tossed sirloin that hit all the right notes.

What impressed me as much as the tasty food that evening, was the impeccable service. Seating was prompt, and super easy having booked through the Opentable link directly on the Yelp page. Water was always topped off, and place settings were changed at least twice during the meal. The staff was so on point it was almost creepy. There was an instance during the date when I walked 10 feet to the bar area to get a paper napkin, and by the time I had turned around and walked back to the table, my napkin had been refolded and placed on the table. I shudder to think what would have happened had I went to the bathroom, perhaps the waiter would have dipped it in bronze or used a loom to handspin a new napkin for me. 
    

Hits: Good food, good service, good atmosphere

Misses: no glaring offenses

Words of wisdom: Street parking can be a pain, but there's a parking garage about half a block away, just be sure to get back before they close (early-ish on a Sunday 11PM) otherwise the attendant will guilt trip you about not being able to go home to see his family, and then have your car towed.
author: Curtis C.

description:
Had fond memories of Limon previous to the renovation but hadn't been back since so I dropped by for lunch a few weeks back. The food was decent but service was a bit surly and the prices quite a bit higher than I recall. Lunch for two was over $40.  No alcohol.

The Chicharron and Lomito were tasty but the empanadas were only OK and the yuca fries were soggy. The server didn't refill our water until we asked and wasn't very friendly.

Perhaps it was just an off day but there are too many good restaurants in the City to give them another chance.
author: Charles M.

description:
A very, very good intro. to ceviche and Peruvian food in general. Very trendy, high-energy restaurant with a young scene in the heart of the action on Valencia Street.

Reservations are a must, you will not get a table without one!

Start out with the Ceviche Trio, which consists of:
-Ceviche Nikkei 
-Ceviche Leche de Tigre 
-Ceviche Mixto

These ceviches are each delicious and complement each other well. The Nikkei is spiciest and has a hint of wasabi, while the Leche de Tigre is rich and succulent.

Meat and veggie empanadas are crispy fried chunks of goodness, but they are very overpriced at $7 for just a single small piece.

By far the best entree was the Calamares Rellenos, with an unbeatable and unique sauce.

Service here was wonderful. One of our friends went up to the go to the bathroom and returned to find her napkin perfectly re-folded by her plate. Sangria was fantastic and worth trying - start with a pitcher and see where the night takes you!
author: David P.

description: Great food and great drinks here.  Also, as far as San Francisco goes it is good value in terms of what you get, like a whole chicken and sides.  Though it is popular and you'll need reservations on weekends, the place does not have that over the top trendy feel to it that you get with many other restaurants in the area.  In other words, they focus on serving good food rather than a lifestyle.
author: Scot M.

description:
Dammit. I went to the wrong Limon. Meant to check out the Rotisserie but instead came to this one. 

Everything was A-OK. Typical tapas place. The pescado was numero uno in our book, and the rest not that memorable. I love ceviche, and this one was alright, but I've had better. The chicarron pollo was fine, probably a bit too salty. I wouldn't recommend ordering the seafood tapa or the beef rib tapa. They weren't bad, don't get me wrong, but don't you want GOOD food that makes your tastebuds dance?
author: Ava C.

description:
This place is so good that I'm speechless.

Okay, I do have something to say.  I always have something to say.  Here goes.  For one thing, they have 6 different ceviches; all are amazing.  For first-timers, you can always get the Trio de Ceviches and try 3.  The dinner menu changes seasonally, so I can't recommend specific dishes, but they are all so good!  My most memorable dish was a pork chop that was so succulent that I could not stop licking my fingers afterward in order to take in last of the juices and flavor.  It was that good.  I totally don't care about acting neanderthal when it comes to juicy pork chops.
author: Ally W.

description:
A great experience.  We were lucky to come on a holiday w-end so we were able to get a reservation quickly.  The hostess along with the manager/owner that met us at the entrance were very friendly and we were seated within 5 minutes of arriving. 

We ordered the pork ribs, snapper, ceviche and a few other dishes.  FOr dessert we got the profiteroles and the choclate  cake. Evertything was delicious.

My only suggestion would be to increase the cerviche plate. It seemed frugal compared to others I've had. Also the choclate cake was fantastic, just wish it was bigger. I almost ordered another one.  My wife was glad I didn't.  Can't wait to go back
author: Mike T.

description: First time here and the food was great. We had empanadas, paella and chef special with sole fish. Service was excellent, staff was very attentive and friendly. The only reason Im giving them 4 stars is because not all the entrees came out at the same time. I will definetely go back again.
author: Mildred R.

description:
Our Thai Monkey a few blocks away had closed its doors so we had to find a place for a nutritious dinner. Despite a huge crowd Limon managed to accommodate us very fast. When the menu arrived both of us had mixed feelings: the appetizers (ceviches) looked appealing but for the main course we had to choose between chicken-chicken and chicken. Really? A little disappointing, they could have used a bit more variety to feed a hungry person.

The good: chicken was delicious! Ceviche was really good too, except I usually eat it with some chips or crackers (of which they never thought) and they charged us $3 for chips. Drinks were good too, my husband was still raving about the Sneaky Pisco several days later.

The bad: super loud, crowded, the waiters kept pushing my chair trying to get to the tables around us, pretty annoying. They brought us the order for a different table, but you can't tell the difference because it's all about CHICKEN. When the check arrived it was also for a different table.

Conclusion: good place if you are craving best chicken ever, don't mind waiting and loud noise level and pretty overpriced drinks and appetizers.
author: Scarlett H.

description: Limon has such delicious food! The chicken and meat is authentic and so so good! The waiter we had was very nice and the ambiance was great. It was poppin for a Saturday night. People were having a great time. It is a nice restaurant to meet friends for dinner and drinks!
author: Maxine S.

description: I and seven friends met at Limon and we had reservations and because two of our party were 10 minutes late, they gave away our table. We were placed next to the kitchen and next to the stairs and could not hear each other talk, it was so noisy. We had the rudest waiter we have ever had the displeasure of meeting and he gave us the wrong information on what the family style dinners were so we ended up ordering things on the menu that cost us double the price. We said something at the end of the meal and they said they were sorry and that was that. We did enjoy the chicken and yucca potatoes and various other items, yet it was not worth what we went through, never again.
author: Donna C.

description:
Went here on advice from fellow friend and yelper Nina. I have to say I was impressed.

I wasn't too hungry so I just grabbed a couple appetizers. Oh yeah, I had to get a mojito made special there.

First app was the red snapped ceviche. The portion size was a lot more than I expected and every bite held its own. The fish was very fresh and wasn't out done by the marinade. 

Next app was the fried chicken. I can't remember what the sauce on the side was but it had a slight ginger taste to it. The dish reminded me of jerk chicken but better than I've ever had.

Feeling good I sipped on a local beer, anchorstein. Doesn't dissapoint.

Thank you Nina for the recommendation. I will be back!
author: Derek J.

description: One of my favorites. Chicken and french fries are better than most North American restaurants. On the top of my list for visitors.
author: Phil H.

description: Yummy! Went here for my husbands birthday.. He got recommended it from a friend. We drove from sacramento but it was totally worth it. The staff was really helpful and the food was amazing. They are a pretty small restaurant but the plating looks 5 star. It makes you feel like your eating somewhere super expensive with out the price. We ordered the rotisserie chicken and the Ceviche they are a must try then they brought my husband out a lava cake for his birthday that was delicious. We had a great experience here al will definitely be back!
author: Kelly Q.

description: The food was ok but I liked the location by 3rd St better. The service was bad, the waiter takes forever to get our orders and didn't come around to our table to check how we were doing much, probably just once.  The one on 3rd St has way better service and food. More friendly and personal there although the neighborhood is a bit scary.
author: Alice D.

description:
Never heard about this place before until my friend took me there for dinner!
The place look super nice,very romantic! For drinks we ordered Sangria! It was very good with fresh fruits! I LOVE IT! 
My friends with who i was knew this place pretty good so i gave him opportunity to order the food! first we got Ceviche Lemon! i am not big fan of spicy food but this one was really good!  The next one was Churrasco a la Parrilla and of course more Sangria!
It was so good and i couldn't say no for desert! I ordered Bandido! OMG that was awesome!
I had wonderful time! I diffidently will be back there!
author: Ana R.

description: Everytime I eat here I leave happy.  Great chicken, awesome sides. good cocktails and a meal for two usually comes in under $40. Absolutely no complaints.
author: Chris S.

description: Food was delicious. Probably would have given a higher rating, but service was a little slower than expected and noise level in upper room of restaurant made dinner conversation impossible.
author: Andrea J.

description:
I'm torn. While I love the food here, the service is hit or miss. The first time I sat at the bar and our server was attentive and helpful. The second, the service was frankly sh*t. I asked the hostess for a table away from the door, because like most San Francisco evenings, it was cold and windy. Not only were we sat in the breezeway, but when patrons entered or exited and left the door wide open, the hostess would stare aimlessly at the ajar entryway. Close the f*cking door! It should be part of your job. The waitress was also slow as molasses even on a Tuesday night. 

That said, the pollo chicharron is fantastic and the quinotto is to die for. Just be sure to ask for a seat at the bar. 

**Oh, and I got an email from opentable that I was a no show for my reservation, even though I was quite punctual. Not sure who is to blame for that, but I would guess the dazed and confused hostess if I had to put $ on it.
author: Valerie N.

description:
I had what I would consider to be the best restaurant meal I've ever had.  No, seriously.  I mean, it did help that my boss let me use the company credit card to pay for it as thanks for a job well done.  So, yes, a free meal is usually a good meal.  But, the food was so tasty, every bite was so full of flavor, that I wish I could give Limon five more stars.

Not only did they serve up fantastic food, but they also provided stellar service.  A friend and I called to make a reservation on a busy Friday night, so they only had 10:30pm available, but we arrived early and had drinks at the bar and they seated us almost an hour earlier!  

The waitstaff was also very attentive, explaining the dishes in full detail in a good natured way.  When I ordered the red snapper I asked the waiter if I could have it without it being served in the fried fish carcass, as it's usually prepared, I told the waiter I was a newly converted vegetarian (technically now a pescatarian).  Our comedic waiter turned to me and said, "Don't worry.  They've had a good life."

And now that I've eaten at Limon, so have I.
author: Cassidy P.

description:
Coming in from Los Angeles, this was the first spot we were treated to. 4 stars on the ambiance. Very cool spot to hang  Service was not bad at all. Considering it was a full house, food did not take long, and we were given plenty of attention. 
While I'm not the biggest fan of Peruvian food, the lomo Satado was pretty good. 
Absolutely recommend this spot.
author: Eric O.

description:
As a boy, I hated sharing.  I was complicated, I had my plate and that's what I ate.  As a man, I'm simple...I sample.  A little bit of this, a little bit of that.

Tapas.....nothing new.  I was in a long term relationship with Cha Cha Cha's for years.  Some things never last.  How is it that I have never been to Limón? 

With no reservation on a Friday night, the wait was considerably short...20 minutes max?  The atmosphere is loud, as is so many popular places.  The staff was friendly enough and the moment we were seated, we were greeted by our server.  

---I love mac & cheese...let me reiterate that.  I love it.  Limon boasts the TRUFFLE MAC & CHEESE as a signature dish.  It was good, no it was great.  BUT, it was a bit too heavy on the truffle.  
---ANTICUCHOS DE RES: grilled beef hearts on a skewers.  I enjoyed this though it reminded me of a simple steak only kabob.  I don't know that I would recommend this hot dish.
---TARTARA DE TUNA: perfect.  Everything I love about tuna tar tar.  Served with a mild bbq (?) chip.  How can one not order tuna tar tar?
---CEVICHE MIXTO: I love ceviche.  This consisted of red snapper, calamari, and tiger shrimp.  Order a side of the papas fritas to go with it.  I love trying different types of ceviche and while I enjoyed it, I don't know that I would recommend it.
---ENSALADA MIXTA: a good beet salad.  It was the perfect dish to throw in the mix.
---CARNE EMPANADA:- Let me say I love this dish.  Steak stuffed in a cross between Pupusa and Phyllo. Remarkable!

The waiter was a bit too busy as it was difficult to get refills but a great dinner for three with a $75 bill?  WHOA
author: Kris O.

description: Came here for dinner a few days ago with a group of girlfriends..I can honestly say this place is pretty awesome. We had made 6:30 reservations but due to lack of timing we showed up around 7 and immediately where seated on the second level. The server was polite and on point with drink and menu suggestions. I had the Lomito Saltado, which was so delicious, until I got to the end where all was left was french fires and the sauce. It tasted a bit salty at that point, but really didn't phase me, obviously since I did eat the majority off my plate. I paired my meal with a Pisco Sour drink, very tasty and refreshing! I also ordered the Veggie Empanadas and I was NOT disappointed. The dough was so flakey and hot, not to mention the yellow sauce that came with, YUM. We definitely enjoyed our meal and will return for dinner again!!
author: Margarita R.

description:
Nice place. Food was good, dessert was good, sangria was good.

Got the Ceviche, empanadas, and fried chicken small plates. The chicken was my favorite part of the meal, but it was all good.

I think the sangria had a lot of citrus peel/pith in it; other sangrias I've had that have had fruit in it were better because I like eating the wine-soaked fruit.
author: Jeremiah L.

description:
I came here a few years ago, and had such a great experience that I was ecstatic to see a Groupon offered for this place.  I was going to go again regardless, but the Groupon was just icing on the cake.   I sweet-talked some friends into coming with me to make a brunch out of it, and frankly, I'm embarrassed that I raved about it so much.  There goes my food cred! 

Why was it so bad?  Oh let me count the ways:

1.  The service was terrible.  They didn't honour reservations and the wait with reservations was close to an hour.  The attitude for the delay was something along the lines of "This is what it is.  Deal with it."
2.  The entire time there was this massive lineup, you could see the top floor of the restaurant open and unused.
3.  Once we did sit down no one came to our table for a good 10 mins.
4.  When we tried to order, a request for a substitution was shot down so fast my friend sat there speechless for a few moments before she found a voice to say she was still going to order the same dish
5.  When we asked for sauce on the side, we were charged extra (but not told upfront)
6. Our order took forever to come... meanwhile we enviously eyed people who came in after us order, receive, and eat their dishes
7. When the order actually came I did a double-take.  The Chicharron dish portion was so small it only filled 1/4 of the plate.  To add insult to the injury, they put this tiny portion on the top right quadrant of the plate, leaving the rest of the stark white plate...empty.  This is a meal, not an art piece.  Couldn't you stick a few pieces of lettuce on the plate to make it look like you're getting more? Or at least try to trick us with a smaller plate?
8. When we asked to see the bill before paying by credit card (we already had our credit cards out because we just wanted to leave at that point), the waiter just dropped the order receipt on our table and left
 (not the actual bill)

I almost wished I wasn't using a Groupon so I could in good conscience tip poorly, but then the logical part of my angry mind would have screamed bloody murder on the bloody ripoff this place would have been at full price.

What happened to you Limon?

To drown our sorrows we ended up driving 1/2 way across the city to get cupcakes from Kingdom Cake to forget about this food experience.  On that note, the cupcakes were pretty good!
author: Pokin Y.

description:
Promptly greeted at the door.. Sat fast!  Food was great, (what we expected).  We where looking for the WOW factor and it never came.. (that's why the four stars and not five).... I mean everything was very nice, NO WOW! 

I would recommend more attentive staff when it's time to pick ip plate, do so promptly.  Our server was very nice, but I never learned his name... Also when he was asked from other table to make a recommendation, he did what an average server would do and ask what they felt like (fish, steak or chicken) the ladies replied by saying "we are glad we are not vegetarian".  This was my second time and it was all good, just no wow factor.. Google it!
author: Alvaro M.

description: Consistently tasty food. I'd come back more often if the service was a bit better and it wasn't so damn loud. Love the ceviche and mac n cheese.
author: Alyssa F.

description:
Definitely a winner and a great deal in my book.

The party: 4 girls just starting the evening
The situation: Showed up at ~9:30pm with no reservations
The scene: A packed house, few open seats at the bar which were perfect for the 10-15min wait for our table.

We started with drinks at the bar: Caiphirina, Pineapple Martini, Pink Lemon Drop, Mango Lemonade - all tasty.

Eventually seated at a table right next to the kitchen, but were then offered a table/booth by the wall. Props for offering a much better seat away from the hustle and bustle of kitchen and staff.

Server was Armando who was very helpful with recommendations on dishes and order of receiving them. Props for the recs and remembering all of our names, despite the hesitation on mine.

We ordered (in order)(we split all of these dishes 4 ways):
Ceviche Mixto: Good seafood, very tangy lime marinade. Choclo is interesting. Chilled yam slice is a nice flavor contrast.
Veggie Empanadas: Possibly the best empanadas I've had.
Chicharron de Pollo: Crispy, heavily seasoned, but not in a "so-salty-it-burns-your-tongue" way
Quinotto de Vegetales: Skeptical at description, pleasantly surprised at the flavor, texture and presentation. Very risotto-like.
Churrasco a la Parilla: Ordered medium rare. Tender and well seasoned. Red wine demi glaze was a bit salty but still good. Vegetables were vegetables...nothing amazing, but good anyway.
Panna Cotta de Mango: A light, refreshing finish to the evening.

We each paid about $28 + tip for food and drink. For all that we had and the ability to try so many things I think this was a fantastic deal and I will definitely return.
author: Amy S.

description:
My first time coming here was yummy....

My second time coming here was out of this world!!!! foodgasm! 

If you have always been curious on what peruvian food is, please try limon. I am still not quite sure if this is authentic, but who the f cares. It was damn good!!!

- ceviche - red snapper and shrimp.. yes please!!!!!! spicy, sweet, light on acidity, and it melts in your mouth

- mussels in that smoky sauce!!!! roar! extra mussels and maybe some shrimp :)

- mac and cheese with the addition of the mussels I had ordered earlier!!!... molte bene!

- fries.. because mama loves fries! plain, because I am over truffle oil

- freaking chicken............. my mouth is watering thinking of this chicken! soooooooooooooo good!!!! 

last but not least

- their paella type dish.... roar! I love spanish rice, and I love saucy rice! it reminds me of chinese congee, but with flare!! :) not too el dente, and not too mushy, but perfect......

CAN YOU TELL I LOVE THIS PLACE?   

also, the bartender is super sweet, and knows his stuff!!! loves it!!! :) get him to mix you one of his special cocktails :) you will not be displeased
author: Nina M.

description:
Truffled mac & cheese.  
Ceviche.   
Sangria in pitchers.  
Oh god, truffled mac & cheese!

What's not to love?  Oh right.  At busy times it's like dining inside a jet engine.  Not that you'd get in at busy times anyway.  

No matter.  Make a reservation (they even take them for parties of two) and make it late, after that table of ten coworkers buzzed off happy hour and abusing the company card has cleared out.
author: Dana S.

description:
Descent food - not a lot of non-meat/seafood options.  The veggie people made the most of it - but it would have been nice to have a few more options.  

For apps we had a ceviche trio, we selected 3 diff ceviches, we got: Limon (signature octopus dish), Nikkei (tuna), and Pescado y Camaran (snapper and shrimp) - my fav was tuna.  The octopus mixture was a bit too tangy for my taste.  The snapper and shrimp frankly was not too memorable - but I am not a big fan of cold shrimp.  

We ordered the arroz con mariscos - the Peruvian paella - which unfortunately never came - thankfully because we had ordered way too much food.  I would have liked to try this because saw a few adjacent tables order it and looked very good.  

What we did get includes: 
Lomo Saltado - the Peruvian style rice and sirloin strips - I did not eat it (dont eat beef) but those that did enjoyed it with one caveat its very salty - but apparently thats supposed to be that way.  The garnish and presentation was pretty good.  

Trigo & Veg con Pesto - this was the big hit on the table with everyone.  It was tasty, different and very refreshing tasting. Highly recommend it.  The veggie empanadas were ok not quite anything to write home about though.  Taratar de Tuna - was also a big hit - very refreshing, lemony but I enjoyed it.  We also ordered the sweet potato fries and mac-n-cheese - both were just ok, nothing to write home about.  The sweet potato fries - are made as huge wedges - and just did not cook all the way through (as a result of the size) while the mac-n-cheese was better, they use white cheese and truffle oil - it was definitely worth trying and different way of preparation for mac & cheese.  

For post-dinner sweets - we had choc bandido and profiteroles - both were awesome.  The choc bandido is just unbelievable and definitely worth the extra 20minutes (ok, probably extra 30mins) on the treadmill!  Its served warm choc cake with dulce de luche (caramel) and it is really really good.  I would order 1 less entree and wait to order this dessert.  The profiteroles - were ok - I am not a big fan plus frankly the choc cake overtook the attention.  

Overall the place is loud, very difficult to hear and talk - if you go with a large group and are trying to get substantive conversations (be aware).  It was loud enough that the server didnt hear a couple of items that we ordered.  I would go back again - but not first on my list.
author: Bhavin M.

description:
Wow. My boyfriend and I came here the other week and it was incredible. The service was warm, welcoming, and very attentive without seeming like they want to rush you out the door. 

I've never experienced Peruvian food or traditional Peruvian cocktails but wow, those Peruvians must know their way around the kitchen. The cocktails are delicious, and clearly made with love. My favorite is the one that features Pisco and Green Chartreuse (can't find the name on any of these online menus). 

We got the seafood ceviche- amazing. It came with a shot glass full of some sort of Peruvian concoction. We both took a small sip to sample it before pouring it all over the dish- yum. That was probably my favorite dish, as I am a huge seafood lover. The concoction definitely added a slightly spicy and acidic bite that completed the dish.  We also got the Costillas Nikkei (St. Louis pork ribs)-- which were incredibly tender and flavorful. 

We also got the signature chicken, which was the biggest disappointment of the meal- maybe about 3/3.5 star dish. I think that their mistake is making it their "signature dish"--- it raises expectations and sets you up for disappointment. I think that if it weren't advertised as the signature dish, it would probably fare better in these reviews. Even so, I can't take away a star. Everything else was just too stellar. I would definitely recommend Limon for a date night.
author: Alisa B.

description: We loved this place!!! Beautiful space, friendly service, great food. Make sure to try their Cervice.The trio of dipping sauce is just stunning with Yucca fries. We had a great time there. Recommend make a reservation....
author: Patricia L.

description:
They re-opened Limon a couple of months ago but haven't had the chance to return til now. It's got a lot more room to sit than before, and looks a bit more modern than the last time I dined here years ago.

I think I'd like to go back just to try more of their drinks. I had their Strawberry Sour which was so great that I didn't realize how potent it was.

Nice portions for their large plates- their Churrasco a la Parilla is big enough for two to share if you order a pair of small apps. Ribeye steak, nice and juicy. Seasoned right to taste. Same could be said about the lomo saltado. Beef was cooked almost similar to the steak so it was also a win. We also had the red snapper ceviche, generous in portion, with a light taste of garlic and vinegar in its sauce. Beef empanadas were pretty small. Suggest they increase the portion to four if they're that tiny.

The service was ok. It wasn't even really that busy and we had to ask someone that wasn't our original waiter for a dessert menu. He seemed annoyed when I asked too. 

All in all, good food and drinks, better service would have upped it to a four.
author: Geralyn Y.

description:
My unwavering love for Costco's $6 rotisserie chicken may just have seen its end at the hands of Limon Rotisserie's pollo a la brasa. This place is so great! I have not anything here that wasn't good.

Great great things:
- Pollo a la brasa: I love that there are options for this. You can get a quarter, half, or a whole chicken, which makes it the perfect dish for either yourself or for sharing purposes. It is tender m juicy, and so flavorful! I do wish that the number of sides went up when you got a bigger order of chicken, but that's a minor detail.
- Yuca fries: Thick, fried, starchy goodness. The three dipping sauces that come with the chicken are perfect to add flavor to the fries.
- Ceviche mixta: This is so visually appealing, it's almost sad to eat until you realize that you're in for a symphony of flavors the minute you take a bite. It's unlike any fishy ceviche I've had before; acidic, fresh and so delicious. I absolutely love the corn kennel and the sweet potato pieces.
- Seco de costillas: The braised shortribs; the sauce on this is amazing. The portion is a bit small, so it really is a "small plate." Still, excellent flavors!

Most plates cost between $10-15 (except the larger portions of chicken), so it's totally reasonable for the quality of food you're getting. Both of the locations offer excellent service, but the Valencia location has a more open space (with better lighting). Both places get noisy, but it's definitely a fun environment for friends and groups.
author: Shira C.

description:
One star based on their horrible service. We made a reservation for 1pm. When we got there we were told it would be a 45 min wait.  Wait - isn't that what reservations are suppose to avoid?  "Well actually," according to the unpleasant waitress, "  EVERYONE has a reservation."

I don't know that the fuss is about the food but suffice it to say we didn't stick around to find out.

To the owner the Limon, if you are reading this, please fix your customer service, it is hurting your Yelp rating.
author: Alvin L.

description:
Saturday, 1pm

The four of us arrive to a bustling restaurant with a few parties waiting outside.

"Hi, we have a reservation for 4 for Scott."
"OK, it will be about a 45 minute wait."
"Sorry, we had reservations though?"
