"Yeah, so does everyone else who's waiting."

At this point, we walked out wondering what universe we were in where a reservation counted for nothing.  I can understand "oh about 15 minutes, we're prepping your table" or "we're just a few minutes behind" but 45 minutes?  C'mon guys.  What made it worse was the server's "so what?" attitude.  At a least a "sorry" or "man, we're just really busy!" but there was no emotional response whatsoever.  It was almost the opposite, like "f-off, who cares?"  We went across the street to Urbun Burger where the woman behind the counter was all smiles, we got our food quickly and were stuffed, long before the 45 minute wait we would have endured at Limon.

Sunday, 11:30am

This was a much different scene.  For "brunch", Limon was empty.  There were only 2 other parties, one of whom was finishing up.  There was a hostess and 4 servers, which means for a good portion of our stay, there was a 1:1 server:table ratio.

We were seated immediately, and it took 15 minutes before we were were acknowledged.  Remember, at this point there are more servers than patrons.  What.  The.  What?  Finally we were acknowledged and we ordered everything in at once.

P.s. This was the last time we saw our waiter.  Honest to God.  Not even there for the bill.  Probably for the best, because the tip was 10% and that was only because we used the Groupon.  If we didn't it would have been almost nothing.

We ordered a couple of appetizers (Limon Ceviche and Oyster Shooters) along with two drinks (Incan Bloody Mary, Strawberry Mojito).  This was the best part of our meal.  The ceviche was good (if not slightly on the small side) and the oyster shooters were very good.  The bloody mary was spicy as hell, which is also fine.  Unfortunately, this was probably the worst mojito I've ever been served.  First, the only thing "strawberry" about it was the color.  Second, the club soda was completely flat.  Third, there was way too much rum.  Guys, it's 11:30 in the morning.  I'd like to be able to walk out of here and not take a taxi home.  Holy crap.  I mean I'm not 19 anymore - I actually want my drink to taste good :) Fourth, there was barely any mint or sweetness too it.  It was like drinking a glass of rum with crushed mint.  Yuck.

Next was "The Long Wait".  We waited 1h 15m from the time we arrived at Limon for our mains to appear.  That means we waited about 1 hour from the time we ordered.

What's worse was that we saw 3 Lomo Saltados go to 2 other tables that sat down long after we ordered.  I'm pretty sure the person delivering the food (not our waiter) messed up, because after we asked where are food was, the server went over to the waiter who looked confused, walked around looking at nearby tables then back to the kitchen.  Our food came out 5 minutes later.

The mains aren't even worth writing about.  The Lomo was good, meat cooked perfectly although they charged us for a teeny tiny cup of chimmichurri(sp?) on the side.  Chicken was dry and a woefully small portion (NOTE: this is not the same chicken as the bistro, which is excellent), as well as my wife's seafood soup.

There is no way on Earth we're going back here, and neither should any of you.

You spent $20 for that Groupon.  You have to spend at least that much to eat at Limon.

My advice?  Sell your Groupon or throw it in the trash and go to the bistro.
author: Rob S.

description: Really good food and great place for night life to mingle with others. I've always been to the other locations but this location I like better. The food is really good and I never had the shank but I must say it was delicious. The sangria at this location is way better I think I downed 4 glasses of sangria which is rare but it was that good. I will be back again with more people!
author: Sara A.

description:
Really great staff, but it's definitely not a place for a vegetarian unless you are content eating a very carb-heavy meal. 

Based on some previous reviews, I learned that they sometimes run out of food. Before we went, I called to make sure there were plenty of vegetarian options available and was made to feel very silly by the person I spoke to for even suggesting that they would not have enough food. Fast forward an hour: they had run out of everything but a handful of ceviches, chicken, empanadas, mac & cheese and fries.

What I ate, tasty as it was, was not what I had wanted. It's really confusing to me how a restaurant can routinely run out of food.
author: sar h.

description:
Been to Limon for dinner twice now.  The ambiance is great, but both times, I have found the food to be underwhelming, especially given the price.  

Last time I went, I had the fried snapper.  The presentation was impressive (though I could have done quite well without seeing my fish's teeth still in its mouth), but the flavor was lacking.  My friend agreed.  Actually, this is the only time I've dined with him in our almost 5 years of friendship that he hasn't picked his plate clean.  That's saying something...

The sweet potato fries are ok, also.  They really need to serve better dipping sauces with them.  Where is the garlic aioli that these bad boys were made for??

The waiter was also incredibly inattentive.  I think he came to our table a total of 2 times during our meal.

I think this will probably be my last time having dinner at Limon.  I think for the price, you are MUCH better off going to the rotisserie, surly service and all (see past review).  The rotisserie has better menu offerings... I have NO idea why the restaurant doesn't serve the delicious chicken that Limon is known for!
author: Julie S.

description:
I bought a Groupon for Limon. So I made made reservations here on a Sunday. Service was attentive but not smothering. 

My husband and I will go back for the truffle mac and cheese (this dish was absolutely AMAZING!)  and the limon ceviche. But will pass on the Lomito Saltado (the rice that came with is was hard and under cooked. and the dish itself was a bit salty.)  

All in all, a good meal for a good price!
author: J V.

description: Came here and was hoping for more - HUGE fan of Peruvian style and LOVE Passion - there was an uptick in the city for a few years seeing the rise of the wonderful ceviches!!  When applied in right proportions, the citrus and seafood combo is literally mouth watering!!  Add to that some other S American flavors centered around the main attraction of Ceviche coupled with rotisserie style meats or fantastic cuts of beef, and you can really have wonderful meals.  With all that said, Limon is just ok - I recall it being above average when it opened, however, this time around it fell a bit flat - ceviches didn't pop, main entrees were a bit lack luster and overall just didn't stand up to Passion.  Would have liked to see more vibrant flavors (chefs - cardinal sin is to NOT flavor food!!!!).  Still not bad, just not great.
author: Richard D.

description:
I had heard great things about Limon so I thought it would be a great place to take my cousin Griselda D. for her birthday. We have a decade-long ritual of treating each other to lunch/dinner at a new place each year. So I looked into Limon, and found out they were starting a brand new happy hour beginning Monday, August 30, which coincidentally was the day I was taking her to dinner...It was a sign! We are both happy hour junkies, so we were excited to be among the first to try their happy hour. We also dined from their dinner menu.

- Ceviche Nikkei de Atun ($12): One of my favorites because it's like a cross between carpaccio and tuna sashimi. It's actually ahi tuna, but it's prepared like carpaccio. It's served with thinly sliced green onions on top, and a small side of garbanzo beans and sweet potato wedge. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chWLsfWUJ5k8-73t9FOM9A?select=bGTZGvC3msSXAJwFACz8UQ)
- Calamares/calamari ($6, happy hour): Compared to other dishes, this one was generously portioned. Calamari was cooked perfctly and the outside was crisp and warm. Loved the sauce. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chWLsfWUJ5k8-73t9FOM9A?select=2sRtBMF2em5iYKc-okWFow)
- Ensalada Verde/Green Salad ($8):  I was a bit disappointed with the small portion. It was basically just greens with cucumber and red onion. Nothing to rave about. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chWLsfWUJ5k8-73t9FOM9A?select=xo4c1h12MKyIAdCCyxd0NQ)
- Perihuela ($10) - very similar to cioppino, which I love! This dish consisted of a large crab leg, scallops and prawns, served in a cioppino broth. I only wish the portion were larger, but every bite was delectably delicious and flavorful. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chWLsfWUJ5k8-73t9FOM9A?select=DxW1IKV4II6qJgEuePxcMg)
- Cream puffs ($7.50): Comes with four golf ball-sized cream puffs sprinkled with confectioner's sugar. The cream in the middle was fluffy and had the perfect amount of sweetness. I would definitely get this again. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chWLsfWUJ5k8-73t9FOM9A?select=ik-MQY7boJZ2WbmHxrnH1g)
- Chocolate brownie w/ strawberries: Was served warm with a strawberry compote and whipped cream. The chocolate was really rich and sweet - I am not a huge chocolate lover so it wasn't my personal favorite. But if you love chocolate, you'll become a fan. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chWLsfWUJ5k8-73t9FOM9A?select=2zKwd4uqWwIg2bq8ZoDjYg)
- Mojito ($5, happy hour) - strong and crisp. Perfect! (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chWLsfWUJ5k8-73t9FOM9A?select=FHze1DbNsc25VpXxavCJ3w)
- Sangria ($3, happy hour) - deep and red, served with diced fruit. At $3 a pop during happy hour, I could drink these all night.

Additional things to note:
- Happy hour: Monday - Thursday from 4-6pm. $3 sangrias and beers, $5 house cocktails, and a variety of appetizers ranging from $1 oysters to $6 calamari. See their happy hour menu here: (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chWLsfWUJ5k8-73t9FOM9A?select=q2414VU0yWIIfqZVGdw4vg)
- The menu: The menu that Limon posts on ther website is not the same one we saw when we went to dinner. here is a picture of their menu: (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chWLsfWUJ5k8-73t9FOM9A?select=oHJtS7XHOby3YaJVQq4LGg)
- Service: Extremely attentive. Our server was easily able to answer all our questions about the menu. He "hovered" a bit too much, but I think he was just trying to make sure my cuz and I were happy. 

Bottom line: Limon serves gourmet Peruvian fare with a modern twist in an elegant, colorful ambiance. And their new happy hour makes them even more irresistible.
author: Mariela D.

description:
I recently revisited Limon after having moved from San Francisco two months ago.  The last time I went to Limon was probably about 3-4 months ago.  2010 was a year of Limon, though.  I went there a lot with my ex and we had many a fabulous meal there.  However, we went back this time during my trip and we were really startled by how different it was.  It seems like the quality of the food has gone downhill. 

Firstly, the ceviche.  I loved the ceviche here.  I loved it better than the ceviche at La Mar, and at Fresca.  I used to drink the citrousy juice it came in.  And those gigantic corn cornels?  Yum.  Well this time it was different.  Firstly, the dish (ceviche limon specifically) was bigger with way more fish than shell fish (hmmm).  But then I tasted it...they had put what tasted like a cheap powered spice on it that just tasted terrible and which burnt my mouth so much I had to request milk.  I told my friend to eat the rest of the meal, since I could not finish it.  He asked the bartender about the change since he was also startled by the difference.  The bartender made seem like it was good that they had added more fish, they had 'increased the portions', but my friend could tell that the bartender also was enthused about the change. 

The other dishes we had that night, the spare ribs and the octopus were pretty boring.  The octopus, something I always like to order at Limon, was a little more interesting.  It came over what seemed like mashed potatoes and you could eat it in one full bite.  It was good, but nothing to write home about. 

As usual, the wine was very good.  They have some very juicy blackberry full bodied wines here that I really like. I'd still get a drink here, and I will pray that they put the ceviche back together again.
author: Alexandra M.

description:
Major yum.

Went here for dinner as a last minute change of plans since I failed to make reservations at my first choice restaurant, but all ended well.

The prices aren't too bad, but everything does kinda add up and at the end my boyfriend and I were kinda surprised. That said, the food was TASTY!!! We ordered the Ceviche Mandarin and the paelle and some glasses of wine :D

The ceviche was probably the star of the dinner, though the sauce on the paelle was delicious....the seafood on both plates was cooked wonderfully and tasted fresh and amazing. If you go to Limon I highly suggest the Ceviche Mandarin. Those two dished combined with two glasses of wine each was enough to fill us, but it's easy to rack up the monies when it comes to these "small-plate"/"large plate" restaurants. 

For someone like myself who either makes dinner every night or eats out at more casual places, this was a nice change of scenery. I would definitely come back and try the other ceviches.

**fun tidbit: there's a price descrapency for the 10 yr and 20 yr old Brawny wines. My boyfriend got the 20 yr old Brawny for a couple bucks off 'cause the menu lists a different price :D
author: Amanda C.

description: Everything was delicious, service was  amazing- attentive and efficient (they brought out our ceviche almost immediately)
author: Kim H.

description:
This would be more like 3.5 stars but I gave it 4 stars anyway because the food is really, very delicious. 

I came here for a friend's birthday last night and it was crowded before 6 p.m.  The upstairs seating area for our large party had nice decor and mood lighting.  The open kitchen is right below us and our party keeps getting the wafts of delicious smell.  Good and bad since we kept ordering more and more .. 

This is probably hearsay but the birthday girl had the most difficult time getting reservations and getting seated here when she arrived.  Reservations for our party was at 5:30 p.m. because there wasn't any other available times for big parties.  We had the entire upstairs seating area for almost an hour to ourselves!  The birthday girl also said that when she arrived, the hostess tried to make her get prix fix for every single person in the party even though that was not the arrangement they have made.  My friend finally got her way but it just did not start off her birthday evening well and that's seriously not what a restaurant should be doing anyway!

The servers were attentive and accommodating.  However, the first small hot plate I got was not what I ordered.  And, the server wanted to argue with me!  He said that when I ordered, I pointed at the wrong dish on the menu.  Regardless of what happened, shouldn't the server have followed up with the dish I actually wanted?  I would have gladly paid for both dishes because they were both delicious!  The server's attitude was a little poor .. 

The place got its stars because of its incredible food!  I got the Seco de Costillas (boneless short ribs) and the Quinotto de Vegetales (risotto) and both were fabulous!  I think our table got 5 or 6 orders of the short ribs because they were insanely well seasoned and the meat was just falling apart on its own.  The risotto was the error dish but I didn't mind at all.  It was very creamy couscous-like dish with vegetables chopped and mixed in it.  My only complaint is that its portion is too freaking tiny ... I had three bites and painfully shared the fourth. 

Our table also got the following, all of which I would recommend:
- Arroz con Mariscos (paella) - just a little greasy for me
- Lomito Saltado (sirloin strips) - but I prefer the short ribs
- Pescado Limon - MUST GET THIS

I would definitely return to try other dishes but definitely with only one or two other friends and a super well-communicated reservation.
author: Kimberly C.

description:
I had a casual dinner out with two of my friends, we all really enjoyed our dinner. Service was excellent, and the overall ambience was really nice. Not too loud, so you could have a conversation. 

The food was really delicious, we especially love the beet salad. We all ordered steak as a main course - mine was a little tough, but overall the flavors were really good. 

Definitely would recommend this place.
author: Gina C.

description: I loved Limon. I hear they just had a little bit of a face lift, and it looks awesome! I came here with a party of 8 girls for a birthday party, and they were very accomodating! I know a big group of girls with a lot to say, and in need of a lot of drinks can be a bit to handle, but from when we walked throught the door to when we paid the check, the hostess and all of the servers were very nice and communicative! Now on to the food. AMAZING! we ordered a ton of small plates and shared. I reccommend doing the same! They stand out dishes were the yucca fries, the truffle mac n cheese, and the ceviche!! Dont forget the famous sangria either. All in all the experience we had was one of the best Ive had in the city, Ill def. be back!
author: Nicole M.

description:
Nothing makes me miss my old Sunday day-off schedule more than Limon. Not those days of lazily lounging around the house. Not those quiet weekend drives on California backroads. Not those impulsively self- indulgent trips to the suit store for new pachucos and pinstripes. Not even those Sundays getting together for a random afternoon game of croquet with friends.

No, what I miss about Sundays is Limon.

My weekly lunching routine consisted of getting together with a beautiful blonde, sitting at the Limon bar, ordering a bottle of champagne from bartender Tony, and eating the most wonderful selections of ceviches. It was truly heavenly.

If you look at the photos of this place here on Yelp you'll see a photo from one of these blissful weekend lunches. And perhaps it will inspire you to do the same. Or at least go in and try a selection of this place's delightful food.

(sigh) oh how I miss my ceviche and champagne Sunday afternoon
lunches...
author: James S.

description: My brother and his fellow soldiers came to visit me in SF for a Giants game before his deployment and took them here!  One of their wives is Peruvian and she approved :-) On top of the amazing food, service and company, we saw Pablo Sandoval...twice in the same night!  Couldn't have imagined a better dinner all around!  One of my SF faves!!!  BEST CEVICHE!
author: Alex T.

description:
This place is outstanding. The ceviche is amazing. The hanger steak is perfect. Great setting. Great service. 

Warning: the acoustics are lively in here. Pick your table if you can. The seating upstairs is a little quieter.
author: David H.

description:
As a new resident of mission, I was excited to see the groupon offer for Limon. My husband and I had a pleasant experience at their Rotisserie and was looking forward to trying out the valencia location. On Sun of the labor day long weekend, we walked in to Limon on time for our reservation and was seated promptedly.  However, after that it all went downhill.  First, it took 15mins before our server stopped by to acknowledge us.  Few other waiters walked by in the meantime but nobody seems to want to make eye contact with us. It was strange because the restaurant was half empty.

The service continuds to be disappointing. Our food ended up taking an hour before hitting the table. What's worst was the guy who sat next table to me (which was empty when we arrived) had already started eating the same dish my friend and I ordered while our waiter was no where to be found.  We had to flag down other servers to check on our food.  It was a very frustrating.  Although our food was served  not long after we made a compliant, there was no explanation and no action taken to remedy the situation.

My husband ordered Chicharron de Pollo for $9.  The potion was clearly an appetizer size yet our waiter never bother to tell us at the time of order.  My Lomo Saltado con huevo was not bad but I guess after an hour and a half wait at a restaurant, anything eatible will suffice.  

Anyway, our waiter never came back to our desk so we had to flag down another wait staff to get our bill and check out.  If we did not use groupon, I will put down a negative amount for the tips box.  

I am not sure if the service "downgrade" was an side effect of their recent Groupon promotion.  But if the intent was to attract traffic to the restaurant in hope to lead to repeat purchase, Limon has failed miserably.   My 2nd groupon is going to the toilet.
author: Katy Y.

description:
This place is definitely just average.

Don't be fooled! I went here with a large group from work and the waiter downstairs said clearly "we have a large bar and can make any drink you want." I asked for a calamansi and he responded that they couldn't make the drink...what??

The food here is just average too. The ceviches are great, and so are the empanadas, but entree wise if you aren't getting their delicious roasted chicken, prepare to be dissapointed! I got the chicken chicarones and it was the most disgusting, dry piece of meat I've ever eaten. It took maybe fifty chews per piece to get it down...

The roasted chicken however, is the bomb here! The skin is well seasoned, and the chicken moist. But, it takes a while so order it early as you just sit down!
author: David H.

description:
I really liked this place. Nice ambiance, friendly service, yummy food.

My friend and I shared a carafe of red sangria, and a few small plates - ensalada rusa, chicharron de pollo, carne empanadas, and lomito saltado.  I must say I enjoyed them all, although empanadas were my favorite.  Perfect late night meal, not too heavy, as the portions are small (well, everything pretty much is fried, so not too heavy will depend on your definition).  My friend did mention that he would have liked a bit more green and healthy stuff to choose from, but to each their own.  I have no such complaints.

Our server was really friendly and she checked on us several times.  The only thing that slightly ruined the experience was that we had to wait until after all of our food was out to get the sangria.  Our server forgot about it.  She actually checked on us once without noticing that it was not yet at the table, but I just thought that it may be taking some time as the bartender is busy.  Then she checked on us again a few minutes after all the food has arrived, but still didn't say anything about the drinks.  After that point, I baciscally said "looky here, where my alcohol at!??!? (well, not quite in those words), she looked perplexed, then said, oh yes, you still don't have it, I am so sorry about it, then went to the bar and promptly brought it back to the table and apologized again.  No big deal, I am cool with an apology as things do happen to the best of us.  

Overall, will definitely be back again and am looking forward to try the Rotisserie location.
author: Marina S.

description:
I have been here 3 different occasions and must admit they are very consistent with the quality of food. 
5 stars 
Their signature chicken-this was grilled to perfection EVERY time
truffle mac & chez-yummy
tartara de tuna-Peruvian fusion?

2 stars
lomito saltado-this dish lacked flavor and the meat was very dry
chicharron de pollo-who invented this? I'm trying to be nice but it was horrible
empanada-blah, could've done without

sweet potato fries & rice were good side dishes. Yes, restaurants can mess this up too but Limon didn't
author: May G.

description:
If you're not lucky enough to have a native Peruvian in your life who will cook you up a mean Lomo Saltado at home, go to Limon. But do yourself a favor and skip dessert. Instead, order extra Sangria.

UPDATE 06 April 06:
Returned to Limon today for lunch. We shared the Chicharron de Pollo (Marinated chicken pieces fried then served with salsa criolla and lemon vinaigrette) to start and it was fantastic! I couldn't resist ordering the Lomo Saltado (Traditional Peruvian dish of top sirloin slices sauted with onions, tomatoes and fries, served with rice) which was, as always, wonderful. Service was also excellent. As much as I enjoy this space at night, I think I like it even more in the day!
author: Miriam W.

description:
Fantastic restaurant! It has a contemporary but elegant ambiance, we've eaten here twice, and were quite satisfied both times. The service is great, and the place is always packed. Great place to bring a date, but i recommend reservations as there can be a wait. Parking is hard to find, as always in the mission district.

We came here w/ another couple and started off w/ some tapas for appetizers, along w/ a pitcher of their red sangria. (They had delicious white pear sangria, but unfortunately they don't serve that anymore). We had the cerviche limon, the crispy calamari w/ chipotle aioli & sesame seeds, and the marinated fried chicken served w/ salsa criolla & lime vinegrette for appetizers.

For an entre, I had the pollo latino dish, which is a pan-roasted chicken breast along w/ truffle-infused macaroni & cheese, and Aji amurillo jus. The dish was heavenly!! Definately a good portion size as well...as i was unable to finish the dish...but that was perhaps bc we had so many appetizers & sangria =)
author: Gina N.

description:
the food was delicious, the place is really loud! 
loved the chicken, sauces and pork ribs. ceviche is yammy, grilled vegetables . 
i would give the food 4* and the location 3*.
author: Lana G.

description:
Ok more like a 3.5.

Some dishes were good, others were underwhelming but service was excellent! Our server was very personable and pretty efficient considering how busy the place was. Food runners/bussers and other servers were all helping each other out - our table was never in need of anything. Napkins daftly folded when guests were in the washroom, water consistently filled and food came streaming at a steady pace 10 minutes after ordering.

Some of the dishes were small portions but it gives us a chance to order a good range of dishes without being too full~ Could get pricey for those with big appetites.

We tried:
Ceviche Nikkei -Massive portion! Huge almost regular sashimi sized ahi tuna. Very fresh and light but a little underseasoned. Fresh and great quality fish.

Tuna Tartare - Fresh small evenly cut pieces of ahi tuna. Flavours are too similar to the ceviche nikkei but better seasoned and served with good crispy fried potato chips

Empanadas (Carne) - delicious albeit pricey! The pastry was crispy and soft in the centre. The meat was tender and so packful w flavours. Delicious..

Pescado Limon - Very good and fresh snapper deep fried with a light crispy crust. Loved the tangy rice sauce it is served with. The potatoes were supposed to be crispy but they were not, but still tasty.

Arroz con Marisco - The seafood paella was the most disappointing. The rice was a little blah - very reminiscent of Uncle Ben's instant rice. It was dry and lacking. The seafood was fresh and good though.

Lomo Saltado - Delicious tender pieces of sirloin strips served w french fries and rice. Loved the strips, it had a very distinct smoky flavour that I can't identify.

Divina Passion - the cocktail was delicious. Fresh, citrusy and just plain refreshing.
author: Edda O.

description:
I'm giving this restaurant two stars because I enjoyed the ambiance, the wine and the ceviche wasn't too bad.

Everything else was soooooo underwhelming. Stuffed calamari - no flavor and did not enjoy it one bit.   And what I thought was going to be a crispy fish came out pretty soggy and again, flavorless. I mean it's a white, mild fish..do something creative people!!!!   Empanadas - I've had MUCH better. 

I am certain that I could have made these items at home and it would have tasted much better.

With that said, I will not be coming back here again.
author: S G.

description:
Yes, Yes a thousand times YES!  Limon friggin ROCKS!

After having our socks knocked off by the ceviche, I had one of the best steaks of my life here!  I was in heaven.  My husband's pork chop was almost as unbelievable.

The service was perfect.  Our server was knowledgeable about everything on the menu, wonderfully attentive and just plain nice.

Two entrees (one was steak), appetizers and two cocktails were only $70.  I really don't expect this quality of food and level of service for under $100.  I'm really not sure why it had been so many years since I've been here.
author: Amy A.

description:
4.5 stars

came here for a late dinner and the restaurant was packed...dim lighting, trendy crowd, and loud...

we got seated at the bar...
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chWLsfWUJ5k8-73t9FOM9A?select=aa-MWyXKhT2sYYQrE1mNUw

our bartender/waitress took our drink order immediately and handed us menus, water, and bread with dipping sauces...
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chWLsfWUJ5k8-73t9FOM9A?select=pXgm8mmsaL6Qem_7RkOtmA
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chWLsfWUJ5k8-73t9FOM9A?select=yuSdWti_Rc32tprTgsFg9A

our bartender making sangria...
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chWLsfWUJ5k8-73t9FOM9A?select=E12EVQpQezHYnPf2jAibDQ

we started off with caipirinhas...which were the YUMMIEST ever...
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chWLsfWUJ5k8-73t9FOM9A?select=BFCpEPRR6WtDxibxBlNLmQ

we also ordered the sweet potato fries:  yummy
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chWLsfWUJ5k8-73t9FOM9A?select=OJb-n75CaSaQ2_4S6zD9dQ

ceviche with uni:  not bad...seemed like it had a bit too much clam juice...
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chWLsfWUJ5k8-73t9FOM9A?select=1fjfIdn8vicnu7SvL0pFCg

grilled octopus and red bell pepper:  probably my favorite of the night...nice texture and perfectly cooked...
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chWLsfWUJ5k8-73t9FOM9A?select=B2sGXSn26OpQmRfJx4QD8g
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chWLsfWUJ5k8-73t9FOM9A?select=twhCtWjnJ7M7Ml_eqeKWvw

fried snapper and coconut rice:  the snapper was simply seasoned, lightly crispy skin and tender flesh...mmm...
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chWLsfWUJ5k8-73t9FOM9A?select=yhorbEiWlzYLKUkpdM7xaQ
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chWLsfWUJ5k8-73t9FOM9A?select=1vIzGyLdughVhSaL0O3J-Q

extra side of coconut rice:  carrots, onions, parsley, almonds...nice flavor and crunch from the almonds...a tad too sweet...but still very good...
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chWLsfWUJ5k8-73t9FOM9A?select=NJHt6dL-llglxpD-xrm1zg

total before tip:  approximately $60...what a deal...as my friend and i were driving home, we were discussing how the bill was a lot less than we expected...so, we start itemizing everything we ordered and came to a conclusion:  the drinks weren't on the bill!  

there are definite pros to sitting at the bar...i knew the bartender liked me;-)  thanks for the free drinks!!
author: Amanda S.

description: Fabulous and favorite spot for Peruvian.  Husband said his Pisco Sour was one of the stiffest drinks he's ever had.
author: Ottis M.

description:
Like my bff "had" always said, the only place you can get true Peruvian food is in Peru. UNTIL he came here. He said the Pollo a la brasa was better than in Peru. The chicken was exceptionally tender along with the Lomo Saltado (tender beef with sauteed onion, bell pepper and french fries). Everything we ate wasssssssss Buenaso, which means sooooo delicious!!!! 

Also the service was great for a party of eight. 

 
Drinks to try: 

Inca Kola: Peruvian Cola...it's yellow but it tastes like heaven

Chicha Morada: It's made from special purple Peruvian Corn. It's sweet and delightful. 

Drinks with Alcohol: 

Pisco: Peruvian's are known for their Pisco, which is a type of alcohol. Try a Pisco Sour, which is a traditional Peruvian cocktail or anything that has a little Pisco in it. 

Peruvian Beers are light but refreshing. I prefer Cusqueña over Crystal but they are both good.
author: Laura S.

description:
A popular well known destination in San Francisco, this hangout has well stood throughout the years. And with food and beverage outlets competing for their sunshine in San Francisco, any local will nod their head when it comes to Limon. 
The Valencia branch is located in the middle, right across from Therapy. The hostess stand is on your left. Be escorted to a table, amidst a lively crowd. Plenty of drinking and laughs along the way. There for a girlfriend's birthday, We were seated in a back area, in a booth. The wooden tables, probably tired from another cover. We ordered the Jalea first to start. The crispy seafood was spot on and I enjoyed the hucatay tartar sauce. The pollo empanadas were good, but may I dare say I was disappointed? Maybe more meat? A little more flavor? But for a Peruvian place, I shouldn't have want to wish that. I should have been there. The ceviche was good, but again, may I dare say I've had better? No crisps to counter the taste. Maybe we didn't order the right things this time? Still good. 
The chocolate cake though is amazing! Warm chocolate cake with a warm chocolate sauce with whip cream and a side of strawberries. Just the right amount. Now, that one was perfect. Will definitely order that again.
author: Jacqueline L.

description:
We had the Ceviche Mixto.....oooo my goodness! I don't know if it's "The Milk Of The Tiger" or what, but my mouth is watering for it now.

Leche Tiger Cocktail...diced seafood with the choclo on a chip is pretty close to heaven I think. 

Tartara de Tuna.....goes o so smoothly down your neck!

I want to go right now!
author: sabrina o.

description:
I ordered from the small plates menu so I could try more dishes.  I ordered the Costillas Nikkei.  Ribs in a tangy soy-based sweet sauce with sesame seeds served with cole slaw.  The ribs could have been more tender, but that's my only criticism.  The sauce was incredible and beautifully plated.  The cole slaw should not be understated - it had a very nice mix, marinated in a vinegar dressing, which was a perfect counter to the sweet ribs.  

I also had Carne Empanadas.  The meat filling was well composed, no odd bits of meat you sometimes find in empanadas.  The crust was baked perfectly and the yellow dipping sauce was mellow, but a great compliment.  I ate them mostly with the lime that came with it, which provided a great counter to the empanada itself.

Lastly, I had the Chocolate Bandido.  I've had my share of places that attempt a chocolate and ice cream dessert, but this was extremely well done.  I found the cookie (chocolate in crisps of leche quemada - I think) a little hard to eat because they were so hard, but the rest of the dessert was worth visiting this place alone.

I also can't say enough about the staff.  The two servers that helped me, made me feel at home with recommendations and an extremely warm demeanor.  The woman waiter was extremely sweet and made my evening alone wonderfully memorable.  For those of you that care, the hostess and the woman waiter were both extremely easy on the eyes.  :)

I can't wait to return and experience everything again.
author: Richard N.

description: The food was great!  We had 2 large plates and 4 small for 4 people, family style.  Everything was beautiful and yummy.  We had the steak and the bacon-wrapped chicken for the large plates.  For the small plates we had the snapper, the ribs, a salad, and the empanadas.  My only slight complaint was that the sauces were a tad too salty.  Excellent sangria.  Very fun and good service.  A great night out!
author: Shelly M.

description:
This is a solid 4-star, I don't know why I wouldn't give it 5, but I guess that's reserved for places that I can envision going to all the time.  Nonetheless this place blew my pants off...the food wasn't bad either.  

We were there for a friends bday party, so they already pre-selected a bunch of items from the menu.  All in all I was amazed by the taste of every item that came out, from the ceviche (it was so good i slurped the brine, that was actually a bad idea, but probably due to too many sangrias), to the paella, to the empanada...dang there was much more but all I recall was that everything was terrific.  The sangria was also really good...shoot now I have 3 favorite sangrias in town (Papito #1, Esperento #2 and Limon #3).  I can not fault anything here, perhaps the prices are too high but I'll pay up for quality anytime, and the tapas were a decent size.  

Will definitely go again and try the plethora of other items.  Yum!
author: A A.

description:
Had been to the rotisserie so was a bit disappointed here.  

Tapas style and pretty much felt I needed more food every time a plate arrived.  Ceviche and empanadas were the stand outs.  Weird order on delivery of food (would think ceviche would be served first) but it does say served as ready.

I normally suggest tapas for groups but felt i was still hungry and we ordered a ton!

A-ok but would go back to the rotisserie over here.
author: Sarah G.

description:
this oh-so-chic restaurant has all the right components, and brings them together successfully in this intimate spot perfect for a catch-up lunch with a best friend. i'd give it a 4.5 if i could, but i can't go for the full 5 stars. 

among the chartreuse and lime-green bar stools, R.R. and i enjoyed  lunch at a mostly deserted limon. we opted for the ahi tuna ceviche, and i instantly regretted it. R.R. had no problem with the dish, but in comparison to the incredibly fresh sushi we had eaten the night before, the tuna seemed mealy and toothsome to me. however, we stayed with the waiter's suggestions for our main courses - the picante de pescado and the lomo saltado. the buttery fish was nice, and the hash underneath was delicious but the lomo saltado was the standout dish. tender chunks of steak smothered in a pan sauce spiked with soy sauce, and tossed with onions, tomatoes, and french fries. the fries drenched in the sauce were just out of control scrumptious. i loved the dish; super creative and yummy. 

this was a great spot a for a leisurely lunch before an even more leisurely lounge session in dolores park. i'd definitely like to check out their brunch scene or go back for dinner.
author: Kris G.

description:
I celebrated my 23rd birthday here....and it was a really yummy meal. I don't remember exactly WHAT I ordered, but the butternut squash soup I got was killer! 

And Jennalyn M. is right, the sangria is yummy as is their servers (Jen....remember Faustino?? LoL)
author: Jackie F.

description: I love their chicken, gotta have it with the different sauces they offer-- make a reservation or hope to get to the bar -- their Piscos are very good but potent! I wouldn't stray too far from chicken ordering as it's hard to compare  - some of best chicken in sf and very reasonably priced.
author: John O.

description: Wow is the only thing I could say about their pollo a la brasa! So moist and flavor perfectly I could not stop eating. The sides were added bonus and their small plates were the icing on the cake. Must try the ceviche de pescado y camaron  & seco de costillas.... fantastic! The price was reasonable and service was excellent. Portion was generous, whole chicken fed a hungry party of 4 with 2 sides and 2 small dishes. A must when in SF. Can't wait to come back again!
author: David K.

description:
The rotisserie chicken is AMAAAZING here. I'm usually hesitant about trying different cuisines because I don't know what to expect. However, my boyfriend's cousin insisted on taking us here during our visit to San Francisco. I'm glad she did. 

Since my boyfriend and I weren't very hungry, we shared "pollo a la brasa"--half chicken along with two sides: rice and yuca fries. The chicken was very flavorful and juicy, and it tasted great with the sauces on the side. I loved the rice here; it's sweet. Reminds me of a sticky rice dessert. The yuca fries were alright, in my opinion. I usually like skinny, crispy fries but the yuca fries were the complete opposite so I wasn't too fond of that. It was interesting to try them though. 

Service is very friendly here. The waiters come by to check on you and refill your water glasses pretty often. 

I wish there was a location in Orange County.. :(
author: Emily Q.

description: LOVE LOVE LOVE THE chicken!!!@  But for whatever reason, every time after I eat there, I get really thirsty!!!!
author: Deb L.

description:
So disappointed in the food here.  We had:

Ceviche mixto: it was the best dish we had here.  It was lemony (duh? its ceviche). And the corns were huge.  I mean... HUGE!!!!!  You'll see.

Lomito Saltado: We asked for medium rare and got a well cooked dish. And the fries were tossed in sauce and it got soggy.  And the sauce was nothing special... just lemon and soysauce.

Chicharron de pollo: Unseasoned fried chicken pieces dipped in lemon juice.  What's so special about this?  No clue...

Pescado Limon:  The spinach in this dish was what made it okay.  Fish was seasoned with salt and pepper.  Quite basic.

We were disappointed with almost all the dish we ordered.  The only thing we liked was ceviche.  Everything else was really bland.  I don't think we're coming back here.
author: Jessica N.

description:
Had limon on my list of restaurants to try out.  It was also listed on my 7x7 100 of the "must" eats in the Bay Area.

I was very excited as I heard great reviews of the ceviche and the rotisserie chicken.  At first glance, this restaurant is very modern and chic.  Nestled in the more "upscale" area of the mission district, this place is surrounded by bars and pubs, and local hang outs.

Entree's ordered:  Oyster Shooters, Ceviche Limon, Pollo Latino, Seco De Cordero, another entree I have forgotten, a bottle of Riesling C&C 07, and Sangria

For this review, I am not going to even talk about the entree's.  The oyster shooters was served in a very lemony type of base.  The same base was used for the Ceviche.  Both I would say, are VERY good, since I love lemons! Thumbs up!

But here comes the part that really disappointed me.  For a place like this, I would not expect to find an insect in my glass of water.  It was a fruit fly or some small type of winged insect.  I picked up the glass and noticed it right away, fighting for its life.  The waitress saw me staring at the glass and immediately took it, apologized, and returned with a new glass.  Fine, It happens.....

After enjoying the oyster shots, and while the waiter was putting down the ceviche, a cockroach literally runs across the table and up the wall, and stops where the wall met up with the trim.  It stood there as if to admire the incoming ceviche dish, which I had no intentions of sharing with it!  The waiter noticed the roach right after my friend gave out a shreek.  He proceeded calmly reached out with his table cloth and scooped up the roach, apologized,  and put down the ceviche plate.

Now,  expecting to enjoy my main dish.... I really could not.  After the fly and the roach incident, I found it kind of hard to even swallow down my food (Reason for not even trying to rate the food here).  As for my friends, they could not either.  Over all experience, was just bad.  A fly? OK... but then a roach?.... Ok WTF?!  Something is wrong here!  I expected at least some kind of formal apology by the MOD, or some type of discount for the unpleasant experience.  Though we played it off like it wasn't a big deal at the time, it really WAS!

I will not be coming back to Limon.  I am sorry.... please take care of your pest problem.

UPDATE:  Just read a couple of reviews below.  It seems I am not the only one that got attacked by the roaches there. :(
author: Rob H.

description: It's always awesome. The Maracuya Sour drink is fantastic. Also, I know it's not typical to get mac n cheese at a restaurant like this BUT.. trust me on this. It is great. I get it every time I go.
author: Jessica P.

description:
Why can't San Diego do Peruvian like San Francisco!?  Every time I come up to SF for work or for play, I have to stop in at a Peruvian restaurant!  This time, Limon was on my list!  

Started out with the Anticuchos de Pollo and ensalada verde, which was honestly enough for a meal in and of it self.  The pollo was perfectly seasoned and the sweet potato fries were done just right.  The salad was tasty, but in the end, it was just a salad, nothing spectacular.  

For my entree, I ordered my favorite, Lomo Saltado.  The flavors were so good, it is making my mouth water just thinking about it!  The meat was tender, potatoes cooked to french fry heaven, and the other veggies were the icing on the meaty cake.  

Well done Limon!  Well done.
author: Mariah C.

description:
Heard about this place a few years ago from a friend who'd seen it on "Check Please" and had to try it when my best friend came to town. The first time we went, I had the Arroz con Mariscos and loved it! My friend ordered the Chuleton Carlitos (pork chop on a cabbage hash), while her mother had the Pollo Latino. Personally, I would never have ordered pork chops at a Peruvian restaurant, but after I tried a bite of my friend's I was hooked! They wanted margaritas, but they don't have hard liquor, so the waiter suggested their mojitos. Everything was so wonderful that we made another reservation for the following night.

Last time my friend came out to visit, Limon was closed for remodelling and so it had been a long time since I'd been there. I went there again tonight though with another friend and was not disappointed. The pork chops were still on the menu! My friend ordered the Churrasco a la parilla (rib-eye steak), and we also ordered sweet potato fries because that's what he is always craving. Everything was as good as I remembered it and I loved the dipping sauces they had for the fries. The pork chop and cabbage was as good, or better than I remembered. Now I can't wait for my best friend to get back out to NorCal so we can go back again.
author: Debi T.

description:
I've had mixed experiences here.

Our first visit was excellent. We were a walk-in party of 4 and had great service, drinks, and delicious food.

Our second, not so much. We made a reservation for 2 and arrived 10 minutes early, our thought process being that we could have a drink at the bar if they weren't ready. Long story short, they weren't ready. We were told it would be a 30-45 minute wait and we could certainly have drinks at the bar. But as soon as we took seats to just get drinks, she considered us seated, and despite requests to wait for our table, were served our entire meal at the bar. Strike 1. Strike 2, was the quality of the food and service dropped considerably from our first visit. Strike 3? Sitting at the bar gives you an unfortunate view of some old looking seafood which we saw the cook scoop out with his hands to make our ceviche. Not so appetizing once you watch the product and process.

3 strikes? Limon is out.
author: T T.

description:
ahh Limon, it's been awhile. A good consistent go to restaurant when you can't figure where else to go and if you forget to make reservations elsewhere for Xmas eve. Who knew that many people ate out on Xmas eve? After seeing all other restaurants booked, surprised Limon was not. Although it did fill up after we got there. This is the first time here since the fire awhile back. 

-atmosphere: a bit loud but open and relaxed, and we had a nice birdseye view of the kitchen, so it was like dinner w/ a show, yes, we find that entertaining.
-service: attentive and knowledgeable, great recs 
- ceviches were spot on, refreshing and not overly seasoned.
- Ensalada de Cangrejo: one of the rare misses: they drowned it in dressing
-Chicharron de Pollo: this is usually one of my favorites here and at the rotisserie. was a bit on the salty side, otherwise was cooked perfectly, not dried out.
- Jalea: Peruvian version of tempura. lightly battered and crispy, not oily
- Arroz con Mariscos: peruvian version of paella: may look small when it comes out, but definitely filling. Flavorful, can definitely taste the saffron.
- Dessert: Profiteroles: average.
author: Eugene P.

description:
Pros:
-D-licious
-Fried Calamari -Heavenly
-Sangria
-Cute & friendly waitstaffs
-scrumptious large snapper 
-Crazy good crispy chicken 


Cons:
-nothing

One of my favorite restaurants!
author: Michael K.

description: Went there for a group dinner.  We chose the prix fixe menu.  The roasted chicken is the bomb, the mac and cheese is great.  Price was on point, had 4 great courses and I think it was $40 a person (we had 17 people), including tip.
author: Perry P.

description:
We heard about this place for awhile and finally made it there and was very much dissapointed. Since we love Fresca which is in our neighborhood, we compared the food with theirs. I didn't like the vibe there, snobby and the food was nothing special and more pricey than Fresca.

I wouldn't want to go back there.
author: Yoko S.

description:
Okay, so everyone knows that Limon is good and I am not going to be adding any value here by giving a food review (although I would like to plug the Loma Saltado).  So here are some random things about Limon that will enhance your dining experience:

1. say hola when you meet the hostess. she will giggle like a little girl.
2. get the sangria and eat the apples.
3. don't sit by the door because the wind blast will freeze your underwear
4. wash your hands in the ladies room...the soap smells nice
author: Kamael S.

description:
I came here last weekend to celebrate my birthday with all my girlfriends. I wasn't able to get a reservation for them on open table but I called them and they were able to fit me in on a Saturday night with a table for 9 people. 

The atmosphere was nice. It was definitely loud. You don't want to come here if you really want to have a heart to heart conversation. They seated us right away which was awesome even though not everyone was there yet. 

We ordered a bunch of food to share and some pitchers of Sangria. The Sangria at Cha Cha Cha's is definitely a lot better. But Limon's sangria is not bad but I think they put in a little too much Cinnamon. For food, I loved the Ahi Tuna Tartare. It was absolutely delicious. A friend order the grill ribeye and it was by far the best thing we ate. The red snapper was pretty good too as well as the Paella. 

This is definitely one of the better restaurants in the Mission.
author: Esther K.

description:
I love it when everything you taste at a restaurant is delicious, and that's how it was at Limon. We finally tried Limon after a friend stating it was his favorite restaurant. The prices were more than reasonable and the  waiters were knowledgeable. We shared a red snapper ceviche & yam fries (an oddly complimenting pair), wine to match, and order paella & sirloin entrees. 

We used the reservation service on yelp and were seated in the balcony (so fun to watch the chefs prepare our dishes). I can't wait to go back.
author: ellen m.

description: great food!!. We had a ceviche, lomo saltado and the chicken. Portions are small but the quality and taste are great. I am sure we will go back to Limon. The minus one star is because the portions are small and the chicha morada came in a bottle.
author: James E.

description: Huge fan of their chicken and truffle Mac n cheese.  I always get the same thing every time.  My husband tried different dishes and loves them all w the exception of their empanadas.
author: ngoc l.

description: Fantastic place where we often take our out-of-town guests when they visit SF. Good cocktails. The Pisco sours are great. The chicken, the empanadas, the steak and the rice are very delicious. Nice ambience and a lot of energy in the restaurant. Prices are very reasonable.
author: Alex D.

description:
This is one of my favorite restaurants in the city.  I am a big fan of lomo saltado and first went to Limon maybe four years ago (when it was still on the Top 100 Restaurants). The food was great and it was a fun place.

Since it reopened, we've still gone back several times for my lomo saltado fix.  Some of the other dishes worth trying - the truffle mac and cheese, the ceviche, the empanadas, and the seco de costillas.  I've never been disappointed with a dish here.  The desserts are awesome too.

As I've mentioned, I still really enjoy the food. However, I didn't give the restaurant five stars because the service has gone downhill since my first visit in 2007.  I came with a party of 7 for lunch - the service was slow, she forgot one of our dishes but then brought it out at the end of the meal, and couldn't consistently refill our decaf coffee.

I will continue to come for the food...and hopefully can live with the service =)
author: Christine O.

description:
Salty food and terrible service. It feels like a place that used to be good, but isn't trying as hard any more.

Food - Split the empanadas vegetariana and the quinotta de vegetales. The empanadas were OK, but small and unexciting while the quinotta was quite good.

As for the entrees, both the Churrasco a la Parrill and the duck (forget the name) were cooked very well, but everything else on the plates were bland and boring and a bit undercooked. The duck had the saltiest sauce I've even tasted. Once I wiped it off with my napkin it was all right. But why didn't I just tell the waiter? I barely ever saw the guy.

Service - The waiter clearly didn't care at all. By the end of the meal we were just laughing at every new development in service or lack thereof. We asked for water three times before we got it. When the glasses were empty the bus boy came by and filled one then came back 5 minutes later to fill the other. When we asked the waiter for suggestions he shrugged and we had to ask again for "no, really, do you recommend the steak?" 

Our favorite bit was at the end when the plates had been cleared and he just tossed one single, beaten-up dessert menu onto the table and walked away. Classy!
author: Ed L.

description:
Got a same day reservation for our group on a Friday night which was a good idea given how busy they were that evening, my guess is that it's always like that, a long wait if you show up after 7 or so.

We started with a pitcher of Sangria that was good but not special in any way.  I had the quarter rotisserie chicken with sweet potato fries and tacu-tacu (seasoned rice and beans) on the side which was all tasty and great.  I also tried the carne empanadas which were very good as well.

The ambiance is nice and the location on Valencia is great too, a busy neighborhood with lots of choices.
author: Mario C.

description: So great! Must try the rotisserie chicken!  Mmmmm the empanadas are great too!!! Servers are knowledgeable, so ask them for recommendations!  They did not disappoint!
author: Stephanie R.

description:
We had reservations for dinner and that seems to be the best way to go. The service and food was great! The servers were attentive and would crack random jokes with us. I really liked their ambiance and decor. 

We started with the ceviche limon and it was fabulous! The Soju Sour was intense. Not sure if it wasn't made to proportion or if it's suppose to knock you on your ass but I had a hard time finishing the drink b/c all you could taste was the liquor. I had the churrasco a la parilla and it was fantastic! If you're in the mood for meat and potatoes order this dish. The flavors were well balanced. I topped it off with a few glasses of sangria and we shared the bandido for dessert. I was surprised by the paella. It looked good but I assumed it would be proportionate to the other dishes. Compared to the churrasco the paella looked like a side dish. Looking forward to trying out their other location!
author: Adriana G.

description:
Maybe I'm a bit biased since I love Peruvian food. But Limon does do it justice. I've been going to this place since it was a tiny hole in the wall on 17th street @ mission. 

3 or 4 different kinds of ceviche can't be wrong. I'm not a big fan of fish but I will eat any and all of the ceviches. If you're a vegetarian, there's  also a veg ceviche option. 

My favorite is lomo saltado. flank steak with frites and banana chips. It is sometimes on the salty side but still hits the spot everytime. They also have some good chicken dishes. 

They don't have a full bar. Only beer and wine but the sangria is delicious. 

It is a bit pricey and you may not always be satisfied with the amount of food on your plate but if you're looking for a nice date or just want to treat yourself to some good peruvian food, this is the place.
author: Nicole K.

description:
I hate it when I get a hankering late at night, because my tummy usually doesn't crave the type of fare that you can order at a drive through window or find rolling on greasy pins under a heat lamp. No, when I get that little pang in my belly, it's usually for something that I can't get past 10:00 pm on a school night, which means my choices are to try and whip it up myself or find a surrogate snack to take its place.

Tonight, for whatever reason, the post 10 pm urge was Lomo Saltado. Not sure where that notion came from, but once it lodged itself in my head, I decided I had to find some or make some. My first thought was Mi Lindo Peru, but it was already closed. Bummer. I scoured the Yelp listings, and saw that Limon was close by, had it on the menu, and was open until 10:30. Muy Bueno.

I'd walked by Limon before (hard not to if you frequent any spots in the 16th/Valencia vicinity, since it's right in the heart of that corridor), but never really paid much attention to it. First thing I noiced.. I was underdressed. It's not formal, but it's slightly upscale. I'm not going to go into architecture and decor, because, quite frankly.. I was there to order some saltado to go.

I sat at the bar, looked down the menu.. and found it.. damn.. $20? Seriously? I'd been to strip malls in L.A. that had Lomo Saltado for $6-7 bucks, so I'm thinking "this better be some damn fine saltado." For a second, I contemplated going to the store to buy the necessary igredients to make my own, but my stomach gave me a growl that said "oh, no you don't, bucko" (my stomach sounds like Richie Cunningham, doesn't it?)

So I ordered the saltado, and, since I was already knee deep in pursuit of this craving, I ordered a cocktail (limon mojito, for those curious) to kill the 5-10 minutes I figured I'd be waiting. The mojito was solid, but a medium pour (i.e., also a little pricey). While sitting there, I saw a couple dishes pass by. The crispy snapper looked really intriguing, as the fish, which look deep fried with the bones in tact, made for a dramatic plating.

The food came quicker than expected, as I had only nursed about half my cocktail. I chugged the last half, signed my check, left my tip, and headed out with the aroma of steak, onions, soy and other spices wafting up at me from the containers.

It didn't take me long to get home, and I had the rice and the saltado on a plate within minutes after entering through my front door. The moment of truth had arrived. First bite?..

Nice. Not too salty, but it was maybe a little too light on the flavor. I was sort of hoping for that little kick from the vinegar, but I wasn't quite getting it. I actually had to pull out a little of my own malt vinegar to pump it up just a tad. The meat was excellent, though. Very tender and juicy and nicely marinated. The meat, in fact, was what made the dish. The fries were ok (I like wedge cuts over fry cuts, and I like it when they have a little crisp to them), and the onions/tomatoes were fine but, as noted before, lacking the rich flavor that some saltados have.

When I was done with the dish, I was happy. My hankering had been quelled, albeit not cheaply. I think I might check out Limon again sometime for some of the other dishes, although there are other spots that are awaiting my attention first. For Lomo Saltado, I'll probably stick to spots like Mi Lindo Peru.
author: Yato Y.

description: We got off the freeway to go back to Limons   We tried the cerviche and tuna tar tar fantastic. It is one of my favorite places bar none.
author: Ed M.

description:
I brought a groupon for forty dollars of eats for twenty during brunch or lunch. What better day to do this then on a Saturday? 

The restaurant itself is pretty and clean. I sat down at the lower counter because the tables were reserved. No servers came. I looked at my menu for awhile to pick out the meals I wanted to eat there and what I wanted to take out because eating forty dollars of food would have been a challenge or so I thought. 

I started with a Limon shooter and it was different. Then it was a tiny meals of seafood soup of some kind. I received it but the couple that sat down next to me ate the same thing and their dish looked larger. Hmm. And they were given utensils like a spoon. I'd already finished my meal so it was too late to ask for utensils. I just thought scooping up the soup with half of a oyster shell was the way to eat it. Silly me. 

I took out two meals, one of chicken and the other an egg dish with chewy sirloin tips. I eventually got the check but when it was presented to me, they called me mademoiselle. Really? I thought it was Peruvian food. I thought I misheard until it was done again. French? Why? 

When I got the food home, without the presentation, the food just looked sad. Forty dollars worth of food? Not really. I ended up owning sixbucks.The dishes are small and the service was slow. I don't think I'll be going back but if you have time on your hands and not all that hungry, it is a nice little place. It is on the pricey side. Just don't sit at the counter where the bartender can't see you and the wait staff rushes past you. You'll be left waiting.
author: lily l.

description: Very bad experience, we made a reservation for 9pm, we had to wait 25 minutes because they didn't have any table available, the didn't even apologize for it. We has to wait another 30 min to get out food that was a small nothing special chicken. Ceviches are rally small and have the price of a main course also.
author: Gonzalo F.

description:
Me: there is a cockroach climbing up the wall.

Limon employee: shrug

Limon bill: expensive.

I'm done.

I called the Health Department.
author: Gabriel D.

description: Staff was friendly and although it was crowded, there was no wait, which is awesome.  The restaurant was really noisy.  The tuna ceviche was delicious, tasted very fresh, is served differently than most cevhices and I would definitely reccommend it.  We ordered a whole chicken, which was pretty tasty, and sweet potatoe fries and grilled vegetables (in soy sauce) as sides. All were pretty tasty.  My sangria tasted a bit watered down, though my friend's tasted fine.
author: Ronnie S.

description:
So, basically I just stared at everyone else's food and ordered what they had.  

The mussels!!  Jesus.  I'm drooling just thinking of them.  

Also, I highly recommend the Ceviche Limon.  So good!!
author: Angela N.

description:
I was looking forward to bringing my friend, who is disabled and needs his service animal with him when he goes out, to limon.   we chose to have a late lunch, in order to avoid a crowded restaurant.   i called to make 2:15 reservations, and a chap named alex told me their computer was down, but there would be no problem getting a table at that time on a monday afternoon.   alex was very pleasant to deal with.    when we got to  limon, there were four patrons at one table.   these four were the only other customers there.    we were getting seated when the food server first asked for tags.   the dog had already laid down next to the table, so he was clearly no problem to anyone who might enter.    my friend asked for a container of water for the dog, and the food server refused.    my friend asked again, thinking he had not heard correctly, and again the food server said no.   no explanation, no checking with any other employee, just no.   we left at that point.

my friend is not the type of person to cause anyone any inconvenience.  his was a simple request that was responded to rudely and unprofessionally.   this was a totally unnecessary   incident caused by an ignorant employee of this restaurant.
author: ali f.

description:
2.5 stars. 

I've heard about this place a few times and decided to check it out in celebration of a friend's birthday. 

I created the reservation on opentable.com and when I checked in, they didn't even have my name (despite my confirmation email). I mean, those opentable points are important to me! The hostess told me they didn't have the reservation, but since it was a weekday, there was some seating available. 

We opted out of alcohol and ordered the mango lemonade. Very refreshing and probably the best thing out of the entire meal. We also ordered the following:

Ceviche Mixto- basic, fresh seafood. Nothing out of this world

Truffle Mac and Cheese-tasted like Kraft Mac and Cheese from a box. The cheese was kind of runny and the elbow pasta just didn't do it for me

Carne Empanadas-Just a-ok. Tasted like all the other empanadas I had

Lomo Saltado- super salty, kinda soggy, and just not that great. 

Chicharron de Pollo-prob my favorite of the other dishes. Chicken was crispy, juicy, and had the perfect amount of salt. Great sauce too.

Overall, I would skip this place and go to Fresca in Pac Heights. The service at Fresca is better, the food is better, the atmosphere is bumping, and the presentation is great.
author: Victoria B.

description:
Had brunch early to use a Groupon.  It sure does fill up fast on weekends.  The food was pretty good.  Although, the place may need to invest in a new vent because when they cook, it gets a bit smokey inside the place.  Can I say, fire drill soon?

The ambiance is cool, lots o hipsters with babies.  It does get a bit loud in the place when it's crowded, so you end up kinda yelling at your dining partner. Service was good, although, they couldn't figure out how to redeem my Groupon.  I guess they haven't figured out that Groupon has a "Merchant" application that they could just scan or type in the upc code thingy.
author: Ny H.

description: I wish I could give TEN stars for the service we received tonight ! We had to make last minute reservations for a group of ten and they were very helpful and made it for tonight at 8:30pm. At the last minute we had 2 other people show up and they were more than happy to accommodate us. The service was amazing !! Very friendly, fast, and super attentive although it was a busy busy Friday night. Loved the service team from tonight. Aside from the service, the food came out all at once after what seemed a few minutes and every single dish was delicious!! We ate everything we ordered except some of the perfectly cooked chicken since we ordered so many. At the end of the dinner they brought out the cake for the birthday girl and after she got cake slammed into her face the waiter brought out a wet towel to clean herself off and then a dry one. How sweet right?? I would DEF recommend this place! Cannot wait to go back! Thank you so much to the staff tonight for making my friends bday just that much better! Great Job!!
author: Louisa T.

description:
Is it possible to actually fall in love with food? After eating at Limon, I can say with all confidence... YES! It is possible and alas, I am in love! For a group of 6 people, we ordered the trio of ceviche - holy bejeezus... T.D.F! My main entree was the bacon wrapped chicken with asparagus served with a side of delicious risotto and a tasty little artichoke heart. My dinner mates ordered the skirt steak fajitas and some other drool worthy creations that I can't quite remember the names of... yikes! All I know is that I will definitely be frequenting this establishment more often! 

Also, the staff here is extremely accomodating, have a great sense of humor and are just generally all around good-hearted people who want you to have a memirable and tasty experience at their restaurant! Its a perfect birthday joint!
author: Frenchie P.

description:
Best sangria evar! You know they actually soak the fruit when you can get drunk from eating it.

The Peruvian tapas- ceviche, tuna tartar, empanadas, and parilla, were all delicious.

You can definitely find cheaper places in the Mission to get your fill, but sometimes you're in the mood to shell out that little bit extra for the clean and upbeat environment.  Open kitchen and good for medium sized groups.
author: Irene C.

description:
Met a friend here for dinner on a Wednesday.

As soon as I opened the door I was greeted with an acrid smokiness filling the entire, half filled restaurant. Their trendy but ineffectual open kitchen was the source.

We ordered:

- ceviche mixte (calamari, shrimp, and fish ceviche)
- papas a la huarancaina (boiled potatoes with a creamy, cheesey sauce, and olives)
- lomos saltado (steak and french fries coated with a thick, savory sauce)

Oh, ceviche. I love ceviche! I did not love this ceviche. The calamari rings had zero flavor despite the zesty citrus sauce and thin slivers of red onion, the white fish (probably tilapia) was mostly raw, and the shrimp was fine. 

The potatoes were also fine, but for $8.95 and modest portions I don't want "fine". I also want more than one, whole olive when a dish is served tapas style and meant to be shared.

The lomos saltado was a big let down. While the steak was cooked nicely, slightly crispy on the outside and softly chewy inside, the fries were limp (not softened from being stirred around in a sauce, but horribly limp), and the sauce was salty and overpowered the entire dish.

I grew up in Miami and really enjoy Peruvian food. This trendy establishment does a disservice to Peruvian food if you are looking for great food and an authentic experience. 

Avoid!
author: j s.

description:
Meh. Me and a lady friend popped in for a late (and moderately time-constrained) weekday lunch. There were maybe half a dozen people in the place.  It took 5 minutes to get seated because the hostess was speaking on the phone, another 10 minutes for the waiter to even pop by with menus, and seemingly an eternity for our food to arrive. 

Food was average and unmemorable across the board. One of the dishes had a bunch of bacon in it, even though we confirmed with our waiter that all our choices were all vegetarian, as per lady friend's latest dietary adventure.

$50 and 2 hours later, all I've seen is a whole lot of mediocrity. Super meh. Live & learn.
author: Andrew V.

description: Reasonably priced. Chicken is the best option though I always find it salty.  The sauces they give you are a good way to mask the sodium.
author: Sebastian R.

description:
We arrived on schedule, but our table wasn't ready.  The hostesses do not have great customer service.

When making your reservation, ask for the booth.

We ordered our meal and it was FANTASTIC.  we ordered Paella, ribeye streak and the steak with fries.  Oh we had ceviche for appetizers and that was delicious and spicy flavorful.  It was so good i wanted to lick the plate just for the dripping of the sauce.

the food presentation was nice and elegantly done.

I didn't like how we were served so quick!  Made me think they just had the food prepped and microwaved it (that's how quick it was).  The waiter wasn't so personable.  

They had a delicious Robedo (something like that) Sauvignon Black (sweet and fruity white wine).

Food was good, service wasn't.
author: R M.

description: The food is delicious and affordable and the chefs are nice, but we have never had a good experience with the hostesses. No matter who it is, they're always rude and pretentious. Why is that?
author: Shannon B.

description:
We had dinner reservations at 9:00 and we weren't sat until 10:30.  WHAT A JOKE!  Were we offered anything more than a pathetic apology?  No.  After waiting nearly 45 minutes, a few folks from our party went looking for another restaurant in the area.  We were then told it will only be about 10-15 minutes more, MAX.  We called our friends to come back to the restaurant and 45 minutes later from there, we were sat.  PATHETIC!  The food wasn't even good enough to make-up the lack of professionalism.  I would've rather grabbed a slice of pizza next door.

To sum it up, thanks for letting us sit and wait for an hour and a half (WITH RESERVATION), rushing our meals by bringing out the apps and entrees at the same time, and rushing us out of the restaurant by midnight because you sat us so damn late.  OH, and I got a stomach ache when I got home.

No joke - don't waste your time or money.  I've had MUCH better.
author: Noneya B.

description:
Make reservations and get ceviche and sangria--a Peruvian must!

Enjoyed this place for my 3.5 year anniversary--thanks Rohit N! The Tuesday night started off well with us finding street parking right in front of the restaurant. The hostess was very friendly and we got seated very close to our reservation time. To start off, we had the sangria and the ceviche. The sangria was very good - a half carafe is perfect for two people. We wanted a good sampling of ceviche since it was Rohit's first time, so we ordered the Limon Ceviche which had calamari, fish and shrimp. The meal itself (Anticuchos de pollo, Empanadas de carne, and Lomo saltado) was enjoyable, quite flavorful and great texture. 

I definitely want to go back!
author: Joyce L.

description:
Two words: CEVICHE and SANGRIA!
So far, Limon has been my favorite Sangria spot. Its sweet and still gets the job done. It doesn't have that bitter aftertaste like others do.

YUM. This location offers Happy Hour Monday-Thursdays 4-6!

I have to say the portions are rather small but very flavorful. 

Ceviche Limon esss my fave! Yummy big pieces of fish, calamari and shrimp and its so lemony and zesty. Amazing. Even the veggies in it are delicious. 
Empanadas de Carne very good, I think it only came with 3.. and it was nice and crispy!

I would recommend pacing yourself while eatting or your gonna be dissappointed about the portions haha. Definitely dont forgot Limon's bomb Sangria (12$ a pitcher during HH)!!
author: Tiffany N.

description:
Oh what a treat to the tastebuds!
I went to Limon with my family after spending my birthday in San Francisco.  I'd heard a lot about this spot and was intent on enjoying a birthday dinner here.

And what a dinner it was!  It was on the early side so we got here well before it got crowded.  They do take reservations, and based on how quickly it filled up I'd say make some.  So first things first - Sangria and Ceviche Shooters!  Great way to start the meal!!  I happen to love the taste of lime, so the shooters were perfect - very tangy and full of that strong citrus flavor.

Entrees included the fried red snapper (great presentation, tender and flaky), roasted chicken (juicy, crunchy and seasoned to perfection), seafood paella (rice was cooked just right; seafood was fresh and the entire dish was a burst of spicy flavor), and lastly the grilled rib-eye (large portion, tender all the way through, and juicy as heck!)

I don't know what they do here, but they do it right!  From the excellent service to the savory cuisine - I love it here!!
author: Maryrose S.

description:
Pros:
-Good for a first date
-Nice ambiance, lively
-Chicken camarones dish was DELISH...as was the Mango drink

Cons:
-Long wait if you dont have a reservation (though I made mine in advance)
-Slightly on the dark side, but I didn't mind it
author: Tushar T.

description:
As soon as you enter into Limòn's sophisticated yet modern space, you know you're in for a great eating experience!  Aside from including a dining area, this Peruvian restaurant also has a bar area and an opened-view cooking area which I liked very much. 

Though we were at Limòn for brunch, I was quite impressed that the brunch menu offers a variety of dishes from ceviche to chicken to seafood.  Within a few minutes of sitting down at our table, a friendly waiter brought us complimentary bread along with two different dipping sauces.  These sauces were incredible!  The green sauce had a mild spiciness taste whereas the orange reddish sauce had a spiciness balanced out with a citrus taste.

For the food, we ended ordering the anticucho de pollo (grilled chicken skewers with sweet potato fries and aji amarillo-huacatay sauce).  The chicken was tender and marinated in a spicy mix.  The sweet potato fries were ones of the best I have ever eaten!  They were crispy on the outside while soft in the middle.  The aji amarillo-huacatay sauce was so savory and tasted great everything, from the grilled chicken to the sweet potato fries to the bread!    

We also ordered the picante de pescado (fresh fish fillet cooked in aji amarillo creamy sauce over tacu-tacu and potatoes).  While the fish fillet was so tender it melted in your mouth, the flavorful aji amarillo creamy sauce was definitely the star of this dish!  The aji amarillo creamy sauce with a spicy kick balanced well with the fish fillet, the tacu-tacu (rice and beans), and potatoes.

For side dishes we order the French fries and crispy yucca with chimi-churri.  While the French fries were just okay the yucca fries were fried to perfection!  

Overall, Limòn is a wonderful restaurant to have Peruvian food and the table service was not only super attentive but also very friendly!
author: Lupe M.

description: Rotisserie Chicken is the star here.  Half a chicken, 3 sauces and 2 huge sides for $12 is one of the best values going.  The chicken (Valencia St.) was incredible.  I went to so. Van Ness with a Meetup group.  We had lots of different apps but the chicken was totally the STAR.
author: Toby T.

description:
4.5 stars!

The rotisserie chicken was amazing. It was moist and everything I expected it to be from the moment I spotted it on the table next to us. It was paired with 3 types of dipping sauces that were set on the table prior to the the arrival of our food.  It came with two sides of your choice. 

We also had the  ceviche mixto and I absolutely loved it. If you like fresh corvina and seafood accompanied with variety of toppings you'll love this. We  had the lomo saltado which is a sirloun steak sauted with tomato, onions and fries, all marinated in the juices and herbs from the steak. It had great flavor besides the fact that the steak was over cooked (well done).

To top this wonderful meal off we also had sangria. I'm a big fan of sangria and couldn't be more pleased. A tad too sweet  but still a very solid and refreshing drink. I actually regret not ordering the pitcher. Overall, I was pleased with my food and my experience here.
author: Jeanne L.

description:
I had some nice food here.  It's a nice restaurant, with tasty food.  The food, however, didn't "pop" for me.  It had flavour, it felt fresh, but I didn't get that zing I've had from other Peruvian restaurants.  Service was very meh.  Price was very reasonable.  

I'd go back and give it another bash.
author: Jon M.

description: The truth is that the Pisco Sour was quite good. It' has been really hard to find a place that does it at least similar to the orginal reciepe either from Chile or Peru. But the food was expensive for what it was: the ceviche was not made with fresh fish, and the empanadas were estable but not nice.
author: Maria Cecilia J.

description:
