First of all, the food here is delicious. I have been coming for years. Coincidentally, until this past weekend, I have never come on a Friday/Saturday night and have always been seated immediately at either a table or the bar.

Wanting to take my Peruvian friend visiting for the weekend, I made reservations for 8pm this past Saturday. Our entire party arrived on time and then Limon basically jerked us around for the next 1.5 hours before finally seating us at 9:30pm!

When asked if overbooking was common practice for the restaurant the hostess replied "all the time." The manager also confirmed that this is the way they have been treating their customers for years. Why make reservations at all?!

They did not even have the consideration of buying us a round of drinks or giving us complimentary dessert as they did in a prior review - yes, overbooking and making customers wait over an hour is a recurring practice here. Instead, the manager was cold, dismissive and insensitive.

I will never come here again on a weekend.
author: Michael B. K.

description: Went here after a long day of shopping with a girl friend and made our way to the bar to have a drink. Ordered a carafe of sangria and it was so quenching delicious. We noshed on their sweet potato fries and later, ordered another bowl of chimichurri fries. I'll be back and have their lomo saltado on my next visit!
author: Mika D.

description: Ate at the bar a few fridays ago. Service was decent. Grubbed on the ceviche mixto, roast chicken w/yucca fries & vegetales salteados, braised short rib and beet salad. Everything was good enough, though nothing stood out at the end of the night. $80 w/tip and a couple drinks.
author: Anthony R.

description:
This place was just meh. An unremarkable dining experience where the food was nothing to write home about. I'm a fan of getting what you're paying for, the price point is a little high for uncreative tapas. Ambiance is more like blah, I could barely hear my dinner companions and it was a Monday night, the place was half full.

Oh, and have you ever had a hangover in the morning, when you weren't even drunk the night before? Yeah, thanks super sugary sangria, my head hurts.
author: H.S. G.

description:
Unfortunately, this was one of the most disappointing experiences I've had at an sf restaurant..I would have thought Limon's management would take better care of their customers, especially after being highlighted in the top 100 restaurants in SF.  Maybe it's because the chronicle didn't have to wait 1 hour and 15 minutes past a reservation to get what was at best, an average and unoriginal meal.  A restaurant (and I'm talking about the management)  that hasn't figured out how to handle traffic, is a not a real restaurant and a disgrace to the caliber & quality service expected of sf restaurants....In defense of our waitress, she did everything imaginably possible to appease and cater to us, but never once saw did we see her manager.  And did I say the food was average??  Bring your own bottle of wine too because no one should have to pay those prices for that wine list..What a joke.  

If 3 out of the next 10 reviews doesn't have a similar experience, I'll be surprised.  But I still won't have any hesitation walking right past this place
author: Darren B.

description: We were able to get a table within 5 minutes of arrival at 6 pm with no reservations. However they seated us upstairs at the darkest corner with no light. I couldn't even read the menu so we requested a table change. They should either fix the bulbs or set up additional lights to compensate the burned out bulbs. Service and food was good though. We ordered half a chicken, rice and beans, fries, truffle mac and cheese, and carne empanadas. I expected more from the mac and cheese (kinda bland in my opinion) but the carne empanadas and chicken were on point. I will definitely come back!
author: Linlin L.

description:
I don't normally review places I've only been to once but for Limon I can make an exception. There are so many unknown variables that can affect the  type of day you can have and all of this can dictate how good your upcoming dining experience can  be. 

1. Was there a lot of traffic in the city?
2. How many times did you circle the block to find parking?
3. Is that homeless guy going to pee on my car?
4. This better be worth it because everyone told me this place was good.

I have found that the lower the expectations the better your experience will be but that frame of mind is unnecessary here. Unless you are the helplessly urbane type of person that doesn't understand that when a popular restaurant is busy that service may be a little slow, Limon has the potential to be a remarkable dining experience.

After finding parking in record time right on the corner I came in to see my wife at a cozy table on the second floor. Perched  from our seat at the top of the 2nd story loft, we had a bird's eye view of the kitchen.We were immediately impressed by our helpful and attentive wait staff and the tasty sangria.  Particularly liked the nice presentation and robust flavors of our food. Food is Spanish with a hint of asian influence. Not particularly cheap but so worth it. Keep in mind we came on a weeknight...and it was still relatively busy and we are totally in love with this place.
author: Vincent V.

description:
Ceviche? Yes!!! 

It will be a melt in your mouth experience, I hope. I believe the cocktails and deserts were quite scrumptious as well, but apparently not as memorable as the Ceviche... Service was nice.  

I also enjoyed the atmosphere, lime green used to be my favorite color in 5th grade.
I mean that place would have been my dream room 16 years ago... that tidbit is only helpful for other fellow lime green admirers.
author: Courtney H.

description: This place is always on point  , but Chiccharones el Pollo not the best thing on the menu. But everything else amazing!
author: Lauren V.

description:
Tip: While they take reservations for 10:00pm on weekdays (when they close at 10:30), they'll understandably ask you to come in a bit early, and make the ordering process a little rushed.

This was easy to forget though as the food arrived very quickly, all 6 small plates came within 5 minutes. Good for quickness, but skepticism-inducing for the critical eater. Since this is more of the flagship restaurant, relative to Limon Rotisserie, I was expecting the dishes to at least parallel, if not exceed the taste standards of Limon Rotisserie. 

Unfortunately, my favorite dish, the ceviche mixto, did not taste as fresh as the one I ALWAYS get at Rotisserie and which is ALWAYS top notch. There was a quinoa dish that was a tad slimy too. 

Redemption: The yucca fries I had tonight were better than the Rotesserie location. Perfect balance of thin-crispy shell with hot pillowy/flaky internals. And of course the classic Limon sauces. 

Redemption 2: the server gave us all a serving of a Peruvian drink which tasted like half cider half sangria (apologies for mangling the name/description of this drink), and explained to us that they were thankful that we could come in a little earlier than 10. Great service!

Desserts: Both the profiteroles and a chocolate cake dessert were above average in taste and beautifully presented, but not quite 5 stars yet.
author: Clifford K.

description:
first-able I love Peruvian food!! So I'ven around many Peruvian restaurants so on March 17 I decided to try Limon, we were a party of 3!!! so we got there and the place was kind of pack so we asked if they had a table for 3 and one of the guys at door said Yes We can  seat you right away But do you think you will be done in hour? I was like yea i think we can eat in hour we were hungry so seated 
the waiter never brought us water or anything!! he just came to the table to ask if we were ready so i said can we start with an order of Anticuchos? so he responded that we should order eveything together because they had a big party coming so i said fine no big deal so ordered 4 plates since the plates are so small we eat them in less than 20 min We were hungry!! so I asked the waiter if can order more because we weren't full and he said im sorry but You CAN'T order more Because when you guys were seated you agree to stay only an hour! I was in shock i said what you mean?? I CAN'T order???? you dont want me to spend more $$ in ur Restaurant??? i know they said an Hour but we are here only less than 35 minutes?? so refused to let us order more so i try to talk someone else and they said let me send the manager over. Manager NEVER came. other waiter was cleaning our tables i try to explain what was going on and He answer ohh yea But guys were seated under certain conditions!!! I was like Are you serious?? and they just brought us the bill!!!! i mean what kind of service is this????? i have never been treated like that in any restaurant!!!  

I think the service is HORRIBLE!!!!!! they have no idea what customer service is!! I will  NEVER come back here or recomend this Place to anybody this is the worst restaurant EVER !!!!!!!!!
author: Marcela C.

description:
Went to Limon with a girlfriend for lunch and we enjoyed our small hot plates. Our waitress was a pleasure as well. We sat on the bar right by the kitchen and it was nice to see the action. Here's what we had...

1. Lomito Saltado - stir fried top sirlion strips with french fries, tomatoes and lovely sauce all over the whole plate....DELICIOUS!
2. Pescado Limon - snapper fillet with spinach over crispy potatoes...this was cooked to perfection and it was just as DELICIOUS!
3. Seco de Costillas - braised boneless beef short ribs with huacatay, cilantro, peas, carrots, tomatoes, red onions....one of my favorite dishes! It comes with 2 large DELICIOUS and tender pieces of braised beef short ribs, totally melty and yummy!

I've been here before and will return for more! Yay!...also...their sangria is fantastic! just the right amount of sweet and tang....i can probably drink a whole karaf!
author: Juliet W.

description: Love this place. I  amso picky about chicken, but the chicken here is so flavorful and tender. I have loved the sides I have tried here, my favorite being the Tacu Tacu. I love the sauces too. Their special request hot sauce is really spicy, but I wasn't in love with the flavor. All their variations of picso sours are pretty fantastic too.
author: Vrushali P.

description: All I had here was the Ensalada de Atun (salad with seared ahi) and it was the best of its kind I've ever had at a restaurant.  Much better than the last time I tried a salad like this while in Puerto Vallarta; that one was just crap.  This is how it's done.  The rocoto-ponzu dressing that they used for this salad or whatever it was, tasted delicious.  Ten bucks for a salad is expensive, but I thought it was worth it - they gave you just the right amount for the salad itself; not too little, not too much and the presentation was done well.  Interior of the restaurant/ambiance was nice.  Only reason I couldn't give 5 stars was due to items on the menu being on the pricey side.
author: Kahanalei M.

description:
Had an amazing time last nite @Limon. Had the shrimp and fish ceviche, wow, amazing taste. The portion was plenty for my wife and I. Highly recommend this. Also, had the Quinto de Vegetales.  This was surprisingly delicious from we thought we were getting. Flavorful with a great texture. For the main dish we had the rib eye, amazing flavor, of course, rare is the best way to eat a piece of meat this juicy. 

Also, our 5 year old was with us and he loved the macaroni and cheese on the menu, he ate it all, a surprise to both of us. I would have a bowl of it myself. 

The only dish that we were left a bit disappointed were the calamares rellenos.  Missed some flavor in the beans and rice stuffed inside the calamari. Not sure if I'd order this again. Maybe another order of ceviche? :) 

The service was impeccable. Loved the attention not only from Alejandro, our waiter, but from the entire staff. From the receptionist, who seated us right away, to the water boy who was smiling and was very attentive. I highly recommend this place and will definitely be back.  Enjoy!
author: Oscar B.

description:
I went here w/ my guy for the first time last night and the 4 stars here are for the food & the service.

We ordered the red snapper ceviche which was plentiful & delicious, yucca fries which were okay but nothing memorable & the chicharron de pollo - the crispy chicken.  The chicken was nice & crispy, a little dry but I think it's just a matter of opinion and the tangy dipping sauce w/ it was great.  These 3 small plates were plenty for the 2 of us but I think if you were reeeally hungry, you'd probably want to order 1 more dish.  Their Divina Passion cocktail was delicious and plenty alcoholic ;)  The service was very fast & friendly and the food came very quickly.  I would love to come back and try the Lomo Saltado.

However, if I were judging this place on noise level, it would get 2 stars or less.  Yes, we came here on a Friday night but given the "average" noise level description here on yelp, I didn't imagine I'd have to literally yell across the table in order to converse.  I will definitely not return here on a Friday night.
author: Suzanne V.

description: If you're looking for pollo a la brasa or pisco sours, look no further. However, execution of the rest of the menu needs assistance. The tacu tacu was made with Mexican rice (red) and wet, which was not good or Peruvian. Additionally, the ceviche mixto was over cooked (by that I mean over "cured"). The aji salsas were for the most part bland and FYI there is no chimichuri in Peru so if you're going to present it at least make it delicious. To top off the evening our server was cocky and did not know much about Peruvian cuisine. Overall not a great experience our fifth time here.  Van Ness location at least has better servers. Not sure if they've also changed the recipes (e.g tacu tacu).
author: Dahlia O.

description:
Cheap dig for happy hour oysters and red snapper ceviche in the mission, but not that great for anything else. Calamari is a pretty good deal I suppose for the amount you get - it comes with some yuca fries too. But I'll go back to the ceviche - GET IT. It's a huge pile of marinated red snapper for $9 that can happily fill you up.

Oysters can use some work on their shucking skills - there were shells in the ones I had with Lisa W. Who wants to slurp down glass-like shards?! They don't taste as fresh as the ones you can get from the Hog Island Oyster stand, but I guess they are $1.

Service is iffy. The first time I came here the service was fine. The second time I came here they were dealing with alot of big parties so we weren't able to get anyone's attention AND they forgot our order. It wasn't reaching maximum capacity really so I don't know what the deal is but there needs to be some improvement in that area.

If you can't keep orders straight, it must be a disaster for a big group gathering...Shape up, but I'll still come for the ceviche.
author: Charles L.

description:
Although we had reservations, we had to wait about 20 minutes to be seated. All the tables were full and they were apologetic for our wait. 

Once seated, we ordered the Sangria which was very good because it was not too sweet like most I've tried. We ordered the Ceviche Limon, Grilled Baby Octopus, Spare Ribs and Ribeye. Everything was delicious with great flavors and good sized portions.

This was one of favorite meals while in SF.
author: Nicci R.

description:
Food:  Went on two separate occasions:  The first time the stand out dish was the ribs.  The ribs were fall off the bone with a nice crispy skin (they do a flash deep fry I'm assuming?).  The second time I went, I was highly disappointed with all our dishes.  Everything was overly salty and it kinda ruined everything.  The sangria is pretty good though, a bit on the sweet side but still good.  

Service:  Eh.  Both time's service was mediocre.
author: Kevin T.

description: The food was totally yummy especially the pollo empanadas.. The service was decent. Overall good experience..
author: Deepa P.

description:
Did you know there is a Limon AND a Limon Rotisserie? I didn't... until last Thursday. Whoops.

So my goal was to try the Rotisserie Chicken that's on the 7x7 Big Eats List 2010... from Limon ROTISSERIE. Instead, I made reservations here. Damn iPhone Google Map... Anyways, mistake aside, this turned out to be an amazing place to celebrate my birthday! They weren't going to seat us until our full party was there, but the place was EMPTY at 6:15 on a Thursday so I think they finally realized how silly it was and sat the 2 of our 4 that were there. (The others were hiking over from LR, see above.)

We got a pitcher of Sangria, and YUM! It's the perfect balance of sweet and a little spice and the fullness of the red wine... get a pitcher. Just do it. My sister couldn't make dinner and sent a bottle of champagne to the table, which they thoroughly screwed up by getting her name wrong and then giving me the billing info for her credit card! Ah well, the thought is what counts.

For the food, we decided to do it small plates style and share:
Cebiche Limon - a perfectly done, classic cebiche
Atun al Tuasi - (Ahi Tuna) way too small for the money, lacked flavor compared to the rest of the meal
Anticuchos de Pollo - (Chicken Skewers) little flavor explosions, with a tasty sauce
Lomo Saltado - (Sirloin fingers with french fries) I'll just say this, we ALL tried to soak up the sauce with whatever we had left on our plate
Truffled Mac n Cheese - creamy deliciousness
Crispy Yucca with Chimi-Churri - perfectly fried, surprisingly simple and good

Dessert:
Chocolate Bandido - this is what dessert should be! Gooey chocolate cake and a fruity sauce. Mmmm
Profiteroles - good, but the sauces were the stars.

By the time we left, the place was packed! All in all, it was an affordable place with a fun atmosphere for a celebration. I'd come back just for the Mac n Cheese or that Bandido, yup.
author: Shannon B.

description:
I've never been more infuriated by a dining experience. Last night, a group of us had an 8 pm reservation at Limon. We were told repeatedly it would be "10 more minutes" until we were finally seated an hour and a half later. 

I assumed, incorrectly, that a few items would be "comped" (sp?!) given our inconvenience. Instead, when we spoke to Enrique (the manager) at the conclusion of our dinner, he said in an incredibly obnoxious and condescending tone, that this is how they've been conducting business for sever years and it's served them well. Disgusting. I wanted to slap him!

Conclusion: I will never eat at this restaurant again!
author: Danielle Y.

description: The sauces, chicken, and empanadas are amazing. We ended up saying no to dessert and just getting more empanadas. Did I mention the empanadas?
author: Benjamin H.

description:
Pretty unimpressive brunch.

The chicken omelet was pretty bland and had a sauce with a powdery texture to it, plus the fries were soggy.

The mac and cheese was also very tasteless and forgettable.

Empanadas were a little salty and also nothing to write home about.

The most memorable part of brunch:

Us: Do you have any ketchup to go with the fries and omelet?
Waiter: No, sorry, we get asked that a lot but we don't (I thought he was joking, but he wasn't).
author: P M.

description:
I'm a big fan of Limon Rotisserie, probably been there at least 5-6 times since they opened, but until recently had never tried the original Limon. Not that I have I keep asking myself "What took you so long?!?"

We ate the following:

Oyster shooters - so good we ordered another round after the first
Tres Tiempos - aka three types (how's my Spanish coming along?) of sashimi. While I knew Limon did cebiche well, I had no idea the sashimi would be this great

Cebiche Pescado - not so fast, my friend. This was fine but not nearly as good as the Tres Tiempos

Lomo Saltado - now we're getting serious. Holy tower of steak and fries, Batman! The presentation was awesome, the meat super juicy though I got to admit, I prefer the fries mixed in with the beef (ala Limon Rotisserie) instead of served atop.

Truffle Mac n Cheese - it's macaroni and cheese with truffle oil. Duh.

We also had some pretty great dessert (think sorbet trio and molten chocolate cake) and a pitcher of tasty sangria. Grand total for all this food and drink? Under $100, including tax and tip. No wonder there was a steady buzz in the restaurant on a Monday night. I'm definitely adding Limon into my Mission rotation and will be back soon!
author: phil h.

description:
Went here for dinner on a girls' night out...we didn't have rezzies, but we were seated fairly quickly for being a table of 5 on a busy Saturday night. The food was excellent and there were loads of great dairy-free options since two of us are "lactarded."  They also have lots of yummy cocktails. The staff was great, our food came out in a timely fashion and, since we were seated upstairs along the edge of the balcony, we could watch the cooks creating all the yummy dishes. Very entertaining.

Funny side note: There were 3 birthday parties going on (yes, 3!) and that meant we heard (and, *erhm* participated in) the singing of "Happy Birthday" as many times. Good thing we were in a goofy mood...it was fun for us. I could see how someone wanting to have a romantic evening would be disappointed had they been there that night...the whole upstairs got a little loud.
author: Tori W.

description:
I remember going to Limon when it first opened a few years back - when they were still in the tiny space where Maverick is now.  In addition to the lomo saltado (which to this day is the ONLY dinner entree I've ever ordered at Limon), one of my favorite things about that location is this one piece of art that they had up.  It was a bunch of different sized squares with other squares painted on them....put together in other squares.  Anyway, it has been the inspiration for my fledgling art hobby.

The food is great and hearty - I've always been very pleased with my lomo saltado and everyone else with the dish they've ordered.  I've also had the ceviches which were delish, though I can't claim to be a ceviche connoisseur (though I do know my beef!).  Service has also been great.

Great option if you have a large-ish party in the Mission area since you can make reservations.
author: Wendy L.

description:
- Reservations gets you a seat in a snap.
- Interior is modern, intimate, and warm. Nice wood floors.
- Red snapfish? has generous meats, fried and flavorful. I didnt really care for the molasses-like red sauce.
- Sangria! The exclamation point needs no explaining.
- Service- adequate. 

Be aware of prices and parking...
author: Thomas L.

description:
I think this place is phenomenal, and for the price definitely worth a special trip. The snapper I had here was the best I've ever had and be sure to get an order of truffle oil mac & cheese (I never got how that was Peruvian - but who cares it is ridiculous!)

The first time I came here with about 5 friends and were all eating off each others plates - no one got a bad meal. I will say a few the appetizers were just okay, but the sangria washed everything down perfectly.

The wait staff is superb and nice, and they know their shit, so don't be afraid to ask for recommendations if you are having trouble deciding!

Place gets full quickly so you may have to wait, not sure if they take reservations as I've always met friends here for dinner.
author: Nate E.

description: My friend had her birthday party here and we had a great time.  We ( a group of 15+) ate family style and we loved everything.  The chicken was especially memorable.  We also made great use of the bar- getting shots and pitchers of delicious sangria.  We loved it!
author: Jennifer D.

description:
Limon! I haven't been back since you've re-opened but if its anything close to your first location, I'm all for you! 

The last time I was in SF, I looked very forward to going to Limon until I heard about a fire that burned the best Peruvian restaurant outside of Peru down.  The ceviche was delicious.  Sangria awesome.  Modern flair with traditional food and a great vibe make this place a good for bigger groups or more social situations.  The space may not be so big but I really enjoyed myself here with all the chitter chatter and family style food being passed around. 

My only reservation was the location around it but completely worth the venture outside of downtown or Union square.
author: Thad C.

description:
Our large party was seated late and food was just so so. Their ceviche could of been better since the fish was a bit tough. My mussels were almost nonexistent. Out of the bowl I had like 3-4 good mussels as the others were A) not opened or B) only shell with the mussel nowhere to be found.

WORST OF ALL...their cocktails sucked. Sangrias, mojitos and sours all tasted watered down. 

Thanks but no thanks...
author: Jon W.

description: All 3 locations are great but this one is my favorite.  I have been there 3 with friends and plan to return again.  Chicken is to die for.
author: Alexander R.

description:
Let me get the negativity out of the way before I rave about the food. First, we had a reservation for 7 and because parking was so scant, our party arrived in two groups. Though we were STARVING, the hostess refused to seat us on time until our whole party arrived. I understand that it was a Friday night, etc, but is it likely that another party of 7 will arrive and swoop our table? NO. So instead we had to huddle by the doorway all awkwardly for a good 15 minutes.

Ordered some sweet potato fries at the bar to stave off our hunger. Of course they would arrive seconds before we were led to our table. They were amazing SPF though. Really good.

We also had an order of the truffle infused mac n cheese, which was also good but now that I think about it, these appetizers really do not agree with the rest of the menu. 

We bought two bottles of wine ($15 corkage fee) which the servers happily uncorked and poured for us throughout our meal. 

Our waiter seemed a bit huffy with us after we dismissed his suggestion that we weren't going to be satisfied with one order of ceviche. SORRY we want a variety of tastes and enjoy sharing our food! Seriously we got attitude for the duration of our meal.

As for the food, well twas fantastic. We got the Ceviche Nikkei de Atun, which had a very Asian flavor. 

We also got an octopus appetizer that was great but I can't find it on the menu online so I don't know what it is called. I think it comes with 3 and you probably won't want to share once you have had one bite, so keep that in consideration.

The Pargo Rojo was probably my favorite of the night : crispy red snapper fillet, coconut fried rice & rocoto-curry sauce. We were all obsessed with the coconut fried rice (super flavorful) and we picked the fish carcass completely clean like the Asians we are. Delicious!

The Aroz con Mariscos (Peruvian-style paella) was decent, though I think I prefer Spanish paella and I found the dish a bit small for the price. There was so little rice! The seafood was good and I do think that it works well for a single-serving dish. 

For dessert we ordered a Bandido (warm chocolate cake with light strawberry compote vanilla ice cream, caramel tuile & chocolate sauce). Absolutely delicious. Imagine seven silver spoons digging into this hot mess and having the dish be wiped clean within a minute of its arrival. Before I had the O2 at Alexander's, this would have topped my all-time favorite chocolate dessert list. (That is saying a lot.) 

Overall, I had a fantastic time at Limon with my best friends in the world (being buzzed helped). If not for the wait and the haughty service, I would not hesitate to return on a date or for future celebrations.
author: Lydia W.

description: What great menu, excellent rotisserie chicken, awesome side dishes, Ceviche Mixto...so delicious. All in the party were amazed at the menu and very fair priced with good sized servings. Very attentive service... I will be back...
author: Mark P.

description: I heard this was the best  of their 3 locations in San Francisco. Food was A-OK. Did not see what the hype was about..
author: Goldie L.

description:
Jesus served me last night.
Jesus was polite, accommodating, and very attentive. 

Jesus tempted me & got me to eat my very first nibble of fish, ever.
(granted it was the cebiche shooter & drowned in cilantro & limon so there wasn't a *trace* of seafood icky smelling nastiness to it, and yes,  people, it tasted like chicken).

Limon is the perfect place for a nice culinary treat for you & a buddy you need to catch up with.  Unfortunately (or maybe price-wise thankfully?!) my friend & I nibbled on cheese+crackers before venturing out to seek food-food, so all we had was this:

- 1 glass of Malbec
- 1 glass of Sangria (sweet + yummy + generous)
- 1 Cebiche Shooter
- 1 Tabule de Cereales Andinos
- 1 Anticuchos de Pollo
- 1 Chocolate Bandido (orgasmic)
total bill: $46.00 (tax included but not tip)

We were full & YES, SI, OUI, DA the sauce the complimentary bread comes with is freeeeeakin' scrumptious. Very indian mint-chutney like.

It felt like a splurge dinner in terms of ambiance & service, but completely affordable & cosy! - I actually had to take a time-out after chowing down to have a look-see around, and it's a beautiful restaurant - can't wait to go back!

Thank you, sweet Jesus, for allowing us to break bread & drink wine, in your waiter's-name's-on-the-merchant-copy-of-your-check, name.  
You had me stompin' mah feet & a-clappin' mah hands =)

Amen!
author: Anjali V.

description: Fun environment.  Great selection of cocktails.  Cant go wrong with anything on the menu.  I'm partial to the empanadas to start followed by the chicken with sides!  Also a great neighborhood for pre or post dinner drinks.
author: C W.

description:
I've been here several times, and I've never tasted a dish I didn't like.  The meat empanadas are probably my favorite.  They are small portions, but it's fun to get several and share them family-style.

I had no idea what chicha morada was when first coming here, but theirs is delicious.
author: Allison D.

description: Don't bother making a reservation you will be forced to wait 25 to 30 minutes. The hostess will inform you that they are busy tonight.... Hence the reservation was made in vein.
author: Oliver K.

description:
I waited for a long time to try this place for a few reasons. I thought that my beloved Mission had gentrified enough an along came a high end place that was hard to get into. Well I have fell back in love with the Mission and got over the "change" as I call it and gave this place a try.
Loved it, love the food, the service the local everything. The only black mark was the hostess that for some reason idolizes Snooki and does her best to try and look like her. She was dense, rude and totally uninterested in working but maybe that was part of her whole Snooki make up. I will still give 4 stars as she was more entertaining than annoying.
author: Dennis K.

description:
Limon is back and better than ever.

A friend recently had her birthday dinner here and we had a feast. For appetizers, we had an ahi sushi ceviche (fresh and delightful), sweet potato fries (really good), fried yucca accompanied by a delicious sauce (fantastic), carne empanada (mmmm), spinach, mushroom and cheese empanada (the best of the bunch), truffle mac and cheese (big let down; could barely taste the truffle oil). Our birthday girl was delighted by the appetizers. 

Entrees. Three of us got the fresh filet and shrimp in an aji amarillo creamy sauce with potatoes and tacu tacu. The sauce was so flavorful and the seafood was delicate and perfectly cooked and seasoned. One person got the fried red snapper and loved her dish. Another ordered the lamb and remarked it was the most tender lamb she had ever tasted. I had a bite and it was excellent. The birthday girl ordered the seared pork chop with cabbage and bacon hash. She loved it and I had a very flavorful bite. The pork chop was very thick but still moist. 

Everyone was too stuffed for dessert. Next time for sure! 

Service was good and our waters were constantly filled. Fun, energetic atmosphere.
author: Jenny K.

description:
I have a Groupon and close to expiring so i have go try this restaurant with my dad yesterday. The staff is great. We got our table within 5 minutes because we have reservation. 
We ordered the Jalea (crispy seafood(fish, shrimp, calamari and yucca)
with tartar sauce(it is good, my dad love it), and Seco costillas (boneles beef short rib with veggie like carrot, potato and peas), it is just the right portion and I love it because it felt like the meat all melted in your mouth without even chewing on it.
The large plate we ordered the Rideye steak, which is a bit disappointed, the top of the steak have a lot of black pieces with an indication to me it is overcook, I ordered as Middle rare.
It came out to be about $15/person(tax and tips included) with 3 dishes, which is great.
author: Thomas L.

description:
It's a solid Peruvian place, but not a fan of the tapas style menu. Their Lomo Saltado and ceviche are solid. LOOOOOOVE their chica morada (purple corn drink). 

Don't get me wrong the food is good and of good quality, but the tapas style portions kill the value for me and thus the 3 star rating. 

It's a nice spot to eat that feels like you're "eating out", without having to feel uptight.
author: Francis A.

description:
I went there with a friend I hadn't seen in a while. We wanted to catch up, but I realized this wasn't really the place for that (too loud; granted we went around 7pm dinnertime). We shared three dishes - Seco de Costillas (braised boneless beef), Tartara de Tuna and Chicharron de Pollo. The quality of the food was generally pretty great. However, the Seco de Costillas was a way too salty for my tastes. They actually forgot our order for Chicharron de Pollo, but when we got it finally, it was really tasty. I would order that again for sure! 

Dessert was fantastic, however. I would go there for a drink and dessert definitely. (The panna cotta with sherbert and mint leaves)

The service was not something I would come back for - rather cool, almost minimal. That would have been fine as long as they didn't forget my chicken haha. 

Pretty okay, I would go there again if I had more money to casually spend.
author: Erica H.

description:
For me - a self-professed cilantro hater - to give Limon a four-star review speaks volumes for the restaurant.  I am NOT a Peruvian food fan, mainly because their star ingredient always seems to be . . .  the dreaded c-word. But Limon was SUCH a treat. I went here for my friend's birthday and had an excellent meal.

First off, they immediately told me that they could make any appetizer, salad, and entree with or without cilantro - music to my ears (and to my boyfriend's ears sine he loves that green poison!).  
We had a few of the ceviches which were simply delicious - clean, fresh, and fantastic (especially the namesake one).  We also had oyster shooters which had the perfect amount of spice.

The salads were simple but refreshing, and my FAVORITE dish of the evening was the red snapper.  WHOA.  If you eat that with all the fixings that they give you on the plate (coconut rice, spinach, special sauce), it's like a ratatouille-inspired fireworks display in your brain.

I didn't have a dessert but hopefully those were ok.  The drinks were good, but I think they should get a hard-liquor license.  And the service was friendly - no lasting bonds made, but no matter.  I also got to see right into the kitchen which I truly enjoyed.

SO, for all you cilantro-haters (or even those of you who aren't sure yet), if you want to try Peruvian food, don't mind spending a few extra buckies, LIMON is right up your alley.  

Enjoy!
author: Annie F.

description:
Thurs night here and it wasn't too crowded. Parking was a breeze! Very rare for this area. Sangrias were delish but not as amazing as Cha Cha Cha. 

Ceviche de Pescado--haven't had ceviche in awhile and this hit the spot!
Half chicken-it was good, nice and tender as is should be. But thats about it
Lomito-yummy! loved the strips of beef and veggies
author: Lola D.

description: Food is amazing as was our waiter. The bartender is a different story. We waited 5 mins at an empty bar top before we were given menus then the 2 gentleman standing next to us got their drinks before we did and ordered a minute after us. My friend didn't receive her drink and I ordered a grey goose dirty martini and received well vodka. I hate paying $10 for drinks that are made with $3 vodka. Our waiter and food turned our experience around but I would not sit at the bar ever again!
author: Heather B.

description:
The only place remotely open during the Spain soccer game....our waitress was super nice and funny, totally professional....my omelette was amazing and huge...my buddy's empanadas were delectable, but rather small...I only mention this because they were notably smaller (and similar in price) to my omelette. 

I never went here before the renovation, but am curious about dinner. What surprises are in store?
author: Sgtslut F.

description:
Totally sub-par in quality, presentation, and taste. 

YUMS
: Mango Mojo - mojito drink was pretty delish, but that's about it

UMS
: Tar-Tar appetizer - it's kind of hard to mess up tar-tar.

DUMS
: Red snapper with coconut rice - small fried bits with a spicy sauce - made no sense together and the taste was just whatever. The rice was dry, and lacked any substance. 
: Chicken skewers - dry, tasteless, tiny.  

Seems like the quality of this place has regressed. Won't be back by choice. I dunno - maybe it's just good for drinks and appetizers?
author: Jessica W.

description:
Gotta try this place.  It's not very big but somehow it worked for the large group that we came with.  Food was good.  It seemed like the portions were small but I ended up plenty full.  Must've been drinking too much Sangria.

I'd give it 3  1/2 stars if yelp would allow halves.

I'll definitely come back.
author: Colin S.

description:
Food is on the pricey side for Peruvian but very good... Best, the sangria!

But don't come if you're on a date, very loud and you'll have to ask your date to repeat themselves at least twice...
author: Cathy F.

description: So basically, its amazing, delicious, they offer just the right amount of fried food to make your belly happy :).
author: perla d.

description: Food is generally good here, but the crowds make the place less appealing.  The rotisserie chicken is pretty tender overall and the seasoning is delish.  The mac and cheese is awesome, as well as the cerviche de pescado.  I'm a fan of the Yucca fries dipped in the sauces.
author: Christine L.

description:
For the most part, I enjoy when chefs change up their menus.  I think it shows a depth of skill and an understanding of the restaurant.  But I DON'T like when all of a sudden, ALL of my favorite dishes are gone!  Such was my recent experience at Limon: most of the standard Peruvian comfort foods are either spruced up in cool-kid gear (rendering them overly complicated) or relegated to side-line dish wall-flowers, where you have to really know what you're looking for in order to find them. 

Fortunately, my very favorite sauce is still available, though now presented last on the list of side dishes: oh yeah, you know I'm talking about  the chicken breast in Adreso-Picante sauce.  Let me just tell you a little something about this sauce:

This is a sauce for which one orders extra bread for sopping up every last drop.  
This is the sauce over which one makes a disgusting pig of oneself.  
This is licking-the-bottom-of-the-bowl gooooood sauce!
This. Is. The. Sauce.

So, they still have the crack sauce.  That's good.  They've done away with my favorite dessert involving chocolate cake and cayenne pepper.  That's bad.  Although their new chocolate dessert does pose a strong runner up: molten chocolate cake with passion fruit mousse - delicious and decadent, good for sharing.

The wine list is great, and they boast some impressive ceviche options, but for some reason, I actually had trouble finding an entree that sounded good to me.  I ended up ordering two appetizers as a meal instead.

There are some amazing highs to be had at this restaurant, if you navigate the menu properly.  However, for the averageness of the rest of the fare, and the semi-high prices, and the hard to come by reservations,  I find I now have to give this restaurant a mid-range rating.
author: Ravena F.

description:
Great food! I mean amazing. The food was fresh & delicious. The Limon ceviche was wonderful as was the chicharron. OMG I am mexican and I have never had chicharron that i loved. My main course was lomo saltado - 5 stars.

On the downside. parking, very limited. They waiter charged the total amount of our parties total bill to my credit card, over 350$. Needless to say I was a pit peeved, I called and they took care of it right away but I would've expected a little gift certificate or something considering I am now have to wait for that $ to be put back into my account!

Food was amazing hands down! A must try.

* They said they'd take care of it right away, the next day my money was still not back in my account. I called back and the girl tells me that the manager is gone for 4 days due to the holidays, so I asked who "You mean to tell me there is no manager for the next 4 days" and she said yes.  I said well they charged over $300 to my account, someone needs to call me back. NO call back. I decided my kids deserve Christmas gifts for Christmas so because they had my money I couldn't buy them gifts. I decided to call my bank, they took my claim and I had my money back into my account within 2 hours. Its December 28th today and Limon has yet to call me back. They can deal with Chase.
author: Mirella M.

description: I wish I could give TEN stars for the service we received tonight ! We had to make last minute reservations for a group of ten and they were very helpful and made it for tonight at 8:30pm. At the last minute we had 2 other people show up and they were more than happy to accommodate us. The service was amazing !! Very friendly, fast, and super attentive although it was a busy busy Friday night. Loved the service team from tonight. Aside from the service, the food came out all at once after what seemed a few minutes and every single dish was delicious!! We ate everything we ordered except some of the perfectly cooked chicken since we ordered so many. At the end of the dinner they brought out the cake for the birthday girl and after she got cake slammed into her face the waiter brought out a wet towel to clean herself off and then a dry one. How sweet right?? I would DEF recommend this place! Cannot wait to go back! Thank you so much to the staff tonight for making my friends bday just that much better! Great Job!!
author: Gabe A.

description:
A group of us came here for a a New Years dinner and I was in heaven with the 4 course meal. :D 

I was blown away with the Ahi Tuna Starter, Filet Mignon and the rest of the unique dishes I tried that night. My glass of water was always filled as I empied it and the waiters were always attentive. One complaint, the medium rare filet Mignon my friend ordered, came out extremely rare.
author: Ashley C.

description:
Loved Loved Limon, I  have always been a fan of Frescas especially at west portal, but after one of my peruvian friends dragged me here, I was sold. The food is great and the prices are reasonable.  Makes me think they must be killing it at frescas.. But this place is alwasy packed. Prices are great for the food you get. 

 Only downside is it loud in there and boy is it hard to get a table wednesday nights and on. And the last time I was there the hostess was off about 15 or 20 minutes on how long i would take to get a table.
author: Patrick Q.

description:
Jesus christ the ceviche is good here. I would come here again and just order myself 3 plates of ceviche.

That said, some of the other dishes were a little disappointing. The oysters were decent, but I had to pick pieces of shell out of my mouth for almost every one I ate. They also weren't as fresh as other oysters I've had in the city (see: Waterbar). The calamari wasn't that crispy either. But god, that ceviche...

Another thing that bothered me was the service. I felt like the servers kept trying to push us out of the restaurant. They literally came by every 2 minutes to try to take our plates away, despite us repeatedly insisting that we weren't finished. Our check was brought out long before we would have asked for it, annnd they forgot our second order of happy hour oysters!

The ceviche is what makes this place for me, but if you're looking for $1 happy hour oysters, there are plenty of other places in the city to explore where the oysters and fresher and the food overall is better.
author: Lisa W.

description:
Half of the menu is dedicated to mixed drinks, but I'm pregnant, so I couldn't really partake in that part.  The restaurant does offer a variety of ceviches, small plates, larger plates and sides.  My husband got the cocktail de leche de tigre which was a ceviche made with a creamy sauce and served with big helping of cilantro foam and some fried calamari and shrimp.  He said it wasn't bad, it certainly looked pretty.  We also had the carne empanadas, which we enjoyed thoroughly.  The meat inside was plentiful and really well spiced.
I also ordered a side of yuca fries, but they were in desperate need of salt.  We also enjoyed the arroz con mariscos which is their version of a paella.  This was my favorite dish; the rice was the perfect texture, all the seafood was cooked perfectly and the seafood flavors were spot on.
Our dinning friends got the truffle mac-n-cheese, which was eaten before I got to try, so I'm assuming that's a good sign.  I did get to try the short ribs and the beef heart, both of which were good.  The short ribs were not very "Peruvian" though, they tasted more like something you'd get at any decent American restaurant.
Service was fine, our water glasses were constantly being filled and the server was extremely attentive, if not overly attentive.  I think we might have overstayed our welcome, he repeatedly checked in on our table.  It was a busy night though...
author: Lucy H.

description:
I generally don't round up to a 4 when a place warrants a 3.5 but I felt like Limon was worthy of the round up only because their scallops in my arroz con marisco was the surprisingly one of the better scallops I've ever had. Maybe I got them on a good night as the previous reviews state they were over cooked. But tonight, the scallops on my plate melted in my mouth. 

My OTHER boyfriend and I ventured to Limon by accident. We wanted to go the The Limon Rotisserie and made open table reservations here instead. No biggie, I've been wanting to try their ceviche. We got their ceviche limon (mixto), camarones, and pescado. Their ceviche was good but it didn't wow me. Their vegetarian empanada was actually more impressive. The spinach, mushroom, and cheese were the perfect blend even though the shell was a bit on the greasy side. 

For the main course my dinner date had the lomo saltado and I had the paella dish. The rest of the paella was nice. It wasn't dry like the Spanish version of it but somewhat moist, which I gave it a risotto like texture. I actually like this version better. The lomo was chewy but seasoned very well. 

Overall, Limon was a pleasant dining experience and is worth to try.
author: Wendy L.

description:
After a long day's work, we decided to eat here...with 15 minutes left of:

HAPPY HOUR!

In a hunger frenzy, I ordered:

Oyster Shooter - shucked oyster in a shot of their "leche de tigre", which tasted like a mini bloody ceasar to me...yummm

Ceviche Pescado - very good, fresh flavor, and a nice spice...we practically drank the juices...this was our favorite

Empanadas (veggie) - good for veggies, earthy flavor from the mushroom

Empanadas (carne) - even better flavor than the veggie, though the finish was a bit salty

Costillas Nikkei - crispy spare ribs with Peruvian style slaw and rocoto-soy sauce...the ribs kept the bite on the bone, but cooked just long enough for the meat to completely tear off

For drinks we ordered the Strawberry Mojito and the Mango Mojito. I liked the strawberry flavored one for the strawberry sour liqueur that was added. I like the mango for the subtle flavor. Both were not made too sweet which made it refreshing. No water was served during the meal. Water finally came after I ordered dessert.

All the food arrived in a timely manner, within the first 10 minutes, three of the dishes filled the table, and the ribs arrived last. Our server checked on our table several times. The one criticism I had is how the servers attempt to clear dishes out once the last piece of food is off the plate. I HATE THAT! Maybe I want to sop up some of the sauce for my last bite...but we would never know because YOU TOOK THE PLATE AWAY.

For dessert I ordered the Mango Panna Cotta. I have never ordered panna cotta in a restaurant before; I only made it at home. So when it arrived, it felt more on the flan side, a little more dense than I was familiar with, but less yellow than flan custard. I did enjoy the Strawberry Sorbet that accompanied it, which sorbets are usually my dessert of choice. The cinnamon tuile was anything but...it looked like a chocolate almond brittle cookie that was very thick and hard to bite. I ate through half of it, but was worried I was going to break a tooth.
author: Verissa S.

description:
The food was great!! It was my first experience with Peruvian food. I have always heard great things and I am now a fan. Drink wise...the mango mojito and sangria are very good. 

For appetizers the chicharron de pollo is a must have!! I grew up on chicarrones but I've never had anything like these before. The empanadas were ok. You can save your calories and skip these. Try the ceviche!! The seafood was fresh! As a main dish I had the Churrasco a la Parilla. It was very good. Most of our party had the Lomo Saltato and they loved it. For dessert try the profiteroles. Not too sweet and it's a good closing to a great meal. 

Parking is very hard so give yourself plenty of time because you will not be seated until your whole party is there. There is a parking garage about a block away but it does get full. Be careful if you use more than one credit card when the bill comes. The two cards we used were charged for the wrong amounts even thought the signed copies were correct so keep your receipt and watch your statements.
author: Elo N.

description:
I am so satisfied with Limon!!! The restaurant itself is very nice, clean and modern and the food tastes fresh and full of flavor. I also always enjoy being able to see the kitchen (which in this case is open and if you sit in the top floor you get a phenomenal view of the chefs in action).
First time I went for dinner I had the snapper, which was delicious and beautifully presented (whole fish).  Second time I went for brunch - seriously, the best brunch I've had in a long time and the prices were very reasonable.
See you soon Limon!!
author: Mrs. G.

description:
There are some places that can treat you like shit and you'll keep going back because they are otherwise amazing. This is not the case with Limon.

I like to believe that reservations mean that a table will be ready and waiting for your party at or near the time of the reservation. Apparently, my definition is wrong wrong wrong.

We had reservations for 7pm for a group of 7. At 7pm, we had all arrived and were sitting in the "lounge" area, chatting away and giving well-wishes to the birthday girl. We realize we've been waiting a while, and look at the clock. It's 7:36. We are still in the lounge. And there are people walking right in and being seated. If they all had reservations, the restaurant must have been backed up since 1pm with the number of people they sat in front of us. We had finally, after over 30 minutes, been offered drinks. Great. Lovely. Please, bring us drinks and then forget the birthday girl's drink. You will? Oh thank you. Just what she wanted.

At 7:50, we ask if we could just eat in the lounge. They allow us this small convenience, and we push together a few of the tiny tables and all hunker down to look at the menus. We are offered water. We say yes please to the water. Many minutes later, the waitress comes back and tells us that they're "working on our water." Excuse me? What does that even mean? Where in the universe is this water coming from that it has to be worked on and we still don't receive it for another few minutes after that clever announcement? Is there only one person that can pour water? A few minutes after we receive water, we receive BREAD! Yes! We have now been at the restaurant for over an hour and we have gotten in 1 drink order, bread, and water. 

Shortly before we receive our food almost 2 hours after our slated reservation, we are offered to sit at a table. Considering this is a staff that has to work on things such as water, we did not want to confuse them as we were hungry and close to having this birthday party Donner party style. So, we suffered at the cramped tables. I have back problems. Thank you, Limon, for adding on to my chiropractic bills.

The sangria was delicious. The chicken was tasty, but chicken all the same. And, the truffle-infused macaroni and cheese was divine. Not technically divine. I think if the truffles were plucked from the Elysian fields by the gods themselves, the mac n cheese still would not have made up for the horrible service.

After we had food, we waited far too long for the check. I considered faking a seizure, but I doubted it would get us any attention.

It was now 9:30. We are late for the second half of the birthday celebration. The manager brings out two desserts which are flour-based (we'd made it clear that the birthday girl and another in our party could not have gluten) and 7 spoons. Are you fucking kidding me?

Thanks Limon, for giving me more reason to hate.
author: Patricia E.

description:
Went there with a party of 11 on a Saturday night with a reservation.  When we arrived, they were extremely busy and very disorganized.  It took 15 minutes just to get a hold of the hostess and we didn't get seated for another hour and half.  Now,that's a long wait with a reservation!  The manager finally aplogized and sent over a few apps.

The food was okay... nothing spectacular.  We had the Ceviche Limon, Grilled Ocotopus and a Peruvian Sashimi combo with Ahi, Snapper and Ono.  The grilled chicken with sweet potato fries (complimentary) were good, but also not extraordinary. 

Given the long wait and the chaos for just okay food, I don't think I will be back anytime soon.
author: Paul K.

description:
Oh sigh, what a dump. I had really high hopes for it, but I guess I'm just a spoiled bitchy birthday princess who thinks reservations count for something. I'm just silly like that.

Got a reservation for 7 people at 7 p.m. on a Sunday. Sure, 7 is a weird number for a party, likely to require a specific seating arrangement that may require 2 tables near each other to vacate simultaneously so we could accommodate everyone. WHICH IS WHY WE MADE A RESERVATION. I feel like we did our part to make this arrangement work.

We arrived a bit early and waited in the lounge for the rest of the party. Now, when I arrive early, I have NO PROBLEM waiting for my reservation time. When the rest of my party isn't there yet, I have NO PROBLEM waiting for the rest of them before we sit down. I also have NO PROBLEM being offered a drink while I wait. Guess which of those things didn't happen? And if it had been, say, 10 minutes until we got a table, it wouldn't have been a big deal. But after 45 minutes elapsed and we hadn't even been offered beverages, it seemed like something was wrong.

A party of 3 was sharing the lounge with us. They also had a 7:00 res that was being ignored. At least they got drinks. 

Multiple times during this wait, my friend asked the hostess and the manager on the floor when our table was going to be available. "Soon! Someone's leaving right about now!" Which means "if we tell you something, you'll eventually shut up." 

FINALLY the extremely green server came by (no apology for ignoring us) to get our drink orders. We were finally offered drinks as we waited. After being there for 45 minutes. On my goddamn birthday. And the server FORGOT MY DRINK. ON MY GODDAMN BIRTHDAY.

It's 8:00 by now. We pulled the manager over and he gave some windy excuse about "well, there were *people* who showed up without, you know, reservations *on the actual books* and they *had to be* accommodated." So because we are the mere hoi polloi with one of those lowly "on the books" reservations, we don't get a table. OK then, we're eating in the lounge. They obliged: brought us dinner menus in the lounge, shoved all the little tables together, and we ate there.

We got water at 8:10 p.m. *fucking tap water* took 70 minutes to get to us. Perhaps they were waiting for the iceberg to melt.

We got our entrees at 8:50. I balanced by plate on my lap. On my - that's right - goddamn birthday.

How was the food? Completely delicious. Ceviche, octopus, porkchop - all great though a bit too salty. Which wouldn't have been a problem if my water glass had been refilled. My dining companions loved their snapper, chicken and mac & cheese. So yeah, the food's tasty.

The manager brought us two tiny desserts in a lame attempt to make amends. Wow, asshole, thanks for the cakes that I can't even eat. Thanks for 2 fucking desserts for 7 pissed-off people. Can I shove those up your tight ass? No? Then I'm sending your pitiful gesture back.

We had to ask for our bill 3 times. During this time, we thought quite seriously about a dine & dash. They don't want to take our orders, and it doesn't appear like they want us to pay, either. It was $300 for 7 people. They forgot to put a couple of our drinks on our bill, but that was an oversight and not a comp. Thanks, fuckers.

This is the only time in my life I haven't tipped waitstaff. It was abysmal service. 

Lessons learned:
*awesome ceviche!
*I'm not important enough for Limon to honor my reservation!
*I should have brought my own booze! And gone across the street to La Cumbre and gotten my own food, too!
*I'm never coming back here EVER EVER AGAIN.

When will the hype die? Because this shithole ain't worth it. 

Thanks for ruining my birthday, Limon!
author: Polly Enmity P.

description:
Great place for date night....get a window seat!

More of a 3.5!

Must order:
Ceviche Nikkei de Atun!  ahi tuna in YUM sauce w/sesame seeds - our favorite for sure!

Insider tips:
Order yoru Sangria by the GLASS, its cheaper than the pitcher :)

Left happy and giggly  hearts - aww
author: Jana S.

description:
I realized I hadn't written a review for Limon when the truffled mac and cheese showed up in my dreams last night.

Limon is known for their chicken, both at the rotisserie and the Valencia location. So, I ordered the Pollo Latino - it was great. Sometime I think chicken is bland and boring, but not here. Seasoned nicely, moist, and came with a side of mushroom mash potatoes and red wine demiglaze. I can't image what they offer at the rotisserie if this was so good.

Ceviche - large selection, we opted for the Ceviche Limon as suggested by our waitress. The initial bites were great, but towards the end got too tart for my taste. I wish they had served this with bread or something to off set the acidity of the citrus.

As earlier mentioned: Truffled mac and cheese. For only $6 as a side, just go ahead and order it. So good, creamy, rich, and delectable - unlike some mac and cheese it wasn't greasy at all and you didn't find that at the bottom of your bowl was all the sitting oil.

Liked, suggested this for my works Fine Diners Club, will be back in a couple weeks!
author: Nicole L.

description:
Last night, Mari C. and I embarked on one hell of a date night.

Prior to being her +1 at the Eat, Drink and be Gamey Yelp Elite night (because i'm not elite- NUDGE NUDGE, HINT HINT), MC had the brilliant foresight to swing by Limon for a small bite (because apparently acquiring food at these said events is a feat in itself)

Let's just say, MC's a cheap ass date.  $9 later, we had split a quarter of the most succulent roasted chicken I've ever had along with 2 side dishes of a salad and some amazing yam fries with dipping sauce.

Service was fast, attentive, and friendly- they didn't at all seem to mind we were hoggin a 2-top for $9 worth of grub.  (Granted it was 5:30pm and there were about 3 people total in the place)

I would have given 3 stars for the sake of coming back and adding some more, but the hostess' gorgeous Latina Farah Fawcett hair at the front is worth a star alone.  Makes me miss my long locks...

Cannot wait to come back for more!
author: Gabrielle J.

description:
My cousin and I ate here on Peruvian Independance Day. Of course, we were running late and missed our reservation. Regardless, when we arrived, the hostess immediately started setting up a table upstairs for us. We decided to sit at the bar for dinner, since the place was pretty quiet at the time. The bartender (who was also our server) was very nice and patient while we asked all sorts of questions about the menu. He even added an extra shot to a drink when we asked!

We started with the Tiradito de Pescado which was delicious. The empanada de carne filling was a combination of sweet and savory in a really light dough. We just had to try the Lomo Saltado (steak over fries), which was good, but not the best we've ever had.

Overall, a great dining experience. Excellent service, good people watching, decent menu with lots of options for everyone (even vegetarians), and strong drinks!
author: Rachel C.

description:
First date with a girl here.  Now my girlfriend.  

One would say that should deserve 5-stars...but it wasn't the best Peruvian food I've ever had.

Key takeaway:  bring a girl here and close the deal.
author: Yup S.

description:
I didn't expect this place to be packed on Sunday at 3:30 pm, but it was. Although, Groupons such as mine were expiring in a day, so that could have accounted for the ridiculously huge brunch crowd. 

Anyhow, I had a reservation for 2, but my friend was going to be late and likely not going to eat. So I told the two girls at the front that it was just me. I got the usual "Please tell us when your whole party is here and we can seat you." Well, it might just be me and even if my friend shows up, I'm the only one eating. "We cannot seat you until your whole party is here." Well, what if I change the reservation to one person?

Wow, it was like a deer caught in headlights. The hostesses seemed absolutely dumbfounded. Party of one? Does that exist? There was a long period of silence. Finally, one of them came out of her stupor and said she could seat me. 

So after that, everything went smoothly. I've eaten here before, but for dinner. I've never ordered the hot plates like Lomo Saltado. Soggy french fries with a beef stir fry is just not my thing. I didn't even eat it when I was actually in Peru. No, I'm all about the ceviche. But I knew it wouldn't be very filling, so I ordered the causa and veggie empanada as well. 

The ceviche mixto was a fresh mix of fish, calamari, and shrimp. The causa was filled with a chicken salad that was a bit chewy. I prefer the traditional causa filled with tuna or crab. The empanada was filled with butternut squash, zucchini, corn and carrots. The rocoto dipping sauce was tasty, the empanada itself was a bit salty.

My friend eventually showed up, so the couple seated next to me finally stopped staring at me. Yes, I am enjoying a meal by myself!! Is there something wrong with that?

So 3 stars: they don't have a full liquor license so no pisco sours. How can you have Peruvian without  a Pisco? The Soju sour was a nice try, but not quite the same. The price was as expected for a place like this. The food was good but not exceptional. If you want exceptional, check out La Mar.
author: Ai S.

description:
4 stars for my second favorite Peruvian joint in SF!  (Hey, second place to La Mar is still very, very good.)

Food = 4.  The trio of ceviche was an excellent intro to dinner.  Two of the three had awesome heat and the third was tart and fresh.  We kept the fish theme going with the fried calamari for course numero dos.  My entree was the seafood paella and my boyfriend had the chicken skewers with a side of truffle-infused mac & cheese.  We left full and happy.

Service = 4.  The servers were very friendly, attentive and knowledgeable about the menu items.   The kitchen turned out the food on time and hot.

Atmosphere = 4.  Limon's modern dining room is very hip with local artists' work hanging on the wall.  There is an open kitchen where you can see the action happen.
author: Eddie L.

description:
The three cerviche dishes were excellent, especially the Limon Cerviche, their signature dish.  But we also had the beef dish, Lomo Saltado, wich was disappointing.  The cuts of beef were low quality and tough, as well as overcooked, as were the onions and potatoes.  The dessert, Profiteroles, was great.  The initial service was slow, it took quite a while to get our drink order which was just sangria and one pisco sour. 

Got to say the Lomo Saltado at Fresca is better.
author: J H.

description:
Came here for lunch using a Groupon certificate and found that just about every table had one printed out or stored on their iPhones. I was among my kind: driven to trying new things by a good deal.

Food:

1) Chicken skewers with sweet potato fries: tasty and succulent. $8 for three tiny skewers. A bit overpriced but the flavors and quality compensated for this, but just barely.

2) Lomo Saltado: tasty, well-prepared and of substantial portion. Bastardized version for American brunch menu by coming with two sunny-side up eggs. A hit. $14.

3) Picante de Mariscos: creamy soup with decidedly more calamari (skimping on the pricier ingredients for sure) than anything else. Two pieces each of shrimp and mussels. Flavors and quality again made up for relatively small serving. But again, just barely. $12.

4) Mojito: Terrific and sizeable. $9.

Service: 3.5 stars. Server seemed slammed but did her best to pay attention to each table and updated us on the status of our orders. Skewers were served relatively quickly as an appetizer whereas the entrees came out about 30+ minutes later. Minus one star. 

Also not good: I spied another diner having the seafood stew and he had a substantially larger serving, including a crableg. Minus one star. Consistence is key.

I'm glad to have tried this place but don't know if I'd return, considering the issues above. This was for lunch/brunch and the dinner prices are considerably higher (for which/because I definitely won't be coming back).

I'm still smarting from the absent crableg.

P.S. I've been to Peru and the food here is definitely tweaked to suit local tastes, but in a refreshing way.
author: Es E.

description: Love the rotisserie chicken and the Yucca fries here.  Quality can vary from time to time and there are always a long line. Overall I would recommend this place for a group of friends.
author: Larry C.

description:
I like Limon--the food and atmosphere are lovely.  And I know there are cockroaches in the city and that they appear even in the nicest restaurants.

BUT WHEN YOU POINT OUT THE COCKROACH ON THE WALL NEXT TO YOUR HEAD AND THE HOSTESS IGNORES IT FOR TEN MINUTES BEFORE FINALLY COMING OVER AND SQUISHING IT WITH A NAPKIN....!?!?!?

Well, when I lived in New York, you'd get your desert for free for that.
author: Keetje K.

description:
Everything was great. Yuca. Ceviche. Lamb Shank. Bandido. Everything. :)

Also, the Soju Sour is a great alternative to the Pisco Sour!
author: Sahir S.

description:
Came here to celebrate a friend's Dirty Thirty. We had a party of 20 and was told we would be sat together. When we got there we were in fact seperated but it wasn't anything to complain about. Twenty people is a lot of people to seat at a single table.

I feel Limon has more to offer in their ceviches and apps than they do their entrees. I had their Limon shooter which was awesome. A lot of fresh seafood and you can taste every component of it. Would definately recommend the Ceviche Limon and the Ceviche de Pescado but I wasn't a fan of the Ceviche de Camarones.

For the appetizers, we went with the Parihuela and the Calamares Rellenos. The parihuela was amazing. Full of flavor and reminded me much of a cioppino. The stuffed calamari I passed on to let the other guests at my table get full on while I did damage to the parihuela.

For entrees, sitting at a table of 8 you would think there would be a mix of selections but it turns out I had the only different dish from the others. I ordered the lomo saltado and everyone else had the grilled ribeye. The ribeye was cooked perfectly but it is what it is. A grilled ribeye. The lomo saltado was amazing. A little bit on the salty side but when combined with the rice it was just ridiculous. Had a side of the mac n cheese and it was good but undercooked, and I don't mean al dente.

Limon, I'll be back for the great ceviches.
author: Eric L.

description: Fantastic chicken. I wish they gave you a little more of the aji sauce and sides (I don't think they adjust for the size of the party), but otherwise, the second best Peruvian I've had
author: Brian R.

description:
The one star is for the food. That is, this place would get negative stars for the service and management, but the food was excellent and that brings it up to one star.

Our birthday party/evening was seriously affected by the wait staff management here.  Our 7pm reservation for 7 people was ignored, apparently the hostess just kept seating people in front of us and "forgot"?  At 7:45 I asked what the situation looked like and she said that she was waiting for tables to turn over.  I asked her, "multiple tables"?  Apparently she hadn't even started the process of allocating two tables to be put together, but was still giving priority to other folks.

At 8pm, they offered to serve us in the waiting area. At 8:50pm our food finally arrived, in the waiting area.  By this point, the rest of the restaurant had largely emptied out, so you would expect that the service would get a little better.  As our dinner was being served, and the restaurant was largely empty, they offered to move us to a regular table.  At this point, given the delays in service, lost drink orders, lack of refills on things as simple as water, we respectfully declined, because we didn't want anything more to confuse them.

Our group ordered the whole fish, which was very good - 8/10.
The pork dish was very good - 8/10. The chicken dish--the chicken was unimpressive, the peppers were great. The mac and cheese that was served with the chicken dish was a 12 out of 10.  Absolutely fantastic and to die for.

You would think that with the reservation screw up they would pay attention to making the rest of the experience good, but follow on service was absent, food was slow to arrive, drink service was nearly absent.

I have no idea how so many incompetent service experiences could happen at the same time.  Mistakes happen in the business, and how someone reacts to those mistakes is the kind of thing that builds customer loyalty.  In this case, the management's response was slow, poor, and did absolutely nothing to repair our faith in this establishment.

At the end, the manager offered us *two* cake based deserts for the seven people in our party -- which was amusing in itself, since two of our party, including the birthday girl, specifically asked which items on the menu were gluten free.

I have never been so disappointed with the service and callous inattention at a restaurant.  The kitchen is excellent, but the management of this restaurant should be terminated with extreme prejudice.  We will not return despite the heavenly mac and cheese.

Reading other yelp reviews, clearly this restaurant has a history of ignoring or screwing up reservations.  The management simply doesn't care.  There are other great places to go in the Mission.

Thanks Limon for screwing up our friend's birthday.
author: Paul T.

description:
why do people keep coming here despite craptastic service?  the food is pretty and tasty.  the drinks are also pretty and tasty.  the clientele is generally pretty and i suspect if you licked them they too might prove tasty.  like many who complain herein my party's experience was one of being ignored in every possible way by the waitstaff and finding they and the management blatantly unapologetic about it.  it was so bad it was almost funny ... except it wasn't.  i was almost too annoyed to notice the food was good.

it is my wild fantasy that Limon's kitchen staff will someday go rogue, ditch their heinous/good-for-nothing waitstaff/management and begin operating out of a repurposed taco truck on the streets of the Mission.  also, that they will abandon the ridiculous/superfluous accent in the name - was there really any risk of folks calling it LY-mon?
author: Dani B.

description:
Great casual place to eat with some friends. Came here just last week for post Christmas pre new years shindig, and ordered a couple of my favorite things:


Ceviche mixto: I really like ceviche, and I think the one they have here is very fresh, with the juices complimenting each other. I had it last time at a different Limon (on valencia) and the sauce was really tart, but it was good this time.
the chicken: Moist tender juicy chicken cut 8 ways to split with my three friends and I. It's great for sharing as a first or a main course, and it doesn't hurt that it comes with two sides already.
Tacutacu: I personally like their rice dish mixed with vegetables, but some people may think it's kind of soggy or mushy. In my opinion it has great flavors that complement the chicken (but what do I know i'm a chinese guy in a peruvian restaurant)
Sweet potato fries: nothing to write home about, they're pretty standard fare. Only regret is they don't really offer ketchup for this, but the chicken does come with three sauces on the side (again- see remark above)
We also had this disk with steak and fries, and it kind of reminded me of a poutine. It was really saucy, given that it was steak on a bed of fries and bell peppers and onions. Although I was at first wary, it turned out to be a great dish, and was my favorite that day.
We also splurged and had the dessert- the panna cotta and the chocolate lava cake. The panna cotta was spot on as a light dessert to end the meal. The lava cake was kind of thick, and although looked and smelled like a chocolate lava cake, didn't really have a "chocolaty" taste...
author: Derrick C.

description:
I went to this place twice within a week, cuz the first I had is at Limon on Van Ness, it was a wonderful wonderful experience. So I decided to go again but I went to the one on Valencia. The food is still good, but not as good as I had at the other store, but also I ordered different dishes, so it's hard to compare. 
I gave it two stars (I was thinking to give one actually) because their horrible horrible horrible service. The guy who served our table is not polite, didn't answer my friend's questions, everything about him was soooooo bad, and that totally affected our appetite for enjoying food. What worse is when we wanted to order dessert (The dessert is also another reason I wanted to come back again, it was so good at the one on Van Ness) they actually ran out of some ingredient, but they didn't let us know. When the dessert came, I noticed that there's something missing, I asked the server, he just laughed said sorry, we ran out of it, but next time you come, I will make sure there's cookie........... and he laughed again, like its funny. I can accept the fact that sometimes the restaurant ran out of something, but their attitude totally piss us off. I will never come to this restaurant again. I really wish they will change their attitude.
The two stars, one is given to food, the other one is given to the lady who is standing at the front desk.
author: Vicki F.

description:
Dropped in on around 11am one weekend and  they were full. But we were able to snag a seat at the bar. 

Empanada Don Walter Pastry filled with sautéed beef, onion, olives, raisins and eggs served with rocoto cream sauce 2 stars. huge chucks of olives and too salty.  

We also had some seafood omlette which was pretty good. I'd give it a solid 3 stars. 

The drinks were amazing - couldn't taste the alcohol.  The bartender told us they were made with sake and promised it would sneak up on us. And she was right. 4 stars. 

Overall, a solid 3.
author: Milly S.

description:
I had a really good experience here. We sat down after being hesitant we couldn't get a table. Jokingly, we looked up to the top and said to ourselves, "it'd be hilarious if we got the entire upstairs to ourselves." After the hostess took us up into the recesses of the upstairs, we realized our own clairvoyance.

As we sat down, the waiter immediately asked if wanted sangria. +1 because he asked and +1 because he overheard us say we wanted it. The sangria was awesome. We browsed the menu, came up with our list: ceviche, chicken, empanadas.

Then, we asked the waiter for his opinion. He riddled off the same list we had created ourselves. We pat ourselves on the back and said, "So it shall be."

Highlights include: ceviche, potato with chicken, and the pork. Overall, a completely enjoyable meal.
author: Terry H.

description:
Had a great time here last weekend.  Great food, great company... what else could you ask for? We stayed there for three hours... time flies when you're having a good time. When we were leaving every staff member said good night (prob b/c they were happy we finally left as we were almost the last customers remaining)

Here's what we had:
-Trio de Ceviches (i liked the rocoto cream sauce)
-Rib eye (it was ok for me, not as tender as I expected. i would have liked more chimichurri also)
-Crispy whole red snapper (talk about presentation!! it also tasted good. i liked the coconut rice it came w/ also)
-Arroz con mariscos (the portion was a bit small for the price, but still delicious)
-Mac & Cheese w/ truffles (yeah i know... mac and cheese at a Peruvian restaurant? but it was good!)
-Pan seared scallops with froie gras (this was my favorite!)

Dessert:
-Bread Pudding (i think it had passion fruit and mangos... my friends loved this one. i'm sure if we were at home the plate would have been licked clean)
-warm chocolate cake (i'm not a huge chocolate lover but this was good.  i devoured the rice pudding like item that accompanied the chocolate cake. makes me want to cook up some rice pudding now)
author: Alice C.

description: Walked in and of course busy but one of the two servers pointed at a empty table for us to sit.
