Even if this wasn't exactly a big portion of the meal, it was strangely one of my faves. I automatically fell in love with the dipping sauce that accompanied the bread. I'm not exactly sure what was in it (crack perhaps?), but we had to ask our server for seconds. Sometimes I ponder if one could just go into a restaurant and eat these free appetizers and leave? Because if that were the case, I wouldn't mind dropping by Limon just to get some of that saucy goodness.

Anyway, for the main entrees, he had the Pollo Latino while I had the Quinotto de Hongos (Quinoa & Wild Mushroom Risotto, Grilled  Vegetables, Truffle Infusion). I'm the type of person who eats with their eyes first, so when my plate arrived, I couldn't help but think of dessert already because my meal looked tiny. However, when I took the first bite to my meal, I felt like I was in heaven. Although the presentation itself looked small and simple, everything about my dish was amazing! The flavors were just right and surprisingly, despite how my eyes had fooled me, I was more than satisfied and full by the end of my meal. I couldn't even make room for dessert :( But it's okay, that's what next time's for.

I like almost everything about Limon, but sometimes it's hard to have a great time during dinner when you have to yell over each other amidst all the noise. It's so noisy inside Limon that we were practically yelling to each other instead of having a normal conversation. At one point we even thought about texting each other from across the table. But nonetheless, if you're looking for amazing food, Limon definitely can provide you with that.
author: Ally C.

description: The ceviche is really, really good. The vegetarian empanadas are also good, but not the best I've had. Good service and strong cocktails make this place a winner for after work dinner and drinks.
author: Shira O.

description:
Hip and Trendy, Beautiful Presentation, Yummy but a bit Overpriced.

A group of friends invited me out to dinner on Friday night to Limon.  We arrived at 9:00 and the restaurant was very busy with good energy, smells, and sounds coming from throughout.  The decor is quite hip and modern, and it's extremely loud - our group of 6 had to practically yell to hear each other, and it was clear that our waiter had difficulty hearing us to take our orders.

The Trio de Ceviche was quite tasty and fresh, with really interesting sauce and fish variations.  The Pargo Rojo (red snapper) had beautiful presentation and was tasty, but felt overbattered and heavy.  The Lomo Saltado (Wok-tossed sirloin) was also really yummy, but overburdened with butter and salt.

The wine list was pretty limited, especially if you're looking for something other than Malbec.  We did find a Tempranillo/Grenache that was quite lovely.  The waiter treated the opening and tasting as an unnecessary waste of time, which I sort of agree with but I've never had a waiter do that in any restaurant.  

Overall with a round of drinks, bottle of wine, appetizers and main courses, the bill came to about $50 per person, which is not bad for a hip and trendy place, but felt overpriced (especially to those at the table who had just returned from Peru where authentic Lomo Saltado was $3 per serving).  An unjust comparison, to be sure.
author: Kraig M.

description:
We started with the Cerviche Limon and Cerviche de Camarones.  The cerviche limon was a delicious mix of fresh fish, calamari and shrimp.  The cerviche de camarones was large prawns with a tasty acidic sauce.   His Lomo Saltado (top sirloin stir-fried with onions, tomatoes, fries & topped with two sunny side-up eggs)  was so tender and flavorful.  My Anticucho de Pollo (grilled chicken skewers with sweet potato fries & aji amarill-huacatay sauce) was a tad bit on the dry side.  I actually found myself picking off of his plate.  ( I know how you gentemen love that *wink* )  The meal totaled to approximately $60.

The highlight of the meal:  The $5 mimosa special & the fresh cerviche.   Just thinking about the cerviche is making my mouth water =)
author: E C.

description:
If you haven't been, go now!
I went with a group of 10 on a Tuesday night.  We had a reservation.  We were immediately sat upstairs.  The service was excellent all night!!  We had full water glasses, were able to order drinks, food, and whatever we needed at any time, and got our food no more than 15 minutes after the order!  And, we were a high maintenance table, a lot of people with allergies or dietary restrictions. The staff was so cool in explaining what was in all the dishes and answering our questions!
The food is excellent, just awesome!  Small dishes that you can mix and match, and great prices.  I had the leche ceviche, a little $5 ceviche dish to just get a good taste of some nice seafood, it was great!  I also had the steak and tomato dish, that was yummy!  $10 for plenty of steak and a side of sweet potato fries!
We went to the Mission location, it's small but has a nice bar with probably 10-15 seats, a dozen or so tables downstairs and some large tables upstairs.  Upstairs there's also another bar, I would imagine you could rent out the whole area for a large party.
Like I said, if you haven't been, go.  Good stuff!!
author: Stephanie J.

description: The place was packed, they luckily could take our party of 6 without a reservation, and the service was excellent (especially the hostess Friday night, December 30th)!
author: Daniel F.

description:
As for the stars, this was a really tough call. I would certainly give it 3.5/4 stars for the food - delicious ceviche, yummy mojitos, good risotto, etc. However, for service and ambiance, I have to keep it a 3.

I brought my mom here last weekend, and we could hardly hear each other speak, much less enjoy ourselves. SOMETHING needs to be done about the high ceilings, stark non-sound-absorbing materials, and vast space encompassing the tables. It would be a TERRIBLE place for a date or any kind of intimate conversation, and with the loud table next to us, where one girl proceeded to stand up and clap periodically throughout dinner to emphasize her point, Limon managed to induce a migraine, even though this was one weekend where I wasn't actually already suffering from one. Needless to say, it will take a lot to get me back.

That said, their sangria is also good. But I'll stick to Limon Rotisserie. Somehow, it's less loud...
author: Sally M.

description: Love this place! It is my new favorite. I went early in the evening before it was packed and service was quick. The empanadas were so good that we ordered a second round. Nice ambiance, too. Parking might be difficult given the location, but well worth a little walk.
author: Nichole F.

description: Food here is great! A group of 6 of us ordered 6 different items on the menu and shared each dish. We loved them all!
author: Sally K.

description:
There was a little mix up here, and my friend thought we were going to Limon Rotisserie.  We actually made reservations here and were a little surprised by what we found (not in a bad way).

Walking in, the place has a very cool, loungy and trendy vibe.  The hostess was very nice and the service was overall very friendly.  That's always a plus in my book.  We headed up to our table upstairs which was a bit quieter.  It definitely felt a lot more comfortable than if we were to sit next to the bar.

We decided to start the night off with some sangria, which was really good!  Very refreshing.  I wanted to give their oyster shooter a try and I'm glad I did.  I don't know if I would get it again ($3) for a shot of oysters, but it was tangy and light.  On to the main course: Ribeye steak.  Steak was cooked perfectly, medium rare.  I couldn't tell what was on it, but the spices mixed very well with each other.  My buddy had mac and cheese on his side but I ended up eating probably half of it.  Big fan.

Good service, good food and I would probably come back, but not too soon.  "money ain't a thang" doesn't apply to me.
author: Tom Y.

description: It was a perfect sunny & warm day in San Francisco and this was a great place to go to in the Mission District.   Even if it was a cold winter day, I can see this being a  great spot to go to for comfort food.  The space is nice with a full bar and you can sit towards to the window and take in the sunlight and bustle of the outdoor crowd.  I started with the El Matador cocktail and it was delicious.  They also have a list of sours and I tasted my friend's sour and it was pretty awesome.  There is a good selection of ceviche which I love.  Since the spot was famous for the chicken, we ordered a half chicken, the steak with fries, and ceviche.  The sides were Yuka Fries and sauteed vegetables.  Everything was so delicious and they provide a trio of sauces that I put on everything.  I would definitely come back!
author: Neville B.

description:
An old hungry man is walking through the Mission.  Talking to himself.  Mumbling something like "I would really like some good, unpretentious comfort food that has flair and style".  Thank goodness, I looked up and there was Limon.  It had closed for a fire and now it has returned, better than ever.   A cheerful greeting at the door, and as it is early I am seated immediately.  Even without a reservation.  Good service.  And much better than good food.  Very good food that is quite inexpensive for what you get. A bargain.

An appetizer of meaty, crispy spare ribs is accompanied by cole slaw.  Not that milky type of cole slaw.  Rather cole slaw with some vinegar to it that pairs perfectly with the perfectly prepared ribs.  Yummy.

A main of crispy fried snapper is great.  Lightly breaded.  Not at all greasy.  Accompanied by some fried rice and greens dressed with a bit of vinegar.  More great comfort food.  More yummy.  

Great price.  Great service. Great food. Great to find Limon open in the Mish once again.
author: David D.

description:
This place was awesome. We had a large group, and they were very helpful in re-seating us, being patient while we waited for straggling group members, and answering all of our questions.
We ordered what felt like half the menu to be shared family style, which was great. I loved everything I tried: snapper, paella, empanadas, coconut rice, beet salad, fries...
We also ordered one of each of the desserts which were also excellent. 
I would highly recommend this place to anyone who wants amazing food. It was great to go as a group, and be able to order a bunch of things to share.
author: Kayte B.

description:
As soon as you walk in, your taste buds will begin to overflow with salivation. Not freakin' kidding! 

I came to wine and dine with a bunch of girlfriends for some pre-bachelorette partying. They have some great cocktails and I highly suggest the PIneapple Martini. They are dangerously delicious as you don't taste any alcohol whatsoever which means you may either 1.) be drunk as a lush later in the evening 2.) broke from ordering so many! 

I had the lomo saltado which is a popular Peruvian dish. However, I wished that I had ordered the Curry Red Snapper with Coconut Rice as that tasted spectacular!!!!! My dish was good but small and sorta on the salty side. I was hungry even after having many samples of the appetizers which by the way were incredibly delicious as well! My personal favorites were the ceviche and the chicharon's. 

For dessert, the profiteroles are the way to go. After having a rich in flavor food, the profiteroles were a refreshing treat. So light and creamy! I wished that I had more of them to eat! 

This place is a great place to hang out amongst friends. It's small, so make sure you make a reservation.
author: stacy k.

description:
Just had lunch at Limon today and it was awesome!  

I asked my Peruvian friend Paco where he goes for the best Peruvian food in the city.  He replied that there was only one place, Limon.  A few weeks ago I saw a Groupon for lunch at Limon, with Paco's blessing and the great deal being offered, I couldn't turn this down.

My girlfriend and I shared the Ceviche Nikkei de Atun (ahi tuna with mushrooms and sesame seeds in soy sauce-infused leche de tigre).  We then each ordered an entree.  She ordered the Pescado Limon (snapper fillet, potatoes and spinach) and I ordered the Lomo Saltado (sirloin stir-fried with onions, tomatoes, fries and soy sauce) and some wok tossed veggies in soy sauce as a side.  For drinks we ordered the inca cola and a chicha morada (a drink made from purple corn).

Everything was delicious, including the drinks.  The inca cola tasted like cream soda and the chicha morada tasted like apple crumble.  I'm sure that the veggies taste good too but we never got them.  However this was probably a good thing as we were stuffed.  The ceviche itself was pretty filling.  

The reason for 4/5 stars is down to the service.  Our waiter was nice enough but we had to remind him that we had ordered two drinks, he forgot the side (again, it wasn't a problem) and he also gave us claw crackers when there was nothing to crack.  He would have been forgiven if the place was slammed but it was lunch and there were probably only about 15 patrons in there.

I will definitely be going back for dinner and can't wait to try Limon Rotisserie.
author: Prav P.

description:
I had my 21st birthday dinner at this restaurant with my family. I was very excited to go there from hearing good things and i have been craving some good old peruvian since i moved from florida! We were all sadly unimpressed though.

we got the chimichurri fries, sweet potato fries, yuca frita as appetizers. they were very...simple. and small. the yuca was fried too much. it's normally pan fried so it is a little dry and cripsy so you can eat it balanced with the sauce, but it was moist and mooshie! yuck!

As for entrees we ordered the Churrsaco, paella de mariscos, chuleta de puerco, chicharron de pollo. They were actually pretty good for entrees. the paella de mariscos was very plain and was not spicy at all. rather bland. everything else was pretty mediocre. the chuleta was too salty with the dressing but the pork was dry so it kinda balanced a lil.

For refrescos we got inca kola, chicha morrada, sangria, and a mango mojito. the chicha was a lil diluted, sangria was good, but the mango mojito... it was more just plain rum filled with a lot of mint! i didn't taste any mango even tho the waitress said it had "real mango" in it. way too strong.

Over all we were disappointed. We have been looking for a real nice authentic peruvian restaurant since we moved from peru, and this one was not adequate. Our quest continues. :'(
author: John S.

description:
Remodel the bathrooms, not the lomo saltado.
 
This place was amazing before, now I find it just alright. I went and had the lomo saltado it was a sad shell of what it used to be. Low on flavor but high on salt. It seemed as if they just poured soy sauce all over the dish. Not kidding. The people I dined with enjoyed the fried red snapper, however, they said it did not taste fresh.

Pros-
Nice ambiance
Clean
Colorful and creative plates
Sangria
Good service
Unique dipping sauces

Cons- 
Signature dish Lomo Saltado is not what it used to be
Food was competent but underwhelming

Its a hip place to get drinks or impress a date but the food is not as good as it was before.
author: Mike I.

description:
I've been there several times for dinner but recently went for lunch. The prices were great; the food amazing; drinks very tasty and service was impeccable!

I would highly recommend!
author: Martin F.

description:
Went there with a group for a friend's birthday this past weekend. We had a row of tables downstairs in the basement. Fun ambiance and crowd, and DELICIOUS food. We ordered a bunch of plates for the group and every plate was amazing. The rotisserie chicken, though....was the best chicken I've ever tasted. Seriously. It was like magic. Their sangria is also pretty decent.

Service was a bit slow and I had to ask for glasses of water for the latecomers several times before we got our water. It might've been a function of how busy it was that night.

They were very accommodating and let us bring our own cake for the birthday boy.

I was surprised that the tab ended up being only $34/person for our group of about a dozen for tons of sangria and lots of food. 

Highly recommended! Definitely order the rotisserie chicken.
author: Amy D.

description: One of the best restaurants in the city. ENOUGH SAID. Amazing food, great service, seated right way, empanadas to die for, good sangria, delicious dessert. If you ever find yourself in the Valencia area you have to try!  Please stay away from the South Van Ness area, had bad luck with reservations and service.
author: Brenda S.

description:
I had only been to Limon once before the fire came.  It was a fabulous experience with freakin' awesome food.  Tartar de Atun, fresh ceviches, good wine list.

So of course Mister B and I were excited that it was back!  We went there on a monday night for Mister E's birthday.  Maybe it was because it's hard to get fresh fish on a Monday night, I don't know, but I was pretty underwhelmed by it this time 'round.

Ceviches were a little forgettable in flavor, and portion sizes small for the price in my opinion.  And I'm perfectly ok with bite-sized portions, as long as they deliver.  Sadly, I did not see the Tartar de Atun.  Bring it back, Limon!

Staff is still awesome, and the overall ambiance of the place is nice, it kinda looks the same as before though I think they now have a ceviche bar in front.

I'll report back after next visit.
author: Aimee B.

description:
We were in the city to see Wicked. A co-worker suggested we go to  Limon for dinner. It was a Thursday night @ 6pm. The neighborhood is a 'bit sketchy' and parking sucks. Because it was early on a weeknight the place was pretty empty when we got there (& almost full when we left). We decided to get a few different appetizers so we could try more of the menu. Overall the food was fantastic! 

1. Costillas Nikkei - Crispy Spare Ribs
          These are the BEST Spare Ribs we've ever eaten. They were  
          crispy on the outside and tender inside. The meat "fell off the
          bone". The flavor was fantastic!
2. Chifa de Camarone - Tiger Shrimp -- YUM!!
3. Coconut Fried Rice - OMG! SOOO good!
4. Crispy Yucca - Takes like a french fry
5. Empanadas de Carne - Good
6. Anticuchos de Pollo - My least favorite item, wouldn't order them again.
7. Limon Shooter (Ceviche) - my first time...interesting, not my favorite.
8. Strawberry Mojito was good
9. Pink Lemon Drop was good

We can't wait to take our BF's here. Great food, nice atmosphere. I would definitely go "early" for dinner! I would get 1,2 & 3 again and want to try the Pork Chop entree, Truffled infused Mac n Cheese & Wok Tossed veggies w/ soy!
author: Lynn B.

description:
This is what my friend and I ate:

- Cebiche Limon
- Sangria (half pitcher)
- Anticuchos de Pollo
- Lomo Saltado
- Truffled mac n' cheese

The truffled mac n' cheese was one of the best I've ever had. The Sangria was forgettable. I was too full to really take in the flavors of the Lomo Saltado. In my food comatose state, I vaguely remember the lomo saltado so I don't know if that's good or bad. I think it was good. 

Overall a good place to eat. I regret ordering so much. If you have a small stomach, definitely get 3 dishes max and split the food with someone.
author: Kay A.

description:
Couple thoughts:

Food - Solid. Definitely order the ceviche and steak.
Ambiance - Upscale but relaxed. Lots of hard wood, typical SF decor but the chill vibe adds a nice touch. 
Service - Excellent. Attentive and friendly. 

Overall this is definitely a place to check out. It's got great versatility so it's good for a group of friends, a date or a one on one dinner. Put this one on your list. You won't be disappointed.
author: Shreya C.

description:
Delish!  Highly recommend it!  Nice vibe, great service and FABULOUS FOOD!  The ceviche is UNREAL!
May have just entered one of my top 5 go-to's!!
author: Natalie M.

description:
Very tasty ceviche, fish and other main courses. Very nice cocktails and good wine suggestion from our waiter.

So incredibly loud room. Hot spot for sure.
author: Christopher P.

description: I was there for a romantic early dinner and dealt with an obnoxious man sitting a few tables down from me. Besides him all the food was incredible, Yucca, lomo saltado, churrasco, sorbet.... All was amazing. Can't wait to go back! Hopefully that man will find a different spot in SF.
author: Gabriel G.

description:
I was hesitant at first, haven't been since they reopened. I wasn't very impressed in the past.

My recent experience was a nice surprise. The renovation itself is just lovely, service was attentive and friendly.

Food:
Ceviche Limon - yum. (personally, I would've liked to see more calamari, but not a deal breaker)

Costillas Nikkei - crispy spare ribs, double yum.

Pargo Rojo - crispy red snapper, YUMMMMMMM

That being said, I will definitely go back and I look forward to it.
author: C B.

description:
If you are a large party (like we were) be prepared to wait.  At least an hour.  As Dietrich H mentioned below, reservations don't seem to mean anything here.  We had reservations this past Saturday for 8 at 8pm but was seated at 9pm.  

The food is pretty good here (lomo saltado, red snapper, empanadas, ceviche) but I think it would have been a more enjoyable experience if Limon knew what the heck a reservation was and I wasn't left feeling so hangry!  I was ready to eat a philly cheesesteak across the street and I don't even like cheese!

In the future, I'll stick to La Mar when I'm hankering for some Peruvian food or cebiche.
author: Cindy N.

description: I love this place.  I always bring out of town guest here if we plan on spending an evening out in the mission.  Everything here is absolutely delicious.  The empanadas being my favorite.  The staff is always accommodating and charismatic.  I came here last friday and the owners were very accommodating after I last minute added a third person.  They sat everyone waiting and offered free sangria for the wait.   The food here is amazing.  Its a good place to bring friends or parents. :]
author: Jenn G.

description: We came here with a large group and confirmed reservation the day of. When the party showed up on time, we were asked to wait, which  was fine at first. After waiting for 30 minutes, we were told that the restaurant can't accommodate us, because my friend didn't confirm. Hum...weird that we were in their book when we checked in and they even told us where we were supposed to be seating, they were just waiting for people to leave. At that point we just left, terrible experience.
author: Cicie W.

description:
I would go back, but I'm not jumping up and down.

It seems that everyone loves the ceviche here. Well, I don't like ceviche (period) so I have nothing to say about that (though the rest of my table seemed to like it). However, the empanada appetizer and my chicken dish (with mushroom mashed potatoes, yum!) were both excellent. I also sampled some of the pork dish and the table ate some snapper and everyone was very impressed. I also quite enjoyed the sangria though I have admittedly had better. The bread is also soft and scrumptious with really wonderful dipping sauces. So overall, this was a good (but not excellent) experience food-wise.

The service was okay, but really slow. Now, granted I was there on a very busy Friday night at 8pm, prime dinner time. BUT...they should be prepared to handle the crowds. Our food and drinks took FOREVER to come out and we often had to flag someone down to order anything. Now, the caveats are that I was with a large group (I think about 10-12) and I will give them the benefit of the doubt that someone didn't show up for work or something and they could have been short handed. But, the service left something to be desired.

The restaurant itself was kind of a cool place, though it had very tight quarters (not unexpected for most SF restaurants). However, it was REALLY LOUD. So loud that we had to shout to hear people just across the table and we all were having trouble talking after we left. 

So yea, as I said, I'd go back, but I'm not jumping up and down.
author: Amber P.

description: Ay Papi! The food is so good. I enjoyed the chicharron de pollo (finger lickin good) and veggie empandas. Best empanadas I've ever had. The crust was butter and flaky as it should be. My friends had ceviche and limon pescado and said it was all delish. The service was excellent. They anticipated your needs.Really, I haven't had that service in many years. Even compared to more expenisve and shee-shee restaurants.I can't wait to go back! Bravo LIMON!
author: mel m.

description:
I try to spare myself the luxury of dining out on weeknights; but, when an iMessage from your Bros buzzes in the space between your pocket and outer thigh ("Bro. Limon. 7pm. Be a Bro."), are you gonna not "be a bro?" 

If this is your first time here and/or you are not/have not from/visited Peru, the menu can confound you. Small Hot Plates? Small Cold Plates?  I didn't come here to read! Nevertheless, we Bros recited the menu to each other, in turn, the volume lifting where we found preference - with the proper timing, we could have had ourselves a canon, and with any talent, a fugue. When that was over, we spoke at length about our gastric capacity for chicken in a sitting. As this place specializes in roast chicken, the discussion wasn't entirely impertinent. Our gracious waiter confirmed that we should order the chicken, and recommended the Ceviche Mixto, and the Anticuchos de Res (cow hearts). Hey waiter, quick question: is this your first time suggesting items? Keep up the great work! We chose two sides with the chicken: tuca-tuca (Siri told us all about what that meant) and the yucca fries. We threaded the meal with pisco sours and negra modelos. On a weeknight! 

The roast chicken, couldn't have been more roast chicken. Dis free-range? It came with an aji sauce trio that (spoiler alert) DID make it more roast chicken. The hearts were like jerky, if jerky were tender, chewy, charred and robust. The ceviche mixto, like maybe all of their ceviches, is less about the protein and mostly about that juice that accumulates at the bottom of the bowl. Heck, next time I may just order a bowl of ceviche juice. One spoon. 

You should be eating here. You will pay $$, but isn't money an artificial construct we should be unburdening ourselves from anyway? To borrow an association from their "Pablo Sandoval-Approved" Menu, allow me this metaphor to describe my dining experience: Home Run!
author: Vijay R.

description:
Well...I hate fine dining.  I'm the kind of guy that appreciates solid fare at affordable prices, so my review is automatically colored because my unrefined palate can't stand paying double for half the food.
That said, I found myself at Limon for a friend's birthday and decided to review it instead of just complaining.  Despite my misgivings, Limon delivered:
In a display of class and chivalry I would have expected to be dead (especially in San Francisco), the water guy served all the ladies first, noticeably circling the table to do so.  
The appetizers were tasty and well presented, but imminently un-shareable.  For eight bucks, you can give me a couple more chicken skewers, guys. 
After perusing the prices and reasonably easy to understand entree selections, I threw my wallet to the wind and ordered what I really wanted: the ribeye.
I was pleasantly surprised.  The steak was good-sized by any standards, and bursting with flavor.  It was a touch dry, and in an effort to make a good review, I took a picture of the lovely presentation.  Our waiter must have noticed me photographing my meat (which I usually don't do in public) and stopped to ask me if it was prepared to my liking.  This is a good example of the excellent nature of the service, which I felt to be smooth, courteous and efficient.
The Yelp listing is incorrect on one point: the bar is strictly beer and wine.
If force do endure fine dining again, I would not hesitate to choose Limon.
author: Urriolagoitia M.

description:
Great selection of a little bit pricey food. 

I went there with a friend of mine and we shared 3 awesome cheviche dishes (ceviche limon -seafood combination, ceviche de pescado - red snapper, and tiradito de Atun - tuna sashimi). 

We also shared 1 entree of lomo saltado -tossed sirloin! It was amazing =).

Service and the environment were good but the place was a little bit noisy. It's not a perfect place to have a date; rather it's a perfect place to just hang out w your friends.
author: Reyner T.

description:
This was my first time trying Peruvian food and I gotta say, it's quite good. 

We tried their famous half chicken which was pretty good. I'm more of a dark meat fan and the dark meat was excellent. It came with two different sauces (I forgot the names) one is green and one is brown. The green sauce is amazing. It's slightly spicy but even a non-spicy eater like myself loved it. Order a side of fries and use the green sauce as a dip. It's pretty great. Our waiter suggested the halibut seviche which I loved but be warned, there's a very strong flavor to it. We also tried the short ribs which weren't bad but weren't impressive either. 

Overall I would say it's pretty good. I would come here again. I don't really have much experience with Peruvian food to compare it to but I am now a fan of Peruvian food if that means anything.
author: Diana Y.

description: I'm updating this as one of the members of our group were charged for over $400 on their credit card bill, which was a total mistake.  When they called the restaurant, the restaurant didn't refund them and asked them for all of our credit card numbers again b/c they said none of us apparently paid that night.  We all paid and they made a huge mistake which they begrudgingly took off our friend's CC after they tried 5-6 times to call them and resolve the issue.  Very shady and horrible way of doing business...
author: nasim n.

description: The ceviche is always good here.  The service is consistently good and the ambience is nice.  It's perfect for a date or group outings.  I have been here quite a bit over the years and last week I brought a group of 15 employees for dinner and was very pleased with the quality of the food and service.
author: Jimmy Z.

description: Celebrated my 21st Birthday here and it was great! We ordered the Rotisserie chicken, Lomo Saltado, Sangrias, Lychee Martinis, Empanadas, and Ceviche! Literally everything was perfectly made. My favorites were the chicken and the Lomo Saltado. I'd highly recommend coming here!
author: Caitlin B.

description: Drinks were delicious and I highly recommend the Pescado y Camaron ceviche
author: Doris T.

description: I came here with one of my best friends and her Argentinian friends who were vacationing in the bay for a weekend. We ordered pretty much everything on the menu, and the prices were reasonable too. I enjoyed it, but I've definitely had better south american food before. pretty restaurant and yummy sangrias!
author: Sheeva G.

description: The food was delicious, the noise not so cute.  That being said, as long as you enjoy the company you are with, then,  everything will be stellar.  I can't wait to go back!
author: JT B.

description: Terrible service. Made a reservation at 9:30 and they served the same size party without a reservation(I know because I asked them) before us. We checked in a half he before our reservation. Very dissatisfied with primarily the service but food was okay. The meat was dry and the portions were small.
author: Kristen K.

description:
How did this place get 677 reviews?  Well, then I won't worry about being critical.  I am taking off a star each for these:

-NO vegetarian options.
-I thought the heating was unreasonably low for comfort on a cold day (I have a circulation thing that makes this matter.)

On the way in-
Random lady:  "this place is awesome!"
My friend:  "haha that must have been Mrs. Limon."

Otherwise,
-VERY good service and no waiting, when the other brunch places we had in mind were impossible to get in.
-Ambiance was great.  Not too loud at all.  The decor is minimal but colorful (I suggest more plants to improve the concrete view outside.)
-My friend gave me a taste of her strawberry lemonade and I didn't want to give it back.  The best I have ever had.  Real berries and thick, not watery corn-syrupy shit.
-The fries I got seemed a bit mealy inside and could have been fried a shade darker.  
-Yummy, yummy sauces.
-Mmm fantastic sangria.
  
Overall recommended.
author: Pat L.

description:
We went there last light...short version; food is OK, reviews about noise are understated, pass on mixed drinks, bartenders could not make a basic martini or a cosmo.  Our server was nice and helped us and was good. We would not rush back.

Now the longer version...The food was OK.  I agree with other reviewers that portions are very small, so each one is barely enough for 2 people. The Lomsaltado is good, so are the port ribs - did love the pork ribs.  Pass on the mac & cheese with truffle oil it is just OK.  The food is heavily salted or with soy sauce.  Now the drinks - two orders of a basic gin martini with a top shelf ginm still had a citrus flavors in it.  Two cosmos ordered at the table had almost NO vodka in them - we sent back as we refuse to pay $10 - $12 per drink for bad drinks or no alcohol.  Finally we tried the sangria and kept that ($6) per glass and it was good, but beware - they put sugar in their sangria versus really ferment with fruit juice.  This place is LOUD, read again LOUD!!!  if that is not your scene then pass on Limon...a few ceiling tiles would do this place well!!

Summary - Food is OK, some good dishes included.  If you go, bypass the bar as bartenders are unaware of how to make basic mixed drinks that do not include sugar or normal amount of alcohol.  Noise is a serious problem everyone around us was talking so loud. Service is good.
author: Jeff H.

description: Love this place. Service is great as is the Pisco Sours. Great for parties and sharing. Not a quite place but fun!
author: Julia G.

description:
Excellent! I recently went to Limon with some friends for my birthday.  We were able to get the Pre Fix menu (even though we did not have enough in our party) - our waiter was very friendly and accomadating.  

5 of us had the Cerviche Limon - we all LOVED it. The marinade was perfectly tangy and spicy. One friend had the salad - she loved the vinagarette.

The chicken skewers were outstanding (I'd order those as a meal). Very tasty - a hint of spice but full of flavor

The Paella was excellent also, the portion was kinda small -so if you are hungry don't order that or order another appetizer.  One friend had the chicken breast - she loved it. Another had the beef strips - she loved that also.

All of the food was served pipping hot - and it came pretty fast.  We went on a Saturday night at 6:30 - by 8pm it was packed. So, you might want to make reservations - unless you don't mind waiting.  parking on Valencia sucks, but there is  a parking lot one block over - I advise it.

I "eye - hustled" another table and the snapper looked divined - I'll try that next time. 

All of my friends raved about that food - would recommend to any - I'll be returning soon!!
author: Kim K.

description: ITS  a Lil pricey but its super good authentic perubian cuisine.if your're looking for night out in the Town with a special someone or group of friends. I highly reccomend eating here. I want to take my husband here because the paella dish is so good I want him to try it and experience el lemon. Great ambiance and friendly service
author: Cindy Z.

description: We had to come here after having dinner at Limon Bayview for pisco sours. Only Van Ness and Valencia locations serve the real pisco sour. They were very busy when we visited. The service tried its best to pay attention to all diners. The pisco sour at Van Ness location tastes better! We tried the chocolate bandido here and thought it was  very decadent and delicious dessert. I think I would prefer eating at Bayview (easy to find a table) and drink pisco sour at Van Ness(better drinks).
author: T B.

description: I've had better particularly at the Peruvian restaurant Fresca.  I had heard a lot of good things but overall I'm not too impressed.  On a positive note, I did like the Yucca fries and the Sangria was delicious.
author: Evelyn I.

description:
I came to Limon expecting to discover a new find, a trendy place to have cocktails and eats with the co-workers on a Friday, a nice place for a date on the weekend.   Limon left me with something to be desired - namely, a reservation at La Mar.   As foreshadowing to our meal at Limon, we were welcomed by a street lined by rugged construction and an unsightly trench which stretched almost the entirety of the block (not their fault, but still not worth navigating around to get to the actual food.).  Upon entering, we were "greeted"  by two female hostesses, both of whom get an "F" in friendliness and one of whom gets an "A" in having sleeve tattoos and orange hair whilst trying to be pretentious at a restaurant that is...well, continue reading. 

The food was not memorable.  I had the "Pollo Latino," which ended up being the twin sister of a Safeway rotisserie chicken that had been sitting under the lights for a little bit too long.   The peppers were interesting, the macaroni and cheese side was a little bland and served luke warm.  Perhaps the best part of the evening were the sangrias and the dipping sauce that came with the bread - pretty good.  The steak dish was over seasoned.   In a city with culinary feats on and around each block, Limon just doesn't pass muster.   If you want to navigate the traffic and construction in the Mission to get to this place, stick to the Sangrias and bread, then grab a cab and go to a real meal at La Mar or Fresca.
author: Nicole S.

description: Excellent affordable ceviches and piscos - the leche de tigre was brilliant! Also the truffle macaroni and cheese, decidedly strange in a peruvian menu is wonderful.
author: sunita s.

description:
For my birthday I decided to gather some friends for an epic dinner up in San Francisco.  I'd been wanting to try Limón for quite some time--I'd never had Peruvian food before, and was eager to check it out, plus a friend of mine had rave reviews of Limón's rotisserie. 

We arrived for dinner (with reservations, of course, on a Saturday night) at 6:30, and we were seated promptly. The restaurant was packed, and they took our party up to the upper level. We had a nice table in the corner by the upstairs bar. The restaurant was hopping, with lots of action around the bar and tables coming and going. And as my friend Michelle noted--and then insisted I include in my review--"the restaurant smelled wonderful." By the smell alone, I was salivating.

We started off with drinks. Some of my friends tried some of their specialty cocktails, giving them the thumbs up. I decided to try the Peruvian Inca style cola, chicha morada. It was an interesting drink--it's made with purple corn as the base, with a mix of sweet fruit, acidic citrus and hints of spice and cinnamon. One sip in and I was intrigued and didn't know what to think of it, but by the end, I was ready to order a second one!

After a long day in the city, we were starving and everything on the menu looked good. We started out with four appetizers--the ceviche Limón, the causa de pollo, an order of veggie empanadas and the chicharrones de pollo. The ceviche was absolutely delicious--and that's saying a lot coming from me, since I'm not usually a fan of ceviches. The fish, shrimp and squid had a nice, smooth citrus flavor, with just the right amount of kick. The chicharrones were nice and crispy outside, and juicy tender inside. Oh man, I'm having inappropriate thoughts about those chicharrones right now! What I'd for an order of them right now! *sigh* The veggie empanadas were definitely one of our favorites--we liked them so much we got a second order. The outside was nice and flaky, the inside filled with spicy veggies. And I loved the accompanying salsa. The only appetizer that didn't wow us was the causa de pollo--with a cold chicken salad over the potato, it was a little bland in comparison to everything else. (But still tasty on its own.)

For my main course, I ordered the duck--a seared duck breast with spiced Brussels sprouts, crispy tacu-tacu (which I took for some sort of bean cake) and sauteed greens, topped with two fried plantain chips. When the dish arrived, it was a sight to behold--a true work of art with the plantain chips on top. The duck was cooked a little rare for my tastes, but had a nice texture. Flavor wise, I wish it had had a little more kick to it. Honestly, I think I was more impressed with the side dishes--they easily outshined the duck breast. I guess this was the risk I took ordering duck in a Peruvian restaurant--it's not exactly a Peruvian specialty.

My friends all raved about their respective dishes, which included a wok-seared hanger steak, two orders of paella and two orders of the whole roasted fish. The beef was nice and tender, or so I heard, as I didn't sample any. The paella was a nice savory mix of seafood. The whole roasted fish won the award for most entertaining--it was quite amusing as my friends worked their way through the fish, bones and all. All of the entrees got a thumbs-up. 

Sadly, dessert was a bit of a letdown. We were pretty stuffed, so we just ordered two desserts for the table. The bandido chocolate cake got the thumbs up, with the right blend of sugar and spice. The profiteroles, however, weren't so tasty--the dough was a little dry and the filling pretty plain. The syrup--made from the Peruvian lucuma fruit--was nice. Again, I think the problem here is that profiteroles are a French, not Peruvian, dessert. It was my own fault for ordering them anyway, but I wanted to try the lucuma fruit.

I have to say, I thought our service here was great. We were a big table, with six of us there for dinner. Sometimes dining in a large group can throw the waitstaff off their game, but not here. Our glasses were promptly refilled, food arrived quickly, dirty plates were cleared right away, our servers checked up on us several times throughout our meal. I have to say, sometimes I don't get service this good in restaurants when dining with just a table of two in an empty restaurant!

We had a great time at Limón and I'd definitely come back here next time I'm looking for dinner up in the city. Sure, parking in the Mission can be a pain in the evening, but it was well worth it for our dinner here. I'd definitely recommend coming here for dinner--special or otherwise.
author: Raul N.

description: Was in The Mission with an out of town guest and we were looking for somewhere somewhat nice to have lunch. We were greeted upon entry and seated.  The server who came to the table was very pleasant and professional.  Then another server came over and then another --- three in total.  When the third server came to the table we asked if a window could be opened as it was getting warm and stuffy in the restaurant.  We were told that the manager was the only one who had a key to the windows and he/she was not there, so the windows stayed closed. I asked about one of the menu items and the second server said what it was but when it was served it was not as explained.  Overall a good restaurant but three stars because they seemed to be having staffing problems which affected the quality of the meal.
author: Edward P.

description:
Sangria = A+
Chicharron de pollo = A+
Yucca = A+
Ceviche of various types = A+

My only complaint is that I can't eat everything at once.  I would like to eat one bite of everything on the menu - perhaps a sampler platter...  :D

This is a good place to take groups - there's something for a variety of food types.
author: Sara P.

description: Get the pisco sour. Get the chicken. And also, get the tartares. Ambience is fantastic and the staff was friendly. I do have to say, a friend has been hyping up Limon for quite a while and although it was good, I was a little disappointed.  It turns out, he had meant the chicken at Limon Rotisserie was to die for. So, that's next on the list. While the chicken was good here, I either didn't order the right one or this wasn't the right place because it was good but plain.
author: Bern H.

description:
I hosted a birthday party for my sister at Limon last night and I wanted to share my extremely positive experience with you. To put this review in perspective, I'm a die hard fan of local, hip, ethnic food and I'm a pretty detailed reviewer. 

Limon had several other large parties in addition to our party of 20 last night. The restaurant was bustling and I was a little concerned that it was too busy for them to cater to our party. I was wrong. Our waiter Donald and the manager, Enrique were fantastic. I met with Enrique a week prior to the party and he let me taste the sangria to make sure it was sweet, the way I like it. He also walked me through their restaurant, letting me select where we would sit.

Our party arrived on time and then I ordered some of their sides and appetizers for the group. We also ordered several carafe's of sangria :)

Here are some of my favorite dishes:

-sweet potato fries (crispy and sweet but not oily or heavy)
- side of vegetables in soy  (our group loved this. Cooked al dente in a  zesty soy glaze)
- Ceviche (we thoroughly enjoyed the sour, sweet and slightly spicy ahi tuna, red snapper and mixed seafood ceviches. Some were authentic some were nouveau but all were amazing)
- Red snapper with tiger prawns (awesome - great pink sauce, not too spicy)
- Fried whole red snapper (lightly fried, awesome seasoning and the rice on the side was super tasty)

Over all their menu was diverse, fresh and fulfilling. Their service was top notch and the ambiance was young, contemporary and welcoming.

I highly recommend coming here if you like new takes on traditional items and do request Donald as your waiter!
author: vinney a.

description: Good food, and decent sangria. But I was a little frustrated at how late I was seated for my reservation, and I didn't seem to be the only one. I think they may need to take another look at how they are booking their tables.
author: T S.

description: Just had dinner here on Saturday night with my best friend who was visiting from Seattle.  They didn't take reservations so we thought we might be screwed considering how popular this end of town is.  We waited less than 5 mins for a table for two at 7:30pm!!  The sangria was excellent, perfectly matched for any food you get.  We got the chicken plate that came with a corn salsa that had to have some heaven sprinkled on top (actually its carrot) but it was ridiculously yummy.  The steak and fries was a little over dressed with onions, but you can always pick those out and just enjoy the gravy.  We finished with the creme puffs that basically eclipsed anything else we had that night, because I really am still savoring the toasted almond and caramel in my mind.
author: Annie M.

description: This place has great food, good service and nice environment. The ceviches are very  tasty and the drinks so good and exotic!! if you're new in the city and want to try some Latin  cuisine  I recomend going to Limon. BY the way the original is the Valencia not South  Vannes however they both are great!
author: Ginna R.

description:
Stopped in here on a Tuesday night for some drinks and snacks.  They offered us a table, but we opted to sit at the bar since it was only 2 of us, and we didn't plan on having a full meal.  

We split the red snapper ceviche , along with the Chicharron de Pollo and Choros Limon.Everything was great, portions were big, and serive was top notch. 

Can't wait to come back again soon for a full dinner.
author: marjorie v.

description:
Came out here with a friend on a Saturday night. It wasn't too crowded when we got there (6pm) but we were asked to sit at the bar since there were 2 of us, which was no problem. The bartender was friendly and helpful-- in fact, all of the service that we received was quite attentive.

My friend and I ordered a dish to split, and didn't receive any snide comments from the waiter, which was nice. While we were waiting, they brought out bread with 2 very delicious dipping sauces. The bartender also served us up some complimentary oyster shooters which was very unique-- citrusy and full of flavor.

Next they brought out our entree, which was chicken breast served with stuffed peppers and mac&cheese. The portions were surprisingly large, and the 2 of us couldn't finish the whole meal. The chicken breast was tender, but with a tasty crispy skin. The flavor was amazing and somewhat reminiscent of crispy duck. We also had a side of the Yucca fries, which I would highly recommend. They were awesome in the side sauces (that had come out w/ the bread).

After our meal, the waitstaff made us feel like we were welcome to hang out as long as we wanted, although we saw the people waiting at the door and made sure to get on our way. We appreciated the phenomenal service, delicious food, and great atmosphere. I'm already planning to revisit this place soon.
author: Alissa B.

description: Had lunch at LIMON after enjoying SF Sunday Streets.  Started out with a delicious, refreshing, fruity sangria.  Then moved on to the Ensalada Rusa (big chunks of flavorful root veggies), and Ceviche Mixto (the ingredients are so fresh, be sure to mix this one up well before eating!).  We followed this with the Lomita Saltado (I almost placed a SECOND order, for this was to die for!), and the Chicharron de Pollo with some Yuca Fries.  Each plate can actually easily feed 3 or 4 people!!!  Ended our fabulous lunch with the Profiteroles, which were delightful.  Service attentive, and ambiance great!  Be sure to place a reservation, as this place can quickly get packed!
author: Gary O.

description: Let me start out by saying that I am Peruvian so when I go to a Peruvian restaurant I expect to get just that, Peruvian food. I had heard wonderful things about this restaurant so I was so excited to visit this place. Well let me tell you that the service was beyond horrendous! We noticed how a guy on the table next to us had to latterly get up from his table and grab a napkin from the bar because there was no server checking on them. Our server was very inattentive and kept messing up our order. I thought that maybe the food would be good enough to make up for the horrible service. Well think again! Bc the food was just as bad!! I'm not going to say this food did not taste good bc it didn't have a bad taste but there was obsoletely nothing I had that night that tasted like Peruvian food. The "tacu tacu" was a true disgrace to the Peruvian tacu tacu, it tasted like plain rice and beans which is not the concept of the dish. Everything else tasted just as plain, to be honest with you the only thing that was good was the canned "Inca Cola" soda. The server did not check on us once and I can honestly say I will never be coming back again. It's truly sad as a Peruvian young woman raised in the US to see that our food is being presented so wrongfully. Hopefully someone soon will open a TRUE traditional Peruvian restaurant in SF so we can all taste the delicious dishes that my South American Country offers.
author: Daniela C.

description: So, we ordered the chicken. Duh!  It was amazing.  You only really need a whole chicken for two, with the sides, and you're good to go.  Not to mention that it's pretty cheap.  I recommend booking a table, and thank goodness we did, because the line and bar wait were incredible!  It's a very busy and loud place, so, perhaps not somewhere you'd take your grandparents or an intimate date.
author: Laura D.

description: This place is pretty good. Their Yuca fries are solid and their Chicharron de Pollo was on point. Awesome tapas/small plates and the ambiance is fantastic. The only reason I can't give it 5 stars is because the service, while it was good, seemed kinda rushed. It was Friday night so it was bustling but that's no reason to rush people through their meal. Despite all that I would probably go back.
author: Carl N.

description: good staff, easy to get a table, good prices..buuut...noticed the 2 times we've gone, we're always thirsty all night long afterwards...not sure what's in the chicken.  also, way too noisy there...can barely hear the person across the table.
author: Ara L.

description: The food here is okay but then again it's mostly just rotisserie chicken.  Both times I've been here the service was poor though, which makes me not want to go out.  Last time the server tried to take my plate while I was literally eating off it.  Then came back a minute later when I still wasn't done and took it without asking.  If you want people to come back, you shouldn't rush them like that.
author: Kevin C.

description: Normally I would write a review on the quality of food, service, atmosphere and overall experience of a restaurant. However, and despite the fact that I have always enjoyed the food here (ceviche, peruvian chicken, tuna tartare), I will never be able to return after our bill was accompanied by a cockroach barreling towards me from behind the bar. My first reaction was to back away in horror as anyone would; except for maybe the bartender, who witnessed the entire incident, nonchalantly dismissed it with an "oh," turned away and continued about his business. Uhhh really dude? Come on! My friend had to quickly trap the filthy thing with an empty cup so it wouldn't crawl all over us. Even after we still paid our 20% gratuity, the bartender still ignored the "cockroach cocktail" on the counter until we finally asked him to remove it. I'm so traumatized that the only consolation is that it happened AFTER we already ate. Or did it?
author: Connie W.

description: They were able to seat the 3 of us within 15min on a busy Sat night without reservations, with a warning that we have an hour to eat. The food was just as delicious as at the Van Ness location. Excellent swift service. We ordered and got our food within 15min or so, had plenty of time to eat, pay, and finish conversation before our hour was up.
author: O K.

description:
We went to Limon for a suprise birthday dinner.
The only downfall is the noise level in the restaurant.
Otherwise everything was great.  We shared many of the apps including ceviche, mussels, quinoa and empanadas.  I had the ribeye which was huge and for the price it was reasonable.
Drinks are good too.  We brought our own birthday dessert and they plated it and made it look pretty.
Service was very good. Will go there again.
author: Ai C.

description:
Nice decor and love the location, but service is really, really bad. Walked in with one of the party already seated at our table (which was out of sight). The hostess says,"Oh, you guys are right around the corner." Okay, I give it a few seconds and she stands behind her computer, not showing any signs that she will be showing us to our table. There were no other people around us and she was not busy with any other guests. Isn't it YOUR JOB to seat your customers? So I looked around and finally figured it myself which corner we were seated at. REALLY? That is atrocious.

Waiter service was good. He was friendly and advised us on what he recommended. Drinks came promptly and food came soon after. I liked him.

At the end of our meal, while I was still working on my last bite, the bus boy comes by and starts clearing the plates. Hello? I am still chewing my food? Maybe an honest mistake so it wasn't that big of a deal, but compounded by the rude hostess and down goes the tip percentage. Felt bad for the waiter and informed him that he was great but the hostess was rude, but you do work as a team so................................

Ceviche Mixto was amazing! Empandas and crispy chicken was way too salty for me, a salt fiend. Which says a lot.

Overall, it was mediocre. 1st and last time for me. Although they serve a different type of food, I'd rather spend my money at Garcon which I have gone back 3 times. Same price range, good service, always consistent.
author: Celise L.

description:
Yummy food and great service...a little too much, at times.  I went there on a date and when we got to our table, the waiter pulled out my chair..so I sat down and continued my conversation with my date. A minute later, I turned around and the waiter was still behind me.  "Scoot in," my date whispered. Ahhh....so I scooted in my chair and the waiter left.  Then I got up to go the bathroom and a different waiter rushes to the table to grab my napkin --still in my lap and hand.  Ahhh! What now?  Ohhh..he just wants to fold it for me while I go powder my nose....

Anyway, it was a bit crowded when I went, but we had reservations so we only waited 10 minutes after our reservation time.  We had the calamari and ceviche ----and I, two glasses of red wine.  On a date, this should be a girl's max, I think.  I'd go back with some gfs and live it up for dinner again sometime. :)
author: kari t.

description:
My boyfriend and I are visiting SF from the Big Island of Hawaii and met friends at Limon on our last night here.

We've been eating out around the Mission/Castro districts for a few days now and Limon by far will stand out in our minds as one of the best experiences we've had this week. 

The service was great--from the friendly greeting when we arrived to the attention to detail throughout the meal. 

We started with the Ceviche Limon.  I'd go back just for that. For my entree, I had the Pargo Rojo (crispy red snapper fillet, coconut fried rice & rocoto-curry sauce).  Very good. Fun presentation and good too. The greens left just a little to be desired, but the fish was good enough to make up for a lackluster side.

Will recommend this to our host/hostess who haven't been yet. Mahalo, Limon, for making out last night in SF worth remembering!
author: Cynthia H.

description:
All of the dishes I tried at Limon created a veritable explosion of flavors on my tongue.  Zesty, tangy, sweet, salty, savory-- pop, pop, pop! It makes me excited just thinking about them.  

Now admittedly, before my visit to Limon, I was a complete virgin to Peruvian cuisine.  In fact, my knowledge of South American cuisine as a whole stemmed from a single evening I spent at the Brazilian restaurant Churrascaria Plataforma in New York gorging myself on meat years ago.  That, and the stories Brooke G. recounted from her days in Ecuador about carbo-loading on popcorn-centric meals and the one night she arrived at the dinner table only to find that the family's pet "cuy" (guinea pigs) had been de-fluffed and were being roasted on a spit.

To my delight, everything I sampled from Limon's menu was deliciously intriguing and far exceeded my expectations. Each morsel of the two ceviches we ordered to start the meal (the Limon and de Camarones, in case you were wondering) was mouthwatering -- from the Peruvian corn kernels to the chewy octopus tentacle, from the sweet yam to the meaty prawn. For my main course, I ordered the Pollo Latino (yes, I pronounced it "poll-o" instead of "poy-o." American moron in the house!) which was incredible, especially accompanied by the truffle-infused macaroni and goat cheese side dish.  Pure deliciousness.

The highlight of my Limon experience was definitely the food, though the service and atmosphere are not to be shortchanged either.  Granted we were there early on a Monday night, but the place was quiet and intimate, and both the maitre d' and our doll of a Brazilian waitress attended to our every need during dinner, including answering all of our questions about the vegetables and spices in the foreign fare.

In closing, yummy!
author: Erin L.

description:
I went here for the first time recently (after hearing good things about it) and it was fantastic!

We started with the Ceviche de Pescado (halibut), which was very tasty (who else loves that Peruvian corn?) and I had the Lomo Saltodo (top sirloin sauted with onions, tomatoes and fries, served with rice) for my main course. This was also excellent, although I think I liked my friend's Picante de Mariscos (scallops, calamari, shrimp, mussels, clams and diced potatoes in a Peruvian cream sauce) even better...hmm, I'll need to go back to double-check.

The sangria I enjoyed with my meal was very good, the service was top-notch and the decor was cool...I never had the pleasure of going to their old location, so I don't know if any of the above have changed for the better or the worse, but I'll definitely make it back here in the future!
author: Art D.

description:
First impression is kind of important, right? 

Saturday Lunch - me and my friend got seated at the bar while waiting for the table, the female bartender did not take any notice of us whatsoever, after few minutes without any greeting or even looking at our faces she put the menu on the bar and turned away. She never came back, neither with a glass of water nor to take a drink order, there was only 1 other person sitting at the bar, so it's not like she was overwhelmed with orders! 

She looked sour and pissed, obviously having a bad day, but c'mon she is basically the first thing you see when you walk through the door (since the hostess' table is to the side)! No one wants to start a meal with a sourly person completely ignoring you! 

Food was good but not a thrill, our waiter was very friendly and accommodating.

2 stars for the bartender (only because the drinks were great!) and 
4 stars for food and the waiter

PS. The restroom doors with the fancy tempered glass are sort of see-through...
author: Joanna S.

description:
Thank you Yelpers for a great recommendation!  You guys are the best!

Yummy Yummy Yummy!!!  

We arrived for our 10 o'clock reservation and were quickly seated and offered a drink.  It was just the hubby and I, but we still got a pitcher of sangria.  I had no problem finishing the pitcher since the waiter quickly refilled my glass every time I finished.  I had the perfect buzz.

We had the the ceviche limon, empenadas, soup, and a seafood and rice dish (can't remember the name).  Everything was wonderful!  Such a great mingling of tastes...and everything was so fresh!  But my tummy isn't used to eating so late, so we had to take some of the food home.  But it still tastes good today!

I will definitely come back again...and bring more friends to help me with the sangria!
author: Tu D.

description: Went with a party of 10 and shared yummy tapa plates!!! I need to try the other Limon place soon.
author: Wine L.

description: I have to say that the food is good and I like the colors inside but it is so yuppie and fancy that it practically becomes something other than Peruvian food to me - it seems foreign. I guess I'm more comfortable in the dumpy places like El Perol where the working class guys like my dad eat.
author: Marco M.

description:
When you're writing the 463rd review of a restaurant what more is there really to say?

My Lomo was excellent, brilliant, magnifique.   My only regret was that the "New Zealand Mussels"  were not the green-lipped mussels that I fell in love with during my month in NZ.   They were the more pedestrian variety and obviously had been frozen.   

The primary entertainment was provided by the couple next to me who were obviously drunk and ready to have wild monkey sex as soon as the left the restaurant.   As a result all sorts of items were falling off of their table and they damn near tipped the whole thing over.
author: Beau G.

description:
The food here was good.  Not close to an oral orgasm but good.  The Ceviche  Limon was a bit salty for my liking and the fried snapper basket, though beautifully presented, tasted like something you could get at any Chinese restaurant (for much cheaper)..  The winner of the night, however, was the sangria.  It was perfect - not overly sweet and potent as hell.  After my third glass, everyone within a three-table radius was in the know about with whom I've slept, with whom I'm sleeping, and with whom I'd like to sleep.  

The food and the prices do not warrant 5 stars though the service was excellent.  I'm just trying to counterbalance the low ratings sure to come from our neighboring patrons.  Sorry folks.  TMI, I know, TMI.
author: .elin f.

description:
Overrated.  Overpriced.  Overcrowded.  Left me underwhelmed.

If I were a unicorn I wouldn't eat here,
Even if I were Burns, I'd stay away,  
Too blah, too, too much like Chow --
It's just really all hype,
I'd rather go trade my money for mouth 'gasm inducing food,
Rather than blowing it at Limon, where they're only about the 'tude.
author: jack p.

description: I have been here many times and have never had a bad night. The food is SO great. Reservations are helpful but with a few locations, its a bit easier to get in. Listen to the waiters re: specials and you can really be in for a treat. Good service, delicious food, very reasonable prices, good for smaller groups and couples. Always a go to of mine. Everyone should try it!
author: Maria C.

description:
Not enough proverbial bang for the buck here.

My sweetie and I went here for some drinks and a small dinner made up of several appetizer dishes (including the much-ballyhooed ceviche). While the food was pretty tasty, I felt that the service needed to be more attentive and thoughtful, especially given the high prices for the food. Our plates came from the kitchen really (no... REALLY) quickly, but there was no consideration as to the order they were served so we ate this really spicy dish first and then followed it up with a mild tuna tartare, which really did the tuna a disservice as our spiced-up taste buds could barely detect the delicate flavor. We also wanted to stick around for awhile (like, longer than 10 minutes), enjoy our drinks and people watch-- but we felt that the staff was pushing us out so that they could turn tables more quickly.

My search for delicious ceviche continues!
author: Kayt D.

description:
The ceviche Limon is worth crying for. It's that sort of experience where you close your eyes, and your date has to interrupt you from your reverie, or you'll just sit their silently with your eyes closed waiting for that mouthgasm to subside and your vision and hearing to return because all of your neural activity has been short-circuited by that explosion of sour chili on your tongue. 
For dinner- the paella is superb. I had no idea that Peruvian fare could get this rich - saffron rice with springy fresh scallops, prawn, halibut, squid, mussels and the rest. My wife is partial to the duck, which comes with greens that should be a meal unto themselves. Save room for any of their excellent desserts, and do NOT forego the excellent sangria.
author: Stephen H.

description: Delicious food, ok service. The rotisserie chicken is amazing! So is the truffle mac & cheese. Cocktails are also really good - esp the lychee pisco! That said, the service was a bit slow and the place is quite loud.
author: Ana M.

description: If I could say everything I wanted to say about this place, it would turn into a very long long longgg review and the average yelp review reader would probably scroll on by it so I will make it nice and short. THis place is very tasty. Anthony Bourdain would give it two thumbs up. Its Gourmet for sure and super tasty and very gently on the wallet.... I recommend!
author: Mariangeles C.

description: Excellent South American cuisine, particularly the ceviche.  Ambiance is pleasant enough though I found the service to be lacking.  Not so much in that they weren't attentive, but rather they seemed odd.  Almost as if they were all new to the process of seating and serving patrons.  Go figure.
author: James S.

description:
Shatangi had dinner tonight with Dana C and Evelyn I + 4 non yelpers (recruits). There was a slight delay before we were seated, nada problem. The appetizers we got were 4 x ceviches, a Chicharron De Pollo and a tuna tartare. The chicken was great with the dipping sauce, the ceviches were a hit but the tuna was overpowered by the sesame oil. The entrees were beautifully plated and flavorful if a bit heavy in the salt department. I had the double cut pork chop which was perfectly cooked and served on a mushroom ragout to die for. The churrasco was tasty as well as were the top sirloin pieces. The fish dish was artistically mounted. Dessert was chocolate bandito, a very nice clean flavor and the tres leches cake with melted marshmallow ending the evening on a high note. The service was sparse but hella cute (lol). I'll mos def be going back.

Shatangi told you
author: Njon W.

description:
I will confess that I'm not an expert in Peruvian cuisine. In fact, the only Peruvian restaurant I've been is La Mar, which I love. It was with great anticipation that we decided to go to Limon after the Carnaval.

The verdict? It was OK. We had ceviche, shrimp, and the pork spareribs for appetizer. All good, but nothing to write home about. For our entrees, 2 of us had the deep fried red snapper, which was a spectacular presentation, and tasted good. My husband had the stirred fried skirt steak (lomo saltado), and thought it was way too salty.

To drink, the fruity mojitos (mango and strawberry) were delish. We had a nice Malbec which went nicely with the food. Overall, it was a good experience, but certainly cannot compete with La Mar!
author: Judy D.

description: The service is great. Great atmosphere. Well-cooked food and it's very delicious! I loved the beef tongue in particular!
author: Sabrina S.

description:
It's hard for a restaurant to stand out in San Francisco, particularly for the food to stand out.  There are only a handful of places that I'd give five stars, and Limon has been one of them since the first time I ate there.  So good and given the family story behind it, I just love sending business their way.

In case you didn't know, three brothers opened the place serving mostly mom's recipes after learning how to give good service and working their asses off in some of the nicest places in the city.  Martin received a rising star chef's award that year from Michael Bauer, an incredible accomplishment for a family restaurant!  They truly deserve their success.

On to the food.  Limon has the best ceviche I've ever had - ceviche de pescado is my favorite (just halibut) but ceviche limon is also fantastic.  Though it's not traditional Peruvian food they have a great tartare (even if it's a pretty obvious rip off from Mina's).  Lomo saltado is awesome as are the empanadas and anything with addresso sauce.  I generally  share a bunch of appetizers and the lomo saltado and the check is pretty reasonable.  Sangria is a great addition to the overall experience.  Also be sure to try the lucuma ice cream (a Peruvian fruit) - it's a real treat!

It gets loud in there, to be sure - but other than that it doesn't get much better.
author: Jenny S.

description: Want quality, presentation, and affordability? Come here for lunch! $15 for a main dish, soup/salad, house drink! Beside that, their food is excellent! Had butternut squash soup (velvety, easily the best) side of fried Yukon fries (the softest and fluffy), tri-tip with rice. Oh, and their mango lemonade! Gee......
author: Johanna P.

description: wasn't served bread similar to other Peruvian restaurants. The serving sizes were small. My lomo saltado came without rice ! This place says its a Peruvian restuarant but it laked a lot of things other Peruvian restaurants offer. Now putting that aside the taste of the food was definitely there. The purple drink (chicha morada) also came in a bottle so it lacked the freshness. I give this restaurant a 3.5 stars.
author: Maribel F.

description:
This was a special thank you lunch for a dear friend.  I'd heard rave reviews about the place.  What a let down.

The space is beautiful.  Lots of ceviches to choose from plus one of my favorite Peruvian dishes Lomo Saltado.  It's a beautiful space.  What turned me off was the service.  I felt abandoned.  We went early and the place was pretty empty but our waiter was MIA.

The empanadas were excellent.  Reminded me of my grandma's.  The shrimp ceviche turned me off.  The kitchen did not clean the intestinal track from the shrimp -- all of them.  Come on guys, this is kitchen 101.  I sent it back.  Not without some attitude from the staff.  Good service would have taken it off the bill.

No thanks.  I'll go elsewhere.
author: Liz P.

description:
I came here with a small group for the sole purpose of ordering a variety of items and sharing, great approach were beginning to use to taste the city. Limón was the first stop on our taste testing excursions.


We got:

Starters
Limón Cebicheria-Mixed Seafood/Fish, Calamari, Shrimp & Octopus
Empanadas de Carne- Crispy Pastry filled with Beef, Raisins, Egg & Onion, Huaucaina Sauce       
Baskets of bread for the awesome sauces on the table and left on the plates!

Entrees:
Lomo Saltado-Wok-Tossed Sirloin Fingers with Red Onion, Tomato & Soy, French Fries 
Pargo Rojo-Whole Crispy Red Snapper, Coconut Fried Rice, Rocoto-Curry Sauce

Sides:
Truffled mac'n cheese    
Crispy yucca & chimi-churri      

Dessert:
Chocolate Bandit

First thing, when we went to order we weren't able to place our order in segments, it was order everything you want at once, and the place wasn't even crowded at this point. Doesn't make a lot of sense since the food arrived at the table at different times, that's the main reason a star is missing.

The food though was great. I hadn't really had Peruvian food before, the spices and sauces were bold and flavorful. The chimi-churri sauce was the amazing on everything, we ate that up with all the free bread. The fish and meat were both nice, tender, and simple, went well with the spices and sauces provided. My favorite was the cebiche, it had a perfect mixture. All of the seafood in the dish was fresh enough to stand alone and not need to be drenched in citrus.

I thought the mac'n cheese was really good, but was really just a super rich and thick pasta, the shape of the noodle was the only resemblance to what mom makes. With all the stuff on the menu, let Kraft make your mac n cheese for you.

We got sangria which was tasty, not too sweet and sugary like others I have had. When you put sangria in a wine glass though you're never able to get the fruit from the bottom of the glass, what a shame.
author: justin b.

description:
WARNING! If you like Sangria and Ceviche and basically any other Peruvian style dish...DO NOT EAT HERE! 

It will absolutely ruin your experience at any other Peruvian restaurant within a 100 mile radius because the food is...

INCREDIBLE! Yes...so much so that once you have a bite of their Lomo Saltado (tender juicy strips of steak and lightly crisp straight cut potatoes over rice), believe me on this one, you will not be satisfied with this dish anywhere else.

What does this mean? That glass of Sangria over at Cha Cha Cha's will be blah. That Ceviche over at ~insert name~ will not be as fresh. In conclusion, you will be forced to go to Limon with every Peruvian hunger pang that hits your stomach.

It may be a little more expensive than other places but as the saying goes: "You get what you pay for." so "Save the best for last." Who thinks of those sayings anyway?
author: Christopher C.

description:
Meh.  Food was OK, but I expected more for the price.  The waiter kept trying to upsell us on more food, drinks, tea, dessert, etc, which got old quickly (we could tell this wasn't a genuine recommendation, but rather an  attempt to get us to spend more money).  Sangria was not tasty.

Also, be forewarned: if you're planning on having a party, be ready to have a $50 per head charge! :P
author: Corey C.

description: Food was really great, especially the Ceviche Mixto. Giving it 4 stars instead of 5 since the service was a little slow and they were out of the Tartara de Tuna which I was looking forward to trying.
author: Maya W.

description:
I was a hostess at limon for maybe 2 months a couple years ago.  It was such a horrible job!  It was probably the least favorite job I've ever had.  They made us overbook the restaurant all the time.  Then on busy nights I would have waaaay too many reservations booked than there are seats in the restaurant.  People would get so pissed at me when it wasn't my fault it was the owners fault for not listening to me when I told him over and over again, we can't book this many people!!  I would have to ask people to leave because the other parties would be yelling at me.  All the owners see is money, they don't care about the employees or the customers and they have no business education, they just see money money money!  
 
 I agree that the food is overpriced and doesn't live up to the hype.  The ceviche is great, but that's about it.  
  
p.s. try not to give the hostesses a hard time, that job sucks and it's not neccessarily all the hostess's fault.
author: sasha s.

description: What a disappointment! We are from Peru and were excited to go eat their rotisserie chicken which we has heard was good. Such disappointment! Doesn't taste even close to a rotisserie chicken from Peru. I also ordered a side of fries and they were not even made from scratch. They are the ones you buy frozen and then fry...really? We were sad we wasted our time making it all the way there. I'm giving it 2 stars vs. 1 just because the service was good.
author: Daniella C.

description:
YUMMY! Yummy yummy yummyyummy.

That's my .02. I'm Puerto Rican, and I don't know if that's coloring up my review or what, but it seriously tasted a bit like home (of course it's not a Puerto Rican restaurant... but still).

I don't think the bf got it as much as I did. But he's Irish. So whatever.

=p
author: Terra T.

description: Service sucked. Not sure why wait staff was all male. Sangria decent. Empanadas were good. Everything else was subpar. Ceviche was terrible. A Peruvian restaurant with terrible ceviche is not a good thing. I would go back for sangrias & empanadas but nothing else.
author: Rude G.

description:
Beaut little place!

The guy on the door had difficulty with my name - why do American's think 'Jo' in Australian accent is 'Joy?' He was a sport and worked through it! We got a table pretty fast (they don't do reservations), and had a great night.

Table of 5 rocking up on a busy night and getting a table - when the house was pretty much full - was muchly appreciated.

The food was good. LIttle plates that we all shared. The chicken pieces went a long way! 

OOOO and the Warm Chocolate Torte (not sure of the name exactly) was out of this world! MMMMMM!
author: Josephine N.

description: Only shortcoming was that the portions for the price are definitely on the small side! Overall, yummy good food.
author: S. D.

description:
mmmmmmmmm!!!!!....i cannot say enough about the ceviches.  Pefect combinations and super fresh.  Try the Ceviche Limon, or the sampler. I also like the hongos (mushrooms) appetizer.
