I went there this past weekend, with friends from out of town.  We went there the last time they were in town...and they wanted to go back.  ....ummmm....like....ok!!  plus i leave for peru in a couple weeks....so!!  getting in the spirit.

 It is quite hard to get in there on the weekend, so plan ahead with a reservation well in advance.  we went on Friday night, without a reservation....and ended up leaving and just making a reservation for Saturday.  I recommend going during the week and sitting downstairs.  I'm not so keen on the upstairs seating...super packed, hot and loud.  But damn!  the food is worth it.  And the service has always been great, no matter how busy it is.

I never have room for dessert after ceviche and entree but I wish I did.  My favorite entrees: Picante de Mariscos (Braised scallops, calamari, shrimp, mussels, clams and diced potatoes in a Peruvian Adresso cream sauce) and Pargo Rojo ( red snapper with coconut rice).  All beautifully presented and YUMMY!!
author: Isabel C.

description: Pleased even the most picky people in our group! The rotisserie chicken was delicious and the small plates were great for our big group. Don't pass up the Mac and cheese or the empanadas!
author: Kristen V.

description:
At long last this was my first visit to the new location.  What a difference a block makes.  Not that it was bad in its tiny predecessor spot but this felt nothing like that.  If not for the cost this would hands down be a 5 star review.  The food is great - creative, very flavorful and presented well.  We had:

Appetizers-
Vieres con Foie Gras - Pan seared scallops and foie gras... - the scallops were cooked perfectly and the flavors just melted together.
Tatara de Atun - Diced sushi grade Ahi Tuna... - the tuna was very fresh and plentiful and was formed in to a patty with the rest of the ingredients with the vinaigrette and sesame oil around the edge for precision dipping.  In all it was very tasty.

Main Courses-
Lomo Saltodo - Traditional Peruvian dish of Top Sirloin slices... - this was a rich and very full-flavored dish.  The beef was cooked perfectly and the mixture of onion, tomatoes and fries made for some very tasty bites.  This was my selection and I was sure it was going to be the better of the two entrees...until I tasted
Pargo Rojo - Crispy whole red snapper basket... - wow, what a great dish.  Everything about it was stimulating from the presentation to the incredible range of flavors.  Individually the fish, curry sauce or coconut rice probably would have been the highlight of whatever they were with but together they were delectable.

Dessert-
Three scoops of ice cream - Lucuma, Chiramoya and Red Beet - all very interesting flavors.

All in all the dining experience was excellent.  The place was fun and alive but not too noisy and the service was very good (I was glad to not see the bitch blonde hostess - an encounter with her while trying to walk in one night is what kept me away from the new place for so long).  But it really added up.  Throw in a total of 3 glasses of wine and with tip it very easily passed $$$$.

I know I'll get back to Limon but I'm just not sure what the occasion will be.  It's too expensive to be a nice neighborhood meal and not really nice enough to be a special occasion place.
author: Jay W.

description: Excellent food; I had tuna tartare which was exceptional. The atmosphere is a bit crowded, but there are some more secluded seats you can find. It can get loud, but this place is still a great location for dinner for two.
author: Jonathan W.

description:
The SO always lets me choose where to dine for Valentine's Day dinner.  Actually, let me rephrase that: I always decide where we eat any kind of meal because I do not trust his culinary taste and according to him, I am the "Boss Woman".

For this past V-Day, I chose to dine at Limon, as it's been on my to-try list for months now.  Like almost everybody else, we chose to celebrate V-Day on the following Friday.  We arrived on time for our reservation and I was seated right away while the SO went to find parking.  I really hoped that we would be seated on the second level, but I was brought to probably the worst table in the house.  It was the table right at the foot of the steps, which is also right outside of the bathrooms, and closest to the serving station.  There was way too much commotion in that area for one to thoroughly enjoy their meal.  After much contemplation (I hate causing trouble), I asked the server if we could be seated somewhere else, and they obliged without any questions.  And as I had hoped, we were moved to a nice table on the second level balcony area (woohoo, never hurts to ask)!

We ordered the Ceviche Limon, Empanada Don Walter, Calamares Fritos, Lomo Saltado, and a side of truffle-infused mac & cheese.  We thought all of the appetizers were great, but Limon's ceviche is truly above and beyond any I'd ever had.  It had the perfect amount of acidity, not too sour, not too bland.  And the seafood was extremely fresh.  After taking one bite, I wished I had ordered the ceviche trio so that I could try as many as I could.  The Lomo Saltado was tasty, but I thought the mac & cheese side was even better.  We finished the meal off with their tres leches dessert, which I highly recommend, not only because the cake is good, but the tiny bite-sized macaroons that come with the dessert are AMAZING!!  I loved them so much, I actually sent an e-mail to Limon to see if they would pass on their recipe to me., but alas, I have not received a response yet.  To top off a wonderful meal, we received free wine tastings by a vendor who appeared to have permission by Limon to offer their wines for sampling at every table.

We had a really great dining experience at Limon, and I would definitely come back for more of their amazing ceviche.
author: Diane L.

description:
Our service was great-- timely, polite, and very attentive. The food was very good but not excellent. I enjoyed the sangria, which is rare. The bandido dessert was very good and, of course, the ceviche limon was fantastic.

I would definitely return but probably wouldn't call it a favorite. Wish they had a full bar!
author: Jen S.

description:
Yum... I'm getting aroused just thinking about Limon's chopped tuna tartare on top of sweet, fried wontons.

I've been here for birthdays, dates, and bringing out-of-towners - every time I go is a delectable success. The staff are funny, accommodating and attentive. On one date they were so invisibly good at service that while my date sucked down water, I polished off two thirds of a phat pitcher of sangria myself.  Mmmmm... delicious sangria.

If you're into Ceviche, it's probably the best in town. Generally it's not my bag baby and sometimes tastes like acid refluxed tripe. But Limon's ceviche is delicate, freshly citrus flavored, and seasoned to savor.

The sirloin strips are out of this world, tender and sizzling. The whole red snapper will definitely land you some hot action -  presentation will impress your date and the spicy skin will get under your skin heating things up! 

Hmmm... forget everything I've just said... get some Tatara de Atun and sangria and prepare for the best sex.. I mean dining, you've had in days.

(4.5 * stars)
author: Brady K.

description:
I thought that the food was good, but not without qualifications. 
The mushrooms were pretty good.

I had the ceviche limon (halibut with octopus, calamari, and shrimp). The fish itself was fresh and prepared well, but I guess that I wasn't blown away. I liked the octopus, but the calamari might have been a bit tough. I thought that the roasted corn kernels were a bit too hard, and the raw corn kernels were a bit starchy. My companion had the vegetarian entree, which had some rice wrapped in a cabbage leaf and some grilled vegetables. It was fairly good, but not excellent. She said it well when she said that you don't go to a ceviche place to eat vegetarian food.

The chocolate cake was a bit too rich (too much of a good thing), and the scoop of ice cream was a bit puny.

I thought that it got a bit loud during dinner.

The food wasn't cheap (entrees range from 13 for a ceviche to 24 for the whole snapper), but not terribly expensive either. In all, not bad.
author: Dana L.

description:
This is one of my favorite restaurants in the mission. The new space is beautiful, if less intimate. And the food just keeps getting better. Truly, everything on the menu hits the spot.
___________________________

I gotta update this... it's happened twice now. If you're going to serve ridiculously rich chocolate, you have to serve coffee when it's requested, and not half an hour later.
author: Seiji C.

description:
I'm dining at Limon again tonight, and thought I'd write some notes tomorrow.  But with 267 reviews of this place already in the can, why bother?!  I don't know whether you have time to wade through the musings of 267 Yelpers simply to get an opinion on a restaurant, but I typically try to keep my research to 2-3 reviews at most.

So in the interest of saving us all a bit of time, and with apologies to my 267 predecessors, here are the stats and the consensus view of Limon reviewers:

Overall rating:  4-Stars (88 5-Star reviews, 123 4-Star, 43 3-Star, 8 2-Star, and 5 1-Star).

Consistently positively mentioned items:  In the appetizer category, the ceviches are the hands-down favorite, and cited most frequently in reviews as the standout dishes at Limon (there are several varieties on any given night).  Honorable mention in the appetizer category also goes to Chicarron de Pollo (marinated chicken fried and served with salsa), as well as the Empanadas, with some reviewers suggesting them as an accompaniment to Ceviche.  In the entree world, the Lomo Saltodo (Top Sirloin steak with onions and fried potatoes) takes top honors, with several mentions of the Pargo Rojo (crispy whole Red Snapper), and the Pollo Latino.

In the beverage category, Sangria is raved about over and over (and over), but the wine list also gets high marks, with good selections from Chile, Argentina, and Spain, both by the glass and by the bottle.  Interestingly, there's not a lot of chatter about dessert.  Guess everyone's full from all the ceviche and sirloin.

Service:  Warm, friendly, and generally good pacing.  While there are a few bad experiences cited, most people found the staff warm and inviting for such a popular spot.  

Atmosphere:  "Crowded", "Noisy", "Fun".  About what you'd expect from a spot that has 267 reviews already to its name.

There you have it, the Cliffs Notes version of Limon reviews.
author: Hugh B.

description:
This was the first restaurant my boyfriend took me to in SF so I may be a little biased, but that doesn't mean I'm wrong!  I'm not sure I would call it a scene, but definitely more energy than most upscale area restaurants and yes, the bar is crowded.  I didn't find it to be too loud, but there were only two of us and we have a trick.  We've dined at nearly 100 great restaurants in the city and we always sit next to each other.  Always.  We have never once been forced to sit across from each other and only twice has it even been questioned (Incanto and Blvd - we still won.)  Much easier to hear and to share great food!  Also, if you're already on the phone or online to make a reservation - make a request about seating.

I have to agree with the other reviewers about the service.   It's average on a good night and they're anxious to rush you through.  Entirely different cuisine, but Foreign Cinema does a MUCH better job of accomodating a larger party (6+) who want to course their dinners at the same pace and hear each other.

Do you need one more person to tell you how great the ceviche is?  If so, here it is.  I've had  ceviche at several places in town and nothing else compares.  We also had the Vieres con Foie Gras and the Picante de Mariscos.  The food is excellent and worth going back for if you can be oblivious to everything else and dine in your own little bubble.  It helps to sit next to each other!
author: P J.

description: One of the best restaurants ever! I went here for my birthday dinner one year and it had a great ambiance, and everything on the menu was amazing! Love this place!
author: Heather C.

description:
i'm sort of a newbie in town and it's always exciting to eat at a new place, so when my guy and i were driving around looking for a place to have dinner one night, we ended up at Limon.  From the moment I walked in and one of their friendly staff who was off his shift and on his way home gave us a warm and friendly "hello, enjoy your dinner", I was impressed.  The impression continued throughout our meal from the decor inside to dessert.

Our waiter was more than competent.  He actually took the time to explain the different appetizers and entrees and made his suggestions without being pushy.  They were really attentive with coming over to refill your water and taking the empty plates away.

We ended up getting a ceviche and the ribs for the appetizer, then got the red snapper for the entree and the warm flourless chocolate cake for dessert.  All I have to say is...OH MY GOODNESS! :)
author: Sally T.

description:
My boyfriend made reservations for us to come on a Saturday night...it was really loud when we got there.  The host was an absolute delight and a perfect gentleman.  We were seated right on time.  We started off with sangria which was quite refreshing.  As for the service, I give the waiters my triple "A"r rating: Attentive, Awesome, and Attractive!  Very professional.  As for the food....we stuffed our faces that night.  This coming week, we were going to start this crazy exercise regimen....so we ate like it was the last meal of our lives.  We had the following:
  
Tartara de Atun
Empanadas
Lomo Saltado
This yummy saffron rice dish with seafood..I forget the name..so F'ing good!!
And this decadent carrot cake with ice cream
4 glasses of sangria

We demolished everything.  There really wasn't a crumb in sight.  The couple next to each ordered a side of spinach and SHARED one fish dish.  SHARED.  I felt like such a glutton...but I was so satisfied with my whole experience, I didn't care.  

Like I said, it's not the quietest restaurant...on a Saturday night, I think a 9pm reservation is perfect.  Take someone you like to Limon...he or she will be impressed.  Bon appetit!
author: happy t.

description:
This place is very overrated.  The food was ok, but nothing to rave about.  What I must complain about was the service. The hostess was a complete b*tch...we told her that we were waiting for 2 of our party of 6 and asked if we could sit down (we had a reservation). She sat us down. Then she came by and demanded very rudely: "where is your party?  You can't sit here without your whole party."  We were like, we told you, they will be here in 2 minutes.  She walked away but glared at us until our friends came.  

Then the waiters...we ordered a lot of appetizers and main dishes to share tapas-style.  I was eating off my small plate, literally I had the fork on the food on the plate and the waiter moved it so that he could put down a dish!  That really pissed me off. I have never had that happen at a restaurant.  

Then later another waiter decided it was time to clean the table and began removing dishes, even though there was food on them and several people were obviously still eating!  He picked up a plate of shrimp ceviche that had shrimp left, I had to grab it out of his hand.  We felt like they were trying to rush us out.
author: Rebecca B.

description:
Food: 4 stars

We started with a couple of different ceviches, both of which were good, if not totally memorable.  We had 7 people in our group and ordered 4 ceviches, which was just about the right amount as far as appetizers go.  For dinner, I had the pork chop, which was delicious. It was well seasoned and cooked perfectly.  Definitely a highlight.  We did try the mac and cheese, which had been recommended by several people.  It, like the ceviche wasn't bad, but I wouldn't go out of my way to get it either.  

Service: 2 stars

We had a group of 7 coming in for an 8:00 reservation, which I had made on Monday.  We arrived at 8:00, but didn't get seated until 9:30.  Look, I understand that you won't always be seated right at your reservation time, but 90 minutes is a joke. To make matters worse, Limon has very limited bar space, so there isn't a lot of "overflow" room for those parties who are waiting for a table.  We basically stood by the hostess' desk the entire time.  I felt bad for the hostess, who was polite, because there wasn't much she could do (other than offer us wine or an appetizer for our patience, which she didn't do). 

Once we were seated, service was fine.  No complaints.  The long wait left a bad taste in my mouth, though.  I would definitely NOT recommend Limon for a group, unless you're coming early in the evening or at off times.  The food, while good, certainly doesn't justify the wait.
author: Kent E.

description:
Four of us went to Limon for a bday dinner Saturday night.  We waited for two minutes at the bar but were then promptly seated. 
From the very beginning of the evening I felt good, most likely due to the delicious sangria which kept me buzzed all night. Our food was fabulous, the calamari was amazing as was the ceviche limon. I had the short ribs and cleaned my plate easily. Now it may have been the happy buzz I had but it was a great evening, service was excellent and although it was loud we could hear each other fine. The only down side was our table was close to the door so we were constantly getting a cold draft, they need to heat the place more after all it does get awfully cold this time of year. Oh and dessert wasn't very good, I'd skip it next time.
author: Meg L.

description: Always delicious, good cocktails, and excellent service. A tremendous value for the price.
author: Chris M.

description:
Oh Limon, you broke my heart.  Maybe my expectations of you were too high because I had just gotten back from Peru and wanted to relive the extraordinary culinary experience I had there.  I will forever blame Peru for ingraining the "perfect potato" in my head.  Coming to Limon and paying $18 for lomo saltado is just recockulous people.  And it was just OK.  The soup appetizer was so salty that I drank water like it was going out of style.  

Oh and btw, you're very noisy Limon.  What is up with all these restaurants in the Mish and their terrible acoustics?!?  At least my waiter was nice.  I didn't have the heart to tell him I took one for the team that night.
author: Emily C.

description:
I'm no expert in South American cuisine, but I loved my dinner at Limon.  

I went in a group of four people.  We began with a white wine (I can't remember which anymore; only that it was quite good) and three ceviches.  My favorite was the ceviche limon, although there was no clear loser among the limon and the other two (ceviche de pescado and choros a la chalaca.)  I ordered the Parihuela ( Peruvian Bouillabaise), a pot of fresh seafood but no starch, hence the boillabaise comparison  I also tasted some of the Seco de Costilla; it was a much heavier dish, but also quite quite a good one. We passed on dessert, as no one was hungry enough, but the options sounded divine. Don't pass up an offer to visit Limon; I found the entire dining experience excellent, and I can't wait to return!

A few reviewers have mentioned the noise level; it wasn't much of a problem for us, although we were seated against the back wall on the second floor. If you're at all noise sensitive, I'd recommend similar seating; from our perch, we could watch the busy bar and first floor, but we weren't able to hear most of it.
author: Christina C.

description:
This place has been on my list of places to try for almost as long as I've been living in SF and I finally made it the other night.

First off the service was fabulous.  The waiters were very attentive.  We got lucky because without reservations on a Thursday night at prime dinner time 730ish we were seated immediately- i had been prepared to go somewhere else since there is usually a wait, but this was a pleasant surprise.  We were put at the table closest to the open kitchen area- which at first I was worried about, but turned out not to be a problem at all.  

It didn't seem that loud which surprised me being so close to the kitchen and to a large party and the table next to ours.  I was able to hear and didn't have to talk above a normal level to be heard.  This is def different from several other places i've been as of late in the mission.  Also the ambiance is very nice- soft lighting, warm dark wood interior- very pleasant.

We decided not to get any starters since neither of us were especially starving.  They did have a pretty extensive wine list to get through, but i settled on a glass of sauv blanc which was just what i was looking for.  They brought us nice bread and then a little shot of sweet potato cheese soup which was very yummy. 

I got the pollo latino that came with some of the truffle mac and cheese as well as some broccoli.  Now I am absolutely not a expert on Peruvian food- i've never been to Peru and this is probably the only restaurant that claims to be peruvian that i've been to, but it was good.   My chicken was extremely moist , flavorful and in a very well sized portion.  The mac and cheese was delicious.  The presentation was well done as well.  

I will have to come back to try out the ceviche and desserts.  Overall a very pleasant dining experience.
author: Maria F.

description:
Still good.

Was once here a few years ago and was very pleasantly surprised.  Not only was the food excellent, but the presentation and layers of complexity were very refreshing.  I recall the overall experience being quite good.  From the decor to the service, I would have given it high marks.

Fast forward to the reopening...

Not quite to the same level as before, but still very good.  We had a party of 10 and the place was PACK A MAX.  Unfortunately, this restaurant really struggles with the space and the number of tables they're trying to turn over.  Difficult is how I would describe it.

But other than that, the food still shines.  From the ceviches (all very tasty and not too acidic - tuna was VERY GOOD), to the apps (chicken skewers were ok, but the ribs, empanadas and tuna were the favorites), and finally the entrees (too many to list but I had the pescado picante - fish was just right with a nice rich sauce, but the rice terrine although good was a little on the dry side).  It's a good experience and everyone was pretty satisfied with the various dishes and flavors.

I did not try any of their drinks, but they were quite the hit.  Loved their bar.

Service was decent, but again ... way too many patrons I felt.

Overall, I'd still recommend it eventhough prices are on the high side.
author: Patrick K.

description: Horrible service. Waited for an hour for our reservation at 8:30 on a Saturday. Weren't seated until after 9:30pm. Food was good, but wouldn't recommend unless you are not hungry when you arrive, and have a 3 hour window for dinner.
author: Cynthia M.

description:
2 stars is ONLY b/c the food was delicious. The service was disappointing.

Group of 6 ordered: Antichuchos de pollo and mac & cheese (to start); then Pargo Rojo (red snapper) and Churrasco (Ribeye) for entrees. Everything was delicious, especially the red snapper. Presentation is nice and portions are plentiful. Prices are reasonable and I would recommend this place for the food. 

BUT BEWARE: the service is not great (to put it nicely). A friend of mine was proposing to his girlfriend, so he had made reservations for 6 at 9:00pm for an upstairs table. At 9:30, they seat us at a tiny table against the bar (not comfy and not intimate at all). We again ask for an upstairs table and they keep telling us 'just 10 more minutes' - which then turns into almost an hour. So don't bother making reservations - your table will not be ready on time, nor will your request be taken into consideration. In fact, the 2 hostesses were incredibly unprofessional, as well as the guy in the collared shirt helping seat guests (manager??). We almost left b/c they were so rude and unaccommodating. And they knew there was going to be a proposal!! (Side note: our waitress and busboy were friendly and helpful, so nothing against them.)

My suggestion: dont make reservations, sit at the bar and enjoy the food.
author: Marina R.

description:
Here is your menu for the night.

Apps- Ceviche de Pescado (halibut)
Main Course- Picante de Mariscos (great sauce) or Churrasco a la Parilla
Dessert- Bandido

Friendly staff.  Sangria a little on the sweet side for my taste buds.  Can be a long wait on weekends even with a reservation but well worth it.  Portions are healthy so come with an appetite.  Parking is horrible.

Oh yeah- Bread and butter= Crack!
author: Lonnie A.

description:
Ahhh, Limon. They serve a couple of things here that I count amongst my  favorite dishes and I'm almost always blown away when finished. Last night was the sole exception. 

My daughter and I arrived (a Monday night) and were seated immediately despite the fact that we were a few minutes early and the house was packed. We ended up waiting a long time for our service to arrive and even longer between courses. I ordered a glass of Cava (A Priori) and we both decided on the Sopa del Dia which happened to be a Butternut Squash cream. The soup was excellent and despite the long wait was served hot. For my entree I ordered the Lomo Saltodo (traditional Peruvian dish of Top Sirloin slices sauted with onions, tomatoes and fries, served with a side of rice). My daughter ordered the Pargo Rojo (crispy whole red snapper basket, served with stir fried coconut rice and rocoto curry sauce). We also ordered a side of Mac n Cheese (with truffles). I went with a glass of the 2003 Los Vascos de Lafite Rothschild Cabernet.

For the first time, I was disappointed with the snapper. It had a strong fishy taste. I guess the old adage warning not to order fish on a Monday was proven wise. The beef was tough and stringy. The Mac n Cheese was perfect, as always. The wine was fine. I was kicking myself that I hadn't ordered the Ceviche de Pescado, one of my favorite dishes in the city. We ended up with a tab over $100 and left the entrees pretty much untouched. What a shame.

I've eaten here enough in the past to know that both the unfortunate meals and the slow service are exceptions to prove the rule. I will certainly be back...but likely not on a Monday.
author: Gary C.

description:
i liked it better when it was at its old location.

new place looks trendy. love the color scheme.

food, way too salty. more water please.
author: Lauren Y.

description:
The food was good, not great.  The "house margaritas" were delicious, except they charged us for top shelf tequila.  They did change the price after we questioned it. Hmm..
THE CLINCHER for this bad review was this - after paying the bill, we were sitting at our table chatting when the hostess approached us and asked if we would leave the table, as many guests were waiting for tables!  
This is the rudest treatment I have ever received at a restaurant. I strongly recommend against eating at this establishment!
author: Jill V.

description: I was NOT impressed with this place at all. The portions were tiny (even for a child), the chicken...ive had better. The yellow sauces...FRESCA's is much yummier and tastier. The chicharon was dark meat and its supposed to be white meat and the sauce for that was lacking in flavor and the amount given wouldnt have even been enough for 1/4 of the plate. Super expensive for what is offered.
author: Mariapaz J.

description:
The service was amazing and attentive. On a Tuesday night I got a nice table, it was slow, not too noisy either.
Red snapper - unexpected original presentation, tasted fresh and seasoned well.
Truffle Mac - melted in my mouth
Scallops- light appetizer with zesty dipping sauce
author: sarah l.

description:
If you want to wow someone with great food, this is the place to be. 

We ordered the Pargo Rojo-Whole Crispy Red Snapper, Coconut Fried Rice, Rocoto-Curry Sauce, very nice presentation and tasty. 

The Lomo Saltado-Wok-Tossed Sirloin Fingers with Red Onion, Tomato & Soy, French Fries and likewise, elegant and juicy. 

For dessert, we had the Chocolate Bandido| Limon's Favorite! Warm Chocolate cake served with Passion Fruit Mousse, it was a blast! The price is very reasonable given the high quality of the dish. 

Ratings:
Quality of Food - 5
Ambiance - 4
Service - 3 (The server was busy with other tables so we felt ignored...)
= 4
author: Harry L.

description:
Not bad but not excellent...
I enjoy Peruvian food and my go to place was Fina Estampa until it closed (the one on Mission Street, I don't like the one on Vanness).  So this place is a nice replacement but the prices are just too much in my opinion and although the food is good I don't see a reason to come here often other than those random Lomo Saltado, Ceviche or Chicha Morada cravings.  
I guess I shouldn't compare a mom and pop Peruvian restaurant to a upscale Peruvian restaurant but I miss the mom and pop feel and Fina's corn starter and garlic oil bread dip and the hefty portions of food accompanied by white rice with corn...Mmm...but if you do go to Limon, you must have the Lomo Saltado ( steak strips with tomatoes and onions and french fries all cooked together served over rice...my fave).
author: Karen B.

description:
ok, unless there's been a drastic change w/in a week...Limon is certainly not closed! I was there over memorial day weekend and had an absolutely fantastic meal. A group of girlfriends and I were in town to be reunited w/ some of our dear friends across the coast and we ventured to the Mission for a fun night out and some tasty dinner. I think a reservation was hard to come by, but I'm SO glad that we were able to get a table (a cozy booth for 6 of us tucked in the back so we could hear each other, bonus points!) because this was one of the better meals I've had in a long, long time. 

To start, its a great place for sharing lots of plates. I'm not a huge ceviche person, but my girlfriends ordered the trio of ceviches and basically licked their plates clean. We also got the empanada's & the Chicarron de pollo and both were delicious...particularly the the chicken w/ its unexpected kick and tangy lime sauce!

Onto dinner...we wanted to sample a ton of different things so we basically order several main corses and sides and pigged out.  Now typically, I'm a chicken girl- and we ordered the Pollo Latino (served w/ truffle mac & cheese, OMG!) and it was quite good...but the real standout of our meal was the braised short ribs. I love me some delicious short ribs and these were some of the best I've ever had...they were perfectly prepared and so tender! Even my friends who don't love red meat had to admit they were scrumptious. 

We finished it off w/ the molton chocolate cake and walked away very fat-happy. Success!
author: molly f.

description:
I swear to god I'm not one of those hysterical Yelp people; I don't think I've ever written a negative review.  With the promise that I'm just a normal person like you, I feel compelled to say that Limon was genuinely one of the worst dining experiences of my life.  The story goes something like this.

I had a lunch date with a girlfriend.  We wanted to drink.  Groupon was selling a Limon deal for half off a $40 lunch or brunch.  Why not?  Groupons are perfect for getting your actual money's worth at overpriced Mission psuedo-ethnic yuppie restaurants.  I bought the Groupon (this was the only redeeming quality of the whole experience), made a reservation as per its request (but seriously, have you ever made a reservation for a weekday lunch in your entire life?), and trotted off to 16th and Valencia.

When we got to the restaurant, there was a line maybe 6 people long, about half of whom had also made reservations, a hostile hostess, and a packed dining room.  Are you kidding me?  Is this the power Groupon has in this town?  The hostess told us we could wait in line or at the bar.  She made no effort to distinguish between the patrons who had made reservations and those who hadn't.  We watched a six-top sit empty for thirty minutes before anyone thought to separate the tables and actually seat people.  Finally, after waiting forty minutes (WITH A RESERVATION), she seated us.  No apology, no consolation prizes, nothing.

Making the best of it, we ordered some Bloody Marys and food.  I believe the order of items we were given went like this: ceviche (hers), Bloody Marys (both of us), truffle mac-and-cheese (hers), chicharron de pollo (mine), chimichurri fries (mine), all separated by about ten minutes between dishes.  After being informed that the restaurant didn't have ketchup (seriously?), the server failed to even bring me the salt or any form of dipping sauce that I'd politely requested.  

I feel bad punishing the servers in this review, because as a former service industry professional, I know that management does shit like selling a Groupon without telling the staff all the time, but the service was pathetic.  If the food had been great, I might have reconsidered this review, but it was mediocre at best--the chicken was dry, the supposed chimichurri fries were just soggy, lukewarm fries with Italian seasoning dumped on them.  The Bloody Marys were good, at least, but the food portions were so small that I was wasted one one drink by the time we left.  

The only good part of the meal was getting the bill for four dollars at the end--thanks, Groupon (and also, fuck you).  I will never go back to Limon.
author: Laura G.

description: Had a reservation and was asked to wait almost a hour. Hostess was rude. I would of liked to try the food but they made it difficult.
author: Clarence W.

description:
We liked it so much we came twice in 2 weeks.

There's a lot to choose from so we like to come with in small groups so that we can order more dishes. On our 2 trips, we tried:
Yuca fries (our fav! even better than regular potato. chunky, crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside. i crave these. good enough on their own but served with 2 yummy sauces)
sweet potato fries (nice but can't beat the yuca fries)
beef heart (tender like steak. delicious)
chicarron de pollo (great recommendation from our waiter. also delicious)
pork ribs (another great recommendation from our waiter. we were hesitant to order saint louis style pork ribs in a peruvian restaurant but we were glad we did. crispy on the outside, juicy and tender inside. i LOVED the coleslaw as well. perfect complement to the ribs and mayo-free and fresh tasting. can i have the recipe please??)
ceviche de pescado (nice and light cold plate to balance the heavier meaty hot plates. tangy and served with yummy choclo/huge corn and sweet potato)
ensalada rusa (nice but too heavy with too much starch/root veg. i'd rather save my carb allotment for the yuca fries. i'm not usually a fan of beetroot but it was perfect with the salad dressing)
i was not a fan of the jalea or the stuffed calamari. the breading was disappointingly not crispy. the sauce for the calamari was too briny and tasted too strongly of preserved artichoke and black olives.

there's not much choice of desserts. we had the warm chocolate cake which was not imaginative but still good.

drinks are also good. i liked the divina pasion and my husband loves the chicha morada.

service is good and brisk (food comes really fast!) and you definitely need reservations cos it's bustling! i can't wait to try the rotisserie chicken at their sister restaurant :-)
author: pj n.

description:
Peruvian cuisine? Peru's full of mountains. This restaurant's food's gonna suck.

Well, it surely doesn't. But this place is up-scale, kids. A $30 sangria pitcher? It'd better have Cristal somewhere in it. Okay, I'll settle for the cinnamon sticks at the bottom of the pitcher that gives the sangria a really interesting kick. Loaded with fruit too. And eating that fruit, after 3 glasses of said sangria, is a trip down drunky lane...

Anyway, about the food. I ordered the chicken breast with truffle-topped macaroni and cheese, and this was, hands down, the tastiest chicken I've ever had in my life. Ever. It was topped with this tangy sauce that was out of this world. I'm never eating chicken again, I couldn't stand the torment.

Service was impeccable, decor was cool and intimate and kinda dark, and it was an all-round enjoyable meal - the place was hopping for a Sunday night too.

I left half-drunk and fully satisfied. What more can you ask for?
author: Drew S.

description: Outstanding food and service! The ceviche was outstanding, and the crispy snapper was amazing. Fresh, tasty, and left me wanting more. High recommend! Brandon, the bartender, was wonderful to his guests and makes a great margarita.
author: Robyn W.

description:
I took a friend of mine here for dinner and as always, I was blown away by the quality of the food!  We had 8:00 PM reservations, but arrived a little early.  After reading a couple of the Yelp reviews, I was a little apprehensive about waiting regardless if a reservation was made or not. Fortunately for us, we were promptly seated.  

Limon, for me, has alway amazed me.  For starters we had the veggie empanadas, the flavours was explosive and the sauce that accompanied it complimented the empanadas really well.  We had mojitos, and I have to say, they're the best.  I had the mango mojito.  For our entree's, I had my favourite lomo saltado and my friend had the pargo rojo.  The presentation of each dish was beautiful I didn't want to dig in.  However, the scent of how good the food was overpowered the I dug right it.  My dish was good, but a little on the salty side.  Regardless, I finished it.  For our dessert, we shared the Trufa Helada de Cafe, and OMG it was truly a delight.

The server we had was very attentive.  Overall, it was an amazing dinner and I can't wait to go back!
author: Anna M.

description: Had dinner last night with my 10 year old...surprisingly she liked everything on the menu.  We had truffle mac and cheese, which is satisfying for a 10 year old AND an adult's palate, yuca frita, which were very good (although they had a few tough fibers, as yuca does) and not dry (which yuca can be), braised short ribs with carrots and peas, very good, soft beef and great "sauce".  The only disappointment was the chicken chicharrones, which were bite-sized pieces of boneless fried chicken.  It was way overdone, therefore dry.  The roast chicken looked like a much better choice.
author: Mike B.

description:
Great Peruvian food!  You absolutely must try their ceviches--tastes so good! 

Check out this review from the San Jose Mercury: http://www.mercextra.com/pn/modules.php?op=modload&name=Reviews&file=index&req=showcontent&id=63
author: Kit E.

description:
Service: non-existent, our waiter would disappear for a minimum of 30 minutes and we did not receive our food for at least 1 hour and 30mins after we sat down.  Food: way too salty.  Ambience: louder than cock fight.
And eating up on the terrace or loft balcony thing was disappointing for the person who had to look to the back wall to see the visible pipes and vents, basically making it look like some no permit in-law add on.
author: J S.

description: Great food, best shared family style. We had a bunch of dishes but the roasted chicken and sweet potato fries were the winner- hands down! The Sangria here is delicious, one of the best I've tried. Service was good.
author: Laura K.

description:
I do not work for Limon. I will not receive a free ceviche punch card for writing this, although perhaps I should call them and check if I might. Hold on one second. I'll call them. Hold on. 

Well. Absolutamente nada gratis. Pero gracias, pana, por el review. 

I eat at Limon once a week. I am from Ecuador, and since there's no Ecuadorian restaurants in San Francisco, Peruvian food is the closest to home food, although my mother never cooked us ceviche at home, so perhaps I mean home as in Guayaquil. 

The drinking rituals of my all-male Catholic high school always culminated with ceviche the next morning. It was supposed to soak up the alcohol, and since I was not one to say no to rituals, for four years I sampled all types of ceviches, in all types of establishments, reputable and not so much.

It occurs to me as I write this that perhaps I am not the most reliable reviewer. I was, after all, always hangover when I had ceviches back in Ecuador. I guess my reliability depends on whether you believe booze impairs the palate.

In any case. You know how the facile narrative structure of this review ends. 

Something like: "even though I have tried all types of etc. etc., the ceviche Limon is among the best." 

Try the ceviche sampler, the empanadas, the picante the mariscos, los choros a la chalaca, and ask them to reinstate the Causa de Mariscos.
 
And unlike Fresca, that center of seafood scrimp, their portions are not tiny.
author: Mauro C.

description:
My review is just for the Braised Shortrib, I didn't have anything else (oh, I did have their complimetary bread; not good, felt it was too dry).

The $23.00 braised shortrib was good. It's mediallion shaped with one bone. The meat was VERY tender, you can use your knife to cut it. Tastey. It was served over mashed potato, equally good. Some baby carrot sticks, not good... it was cooked, but crunchy in an uncooked sort of way. I would have prefered if the entire carrot was steamed and soft all the way through, not soft on the outside and crunchy on the inside. The peas felt they had been frozen in their lifetime, and not properly cooked/steamed/prepared.

Sat upstairs, sorta of ok... I wouldn't want to sit up here on a hot summer day. Tonight, it was freezing cold outside, yet it was toasty up here.
author: qirk z.

description:
A long wait at Beretta had us looking for other options. Limon was on the list & we were very happy with the choice. Got the following : 

Ceviche - forget the specific type, but the sauce was good
Trigo and Vegetales con Pesto - yummy. Got this one again for our veggie person since we all demolished it .
Empanadas - not bad.
Tartare de Tuna - also very good. 
Lomo Saltado - was quite salty. We asked them if it was supposed to be so salty. They took back the dish and got another one. Still was quite salty. 
Mac & Cheese with truffle oil - good, but not as good as Grub
Got the mojadita and asked them to make it less sweet. Very nice & refreshing.
author: Nilofer M.

description:
I loved this place when it was on 17th street between Mission & Valencia. Great food, awesome service, love that the owner is also the manager. Very hands on. If you ate you likely spoke to him and never realized he's also the owner. It lost some of it's coziness when it moved to Valencia. But now they've moved again to S. Van Ness at 21st.

Can't wait to see the new space!
Love love love the chicken breast with cheese shells in truffle oil....
author: ian m.

description:
Limon truly is in a league of it's own. 

Calamari: I know, I know...you've had calamari at every other restaurant in the Bay Area, BUT you haven't had Limon's calamari. Empanadas: So good! Please don't say, "Oh I can make this at home" because you can't. Halibut Ceviche: One of a kind. You'll find the corn they serve with it is a wonderful compliment. Chicharrones: Crispy fried chicken Peruvian style. Very tasty. Scallops & Foie Gras: Beautiful dish, interesting combination. Make sure they cook the foie all the way. Red Snapper: Stunning dish. Sleek presentation. Incredible flavors! Has Asian influence.

The Sangria is awesome. They have another drink that is made from purple corn - it's very refreshing - sorry, i forgot the name of it. 

Folks, this place is a gem. It's really unsuspecting as it sits in the Mission District. It's pricey, I won't lie to you. Nevertheless it's a great place to take out of town guests or to treat your best friend to an exquisite meal and definitely a place you want to take that special first or second date. You want to win someone's heart? - Limon will win it for you I'm certain!

I hope you enjoy it!
author: Riz B.

description:
4.5 stars is most accurate. I've been twice now, and the first time was a good experience, the second time a great experience! I tried the Chicharroon de Pollo (fried chicken) the first time and didn't like it so I didn't order it the second time. 
I have to recommend the Limon Ceviche as well as the Quinotto de Vegetales as I was pleasantly surprised both times! The Pechuga de Pato (duck) is awesome as well!
author: Ranka M.

description:
My best friend and I have been to Limon numerous times, and every time, it's been delicious food and good service.

Our last visit, however, at around 6:30 p.m. on a Tuesday, completely wiped that slate clean. We will NEVER go back.

When we walked in, the place was empty, save for a few tables with some people having after-work drinks. The hostess was at the back of the restaurant, talking with other staff. Eventually, she came over, didn't even say "hello," and just waited us for to say something. We were then seated.

We already knew what we wanted, which was the vegetarian ceviche. When we looked on the menu, however, it wasn't there, so we asked the same hostess, who seemed to also be our server, whether they still served it. Immediately, she said, "No." No explanation (we were clearly there to eat dinner and were starving). She pointed to this beet salad on the menu, said, "There's this." Since the vegetarian ceviche doesn't really call for any rare ingredients, we asked if she could find out if the kitchen could still make it. "Fine, I'll find out." [For the record, the vegetarian ceviche is why we came here.] 

She comes back, and tells us they can make it. She then walks away. We were wondering where the bread and dips they usually serve before their meals were, so after five or so minutes, I asked her. She said they don't have bread anymore. Then walked away.

Within two minutes, our "ceviche" was ready. Somehow, the server manages to put one plate down on our table, while spilling the leche de tigre from the other plate all over the floor AND MY FRIEND'S SHOES. The server looks down, puts the now half-empty plate down in front of me, AND WALKS AWAY.

No apology, no nothing. A busboy comes to wipe the mess off the floor and the server hands my friend a napkin. We were seriously in shock. THEN, the server has the nerve to say, in the most degrading tone, "I'll buy you new shoes if you want," and walks away. I don't know where she keeps walking off to, but, remember, there's hardly anyone else in the restaurant!

To top it all off, we look down at our food, and it is horrible. They put three large chunks of tomatoes, a few pieces of corn, and one stalk of broccoli on the plate. What their ceviche used to be was these finely sliced vegetables, layer upon layer. I don't know what this shit was, and I don't even want to know how much they were going to charge us for these "off-menu" plates.

We got up to leave, and the server, who still hasn't even uttered the word sorry for ruining my friend's suede shoes, says "It was an honest mistake." Bullshit. If you can't manage to carry two plates without spilling them on your customers, maybe you're not cut out to be a waitress. And if you don't even have the decency to apologize when that does happen, whether it was a mistake or not, maybe you're not cut out to interact with other human beings.

Sadly, we're not the only ones who have had such a bad experience with the service recently. When I was reading Cyndy L.'s review of 7/30/2010, I was nodding my head in agreement the whole way through.
author: unnati g.

description: Went to Limon with big group last Friday night.  We had to order off the prixe fix menu due to the size of our group (required for parties of 10 or more). I recommend the tuna tartar, ensalada rusa, empanadas, and chicharron de pollo. I was pleased with the cocktail list and the sangria was good, but nothing special. The food was 35/person and we all felt that we got enough to eat. We were ecstatic about the price, but we drove the bill up with cocktails.. oops and ended up paying about 60/person. We felt taken care of by the staff and he food was really good.. all in all, it was a really positive experience.
author: Mollie E.

description: WOW! This place goes above and beyond. I got a chance to go here on my birthday and was not let down. The decor inside is absolutely amazing. The food is fresh, bountiful, and delicious. Our server was very knowledgeable on the wine list. We had the chicken appetizer which was fabulous. Not under or over cooked. Soft and juicy as it should be. I had the Ceviche Limon, which was amazing as a meal. The seafood was fresh and just right. Not too crazy. Their sangria was great as well. I couldn't enjoy it that much as was super hung over. I highly recommend this place.
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
Limon is hands down one of the best restaurants in San Francisco.  Just there last night and it just never fails to impress me.  

Must haves:
Sangria ( I mean, I would drown myself in this stuff....)
Any of the cebiche (ceviche -- they sp. differently though)
the sushi grade-fish in the leche sauce (amazing!!)
side of the truffle mac & cheese (read that again - truffle mac & cheese!)

Service:
I think it's awesome, and I've been there a few times now and I think they are starting to recognize me, which is a major plus -- I love feeling like regular.

cost is pretty great for the amount of food and dining experience too.  It's my new favorite place to take friends and family from out of town. 

Overall 5 stars easily.  Can't wait to go back.
author: Sam E.

description:
Half of our group left hungry! That is not a good sign. But the food was amazingly tasty! Just not filling. 

And they didn't have Pescado a lo Macho *sigh* so high maintenance.
author: MiYong E.

description:
A fabulous dining experience all the way around. Flexible when I called and said we'd be 30 minutes late, efficient even though it was pretty packed on a Friday night, with warm, professional service. 

Food standouts for me were the melt-in-your mouth scallops with foie gras, four types of ceviche (you choose from the extensive choices), mussels to die for, and the huge 12 oz steak, perfectly cooked, with chimmichuri sauce (I need to bathe in this stuff). 

The wine was secondary for me--the zinfandel and malbec by the glass that we had at the bar were pretty unimpressive. The bottle we had at the table was better and matched the food well (despite the great diversity of carnage!), but was still relatively uninspired. 

Dessert: The muscat and hot, gooey chocolate cake with house-made ice cream were seriously porn. 

The cost for what you get is just right. The only reason that this is a 4- versus 5-star review is because of the noise level. Even if we didn't happen to be sitting next to a pack of screeching cougars (you had to be there, it was an ungodly racket!) that I was sure would never leave, the green-eyed boy and I could hardly hear each other over our small table until the crowd thinned. 

This is a new Mission favorite for me, I'm just sorry it took me so long to make the acquaintance!
author: Gretchen T.

description:
(FYI: This review was long overdue... I ate at the old location.)

For the food, Limon definitely deserves a 5 star rating... now their service? Eh. Not so much. The only issue I had was although I had a reservation for my sister's birthday, they took forever AND THEN some to seat us. But, I'm a pig and they won my heart over with the food and sangria. (PS. Their sangria is way better than Cha Cha Cha's "famous" sangria)

I had the Lomo Saltado as an entree and oooooh my goodness, I licked my plate CLEAN! Juicy juicy JUICY delicious meat flavored perfectly with the sweetness of the grilled onions and tomatoes and balanced out by the salty fries. I drenched my rice in the juices and devoured every last drop! 

Sidenote: Yeah it's kind of pricey but how can you put a price on a good meal?! Atleast they have decently sized portions! Delicious food + bulging stomach = who cares how much it costs! That's my theory anyway... but then again I'm a pig.
author: Beverly T.

description: OK - went back for lunch on a Friday (12/23) with some friends visiting from Sweden.  Restaurant was pretty empty, the music was so loud we had to shout and they were playing NEW COUNTRY music, totally disgusting.  Food was mediocre - chicken came out super dry and the ceviche was not very fresh.  Service was strained and one of the servers had a huge, open, bloody cut on his hand.  Almost as disgusting as the loud country music.  I am on the fence whether I will go back again.
author: Deb S.

description:
Finally, I got a chance to eat here and see what all the hype is about.

Aiming to eat healthy, I hoped Limon would have some healthier options that wouldn't taste like crap.

They succeeded!  All the ingredients were really fresh and I enjoyed almost everything about our meal.  We ordered the Ceviche Limon with mixed seafood which was good, but I could have done without the octopus and the corn that accompanied.  The roasted corn was slightly gritty, and the steamed corn was pretty tasteless.  We also ordered the tuna tartar, which I really enjoyed because it was spicy and the quality of the tuna was good.  They could work on the presentation, however because it came out looking very similar to a raw hamburger patty.  Finally, we finished off our meal with the Arroz con Mariscos, which was similar to paella and very tasty.  

However, one thing I didn't really like was the sangria.  Supposedly they used to have a really good white wine sangria, which is no longer on the menu.  So we tried the red wine sangria which was ok, but not better than Cha Cha Cha's.  

I'll be back.
author: Genevieve M.

description: We had drinks & dinner at Limon on Valencia last Saturday night with 5 friends...the bar was packed, as was the restaurant.  Our bartender, Armando, mixed some stellar cocktails...Try the Pisco sour, Chilqano de Uva, and Don Carlitos.  When our table was ready, the service was very attentive.  Darren and his staff hustle to get the food out to the tables quick.  Don't miss the pollo a la brasa (rotisserie chicken), ceviche de pescado (that night it was tai snapper...our fave dish of the night), carne a la parrilla (marinated hanger steak), and yuca fries.  All delish.  The combination of friendly staff and yummy food and drinks in a lively atmosphere made the night really enjoyable.
author: Sasha K.

description:
I've taken all of my out-of-town guests to Limon and they love it! I can't bring myself to try something other than the Lomo Saltado---it's THAT good. The chicharron de pollo rocks, and if you want a great and authentic non-alcoholic drink, order the chicha morrada. Their Peruvian beer, Cusquena, is quite good. We're always too full for dessert. The servers and staff are very friendly--though I've noticed they're all male...weird. One of the hosts wasn't very friendly to us on our last trip there, but all in all, I definitely recommend Limon and suggest booking reservations in advance.

Update: (09/07/07)
Changing from 4 to 3 stars...

I've come here a couple of times since my review, most recently with my parents, who were visiting. The prices have gone way up - 18.95 for Lomo Saltado?? For a meager portion of just a few steak bites? Craziness. The chicha was too acidic, way too much lime. They no longer offer Cusquena beer. Service (though still all-male servers) is still great, but somehow the price tag just isn't worth it for me anymore. If you do go, I still highly recommend the chicharron de pollo - the one item that actually improved since my first review!
author: Dora A.

description: Food is okay ... bu the noise level was unbearable!!! :(( ... If ever I do go back its because we ran out of options.
author: M R.

description:
Let me tell you, I love Peruvian food.  And, this place does it well in terms of their Lomo saltado, but the atmosphere is mediocre.  Last month was the first time back since the remodel and they stuck us up in the loft by ourselves, AGAIN.  I was hoping the air flow would have improved since the remodel but the smoke from the grill still rises and the air conditioning is blasted to make up for it.  

They have a great list of wine but kinda skimpy on the South American options for a Peruvian restaurant.  They were out of the one Argentinian bottle we wanted to order.  

We were so excited for the oyster shooters but they were tiny and way too salty of shot.  All the other appetizers were great and the service was great but the atmosphere needs improvement.  For an anniversary dinner, I was let down.  I MIGHT return but only for the lomo saltado and dessert.  Oh, and the ceviche is pretty good from the last time I went to Limon.
author: J J.

description:
Went here on a Saturday night...  My buddy Eric called me up 25 minutes prior to my stop at the lovely 16th & Mission BART (or "the" BART) station and said, "hey - the Michelin Guide wrote this rave review about Limon, and we must go.  Be there @ 8".

I show up on time as usual, and wait 15 minutes for the kid to show up.  Knowing he'd be late I took the opportunity to stroll around the block and when I returned the line is what most people would consider intimidating at the least.  We walk in, put our names in, hear that it will be 1 hour and 1/2 before we get a table so we decide to hover over the people comfortably seated at the bar.  I nudge my elbow in through the patrons (most of them with entrees in front of them) and manage to order a pitcher of Sangria.  I pour 2 glasses, we toast (to SF- what else) and then look around at the crowd.  I give Eric a nod, he responds with an understanding raised eyebrow and disappears over to the hostess booth.  He comes back (5 minutes later) with a big grin on his face, and about 8 minutes later the hostess comes over to us with menus ready to show us to our seats at the loft.  

I save my questions until we are seated.  "Alright", I say.  "How did you pull that off"?  He looks at me, takes a drink of Sangria, crosses his leg, opens the menu and says, "I think I'll start with the Calamari" and closes the menu.  I throw my hands up (shoulder high, open palm) and he said, "look Ben.  I just went up to the counter and smiled and asked, 'why do you hate me'?"  I laugh, he laughs, we look at the people across from us and they laugh (I'm so glad laughter is viral and contagious) and we order our plates.

Because I was on (the) BART, and because I'm a germ-a-phobe I excuse myself to wash my hands (throwing my napkin from my lap onto the table).  I come back, sit down and notice my napkin is folder rather nicely atop the table.   Apparently, one of the servers noticed that it was wrinkled and didn't meet the standard they'd like portrayed and came over to fold the thing while I was gone!  HELLO SERVICE!

Anyway, the scallops cut like warm butter and they may as well have melted in my mouth...  WOW.  

Fun, friendly, clean, exquisite dishes...  I'm going back.  Soon.
author: Benjamin G.

description:
I've been sitting here for an hour trying to figure out exactly what it is about this place that I love so much...

But i think i've been left speechless.

I heart Limon. 

Is this what real love is like??
author: Angelinaaah h.

description:
I've been here twice and the food has been consistently good. Perfect for either a date or group setting. Moderately priced. Reservations are a must. Parking is no fun. Good thing the food makes up for most of the inconveniences. 

Favorite dishes include Chicarron de Pollo, Ceviche Limon, Lomo Saltado, Churrasco a La Parilla, and Mac N Cheese with Truffle Oil (yum!). Their red wine sangria is pretty good, not too sweet compared to some of the other sangria that's out there.
author: buggy b.

description:
Okay, 660+ reviews already.....damn you people!! So, I will just keep this short and simple.

Cousin took me here for my birthday and I had one of the best birthdays ever and would never forget it. 

Waiter was very attentive, friendly and recommended some great dishes.

Favorites include the Calamari, Pargo Rojo (Awesome presentation with the red snapper. Looked a bit scary, but I suppose a dead fried fish isn't supposed to look all 'pretty' for you), Lomo Saltado (that sirloin was cooked perfect). Decent sized portions, but a bit pricey. 

Sangaria was good, but I have to side with their Mojitos. Very refreshing. They make it with Sake btw. ;D

The night ended with a complimentary Molton Chocolate Cake (Bandido). All in all wonderful experience. I would highly recommend and will definitely be coming back.....when I'm ballin'!
author: Serena W.

description: I wish I would have written a review right after my visit so that I could remember the cebiches we ordered! I know we ordered a snapper one and an ahi one and both were absolutely amazing! The fish was fresh, the flavors exactly as they should be. We also ordered a carafe of sangria and it's probably some of the very best I've had! I kept looking around me to see what other people ordered and I really cannot wait to go back!
author: Natalie M.

description: Their ceviche has got me hooked! Wait staff is pretty decent and our experience overall was a good one. Their mac & cheese w/ truffles is a must!
author: Danny K.

description: Fun menu but too many items are greasy or laden with sugary sauce. Excellent fast service, reasonably priced
author: Michael F.

description: I have been to Limon several times but the Van Ness location.  This was my first time at the one on Valencia street. I am a huge fan of the food but my experience last night was pretty horrible.  Service was slow and lackluster and in addition we found a jagged piece of plastic in our pitcher of sangria.  Got no apology or compensation from the management.  I just find that extremely classless and not a good service environment.  Shame on you Limon you lost a consistent customer.
author: Maile W.

description:
I used to work as a hostess and the management and cooks were all very clean and everything was very clean.  the staff favorite is the Lomo Saltado...and
I love the bartender...thats about it
hey mike!
author: Carmen A.

description:
Tasty cuisine, delicious sangrias, and friendly/forgetful staff! 

Went there for my friend's bday, and it was nice although, I think they forgot to sing her "happy birthday," which was a bit disappointing. It's usually packed, so you definitely need to call in advance. It definitely is overpriced, but the food is yummy. However, if you are really hungry......you might need to order more than just one plate, lol!!
author: Cheryl S.

description: After wanting to try this place for a long time, I was disappointed. Didn't think anything I had was great. Had the pollo empanadas... well, nothin' special, in fact, I don't think I would order them again if I were to go back... they were pretty tasteless. Also had the mixed salad-- eh... just a regular old salad with so-so vinaigrette. Our main course was the paella--- it was salty, wet, and nothing I would get again. I wouldn't say anything I had was bad... just not great and I don't think I would go back unless someone else I was with wanted go to... there are much better, similar restaurants in the area. Service was fine.
author: Nova R.

description:
"Premio Limn"

Well, I went to this restaurant after reading the menu on the internet and it turned out they didn't serve Papa a la Huancana (halved potatoes on cheese-pepper-milk-peanut sauce, really good). They really need to update their menu online! I thought also the food would be peruvian 100% but instead it was something called Nuevo Fusion (that's a music genre, for Satan's sake!) and well, I just ordered a Ceviche with Rocoto Sauce that was pretty decent, but not the thing I was expecting after reading so many good reviews about this place. I'm sure the chef is good, but please, don't be afraid of serving real peruvian food: Papa a la Huancana, Carapulcra, Adobo de chancho, Mondonguito, Cau Cau, Tacu Tacu... dont give me the Lomo Saltado excuse. Enough with "internationalization" which just means watering down local flavors.
author: CacaoRock J.

description:
This place blows donkey balls.  Way too overrated for its own good.  I've been here twice and both times I've walked away disappointed.  Maybe its because I live so close that I had too high of expectations for this joint....so the saying goes "don't expect too much from me, you might not be let down."  

What was good: the waiter, the Ceviche Limon and that was about it (a tad too salty for my tastes but my gf liked it)

The bad: the wait even though you have reservations (about 15 minutes); the claustrophobia inducing nightmare consisting of sitting so close to people and having waiter bump my seat every 5 minutes as they walk by; the Tatara de Atun was neither sushi grade nor fresh it was a piece of shit in my opinion with the taste consisting of a fine mineral/dirt texture (ala the famous Rutherford dust you find in find in great Rutherford cabs, good for wine, bad for fish); the mussels were ok, you can find better anywhere else in the city; the whole red snapper was fair at best, it again was too salty.

Probably will never come here again even if someone else is paying, that is how bad the food was the two times I was there.
author: Charlie C.

description: Delicious food, good cocktails, great service.
author: Jane L.

description: Ceviche Heaven!
author: Lisa R.

description:
Honestly, people... what's all the hype? Sure... great decor, great presentations... but we're here for the food... and the food ain't that great. 

Ceviche, yes... mariscos, ok... desserts, just skip them. Wam, bam, let's move on from "the scene" and try something else.
author: I Love Beef C.

description:
I had a fun time here.  Great scene - lively but not as loud as Luna Park.  The service was good - the hostess & waiter were both very friendly.  I had the Lomo Soltado, which is just as good here as it is at Frecsa.  I also had a seemingly bottomless mojito - it was in this really tall glass and I swear it took me forever to finish it (and I can usually polish off my drinks pretty fast ;).  Gotta go back again and try their ceviche, plus there were some other dishes on the menu that looked really good.

1/18/07 update - went to Limon again last Sunday.  Even though it was so cold out I just had to try the sangria.  I'm glad I did, it was so good, with lots of fruity bits!  Tried the Ceviche Limon this time and it was really good, and dessert was wonderful - I think it was called Tres Leches or something like that.  Our waiter was funny and friendly.  Bring a sweater if you're sitting in the man room because it can be drafty -- or maybe that was just because of the cold night.
author: DD B.

description: Came here on one of those first date situations, you know...where you feel like you're saying dumb things but then things end up going really well?  Anyway, the service was pretty good, the food was delicious.  We shared (which is uncommon for me because, like Joey Tribbiani, I don't share food) some Jalea, and Chicharron De Pollo. Both were really, really good. So yeah, I'd go back.
author: Jackee K.

description:
Had dinner at Limon with some friends last night and it was such a spectacular experience. The room is tastefully decorated and the eye candy is top notch. Beside being gorgeous, I think these are some of the best waiters in town.

Started it off with a bang- a pitcher of exquisite Sangria. It is not especially fruity, medium-bodied with a lovely hint of cinnamon. Next, some ceviche. Limon offers 7 types of ceviche, so we decided to go with the house-named Ceviche Limon. It was really light in lime juice with large pieces of halibut and shrimp. Scrumptious. Followed the ceviche with empanadas. The empanadas were on the larger side, but only come with two. So, if you have a large group this would not be a recommended appetizer. However, they were delicious- filled with sauteed ground meat and perfectly cooked without too much grease/oil. I would have thought they were baked if I didn't know better. 

We each ordered different entrees to get a good sample of the menu. I had the arroz con mariscos- basically a Peruvian paella. It was excellent with the perfect balance of flavors and no shortage of seafood. 

And finally, dessert.  We were treated to an assortment of desserts on the house and they were to die for. Tres Leches cake was the most perfect version I have ever tasted. It was extremely light and fluffy but had the perfect creamy flavor. Then we had three helados (ice cream) with berries. My goodness it was to die for. My fav was the coconut. YUM. 

I will most definitely be back to Limon. It is now my favorite restaurant to hit in the Mission.
author: Anna S.

description:
My goal was to try the RED SNAPPER (based on reviews & photos) .

Unfortunately, if 2 YELPERS were both there Sunday night, 
I think Purvi G got my Snapper (that sounds funny)  !!
 
So this is what our party had:

STAR for Appetizers: 
a) empanadas - yummy yummy (i wish they provided more instead of 2 per order).  Peruvian way to eat: cut it, sauce it and lime it =)
b) scallop w/ foie gois -- damn tasty.  u have to really rub in some of that sauce it comes w/.
c) Ceviche de Pescado aka  ceviche w/o mussles:   if u like citrus lime and the taste of fresh-ness halibut .. damn this is good .. MOUTH IS SALIVATING .. 

STAR for Entrees:
a) Lomo Saltodo - their Traditional Peruvian dish of  soft sirloin slices sauted with onions, tomatoes and fries - YES!
b) 12 oz Ribeye - good (brother ordered this to satisfy his end of "no meat' for 40 days)
c) Seco de Costilla - braised shortribs (SALTY)

STAR for Dessert:
Tres de leches:  brother & wife enjoyed it (said it was interesting)
Panna cotta:  it was good, refreshing but I wished I had orderd the Bandido Chocolate (fyi: the bandido takes 15 min to prepare)

STAR for service:
The presentation (I think he was one of the brothers) did a great job in explaining & proper way of eating. Yes folks, we just do not tear right into it.  See proper way of eating Peruvian empanada above.

Service was sorta slow but our waitress was awesome.  She provided some great recs on dishes.

No Star for:
NOISE - prior to going here, I know I Q-tipped my ears after shower but I had a hard time hearing 

But will surely go back for the SNAPPER & BANDIDO! 
OH, It is BEST TO MAKE RESERVATIONS!!
author: Stel D.

description:
I had an opportunity to try this restaurant a few weeks ago with a female friend.  It had the nice decor with high ceiling and spacious seating.  Since my friend needed to attend a dinner and we got there pretty late (3 p.m.), I ordered Ceviche Limon and some octopus cold appetizer.  Both of them were pretty good, if lacking the extra tastiness that would make me appreciate the food more fondly.  That was the first time I had ceviche, but from my understanding it's the combination of fishes and milder salsa sauce.  As we wanted to eat something more, sauteed sirloin slices.  That was also good, but again missed the extra something.  

When I talked about this to my former co-worker that lives in SF, she told me that she liked Fresca in Fillmore St. more.  I vaguely remembered how good dishes were when I went there 3-4 years ago, so should try that place again soon.
author: Tak K.

description: I went with two other girlfriends, who had both been before- but it was my first time. Short wait and pretty packed for 10 pm on a saturday. We were seated in a corner which would have been perfect, except the three of us were awkwardly facing a couple who were in a full blown fight. I mean tears, strong words, and tense pauses. My girlfriends and I were trying to sip our cava and wait for the food without staring, but again our whole table of three was directly facing the couple in meltdown. SO good or bad, that seating arrangement is awkward. The food was great, although the steak we ordered was far too red for my taste. They didnt ask how we wanted it cooked, and I guess medium is a house standard. The chicharon de pollo was amazing, make sure you get it. Side note: apparently this is Panda's fave restaurant in SF and I was sitting in the seat he usually sits at. The awkward corner. ha.
author: Kassaundra G.

description:
I feel so special - I'm #401 to review Limon.

Limon's one of my favorite places to eat in San Francisco.  You *must* plan ahead and make a reservation for dinner, or you can go in the afternoon (which is what I do most often).  

Favorites: ceviche (the non-creamy ones), Chicarron de Pollo, either of the steak dishes, Bouillabaise, Arroz con Mariscos, or fried snapper.  OK - so I like all of the entrees.  What can I say?  

Alcohol selection is good too - peruvian beer and cava.  

I love coming here for special occasions and the casual brunch.
author: kim n.

description:
The food was fairly decent. Between the two of us, we shared 3 appetizers: chicharron de pollo, empanadas de carne, and the ensalada de vegatales. The first two were recommended by our waiter and everything tasted great. 

Why only 2 stars? Well, the 2 hostesses were incredibly rude and I would not come back here no matter how much I liked the food. I arrived early and told the hostess I was still waiting for a friend. She didn't tell me that there was a wait or that I could put my name down until I asked. No big deal. 

I came back 10 minutes later and another hostess was working. She didn't say anything to me even though I was the only person waiting in the front. After my friend came, they asked us three times if we had reservations - we didn't, we didn't, we didn't. We asked for a table for 2 and the hostesses talked amongst themselves for an uncomfortable amount of time - as if we were rudely imposing on them. They ended up putting us in a dark corner upstairs. . 

When we left, they made no eye contact with us, but cheerfully said good night to the older couple right behind us. 

I didn't know whether I was discriminated against because of my age or race but I don't appreciate it. We could've stayed for dessert but felt we would've had a better experience if we walked to Bi-Rite. I won't be coming back.
author: Cyndi L.

description: The reason I gave 3 stars instead of 2 is that the food was quite good.  The service was terrible!  There were five of us and we ordered drinks and then food.  Two meals arrived immediately (the chicken) and then the drinks (Pisco Sours so it would have been nice to have them before dinner).  The two meals sat there while the other three  were being prepared.  We ate and were sitting talking while we waited to pay--and tipped generously--and talked a very short while after paying.  There was no one waiting for the table or at all, but the server came and asked us to leave because there were reservations coming in.  This was a little after 8 at night.  In fairness, two of us got lost and went to the wrong restaurant so our 6:30 companions sat for half an hour waiting for our arrival, which may have meant that our waiter was not getting as much traffic at his table. The latter is the only explanation I can have for his rudeness.  I cannot, however, ever remember being asked to leave when no comment was made upon arrival that the table needed to be turned over and there was no one waiting in the restaurant for a table. We would have immediately left had the latter been the case.  We were a very quiet group (one Pisco sour a piece) and three of us middle aged, I hasten to add.  I would not go back to this venue of Limon.
author: Bettina R.

description: I've been to Peru to visit family there and grew up eating Peruvian food.  The food at Limon was good but strayed too far from the authentic meals and flavors I'm accustomed to.  Less "fusion" in the dishes would be better for my palette.
author: Miriam S.

description:
I get all turned on just thinking about the ceviche at this place. The sangria is solid, the other seafood dishes are good, the lamb is great, but come on... you know why you are came here and i know why you are came here.  The ceviche is that good.  The portion is pretty solid (especially compared to some of their other dishes - which aren't particularly huge) and comes with all the tasty corn and yam which is always welcome.

A bit pricey, especially for the mission. But definitely a destination spot.
author: D S.

description:
feel terrible- I mistakely reviewed limon for range.  Range rocks Limon needs finishing school- I need a new brain (sorry this blonde hair is sorta real)

I have been here twice- both times I waited at least an hour for food- no joke!  Do not come here a day you work out a lot, I was minutes away from getting my friend a burrito across the street.  This happened both times.  Once you get your food it is decent but nothing really memorable- try Garcon, Bar Tartine or Maverick instead.
author: rachel c.

description:
Visited Green Limon on Green St Patty's Day....how appropriate.  Finally made our way to Limon after passing it on Valencia several times.  It was packed on St. Patty's day, so we settled for a great bar seat to have dinner.  The waiter was friendly and helpful with choosing our meals.

We had the 4 choice Ceviche plate, the empanadas, and the ribeye.  While the Ceviche was fresh and flavorful, it wasn't quite as good as I remember Fresca's to be...and H. thought it was too tart, but thats just how I like my Ceviche!  The ribeye was a tasty meat option and overall, everything filled us up....but I don't know if I would have gone for the second cup of  lemonade if I knew they charged $4 per glass!!  H.'s beer was only $4!

The decor was modern and soothing...only time I've seen green walls actually work well.  Its still amazing how nice these places in the Mission are...yet still have drunkards walking in trying to cause a ruckus with the patrons (yes, it happened to us!)....
author: Annie C.

description:
My dinner at Limon was excellent.  The quality of the food was wonderful, and there were some interesting dishes on the menu.  I had the crispy red snapper, which was done just right and presented in a way that I've never seen before.  The fish meat was carved off and the skeleton with head and tail intact was fried into a curve.  The rest of the meat was cut up and fried in a light batter coating, and then piled into the curve of the fish skeleton.  The dish came with stir-fried coconut rice, some greens, and a sauce that tasted very South-Indian.  It was an excellent dish.  The empanadas were excellent.  The ceviche was good, but it was served in too many pieces -- all the elements didn't fuse together into a greater whole.  The truffled mac'n'cheese was one of the most interesting dishes I've had.  The cheese was subtle enough to let the truffle come through strongly.

Once the service started, it was amazingly attentive.  It did take some time for someone to take our order, but that may have been our fault for being in conversation.  Note that you will only be seated when your entire party is present.
