Just one little tic tac of a detail, as I finished my dinner I went to the bathroom and on my way there, I heard a waiter speaking spanish to a bus boy,  they where talking about the Mexican "clasico", Guadalajara vs America, me being Mexican and a FUTBOL fan, approached the waiter and asked him in spanish about the game and the score, on what he responded to me in Spanish, "um, I don't" , he was Argentinean, I could tell by his accent, that's why I didn't get upset, it just confirms my theory that Argentineans don't know any thing about FUTBOL. (I am only kidding, boludo te quiero!)

So in conclusion this is a very very very very very very very very very very very very very, good place to come to eat, there 400 words, thank you very much.

                                                      THE END
author: Hector S.

description: The crevice is so sublime. Tender and delicious. The risotto was really good too. I have been a few time and always had good food and great service.
author: Leigh S.

description: I'd give this spot more stars if it were bases solely on their crowd's vibe and drinks- very scene-y and super hot waitstaff.  Food is kind of mediocre and expensive, given what great latin food selection there is in the Mission area.  Good spot for pre-going out drinks with friends, if you can get a spot at the bar.
author: Christina V.

description: Honestly, I was not impressed by this place. The atmosphere was a little stale and the restaurant lighting was bright. The food was just okay - I didn't leave hating it but I also didn't leave thinking about it. There are a lot of other places I would go before I go to Limon.
author: Jenna Q.

description: Limon was pretty good but a little pricey for the quality. I can get better ceviche in San Jose for under $5 a person. Their ceviche was huge pieces which I had never had before and didn't like as much as small pieces.My friend and I ordered two orders of ceviche, the beef empanadas, and another dish that I cannot remember and 2 mojitos and the bill was $80 including tip. Not as much food as I'd like to get for $40 but it was good food.
author: Joanne K. B.

description: Great food, wonderful service and a great place for a first date. Highly rec. -one downside: parking on this street is horrible. Arrive early
author: Malak M.

description: The Sangria is really good! We went with a large group and tried alot of different dishes, they were all excellent. I took a roasted chicken home, it was so yummy! The best roasted chicken I have ever had! The sauces are amazing.
author: Sepas K.

description:
We came here on New Year's Eve, so we were expecting to pay a premium for the prix fixe menu, but we expected the food to be delicious and the service to be excellent, judging from their online menu. However, we left disappointed on both fronts. The food was salty, espcially my main course filet mignon. The ceviche was okay, but I've definitely had better. The price for the meal was not printed on the menu, and we felt kind of weird asking since we made a reservation and we weren't going to just get up and leave. It was $90 for 5 courses. For that price, you should have flawless service as well, and our waitress was very inattentive. She didn't check in with us at all throughout the meal, and didn't offer us coffee to go with our desserts. We had to flag down a busboy to get coffee since the waitress was nowhere to be seen. Then they rejected my husband's credit card because they said it wasn't swiping properly, so I had to pay with my card. After we left, my husband tried out his card at another establishment and it worked fine. 

Maybe we were there on a bad night, but I was definitely not impressed and won't be back. There are lots of other Peruvian places with better food and better service than Limon...
author: Jenny R.

description: My friend and I were disappointed with the food at Limon -- this place is definitely overrated. We ordered the ceviche and the fish was chunky and chewy. Then we had the Lomo Saltado which was tasty but very "fibrous" as my friend would say. Most of the sirloin slices were cooked medium rare and really tough to cut.For dessert, we selected the panna cotta which was probably the best thing we had all nite but again nothing special. We sat upstairs which didn't really add to our experience -- very smoky and crowded up there.
author: Helen Y.

description: hands-down the best red sangria i've had in the city. Great place for a dinner-date on a medium budget. Friendly and accomodating staff, comfy -yet hip mission atmosphere. I heart limon!
author: Nikki M.

description: The food is great. but i felt it was all a bit overpriced.
author: Alyssa K.

description: A favorite place to meet friends for dinner: classy and delicious.  The ceviche is stupendous.  The single empanada is good but you feel slightly cheated since it's just one - instead of one big, how about a couple small? Lomo Saltado (steak over fries) is a classic dish, done very well.  The steak is also a good pick.  End the evening with the Bandido chocolate cake -- it's not very authentic but it's meltingly delicious.
author: Vanessa H.

description:
Best Ceviche EVER!!!!  So fresh and super delicious!!!  I also feel like they have the best sangria as well.  It's not super sweet like some places tend to make it.  And the wine seems like good wine too!  Those are the two things that I would definitely go back there for.  Everything else we had was ok.

Ceviche: The bomb!
Sangria: Yummy
Loma Saltado: Ok, not bad but nothing great either
Beef Heart: Tastes like chicken heart... Ok I guess if you like hearts.  My friend wanted it.

We had a couple other things but I don't remember... Nothing was bad there but the only thing I would go back for is the Ceviche mainly. Next time I'm ordering that just for myself!!! lol
author: Anna Y.

description:
My hubs took me here for lunch. He had been there with a friend when he was in the City a couple months back and had raved about it. We took BART down to the 16th and Mission station and walked about three or four blocks to a street that was lined with pretty much every big international cuisine (Indian, Thai, Mexican etc). Limon is Peruvian. 
   We got there on a Saturday not long after they opened. They sat us at a table for two and offered us their menus. We ordered the mango lemonade upon suggestion from our waiter (a great choice) who also let us sample the strawberry lemonade for comparison. The menu features primarily small plates with three or four large plates. But you really should share.
   We got the yuca fries which are crazy addictive (came with two spicy sauces, one green and one orange) which are like logs of crispy tender yumminess. We also got the chicarrone chicken which had the right amount of spiciness with a crispy exterior and managed to keep a bit of moistness on the inside. The clear vinegary sauce didn't work as well for me as using the sauce from the beef empanadas which was herbally and soft which was a better match for the salty chicken. We also got the lomo saltado which was so mouthwateringly savory that I didn't know how to stop eating it. It's like a Peruvian steak frites. The fries were bathed in the same sauce as the beef and red onions so you had a forkful of yumminess each time. It comes with a side of rice that you end up sopping up the sauce in to clean the plate.
    It was a full meal. We were quite full for a few hours after we left the restaurant. It is a warm place to hang out and it's definitely family friendly.
author: Kim S.

description: The food is AMAZING the service . . . . less than amazing.  The location has a clean contemporary feel accented with beautiful abstract art (available for purchase) and very cool lime green leather chairs! I will certainly go back but with hopes they get it together!
author: Jessica H.

description: Limon is to die for!!! the service is on point and you cant go wrong with anything on the menu....the perfect atmosphere for a first date to a  night out with friends. Best sangria in town in my opinion.
author: Grace Anne A.

description: Two plates of ceviche, the seafood risotto thing, and the steak - all SO good, flavorful and not too filling. Plus 4 glasses of their mojito and a glass of rose. Service was average. Overall, we left happy.
author: Lilian W.

description:
Not sure if the kitchen was having an off night when we were there, but I was really disappointed.  I had read lots of good reviews and decided to take some out of town guests.  The ceviche and sangria was definitely tasty, but that is where things started to go down hill.  All four of our entrees left something to be desired.  My husband potatoes were so greasy that they were translucent and my paella tasted so fishy that I tried to just move it around my plate (not wanting to ruin the meal for our guests).  All of the meat (even fish seemed overcooked.

It seemed like a place you might go to see and be seen....not for the food.
author: claudia D.

description:
I'm a Yelp lurker - never have I been inspired to write a Yelp review.  But my experience at Limon Saturday March 6th, was one of the worst SF dining experiences I've ever had.  Just to get it out of the way: the food was very good, albeit a bit salty (my Peruvian friend who ordered for us concurred), and the service ONCE SEATED was fairly good, if a bit disorganized.

The short version: reservations for 6 at 8:00 on a Saturday night.  We arrive on time, and are told there is a slight delay.  No problem - we wander across the street to Casanova for a few drinks.  And we proceed to check in every 10 minutes for AN HOUR AND A HALF.  Hostesses' response: "your table will be ready in 10 - 15."  We only put up with it because our friend was dead-set on going to Limon, and just as we're walking around the corner for a burrito Limon calls and we're seated at 9:30.  We enjoy our meal, make a passing comment to our waitress (not her fault!), watch our waitress argue with the manager, and receive our bill, which we pay in full.

I approach the manager, Enrique (sp?), introduce myself, and describe our experience.  His response: "This is the way we've done business for 7 years, and it seems to have worked out fine for us."  He gives a cursory apology in a completely uncaring tone, and repeats himself after I suggest that they not take reservations that they can't honor.  The Manager COULD NOT HAVE CARED less.  I later find out that a waitress there is quiting that night because of the management.

Bottom line: good food, but I REFUSE to give business to management who doesn't care about their staff or their customers.  I might have even been satisfied with a meaningful apology or explanation, but Enrique's attitude was unbelievable.  I hope you don't enrich these cretans - take your business elsewhere.
author: Abe Y.

description:
Peruvian succulence: The rich flavors I savor.

My lord, there are some fantastic dishes here.  As I come in, I'm ready to get some of their delicious Cerviche dishes as soon as I sit down.   I am such a cerviche fan: I love the different approaches on raw fish.  However, what you really do need to get for an appetitizer is the Vieres con Foie Gras.  My lord is this a decadent dish: scallops and foie gras served over a creamy yucca puree w/ fig sauce.  The sauce is divine with the richness of the mixture of the scallops and liver.   

I always have meaty things in mind when I think Peruvian.  The Churrasco a la Parilla was a thick juicy delicious steak.  I did wish that that provided more of the mustard sauce.  The fries also  felt like they were missing some seasoning.  However, the Lomo Saltada is even better, just amazingly tender. Each slice of steak of the Saltada is an burst of flavor in the mouth.  Top all of it with a Sangria, and it's all a very delicious endeavor.

The decor does need some what of a makeover.  It does seem a bit too drabbly dark due to the dark green interior.  Maybe they were going for a modern touch on traditional Peruvian decor. I'm not sure.  However, the service was prompt and friendly.  

Definitely one of my favorite places in the Mission.
author: Satoru Y.

description:
this place has really gone downhill.  the ceviche was ok, but the main courses were like hotel restaurant food.  The menu has also deviated away from peruvian into a bit of a mashup.

service was also poor.

If you want peruvian go elsewhere.
author: Andrew G.

description: The food here is awesome!! The Sangria here is the best I have ever had!! The steak was really nice and so was the sea food. I would definitely go back. Especially for the Sangria!!!! Went at the beginning of dinner service so ofcourse it wasn't super busy and had really good service as well.
author: Mariya L.

description: Best Ceviche in the City!  Loved it!  Great service, the server was quite knowledgeable, professional, friendly and outgoing.
author: Ashley J.

description:
I went back after a long hiatus... haven't been since they've moved to their new place in the mission.

setting -- eh? wha' happened? it was so close and comfy before, now it's this big, dead space, trying to be too too, spot.

service -- was fine. 

food -- ceviche was perfect. a little too generous in the portions, but when is that really a negative. even seafood-hating husband liked it. altho he got the lomo and it was Awful. the mac n cheese -- where the f was the truffle? the coconut rice was much better, and in my opinion, the star of the meal.

good when you get a hankering for ceviche, but only for ceviche, as you cannot even order a pisco sour to wash it down, since the bar is wine only.
author: Sasha R.

description:
*There are enough reviews for you to read, this is my take..

This is the kind of place where you wish your man would take you without you trying to hint at it every time. AHEM, still waiting for the man to surprise me.

This is the type of place that you might have to try during lunch because its a little easier on your wallet, aka someone like me.

This is the type of place where you savor every bite of your meal, especially if its lomo saltado, I love it.
author: kate r.

description: The food is really good but the service is awful. I found them patronizing and disrespectful...trying to usher people out of their tables. Jerks.
author: Katie H.

description: mixto ceviche was yummy. beef heart was not good. tough and flavor was basic salt and pepper; unimpressive. the hanger steak was medium rare but again unimpressive in flavor. we didn't care for the soy sauce crispy chicken as well. the chicken was on it's way to being soft and chewy. i hear the rotisserie chicken is bomb. i will try it next time. based on food alone i would've given this place 2 stars (at least this location) but the staff was very friendly and helpful. they even gave my girlfriend a birthday sorbet which was tasty.
author: Eugene H.

description: hmmm... I was very excited to finally try this place. But... I only thought it was O-K, nothing that amazes me except the decor and the ceviche.  Dont get me wrong I LOVE peruvian food, but not limon. I rather go to Mi Lindo Peru ... !!! :)
author: Tess C.

description:
I ate in this location when it was the original Slanted Door. Sat upstairs, like before. Service - fast and flirty. Food? Hmmm...not so great. I love ceviche, but my dining companion does not. However, he is a perma Atkins guy, so meat was de rigeur. My Lomo Saltodo? If the potatoes had not been cooked through, I could have reenacted a scene from Quest for Fire. And, I do like rare. Tough, however, is another animal.

I'll try again, with a someone who likes fish.
author: Rene D.

description: Whatever you do, do NOT bring a large group here! We booked an upstairs table for my cousin's 30th birthday, and because of the size of the party (about 18 people) were required to order the prix fixe menu at $30 per person. After waiting nearly an hour past when we were seated, we got tiny bowl after tiny bowl of salad, not even nearly enough appetizers for the entire table, and to add insult to injury, they brought about 12 pieces of chicken to feed the entire table. When we pointed out to the waiter that there were a number of us who hadn't even had an entree, he argued with us about the menu before finally bringing one more plate - enough to just give everyone one piece (fine by me, although not having eaten since breakfast I went home still hungry, but some of the husbands were looking a little wan after just a few bites of salad and a bit of chicken). The chicken was delightful, I'll give them that, and the ceviche was very tasty, but frankly this was a rip-off, and I would not come again. There are plenty of places in the Mission where I could have a full, wonderful meal for a fraction of the price - and don't even get me started on the cocktail prices. Not to mention, the upstairs is sonically awful - if anyone in your party wants to talk to each other, prepare for them to have to scream. Ugh.
author: Sarah L.

description:
Limon is easily in my top ten list of SF restaurants.  The Nuevo Latino cuisine which is a re-interpretation of Peruvian cuisine.  I make Lomo Saltado but I cannot approximate this dish--wish I could.  Limon is quite consistent in it's quality and have eaten most everything on the menu.  I have been eating at Limon since its founding on 17th Street near Mission--now Maverick's space.  

The wine list--while not bad--is an engima to me.  There are some very thoughtful wines - like Gaja, Kongsgard it is unbalanced with such common wines like Penfolds Bin 2, Clicquot (they spell Clicquot incorrectly on the website) and Catena.

Argentina is a powerhouse producer of Malbec--even though Malbec is grown elsewhere Argentina and specifically Mendoza makes the best Malbec on planet Earth.  And there is a great breadth of choice--that is why I cannot believe that Catena is on the list.

But with all of my thoughts on wine lists--my hats off to Limon and they still get 5 stars.

Buen Provecho!
author: Jaime Patricio M.

description:
3.5

Service here is excellent:  friendly, professional, warm.

Food I tried was pretty good.  Had the ceviche sampler (includes 4), which our server recommended.  Pretty good.  My friend suggested pairing the spiciness of the ceviche with a Riesling, which turned out to be an excellent choice.  The Riesling was also recommended by our server.  Lomo saltado was pretty good, unfortunately not served super hot like I like my entrees generally served -- lended itself to a somewhat oilier taste and soggy french fries.  The BEST thing tho was the seared scallops w/ foie gras.  Sorry folks.  I go back and forth on the FG.  But I love the way it tastes -- here, buttery, rich and so so good. 

Typical hip Mission restaurant personality and clientele.  Pretty packed on a Friday night around 9:00.  But we got seated fairly quickly, even tho I was (typical) late.

Eating here makes me miss the ever more lowbrow Mario's in Hollywood -- http://www.yelp.com/biz/Fb3WueRF1ekhs72psinq5w .. no foie gras or fancy schmancy hipster at this place, tho.   Just good Latin eats.
author: Natasha S.

description:
Fantastic.  No seating was available when we arrived so my friend and I started at the bar with drinks and an appetizer.  We shared the Anticucho de Pulpito (marinated baby octopus, grilled and served over chimichurri mashed potatoes) which was divine.  There was a little confusion over our table because the hostess assumed, after we sat down at the bar, that we were no longer interested in a table.  I managed to correct that and we were seated shortly thereafter.  I had the Seco de Costilla (shortrib served over herb mashed potatoes with peas and carrots, spicy cilantro-huacatay sauce) as a main which was equally great.

They reminded us twice that "everything might take a while because they prepare everything from scratch" which may be true but after hearing it more than once, it comes off somewhat gimmicky.

Overall, a fabulous evening.  I've only been in SF for a month but this is by far my best find.
author: Joshua K.

description:
Its been a long time since I've been blown away by a dinner spot, and I think I've finally found my match!

I love me some fresh ceviche & a good, glass o'wine- so how much happier could I be w/ 1 of 4 of their ceviches (Ceviche Limon) and a glass of their Malbec? Well, MUCH happier apparently...

We were served their warm bread w/ butter & a nice spicy dip that was a pleasant switch up from the norm. Now that I think about it... they refilled the bread plate & dip about 3 times- we liked it that much!

Next up was my Arroz con Mariscos, which had great flavor & was just what I was cravin', however it could've used a few more scallops seeing as how they tasted sooo velvety. I was torn between this dish and the Lomo Saltado... actually I was torn over the whole menu! Everything sounded so delish, that I'm looking for any old excuse to go back now.

In addition to their all around great food & wine, their service was superb! The hostess was very welcoming and our server gave us quite the detailed menu run down. It felt like their whole staff was there to serve us.

We hit up this place on a Monday and since it seems like its been packed on wknds, I think I'll be stickin' w/ the weekday dinners here. 

I'm looking forward to making it back soon for some more ceviche, vino, and another solid main. I also need to try their sangria!
author: Tiffany M.

description:
The appetizers are delicious - 5 stars.  Try the ceviche, the scallops, and the fried chicken.  

The entrees are mediocre - 3 stars.  I tried the chicken, the pork chop, and 2 of the 3 steak dishes. Though marinated with a nice tasty sauce, the meat of any entree I listed was either too dry or too tough.

The sangria is sweet, but I personally like it that way. It has tons of fruit in it and made me feel healthy.  

Because of the prices associated with the "eeeh" entrees, I would give 3.5 stars overall.
author: Nette C.

description:
An excellent restaurant.
My friends enjoyed a terrific meal here.  from steak chimichurri and more... a fun time!  great frinks as well.

excellent chocolate cake/banana dish for desert
author: Mitch D.

description: We had the Ceviche Mixto and a chicken soup. Both very good. Good portion size if you share an appetizer. I will return.
author: Tiffany W.

description: Great Service. Excellent Food! I love the Sangria!! The Ambiance is absolutely wonderful!! A great place for a date or a night out with your friends. Can accommodate large groups as well.
author: Annalisa S.

description: Came here with some friends for dinner and, as we waited on one more person, we sat at the bar and tried their sangria.  The bartender poured some in each our glasses to try it out first, then when we agreed that it was good, he suggested getting carafe of it and filled it to the top!   For our appetizer, we got the Trio de Ceviches and chose the Ceviche Nikkei de Atun, Ceviche Limon and Ceviche de Pescado.  They were all so yummy, especially the Ceviche Nikkei de Atun.  I got the Churrasco a la Parrilla (grilled ribeye over sauteed veggies, crispy potatoes and chimichurri with red wine demi glaze) and is was delish =)  Definitely will be back one day...
author: Jocelyn O.

description:
Really 3.5 stars.  4 stars for fabulous food; 3 stars for service with attitude.

I gave up meat (bird and mammal) for Lent, and despaired of finding fulfillment with veggie fare and seafood, outside of sushi.  Limon was the perfect answer - a great menu of high quality seafood dishes.  I particularly liked the Ceviche Limon and the Picante de Mariscos.  However, I have to say that I did not enjoy the potato dishes, despite the recommendation of at least one Yelper :-(

I might go back on a non-weekend evening; maybe the service will be better when its not overflowing with people.
author: Serena Y.

description:
I came here on a Saturday at around 5pm and the place was almost full to capacity.  We waited about 10 minutes for seating and were seated AFTER another party of 3 that arrived after us.  However, it didn't bother me too much since our table was ready about a minute after the first group.  

After looking over the menu, the 3 of us decided on ordering a Ceviche Limon for appetizer then the entree's included: Pollo Latino (Roasted Chicken Breast),  Churrasco a la Parilla (Ribeye Steak), and Parihuela ( Peruvian Bouillabaise).  The Ceviche was very good and was the best dish of the night, it had just the right balance of lime and peppers to give the fresh seafood a nice tangy heat.  All of the entrees had nice presentation and were pretty good, but was nothing spectacular.  For dessert, we shared the Amaretto Tres Leches Cake which was "eh...so so".  This is the first Peruvian restaurant I've been to so I could not tell you how authentic the food was.

Our waiter was very attentive and service was very good after the initial seating incident.

Overall, this was not bad for my first Peruvian cuisine experience.  I give a solid 3.5 STARS even though the menu was definitely a bit pricey for what we had.  Now I'm curious to try other Peruvian restaurants so that I can make a more fair comparison.
author: Steve D.

description:
Great place for some really good food.

Cons:
Extremly loud inside. So dont plan on having a conversation unless u plan to scream.

Pros :
The staff and host are friendly.
author: Amlan S.

description:
It was raining out, and I was walking alone in the Mission. To my car, which seemed like it was parked in the Marina because that was the closest spot I could find. I normally like the rain, but I wasn't dressed for it and had no coat and no umbrella. As the downpour became unbearable, I stepped off the street and into Limon, where I discovered a beautiful haven.

I wrung out my sweatshirt to the best of my ability and sat down at the bar, where I found delightful service. This began my Limon odyssey, and I've been back several time.

The food is quite simply delicious. I once woke up in the middle of the night craving their ceviche. The yellow one with the bright taste. It's my favorite. If you go, you should definitely order the ceviche platter, or whatever it is called. You get to choose four types, and they are all incredible. I could easily order a meal from their appetizers, which are all great - especially the empanadas. The calamari is also crisp and fresh-tasting. For entrees, I would recommend the lomo saltado as a typical Peruvian dish and the whole fried fish for something fun to look at.

If I go with just one other person, I usually ask to sit in their lounge area upstairs that overlooks the kitchen. You get to watch all the action going on, and it is fun.

This whole restaurant is fun though. The servers and waiters are always smiling and joking around. And really, the bill comes out surprisingly inexpensive. My only complaint would be that it can get really noisy. But if you're ever stuck in the rain and need a place to hang out, the atmosphere will make you completely forget that your sweatshirt is slowly dripping water onto the floor behind you.
author: Jonathan S.

description:
I recently went back to Limon after having an initially mindblowing meal over a year ago. Disappointment is putting it mildly. Nothing was the right temperature, flavor, texture, or anything. Just blah food all around... then I heard that they changed chefs. That explains a lot. I wonder where the old chef is working now...

On the upside, very sweet waitstaff.
author: Sita B.

description:
Taken from a Gmail chat convo:

FRIEND : thank you again for dinner
    i went into a food coma
    and slept all night
ME : haha me too

All in all, a filling meal with just the right amount of food to keep two hungry girls happy.  The dish of the night was the Ceviche Limon--excellent.  The Lomo Saltado is a lot like Fresca's, but the rice was exceptionally good here (my friend says that back in the day Limon served this dish with chicken, which would be a nice alternative, I wish they'd bring it back).  We finished the night off with apple & coconut bread pudding, which was tasty but a little too sweet for me.
author: Andrea U.

description:
One of the best restaurants in SF (or shall I say Frisco!!! -- I could say that... I was born and raised here!). Order me me the following:

1) Appetizer --- Chicarron de Pollo (Oh la la!!!!)
2) Entree -- Lomo Saltodo (oh la la la la!!!!)
3) Drink --- Pitcher of Sangria

........and I could die tomorrow! :)
author: La C.

description:
Great service, great food and very reasonable prices. Our waiter really took the time to explain the menu to us in detail and was always very attentive. 

The red snapper presentation was quite impressive. Be warned that the portions are very large though!
author: Jon N.

description:
Scallops with foie gras was absolutely yummy. Sweet, firm scallops, savory foie gras - perfect marriage. Tres ceviches was also rockin' - the one with the rococo sauce was my favorite. Love that you get to choose! Other favorite was the pork - so often, pork can be overdone and dried out, but it was scrumptious and tender. Mac and cheese with truffle does not seem very nuevo latino/peruvian/latin fusion, but it's yummy, so who really cares? I so want to try the whole red snapper next time - the couple next to us ordered it as we were having our dessert, and it looked grubbin'. 

Our waiter was very knowledgeable about both the wine and the food, which is always appreciated! He recommended an Argentinian Malbec that paired excellently with what we had. It was so good, we ordered another bottle! Can't remember the vintner, but I do remember it was $45. Waitstaff are also really courteous for a somewhat unpretentious-looking place like this; they pulled out our chairs, helped me with taking my jacket off, folded our napkins when we took a trip to the restroom. 

If you want the bandido molten chocolate cake, be sure to order it before you're ready for dessert - it takes 15 minutes to prepare. Good quality chocolate was used. Melted in our mouths. SO worth the wait. 

I'm glad we decided to go in, and you will, too!
author: Sarah S.

description:
Your standard mid sized restaurant in the city. Has a great selection of wine and the servers make great recommendations. 

Make sure you come a bit early to find parking. Some people park in the middle of the road!
author: Terrance M.

description:
Awesome food.

Stick to the first floor... the low ceiling on the second floor can make it a little loud when the restaurant is full.
author: Jasson S.

description:
Ok..trying not to hate but....

Service was mega slow and the 2 groups that came in after us received their orders before we did? I don't know if it was because they were short staffed, it was early in a Sunday afternoon or what..but we got our food back by the time I was finished with my tall glass of mojito (the mojitos were lovely, by the way) and the "drama fo yo mama" discussions with my friend

I had an "okay' Ceviche de Corvina...the garnish made my meal look pretty because of the colors...the meals here are totally for presentation 

The Empanada Don Walter was yummy! I love empanadas in general but the Don Walters were just fab...

Chic modern decor, very clean with a taste of multicultural...nice place but once in a lifetime deal for me
author: Charmian D.

description:
My cousin wanted to check out this place and I'm not about to pass up good food :)  He made reservations for us day of and we had no problems, course it was a Wed. 
We started off with red wine and a mango mojito.  The mango mojito didn't taste strong but it still gave me a nice buzz.. Sneaky!!
For the 3 of us, 2 boy and 1 girl we ordered.. 
2 oyster shooters - the oyster was fresh and delicious
1 limon shooter - my cousin liked. 
Trio of cerviche - Ceviche Nikkei de Atun, Ceviche Limon, and Ceviche de Camarones  - They all had different sauces and they all tasted fresh and yummy. 
Empanada Vegetariana - I love mushrooms so this dish was my favorite. 
Pargo Rojo - Snapper.  In comparison to everything else, I thought it was okie.  It has a subtle taste which I don't think went well with what we had ordered.  Everything else we ate had a strong taste.  Our bad :P  The fillet were big and moist though.  I'd order it again but not with the combination we had. 
Truffle Mac and Cheese - YUM!!
Fried - Not greasy and well seasoned. 

Service was helpful and attentive.  We were never lacking and never had to ask for anything, which was great!!  I hate having to hunt and flag down our waiter to refill water.  
I can't wait to come back and try other things :D
author: Karena L.

description:
Came to Limon with some friends a couple of weeks ago and was wonderfully impressed. My party was late for our reservation but the host was very accommodating, despite a pissy customer who was also in the same situation. Some people just don't know how to act in public. Packed to the door, the open kitchen filled the small upstairs dining area with the aroma of peruvian cuisine (took some getting used to though). 

So I didn't know that you could make mojitos with soju, but this place doesn't have a full liquor license so that is what they do. I was pleasantly surprised!

Here is what I ordered:
 - Ceviche Limon: I've had quite a few ceviche's in my lifetime and this has got to be on of the best. Loved the mixture of fish, calamari and shrimp. The lemony base offset the flavors of the seafood nicely. 
 - Ceviche Nikkei de Atun: CAn't go wrong here, ahi tuna with a flavorful sauce. 
 - Anticuchos de Pollo: Comes with sweet potato fries, yum!
 - Empanadas de Carne: This took the cake right here, I was SO surprised at how absolutely delicious they were. MUST TRY!!!

Overall, love this place. The food is excellent, great prices, nice atmosphere...the downstairs area is quieter and less hectic.
author: Matt K.

description: I have never been to a Peruvian restaurant before nor have I eaten any Peruvian food, as far as my young senile mind can remember. A friend of mine wanted to check this place out and so we did. The restaurant facade does not justify what is to be had in the restaurant. The restaurant is very clean and the servers were very welcoming. Although the place was small, it was not confining at all. We got served pretty quickly. Of course, we got there around 2 pm (thanks to SF traffic), when lunch hours were over. Started with a cocktail drink, the El Bacano. All I know is that it's got fresh strawberries in it. Excellent choice! We also ordered Ceviche Mixto that had fish, tiger shrimp and calamari. Never had ceviche before but I loved it! We also ordered Pollo a la Brasa with a side of Arroz (rice) and  Vegetales Salteados (sauted mixed vegetables [looks like]). The chicken came with different sauces but in the end, we really didn't need those because the chicken was tasty as it was. The Seco de Castillas (braised boneless short ribs) is a must have! The meat was so tender and oh so good. To end the happy lunch, I had the Chocolate Bandido for dessert. We got out of Limon happy campers. I would definitely come back to try the other food on their menu.
author: Eddie D.

description: The best value dinner in San Francisco.  Nowhere else in this city can you get such a delicious and complete meal for so cheap!  Definitely get the chicken, and for sides, get the tacu-tacu and yuca fries.
author: Babak N.

description: This place offers great food with tastey drinks.  There service can be unpredictable.  This location can get pretty busy, so they tend to rush you out to accommodate other reservations.  If you don't mind getting rushed, the food makes up for it.
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
place is super yummy. i love their sangria, but watch out because they are pretty strong!

i had their pollo latino, but substituted the mashed potatoes for veggies. super delish. would definitely order it again.

the decor is very modern. nice place for dinner in the Mission.
author: Susana M.

description:
Don't think I would've known about or tried this place without my Groupon, but I'm glad that I did.  It was a bustling restaurant, even into the early afternoon with families and 

I would recommend:
Truffle Mac n Cheese - absolutely delicious without being overly rich as some mac and cheeses can be.  This dish alone is worth coming for.

Quinotta - i love quinoa and this one was prepared quite well.

Strawberry Mojito - pretty strong drink for brunch and well made, not too sweet.


Other dishes we had that would be okay to try, but not something I would rush back for -
Yuca fries - my friend loved them, and i thought they were well fried, i just don't particularly like fried foods

Empanadas - they seemed kind of bland and just weren't overly interesting
author: Olivia T.

description:
I'm just gonna get to the point because this place was amazing and I don't need to go on and on about it. Just try it yourself and you'll see.
What was eaten:
Oyster shooter (2) -- amazing! Lots of lime juice, onion, and other goodies. So good I had to get two just to make sure it was true.
Tres Tiempos -- Was a great combination of 3 different sashimi-style fish cuts, each with it's own tangy/zesty sauce. The red snapper was my favorite, but they were all incredible.
Cebiche pescado -- This one was ok. The red snapper was fresh and delicious, great portion but the fish didn't seem to be marinated long enough in the lime juice. From the ceviche experience I have, the fish takes on a more "cured" look and has a more lime-infused flavor than a fishy flavor. Regardless, there was nothing left on the plate when I was done.
Lomo Saltado -- Whoa. The meat was incredibly flavorful. I usually prefer red meat (the more raw, the better) and this one was cooked medium-well. It's wok-tossed sirloin with grilled onions, tomatoes and AMAZING french fries on top as a side dish/garnish. The french fries are lightly cooked in truffle oil, giving them a completely different twist on regular fries.
Truffle-infused Mac & Cheese -- I have no words. The leftovers of this dish were supposed to be for my lunch the next day but they didn't even make it to the fridge. I ate them as soon as I got home!

Dessert was delicious. We (Phil H. and I) ordered the Trio of Sorbets including a scoop of Coconut, Mango and Passion fruit. The best of those has to be the Passion fruit. Somehow we managed to get a second dessert on the house: Molten Chocolate Cake with Passion Fruit Mousse. OMG it was incredible. The best part was mixing the chocolate cake with a little bit of the Passion fruit sorbet.

I could live off their oyster shooters for the rest of my life if I had the choice. That, and the chocolate molten cake with passion fruit sorbet.
author: Alyssa G.

description:
"Pedro the server..."

I've been there like 3 or 4 times already the first time it was fabulous, great service, fast arrival of the food!! very great experience! second time we wanted to share that experience with the family,  it was a very good experience too. 

BUT yesterday 6/17/2012 even that we had the same server as one of the last time, I though everything will be great as always. but NO we had some long-time friends visiting the bay area and we were exited to take them to Limon, very disappointing service let me tell you. we were at the second floor and there was like 1 server and 2 helpers, once we ordered drinks they took sooooo long to bring them I was just turning my head trying to catch one of them so I can ask for our drinks.

that's the first thing they give you once you order!!

we had a hungry 7 yr old girl with us, so we ask the server if he can bring her food first. they brought one item not fast enough but first, probably they got confused but it was the wrong plate, still NO drinks at the table. then they brought my plate,  only my plate! I picked the empanadas and of course i'm not going to eat when everybody else hasn't received their plates! so I share 1 empanada with everybody and we wait, then, another plate!!! just 1 plate!! it was like we were going to eat individually, totally ridiculous, they supposed to bring everything together and if is not ready they need to tall you, after another few minutes another plate!! this time a side plate, only one!!! at that point I was like a bull with red eyes! the server arrives and tell us the shortly the food will be there all together,. I didn't say nothing, but they took another set of minutes to deliver the rest of what we ordered but at that point 2 of my friend finish their plate, we were very hungry!! 

they were not interested in our table at all !!!! I can easily compare service from another tables next to us, very fast even when they arrive after us! 
they were at the middle of their entrees I can tell, and we were finishing receiving our orders, again, ridiculous!!

basically the server only took our order, told us about timing on the food after waiting I don't know how long, and give us the bill, the rest of the service was from the helpers (???) as always the food is excellent!! and I will recommend their food, but give them the advise to improved their service at least with that one server PEDRO,  you can tell that he has a "clientela preference" 

sadly a whole place can be jeopardize but things like this one.  :(
author: Tina L.

description: I've been here twice. The first time was about four months ago and I had a great time. I recently returned on 2/25/11 and their menu changed. They no longer have my favorite dishes: Ribs and Whole Fried Fish.  I definitely recommended the Ceviche de Pescado, the Lomito Saltado, and the Churrasco a la Parilla. Service is great. All in all, I had a great experience dinning in here. I just wish they bring back the Rib and Whole Fried Fish.
author: Joe C.

description:
I was in Limon last week and have to say it still remains my favorite Peruvian restaurant.  I was a frequent customer at Limon before they closed and was so glad to see that they reopened.  Although some of the menu has changed, they still have a few dishes that they had before.  The new additions to the menu are wonderful and I think it is a great change for the restaurant.  A few friends and I ordered several ceviches and entrees and cannot say a negative things about any of them.  We had a great time and a great meal.  They also have an awesome and reasonable wine list that compliments the menu perfectly.
In addition, my friends and I thought the staff was amazing.  From the hosts to the servers and even the people who brought us our food were very nice and knowledgeable about the food.
Besides all the eye candy working there, the cocktails are the shit.
author: Malik R.

description:
**NOT gluten-free friendly AT ALL**

(must be able to order creatively to eat here)

Compared to this list of dishes and drinks on Wikipedia (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peruvian_cuisine), this is not *real, traditional* Peruvian food, but rather San Franciscan she-she food with a Peruvian twist.

A friend of mine took me to dinner here. It was nice on the inside, but the tables were really close together.  I have a severe gluten allergy.  The waiter was nice enough, but kept mixing up what I could and couldn't eat.  However, I know that it is my responsibility to know the difference, and I corrected him as needed.  I finally found something I could eat in the form of ceviche (which I've never bad before and was way yummy), spicy chicken skewers, some steamed veggies (which did not retain their heat) ,and some white rice.  The food I was able to eat was on the 'appetizer' menu.  My friend ordered off the main course menu.  They brought out my food way early, and brought their's out only when we said something.  This, in my opinion, was poor customer service.  I felt I had to wait until my friend got their food, while mine got cold.  The waiter knew about my food allergy, and so he knew the food I was ordering was for my main meal.  As a waiter, you *gotta* ask, or put two and two together.  It's just common sense as a wait person.  The food was *good*, but nothing to really write home about.

I understand liquor licenses are hard to come by and are a pain in the rump to maintain, but Soju is utterly gross to me, and I won't drink it.  I *refuse* to drink it (it tastes so gross to me).   I don't drink wine, and I can't drink beer, so they lost money on me in the drink department.  A bottled cider on the menu would have made an additional $5 off me.  I stuck with water.  

We were in a hurry, but still managed to get our food and get out of there in time to get to our destination.  I'm not really fond of the whole 'metro-restaurant-feel'  (Sorry, I don't know what else to call it;  the decor of places like this, T-Rex, Sea Salt, etc), so I can easily skip this place, but if you're into that sort of atmosphere, try it, but don't expect a real 'taste of Peru'.
author: Missy W.

description:
You  had me at truffle mac&cheese.

Perfect night out at Limon!  Came here last night with a group of 8 people celebrating a birthday.  We had changed the reservation number the day of, and they accommodated it no problem.  We were seated upstairs on the mezzanine, which is great because you have a birds eye view of all the food coming out of the kitchen.   There was that usual uncomfortable silence at the table when nobody knows what to order or if it's going to be family style.  A couple of us took the lead and ordered a feast for all:  three cebiches (mixed seafood, mango&shrimp, and the tres tiempos).  The classic mixed seafood was the best.  They were out of the char grilled octopus (damn!), but we ordered the beef empanadas and the chicken skewers.  Also a couple orders of the Lomo Saltado, which was cooked perfectly medium rare.  I think this is the true test of any good peruvian place...if they can do the "everyman's local dish" well...then your home (just like a great italian restaurant better blow your socks off with spaghetti and meatballs...or I'm outta there!).  We also had the stuffed chicken dish, which again was cooked perfectly moist.  The truffle mac was awesome...maybe could have been a little more baked crunchy....but still great.  Finished up with four chocolate cakes for the birthday girl (with candles).  Our waitress was very personable and attentive.  High marks here all around.
author: Michael G.

description: Enjoyed Limon since they first opened in the small space bw Mission and Valencia. Since then they have moved to Valencia and 16th expanded and even dealt with a fire. My fave dishes are the ceviche tasting, Pollo al Merengue, Pork Chop on bacon mushroom and cabbage ragout, and the Lomo Saltado. Good wine selection, great atmosphere, and excellent service. On busy nights service might slow, but what do you expect in this nabe on weekend nights. Grab a seat at the bar have a few drinks and relax a little.
author: Anthony V.

description: Came here on Christmas eve with my parents using my groupon certificate . . .  BIG mistake.  Entering the restaurant, the layout and decor was excellent.  The service was mediocre but nothing to complain about.  However, the food was super burnt or super sour.  The chicken thigh was deep fried until it was burnt; the grilled beef and vegetables were also burnt.  The shooters and tuna seemed to be drenched with lime juice and nothing else. After eating here, it feel like acid was tearing through the entire party.  Definitely not a place for me.  Very disappointing.
author: Aaron K.

description: Amazing ceviche, and the rotisserie chicken melts in your mouth!
author: Kersey H.

description:
I definitely will be going back here again...

= D The ceviches were all really good....

= D the braised whole calamari stuffed with shrimp was amazing...a must try

= D the foie gras was amazing too.... the appetizers were a little small for a large group of people but ok for 2 people to share

= D have to try the lomo saltado...it's excellent

= ) Sangria was ok.

= ) Paella was good but a little small
author: C M.

description:
Unique and extremely delicious everything. We shared the ceviche sampler and had the deep fried snapper. They have an interesting wine list, and great ambiance. Everyone was smiling having a great time, drinking fun drinks and enjoying their food. 

Reservations, I would say, are an absolute must.
author: Jenny R.

description:
Out of all the peruvian/ceviche places I've been to in SF, Limon was tops. The only drawback is that judging by the wait everyone else thought  so as well. I  was here on saturday night with reservations and had to wait almost an hour for a table, but luckily the sangria and bread kept my group entertained.

Highlights:
Red pepper soup with a dollop of sourcream in the center. 
Ceviche Limon
Truffled Macaroni & cheese-very garlicky & oily but great
author: Amruta G.

description:
The Fongz brought me here, and I thought it was a solid choice.

Decor was very nice, dark and moody.  Waitress was very friendly and helpful.  We started out with some appetizers, the ceviche was good, the baby octopus were awesome, but the empanadas failed to impress.  The lomo saltado was very solid.  Overall, I thought the food was good.
author: Michael L.

description:
This is my favorite Peruvian restaurant.  The Calamares fritos with chipotle aioli was very tasty. We had the Ceviche Limon and it was the best Ceviche we we have ever had. 

Also, the Chicharon de Pollo just had the right amount of crisp. 

We definitely will be back for the Ceviche....
author: Clarice V.

description:
The ambiance and service was top notch, but the food was a bit too westernized for my taste. The paltry serving size also does not help to boost my ratings for this place. In all, good food, but have had better. 

For more authentic Peruvian fare, try Mi Lindo Peru, which is also in the Mission District.
author: Sandy Y.

description:
Whenever I pass by Limon it is always crowded. 
The restaurant looks very nice from the outside, so I decided to go eat one night. 

I was very excited to see how good they were...

It was a very very busy night- I understand, but the service seemed too slow. It was good that I got to seat on the second floor-  it was fun watching down the cooks prepare our foods while we waited for the servers. That distracted me from the long wait.

The famous ceviches was good.
The portion and presentation part of the main entree was good also, but I was not too impressed with the taste.
It was very loud in the restaurant too. 
From the outside I thought it would be a relaxing dinner, but turned out to be more of a "bar" feeling restaurant.
author: Mai K.

description:
Around 3.30 pm today a man with a sexy latin voice called.   Do i know an Antonio?  Is this the wrong number?  "I would like to confirm your reservations at Limon tonight for your party of four."   Oh yes, we've been looking forward to this all week!

We ordered:

Chicarron de Pollo*
Calamares Limon
Tatara de Atun
Empanada Don Walter
Ceviche Limon
Pitcher of Sangria....(as lovely as everyone says)

*My favorite dish there.  Apparently "chicarron" means something like pork skin? This chicken is sick--just the right amount of spice, NO skin, a nice dipping sauce, and purple onions.

And also, their sangria gave me a happy mellow buzz.  I've not felt that since I gave up the herbs.  Yummy!
author: Penny P.

description:
Girls' night out started at Limon one night.  Parking around 16th and Valencia was a b*tch, but we were genuinely excited about this place that we have heard so much about.  

As soon as we were led upstairs to our table, I immediately secured the cushioned bench.  Cushioned bench?  couch without a back?  I dunno.  If you have been, you know what I am talking about, the seats along the wall upstairs, big, leather, seats.  The lucky friend next to me and I looked at the two opposite of us sitting on normal chairs like suckers who ended up with the b*tch-seat in a car.   Little did we know as the night went on, that those aren't meant for short people.  Even with heels, my legs couldn't reach the floor.  Is that pathetic?  My at least 3" heels!

well, besides feeling like a midget the whole night, we enjoyed our dinner.  The appetizer that we shared, the Limon ceviche, was extremely delicious. 

so why only 3 stars?  I think I'd rather go to Fresca.  The whole time I was eating my Arroz con Marisco entree and agreeing with my friends how delicious our dishes were, I kept on thinking about Fresca.  How their seafood is more tender, rice less salty, price much cheaper...and I don't think it's just my numb legs talking.
author: Candice B.

description:
Yeah, Limon is good.  Great ambiance and the fried snapper dish is fun to eat and look at.  The ceviche is real good too.

But with the lethargic (but nice) service and the 30 minute wait even with a reservation, I'd say there are better choices.  I'd like to give 3.5 stars, but my friend Beth is giving it a 5 so I'm trying to average her out.  She's crazy and from out of town and doesn't know any better.
author: Matt S.

description:
Limon Resto is simply fantastic!  Gotta give this restaurant the  Yummoh factor!!  Thats if you have a love for Peruvian Cuisine!  The waiters are excellent with extraordinary smiles!  I was about to pour more Sangria into my glass...and the waiter swooshes right next to me and takes the pitcher from my hand to pour more Sangria into my glass!!  Thank you!!  Do order a pitcher of Sangria...I am a Sangria fan so its really a 5 star Sangria!!  It goes well with all of their yummy dishes!!  
My favorite dish is the Lomo Saltado.  Its an authentic Peruvian dish of tender sirloin, tomatoes and fries(yes French Fries) all mixed together served with white rice.  This will be a dish that you will crave!!  I'm looking forward to many visits to Limon!!
author: Darlene F.

description:
Nice food. odd service: both host and bartender referred to us (a man and woman) as "sir" ?!?! and "guys." I ain't no dude lady!

ceviche was extremely good, if pricey. a less-than-thrilling wine list. overall, decent, but I prefer Fresca if you don't mind lazy-ass, borderline rude service.
author: G Z.

description:
We enjoyed a fabulous dinner here. We started with the anticucho de pulpito which was VERY flavorful but I found the octopus to be slightly tough (especially for being BABY octopus). Next we had the empanadas Don Walter which were great. Finally we had the Lomo Saltodo which was very good. To quench thirst, I recommend the sangria. It's juice with wine...nothing wrong with that.

The table next to us ordered the pargo rojo which looked and smelled divine...must try it next time. 

The portions are not huge but surprising filling. It can get a bit loud as it gets later into the evening.
author: Romeo And Lola K.

description:
This will be Limon's 503rd review and there is good reason why so many people have yelped them... Limon is exceptional.

In comparison to other South American influenced restaurants in SF, there is no other like Limon. They have good portions, great service, and the place has a good feel. 

I can't wait until the next time I go back.
author: Lee M.

description:
I went here with four of my roommates on a Thursday night, for our monthly roommate dinner. I was excited due to the reviews on yelp, but when I left, I was pretty dissapointed.  The atmosphere is great for going out, elegant, yet still casual and moderately loud.  The staff is very accomodating and welcoming, but we were charged a 18% gratuity for a party of 5... shouldnt it be 6+ at least? 

Here is what we ordered:

Appetizers
1. Ceviche Creme - a little on the spicy side, it definately has a kick to it. We tried it because none of us had ever tried a creme-based ceviche, and it was okay. Wouldnt order it again.

2. Ceviche Limon - the acidity is exactly what we were expecting for a classic ceviche, but didnt dazzle us much. It was ordinary, good, and the seafood was good, yet tasted a little canned.

3. Mac & Cheese - Good, solid mac & cheese. The pasta is well done, and the cheese is great; but honestly, I can make better mac & cheese at home with fresh cheese. 

Entres 

1. Pork Chop - I had the pork chop, and maybe because I had the best pork chops at RNM when they used to serve it, that I may be a little bias. They were dry (I got it medium), not enough sauce, yet still a little too spicy from the pepper and salt. The surrounding bits of bacon and potatos were also too salty/peppery, and I couldnt finish it all. I wouldnt recommend you ordering it.

2. Beef with peppers and onions - this reminded me of a chinese stir-fry that you could easily get for $5, bigger portions. The beef, yet, was deifnately delicious, but for the portion, it was mostly veggies, rice, and small amount of beef. Honestly, Id rather go to a good chinese restaurnt for this dish, due to the price, but hey, it was pretty good. 

All in all, it was a good place to try, but not a place you would keep going back. I prefer Fresca over Limon, due to the more intimate atmosphere and a lot fresher ceviches.
author: Chieko H.

description:
I really like this place. The food is great the atmosphere is great and I will definitely return. I've been twice and both on celebratory occasions and I have to say I really am impressed. The food is fresh and served in a timely manner and the sangria is pretty good. 

We usually do a family style dinner when we go. There are so many delicious options and this way everyone gets to try everything. 

My personal favorites are the steak and fries. Yum. and the whole fish with coconut rice. Also the ceviche is really good with all those big ass corn pieces in it. oh yeah the fish is fresh too. 

I will be back to Limon very soon.
author: Lawrence A.

description:
My friend introduced me to Limon a while back and it's now become our must-eat place whenever she visits. I'm not sure if Limon has true authentic Peruvian cuisine but who cares when it tastes so good. We like to start off by each picking a ceviche (which are fun and creative takes on traditional recipe), then an appetizer or four (tastier items include the tuna tartar, scallops with foie gras, stuffed mushrooms, and grilled octopus) and then we share an entree. The taste and presentation of the fried red snapper, IMHO, are AH-mazing. Wash everything down with a glass of yummy sangria as you go along and you'll feel that all is well in the world. 

I also love that the atmosphere is nice but not uptight and I've had very good experiences with the service thus far and have never felt rushed, especially since we always dine for 2+ hours. Hey, how else are we supposed to finish all that food?
author: Queenie C.

description:
After the Kooza, Cirque Du Soliel show, my husband and I were a bit early for our reservation to Limon. Kudos to the seating hostess gladly who sat us right away instead of making us wait at the bar.  

Started off with a glass of sangria which I though was very light and even went well with my meal.  Ordered the scallops with foie gras.  The scallop was tender, flavorful and delicious.  The hidden mushrooms was an unexpected treat. Hubby ordered the fried calamari, which was just okay but the dipping sauce was good.

I ordered the rib eye, medium rare and it was absolutely perfect. The sauce complimented the meat very well.  Hubby ordered the famous fried snapper.  I tasted his dish and I liked it too.  Didnt care much for the coconut rice or the side of curry sauce but the spinach salad with vinagarette was refreshing.  

For dessert we ordered the tres leches with ice cream and macaroons.  I've got to say this was the only part of the meal I didnt enjoy very much.  The milk on the cake wasnt very sweet and and carried an odd flavor.  I did enjoy the ice cream though.  All in all, a very good meal with the exception of dessert.  Too bad Bombay Ice Cream was closed, otherwise that would've been a perfect compliment to the evening.  The food was cooked exceptionally well and was very memorable.
author: Lauren S.

description:
I always have so much fun whenever I go to Limon.  It's so busy and crowded, but it's fun and everyone looks like they are having a great time.  

Overall, the service is good and the food is pretty good too.  I love calamari, so I tend to get their calamari appetizer a lot even tho it's not that special~ and their ahi tuna appetizer is typical, but it has a kick to it.  I'd say it's a good one to start off the meal with.  

But I think their Ceviche is one of their best dishes.  I like seafood, so I generally get the Ceviche Limon, which has all kinds of seafood - scallop, shrimp, fish, mussels, etc..  My friend got their top sirloin dish, which he thought was pretty good - Lomo Saltado... we got one like it at another Peruvian restaurant, Fresca and I think it might've been better there.....but it's still tasty at Limon.  

Oh, their seafood dish with creamy sauce called something Mariscos?  That's pretty good if you like creamy sauce and seafood. But you know, their signature dish is this fried(?) Red Snapper dish.... the presentation is amazing.  You look at it and wonder, how the heck do you eat this?  :)  Honestly, I think the presentation is much nicer than the taste itself, but it's worth trying it once just to see.  It comes with curry and coconut rice, which compliments the red snapper really well.  

It gets booked pretty fast, so reserve ahead of time or just stop by at a random night and sit at the bar.  You can order a full meal at the bar - that is, if you can find a space to squeeze yourself in.
author: Catherine H.

description:
The Ceviche alone is worth 5 stars.

Decor, Vibe, Music, Atmosphere and Mains all get 4's.
author: SF U.

description:
Service! Service! Service!
Bravo for the service.

Some nice places give you bad service on purpose.  This place gives you great service  on purpose.

My girlfriend and I dined there for Valentine's Day, and anytime we got up, we always returned to a folded napkin in our place.  Also, when asking where the bathroom was, the server WALKED me there.  Very awesome.

Being a busy night, our food was a tad slow, so not only was the server super apologetic, he also comped us a couple glasses of wine for our troubles.  We were so well taken care of, we didnt notice.

The food is awesome too.  Highly recommended.
author: ryan y.

description:
A friend of mine had heard a lot about Limon so we decided this past Friday night to check it out . . .  

For cocktails, we got the sangria pitcher, which was decent, though it seemed very low on alcohol content.  After our meal, I still was not even slighlty buzzed, or flushed, and I'm Asian!!  Though it tasted good, the cost of the pitcher seemed a little too pricey.

Foodwise, to start things off, we got the Trio de Ceviches and tried the first three ceviches on the menu (Ceviche Limon, Ceviche de Corvina, and the Camaron).  The flavor was good, but the pieces of fish did not seem to be the freshest . . a little too chewy to be considered a truly excellent ceviche.  My friend and I joked that had our Taiwanese folks come out, they would be calling the fish "Cue Cue" . . . I'll leave the translation for other Yelpers to decipher.  Personally, I think there are better ceviches elsewhere - Mochica is one place to check out for sure if you like ceviches. 

For the main course, my friend had Lomo Saltado while I had the Picante de Mariscos.  She had been to Peru recently and wanted to compare the autheticity and taste of the dish which she said was similar to a Chinese beef stir-fry dish.  Her take on it after a few bites was "my jaw is already sore", and after she had all that she could, she contended that though flavorful, the white rice on the side might have been the best part!!  On the other hand, my Picante dish left me with little to complain about except for the meager portions of actual seafood.

Service was on par with other restaurants of the same caliber.  Overall, I would have to say I was disappointed at Limon considering all the hype.  We had gotten an early dinner reservation so though I might have been willing to give the benefit of the doubt at the end of a night as to my food not tasting as good, I really cannot justify why the food did not seem as fresh.  Unfortunately I can only give Limon 3 stars . . . just average in my books.
author: George J.

description:
Maceo C., treated me to dinner here the other night. Aside from having to kill some time and wait for it to open at 5:30 cuz we like to dine early like the old ladies we are (Bar Tartine lost out cuz it didn't open till 6!), I would like to officially say... Like wow. 

We ordered apps and dessert. All of it was yum, but the ceviche was delicious. My partner in dine made some witty comment about wanting to give it her phone number and go home with it, cuz she's a professional writer. I don't even know what kind of fish it was, but it was heavenly. It appealed to my love of sashimi, because, well it is raw fish, and it was cut into lovely large sashimi-like slabs (although it did make it difficult to shove whole pieces into my pie-hole, which i almost had to resort to because it was so hard to cut. Gimme a steak knife Limon!), but the citrus/acid factor was what sent it into outerspace, flavor wise.

I liked the bread pudding we had too. The pastries that came with it were superfluous, but damn the creme fraiche and smoothness of the bread pudding was good. 

And really, I thought we were getting so much attention from the staff cuz we're cute, but I guess everyone gets treated like they're cute. Because really, aren't we all?
author: Wanda D.

description:
Had dinner with a big group here last night.  Food was good.  We had a wide variety of different things at our table.  Cevice was good (tried three different kinds), Ribs on the appetizer section were out of this world.  For dinner the portions are pretty big, we chose to split one of the mains and others at the table ended up ordering a appetizer size for dinner which was plenty.  

Would go back again.  Good - not earth shattering.
author: Doreen D.

description:
I've eaten here twice (random saturday night and V-day) and both times left the restaurant feeling very satisfied and super full.   I'm impressed how great the service was despite how busy the night was.  Make reservations because this place gets PACKED!

The place is cozy meaning the tables are close together.  At first we were seated in the corner, the my seat was along the window so it was more like a hard bench.  I don't have enough cush in my tush so I asked to move us somewhere else and they were more than willing to comply.  When we got up to use the restroom, we'd come back to a nicely folded napkin on our seat.  very nice!

now the food...
filled with flavor, nice presentation, tender meat, and you get your money's worth
author: carrie c.

description:
Limon is a very decent restaurant with very decent food. Great atmosphere, well decorated space. Though, in my opinion, it was a little too pricey. Plus, I agree with Victoria N's review that the service was in a bit too much of a rush to get us out of there. The server kept commenting after everything we ordered "you know, that takes 20 minutes to make, so you might want to order something else". My dinner partner and I just laughed him off, but I felt that was very rude. It wasn't even close to closing time AND there were plenty of empty tables for waiting customers!

- Ceviches were good. We got a triple plate to try a few. They were all similar, but I felt we got more bang for our buck with the Ceviche Limon. Just had more stuff packed in it. If you don't like cilantro all that much, don't order it - it's packed with the stuff

- I got the mixed seafood with saffron rice - similar to paella. It was very good. Still not worth $25 though

- Dinner partner got a steak. It was HUGE. He ordered it Medium, but it was still moo-ing. Unlike me, he doesn't like to complain at restaurants so he didn't send it back, but wow... that thing still had a pulse! 

- Truffle infused mac & cheese: YUM. Next time I'm just ordering that as my meal. Definitely not your standard Kraft.

- Some sort of apple pie like dessert. Not all that impressed.
author: Sarah P.

description:
I had a HORRIBLE experience here.
I've read great reviews and I wanted to try it out. I went with a friend and got a risotto dish.  It took at least 30 mins for our food to be served.  We were starving at this point..and his food came out and it was quite good.  My risotto that I was dying to scarf down was uncooked and still raw wtf.  I was pissed.. there was no apologies nor anything to accommodate all our waiting for shitty food. ugh.

Limon is a nice spot to go, but with food was blech.. I left here starving and opted for ice cream at Bi-Rite Creamery instead.
author: anita h.

description:
Since a really bad experience at the old Limon a couple of years ago, I have boycotted the place, even though I loved the ceviche.  Last night Anthony and I wanted something local and inexpensive.  The new Limon came to my mind.  Heck, you can't hold a grudge forever!  Anthony said he eats lunch here regularly (it being only two blocks from Ginger Rubio) and he thought the food was tasty and reasonably priced.  So, off we went...

At 8:30 pm the place was busy, but we were told we'd get a table within 15 mins by the darling guy acting as maitre d'.  No problem - there were seats at the bar and a pitcher of sangria was in order!

True enough, we were shown to a table within two glasses of sangria... next to two very enthusiastic guys who gave us their recommendations (Michael from Sax 5th and his boyfriend Ryan).  We took their suggestions and ordered the halibut and shrimp ceviche, beet salad, and the stead and french fries deal.  My only complaint was that all dishes arrived at once.  Maybe you like to eat hot steak and french fries with your cold ceviche, but I don't.  I asked them to keep the dish warm, which they did, resulting in soggy fries.  Oh, well, Miss Picky Picky Picky ordered a side of fries to augment the soggy ones and I was not disappointed.  The fries were delicious and this Scottish gal knows her french fries:)

Not as swank as the old location but we got out the door for $80 including tip.  That, my friends, is a damn good deal these days:)
author: Lorraine F.

description:
We went with my girlfriend on a Thursday, the place had a lot of people. While we were waiting for our table at the bar. We noticed that the way the bar and kitchen are put together is uncomfortable -while we waited I had to keep moving so I didnt bump into one of the waiters that were coming out from the kitchen.

The food was good specially the sea food, the ceviche and the tuna tartar were awesome. We saw a lot of people eating chicken so we ordered some but it wasnt nothing special. 

The bad part of the night came with our waiter (Bruno) the guy needs to learn how to treat the clients, we ordered some fries and asked him for Ketchup and the guy looked at me as if I would have ordered the weirdest thing in the world... my girlfriend and I are Latinos and we have never had such a bad service coming from a Paisano!!!.
author: Juan Camilo R.

description: I wish i could give zero starts after the experience me and my girlfriend had this past saturday. We have been going to Limon for years now and after this saturday will not go back after the way we were treated. We first walk in and get a table for two after a few minutes we order are drinks and food. Then we notice 3 serprate groups ranging from 2 people up to 5 people get seated rite around us. So we are conversing and enjoying are drinks and realizing it is taking a while to get our appetizers and food. So us realizing they are busy think nothing of it until we saw all the people who sat down after we ordered our food getting there appetizers and food. So we think the kitchen just did the orders in the wrong order and think nothing else of it. Another 15 minutes go by no waiter check in nothing so we get up to ask whats going with our food and by chance get the manager who is an arrogent piece of sh!t and basically explain that three other parties have been seated after us and have already gotten there food and finished before we even got our appetizers. The manager at this time does not apologize and does say anything and just ask us if we want our check. After this experience i will never go back to that palce ive been going there for years and I was very understanding about having to wait almost an hour for no food and see people who were seated after me finishing there meals while me and my girl hadnt even got our appetizers yet. And to get attitude from the manager about complaining about this was just the last straw. Limon the food was good while i was going there but your service is sh!t and we will never go back after even though we have been going since you guys opened!!!!!!
author: Patrick K.

description: I had a good time at Limon, but it was the last of several stops through the Mission on a Saturday night. The best part was they were able to take us without a reservation, and I remember liking the food.  At the time, they only had beer and wine. I'm not sure if that's still the case.
author: Katie M.

description:
We never were quite able to put our fingers on what cuisine Limon was exactly; it calls itself Peruvian but there are touches of Ecuadoran, Brazilian, Mexican, Indian, Japanese, and Thai. Immediately recognizable from the street by its stark, bright exterior, Limon is sleek, dim, and fairly loud inside. There is a bar along one side and an upstairs seating area for overflow. It is a shining exemplification of the gentrification that is taking place in the Mission. The menu is heavy on cocktails, appetizers, and small plates, and fairly light on entrees. We shared the Ceviche Limon to start - a raw assortment of shrimp, calimari, and white fish "cooked" in lime juice and "leche de tigre" along with sliced onions, hominy, and corn nuts. Refreshingly delicious. For my main course I had the Lomo Saltado - amazing. Sliced beef tossed with onions, french fries, and a rich, salty soy sauce. The main chicken course was also good but my mom was unimpressed with her chichen empanadas. For dessert there are profiteroles, cappuccino gelato, and a molten raspberry chocolate cake. 

Delicious diversion for Mission yuppies.
author: Alexander M.

description: This place was authentic.  Mostly peruvian waitors/waitresses which added to the ambiance.  The food was good  The be.st part of my meal was my Pisco Sour.
author: Ava D.

description: So sad, I thought I booked the other one because I really wanted to try their chicken. The food was good, but given the prices, there was nothing amazing about it.
author: Tif L.

description:
Disappointed :-(.

I came to Limon with a very high recommendation from a friend only to leave full, but disappointed.  We were seated upstairs and it was very dark (not even those cute little candles were used to decorate the table).

What we ordered:

Empanada (carne) - just OK but the dipping sauce is much better
Chicharron de Pollo - probably the best dish we had
Lomo Saltado (my favorite Peruvian food) - very salty...I mean very, very salty
Arroz con Marisco - just ok--meh
Lemonade - not free refill :-( really?!?!

Had the pana cotta for dessert and it was yummy.  The only bad part is that I ordered cappuccino and the waiter said they only had brewed coffee...another bummer.  For a pricey and popular establishment, you'd at least think they had some kind of espresso/cappuccino.

Overall, the waiter and the place is nice but I don't think we'd be back anytime soon.
author: Mae D.

description:
I would give this place five stars due to the wonderfully delicious food, but the waiters just aren't very friendly. They aren't exactly offensive, they just don't really talk or check up on you are seem to care about you at all. They simply take your order, bring your food, and never smile or introduce themselves or bring any sense of hospitality.

The food is amazing though! I love the tacu tacu. The ceviche with the shrimp is one of my favorite items. For two people, I would suggest ordering half a chicken and two small plates. Don't forget to try the Inca Blue corn drink! Very strange, but delicious!

PS It is somewhat expensive. You'll pay about 10 dollars per small plate, and they are pretty small plates for the most part. Youll end up paying about 25 - 30 dollars a person at least.
author: Jesse D.

description: a hair in your Yucca fries = okay acceptable somehow it happens once in a blue moon, but no apology from the waiter or possibly manager is unacceptable , next time you go to lemon order your yucca fries with no hair ...
author: NAEL K.

description:
Limon has grown up into one the IT restaurants in the Mission.  Seems to be overly popular and more  difficult to get into than the food warrants.  

Thumbs UP: Food is consistantly good.  Dont make reservations and sit in the front lounge.  A nice  place to have a meal without all of the pretense.  
Thumbs DOWN:  Was better when it was down on 16th and wasnt as popular.  Food just doesnt messure the hype!  Dont get me wrong, its delicious but...
author: Jeff C.

description:
Is there any marginal value to yet another review when the tally stands at 53?  Probably not, but affirmation is usually a good thing.  So here it is: Limon is a little slice of chic heaven that is in slightly jarring contrast to it's textured surroundings.  Though you can certainly go for classic Lomo Saltado, you're better off indulging in the foie gras and trying one of their great ceviches.

The service is prompt and professional, and the decor is very pleasing.  Though the upstairs seems intriguing, apparently it's not as desireable as the downstairs tables.
author: Andrei M.

description:
Limon sits in a very cool space with a second floor of add'l seating. Parking is difficult as with any Mission boite, but worth it once you taste their dishes.

Now, I've only been there once, so take this with a grain of salt, but the service was a little on the slow side. There was a huge lag time between when we finished our first course to when we were served our entrees. Luckily, I was with a friend I hadn't seen in six months, so we had a lot to catch up and didn't mind the wait. 

After a fresh little octopus/calamari amuse bouche, I tried a salad which was a special of the day - heirloom tomatoes with fresh mozzarella, pea shoots which was sitting in a very interesting puree with varying levels of flavor. I wish I could remember what it was made of, but it had beautiful colors, green, yellow, white, burgundy. I had the Parihuela, a Peruvian Bouillabaisse composed of a flavorful tomato broth and was chock full of scallops, a crab leg, mussels, clams, shrimp, calamari and fish...a seafood injection of lovelieness. My friend got the traditional Peruvian Lomo Saltado, sauteed beef with tomatoes, onions and spices and incredibly delicious. We didn't have room for dessert, but I plan to return!
author: Dariana R.

description:
So the food is still really good, but this was the second time that we had to wait 45+ minutes WITH RESERVATIONS. I thought maybe the first time was a random fluke, but clearly not. There was another woman there complaining that she had been waiting with reservations for over an hour. SUGGESTION: Don't take reservations.

For that fact alone, I must downgrade Limon from 5 stars to 3 stars. (P.S.: the coconut rice and waiters are still the two tastiest items at Limon.)
