----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

In a word... Scrumptious! From the sangria, ceviche, main courses, dessert and most of all the wait staff. 

So even though we had to wait for almost 45 minutes even though we had a reservation and after I complained they didn't comp us anything, I still give Limon 5 stars. Why you might ask? 

Because the food and the YUMMY Latino men made me completely forget about the looong wait. Maybe it was all the sangria I had while waiting for our table, but holy sh** were these men hot, hot, hot.

So the food... everything I had was beyond my expectations. I started with the empanada and tasted the ceviche. For my main course I ordered the red snapper with coconut rice and a side of mac n cheese. OMG the coconut rice made me harder than the tasty waiters. I ordered the tres leches for dessert and refused to share.

I dreamed about Latino men feeding me coconut rice all night.
author: Brad C.

description:
I was lucky enough to be taken out to dinner tonight at Limon by a friend who owed me a birthday and graduation present.  I start by saying that, because this is not somewhere that I would usually go because its a little expensive for my liking. But hey, if she's paying... :)  

Anyways, I've always heard really mixed things about Limon, about how the food is just average and overpriced.  That was not my experience tonight though. Two of the dishes we got were at least an 8 out of 10, and the other was about a 6, not bad in my book.  If you go, definitely get the Pargo Rojo.  The sangria was also very very good.  The only bad thing about the food is that they only have one vegetarian option, and it is "chef's choice", which always sounds a little menacing.

Other than the food, the wait staff was extremely friendly/helpful, and the ambiance was pleasant, but maybe a little austere.  At the very least, I would recommend that everyone try it once and make their own determination.

One funny thing is that in the bathroom (single occupancy) there are a bunch of chairs and two sinks.....thoughts anyone?
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Great Seviche and Lomo Saltado...what a place.  Great space.   Fun neighborhood.  And reasonably priced for the quality and quantity of food that you get.

Can't wait for my next trip to SF so that I can return.
author: John H.

description:
A night of disappointment.  

Misses:  the ceviche pescado, Lomo Saltodo, the Tres Leches dessert.   I was really looking forward to the ceviche, too, having had it before in another city and being blown away.  Not here.  The chunks of fish was cut too large and was more chewy than i preferred.  The corn too starchy.  The top sirloin dish was basically a poorly chosen choice cut beef and french fry stir fry; the beef was overcooked and chewy.  The Tres Leches was way too heavy for something at the end of the meal.  Everything seemed heavy and starchy.  

Average:  Good but not blown away was the saffron seafood dish. The cream made it a bit heavy at the end per my dining companion.

Delicious:  the  Vieres con Foie Gras.  Though the portions are very small.

If you are seated on the upper floor, be prepared for a BOMB level of noise.  Yikes!  If you look at the slope of the ceiling as it curved downwards to the direction of the main floor, we could tell it was a noise amplifier.  We could barely hear each other talk and had to lean forward and raise our voices; contributing to the noise level as everyone else was.  It would be a good spot to listen to the symphony with its acoustics.  

The hostesses and waiters were friendly and attentive.  The bartender was unfriendly. 

For the prices.... and the high expectations due to its reputation...i was truly disappointed.
author: Animal K.

description:
Sex and the City meets a cramped and tasty Latin kitchen that's gonna make your tastebuds stand up, stretch and sing out a la 4 Non-Blondes: AND I SAID, HEYYYYYY, YAYYYYYY, YAYYYYYYYYY, YAAAAAAY YEAH. WHAT'S GOIN' ON???!!!

This place is a taste explosion: mariscos with a comforting, delicately spiced cream sauce and fluffy rice (yum), ceviche (duh) and - drumroll please - truffled mac n' cheese!!!!  The Peruvians love it too!!!

WARNING:  possibly the noisiest restaurant you will ever set foot in, especially if you're seated next to a table full of financial douche bag daddies. ugh.

Wait, I'm secretly attracted to these types of men.  My bad, guys!
author: BroSauce J.

description:
The mac and cheese with truffle oil is to die.
The ceviche limon is perfectly marinated and the seafood mix is thoughtful and fresh.
The mushroom soup is so flavorful.
The sangria is perfectly sweet.
Save room for dessert.  Cherimoya ice cream!?  Guava and chocolate?! Unexpected and sooooo good.
author: K W.

description:
I reserve the 5th star for the mac and cheese which I have yet to try but the ceviche, empanadas, and the chicharron were all so *very* good. Unfortunately we let the grilled octopus sit too long so by the time we bit into them they were like rubber bands. I'm sure they were excellent right off the grill. The pace was a bit off - should've served the cold food before the hot, but we had a really great waiter who was so kind and accommodating of our questions. He also had nice taste in wine suggesting the less expensive bottle to us based on what we were looking for taste-wise rather than the expensive one.

I'll be bringing my hubby here on Sunday so stay tuned for that review.
author: C P.

description:
Love this place.  Everything is super tasty and the Malbec selections (Tikal and Catena) are a perfect accompaniment.

Though I have to say that when I first came here a few years ago, the food was better.  Flavors were more distinct and interesting.
author: Lev E.

description:
The sangria and mojito are absolutely yummy!  I believe the restaurant does not have a liquor license so they can only serve wine (i.e. sangria) and drinks mixed with soju.  Therefore, the mojito is made from soju... can't really taste the difference between that and a normal mojito.

I also really like the food and the ambiance is pretty nice.  There usually is a wait so I definitely recommend that you make a reservation.
author: Lisa L.

description:
The appetizers are AWESOME (ceviches amazing).  The main courses are ok.  I've given restaurants 5 stars for food that wasn't as good but the problem is the price.  For the price you pay Limon should be X times better and just isn't.  

Food : 5
Price : 2
Service: whats that
author: Herbert W.

description: This place is in a great location though parking is hard to find. The atmosphere is good, but the service is horrible. Our waiter had an attitude and everytime we asked him for something it was as if we were bothering him. The ceviche which everyone recommended was just ok. I guess I'm used to having ceviche served with avocado, cucumbers and all the toppings and this was not. The churrasco was served medium when we ordered well done and where was the chimichurri sauce? The only tasty thing we all enjoyed was the sangria! that was yummy!
author: Maria J.

description: The chicken here is great. And I love the Yucca fries.  We order extra chicken and love the sauces they come with. It makes for great tacos and the sauces are an awesome change of pace from tacos made with salsa.
author: bobo f.

description:
Pro's:  The food was excellent, and the service was good.  

Con's: The drink menu lacked variety and it was really loud.
author: Chris T.

description: Went for brunch with a Groupon and will go again.  Had the chicha mimosa (delicious - and a deal at $5) and a taste of the pineapple martini (also good) and then shared the ceviche de pescado - very good.  I ordered the quinotto (quinoa risotto), which was quite good if a bit small.  My husband got a beef stirfry dish that he also liked.  We would definitely go back - maybe for dinner.  The ambiance was great.
author: B. Y.

description: Came here again a couple weeks ago and the food was still just as good.  Eduardo our server was the best!  So nice and attentive.  A good server really puts the icing on the cake for a pleasant experience at a restaurant.  I loved everything we ordered from the empanadas to the rib eye steak, the peruvian corn and  the rasberry sorbet!
author: Michelle S.

description: I hosted a large party up in the mezzanine, and it was a GREAT success due to the attentive and accommodating staff and delicious food.  The owner and servers were incredibly nice.  The cebiche mixto is to-die-for!  I'd recommend this place to any lover of good seafood or Peruvian cuisine. Great place for a special occasion that doesn't have a pretentious vibe.
author: Mai A.

description: The food is good but the service was horrible. First off, we did not get acknowledged until 5 min of standing there. After it took then 20 min to set when there were plenty of open tables. They crapped us in a corner and told us we had to be out in an hour. Before we were done eating they came and took are plates and didn't even ask if we were done and then started to clean the table with a dirty wet rag when we were still seating at the table. we were disappointed with the rude service we experienced.
author: Nathalie C.

description:
The name on the check was "1010 Guzman"
The worst server I had in my life!!!!!!
Food was good, bussers were definitely more friendly than the server.
Hostess cute, but not friendly.
Why should I go back to waste my money at that place? There are more and better places than Limon for Peruvian food, even prices at Fresca are not cheaper than Limon, I always get great service, same thing at Piqueos or La Mar...

BE SMART when you hire!!
author: Maria Loreto R.

description:
To sum it up:  the food is ok, the service is ok, and there are a TON of better restaurants in the Mission (even right across the street).

So they are back open after their fire mishap.  Seems like they need to work out the kinks again.  I have always found this place a little uninspiring.  They are good at getting the Marina crowd to come to the "hip" Mission.  The people sitting next to us were seated before we arrived and still hadn't received their food after an hour and a half.  

The Rib Eye was a poor quality piece of meat that was peppered and salted to oblivion to disguise it.   My companion had the Red Snapper which was good. 

We were there to use a gift certificate that someone gave us about 2 years ago.  When we went to pay for it the manager said any money we didn't use would be lost because the gift certificate was so old.  He didn't seem interested in our comment that it is illegal to expire gift certificates in California (http://www.legalmatch.com/law-library/article/expiration-dates-on-gift-certificates.html).  It was also not possible for us to use the gift certificate until then because they were CLOSED for a year.

We won't be going back.
author: Tom S.

description: Limon is great on the cocktails and ok food but the service? We found it insulting.   After having been seated at the bar for about ninety minutes and each dropping the cash for drinks, dinner and a tip, we were wrapping up our conversation when the bartender asked us to LEAVE the restaurant.   No, we were not drunk and screaming we were apparently 'in the way.'   Two professional women, together, over the age of 45?  Take your business elsewhere.  Don't let your cash get in Limon's way.
author: andrea k.

description: This place wasn't what it used to be. Over cooked food... Poorly made sauce. I don't remember Peruvians using soy sauce in their food but whatever works. Maybe it was an off night but I don't plan on finding out.
author: Gordon C.

description:
this is beautifully plated crappy peruvian food. not sure what the concept of this restaurant is, if it's going full peruvian, peruvian fusion, or americanized peruvian. Had the ceviche and lomo saltado. the ceviche used old fish that was covered up with citrus to mask the age of the fish. the lomo saltado was good, but the portion was ridiculously small. Service was slow which made it even more painful to eat, the ambiance is nice, but i'm not an ambiance guy, i just want good food. 

I think el pollo inca in LA is better than this place (in terms of food) and Pio Pio is Hell's Kitchen in nyc is def. better than this place...once again SF has jacked me in getting good ethnic cuisine.
author: Mike C.

description: Still one of my favorite places on Valencia! Great to go to right before you start bar hopping. They have plenty of small dishes that hit the spot and fill you up. I recommend ANY of the ceviches and definitely the YUCCA FRIES!!!! YUM!!!!!
author: radio j.

description:
We had not been to Limon since it reopened and decided to take an out-of-town guest there.  Having not seen him for awhile we were looking forward to a relaxing dinner. We did not know that it is Limon's practice to get people in and out of there as fast as possible.  We had drinks, our meal, dessert and coffee all in a little over an hour.  We managed to carry on our conversation despite constant interruptions.  The staff were very aggressive in trying to get our plates off the table - it was almost as if they were watching the small plates and if no one took a spoonful of something for 3 minutes they would come and try to whisk it away.  I am not exaggerating.  They kept trying to take our friend's drink glass, which still had a little bit in it that he wanted to savor, and ultimately they were successful in grabbing it before he was done with it.  They also repeatedly came over to ask if we were going to order something else, even as we were just starting our meal.  I assume they were rushing us  because it was Friday night and they wanted to turn over the tables as fast as possible.  One other consequence of this is that they bring the small plates as they become available, even when it makes no sense from a culinary standpoint.  We had only fries, yucca fries and rice to eat for the first 5-10 minutes - at least they could have brought the rice when the rest of the food was ready.  

As for the food - it was good but not great.  The chicken chicharron was very dry.  The carne empanadas were good, as was the calamari.  I liked the sauces very much - it's nice to dip fries in something other than ketchup.  And the yuca fries were very good too.

Another thing - the hostess was rude.  We won't go back to Limon and I don't really see why it is so popular.
author: Jennifer A.

description:
I went half expecting to see guinea pig on the menu (not trying to offend anyone - a little joke), only to have one of the most wonderful tartares I have ever had.

The entrees were a little heavy on the salt - we were upstairs and saw a very enthusiastic salt-loving line cook!

All-in-all, great experience, and there is something to be said for Peruvian waiters in really shiny shirts.
author: Julia P.

description:
Make reservations before you go!!

Food's awesome (I recommend the civeches, pollo latino, and sirloin). Sangria hit the spot as well.
author: viv k.

description:
FANTASTIC!!!  We went to celebrate our first year anniversary and the  staff and food were fabulous.  The red snapper basket is a must try...any of their ceviche' is a cant miss. The staff was great and accomadating.

they even comped some finger foods in between service ( they new it was our anniversary thanks to opentable.com).

Go..you wont regret it.
author: Poncho M.

description:
For the longest time, this has been my favorite restaurant in San Francisco. Just heavenly food in a chic Valencia location.

Things to eat:
Pork Chop
Ceviche
author: R K.

description:
Mmmmm.  YES, PLEASE on the short ribs, the mac & cheese (trust me, it's FANTASTIC), & the foie gras/scallops (not AMAZING, but still very good).
We had to wait 10 min even though we had a reservation, but the group next to us had been waiting 1 hour!  Oh well, the food is worth the wait.  Our waiter was lovely and recommended wonderful desserts.  The coconut ice cream is delish. 
ps, I came here a year and a half ago and ordered some ceviche (because it's the thing to do when you hit up Limon) and ... well, I guess I'm just not a fan of ceviche.  It's good to be adventurous with food, but if you're not into cold seafood dishes, steer clear of the ceviche.  It might be a more memorable and pleasing dish when it's hot outside...!
author: Lily C.

description:
Had dinner here the other night with a friend.  I was honestly a bit disappointed.  The first two choices we made on a half bottle of wine were no longer available.  Then, the halibut ceviche that we ordered was so tough that my friend would not eat it.  

The positives were that the chicken we ordered was AMAZING and the presentation and service were fantastic as well. Jose rocks!
author: Beth M.

description: good food and atmosphere!  Don't come without reservations.  They were actually delayed in seating us on time so we got free sangria!
author: anette d.

description:
This is one of my favorite restaurants ever! The first time I came here, I fell in love already with Peruvian cuisine. If I had a lot of money, I would certainly come here everyday!

The atmosphere of the restaurant is very inviting and everybody is having a good time, though it can be a little hectic and loud sometimes. The customer service is always good and I've never waited more than 5 to 10 minutes for my table. I do recommend to have a reservation, cause it will be impossible to get a table during dinner hours. Unless if you want to get an early dinner like around 5-ish, there might be a possibility for you to get a table right away. 

The calamari is always good for a starter but the reason you come to Limn is for the ceviche! They are to die for! Ceviche Limon and Ceviche de Camarones are my favorites. 

I would definitely plan my visit soon!
author: Perry S.

description:
I'm going to be completely honest and say I don't really remember how the food was here...I was a bit tipsy when I arrived, and a LOT more tipsy after I left. (Thanks, Zeitgeist!) But I DO remember having a lot of very tasty sangria, and having a ton of fun.

The location is quite convenient to your local Mission bars (as evidenced above)...should you want to upgrade from the fare at Zeitgeist, head on over here and pick your poison.
author: Aubrey S.

description:
Sangrias, Sangrias, Sangrias

Service is impecible - Food is Delicious.  Did I mention the Sangrias - the best I have ever had.

They are on top of it and always at your service.  Feel like you are fine dining, but it keeps its hip-and-happening atmosphere, and not stuffy. 

Make the reservation or you'll be waiting.
author: Benjamin B.

description:
Overall the place is pretty good - I just think that there are other places with more authentic / better tasting Peruvian food.  Perhaps it is because this place is supposed to have a "fusion" element to it - that explains the cooking liberty.  For instance, there is a foie gras with scallops appetizer.  

Pretty neat looking in there.  It's very modern and the lime-colored walls add a nice glow.  It's perfect for its location - the Mission - which is allegedly up and coming.   Perhaps I should call it yuppified Peruvian food.   Kind of like going to PF Chang's for Chinese food. Service is a plus here - the waiter was helpful, polite and attentive.  Of course, we did have a 4:30 PM dinner and there were only two groups (including us) in our section - but he seemed to work well with the other group.

We had the lomo saltado (sirloin slices, onions, tomatoes and fries) and the arroz con mariscos (various seafood with rice and in spicy sauce).  Both meals were good.  I would probably go back just not for a couple of months.
author: Jimmy F.

description:
Only been here once.

Average food.
Average, but FRIENDLY service.
Great sangria.

My friends loved it...I may have ordered wrong.
author: Scott W.

description:
I found it!  Eh, never mind, its red.  Another!  Ho-hum, that one's a handicapped spot.  Huh, that leaves that one open spot eight blocks down with the broken glass and hypodermic needles.  Whatever.  Park the car.  I'm hungry and we're late.

Parking in the Mission aside, stepping into Limon and seeing pitchers of sangria makes me all warm and fuzzy inside.  My party of 3 had good sangria (although I personally like Fresca's best), and decent appetizers:  shrimp ceviche, ahi tuna tartar (my favorite of the apps), timbale, mushrooms, and empanadas.  Shared a main course of yummy lomo soltado.  

I'd come back for the ahi tuna tartar, mushrooms, and lomo, but the others were just okay.

The service was excellent and waters stayed refilled constantly.  Yes!

I'm subtracting a star because the floor (carpet) upstairs was disgustingly gross - as in, my friend and I walked across it twice and our shoes were sticking to it.  We noticed it simultaneously and looked at each other, totally grossed out.  Second, the three of us sat in what should have been a quieter table in the place but the whole restaurant is impossibly loud.  I asked my friends to repeat themselves multiple times.  I feel like the space is similar to NOPA, which has the same noise volume problem. 

I wouldn't mind returning, sans parking issues and adding in dessert - possibly the Tres Leches.  Mmmm..
author: Marina Maven C.

description:
The food here was delicious!!!!!!! I went there last night with a group of ten and ordered the Lomo Saltado (like 8 other people in my party!), which is steak mixed with french fries, onions, and tomatoes served with rice. The steak was cooked medium rare and was really juicy and delicious and it had a really good flavor. The rice tasted like it had saffron or garlic or something that made it taste amazing! 

The ceviche (which is cold fish) was really good, it had a really tingy flavor (lemon and something spicy that I couldn't figure out). The sangria was OK, not as good as in Spain and had a little kick to it.

The food was amazing at Limon, but I have to say otherwise on the atmosphere. It was probably one of the loudest restaurants I have been to, you could barely hear people sitting two seats away! Also we had to wait a long time for our food, but we did have a big party, so I can't complain too much about that! Plan on spending at least $33 a person...and don't park in the Median on the street or you will get a $50 parking ticket like I did!!!!!
author: Elaine S.

description:
Great Peruvian Fusion food! Fun, high-energy restaurant with amazing ceveche and the best lomo saltado I've ever had. Their chiccarone de pollo is also a great appetizer. We had a pitcher of sangria which was really good. 

Their Aji de Gaina was so-so and their desserts weren't very good. Their tres leche cake is dry and not very tasty and they put a weird twist on the alfajores.

Overall though, their appetizers and entres are amazing and full of flavor. Great presentation and nice staff.
author: Janelle R.

description:
I'll keep this short since there are 600+ reviews on this place already.  Went here for my wife's birthday with a group of 12.  The food was awesome, some of our favorites were: Ceviche Limon, Pargo Rojo, Paella and the Vieres con Foie Gras.

If you're with a group (i.e. 2+) I would highly recommend ordering family style.  We got to try almost the entire menu, and dishes like ceviche and paella are perfect for sharing.

Only drawback was that it was way too hot in there, due to the nice weather that day (70+ degrees in the city) and we were sitting upstairs.

Would definitely go back.
author: Brian Y.

description:
Consistently Good!    Great place for Ceviche and Sangria.  Yes, a bit pricey... but will keep coming back.

We first discovered this restaurant while visiting SF.  Now that we're here, it is one of our favorite places to dine.

We highly recommend the Ribeye Steak and the Crispy Red Snapper. and of course, traditional Peruvian Steak and Fries.    Yummy!!!
author: Mia N.

description:
I've been to this place a couple of times.  The food is very good, but I love their truffle oil mac and cheese! 

The waiters were cute and nice.  The only thing I didn't like about it was the way the restaurant was very noisy/echo-y.  With the open kitchen and everyone talking, it was a very uncomfortable rumbling that made the place a little annoying and hard to hold a conversation in.
author: Mindy K.

description:
Update: Called the phone number tonight and they picked up and asked how they could help me, the 524 Valencia location is currently closed for remodeling! If you call the number listed they connect you to Limon rotisserie which is currently open and located at 21st and south van ness! 
Mystery solved, however one star still for lack of notification on the website or at the storefront!

Last night (Thursday 2/26/09) the boy and I planned  datenight to begin with a meal at Limon. After reading the Yelp reviews and looking at the menu on the website we were very excited. 
We drive to the mission from the sunset, score a sweet parking space (thanks mini cooper!) and scamper down 16th to valencia. Its after 7pm but before 8 and i'm preparing for the possibility of a wait. 
We get there and the place is shuttered tight. It looks out of business shuttered not just closed. Theres no hours or menu posted but also no "going out of business" sign or "closed for blackout/waterproblems/fire" sign. WTF?
I checked the website again this morning,the hours are posted and it should have been open last night when we were there,  no indication that its out of business except that you can no longer make a reservation via open table.  

so while the food may be wonderful, one star for confusing closed-ness at dinner time on date night!
author: Alex K. W.

description: Really good restaurant. I've come a couple times for lunch, and its always been delicious. You can't go wrong with their ceviches. I also like their pollo chicharon, and their sides, particulary the yucca fries and sweet potato fries. The only thing I didn't like was the stuffed calamari my friend once ordered, it wasn't bad, but nothing special. The service has always been good when I've gone. Overall, it's a great resturaunt, and i'll come back time and time again.
author: Ashley S.

description: We came here for brunch after m had a great dinner experience here with a co-worker.  The bloody mary is the best I have had in a restaurant.  The brunch menu had tons of options that all sounded tasty and based on our table of 4's experience all actually tasty.  I had the pescado limon which was awesome.  Lots of non-egg options.  The Ensalada de Vegetales appetizers was totally a miss though.  Would recommend and a great spot for brunch with out of town guests.
author: Jessica M.

description: Went here accidentally because we were trying to get to Limon Rotisserie... it was a pleasant mistake! The food was very good and it was a cool atmosphere. Not terribly pricey either. Our server was really nice but kept a stone cold expression the entire time which was a little weird... I'm guessing he was exhausted because we did come in pretty late.
author: Rachel S.

description: Read Limon reopened after being closed for over a year so I went to check out the "new" place last night. I like the new decor. It also seemed less noisy than what I remember it to be in the past. The food we had was really good. My friend and I shared everything, which I recommend to others so you can sample more dishes. Without wine, our bill came to about $94 which included a ceviche, two appetizers, a main entree, a dessert, tea, tax, and 20% tip. I think it was worth it. The service from the bartender to the waiter was very good.
author: A M G.

description: "The Joy" and I went to Limon for brunch and it was terrific. Veg Empanadas, Ceviche Limon, and red snapper entree were all outstanding dishes. The service was very good. The entire staff was very attentive and friendly. I recommend visiting Limon anytime and certainly recommend the brunch!
author: Gerry C.

description: Went here last week and thought the food was pretty good. Tried their famous rotisserie chicken which was tender and good. Had cerviche and side veggie dishes. I liked the one with lots of veggies like beets, and potatoes. It was so colorful. The dish portions were good, and the cost was reasonable. The atmosphere was nice and represented mission restaurants well. They have 2 branches in Mission, Valencia and Van Ness. This one is the original one. Be sure you are placing reservations at the correct branch. They use Open Table.
author: Felecia W.

description:
The management here is terrible. Limon ruined my birthday night! 

I reserved a table for 14 at 8:30pm at least a month ago for my birthday. And I had specifically asked Antonio, who apparently is the manager of Limon, if it was mandatory to have a prefixed menu for the size of my group because I know that is the general rule for a big group at this type of restaurant. But he kept saying, "No it is only an option". So then I decided to book the reservation under the impression that each person would not have to pay 39.95 for a prefixed meal. 

So it is finally my birthday night, and I am so excited. Then I get a call at 4pm from the hostess, confirming my reservation. And that is when she tells me that there is a prefixed menu for a group of 10 or more. I am obviously frustrated and ask her if there is anything that can be done because I was told specifically that it was only an option! And there is no way that I can find another last minute restaurant for a group of 14 on a Saturday night!! So she says she will talk to the manager. I get a call back from her, saying she can waive the fee per person but that my reservation would be pushed back to 9pm. And I tell her that it is fine. Should be OK. 

So when we get there. We wait and wait...9:15, 9:30, 9:45 etc We don't get seated til 10:15 to 10:30 pm! How does a reservation made a month ago turn from 8:30pm to 10:30pm?? And the whole time when I would ask when we would be seated, the hostess kept saying, "All these people have made reservations too...the group here has already waited an hour and a half!". Well you know what, lady, what is the point of a reservation if you have to wait 1 to 2 hours to be seated!! That is BS, I tell ya!!! 

The food was the only redeeming factor, but waiting 1:30 to 2 hrs is not worth it. Overall, the service is terrible, they got our orders wrong, the manager did not even have the decency to apologize for the wait and the false information given to me at the time of making a reservation,etc. That is not how a 4 to 5 star restaurant operates. 

This place is awful, one star!
author: Allison G.

description:
I finally got a night off to go out with the girls from my work to celebrate a birthday and wish we had picked another restaurant. 
Before we arrived I called ahead to let them know we would be running late due to traffic and we got a rude attitude and a hang up. 
The restaurant itself was beautiful and the bar service was great! 
When we got to our table the good service ended. The server helped us right away. When our first order came it was wrong. As if it was our fault, our server immediately abandoned our table. We were helped from then on by a Serving assistant. The table right next to us saw their server frequently! 
Towards the end of the meal I went to ask for a manager. I explained our situation and that we wanted to get desert for the birthday girl and leave. I told him we were having a horrible experience. He then gathered bussers to come and clear our table. We felt like they wanted us to leave! 
I have been in the service business for over 10 years and have never had such a horrible experience. Not only did our server not care but neither did the manager! After spending 30 minutes trying to find parking and the bad service I am disappointed we wasted our night off here. So, unless you want to eat and spend your whole night at the bar don't waste your time!
author: lauren H.

description: to celebrate my friend's birthday, we all went to limon.  i recently said how much i love peruvian food but unfortunately i don't LOVE limon.  its just ok IMO.  they have some good dishes but because they're a fusion restaurant, they don't have many of the traditional dishes that i enjoy.  we ordered an array of appetizers like the oyster and limon shooters, ceviche limon, chicharron de pollo, costillas nikkei and crispy yucca.  my favorite was the costillas nikkei and ceviche.  the entrees included seafood paella, pargo rojo (crispy red snapper), lomo saltado, pollo latino, chuleta carlitos and a few others.  the paella was good but kind of salty and the pargo rojo was actually quite tasty with the rocoto curry sauce.  i like the layout of this place with the high ceilings and upstairs loft dining area.  we had a great time and it was a good atmosphere for a large group like ours.
author: Vic S.

description: Just OK. The rotisserie chicken + potato fries is great but the rest is average.
author: Tuhin S.

description: Came here with a big party and were able to accommodate us all.  I'm not sure what entrees were ordered, but they were all pretty good.  The Ceviche Limon, Anticuchos de Pollo, and Lomo Saltado was quite tasty. There was a chicken dish that was good but a little salty.  The sangria was so-so, only got a few pieces of fruit while others had a ton!  Taking a couple stars off since the party wasn't given any water until halfway through the meal and the portions seemed small.  Maybe it's because we were with a big party and we shared everything, but I was still a little hungry when we left and wasn't fully satisifed.
author: Michelle V.

description: Food was excellent but the service always gets me, I'm not for awkward situations and thats what the hostess created. She stared at us till we said theres two of us and then walked us to our table where she quickly made her way back to the front door. Besides the poor communication skills the hostess acquired everything else was good, our server was on top of his game and the tapas was well priced.
author: Garrett B.

description: After a slight misunderstanding with our reservation the hostess finally seated our party of ten. At first I was a little skeptical because of the attitude of the hostess and then our server arrived and everything suddenly got good. She was professional and attentive. The oyster shooters are not worth it but every other app was great like the empanadas and ceviche. The rib eye steak was one of the best seasoned steaks I've had in a long time. It was a little pricey but I guess it's worth it. My only true beef is that it's not a full bar.
author: Joseph M.

description:
with the exception of the pricey menu items, almost everything at this restaurant is a foodie's dream! their appetizers are incredible. my favorite dish here is the red snapper. the presentation has a real WOW factor and the side of curry is light  but sooo tasty!

my friends love it there bc the servers are attractive men. i go for the good food. oh! and the good drinks!
author: MD N.

description: So the service is horrible. Check your orders if you are ordering to go. They hang up the phone on you when u call to clarify a mistake. Worse service ever, I really feel ashamed to be Peruvian.. The food is decent, the chicken is the best.
author: Betsabel C.

description: The Chicken dish (white meat) was tasty but the yucca fries were skimpy. Veggie sides and sweet potato fries were great. We met another couple and wanted to catch up and chat....WAY TOO LOUD for this. We could barely hear our waiter. Overall it was okay.
author: Linda H.

description: Far better than imagined!  I had the snapper, limon lobster shooter and Sangria.  All was divine!
author: Wendy K.

description: the food was fresh and delicious. we had many of the seafood dishes and were impressed with the freshness.  The Mango Mojitos were refreshing and tasty, made with rice wine and fresh fruit.  Even the dessert was light and not too sweet.  It is pricy. we made reservations for eight and they wouldn't seat us until 8 people showed up, so make sure to consider this when you make reservations.
author: Roberto V.

description: I went to a family reunion at Limon and we had about 20 people in our group.  The service was great but the food was a little over hyped.  We ordered some appetizers and some sangria, both of which are very good.  The best app was their ceviche, which most Yelpers recommended.  But the entrées was not all that impressive.  I ordered the Red Snapper which had nice presentation with a whole fried fish with nuggets of fish fillets.  My cousins ordered the pork chop and chicken and they were nothing special. But over all, I think this place is great for appetizers and drinks.
author: Carmen C.

description:
Food - pretty good, we had one of the "Limon Classic": raw halibut, some calamari and shrimp, two types of corn (one large and soft, one dry roasted like pine nuts) served with a tart citrusy, light cumin sauce. That was pretty good, but I wasn't so fond of the cumin. Still, a pretty good starter.

Then I had a Lomo Salta(sp?) - beef strips with onion, red bell pepper and fries served with rice. The beef was nice - warm, soft and still pink on the inside. It was a tad oily for my liking though. The chicken version of the dish was better, in my opinion. It had a nice woody charcoal grill taste to it, with a light lemony flavour. Pity it was a little on the oily side too. 

On the whole, it's a nice place for dinner. Cosy, mid-range prices (4 entrees and a starter put us at about $25 per person). The service was pretty good and friendly. And at least I didn't get out of the restaurant smelling of food.
author: v w.

description:
Really fantastic. 

Besides the ceviche, which was quite good, the three entrees I tried were all really, really good.

The Picante Mariscos were excellent, the empenadas were delicious, and the red snapper was both artfully presented and tasty.

Service was perfect also, and when combined with the best sangria I've ever tasted, five stars no doubt.
author: Andrew L.

description:
Limon, thank you for proving yourself.

The first time I went to Limon was with a co-worker. I had never been and I was dying to go, so I dragged her out. 

I can't exactly remember what we had, but i do remember my pork chop tasting like a salt lick. Seriously, it tasted as if my pork chop had been raping the Morton Salt girl.

But for some reason I was still drawn to the restaurant and decided to give it a try--for my birthday dinner no less!

And it was amazing. Seriously. Delicious.

My only criticism is that the dessert menu wasn't terribly impressive to me--a little bit of a disappointment on your birthday dinner.

No dessert, and the boyfriend dumped me the next day--but it wasn't because of the food--and we're back together, so all's good.
author: David F.

description:
I finally got to Limon after hearing high recommendation from my foodie friends since they opened.  6 of us went for my birthday.  Everything was delish, even the kind of stuff that I usually avoid b/c it sounds mundane, or everyone has it.
My seafood stew entree was excellent-everything briny, cooked perfectly, well balanced with the sauce.  Even the prawns were top notch, in a prawn-inundated world.  Usually they're only this good in Chinese restaurants fresh out of the tank.
author: Rob B.

description:
The first time I went to Limon was for lunch and I only had their salad, mixed greens tossed asian pears and candied pecans.  But that was enough to let me know I am definitely coming back.  

The second time I went to Limon I knew this restaurant would be on my recommendation list to others.  My boy friend ordered ceviche limon and a steak dish.  He loved the ceviche and wished he had room to order the sampler so that he can try all of the ceviche varieties.  The steak dish he had (I forgot the name of it) was good, but he commented it was not over the top.  Well, that was all beside the point.  The key is all about what " I " ordered.  I had the fried  whole snapper that looked like it just jumped out of the deep fryer.  Not only the presentation was cool, the fish was yumtastic, the side of coconut fried rice was so flavorful that it can be a dish of its own.  The curry sauce was also really good to go with either the fish or the rice.  I personally thought the fish and rice had enough flavors that it could do without the curry, but my boy friend was totally digging it.

The service was good along with the food and the ambiance.  This is a must try if you are dining out in the Mission!
author: sandy c.

description:
We had dinner last night at Limon and really liked it.  

For appetizers, we had the shrimp/fish/corn Ceviche and it was fantastic.  We really enjoyed it

For dinner, I had the chicken breast with macaroni and my fiancee had the Top Sirloin slices with fries mixed in and rice.  They were both AMAZING.  The chicken was probably the best chicken I've ever had in a restauran and I ended up switching with her and enjoying the beef dish even more than the chicken.  Awesome.

In addition, the service was fantastic.  The host was very polite and got us seated earlier than expected.  And our server, Angel K, was very nice, very helpful, and all over ensuring that our wine glasses were full.

We'd definitely go back and we highly recommend it.
author: Collin H.

description:
Decent place.  I haven't been so kind to SF restaurants, too loud, and the table set up is a little funky monkey for a rectangular place.  We had to move 3 times.  

The hostess, and service was fantastic.  I was a little perturbed with the noise and lousy tables, she sensed it and moved us and was first rate. 

We had a sea bass appetizer with a creamy sauce that was delish!  I had the chicken with macaroni and cheese, both sub par, she, the hottie yum yum girlfriend got steak with fries and a dark sauce.  I was watching these chefs cook, they don't hold back the butter, but true professionals. 

Great place.  With the exception of the loud, recently released institutionalized woman behind me, the excessive loud large table settings, it's a good meal, but others posted a good place for a date, I would seriously disagree.  

I've been dating the same girl for a year, and had trouble focusing, let alone convo, "really you work with rockets?"  "wow, I love rockets."  That would suck.  

P.S.  Get the sea bass.
author: Michael R.

description:
I ventured over to Limon one fine evening with a friend. Before I went, I looked it up (on yelp). The menu looked good and the photos of the restaurant were enticing.

I got there a bit late, but my friend hadn't arrived yet. The host was very nice and invited me to wait at the bar while I waited for my friend to show up. I sat there for a few minutes before the bartender offered me a wine list, but I decided to wait until i was seated. The wine list is not super extensive, but they have a nice sample of wines from other countries (Argentina, Chile, etc.) which I can appreciate.

I had read great things about the sangria and it was good. Not the best I've ever had, but it wasn't bad. The first glass had no fruit and the second had some hanging out at the bottom which surprised me a bit.

For dinner I had the pork chop with bacon/mushroom cabbage. The sauce was decedent and I enjoyed it very much. I also had a bite of my friends steak which was great as well. We ordered some veggies on the side which didn't look all that great, so I passed. We split the trio ceviche that was recommended by the waiter. It was good and had huge pieces of octopus in it (which I totally dug). Thumbs up there.

The service was okay. There was some confusion in the beginning about our drinks, but other than that it was just alright. We really weren't in a rush so the lack of attention may have been because we were too busy chatting and the waiter picked up on that we were fine taking our time. 

The place was nice, but I wasn't super wowed. I would go back if someone invited me, but it wouldn't be on the top of my list.
author: Heather O.

description:
Yummy yummy!  We've been here a few times, and we've never left disappointed.  Their beef is good.  Their fish is good, as one would expect.  The soup I had last night (cream of corn) was almost too salty but still yummy.

They apparently have rooftop seating, though I only learned this from my next-door neighbor this morning so I have no idea if this is true or just a rumor.  I've been for lunch and prefer that, when it's quieter.

My husband is allergic to shrimp and crab  This really limits what he can order, which is a shame because he loves ceviche!  Last night he was able to order two, one which has no shrimp already and one which was modified for him.

We were happy with the service - dishes came and went unobtrusively, our waitress remembered to bring a spoon for the baby to play with.  We had intended to go somewhere else so we were dressed rather casually and I felt that we stood out for that - I think we were there during the after-work crowd but definitely most people there were better dressed than we were in our jeans and T-shirts.
author: Hypercycloid ..

description:
Apparently its not closed (thank God), just a little singed:

THE MISSION--About a week ago, a fire in the building--and the subsequent water damage--took a bite out of Limon, particularly its second-floor dining area. At the time, they only canceled lunch service and reopened for dinner, albeit only on the ground floor. But now, it looks like there's more damage than originally anticipated (see the interior) and the place is officially shuttered for "the next few weeks, until further notice." And yes, the latter part of that phrase is always an ominous sign.
 FireWire: Blaze Hits Limon; Lunch Off, Dinner On [~ESF~]

http://sf.eater.com/archives/2008/06/02/firewire_limon_forced_to_shutt.php
author: Matt L.

description:
I have always been a fan of Limon. Don't waste time looking for parking, just park in a garage. When you arrive get ready for great service the best sangrias and great food! As many as times as I have dined up stairs, down stairs' ambiance is just as cool. Get a few dishes and share them. My all time Limon favorite is the ceviche of course. But you have to have some other really cool dishes they serve like the Ahi Tuna and don't sleep on the scallops & Foie Gras it seems to melt in your mouth. 
The Rib eye and Roasted Chicken were prepared perfectly and the sides didn't just serve as garnish, it complimented the meat well. The Red Snapper was quite tasty. I found the staff friendly and great to look at.
author: MO C.

description:
I am so sad! LImon use to be all time favorite restaurant. We finally went tonight after being closed for over a year. I walked in and said "I am home" and that was about the last minute I felt at home. The menu is completely changed. I actually had a hard time finding something I wanted to order. Where is the scallops with Fois Gras?? Where are the Empanandas??  Where was the yummy crispy chicken?? 

The Scallop dish they now have was boring baked with parmesan cheese... very average. The Lomo Saltado was good, but really it's steak, onions, tomatoes and french fries... the oyster shooter was a dirrty, gritty oyster. Even the dipping sauces weren't good. The red one taste like baby food.

Then the dessert menu comes... Key Lime Pie??? We thought we were in a time warp... Come on LImon give us what we loved!!

We missed you for so long and now we were so underwhelmed!!
author: kelly f.

description: Great food, a little too pricey. Basement ambience is pathetic.
author: Alex M.

description:
Went to Limon for lunch yesterday-it's been on my list for over a year, so I was anticipating a great meal. The food was incredible but the service was terrible. I couldn't believe it. With all the great waiters in San Francisco that are out of work, why would the management keep these guys? Answer: maybe they don't know any better..

We waited forever for our meal, although several tables who came in after we did were served with alacrity. Then, my husband discovered two clear, square pieces of PLASTIC in his fried calamarii. They were practically invisible, but could have been lethal. Since our waiter never checked in with us after serving, we pointed the plastic out to the busperson. We watched him take the plate to the owner (or manager) who carried it back to the kitchen. He came out and spoke to our waiter, who never said another word to us until he placed the check on the table. No one ever apologized and we were charged full price for the dish. 

Is this any way to keep a customer?
author: Sharon E.

description:
To start with, Limon Rotisserie (their sister restaurant on Van Ness) is one of my favorites.  

That being said, I've never been disappointed by Limon on Valencia (this was my 4th visit).  Limon offers a combinations of good food, great service, interesting (and good) wine list, and cool ambience.  It's good for a date night or a larger group, so it seems to fit the bill when you want some modern Peruvian/American food.

The Ceviche Limon is standard ceviche fair.  Nothing spectacular, but nevertheless, quite good.

The Red Snapper is presented beautifully.  Very popular dish, as many tables around us also had the snapper.  It's filleted and cut into chunks and deep fried, and presented on the remainder of the fish, which is also deep fried. 

The Pork Chop on cabbage was cooked perfectly:  Slightly pink in the middle and crispy on the outer edge.  It's topped with more pork bits (don't recall if it was pancetta or sausage)... Is there such a thing as too much pork?  Maybe.  But not in this case!

We asked our server to bring out the dishes in courses, and he was very happy to oblige.  Service was excellent from beginning to end, even as we kept asking for the wine list to get a new glass of wine for each course.
author: Richard K.

description: Best ceviche in SF.
author: Pietari G.

description: We had a table of six for dinner at Limon, knowing that the small plates were fit for  sharing.  It had a good group atmosphere, but the dishes were mediocre.  I've heard better things about the Van Ness location.
author: Alice Y.

description:
If you want a fast way to an upset stomach - eat here!

I dined at the newly renovated Limon a few weeks back, and must share my ordeal with fellow Yelpers.

My girlfriend and I had several cebiches including the uni with sea bass.  The first round was way too salty, and they were kind enough to make another portion for us.  It was a bit more palatable, but missing that certain je ne c'est quai.

We also had the baked scallops with cheese, the grilled octoups, the vegetarian risotto, and the sirloin steak.

Our meal was pleasant enough with a carafe of argentinean cabarnet.  But, I must say after a few hours, it was not so pleasant!  I won't go into details, but suffice it to say that my iron stomach was not calphalon proof!

I called and left several messages with the GM (Kevin), but to no success.  Hence, I am sharing my experience and frustration on this site.  I am not one to whine, but I will NEVER recommend Limon to anyone on my roster!!
author: edward a.

description:
I liked Limon a lot before the fire. 

Friday night I went and was very disappointed. The place looks great, and was hopping. I was excited! From stepping foot in the door, it was all downhill.

We had a reservation  - it took them an hour to seat us. 
We were sitting upstairs, and it was so loud we could not hear eachother speak.
At various points in the night the room filled with smoke, which made us nervous considering Limon seems to have fire control problems.
Service was veeeeery slow. We waited 20 minutes for our apps, and another 35 minutes for our main course. The first person we ordered dessert from forgot about it, and we had to order it from someone else.
The Pork was raw. Um, Yuck.

The food in general - ok, but for the same money we could have gone to Conduit, or for a tenth as much we could have gone to La Tacqueria. So, yeah.

Luckily the company was amazing, and the sangria pitcher was large.
author: Sarah G.

description: This place was spot-on! Deeelish! A little pricey, but that's my only complaint.
author: Alicia J.

description: This place is one of my favorite places to eat in the city. The ceviche shooters are to die for and their drinks are the best. They have amazing service and a great atmosphere. Totally recommend it!
author: Victoria H.

description: It pains me to give Limon only 3 stars. I used to love this place. I would dream about its chicken entree for days on end before we would go for dinner. But when they opened again they changed the chicken entree - now it has a strong pepper taste - not only stuffed w/peppers but also pepper in the sauce which I don't remember from before. I wish they hadn't messed with the original. They kept the same great taste of the Lomo Saltado which is basically french fries, steak and sauce. My husband LOVES this dish. But it's a shame because we likely won't be back unless they change the chicken recipe. Last thought - there prices seem high for being in a recession. There is still a lot going for this place but I'm not sure how well they are going to do at the current price point. Two entrees for carry-out were $40+.
author: Kimberly H.

description: Delicious sangria, and interesting and tasty menu items. The flavor is great and I want to try more. Now.
author: Meera G.

description: If it's dinner, don't go hungry.  The photos shown have nothing to do with the skimpy dishes you're actually served.   On a Wednesday night, Limon had a handful of diners, and a $12 "cerbiche" appetizer offered was "cooked perfectly, but so very small a serving of fish with almost no accompaniment (a single slice of a carrot halved as decoration?) that it disappoints gravely -- and who posted the food pictures?  my $21 entree was 4 bites of halibut paired with 4 bites of a potato and 3 shrimp -- I'm still hungry for dinner!    I didn't see any dish resembling the pictures!  Do NOT go hungry to Limon, or you'll be disappointed.  btw, the decor is fresh and lovely with handsome wood tables and chairs, so order a (pricey) drink and enjoy the place.  I won't go back until they change their ways.    Order food, and pay double for a fraction of something edible.
author: Patricia F.

description: Went here for the first time last Saturday night with a group of friends.  For most of us this was our first time. This restuarant did not disappoint. The staff were very nice and helped with the menu. We enjoyed every bite of food we ordered the chicken with the the yummy sauces, chicharron, tacu-tacu, all so delish! The drinks were great. The restuarant was a bit small and the crowd picked up at 9pm.  People were standing near by waiting for a table and the it was a bit loud, but then again, so were we. I can't wait to go back, maybe I'll try one of their other locations.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
So disappointing!  After waiting over a year for Limon to open, my friends and I went last night.  Upon walking in I could tell immediately that the atmosphere had changed.  Gone was the comfy, warm, homey feel and in place was something more sterile and cold.  I'm not sure what took over a year to build but it certainly didn't look impressive to me.

And the food.  Limon used to be my favorite restaurant in the city.  Now, I'm not sure I would go back.  When a restaurant claims to have a Michelin star rated chef, I expect to be wowed.  Underwhelmed would be an understatement.  The cebiche was nothing special, the grilled octopus was boring and tasted like it had been cooked with smoked sausages, the scallop dish was amateurish, and the oyster shooter my friend ordered was gritty.  The dipping sauces were terrible.  Limon Rotisserie's blow these out of the water.

Please reconsider the menu and bring back the Scallops with Fois Gras and Empanadas just to name a few!
author: Michele N.

description: I had lunch here last week.  The ceviche and shooter were excellent.  The  Parihuela, while tasy, seemed a bit over-seasoned for me.  We also had an empanada, which was ok, and had some interesting flavors.
author: Bill P.

description: Came here for dinner with a group of friends and gf. Nice place and atmosphere.  Very upscale. I had the fried snapper, which was very good. And the presentation of everyone's food was great. If you are hungry or go with an appetite the entree portion sizes are a bit small. I would recommend ordering a side to go along with dinner and an appetizer.  All in all a good classy place to go.
author: Chuck G.

description: Heads up Yelper Foodies - Limon on Valencia re-opened on 8/27/09! I can taste the truffle mac and cheese already!!!
author: Alan L.

description: They serve yummy ceviche and sangrias. I'd recommend going here for dinner on Friday or Saturday since it's located on a fun strip of the Valencia that has a lot to offer. Not for the faint of heart but if you get passed first impressions, you'll enjoy the boutique shops, bars/lounges, and people (authentic hipsters?). Be careful of 16th and Mission though. Even with major gentrification over the years, that corner still attracts shady folks.
author: Regina A.

description: This restaurant was my first real experience at tasting Peruvian food.  The staff was very friendly and ensured we were always content with our drinks refilled.  Overall, the food was quite tasty. I really recommend getting the Ceviche Nikkei de Atun - it had enough taste of lime - but not enough to empower the taste of the tuna.  For our main entree, we ordered the Lomo Saltado.  A little bland on the flavor, but the meat was very tender!
author: Mark T.

description: I'm not a Peruvian cuisine expert, but I had the opportunity to try the Ceviche in a Peruvian restaurant in Miami. The one at Limon was not nearly as good and the portions were tiny. The place is really nice, but I think it's a little pricey.
author: Juan G.

description: My husband and I celebrated his birthday at Limon Rotisserie, along with about 10 of his friends.  We LOVE Peruvian food!  We're originally from Maryland where our favorite Peruvian restaurants are cheap, the food is served on styrofoam plates, sides are piled high, soda's in a can, and there's a TV in the corner playing a soccer match.  Limon is the complete opposite, and that's okay.  The food was delicious (excellent taste and presentation), the service was good, and the interior design of the place was cool.   Now, here comes my two minor complaints: 1) I understand they serve small plate/tapas style, but I didn't expect the serving size of their sides to be so stingy. We ordered yuca fries and got back about four yuca fries...artfully lined up...on a tiny plate.  Really?!  They're probably one of the cheapest menu item for the restaurant to make.  2.) It was a little loud in there, like other reviewers have said.  All in all, we liked Limon Rotisserie and I want to go back so we can try their Pisco Sours.
author: Jen L.

description:
Exceptional food and great service! The sangria is awesome! I find the place to be very Ikea-like and lacking in character. A few added large paintings or anything with some character will help. I haven't been to Peru but I doubt it is this boring.
One thing I noticed about Limon is that it made me feel like I was in LA.
4 stars in food. 1 star for decor/ atmosphere.
author: H K.

description:
Very cool spot.  Energetic and stylish.  The service is great. Go for the fried fish. It arrives at your table in such a beautiful presentation, you don't want to ruin it.  But tuck in because it is scrump!

Pass on the traditional Peruvian stew of sliced steak and french fries. Bland bland. And the steak was a bit chewy too.
author: Christina T.

description:
Atmosphere - 4 (trouble with the lights)
Beer - 2 (bitter)
Food - 4 I had the rib and it was not enough food
Aps - 5
Desert - 3 (Banana thing was weak)
author: David B.

description:
Excellent food, service, atmosphere-- no complaints at all 

The Ceviche Limon is  must although I noticed they have reduced the size of the portion a bit. The snapper was fantastic!

Reservations are a must.
author: Steve A.

description:
Nice space and great location -- lots of great bars nearby for an after dinner drink. I took two out-of-towners here and was really let down by the service.

Firstly, our drink order disappeared -- after having given the waiter our order we spent a good 15 minutes waiting. I mean you would have thought they'd have come to take our food order in that time, at which point we could have reminded them about the drinks. In the end we had to fetch another waiter to take our order and go look for our drinks.

But it gets stranger. The lights in our section started going on and off for about a minute. No idea why. No explanation given. The whole experience was getting weird -- and we began to feel an ominous sense there was more to come.

Which there was.

We got the sampler of 3 types of ceviche. Not bad. The only issue with this period of the meal was when a busboy came and topped up my sparkling water with his jug of tap (I had already narrowly avoided this, stopping someone previously just in time). When we explained what he'd done he just looked blankly at us and walked off. No offer of more sparkling or any other recompense.

The entrees arrived and my friend's fried snapper was promptly dumped in her lap when the busboy went to place her plate in front of her. Holy crap! If you weren't there it would be hard to believe. To their credit they were able to bring her another in a few minutes. And the food was delicious, it must be said.

The thing is, up until this point they hadn't once come over and properly apologized for anything, offered any free dishes or any other measure you'd expect a good restaurant to take when this sort of thing happens (which even in the best restaurant, it sometimes does). When the waiter came to take our desert order and my friend told him she was too scared to order anything else he looked confused as said "uhhh, because things took a bit long tonight? sorry we were real busy". We had to explain what had happened! (although he'd seen it all, surely). At which point we got free coffees and a desert.

Accidents and issues with service are a great opportunity for a restaurant to show its true class. It's easy to be slick when everything is going along smoothly. It's how you handle the bumps that puts you a cut above in my mind. In this department I felt Limon failed.
author: Anson P.

description:
We've eaten several times at Limon and have always enjoyed its excellent cuisine.  The cervices - the star of the show - are varied and delicious, perhaps the best in town, and the rest of the menu offers nice, balanced variety including some excellent meat dishes (I love the pork chop).

The place is always full, and its open-plan layout with mezzanine level all contribute to its buzzing atmosphere, but I have one huge reservation about the place: I am sick of making reservations and STILL having to wait for 30 mins each time for my table to be ready.  Limon has no bar to relax in as they try to make space in their - clearly overbooked - dining room, so I wish that they'd fix the front of house operation.

Still go for the food - it's excellent - but be prepared for a long and less than convivial experience before they finally lead you to your table.
author: Dom B.

description:
We received delightful service.  Especially the host and our waiter, he was a delight.

Enjoyed the food, very good, not stunning, but still good.

Maybe we are dummies but couldn't see the place from across the street, who knows why was still sober.
author: E C.

description: Have visited about 3 times now with friends/ Groupons.  Was pretty yummy in a modern, trendy atmosphere.  Pretty much all their portions are fairly small as one usually tends to find in a trendy modern atmosphere, right? So it's perfect for ordering a few dishes and sharing with a few friends.  I bought a Groupon after eating at their sister restaurant, Limon Rotisserie.  Can't say that I had anything I didn't like, but I was left still craving their signature chicken at Limon Rotisserie as it was not on their Limon menu (at least not on the lunch menu).  Everything seemed pretty fresh and all experiences with staff/ servers were positive ones.  Don't know that I would come back without a Groupon as it did seem fairly pricey, but, we'll see.
author: Ana B.

description:
Visiting from out of town, we enjoyed getting off the usual tourist path and eating in the Mission area.
Only fault was the drinks from the bar weren't great, we wanted a pisco sour, which they had their version of on the drink menu, but they said they didn't have pisco.  I'm not sure what we ended up with after the bartender's haste as she hurried us to choose a new cocktail.

The food was pretty tasty.  Our group ordered several appetizers and dishes and we shared everything.  The waiters were also very accommodating to this as well.  We definitely ordered our share of various wines and sangria.

Had the trio ceviche, mushroom empanadas, snapper fillet, Churrasco a la parilla, Aroz con Mariscos (paella), truffle infused mac-n-cheese, crispy yucca fries.
Everything was great, sans the snapper, it was probably more interesting in presentation than taste.  I didn't see the sauce to pour over it until the end, so it was a bit bland without it.
author: Scott T.

description: Found a live worm in my ceviche. I have never had to go to the bathroom to throw up before, and can attest to the clean bathroom. Again a live worm. The waitress was shocked and obviously did not charge us for our meal or drinks, but still a live worm in my marinated raw fish.
author: Laurent R.

description:
Had dinner with some family from Peru last night. Honestly the best Peruvian food I have had outside of Peru, my family was very happy as well.

Living in San Francisco and being exposed to so many good restaurants I have to say that we are spoiled and we are very good critics.

Dinner started out with Ceviche Mixto (a must) and some Chicharron de Pollo DELICIOUS!! We shared a lot of different appetizers or "piqueos" The empanadas are out of this world and so is the Tuna TIradito.

Our server was very attentive and he knew his food (even though he wasn't Peruvian) Cleared our plates between courses and gave us clean silverware a nice touch I think.

My Lomo Saltado was as good as in Peru!! My aunt had the Pargo Rojo, very creative presentation ...

Desserts were good, but they lacked the Peruvian Staples like Alfajores, Arroz con Leche etc..

Great Dinner and very reasonably price, will definitely come back!!
author: Chorrillano P.

description: I went for dinner with 5 people in our party. We made reservations and got seated quickly. We ate tapas-style so we ordered the whole chicken, 2 sides came with it and ordered 3 more, plus a pitcher of sangria. Surprisingly, it didn't break the bank! I don't know the exact names of the plates, but I can describe them for y'all! Get ceviche (Limón), fried seafood with scallops and goodies, slow cooked beef, sweet potato fries, yucca veggies. The three dipping sauces that the chicken comes with is superb!!!
author: Susan D.

description:
Had dinner at Limon and it was AMAZING!!!!!! the food was incredible and we enjoyed it so much! i will be there every week! love the people that work there. they are so nice!
Good Job!
author: irene h.

description:
Somehow I missed the fact that this is a Peruvian fusion place when I first looked it up.  Needless to say, I was pretty disappointed when I saw the menu.  There was hardly anything peruvian aside from the ceviche.  Everything seemed to be more "asian" than peruvian.  The restaurant is definitely out of place in the mission... it's very clean, modern and contemporary compared to the taquerias around the corner.

As for the food...I liked their spreads that came with the bread - a garlic aioli type and some kind of spinach aioli or something of that sort.  The garlic (yellow) one was the favorite at the table.  Although the menu wasn't very impressive, the dishes didn't disappoint too much.  My friends got the chicken with mushroom stuffed pepper and truffle infused mac n cheese.  The chicken was very flavorful and according to my friend, the stuffed pepper was really delicious!  The mac n cheese was good, but nothing too impressive.  I got the ribeye with potatoes and green beans.  The steak was good, had some flavor, but didn't seem any different than any other steak... so, how was it peruvian fusion??  Another friend got the popular sirloin with rice and potatoes... This was a very asian dish.  Very tasty, but I still don't see how it was peruvian other than the fries (yucca roots).  Another friend got the fried snapper with curry sauce.  By description on the menu, it sounded mouth watering...  but by taste, it was not impressive.  The presentation was very eye catching though! See the pictures for more visuals.  The curry sauce didn't really go well with it... it was a bright orange curry sauce and i couldn't really pinpoint a good taste... it tasted... interesting.  Overall, the fish was something I wish I had skipped.

Something not to skip is the ceviche.  We got the red snapper ceviche, which was really good.  My friend who hates sushi and anything raw even liked it!  My only complaint about this is that it was hard to eat/share because it was in long thin strips instead of chunks.

Overall, my picks for you if you go would be:
- chicken with pepper and mac n cheese
- red snapper ceviche
- steak if you want steak... 

I only wish it was more peruvian.  I guess I will stick to Fresca =P
author: Diane L.

description: Get the Pa Bravo Yo cocktail, a half chicken with vegetables and sweet potato fries. Maybe the truffle mac-n-cheese. You are welcome.
author: Thomas K.

description: What a great hip place with remarkable food.. We sat at the bar and received terrific service all night. We split the chicken appetizer which was enough for the two of us. The bread came with 2 dipping sauces that we amazing. I had a perfectly grilled rib eye steak. They let me switch out the potatoes for some excellent grilled vegetables. My partner had a pan seared stuffed chicken that was perfectly crispy on the outside yet very juicy inside. We tried 2 different wines by the glass. All said a perfect night for under $100
author: Robert O.

description:
great lomo saltado!!! Pricy but worth every penny... Great desserts..

The decor is awesome.
author: Karen F.

description:
I went here with a friend.

We ordered two appetizers and some main course that was fried fish CHINESE style. 

If I wanted to pay $90 for imitation Chinese food, I would go to Chinatown. And there I wouldn't have to pay $90 for the food.

Btw, the $90 also includes the tip.

The waiters are nice and friendly. Not jumpy jumpy and all over you.

Would I go back? 

Sure, if someone else was paying for it!
author: Nicole W.

description:
Really tasty morsels! I would advise that the entire table orders multiples of small plates. The stuffed calamari is to die for.

I also enjoy the detailing on the booth seats. They are really true to their roots. No cookie cutter restaurant here.

However, when they get busy, they WILL forget your leftovers, water, etc. Hence 3 instead of 4 stars.
author: Charmagne L.

description:
Limon is probably the best Peruvian place in a city that suddenly seems to have a lot of them.  Try the ceviche sampler for a little bit of everything they specialize in. 

Also, I had a whole fish there that was deep fried, and curled up into a standing loop.  Showy and yummy.

I give it only four stars because after going four or five times, I don't really feel like going any more.

Update (3/5/11):  They've re-opened after a fire there, and it looks basically the same, but with a fancier bar.  Food seems the same.  I just wanted to say you should try the rib-eye if you like steak.  Fantastic!
author: Danny H.

description:
Hostess:  40 minute wait.
Shit, but there's space at the bar to grab drinks while we wait.
Actual Wait:  1:45.

Why am i giving four stars?  The food was fantastic, waitstaff attentive.  The decor is sharp even while the atmosphere was still cozy.

And I had a whole lotta wine on a rainy bummy day.
author: Ravi G.

description:
Limon's been closed for more than a week  "for renovations" -- althoujgh it doesn't appear any are in progress. Chairs are stacked up on the tables. No signs of life when I've walked by. Anyone know what happened?   

Food's great but pricey. Liked the loma saltado. A bit cheaper in the lunch hours. A Peruvian friend of mine found it overpriced and portions small when he went at night. He prefers the Peruvian restaurant  that's in the old Food Mall near 22st  on Mission. 

Hopefully Limon will reopen and maybe lower their prices so more people can go (like me). I know I'm dreaming...
author: Ted W.

description: Been here several times now. The food is good but the prices are expensive. Be prepared to dig into your wallet. I do have to admit that the portions are satisfactory so you don't leave hungry after spending your mulah. Our table ordered a variety of options (ceviche, red snapper, baby ribs, and lomo saltado). The ceviche was amazing, by far my favorite. The other dish were good but could be found at alternative Peruvian spots with a less expensive price tag attached. All in all, if you have some extra cash to spend on eating out give this place a try.
author: mary s.

description:
I've heard many good things about Limon, but meh...it's okaaaaay, just not my favorite. My handsome took me here on a Friday night and boy, was it busy...there was not an empty table in sight with several parties still waiting for their table. Recession? Apparently not!
The decor was subtle, modern and simple. The hint of lime green and orange colors throughout the restaurant as well as in the food was a nice "red thread" touch.
The service overall was pleasant as well, although I have to say...sitting next to two tables who knew the chef and the waiter kind of made me feel unimportant. However, it didn't prevent them from paying their other patrons attention...But I'm just sayin'...
The menu was not extensive, but balanced and full of flavors. We started off with the Limon Cebiche. It had perfect portions of shrimp, calamari and tuna (at least I think that's what it was...). However, the squid was a bit chewy...bleh. I wish I tried the Cebiche shooters...they looked delish! The Empanadas de Carne was also good. A bit on the salty side, but it had a crispy pastry crust that made my mouth water.
Finally, our entrees came. I had the Pargo Rojo (Fried Whole Red Snapper) but I made the mistake of trying his Lomo Saltado first. Medium rare steak, fries and onions...Wow, a salty punch, but delicious! Therefore causing my snapper to taste pretty bland. I also didn't like how my fish was staring right at me, cheezin' his teeth at me. My handsome had to discard his head for me...he gave me the heebeegeebees. I was expecting the snapper to be a bit more salty, since everything else seemed to be drenched in it! Oh well...
Alas, Limon's saving grace: Dessert!  The Mango Pie, light, fluffy and whipped was quite tasty. So pretty. So precious. We also ordered the Cream Puffs, which were my personal favorite. Not too sweet, but oh so yummy!  
Overall...I can do without...but glad to have had the experience.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
WORST FOOD EVER!!!! Taco bell would have been better  
Came here for a Birthday Dinner for about 20 peeps... We had the prefix menu.  For Appetizer, I had the mix seafood cebiche  my little 5 year old cousin could have done better. NO taste, BLAND ass hell, I had to ask for hot sauce to give it some flavor.  Had this seafood paella.. %$##@ ( this dish isn't even on the menu ) first bite into it... this shit is so salty, it's like you were snorkeling in the ocean and had a taste of the water but even x10 worst. We told the manager and he comped us the dish. To make things worst the Chef that made the food was some illegal FUDGE  !! prob was getting paid $5.75 per hr ( sorry but I'm pretty upset) he was laughing with the rest of the workers.

OVER PRICE FOOD FOR CRAP!!!!
author: So V.

description: Had a birthday celebration there yesterday, so we were a bigger and and the service was still great, very attentive waiters. Unfortunately there is a cake cutting fee, but that could have been expected. they did present our birthday cake though in a great way as dessert. The prices are definitely okay for the food, and the food was great! We had family style dinner so  we got to try  a lot of things. Ceviche mixto is my favorite but the other dishes were great too! recommend it!! and will go back again:)
author: Marie F.

description: This restaurant has some great food, a little bit noisy but now that they have their liquor license you can know back a few shots and the noise becomes a little more tolerable.
author: Dan M.

description: The food at this place gets 3.5 stars by my liberal standards, but I had the worst experience here.  (a) the seating arrangement and the acoustics at this place are awful -- it's one of those places where the tables are at least a couple of feet in length and the conversational din gets so high because of how enclosed the space is, it's impossible to even talk to the person across your table.  (b) it's also one of those fancy-schmancy places where you are paying mostly for garnishment and ceramic, so you almost need a supplemental meal afterwards...good thing there's plenty of tacquerias in the mission.
author: Chaz N.

description: Its wonderful the Ceviche is out of this world and the fish is outstanding the staff is great as well
author: Jim F.

description:
A group of us went here for dinner.  The food is okay and the service was poor.  I was flagging down the waiter for more bread.  He looked at me and walked away.  And the hostess was trying to hurry us up.  

The dressing on the Ensalada Mixta was memorable.  The sliced pears on top was a nice touch.  After the meal, we were still hungry.  My friends and I searched for ramen!
author: H C.

description: Went for the first time.  Overall, it was ok, but numerous problems detracted from a good experience.  First, the service was incredibly uneven.  The first person took forever to take our order.  After that, 3 additional people acted like our waiter throughout the course of the meal.  Next problem was the food.  The ceviche was excellent.  The cooked seafood was overcooked every time.  My wife got the PEI mussels as an app, and they were tiny, and rubbery.  Then she got the paella with seafood for a main, and again, most of the seafood was horribly overcooked.  I got the pork chop for a main, and it too, was over cooked and chewy.  We likely won't return, as nothing was especially good here.
author: lonni f.

description: First a few things to admit...I read the other reviews before visiting.  I went with a large group, so we had reservations and we did the Prix Fixe Menu.  It is a very busy, loud and lively place.  For such a large group, our customer service was excellent.  Although we had more than one server at any given time, they were all timely in refilling sangria and water glasses.  They evenly distributed the food throughout the table and were very attentive.
