Now the food...We had the beet salad, tuna tartare, mixed green salad and the mixed ceviche for the first course.  I am not a tuna tartare fan, but this one won me over.  It was rich and smooth and "meaty" tasting.  The second course we had empanadas, the lomito saltado and the chiccaron de pollo.  They were all delicious, but the empanada shells reminded me of a hot buttermilk biscuit!  They won me over for this course!  For the last course we had fries, rice, and the whole reason why you go to Limon Rotisserie, the chicken!  Folks, this is not the supermarket rotisserie chicken, OK?!  It is hands down the best chicken ever!  The sauces were good, but I felt the chicken didn't need anything extra.  I am normally a dark meat chick and I decided to go for a breast piece and it was so moist and flavorful! For dessert, we had the chocolate cake, the profiteroles and the panna cotta.  I only tried the cake.  I was so full!  I unfortunately did not get to try to the truffle mac and cheese because it is not apart of the Prix Fixe Menu option our group chose.  This will be my excuse to go back!  I had a wonderful dining experience, even with a large group! The portions are great and the prices are affordable.  I  highly recommend it and I will definitely return!  No more  wire hangers...OOPS!  I mean supermarket rotisserie chicken!  ;)
author: Carla J.

description:
Limon is fabulous! Every detail from the ambience, the service, the combination of flavors - your palette will explode with joy! Exceptional!
God bless Martin Castillo!  Make a reservation, and escape into a wonderful culinary adventure in nuevo latino fusion at its best.
author: Dori C.

description:
Food and service was excellent. This was one of the few times that when asking for a wine reccomendation that the waiter asked what type of wine we were looking for ie big and bold, med bodied ect. If you feel like venturing out try a south american wine. 

Highly reccommend the pork, mac and cheese and the hot scallop appetizer. They have a large assortment of cerviches to fit anyones pallet. 

I would definitely go back.
author: Phill and Molly O.

description:
I went to Limon last night and it was quite a disappointment. We arrived at 9.30 pm but we got our meal at 11.05!  And their menu was more fusion than Peruvian: besides the causa rellena, ceviches and pricey "canchitas" (4.50 each!) there offered mostly international dishes.  I was also expecting to have a pisco sour, but they don't have a liquor license (bummer). 
I am giving them 3 start because they do have a friendly service and tasty food, although you have to wait way too long to get your food.  Definitely not coming back.
author: Fabiola P.

description:
I went to limon for my wife's b-day and this place was great we had to wait in the bar for 15 minutes, but we had a glass of merlot.
We had the tuna and th esteak with achimicurri sauce.  I will highly recomend this place for a nice new concept.
author: P S.

description: The atmosphere was sensuous. I am a huge fan of the sangria and cebiche. I loved the steak I ordered. Worth the parking hassels.
author: Anna R.

description: Was disappointed.  Ordered the chicken - nothing special.  My friend ordered the crispy chicken - said it was salty.  The sangria was too sweet.  Service was good.
author: Nora S.

description:
Disappointing.  I was expecting a five-star experience but left with a 2.5-star taste in my mouth.  Sad, because I really love the taste of ceviche!

The food here is good and the only reason why Limon gets any stars; however, it's a tad overpriced.  We tried the Oyster Shooter ($3), the Ceviche Limon with fish, octopus, shrimp, and calamari ($12), the Quinoa and Wild Mushroom Risotto ($17) and the Lasana Amazonica for dessert ($8).  All of these dishes were pretty good, but generally the portion sizes were skimpy.   Plus, I found the "leche de tigre" sauce in the shooter and the ceviche overwhelming and felt like there was way too much lime.  For a better deal, head to Limon Rotisserie, which offers more delicious and abundant ceviche and other Peruvian food in a less stuffy atmosphere. 

Knocked down 2.5 stars for the service.  First, our server took FOREVER to even take our drink orders.  I saw a party who was seated after us happily sipping their mango soju cocktails and this was upsetting.  Then, our server gave me a strange look when I asked to keep a menu after we ordered.  Sorry, but I like to have the option of ordering more, especially if it's my first time at a restaurant.  I don't know why you'd complain if that means more money for you, mister!  Then, our server forgot our dessert until my boyfriend reminded him, after our server presented the check without the dessert.  To top it off, he tacked onto the bill two extra items on the menu that I most certainly did not order, and when I pointed this out to him, he said "oh yah....I meant to take that off."  What if I hadn't noticed?  His behavior all night left an unsavory flavor in my mouth, so I won't be returning any time soon.  The Rotisserie definitely reigns supreme above this over-hyped joint.
author: Kira K.

description:
We came here at around 3pm for some early dinner. The restaurant is very small, with about 12 tables or so, a bar area. We were given a "brunch" menu which doesn't have that many choices. The dishes are VERY small!! We ended up having to order 4 dishes and weren't that filled! We the shrimp ceviche, empanada, & grilled chicken in skewer (dont' remember what it's called in spanish). When all these "brunch" dishes arrived, we were still hungry so we asked for the menu and thent hey gave us a dinner menu. We ordered the quinoa veggie dish. 

This place looks nice and trendy. But dishes are too scant, seems like finger food. I was recommended this restaurant by a Pervuvian friend, b ut then i realized we went to the wrong location! There is another one on s. Van Ness but I'm not sure if they're under the same mgmt. so i give this restaruant a 3.5 stars. The food is good, but just portion too meager.
author: Tiffany W.

description:
I give this restaurant  a mixed review.

Meat empanada had a slightly burnt, weird taste, which I didn't enjoy. They were nothing like traditional Latin American empanadas.

The mimosa lacked the usual sweetness of orange juice. I hated it.

The yucca fries were superbland. I've had much better yucca in other places

The ceviche was delicious, as was the lomo salteado with eggs.
author: M M.

description: Came here with an out of town guest (I am local).  I have not been here for a while and wanted to show him the Mission district.  A quick BART train ride from downtown, and another quick 1 block stroll to the restaurant.  Don't drive here - parking is impossible.  We ordered a nice bottle of Argentinian red wine, started with an order of chicken empanadas (comes with 2 small pies - perfect for sharing).  The pastry was crisp and flaky - and not greasy.  Also had the OUTSTANDING ceviche.  YUMMY.  Could have eaten a full order of this.  We spilt the  1/2 chicken and got sweet potato fries.  They are known for their chicken and it does NOT disappoint.  For those who like only white, or only dark, you have the option of specifying if you like which meat you want.  We had the standard  1/2 chicken so it had white and dark meat.  My friend only likes white meat and I like both so it was perfect.  Comes with 3 tasty sauces.  An excellent meal and great value.  The service was excellent.  This place does not disappoint.  I have recommended it over the years to several friends (locals and visitors) and they too have enjoyed their meal here
author: Sandra M.

description: Limon took wonderful care of our party of 20.  The food was truly delicious (including some of the best chicken I've ever had), and the service was great.     Limon is one of those places where you can tell that the people who work there really want their guests to enjoy it.   Will be back again and again.
author: Adam C.

description: I dined at this Limon in a party of 10 on a Friday night and it worked very well. We each ordered two plates and then shared. The classic dishes are empanadas and cerviche. Service during dinner was great, but we were forgotten when it came time to pay the bill and depart. No expresso coffee option.
author: David R.

description: What a great place!! My friends and I came to eat here on Saturday for a friends birthday. We made reservations for 8. We had seating on the second floor overlooking the bottom floor. I ordered a appetizer, ahi tuna, very good! For my entree I ordered the pork chop, mmmmm delicious. The steak here is huge and super yummy!! Overall this place was a nice choice, the staff is friendly and the atmosphere is cute. The only thing was the lighting. Half of the table was in the dark and the other half was in the spot light. I think they should fix that some how. I sat in the spot light and it was a bit too warm. Still though I will come here again!
author: Michelle S.

description: Good ceviche, not fancy like La Mar, but fun.
author: Hugo R.

description: I recently visited this restaurant a couple months ago for my 3rd time. Each time that i have dined here my experience has always been a very pleasant one. The service is great (every time you get up to use the restroom or go outside for a smoke, your napkin is magically folded neatly when you get back!), the food is delicious and you can't beat their $35 pre-fix menu! It's definitely a bang for your buck. Their sangria is one of the best I've tasted and my favorite entree is their lomo saltado. The parking is horrible here but that won't stop me from dining here in the future. Yes, it's that good.
author: Liss E.

description:
I came on a date here a few weeks ago and the food was great! I would definitely recommend this as a first date spot. 
The Ceviche was outstanding and the Sangria was great as well!
Service was overall great, felt a bit rushed but on a busy Saturday night its understandable.
author: MARK J.

description: I like the atmosphere here.  The sangria was also pretty good.  My boyfriend had the red snapper and it was delicious.  I had the arroz con mariscos.  The seafood was all really good quality and cooked to perfection, but I didn't enjoy the seasoning of the dish so much.  It didn't taste much better than a box of rice you make on the stove top but maybe that's normal for paella.  It was a really nice place though and I would recommend trying it, especially if you're with a larger group it seemed like it would be a good environment.
author: Jai B.

description: What a sexy fun place. The service was wonderful, knowledgeable. Killer food, try the oyster shooters. I had the ribeye too which was wonderful. I will certainly be going back there
author: Benjamin K.

description:
we came here to attend a birthday dinner. the place was completely full, and bustling with energy on a saturday night. we were told that dinner was at 8:30, and were seated close to 9:45. now i feel that the organizers said 8:30, with an actual later reservation, to ensure the lagers and stragglers would get there at a decent time. the bf and i were not in the humor to wait in the crowded bar area. every minute or so you had to adjust yourself because either a waiter or patron had to pass by. we opted to wait outside and enjoy the fresh air. 

they did the best they could to accommodate our party of 17. we were seated at the loft with several tables assembled together at the back wall. we were crammed, but the birthday girl did not want to split up her guests. we had to play tetris with the tables when the people sitting against the wall had to get up to go to the toilet, and what not. it was a definite fire hazard. 

the wait staff worked hard on getting each course out, changing plates and silverware, and attending to the never ending requests of our group. the bf and i shared the ceviche limon, had an oyster shooter a piece, and feasted on the snapper dinner. our party had numerous desserts, of which i'm not sure of, and all were tasty with pretty presentations. 

this place is definitely not an intimate spot, but the presence of a roaring crowd speaks for the food itself.
author: Sheri N.

description:
I had been waiting to go there for some time, ever since they got featured on check please...... 
Its nothing to write home about. i dont think i will be spending my oney here.

the staff was good, the sangria was good too but thats about it.

th food wasnt and thats all that matters
author: snigdha c.

description:
The mother and I dined here on Saturday after a Kryolan raid. 

Came in just as the dinner hour were beginning. 

I can't remember our waiters name, but he was very attentive and personable. 

We ordered the Sangria and the Pink Lemon drop, both were very tasty. I ordered the Sangria, but wound up switching to the Lemon Drop. The sangria was slightly sweet but more tart, with chunks of apple, just the way I like it. The Lemon Drop was nicely balanced, not too sweet, but not too tart.

The red snapper ceviche was out of this world- fresh, no yucky fishiness, and with a good amount of heat from the peppers. I even had to stop the busboy from getting my empty plate, as I savored the juices. 

The sweet potato fries served along my chicken skewers with chimichurri sauce were pretty good as well, and the chicken was delicious. 

I had a bite of Mom's empanadas - she ordered the vegetarian ones, but instead got a veggie one and the meat one. Ordinarily she would have been pissed, but she actually liked the meat one better- the bits of Kalamata Olive really set it off nicely. 

All and all a very pleasant meal, and if I get the opportunity will go again.
author: Sim C.

description: I really like the atmosphere here.  Went recently with a group of friends and we were seated upstairs.  My only complaint is that there seemed to only be one server for the whole upstairs.   Overall though, the food was great;  I had the whole crispy red snapper, and the roccoto-curry sauce with it was amazing.  I also highly recommend the yucca fries.  The ceviche was super yummy and I want to go back and try a few more from the menu.  Decent wine selection but real mojitos would be a better option than that soju stuff.
author: Laura S.

description: 5 stars for the good service, nice ambiance and awesome food. Small plates are amazing and the chicken is very well seasoned  If you want to make sure you have a table without any wait, go around 9pm. Otherwise the wait is about 30 min and gives you the time to enjoy a good mohito at the bar. Next time we will try to get a table downstairs. There will be a next time for sure.
author: Stephanie D.

description: I was on the wagon, with my parents and hungry. Three of the worst things you can have happening in life as far as I'm concerned. The only thing that was going to solve this was ceviche with lobster, crab and scallops. Damn that was good. I also had the grilled octopus - excellent! You can't really go wrong with what I ordered. Service was good and the renovated space looks nice.
author: Corey V.

description: I love this place!  Every time I eat here I am amazed how much I love it.  The food is excellent, the place is hip, warm and cozy and the servers have all been happy and friendly.  Perfect!  For dinner we stared with the Ceviche de Pescado which was halibut perfection.  I always get the same entree: Pollo Latino which is an amazing breast of chicken served with truffle infused mac and cheese and steamed broccolini. YUM.  For dessert Tres Leches cake with chiramoya ice cream.  Honestly, an amazing dinner in fabulous environment.
author: Stacy R.

description: I reserved Limon for a friends birthday about 2weeks prior the the actual event. Phone service was very professional, and of course a credit card was required to finalize the reservation. So why did we have to wait at the bar due to our table not being ready? A large party in a tight space on a busy friday night = not fun. Besides that oversight the overall dinner was enjoyable. An endless supply of sangria and bountiful menu options kept us happy. Standouts include the ceviche dishes and you MUST order the snapper. Other items tend to be a bit overpriced, and lack that wow factor. The birthday girl had a ball, and really that's all that matters. . .
author: Kia B.

description: Good ceviche and sangria!
author: Nicole H.

description: The food is so good, when I got home I almost bought a plane ticket to Peru!
author: Ben L.

description: I've been here a few times and it seems that lately the quality of the food has been getting better.  The ceviche is very tasty.  Definitely try the platter.  It's about $25 but is enough for 2-3 people for an appetizer.  I love the steak here.  I'm not a big steak eater but it's so tasty and has the perfect amount of garlic on top which gives it a little kick.  Also try the whole fish.  It's really good and comes with a nice tangy sauce.  It's fried and it comes in the whole fish, bones and all which you could eat because they are fried.  If you're looking for a good Peruvian place, definitely try this.  The wait can be long on the weekend to get your food which we experienced, though.  Definitely make a reservation.  The place can be -really- loud, so be prepared.
author: Mitch A.

description: This place was amazing! I loved the decor and the ambiance of Limon. The service was kind of slow but the good part was we got all of our drinks comped!! The ceviche was to DIE FOR. We both got the chicken with the mashed potatoes, probably some of the best mashed potatoes I have ever gotten! The wine was really great too. The servers were SO nice! All around a really great place!
author: Jen K.

description: The pork chop and the empanadas are "lick your fingers and call your mama" worthy, and the wine list is great.  They had a ton of bottles for under $35.  The mixta salad was a bit salty for my liking, but it's my fault for trying to be healthy at a Peruvian restaurant.
author: Julie H.

description:
when people say, "the ambience is good," that shouldn't translate into, "the ambiance is good if you are a late 20's yuppie-to-be and are looking to get lucky tonight." yet that was limon's overall feel, and the service wasn't nearly good enough to make up for it.  the food came close, but did not succeed even in balancing out the interminable bathroom line, which was reminiscent of bad junior high dances.  it all seemed much more marina than mission. 
on a side note, there was humor value to be found in the 8 top next to us when all four frat boys received their steaks and began chowing down immediately, while their four corresponding blondes awaited their salads/small plates and hungrily pouted.
author: Ariane R.

description:
i will be a curmudgeon, and bring everyone down with this review.  i'm talking maybe 5-6 years ago, at least, at Limon's old location, on 17th, i believe.  i arrived on time, as did one friend of mine.  my other friend called to say she'd be late.  me and on-time friend ordered drinks and appetizers - starting eating & drinking.  late friend was about 35 minutes late.  we ordered a ton of food and vino, and stayed about an hour-and-a-half TOTAL.  the manager, who had been pretty friendly for awhile, started hinting not so subtly that we should be ending our meal.  then the busboy/servers, realizing it was my bday, offered us complementary dessert.  we accepted.  manager came over and began yelling at us that we needed to leave as he had a party waiting for our table.  we fought back.  

now, i UNDERSTAND people were waiting for their table.  i UNDERSTAND no one wants to wait too long after their reservation. but you DON'T BERATE YOUR SEATED EATING/DRINKING $250-PAYING CUSTOMERS. YOU DON'T RUSH PEOPLE OUT OF THEIR TABLE.  NO NO NO.  AND, you especially do not go outside to waiting customers and TELL THEM - while pointing fingers at lingering table - THAT THEY ARE THE REASON FOR THE HOLD-UP.  you just don't do it.  i will never, ever go back.  and yes, i know i should have posted something years ago - but i didn't know about food blogs then.  chalk it up to ignorance.

as for the food . . . EH.  i've had lots and lots and LOTS of peruvian food - nuevo, fusion and authentic.  it was OK.  not great.  really, now i'm not being curmudgeonly.  i remember as i was eating that things weren't all that great.  it just missed the mark.

maybe since that time they've fired rude manager and improved on the food.  i'm just saying.
author: maria a.

description: This is a great place to go with a group, as you can easily manuever it so you can share everything family style. The ceviches are delicious and quite frankly you won't be disappointed with anything you order here. The drinks are great as well.
author: Jennifer S.

description: I was looking for some really tasty chicken. This place was umm....well.....JUST OKAY! I felt like we were trying to make the dipping sauces justify paying that much for some simple azz yard bird! The sides seemed to be an afterthought. It was....Just Okay. That is all. Not very comfortable inside either...small tables and chairs seemed to be a balancing act.
author: Carla L.

description:
It's like beating a dead horse writing the 8 millionth review on a place, but I suppose the only child in me just wants to be heard.
Had dinner at Limon on Friday night and it was EXCELLENT.  The service was great - not just our waiter, but everyone; they really worked together to the benefit of the guest (with the exception of when we first arrived --- no one even acknowledged us for a few minutes, which was strange, not even eye contact or a "hi.").   Bit of a bummer that we sat right by the front door because brrr.  Luckily there was eating and drinking to distract me from the arctic blasts.
It was loud, but people were having fun; I wouldn't recommend it for a first date, which is what I was doing, but with friends it'd be great.  We chatted a little with the guys sitting next to us (who were seriously having mouthgasms over the Lomo Saltado).  The sangria was great, but all those pesky ice cubes made it difficult to gulp, which is how I tend to drink sangria.  I only had an entree, so I didn't think it was too expensive.  I did think the ceviche looked like it was a pretty small portion for the price, and I definitely see how it would quickly add up with a few starters and THEN the entrees.  I had the Pollo Latino, and let me tell you kids, this is not your ordinary chicken dish.  It comes with this excellent, spicy au jus that I could've licked off the plate.  The broccolini was perfection, and I don't know that I have ever had anything as wonderful as the truffled mac n' cheese.  AND the best damn sweet potato chips ever --- I tend to find them just sweet, but these were salty and excellent.  My date was teasing me because I was seriously taking a bite of every item in order since the flavors went so well together.  I wasn't in the mood for dessert, so that may be why I wasn't so over the moon about it, but I thought the chocolate Tres Leches with ice cream was only okay.  No matter, I was still on cloud nine from my dinner.
Now I see what I've been missing.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
I was a bit disappointed by Limon. I came here for lunch and was really looking forward to something delicious with great service. 
The seating staff were excellent and quite nice. We were practically alone as we got there about 20 minutes after they opened. 
The waiter came over and pressed us for drinks when we were clearly not ready. He got huffy when we only wanted water, but didn't leave a drink menu in case we wanted to order later. I actually had to ask for one. 
Because we weren't all that hungry, we each ordered just a main dish. I had the traditional stewed sirloin french fries and rice. Because their menu is limited, I  felt rather boxed in, and wanted to substitute the rice for sauteed spinach (something already on the menu). There was more huffiness from the waiter about substitutions, especially when I told him I simply didn't want to rice on the plate. It seemed like way to many carbs and no veggies at all. This was a privilege for which I was, I felt, overcharged. Quite frankly any restaurant that wants points for service needs to be accommodating. period.
I eventually decided I felt like something sweet to drink, so I had a Riesling. Yes, it's not what should go with beef, but that's what I wanted.
Our entrees came out with the wine, but the spinach was very late.  At that point I could have waited (and by the time it came it would have been pretty cold), or been left with sauteed spinach solo. I'm a bit puzzled as to why they didn't simply put the spinach with the beef as was the specified preparation on the menu. Sigh.
My food overall was pretty good, but there was hardly any meat, which made the balance off with too much onion and tomatoes. The french fries were interesting and different, but I really would have liked to try to the whole thing with the spinach. I'm very glad I didn't order rice, as it would have been one huge carb with just a tiny bit of meat. 
Overall 3 stars, it was good, but not great, though the waiter had the attitude that this was some amazing restaurant. To me it's not worth putting up with the prices and attitude if the food doesn't live up to it's reputation. Again, however, it was merely the waiter, and not the other staff which has clouded the impression, but I would not eat here again with all the wonderful food in the mission.
author: Kat C.

description: This restaurant is absolutely fabulous!  From their empanadas to their yummy sangria, this place has nailed down quality Peruvian cuisine.  Great for a date or a big group and their desserts are to die for.  I highly recommend this place if you're looking for quality South American cuisine with a chic ambiance in the Mission district.
author: Danielle V.

description:
This restaurant's food will transcend your palate to an even higher level.

For starters, we had Ceviche Limon (fresh halibut with mixed seafood marinated in lime juice, served with yam, Peruvian corn and mussels in a salsa criolla), Hongos (sauted mushrooms with light butter, garlic and parsley, Calamares Fritos (lightly breaded crispy calamari with a chipotle aioli and sesame seeds) and Empanada Don Walter (pastry filled with sauted beef, onions, olives, raisins and eggs served with rocoto cream sauce).

My hubby had Picante de Mariscos (braised scallops, calamari, shrimp, mussels, clams and diced potatoes in a Peruvian Adresso cream sauce), our friend Maria had Lomo Saltodo (traditional Peruvian dish of top sirloin slices sauted with onions, tomatoes and fries, served with a side of rice), her Peruvian BF had Churrasco a la Parilla who didn't share at all -- I wouldn't share the grilled ribeye steak either if I were still a meat-eater (grilled 12oz. served with roasted red potatoes, grilled asparagus, chimichurri mustard sauce) and I had the Pargo Rojo (crispy whole red snapper basket, served with stir fried coconut rice and rocoto curry sauce) which everyone agreed that it was, indeed, the best dish on the table. The presentation alone will take the cake for this restaurant (well, keep reading). The deboned fish bone is arched like a basket and pieces of the well-seasoned snapper are contained within.

Alright ladies, the "piece de resistance" of this restaurant is the hot bartender who looks like Wentworth Miller in Prison Break (shaved head with captivating light green eyes). OMG!!! 

Overall experience was *gulp* AMAZING!
author: Miles G.

description:
I'd have to say I have mixed reviews for this.  It is definitely on the pricey end and the place is really nice.  the lighting was dim with the walls having somewhat of an artsy mix of colors.  

when we arrived, the host Antonio was really cool.  I had spoken with him on arranging a party of 17 people which would require a pre fix menu.  I'm guessing this makes it easier for them but then I would have rather had more choices.   However, since its eveyrone's first time there, it woulda been nice to just have a 3 course meal to make the night.  We'll come back to Antonio later.

IF you're planning to get full and bloated after eating here, that is totally not what to expect.  I mean the portions are good, but it ain't no buffet!   Most of us had the cerviche mixto which was like lemon juice and some spices with raw seafood, somewhat simlar to sashimi but with lemon juice.  some of the stuff in here were calamari, shrimp, and some fish.  all really good along with a random piece of YAM.  yes, iono why it was in there, but don't mind if i do!

Next course was a mushroomy filled with cream fried potsticker looking thing.  But it was good.  it came with some pink cream sauce that made it a good in between snack.  I wouldn't have minded to have another piece tho (it came with only 2)

ANd main dish, I had the snapper which looked like a filet o fish without the bun, but it was actually pretty good.  it looked simple, but it was cooked well and moist.  my friend had some stir fry looking steak and onion and fries.  that was pretty good too.  

and for the dessert, we had the balladina or somethin with a choco souflet and ice cream.  THAT was hellllla good.  I think i've just gotten to liking dessert more.  note to self: save room for dessert.  

ok so back to Antonio, i'm guessing the restaurant owner/manager, had charged us 17 people for the table but with only 15 people showing up.  His reasoning was that he had lost money by having us stay ther for so long and that we had the pre fixed menu.  At the time, I was sympathetic with him for yes taking up so much space, but I did really enjoy the time there.  And I guess I did tell him beforehand we had 25 and then I changed it to 17, but now that I think about it, and my friend had actually mentioned it, that this is somewhat on the restaurant's fault and shouldn't really have the customers carry the burden and end up paying more than they should.  I'm not exactly sure how to justify the right and wrong, but prior to that, I did have a great time and definitely enjoyed the food.  This sorta makes me give Limon a 3 star, but it would probably be a 4-5 if I didn't run into that trouble at the end.
author: Vincent K.

description: I like how this place looks, I like sitting upstairs looking down, (so I could see what everyone is eating without them seeing me drooling over their food) Love their ceviches! Delicious. Empanadas and fried calamari are also great dishes to try. People that love tamale should try their tamal criollo, filled with pork, salty black olives, and egg.
author: Juliane N.

description: Order the Red Snapper and you will NOT regret it. This dish is the most memorable and tasty dish I have ever had in San Francisco.  And, for the icing on this 5 star review, a Peruvian took me here. Nuf said.
author: Kerrie T.

description: Well 5 stars for a great meal and for the fact that I proposed to my fiance here. Upon recommendation from a friend whose opinion I respect greatly I made reservations. The restaurant is very cool with an "in-crowd place to be" feel to me. We shared the empenadas which were deliciously prepared and perfectly fried. Everything we ate made me feel like they put a lot of effort in making sure the dishes are well prepared with fresh ingredients. I had the Churrasco rib eye steak and it was wonderfully prepared. My fiance had the Pargo Rojo. It was a red snapper that was presented beautifully and tasted equally good. I would recommend Limon to anyone and will go back. The service was not overbearing but appropriate and we were well attended to. The price is equal to the level of service and quality of food.
author: Johnny J.

description: I very much like this place.  The food is great, the presenation is very nice and the staff is very friendly.  Some have given this place not so great reviews -- which I expect from every restaurant because nothing is perfect, right?
author: Hector M.

description:
i know people who are hosts at restaurants and yes customers who come in are annoying as hell when they ask for a bunch of stuff...
so... we had a reservation for 2, but last minute our party became 3... the male host at this place is just an asshole though... he wasn't even trying to be nice to us about unfortunately not being able to accomodate our 3rd person... 
any option we suggested was not possible at all - the only option he gave us was to wait for 2 hours for the next table.
we left and had dinner across the street at ramblas where our friend lina happened to be working that night and so she took care of our hungry souls...
:)

i'm sure the food's good here... if we'd ever gotten past that stuck up, rude host so proudly wearing his stupid tie... 
will i try to go back there?
probably not... there's a bunch of other places in the city :)
author: charlotte s.

description:
Went with a huge expectation, left with a disappointment.

After hearing my friend's descent dinner experience at The Limon and sitting next to couple public figures(let's not mention the names here), I decided to give it a try with my friend. Arrived at 1:30pm and easily got a table. 

Service: the host was friendly and the guy staff kept coming to clean our table with a very warm smile(5 stars for him).

Lunch menu:
Limon Ceviche: 2 shrimps, octopus and fish. I wasn't too impressed with the dish especially the fish. Besides the acid taste, the fish was pretty bland and without much texture. If I was blindfolded, I probably couldn't guess it was fish(given I am a sushi lover). 

Lomo Saltado: top sirloin stir-fried with onions & tomatoes, with fries, rice & two sunny side-up eggs(turned out to be eggs over easy). Yes, it was flavorful but I wouldn't say it had an authentic Peruvian taste. Actually,the dish reminded me of the Chinese soy sauce stir fried steak I had a week ago. Very similar in presentation(minus the fries) and taste.

Snapper fillet: the best dish so far. Fish was very tender and tasty. For $12, it's worth it.

Picante de Mariscos: the base was a spicy cream sauce which was very delicious with a kick. However, the whole dish only had 2 small-medium size shrimps, 2 mussels, and a couple small rings of octopus. I wasn't looking for a supersize dish. But I absolutely couldn't understand these average ingredients in a tiny portion. 

Yucca Fries: very crispy with 2 somewhat tasteless dipping sauces.

Aftermath: I felt super thirsty the rest of the day. Either they used too much salt or MSG(or similar stuffs). 

I started to wonder if the restaurant paid those public figures to dine there. For me, I will continue my mission to search for the Next Peruvian Restaurant.
author: N K.

description: I never understood what orgasm or explosion in your mouth meant until I tried the Chicarron de Pollo. My god, the different flavors in this dish dance so well together. For main course I had the Pargo Rojo which was very good, though I was not crazy about the curry sauce. I would have preferred something citrusy like the lemon vinaigrette that came with Chicarron de Pollo. My friend had the Churrasco a la Parilla which was also very good, the chimichurri sauce was excellent. The sangria was well made, though a bit sweeter than I like mine. Overall, a very good experience...I will definitely go back.
author: Reza E.

description: Limon is the perfect name for this place!  With it's intricate design and dim lighting, limon definitely sets the mood for a wonderful evening far from San Francisco.  One forgets about the traffic and hustle and bustle of the city, which is strange because the restaurant is packed with strangers. Maybe it was the Spanish wine that helped me dip into a different realm and explore the exotic spicy menu!
author: Michelle F.

description: My office is in the neighborhood, so we eat here often.  I am so glad that the lunch menu has changed - and had a great meal.  Service is much improved.
author: Michelle H.

description: I am a huge fan of the food here. I've been coming to this place since 2006 and absolutely love the food here. I've been here for graduations, birthday, and even a bachelorette dinners. I absolutely love the sangria, ceviche, and the chicharron de Pollo,
author: Millie N.

description:
i was recommended this place by a fellow chef friend of mine who worked the hotline here. the decor was super modern and very out of place for its location. the wait staff was ok just a little snooty, the door man sucked. 

now the food...it gets a 1 for all the above i mentioned. it gets a zero for the food.


no entrees
no dessert
just 2 apps and some wine

awful
author: Sean B.

description:
i have only been here twice, once for a birthday a long time ago and it was fantastic! and just last month...

i remember having the ceviche and some pork chop dish, which has obviously changed since the last time i was there.

the ceviche was still good, no doubt about that..and the appetizers were good. love the dips for the bread, i would come back just for those 2 things, ceviche and apps.

the pork chop dish and the steak dish my boyfriend had were just mediocre. my dish, the pork chop was actually really disappointing. the pork was tender and all but really had no flavor to it, the mash of cabbage, bacon and tiny sliced mushrooms was sort of weird overall...it just wasn't right. 

they stuck us in the corner which was awkwardly close to two other tables and when we were leaving, we saw a cockroach hop from one chair leg to another.......
author: sue k.

description: A friend of mine that I used to work with is from Peru and turned me onto this place when it was at it's old location.  That was the first place I had ever even had Peruvian food.  These style of places are popping up everywhere now.  I don't think anybody can hold a candle to Limon. I was just there last week as a walk up, and even sitting at the bar was fine with me.  A culanary delight.  So fun to go out in the Mission after dinner.  Have to say though, the Octopus was overcooked this last time...Hard to be perfect!
author: Daniel Q.

description: ROACH ALERT ROACH ALERT I REPEAT ROACH ALERT  Whatever Limon used to be it is no more.  If you enjoy roaches creeping up your leg like a sleazy first date or dancing across your table like they were in a New Orleans kichen, then continue to eat at this once fabulous establishment.  If being waited on by an unenthusiastic  server who offers to comp you sangria to make up for the unsanitary dining environment  only to then charge you for the drinks, then Limon is your type of dining institution.  Beware though and do not say you weren't warned when an army of roaches comes to bring your first course.
author: Katherine F.

description: Delicious Peruvian cuisine served up in a lively part of the City.  We recommend their chicken with macaroni and (mascarpone) cheese served on the side.  The chicken is complemented with a great-tasting sauce.  We also recommend their sangria, which is very tasty.  We were told that the chef once worked at Aqua, where he honed his skills in preparing sauces.  It really shows!!
author: John c.

description: I had high expectations of this place because a participant on KQED's "Check Please" raved about the red snapper basket. It was no better than the fried fish I can get at any mom and pop shop in Oakland. The coconut rice did not have much coconut flavor. Presentation was not as pretty as I remembered it looking on the show. Service was very impatient (even though we're paying customers and had early reservations!) My friends and I noticed that the host, waiter and servers were all staring at us towards the end of our meal. It felt rushed and that's not the kind of feeling I enjoy when paying high prices. I do have to say that the appetizers were not bad. The tuna tartare had a nice spice and the stuffed calamari came with a very tasty sauce. We may have made a mistake by not ordering a ceviche.
author: Farah S.

description:
I fell in love with Limon when it was still at its old, intimate location on 17th Street.  Apparently, many others did as well - Limon's success allowed the Castillo brothers to upgrade their restaurant to its current, larger location on Valencia.  Reservations are highly recommended for this place - make sure everyone shows up on time, otherwise you won't be seated.

Food:  4 stars.   I heart Peruvian food.  I went with 4 other people, so I got to try a little bit of everything that we ordered:  tatara de atun, chicarron de pollo, ceviche limon, lomo saltado, pollo latino, pargo rojo (snapper), churrasco a la parilla, and amaretto tres leches for dessert.  The standouts were the chicarron de pollo (fried chicken nuggets), lomo saltado, pollo latino (with truffle-infused mac and cheese!), and the churrasco a la parilla (ribeye steak).  The fried chicken nuggets and ribeye were so good, I was getting food orgasms - thank god the restaurant was so noisy, because no one could hear me.  The tuna tartare had good flavors as well and was better than the ceviche.  I was a little disappointed with the snapper because a lot of people rave about it (yes, Michael Bauer, I'm talking about you), but other than the presentation, it's just not that good.  The amaretto tres leches cake was not moist enough (yet another M. Bauer recommendation).  We still ate every bite.

Service:  2 stars.   Limon upgraded everything during the move, but forgot to upgrade the hostess.  We had reservations for 5 people at 8pm and had to wait 30 minutes for our table in the tiny area between the bar and the front door.  The server was friendly and got most things right, but was not attentive enough to notice that our glasses of wine were empty for way too long.  The saving grace was the friendly bartender, which is good when you're waiting forever for your table to be ready.  

Atmosphere:  3 stars.  "What???  What did you just say?"  That is the quote most often heard (or not heard) at this noisy restaurant.  The space is urban and hip, with a crowd to match, but I actually prefer the old location for its more intimate, quiet setting.  Tables are set close together, which was good news for the couple sitting next to our table.  They looked so bored with each other and were more than happy to eavesdrop on our more interesting conversation.

Hits:   Chicarron de pollo, lomo saltado, pollo latino, churrasco a la parilla

Misses:  Pargo rojo, amaretto tres leches, the hostess not with the mostess.  

If You Like This Place, You'd Probably Like:  Destino, Fresca
author: Keith C.

description:
As if this place needs another review. 

I went for an early dinner with one of my closest buds and it was just superb. The sun was shining through their large windows and the atmosphere was lovely. We had their tasty sangria, split an array of appetizers, and had the tres leches cake for dessert. Among the appetizers, the halibut ceviche was great, the ahi tuna spectacular, and the largeish tentacle-y octopi with mashed potatoes were splendid! The tres leches cake was missing something....I couldn't quite figure out what it was...but nonetheless, I'm a sucker for a nice tres leches. Mildly sweet, milky goodness!

The service was ridiculously attentive and unique. Even after the 2.5 hours my friend and I spent in this place, with all of the people crowded around the bar awaiting their ravenous turns, they didn't give us sneering looks or "get out" phrases. Limon is just too much fun!
author: bloopie s.

description: The best mashed potatos I have ever had. That's right, mashed-muthafuckin-po-ta-toes.
author: Big S.

description: The food is soOOOoo like an explosion in your mouth!! hahaha!! Food is so DE-LI-CIOUS!! My taste buds were like, "DAMN GIVE ME SOME MORE!!" hahhaa!! The ambiance was cool, the waiter was awesome, besides the parking, hey this is what you expect in this location, but my and my bf loved the place!! We'll I did. I will be making my way back to this place soon!!!
author: Joanne D.

description: I think overall the restaurant is probably a 4-5 star.  However, my experience was pretty horrible.  Although I didn't make any reservations, the hostess said it would be a 30 minutes wait.  Our 30 minutes turned out to be a 90 minute wait.   By the time we were seated we weren't even hungry anymore and our steak was too tough.
author: Annie S.

description: The ceviche is amazing and the sangria is even better.  Even without a reservation we were seated quickly (granted it was about 1/2 hour before the dinner crowd hit).  Our waiter was amazing and did not have any qualms with us sharing a meal (it is a bit pricey but totally worth it).  You may  be asking yourself why I even found myself in this glorious little restaurant on Valencia?  Well, it was in a way a surprise date!  Totally awesome atmosphere as well as service and food.  Check it out if you can even it is only for an appetizer and a glass of sangria!
author: Kylie L.

description: Service was forgetful.  Forgot an appetizer, even though she verbally confirmed by appetizer order.  All of our plates were SALTY.  From the chicken to pork to beef.  When given the bread, I wasnt too snazzy about the sauces so I asked for butter.  The owner, ANTONIO, said there was NO BUTTER....WTF?  How can you NOT have butter at a place!!... So I asked the waitress and SHE got me the butter.  So if your food is salty...SEND it BACK.
author: Lil T.

description: I went there based on a Mexican friend recommendation. She said the Ceviche is Lo Maximo ( means its great) but its the worst Peruvian Ceviche. The fish was still with ice and the lemon taste like the bottled one you can buy from Lucky. And they dont even have Chicha Morada (bottled not even fresh). The only thing Peruvian i experience is the waiter who is Huachafo (dont know how to describe it in. And for info my wife is Peruvian and we live in Lima for a while.
author: Manok L.

description: It's weird because I want to give this place more stars, but just cannot .  I feel solidly wedded to this three rating.  The food was very decent.  I liked the atmosphere, our waiter was very pleasant, but our appetizer had very gristly chicken and our entree of rice with seafood had little seafood and little drama.  If you are going to do Spanish cuisine in San Francisco then please attempt to make it spectacular, otherwise I have just eaten and then forgotten my meal.  Unless I hear that the chef has decided to get creative and use some better chicken, I'm taking my business elsewhere,.
author: Claire C.

description:
we took our two friends that were visiting from ohio here last sat nite. they loved it because the food was the perfect portion size, not like the gargantuan plates of food they get back home. and having used to live here, they were so happy to eat somewhere cool. you know, i think we take cool for granted here. we have it all the time so we feel free to scoff at "cool" like we're too cool for cool. well, perhaps everyone should move to ohio for a while. ever notice how grateful people are from ohio who live here? they appreciate SF. they have this sparkle in their eyes all the time. they think san francisco is co cool. they're right.  we need people from ohio here, they keep us grounded. 

anyway, we all ordered a starter. the tuna tatare was great--as were the fried calamari. and we shared a nice bottle of chilean wine for only $36. my husband and i both opted for steak. me for the sirloin, which was perfect, actually cooked to med rare perfection. and kev had the lomo saltado, which was so much better than the lame, tasteless lomo saltado we'd had a couple weeks before at mi linda peru in the marina. lesson learned--go to the mission. or at least up the hill to fresca. 

our waiter was very nice-looking, and just attentive enough. he didn't rush us or try to push dessert., which we had no room for after all that meat.
author: rachel p.

description:
we had the shrimp ceviche and fried calamari -- both were only ok, and way too expensive for their mediocrity. furthermore, the wine wasn't great, and the server didn't give particularly good recommendations. plus seating was a bit too tight. a server for the next table kept kicking my bag!

overall, limon seems overpriced and overrated.
author: omar k.

description:
this is possibly the worst experience i've had at a dining establishment. i took advantage of a recent groupon offer and it brought me to this place. i told the hostess i had a 12:30 reservation. she didn't ask for my name and pointed me towards a table and went away. and also that was where any whatsoever promptness ends. 15 minutes had passed before we could flag down someone just to give us menus. it was another 15-20 mins before we got order. as i was waiting for my food i went back to the hostess and made sure she acknowledged my reservation and gave me my opentable points.

my spirits rose a little when the food came. the oyster and seafood shooters and the ceviche limon were pretty good. and our cocktails finally came halfway through the meal. then everything went to the dumpster after that. we were done with our 1st entre (seafood bouillabaisse) and our waiter came and cleared the plates. a moment later he dropped off the bill to our table and fled to setup another table. um, wtf? we didn't even get our 2nd entre (empanada de carne) yet. so we got hold of someone, anyone, and told him of the situation. we saw the guy conversing with our waiter. couple moments later our waiter literally dumped the bill (they took out the empanada de carne) onto our table, and continued working on setting up the next table . but the waiter did not saying anything to me nor gave me any sort of explanation! no "sorry for the mixup," no "do you still want the dish?" no "any room for dessert?" and no "thank you." i have had bad service before but never as bad as this. i won't come back here even if it's free.
author: Doris Y.

description: This place is cozy and located right on the MIssion.  My bestie and I sat on the 2nd floor which was small and crowded.  I loved the ceviche and steak.  The meat was very tender and tasty.  Nice place to hang out, have drinks, and eat good food in the city!
author: Elle M.

description:
I recently had dinner with a group of friends at Limon and was not impressed--  It is way overpriced and a terrible value for the quality of food it serves.   I had the lomo saltado ($19) which consisted of 6 strips of meat, french fries and gravy.  The other dishes on the menu were $27 and not much better!  

It beats me why anyone would pay these prices when they can have an incredible meal at stellar restaurants in the same neighborhood (e.g., Delfina or Range). 

Finally, the waiter told us that the main courses would take 30 minute s to cook. We waited 50 minutes.
author: Tom W.

description:
On my visit to San Francisco, my friend recommended Limon for dinner. The website was under construction and I felt a bit hesitant to try the restaurant before viewing the menu selection. I read the reviews on Yelp and Limon received excellent ratings across the board. It was between La Mar in Embarcadero or Limon, and we went to the latter. 

The service at Limon was excellent. We were seated promptly in the upstairs lounge and greeted enthusiastically by our server. He recommended several great dishes. I chose the Pollo Latino, which was amazing. Having been to Peru recently, I can say the cuisine at Limon had some American blend, but nonetheless it appealed to my taste buds. The wine and plate of sweet potato fries were great complements to our meal.
author: R C.

description: One word: ceviche, ceviche, ceviche! (or is that 3?). Anyway, it's fine but otherwise unimpressive for all the hype and wait for a reservation.
author: Samira S.

description: Q-.  Negative stars if possible. For the 2nd time, we made reservations, which seemed futile since the 20 other people waiting in line also had reservations at the same time.  45 min. later we got seated, only to ask for bread, water and our drinks each twice.  An hour later we still lhadn't gotten served and finally left.  There were totally flippant and seemed to care less.  No reason in the world to eat here with Fresca in the mix.
author: greg f.

description: Ok, YUM!!!! I absolutely love this place.  SOOO good, I had the ceviche and it tasted so refreshing and tangy ( Just the way I like it)  A bit busy, but the service was great.  I had the Pargo Rojo (Crispy Red Snapper) and my friend had the Pollo Latino (Chicken with Mac n Cheese)  I loved every bite of it.  If you're looking for a Peruvian Infused restaurant, I would highly recommend LIMON.  (I LOVE THIS PLACE!)  Now, a new FAV Place.
author: Aileen D.

description: I've been here once for dinner, and all of the food was great, particularly the ceviche course and foie gras.  If you have the $, this is probably one of the best places to go on the 16th St side.
author: Brandon B.

description: Yummy but expensive. Didn't eat much food but paid a whole of $$ for it. The wait staff was helpful and charming. The crowd was noisy but fun. I had the steak skewers, stuffed squid, and paella-style seafood rice. Loved it all but don't ask me to remember the Peruvian names for them all.
author: Sirima S.

description: I haven't eaten here in over a year , although I'm not sure why, because the food was great.  My date and I sat at the bar because we were starving and didn't want to wait for a table.  It was comfortable and not at all crowded eating there and the bar service was fast and attentive.  We ordered several appetizers and they were all delicious.  The mojitos were great, the ambiance was cool, and we could actually have a conversation and hear one another.  Now that I think about it, I think I'll go back soon.
author: s r.

description: Reservation does not mean any thing to these people...I made a reservation on Sat night then had to wait another hour to be seated, while the host and manager were seating their friends and ignoring other customers. Food was great, but the kitchen is very slow...The server was really nice. They need a new manager to know how to manage a restaurant...
author: Obaid A.

description: Another spectacular meal at Limon. I went here with a party of 7 last night and everything was great. From the sangria to the ceviche, you really can't go wrong here. I would recommend a reservation because we saw people standing at the front when we were seated and when we were leaving, so if you are a party of 4 or more, my guess is that a walk-in is not such a great idea. We ordered a lot of different plates off of the menu and I can honestly say that everything that I tried was excellent.
author: Miles T.

description:
Me encanta Limon! 

My fiance and I have only tried the one vegetarian plate they offer but OH MY they don't need to offer anything else, seriously. I forgot the name of the dish (it's not listed on their website) but it consists of beans, onions, potatoes, yams, cabbage, spinach and other goodness. 

Atmosphere is great for a romanticy dinner or with friends. Our drinks, appetizers, main entree, and dessert all get receive cinco stars :) We did not make reservations so we had to wait an hour for a table but it was very well worth it. 

Eat, drink, and be merry.
author: gibronandsahar K.

description: I first came to Limon for a work-related event. One of my work buddies has this weird little crossed-wire thing where delicious food causes his eyes to flood so that he appears to be weeping. He's our food-o-meter. He wept profusely. We ate like pigs (especially given that it was on the office tab), sampled food from one another's  plates, and even dared getting our hands slapped for going back for more than was offered by colleagues within reach. Everything, EVERYTHING, from the sangria, to the entrees, to dessert was goooooooooood. Limon is one of my go to places when I want to be especially nice to someone I love (or someone I owe, want to impress etc.), but I much prefer having someone take ME there as the prices make my (ahem) modest budget creak a bit.
author: Gloria Y.

description:
To summarize, the food was super, but the service was pretty bad.  From the moment he first came over, the waiter was looking around, and quite impatient.  Since the restaurant was not yet full, we couldn't understand his attitude or reluctance to answer simple questions about the food, such as the translation of certain ingredients, etc.
The chef clearly knows what he or she is doing; it is some of the best ceviche we have had.  A waiter who is not knowledgable and is as unprofessional as ours was did the chef a great disservice.  The salads and empanadas were also great.
author: Sue E.

description: Overall, I like it.  My meals have been fine, and my friend the winemaker's wine's on the wine list (a nice thing).  It's got a fun vibe, so it seems reasonably like a party, not just dinner.  It didn't slay me, I suppose because it's pricey for what it is.  I'd give it 3 1/2 stars, but I'm rounding up.
author: Laurel B.

description: Lovely, cosy atmosphere, sangria, and lomo saltado.  The best ceviche I've had in the Bay Area.
author: Adam Z.

description: I am so disappointed in Limon. I came here a few times and usually had a somewhat decent experience. I came for brunch with a few friends today and I"m not sure what happened. The room was smoking up. We were getting ready to watch Peter Pan, we got to Limon 3 hrs prior to the show, it took us about 25 mins before we could flag down a waiter, and this was when it wasn't busy. our drinks didn't come until another 15 mins, my mimosa was almost close to half a glass when it got to me. (this is very messy  for a high end restaurant). bad presentation. Our first dish limon ceviche finally came after another 15 mins, (this was about 55 mins later, it's starting to get busy in the restaurant, we notice that people who came after us are already finishing up their dishes, I flagged down the waiter twice, he siad he was going to check on it but still we waited for at least another 45 mins, I finally  flagged down the guy with the white shirt (manager?), 3 mins later our food finally came out. I am very very disappointed Limon. What's going on????? We barely made it to the show.
author: Tiff W.

description: Overpriced and all right. I've had better Peruvian chow in L.A, which was actually a hole in the wall joint - but was truly authentic. The atmosphere and ambiance is A++ for a good first date. Impressive place to bring your out of towner pals to.  But the cerviche is great!
author: Maya L.

description: This place was nothing special. It had a nice atmosphere....mid 20's early 30's crowd....but the food was nothing memorable. I had higher expectations for this place....i probably won't go back. I'm not sure what all the hype was about......
author: Niki F.

description: Limon is terrific and turns out creative and delicious food.  My caiparinha, mushroom empanadas, quinotto, and molten chocolate cake with banana were all superb.  We split a "thoughtfully chosen" half carafe of red wine (Portuguese) and that was the perfect amount of wine for 2.  I didn't think the bill was all that high, considering.  Great place.
author: Blue L.

description: The sangria is to die for. I could drink a whole pitcher by myself! The Lomo Saltado is like heaven on earth! And the waiters provide nice eye candy while you scarf down your meal.
author: Jennalyn M.

description:
Peruvian treats
Slow indifferent service
Not really worth it
author: HaikuReview X.

description:
I went to this spot recently for a birthday dinner and fell in love with it. I would definitely come back to this place.

Let me start with their drinks. I had a sip of their strawberry mojito and may have been one of the best I've had. It was the perfect blend of lemon juice and mints with the strawberries. Their sangrias was also very good. I did also notice that when you order it, they ask you how many glasses you want. They come back with that many glasses half full, plus a filled pitcher as well.

The food was definitely a plus. Even their bread (served with two different types of sauces) was very surprisingly good. I would come back just for that! Their ceviche was very satisfying. It's a must order if you come here. All the appetizers that our party ordered was good. As for the main entrees, they were also very pleasing. I got to try the pork chops, which was juicy and not dry at all. I ordered the fish and shrimp. That dish was very unique and flavorful. To some people, it may be too much flavor, but I thought it balanced itself out pretty well.

The service was great. Bathrooms were very clean. I would recommend this place to anyone who loves ceviche and wants to try something new.
author: Na N.

description:
I miss the days when Limon was just a tiny intimate restaurant that introduced us all to how great peruvian food can be. I remembered the pork chop to be extremely tender and flavorful. However upon return to the new location, larger dining room version of Limon, it was dry and bland. And then my last visit was ruined by having to sit at a table upstairs, which seems to magnify all the noise in the restaurant. And this restaurant is noisy! Secondly, our waiter was rude to us and unprofessional. We had ordered a sort of mashed potato dish that had crab in it. But instead we got a dish that had 4 peices of bland potatos, that seemed to have just been boiled and dolloped with an aioli. We weren't sure if the crab was hiding somewhere in the bland peices of potato, so we started eating it. When we realized it was the wrong dish we notified our waiter, who then accused us of eating all of it already. I was very offended that he would even suggest that. On top of that, the dinner came out to be $65 dollars a person, but when we got our credit card bill we both were charged $69. 

Overall, I still think Limon is worth a visit to try their great ceviches, but a return visit for me is doubtful. Limon has lost its charm. There are just too many other choices in San Francisco that top this place.
author: Karen C.

description: This is one of the best restaurants I've been to since I moved to the Bay Area in 2001. It's a bit pricey but the food there is AMAZING, not to mention the sangria! I really enjoyed the ceviche, papas a la huancaina, tartara de atun, lomo saltado and lucuma icecream. And by the way, lucuma is a South American fruit with a custardy texture found only in Peru, Chile and perhaps the neighboring countries.
author: Daniela A.

description: The new space is sleek but still welcoming. Go with a group to share a few small plates, and make sure to drink their increasingly-famous sangria.
author: Nish N.

description:
great food (mmm, lomo saltado), nice ambience... but i think the busboys stole my credit card!

they do have quite the prix fixe though!
author: Jill k.

description: Nice clean space. A good place to order multiple small plates/apps so that friends around the table can enjoy and share.
author: Heather R.

description: I LOVE this restaurant.  This is one I can keep coming back to over and over and over again just to try their different dishes.  They are also very nice here.  Even my mom loves this place.  She brings all of her friends and our South American relatives here too.  Everyone leave here a fan!  Nice ambiance, good service, great sangria and even better food.
author: Kirsten M.

description: yummy ceviche, with their leche de tigre... i've been looking for good ceviche since i moved here in january.  i've only been once and only had a couple of dishes, so i may need to try out a couple of other items on the menu.  stay tuned.
author: Terri M.

description: Went without reservations on a Friday night at 8:30 with a starving boyfriend - pretty much a recipe for disaster. But I was up for it, and absolutely loved soaking up the very crowded and eclectic scene. After a few drinks, the arrivals of the rest of our party and at least an hour later we were seated, and proceeded to enjoy some truely outstanding food. I loved everything we ordered including the house ceviche, fried chicken app and beef dishes. Go with a group that wants to share!
author: Jessica D.

description: Limon rocks! I've been here 3 or 4 times now and still crave for the same things....ceviche, fish, steak, oh and the sangria! The atmosphere and decor is nice though can get kind of loud...but it's totally worth it. will definitely be back.
author: Hazel S.

description: Limon is amazing!! I've been there multiple times..small groups/big groups, and they've never failed to please!! I'm glad they moved to a bigger location..but still wished they had more space!! Overall..every dish I've tried is fabulous and they make one of the best mojitos in SF!!
author: Littleone P.

description:
pretty good pretty good.  ceviche.  seafood, lemon and salsa if you love all three, then you gotta do it.

they have truffle mac and cheese.  freakin good but... is that latin american?  i guess its more of a fusion place

hostess was way friendlier than the waiter... waiter was more... curt? i dunno but i no like him. 

ihave hangover rightnow.. i'lll do more later
author: Doug ..

description: My friend's and I went on a Saturday night.  This place has an allusion of being fantastic because of the way it looks, and all the people inside waiting and the raves about the food.  It was just all right.  The food was a little too salty for my taste and the truffle infused mac and cheese was referred to at my table as possibly tasting like BO - (what does BO taste like? The mac and cheese at Limon!)  The service was lacking too.  It was hard enough to get a smile out of our waiter let alone some attention...I think I am definitely trying a different place for Peruvian food next time....
author: Liz N.

description: This place NEVER fails me! Great service, GREATfood and sangria. I usually order the mixed ceviche, lomo saltado, foie gras w/ scallops, and all their desserts are delish. It's always busy, so make a reservation. You might have to wait a little, but it's worth it!
author: Mina T.

description: Limon is great! I have eaten there at least 10 times and every time it has a killer experience. The staff is always good, the owners are super cool and they have a great wine list. The place is a bit loud for a date however I would still bring one there because of the great energy and killer food.
author: Bobby B.

description: Surprised by the glowing reviews of this restaurant considering I found the inconsistency to be quite annoying. Went into it thinking Peruvian... Yes, I enjoy this food, but disappointed by the ,"Let's be trendy and add a truffle mac and cheese to the menu." It was all over the place with what was supposed to be a Latin chicken (just salty poultry) to the truffle to mac and cheese and truffle potatoes to a menu that what supposed to be Latin! Not impressed by the, "let's pick the popular flavor cuisine." Extremely disappointed with the muddled menu. Bleh.
author: Michelle J.

description: Love this place...Finally they reopen...All the dishes are very flavorful and exotic...
author: Jade L.

description: Great spot to have dinner. I must say they have a very nice location - in the heart of Mission. Don't even think about leaving without trying the Halibut ceviche, followed by the fried snapper and the bread pudding. Service is good, not great. The view from the second floor of the restaurant is very nice.
author: Palak P.

description: The Red Wine Sangria is amazing.  The seafood appetizers and entrees are great.  But I would have liked more vegetarian dishes on the menu.
author: Louise A.

description:
Was this the El Limon that our entire city was raving about? All the queues, reservations, the whole hoo-haa?

PSHAW!

Atmosphere: VERY NOISY
Service: Dreadful
Prices: OVERpriced
Wine list: Inconsistent with what is brought to the table

Overall: AWFUL
Recommended: Absolutely not

There you have it. Finally I made it to EL Limon and none of the categories that make a restaurant stand out where in place.

Perhaps that's the price of becoming too comfortable once the novelty has worn out for the establishment?
author: Nena G.

description: I love this place.  The ceviche is awesome, worth the trip by itself.   The flash fried chicken dish is also great.  And the  Foie Gras and scallops dish... well, foie gras and scallops, need I say more.   Good service, cool vibe, great food!
author: Raj M.

description: I've been here a few times, the first time was after seeing a review on "Check Please" 2 years ago? Back then they had my favorite dish- Pollo Saltado which they changed to Lomo Saltado. SO SAD! But they have another chicken dish on there which comes with a side of mac & cheese which I swear you'll want to eat as an entire meal. Yes, it's that good...but also rich and fattening. YUM. The ambiance is great, if you sit upstairs in the balcony the view of the first floor is neat...it can get warm though because you're right by the open kitchen. The servers are good about recommending wine and make sure you save room for their chocolate cake.
author: S K.

description:
Since we had a party of 9, we made reservations. They said that the earliest they could seat us was 8:30 p.m. on the Thursday that we went. All's good.

We got there exactly at 8:30 with our full party and they said we had to wait because the people at our table got the bill and paid, but were still mingling. They politely asked us to sit in the window area for drinks...except the entire 15-20 minutes we waited, we never got any drinks and never got served or asked if we wanted any drinks. Kind of lame and a bummer.

Do they not serve good bread here was was it just bad luck for us? The bread came out in warm plates, but the bread was completely cold and was something you could get at a crap chain restaurant. At least the sauces were interesting and tasty.

Aside from the wait and the bread, everything else was pretty delicious and great! My boyfriend and I shared the tabule appetizer with quinoa and other veggies. It was cold and I liked it; my boyfriend thought it was ok; he was expecting more veggies than quinoa. We shared our two entrees, the red snapper and the ribeye (cooked medium). The red snapper was very crispy and delicious with the curry sauce; the coconut fried rice was also very good with a perfect texture of rice. However, there were only about 6 chunks of meat...sadface. Good thing the entire fish was deep fried; I obliterated the rest of the carcass by eating all the crispy bones and fins, while my friend ate the head and eyeballs. We saw another table get the same dish and they actually didn't even TOUCH the fish carcass/bones. WTF? THAT'S LIKE PRACTICALLY THE BEST PART IF IT'S DEEP FRIED!!!! God, I wanted to slap those people.

Anyhow, the ribeye was tasty; I mean, how can you go wrong with ribeye right? I got it medium because I was told that when you ask for medium rare, it's a little too bloody. Honestly, it was cooked perfect, but I could have had mine just a tad bit more alive. The sauce with it was good and the purple potatoes had a slight crisp.

Munching on others' foods, the lomo saltado (sirloin) had really good flavor; fried sweet potatoes were good; yuko was FANTASTIC (pretty much like a giant french fry and a little bit more fibrous); pork chop was a teeny bit dry but very good with the ragout (my sister ordered this and gave me the leftovers; which I ate the next day for breakfast with rice. DELICIOUS). Everybody seemed very satisfied with their food; I heard the cebiches were awesome too.

As for drinks, the sangrias were quite tasty.

For our entire party, our bill came out to be about $480. My boyfriend and I paid $90 altogether (two glasses of sangria, one appetizer, red snapper, and ribeye).

For the saltiness, the food didn't taste very salty as we ate it, but I realized I had about 6 glasses of water during dinner and when I got home, I was really really thirsty.

All in all, great place to try and definitely on the pricey side. We don't usually spend this much on dinner (actually, we've never spent this much on dinner). It has fancy decor inside; service is ok (except for the wait and the not-serving-us-drinks-while-we-waited thing); food is quite, quite good. I'll definitely come back; maybe in half a year when I have the money to splurge.
author: Angela H.

description: This place had a good vibe when I walked in with some friends.  We were seated upstairs in the back which quickly became packed with people.  The Sangria was excellent.  Started off with the tuna and chicken appetizers which were also excellent.  I thought we were off to a great start but then I received my entree.  I got a dish that is considered, according to the restaurant, a signature peruvian dish.  It was ok.  It was beef mixed with tomatoes, onions and fries - thought that was a little odd, and some rice on the side.  Kinda disappointed and wished I would have ordered more appetizers instead.  Dessert wasn't that great either.  And then it became so loud in this place I could hardly hear the conversation at my own table.  Overall it was a fine experience - just nothing to write home about.
author: Kerry M.

description:
I finally got a chance to check out Limon, after having tried to go the old location when they first hit it big. They are much better equipped now.  We got a creme ceviche. The second one, forgot the name. It was a pretty big serving and the fish, octupus, and squid were all tender.  As for the entree, the waiter had said that they were out of the red snapper, even though the people next to us, who sat down after we did, got the red snapper. Hmmm.  ANy way, after the ceviche, I was in the mood for land animal, and so the duck was perfect. IT was displayed around some starch and spinach. I git it medium rare, and it was tender as hell.  My friend got the beulibase (no time to look up the spelling). he liked it a lot. I tried it, and thought it was light and fresh, but not as good as my duck.
No dessert, we were full.
author: d r.

description:
Love this place. Fantastic food, great atmosphere and great service. It's a very lively, trendy restaurant. Great for a date or a group. Gotta have the ceviche. My favorites were the Creme Ceviche Rocoto (I think that's what it was called... ceviche in a chili creme sauce) and Ceviche Limon .

The service was excellent. Very attentive and helpful but not overbearing. The hostess was great as well. And this all while the restaurant was jam packed.
author: Nithin R.

description: I've never been disappointed by this place.The pan seared scallops and foie gras make you yearn for more (although I never seem to get enough scallops in any appetizer in any restaurant!).  The rocoto curry sauce is perfect for the red snapper and the Rib Eye is delicious.  Try to go with a big party so you can sample as many dishes as possible.  Oh, and don't forget to get the Sangria.
author: Mike K.

description:
Went with just mom and I, were sat immediately and upstairs where it is quieter, great, patient service from our Spanish waiter who made perfect wine suggestions.  All the food was very good.  One warning: the "Sashimi" section of the menu is decidedly Ceviche.  I wouldn't call it sashimi but I love ceviche as well so I wasn't disappointed.  Mom got roasted chicken with truffle mac n cheese.  I don't think any culture in the world handles chicken better than Peru, and Limon is no exception.  The skin was crispy and the meat hot and tasty.  Back to the service: the waiter did not remove any dishes from the table until we were DONE eating.  So rare to see proper restaurant etiquette, and as a slow eater, I appreciate not being ostracized as the only one with a plate.  Water glases were kept perfectly full with no ceremony.  So rare, it seems.  We finished our meal with leisurely glasses of port as he dinner rush started to come in, and the waiter still did not bring the check until we had finished them.  It felt like eating in a laid-back European fashion where the food takes center stage.  2 glasses of $7 wine, a $14 ceviche and an $18 entree and 2 glasses of $9 port and the bill came out to $86 with tip.  I will be back to try the $3 oyster shooters and enjoy the great wine list at the bar.

PS. The bathroom is small but beautiful and nice.
author: Lauren J.

description: Probably one of the top three restaurants in SF for me.  This place is GOOD!  I've been to Peru and they have awesome dishes.  The Peruvian cuisine comes from a mix of Indigenous and Spanish influences.  The varying landscape of Peru offers up a great variety of vegetables and spices and seafood.  There is a down home quality to Peruvian food too.   Meat and potatoes type stuff ya know.  The chef at Limon can really cook, he/she transforms traditional Peruvian dishes into something especially gourmet.  This place is full of good vibes.
author: Patrick T.

description: After experiencing the glamour (and by glamour I mean scam) and delicious food (and by delicious food I mean overpriced, small, rationed food) of the spectacular (and by spectacular I mean poorly kept) La Mar Cebicheria I was a little skeptical about trying this place. I was scared of experiencing the same. There is something about Peruvian and Indian food that simply arouses my attention. I tend to escape my traditional chicken chow mien to delve into Cebiche and Lomo Saltado. What I found in Limon was americanized Peruvian food. And I guess I liked it but it should really promote itself as AMerican style Peruvian food. Furthermore the ambience is not one of Peruvian decent but rather one of a Cable Cafe or McDonalds afternoon. Noisy, crowded and a lot of ppl of my kind ;) Never the less the experience was 100 times better than La Mar. But there was something missing. I must continue my search!
author: Cecilia A.

description:
Thankfully this place is back and even better than before!!
Oyster shooters are marvelously delicate with a strong finish. Get 2 each!
Octopus is the best in the city - don't be afraid of trying them. It doesn't taste like chicken but if that's what you want go to KFC please and leave this for the delicate palates of my friends.

Now, to continue, the pollo is good but the whole snapper is amazing. It is fried but totally worth it. Melts in your mouth with a dipping sauce that you cannot leave alone. Better than before.
Value, flavour, service is great.
author: Faisal M.

description: Great loft space and ambiance. The food was wonderfully prepared and very flavorful. The sangria there was great, along with the churrasco ala parilla (ribeye steak) and pechuga de pato (duck). We made reservations, which was a good idea, because the place got packed. We noticed that the servers seemed very tolerant of children, and even amused them by carrying them up and down the stairs - so definitely also a family friendly place and not stuffy at all.
author: Connie C.

description: Limon is a great dinner spot in the mission.  Not to be a cheapskate, but I was surprised at the price of entrees (nothing under $20) and there weren't any great steals on wine.  Food was all delish, and the ceviche is totally praise-worthy.
author: Heather C.

description: I had never been, always had great reviews on yelp! A few of us checked it out last night and was very happy with our meal selection. Def not a tapas place, full of flavorful entrees from pork chops, to top sirloin and excellent calamari with a tangy chipolte sauce. A great find!!!
author: Kavita S.

description:
