I'll start by saying that the food was pretty decent here. Not the best I've ever had, but tasty nonetheless.

However, I have to really ding Limon for the service we got. Normally, I have a high tolerance for a busy waitress or a loud atmosphere, as these don't bother me too much. 

Limon, however, tried to kick my party out after 1.5 hours. We were finishing our tea and coffee and the waitress came by and told us that she had a lot of people waiting and asked if we could pay. We gave her a credit card, slightly annoyed but figured we'd stick around for a few more minutes. We got the card back and signed, and then were just chatting over the last of the drinks. At that point, THE MANAGER came over and told us that he had a lot of people waiting and asked us to get up.

At this point, I was a bit surprised, so I looked at my watch. It had been an hour and a half, so I asked him how long the average table stayed. To our surprised, he said 2 hours. I think he offered to buy us drinks at the bar, but it was hard to hear over the din. Plus, the bar was so crowded that it didn't look too fun to hang out and stand up packed in, so we left. 

Overall, the manager was very rude and it ruined an otherwise decent place. Won't be going back.
author: Alex S.

description: We had a large group and had reserved in advance... so we weren't very happy to wait nearly 45 minutes for our table with hardly an apology or anything.  The ceviche was very tasty, but the entrees were just okay.  Or maybe just okay in light of having to wait so freaking long for the table!
author: Nat K.

description: Mandy and I sat in the 'skydeck' , which was not as appealing as I thought it woudl be.  Anyway, the stuffed calamari with saffron starter was the highlight.  Nearly as good was my main course of Lomo Saltado, which left me too full for any of the desserts.  Mandy had the ribeye with Chimmichuri that disappeared in no time.  Great red meat, no doubt. Also, a decent selection of American and South American reds.  I saw (but did not pull the trigger) they have Merry Edwards Pinot, which is a must buy if you are sharing a botttle with friends.  Probably on the menu, but not available for much longer...
author: Todd J.

description: Might be one of the best restaurants in the City! We had the Ceviche Limon for starters, which was completely amazing!  The fried halibut curry was fantastic, even the rice that came with it was great!  The picante de mariscos was probably my favorite part of the meal....oh wait...that was actually the sangria, which was awesome!  The service was perfect as well.  The only drawback was that we had to wait to be seated even with a reservation, but that's to be expected at a restaurant that's this good. Definitely will go back soon!
author: Craig E.

description: The cerviche is awesome!!! The fish and seafood is yummy!!! Great food for the price.
author: Denise L.

description: Very solid dinner, but in my mind I was comparing it to Fresca and Fresca just came out on top. Favorites were the sangria, truffled mac & cheese and the chocolate bread pudding. I felt the ceviche had a tad too much lime juice...probably a personal preference, but when I eat seafood I still want to be able to taste the actual seafood. If you're on a date, I recommend trying to get a table upstairs versus downstairs...the volume level is much better upstairs.
author: Adrienne C.

description: Well. I expected so much more from a new hot spot. From the second you walk in you feel like youre eating at a zoo. ITS SO LOUD IN THERE. I usually love open kitchens but that doesnt help either as it isnt ventilated well. Ok so its hip and cool and loud. Once you get over there, its on to poor service. Slow slow slow. The worst part ever...we are out of the pork, the fish and the chicken. WHAT? how about if I dont eat red meat? Basically on a sat night at 9pm, you dont run out of your main dishes expecailly considering there isnt much selection to begin with. Lots of appetizers, cold and hot though. The ONLY thing I LOVED about this place was the Truffle Oil Macaroni and Cheese. Delicious. That is all. So not worth anything else. Save your money, the taxi cab and all. Not worth it at all.
author: Jackie D.

description: If there were only one food served in heaven every day, it would be Limon's truffle-infused macaroni & cheese.
author: T. C.

description: Went here (van ness location) for late lunch on Thursday.  I cant say enough good things about this place.  The service was excellent, we started off with drinks, I had the Don Carlitos and he had the Pisco Sour....both perfectly made.  Then we shared the beet salad, ceviche with fish and shrimp, lomito saltado, and chicharron de pollo.  Amazing.  The food came out fairly quick, although the restaurant was half empty.  The best dish by far was the chicken but all four dishes were ridiculously excellent.  We had a great relaxing time, were able to hold a conversation, and enjoyed the food tremendously.  The price was slightly above average for food as good as this.  Will definitely go back again.  I highly recommend.
author: Robbie T.

description: Mmm delicious!! Finger-lickin' good things we've had: pan-seared scallops with foie gras, pork chop with mushroom ragout, the steak. The waitsaff are friendly and attentive.
author: Joel A.

description:
i am still dreaming (2 days later) about the sauce that was on my chicken.  god, i love a good sauce.

but I just had to edit my review and take away a couple stars for service.  My dinner last night was just as delicious as the time before, BUT the service was pretty bad.  We waited a half an hour for a table, in spite of a reservation, first of all, with little apology.   We then waited a bizarrely long time to ever see our server.  EVerything seemed rushed and slow at the same time (like she had to rush around and rush away from us as quickly as possible, but yet we waited a long time on everything).  I enjoy a nice slow relaxed meal, but with the noise level in Limon being super loud, and the music all fast, and the servers rushing here and there at high speeds, it's not the correct atmosphere for that.  It's almost impossible to talk to your dinner partner across the table.  

i don't know.  the food is A-MAZING.  but it'll be awhile before i'd go back and feel like it was worth it again.
author: Sharon M.

description:
the servings aren't big, but you'll want to order a whole lot

the fish and ceviche are worth going back for

the space is warm and welcoming, if slightly noisy
author: Charles C.

description: I have been an avid fan of Limon for years, ever since they were a small outfit around the corner before the expansion.  Have been there numerous times and on every occasion... always impressed....always consistant and always delicious. Limon is one of the top 5 restaurants in the city for me,  and highly recommend it to everyone.  Amazing cevechie and sangria.  I have tried almost everything on the menu and love it all!
author: Caroline S.

description: Great Peruvian food with delicious ceviche.  They also have a great wine list and a great setting for an intimate setting or a group party.  Another restaurant in the growing fashionable Mission area with very affordable gourmet food.
author: evan t.

description:
I enjoyed a nice dinner here on Saturday night. 

-Ceviche Limon: Limon is known for their ceviche, but this ceviche was delicious! It was a platter of mixed seafood including, halibut, mussels, calamari, and i think maybe some other thing with suctions on it that I was too afraid to eat. I loved them all because instead of just lime juice and seasonings, this ceviche had some kick to it! I can't handle spicy foods, but it just the right amount of spice to it. And the mussels were the best part of the assortment! 
-Mac&Cheese w/ White Truffles: I'm a sucker for mac and cheese, so when I saw this on the menu, I had to give it a try. It was delicious! I could have eaten a platter of this for dinner! I've had it other restaurants, but this was by far my favorite. It was creamy, but not too heavy and filling. 
-Lomo Saltodo: sirloin with onions, tomatoes, peppers, and fries served with rice. YUM! 
-Picante de Mariscos: sort of like a seafood stew i want to say. The sauce was reallly good- I wanted to soak it all up with bread, but sadly I was way to full.

The ceviche was impressive, the sangria was sweet and delicious, but the entrees did not stand out. They were good, but I've eaten the same dish at Fresca and the Fresca dish stand out a lot more. The service here was impeccable! Our chairs were pulled out for us, I had help with my jacket, our water glasses were never empty, and the waiter consistently came by to wipe off all the food we had dropped on the table. 

I would definitely come here again- high recommended :)
author: lauren j.

description: We came here a few weeks ago for my birthday, and it was delicious!  The vibe is very hip and trendy, and the service was attentive.  We all had meat-heavy dishes, but the presentation was spectacular and the food was delicious!  I love the sauce they serve with the calamari and I really liked my pork dish.  We waited a few minutes at the beginning even though we had reservations, but it wasn't too bad.  Even though it's on the pricey side, it was worth it!
author: I-Chant C.

description: I heart Limon.   Me and the hubby came here for our anniversary last year and everything was delicious!  We ordered the the ceviche, calamari, Picante de Mariscos (the sauce was yummy), Lomo Saltado and a chocolate dessert.  The service was excellent and the staff was very attentive and efficient.
author: Mare P.

description:
We showed up on time with 4 out of 5 people for a 7:30 Saturday night reservation.   We were given the fairly standard "wait for your whole party before we seat you" when it was pretty obvious that they didn't have a table for us anyway. So we grabbed a spot at the bar.

15 minutes later when our fifth person showed, they gave us an option to put us in the "lounge" around a coffee table or wait for a table that was finishing up.  We had a pregnant women in our group so the coffee table lounge thing wasn't going to work.

At 8:30 (we'd now been waiting an hour for a table -  with a reservation) we talked to the hostess again to see what was up.  Because the table we had been waiting for (I'll admit the table was camping) wasn't free they tried to again put us in the upstairs lounge at a 8 person high-top.   The thing is the upstairs lounge was roasting.  So we asked if we could wait for a regular table. After an hour how much longer could it be?

So finally between 8:45 and 9 we were finally sat for a 7:30 reservation.  From there the service was "meh", a bit slow - the food was delicious.   But at that point there was no saving it.
author: Mike R.

description: The food was amazing and soooo flavorful! Loved the atmosphere and the service was outstanding! Diana was very informative and super nice! She not only gave us great suggestions but she also was very knowlegable about the culture. My friends and I can't wait to go again!
author: GiGi L.

description: Fantastic evening .... Food was amazing, staff was so accommodating, warm and so friendly.   Great place to have a celebration!
author: Carol F.

description: Try the ceviches; Limon, and the pescado. Scallops!Pork chop, Harimassa and the grilled octopus!
author: K k.

description: I came here with Shatangi and Eve and it was nice.  The atmosphere was simple yet vibrant however they had these paintings that looked amateurish and cheap yet was passable to the nondiscretional eye because it matched the color of the walls.  The apps were tasty and the plate presentation was lovely but I think the maincourse food was oversalted.  Dessert was nice but how can you go wrong with melting chocolate.  Service though?  Service was SLOW and was lacking.  And on a low note, I witnessed some gross behavior in the ktichen while I was waiting for the bathroom - I don't want to see prep chefs drinking and eating with his bare hands while cleaning out the calamari that I just ate.
author: Dana C.

description: Yep.  Five stars for the most unusual combination of delicious food and drinks I may have ever had and enjoyed immensly!  We got a pitcher of (I love pitchers of anything basically) sangria at the bar and I was already in love, but then when we were seated on the top floor looking down on the line cooks I was totally sold.  A great dining experience.  The ceviche was phenomenal (six of us shared something like four dishes), the service was great, the sangria I totally recommend and the restaurant - best time I've had in a while.  A mix of snooty and groupie snooties, groups and couples who wish they were in groups, but shit, if you're there to have a good time, it will be had.  The food outshines everyone anyway.
author: Amy M.

description:
**UPDATE 8/24/07 **
Awesome Awesome Awesome! ...managed to eat a l i t t l e less than first time around, so enjoyed much more!  Mac and Cheese with truffle oil is still the BEST EVER MAC&CHEESE.  But you can't eat much because very very rich.  Ceviche limon is great.  Everything is great, but HAVE to get the pitcher of sangria.  Desert is worth it, too, just eat it and you'll love it.  Take parents here because you can get them drunk and they will buy you dinner and entertain you fabulously. 

--before--
Everything was very good but i ate (and drank) wayyy too much because i was so happy to have awesome, non-camping-hiking food (post vacation), and in the aftermath i forgot all the good details, except that it was really really good and I remember especially gorging on fried calamari that was soft yet crispy, lapping up especially smooth and perfect sangria that didn't just taste like cheap wine with fruit , and stealing all a certain soon to be ex 's and housesitting-friend's white truffle oil mac and cheese.  Oh yessss.... the WHITE TRUFFLE OIL MAC AND CHEESE is AWESOME and is the best mac and cheese i swear i ever ever had or imagined.  The lemon ceviche was good, the tuna tartar was, too... we had a lot more... The service was realllllllly good, someone was always clearing our dishes as soon as they were done, no sooner and no later.  Except for not telling me we were ordering like pigs at the start, they were exceptional.
author: Today Y.

description: This was my third trip to Limon and, yet again, the food was delicious, the service great and the ambience fun and energizing. Three of us ordered four plates and combined they were more than enough to satisfy appetites. Definitely order the ceviche and the lomito saltado.
author: Joanne C.

description: Located in a trendy part of town, this place serves great peruvian-cali food at a moderate price.  A few of the dishes sounded a bit risque but what I got was good.  I ordered a mouthwatering dish called the Lomo Saltado, a traditional Peruvian dish of top sirloin slices sauted with onions, tomatoes and fries, served with rice - Yum.  The Ceviche was excellent as well, very nicely prepared.  Service was great too.
author: Joe D.

description: What happened to this place...Did they change ownership recently and I missed it?? I've been here about 7 times over the last year. My last trip was an unplanned visit. The food was drab and the portions were noticeably smaller (the ceviche was past its prime) and the wine prices have increased for some just okay selections. The two people I was with felt the same.
author: Amarar S.

description:
the ceviche was very tasty and citrusy and so good. the service here was excellent despite the large valentine's day crowd. they were very accomodating and respectful. we were given the option to have our food served in courses or all at once. 

my only complaint was the noise. we were seated upstairs and i felt that all of the sound carried to up there and all i heard was everyone else's conversation and i couldn't focus on my own.
author: brian j.

description:
So this was my last stop before leaving San Francisco, and by far the best!

We set the reservation for 5 PM, we get seated by the nicest hostess I have met through out my whole trip in SF.  After being seated we get waters and bread promptly (one thing I liked about there butter, it's salted!).  Our server comes shortly to take our drink order.  We order a pitcher of Sangria, and I have to say the best damn sangria I have ever had.  First off I hate red wine, but there Red Sangria was refreshing, and quite tasty!  For appetizers we ordered the Chicharron Camarones, that dish by itself would make me a happy camper.  Crispy peices of chicken along with lime marinated onions with a citrus vinagrette you can drench the chicken in.  AMAZING!  We would have ordered another serving of this amazing dish but we had our entree.

Me and my friend ordered the Lomo Saltada, my other friends ordered the Pan Roasted Chicken, and the Ceviche with cream sauce.  can't really say much about the Ceviche, I hate cream based ceviche.  Or the chicken dish, my friend hates sharing her plates (she's weird like that).  But my Lomo Saltado, my God! It was truly heaven on a plate.  The fries were still crisp and the sauce was so meaty.  Along with the rice it was strachy, meaty, and everything you'd want in a nice South American home cooked meal.  We were so full we couldn't even eat dessert, but we saw another table eating some cookies and they looked great.  The decor of this place is simple and clean with nice color schemes through out the entire restaurant.  OK I had one little issue, and trust me anywhere else I would have been annoyed but due to everything else being so perfect I can let this slide.

Once we finished our appetizer we waited for about 20 minutes for our food.  It was so long that a table that sat after us got there meals before ours.  But again the meal and the service (minus the long wait for our meals) were great.  I will definitely come back again when I visit SF.
author: William C.

description: The Peruvian cuisine was fantastic.  The upstairs was a little chilly with the air conditioning  going strong. But, the service made up for it.  It was a truly wonderful dining experience.  The sangria was delicious and I highly recommend the Tres Leches dessert.  The eye candy behind the bar didn't hurt either!
author: Lisa F.

description:
food:amazing-best pork chop i have ever had
drinks:sangria pitchers...need i say more
author: David F.

description: Great peruvian cuisine with stella ambience. The food here is simply mmmm....... , could it be the calamares limon, or the arroz con mariscos, or simply the bandido. Whateva it may be they sure have it down good. I am sure I will be going back there very soon.
author: Raj K.

description: Incredible food, every item on the menu is outstanding.  Try the scallops with foie gras.  Service is exceptional, knowledgeable, and super friendly.  Wonderful atmosphere, sophisticated without pretensions.
author: George A.

description: This place was hoppin on a Sunday night!  The space is sleek but the acoustics make it possible to hear your tablemates without the need to scream.  Our group of 6 shared a smattering of the ceviche dishes which were very good.  I tried ordering 2 appetizers and had the shared ceviche along with a dessert.  I'm a big eater so the 2 appetizers were not very satisfying but after stealing food from friends, I managed to get stuffed.
author: ann m.

description: Food is good but a little over priced.  Wat too hot in that place!
author: David G.

description: AMAZING AMAZING AMAZING ceviches. Service very slow and not close to satisfactory.  that being said...i still fight thru it, because the food is just that good.
author: jim a.

description: Limon was dissapointing.  I know, I was shocked myself.  I had such high hopes for this peruvian joint as I heard great things about the food.  There is no doubt that you will have a good meal here but it is not as good as it is hyped.  Ceviche we got tasted like I was eating a lemon the whole time, no seafood taste.  The pork chop I got was not cooked nearly as good as the one at other places, both lacking flavor and tenderness.  The desert we got was not memorable.  If you are looking for a great great peruvian place, go to Fresca.  I will say the physical rest. itself is much bigger than I expected and was nice ambiance.
author: Charles C.

description:
I'm just going to say it: this place is for suckers. I am honestly having a hard time recalling what we even ate, the food was that unmemorable. Ah yes, tuna tartare which boasted pear, red peppers and pine nuts on the menu and yet there was little to no evidence of any ingredient in the dish besides tuna and sesame oil (you want rad tartare, hit up Mezze in Oakland.) Okay, what else? Fennel orange salad, where I tasted no fennel. Un ceviche de corvina that left us saying "Yep, that sure is snapper marinated in lime." There was no hint of chile or onion or any other thing in the dish. My feeling was that it could have been left to marinate another four hours or so, give that fish time to become tender. As it was it was rubbery and sinewy as all get out.  We had a steak and fries dish that was exactly that. There was very little seasoning, very little wow factor in any of the dishes. The food was edible, but not memorable. Too bad because you so rarely see Peruvian food on the West Coast. And as far as I'm concerned with Limn, you still don't. I can still remember the first Peruvian meal I ate ten years ago in New York: it was a quarter of a chicken rubbed in 27 different spices, roasted and served with mashed Yucca. I can remember a bite of a friend's Peruvian seafood stew I had in Brooklyn five years ago the sauce tomato-y and slightly creamy, and the ceviche I ate that night. 

The food at Limn is totally edible, but bland. Also, WTF? We're in San Francisco and the "house baked" bread they serve is glorified Wonder Bread instead of Sourdough? Given that nothing else seems to be muy authentico at this "Latin Fusion" restaurant, why'd you bitches have to go and give us lame bread? Raw deal.  The clientele were mostly business men and tourists, and their elderly mothers. The table next to us were three loud gay youngsters and their raucous gal pals, who were all texting and talking on their cell phones throughout the meal. Limn struck me as the sort of place a person goes when they want to go for "Ethnic Food" minus the  whole Ethnic part. It's like how you'd make Peruvian food for a picky five year old. I think they get away with this mostly because there's no other competition around/basis for comparison.  I gotta go check out Mi Lindo Peru next, see what's up. 

Service was okay. Our server was nice, but not particularly concerned one way or another whether we were enjoying our meal. Definitely had a turn and burn kind of feel to it, like we were taking up valuable real estate. Save your hard earned ducats and go elsewhere friends.
author: Sara L.

description: OVERRATED! The food was horrible and bland, the service was non-existent, it was so crowded and pretentious we felt uncomfortable the whole time. On Valencia but seems like the kind of place marina snobs and bridge and tunnel flock to because they think it's cool. There were really NO vegetarian options. We ordered an ceviche, which I love but theirs was just lumps of fish in sauce, no fresh veggie garnish, a sashimi tuna that was okay but bland, and a truffle oil mac and cheese, which, i have no idea  how anyone can mess up mac and cheese, but they sure did it. it tasted like it was smothered in aunt jemimah's. for all this totally overpriced as well. will never go back here.
author: Amy P.

description: I accidentally wandered in here while looking for a restaurant my first week in SF, and now i go back whenever i can. there's not a ton of food for vegetarians on the menu (doesn't apply to me, but just fyi), but everything is delicous. I particularly recommend the steak, which appears to be deliciously drenched in butter. yum!
author: Manlio L.

description: Went here for my birthday. Everything from the pitchers of sangria to the mouth watering food to the chic ambiance will make me come back!
author: Alex K.

description: go if only for the ceviche. they could use a refresh of their wine menu maybe but the food was fresh and delicious.
author: Jim O.

description:
Edit to my 2007 review.....

Went back 11/2009 after their recent renovation....

I have four words to describe the experience....

"Food good, service atrocious"

We get there and the hostess tells us that they are about 30 minutes behind.....I made reservations 6 days prior.  So that was disappointing.

During out over 45 minute wait for the table (let me state again reservations were made well in advance) they did not even offer a complimentary glass of wine or water.  

I overheard the manager (or someone in charge) say to another party that there was problems with reservations showing up but not being on the book....ummm, those are called walk-ins last I heard and tables with reservations should not be used for them.  Perhaps they can wait 45 minutes.

We finally got a seat, but a b-day party with reservation had to eat at the lounge area because of Limon's inability to understand reservations and "restauranting"

The new staff is new and needs someone to get in there and show them how to run the show!

Overall I would go back, but be prepared to wait....
_________________________________
Yum, yum, yummy, yum yum!

Went here for dinner on a weeknight (so thankfully not too crowded) and the food was awesome.  We had the tuna tar tare appt and then I had the chicken which was excellent.  My friend had the steak.  We both cleaned off our plates!  Perfectly cooked and perfectly seasoned.  The Cuscquena beer brought back fond memories of my Peru trip, so that was nice.  Service was great and the place was beautiful.

I will be coming back very soon!

(While I loved this place, when I was in Peru I definitely DON'T remembered being offered truffle-infused macaroni and cheese.  : ) The two thing that were missing from an authentic Peruvian menu, as I recall, were the alpaca and guinea pigs that are main staples in true Peruvian diets! )
author: Lara F.

description:
The best thing about Limon is their ceviche.  Starter items which are good over shadow main course dishes.  main course dishes are just so, so.   I concur with other reviews that the hostess gives attitude and was very gruff about letting us know that if our full party (6) did not arrive in 20 mins they would give the table away.  The waiters/bus boys also tried to take food and glasses away before we were finished.  Not good.

For the price I've had better meals in other locations.
author: Deirdre M.

description: i have to say that i was very excited to eat at this place....we had the worst reservation  and seating expereince.  we arrived early for a party of 3 but our friend was running a little late...we ask to be sat and the rude hostess said they dont seat incomplete parties...she then sat a party for eight that was missing four people...i spoke to the manager and he said the same thing until i pointed out the party of eight that only had four seated. he then came up with the excuse they work with us..a bunch of bullshit i say...never again will i go to this restaurant...
author: Mychael S.

description: Ceviche ceviche ceviche!  That is my favorite thing at Limon.  I've tried a variety of their ceviche and they've all been so fresh and light. The ceviche mixto is a good blend of fish, calamari, and shrimp. This one is a must have each time we visit Limon.  Each bite is so full of flavor, a mix of citrus, onion, and their "milk of the tiger" marinade.  I also like the pieces of corn that come with the ceviche.  I have also tried the tuna tartare and shrimp and mango ceviche.  Again, so delicious, you can easily get 2-3 different ones to share.  On to the hot plates, I love the empanadas. We tried the beef and onion one.  The outside is light and crispy and the inside is a warm blend of meats, onions, and eggs.  It did not feel heavy at all.  For our entrees, we had the mixed seafood paella and the lomo saltado.  Both were delicious and very classic dishes.  I preferred the paella more because I loved the seafood medley.  The food here is always good, but personally, I felt it was better before they shut down due to the fire.  I think they've gone down slightly since the reopening, which is why I am giving them 4 stars, rather than 5.  Also, it does get kinda noisy inside, especially if you sit upstairs.  I remember having to practically scream in order for the other person to hear me.  But hey, the food makes up for it!
author: Kat M.

description: I had my first mashed-potato-driven transcendental food experience last night at Limon. The mashed potatoes with mushrooms and truffle oil landed me in a serious out of body experience, in which I felt as if I *were* the truffles, all earthy and sublime, gem of the soil, sparkling, alive, reverberating from the earth's magnetic core! (For real.) Also, the pollo latino served with those mashed potatoes was perfectly juicy and seasoned brilliantly, and the two ceviche dishes --- Ceviche Limon and Ceviche de Atun --- were intensely flavorful, with all of the right textures and tastes. I will definitely, definitely go back to this restaurant, and revisiting a restaurant is a rarity for me.
author: Sahra H.

description: We never actually got to the food because Limon lost our reservation.  We had 6 people on a Friday night to celebrate a birthday, and were left to find other accommodations.  I understand that mistakes can happen, but in 2010, how can a popular restaurant possibly use a sheet of paper with crossouts, erasures, and scribbles for their reservations sheet?!? It's idiotic, and begging for mistakes.  Note to Limon, if you're reading this - get a computer!  Get OpenTable!  Note to diners, makes sure to confirm your reservations!
author: Jon G.

description: Peruvian food in the mission. fitting. Get the duck for your main course. Its unlike duck that I've ever had before... wait, do ducks even exist in Peru? Probably not, but neither do $20 entrees. But it's worth every penny. The duck was so good that one of my friends still claims that it was beef!
author: John M.

description: I'd never been to the old one, so I can't compare, but I really love the new place.  Every time I visit I feel really comfortable in the warm and inviting space they've created.  The sangria is sweet, totally excellent.  The service is the most genuinely attentive, non-obnoxious service I've ever experienced, and the food of course is excellent.  My favorite so far is the Lomo Saltado, especially the french fries drenched in the meat juice.  That sounds totally gross, but you've got to try it!
author: Nancy M.

description: This Peruvian delight has moved to Valencia and is much bigger than it used to be, but the food is still amazing.  Not ideal for sharing, but sometimes you just don't want to share.
author: Dave L.

description: The ceviche was so fresh, and the atmosphere was hip and modern- Duck was fantastic too.
author: Danielle V.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE!!! The ceviche is always fresh and ridicously delicious.Try the lomo saltado...it's so yummy,my mouth waters when I think about it!What's even more fabulous about this green wall haven, is the service.You can't beat that with a bat!!!
author: Marivic F.

description: All of the previous raves are (mostly) true, but why hasn't anyone mentioned the HOTTIE behind the bar?  On Friday night, maple-skinned, bright-eyes and tight tailed in that chic all-black 'uniform' de Limon.  The table of six women beside us all faced the bar.  Otherwise, the food is good-- I would not say spectacular like Boulevard-- but it is good.  The ceviche seems slightly dumbed down, but all of the beef dishes are sublime.  I just had the ribeye with chimichurri and it was MR grilled perfectly juicy; chimichurri is tasty without being overly oily and what the hell is in that rocoto sauce?  Y-U-M.  The atmosphere at Limon is high-energy; service amenable and the crowd very mixed.  The only downside is the lack of full bar, also, they took the Veuve split off the wine list-- what's up with that?
author: E L.

description: The pan seared scallop with foie gras was a compact bite of buttery joy. Delicious halibut ceviche with raw mussels, too. The warm flourless chocolate cake was good, but I've had better.
author: Netty L.

description: I give this place a 5.  It had a cool hip feel to it.  The service was great and the people were nice.  I even asked about the food I ordered and the waitress even broke down how to make the damn thing.  I thought that was pretty tight.  I need to go there again.
author: Jason R.

description: It's true, Limon is kind of pricey... but the combination of delicious ceviche, respectful and attentive waitstaff, and atmosphere make it worth it.  I can't vouch for larger groups or weekends, but my exboyfriend and I had a great experience on a weeknight, sitting upstairs.  Our waiter was explanatory, made good recommendations (reasonable, not like some who try to sell you the entire kitchen), and wasn't kitschy (I'm looking at you, North Beach).  Try going on a weeknight and splitting a couple of appetizers and a ceviche plate!
author: Maggie D.

description: I used to come to this place all the time when it first opened and was a tiny little space that fit like 20 people.  I came back Saturday night to the new spot with some friends who've never been and I don't know what took me so long to return.  The food was better than I remember.  I always get the lomo saltado, but I need to branch out and try the deep fried red snapper, it looks like art.  I love the ceviches here, and also the spicy chicken apetizer (a new favorite).  The dessert was this fabulous flourless chocolate cake, with ice cream on the side.  The only sad part was I couldn't drink, due to too much fun Thursday night at Trader Sams.  But my friends said the Camerere from Chile they ordered was fantastic.
author: kimberly k.

description: This is one of my favorites in SF.  great for date, with good service and excellent food.  i have been a few times, and it has been pretty consistently good.
author: Roy N.

description: My friend and I were walking down on Valecia St. [ beautiful hipster town :) ] and came across the restaurant. We were instantly drwan in by the modern decor and the fact that it was packed! I had never had Peruvian food in my life.She is Peruvian so she suggested the staples of Peruvian cusine. So i had Lomo Saltado and Ceviche, both were to die for. The ceviche is not your typical mexican red ceviche. Once you taste this any other ceviche will taste bland. The Lomo Saltado was served with rice and french fries wrapped in a strip of toasted platano. The meat was soo tender and juicy. To drink we had Inca Blu, a corn drink that tastes a lot like sangria but is non alcoholic, looks like grape juice. And to finish it off we had yuca frita with these heavely green and mustard based sauces that complemented the swweet/salty undertones of the yuca frita. I will definetly be coming here again!
author: Ivania P.

description: Excellent. I ate here once. Their Sangria is the best in the mission (that I've tried so far) and their cerviches (I had the sample platter) are absolutely divine.
author: Amy T.

description: Came here for my birthday last month. They catered to me and my loud friends who snapped pictures all night with a smile. The ceviche killed and all of the desserts were pretty amazing. My mom and I are coming back soon. Not just for the food, but for our waiter who looked like a Peruvian Clinton Kelly (a la TLC's What Not to Wear). No joke.
author: Anne Julia B.

description:
ceviches are the definitive starter at this place... for dinner a friend ordered the top sirloin which was awesome as was my order - the seared scallops - very fresh and worth of the wait from the slow service.  when we hinted that the wait was a little long, the waiter said he would take care of the corkage fee for us... which he did, so everything was forgiven.

the only really negative aspect was the obvious crowding and eminent violation of fire code. if they are having trouble with people keeping reservations perhaps they should charge for no-shows.  I would definitely recommend a mid-week visit to this mission hotspot
author: Martin B.

description:
From the in minute you walk into Limn, you know that you are in a nice yet unpretentious restaurant. The hostess greets you with a smile and seats you promptly. This place is usually happening, and even the bar is full of patrons, as walk-ins are very common. Because of its prime location on 16th and Valencia (right in the mix of all the cool bars and restaurants), it's very conducive to getting walk-ins, as people peer through the windows and they see the delicious plates of food tempting them to come inside.

Our server was very knowledgeable and friendly. I really like it when I can talk to my server and feel very comfortable with him and be able to ask him questions about the menu and know that he's going to give me an honest answer. Because I've been to Limn several times before, I have a certain level of expectation, which they always seem to meet or exceed every time I go. 

The food is really the main thing that keeps bringing me back. We started with an order of the calameres fritos, which came out perfectly golden and delicious. The chipotle aiolo sauce that was drizzled on was just the right amount of heat and complemented the dish very well. It was a good portion, and we even had leftovers to take back with us (very uncommon at a nice restaurant). 

Next, my main course arrived. I ordered the deep-fried red snapper, which is presented in the most creative way you could ever imagine. They remove the meat from the bone in small cubes and fry them separately. Then they take the whole bone and fry it. They replace the cubes back on the bone, which is in this "U" shape that holds the fish meat in place. This is so great, because you don't have to work at getting the meat out like you usually do when you order a whole fish on the bone. The fish was so flavorful, and it came with two sauces that were the perfect complement to those golden delicious nuggets. One was a rocoto (a hot bell pepper from South America) curry sauce, and the other was this light and sweet sauce that was drizzled next to the fish. It also came with a side of coconut fried rice with almonds that was to die for! It was stir-fried and it perfectly complemented the fish with all the right flavors blending together in your mouth. There was also a little side of baby spinach for some color and a veggie to complete the dish. I have to say that this is probably one of my favorite dishes EVER! I'm getting hungry just thinking about it.

Check it out for yourself. Yum!
author: Pumakat K.

description:
food was lame and overpriced, ceviche wasn't "all that" like it was hyped...
they put us upstairs in the dumpy section, we peeked down at the beautiful people and wondered what their lives were like, with their money and diamond fur...
author: slapaham s.

description: Finally, after four years of meaning to try this place, I have. And I must say I can see why it gets such rave reviews. Loved the wine list, the friendly service (both at the bar & table) and the food (I had the lomo saltado). Our party did have to wait despite a reservation, but of course, that's par for the course in this town. All in all, it was a great experience.
author: a p.

description: Ridiculously good food, service was a bit annoying, but they were persistent if nothing else.
author: Anthony O.

description: This place is just incredible.  I wish they would open up one of these in Marin. The meat literally melts in your mouth with all its tangy flavors. If this was closer to home I'd probably everyday! Deli-C- oso!
author: Brigit B.

description: This is by far one of the best restaurants I have been to in the city... I mean the Mission :). As we all know, the mission is known for its food, bars and shopping, but as for me... it's definitely the food lol. I never have been disappointed at any of the restaurants I have been to in the Mission especially... LIMON.  The food is great and tasty, the waiters are definitely accommodating... to me, if the waiter refills your glass of water before it's even half way empty... is definitely a PLUS. Make sure to reserve a table because it gets really packed in there. OH, their Sangria is soooo GOOD!  I highly recommend for a 3rd date lol OR if you just want to get together with your room-mates or friends for a delightful dinner and cocktails...this is a good place.  The prices aren't exactly cheap but affordable.
author: Charlage W.

description: Ate lunch at the bar.  Attentive staff was excited to see our groupon.  Vegetarian empanadas much tastier than meat ones.  Salad + ceviche were fresh & sabroso.
author: Jill M.

description:
the ceviche at limon is to die for!!!! ambiance is nice and darkly lit, though it can get quite loud, making it difficult for conversation. i found myself practically yelling across the table when i went there with a group of friends last time. not an ideal date place if you're looking to have intimate conversations and woo your date by whispering sweet nothings into her ear.

it was here that i first got a taste of peruvian food and have been hooked ever since. LOVE the lomo saltado, especially since i'm a sucker for anything with fries. 

my mom actually makes a vietnamese dish that is pretty similar to the lomo saltado so i went home to experiment and have made it one of my staples that i cook for friends. i can now proudly say that i make bomb-ass lomo saltado and the secret ingredient? fish sauce. 

my roomie is actually in peru as i write this and last week, he emailed me saying that even after trying it several times in peru, i still make the best lomo saltado.

in conclusion, limon has really delicious peruvian food but no one can make better lomo saltado than me.
author: Jenni B.

description: let me say that if your near limon and its happy hour, step in and have some oyster shooters and beer from peru, you can thank me later, no matter what you choose on the happy hour menu you cant go wrong...c ya there soon
author: Ivan C.

description: This is a great place to try an assortment of fresh ceviches. The service is great and the decor is chique and perfect for a comfortable romantic date. To be honest I don't remember getting past the ceviches because of the awesome wine selection and champagne (we were celebrating). Nevertheless, I do remember it being a great dinner experience and have plans to return.
author: Julian A.

description: I recommend this place the chicken was quiet exquisite and the service was pretty good.  But then again I was here 4 years ago so I am sure the service has changed.
author: Brenda V.

description: Really Good Lomo Saltado, ceviche, roast chicken - also have a rotisserie restaurant further into the mission. Since reopening on valencia I think the food is not as good down grading to 3 stars
author: jordan n.

description: We came here because of the Groupon deal so often mentioned in the recent reviews. I am a fan of the Peruvian food that I have had before, so I was confidant that I'd be impressed. We were seated promptly but, oddly, received two different menus marked "Brunch." Once we realized it we asked the hostess and she promptly offered us corrected menus. No big deal. The waiter came after a short wait, and I ordered a mimosa. They were apparently out of OJ, but the waiter assured me that he was going to run across the street to the market for more (I insisted this wasn't necessary, but he said he needed to do it anyway). Ok. The food started to come out (before the drinks). Tuna ceviche. The tuna was really mealy. It had a very tough and chewy texture which didn't make a great impression. The flavor was fine, but it paled in comparison to, say, La Mar. The veggie empanadas were fine. Nothing special, but fried to an appropriate crispiness and tasty. Finally, we had the seafood boullaibase, which looked great but had an odd stench and flavor, almost as if it were a bit past-date. Despite crab legs being included in the dish, we weren't offered a crab cracker and had to ask multiple waiters. Overall, the space is awesome and the service is mediocre, but the food really is sub-par. When we considered the price in relation to the quality, we decided not to return.
author: Jenni D.

description: I came here for a birthday dinner in a group of about 10 so we ordered almost all of the small plates (except the beef heart or whatever) and shared them amongst the group.  Most of the plates were very good but came in such small portions that it was hardly filling at the end of the meal.  I would come back but would opt to order my own plates next time.
author: Christina D.

description:
Hadn't been since the reopening post-fire, and we were painfully disappointed.
Service was fair at best - both to be seated (way too long with empty tables...the "your table is being set" only works so many times) and also during the meal. Certainly below par.
Food was acceptable, though nothing we will be back for (too many good restaurants in the city to enjoy).
Ambiance gets a solid D. We unfortunately had the misfortune of being seated in the upper section. The HVAC kinks (maybe this why there originally was a fire?) leaves it far too hot and stuffy. With a low ceiling on the second level, if it is even half full the noise level will be absolutely brutal (they haven't put anything in to help dampen the sound, and as a result the setup really ruins an otherwise mediocre dining experience). 
Sit on the main level, or don't bother. On second thought, just don't bother.
author: Mister Y.

description:
Update-1/31/06: Revisited Limon the other night. Halibut ceviche was quite tasty and not overpoweringly citrusy, but the scallops with seared fois gras and fig reduction, wow! I think I finally met my match in the richness department. Ok, well, I ate the whole thing myself, but didn't need an entree afterwards. Better shared, but a decadent meal for one if you can handle it. 
I've heard a lot of reviews of bad service at Limon, but I've always been well attended to there. The tables are too small, which leads servers and bus-people to constantly be re-arranging plates, glasses, candles, flatware and the like, but I find it almost comical. They need bigger tables.

*********************************************************************
Slid into Limon at 1050pm Saturday night with no reservations. I love going late to places to avoid the crowds and need to make reservations, but it only works well if restaurants give quality service toward the end of the night. There were no problems with service at Limon, the fleet of people pouring us water, bringing our food, taking our order, etc were all nice. It was refreshing to see the people in the open kitchen smiling as they worked too. 
It was a hot night and we weren't initially attracted to anything on the menu except for the ceviches.
Ended up getting the shrimp starter which was tasty with a decent portion, a ceviche, a raw tuna starter (a little redundant after the ceviche), and the pechuga de pato (duck breast). The duck confit potato gratin was super tasty and the duck was also really good. The ceviche was made of top quality sea food, the squid and octopus were actually tender. I'm interested in trying some of the creamier ceviches, b/c I've never had anything like that, but yeah, the duck, made me want to return.
author: Candice L.

description: I used to go to their old location and I'm really happy that they moved.  It just got way too hot and loud.  The ceviche is great and I love the lomo saltado, even though it's a bit salty.  However pair it with their buttery rice and it's awesome.  Also the Halibut and seafood is great.  Order a side of rice and eat it with the great sauce.  Lastly, the pork chop is delicious.  My boyfriend really liked the Belgium beer and the small glass it was served in.
author: Carol C.

description:
went with a friend i hadn't seen in a long time and it was yum yum yummy. had the PEI clam appetizer which was good and the steak that was cooked with fries (sorry i forgot the name) and my friend had this nifty red snapper that looked artistic when it came out.  the people right across from us had ordered the same dishes so i was stoked. my only complaint is that the waitstaff was too fast in collecting our plates..before i could finish or decide i was finished, they came and asked me if i was finished.. i know i could have said no but they seemed so eager to take it away...
it was nice though, and since the flourless cake was delicious way to end the meal.  it's a casual place, but i recommend going during the week because it can be a bit small
author: Elaine G.

description: Food was very good, drinks were very good.   Seems to be a very nice happy hour-type place.   Does get crowded and tight though.
author: Chris B.

description: The first time I tried ceviche was at Limon and it was really, really good. I told the waiter that I had never tried ceviche and I wanted to know what he recommended. He suggested the trio de ceviches ($21) where we could try three...he ordered the three and they were all so fresh. After the ceviche, I honestly don't remember what I had for dinner but whatever it was, it was good because I'm still looking for another excuse to come back!
author: Janel Y.

description: Food. is. yummy.  Limon is not overrated, it is delicious.  I'm pretty sure it's not really Peruvian but whatever it is, they can keep on doing it if it means that the food will be this good.  I forgot what I ordered but I remember it being like a party in my mouth.  Excellent.  I went with a group of girlfriends and we all raved about it.  Also, there were 7 in our party and we got a table with NO RESERVATION on a busy Sat. evening.  The hostess was so gracious and accommodated us which I highly appreciate.  I was a little disappointed with the sangria b/c  it came w/ ice in it (wtf?) which I don't understand.  But the food and the lively atmosphere more than make up for it.  I'm sad the the restaurant is temporarily closed due to a fire.  When (if) it does open again, please do yourself a favor and go.
author: Nene K.

description: Limon is a favorite spot of mine. The ambiance is lively, modern and fun, making it a great option for a group dinner. The Peruvian menu has a good variety of options, with awesome appetizers and solid entrees. The sangria is also delicious!
author: Sara W.

description: YUM!  You must have reservations for a table otherwise walk ins is first come first serve at the bar or lounge...which is packed normally.  But we were lucky enough to get a spot at the bar right when we got there. Amazing sangria and the ceviche was the best!  The seared foie gras and scallop with fig sauce shouldn't be missed either!
author: Tanger T.

description: Wonderful peruvian.  Well decorated new space, good service.  Nice choice for a fun dinner with a large group.  Good all around.
author: Rudro S.

description: I've been to Limon twice; once at the original location with the girls and again on the first date with the bf. Both times are warm memories of good food and an enjoyable evening. The Castillo brothers seem to have eased into the new space without sacrificing the food quality.  Love the ceviches!
author: Theda E.

description: Alright, maybe my opinions are skewed 'cause I live in SJ and the food is crap (and yet expensive) but I really dig this place.  Been there twice, and both times dh had the pork chop -- I managed to sneak about two bites without getting stabbed by his fork.  First time I had the ribeye; I start drooling just thinking about it.  I don't normally eat red meat, and I definitely don't eat a giant slab of it at once, but it almost made me cry, it had been such a long time since I'd had a decent meal at a restaurant.  Did I mention I live in San Jose?  This time, I tried the Lomo Saltado.  Once again, I cursed the mediocrity of the city I'm forced to live in.  F'in awesome.
author: Heather K.

description: One of the best fried calamari appetizers I've ever had.  The calamari was tender and the dipping sauce had a nice punch.  The lomo soltado was also excellent, but then again I'm used to cheap Peruvian where the lomo is half the price of Limon's.  Nice atmosphere, but very busy, and very loud.
author: Jason M.

description:
We get seated on the 2nd level, overseeing the restaurant and all its inhabitants. We quickly order a pitcher of Sangria, the ice cold fruity wine drink popular in its native country of Spain and all other Spanish restaurants... another curious item on the menu of this Peruvian restaurant. In my brief research on chowhound and other assorted websites I repeatedly see the suggestion to order the combination ceviche. The CC is a choice of 4 ceviche's out of the restaurants 8. The ceviche on the menu is split into normal "limon" ceviche and cream based ceviche. Since I am one for equality and fairness in all aspects of my life, I ordered two of each.

Being the fatties we are, my friend Ryan and I ordered the fried chicken appetizer (Chicarron de Pollo) to go along with the meal. He (not I) figured that the platter of ceviche would not be able to satisfy our hunger, especially when its shared among a party of 9. Now you know I love fried chicken, but I'd consider this more as pan fried chicken with absolutely no batter. But the chicken was extremely soft and tender and very meaty. Imagine crispy chicken at your local Tapioca Express but with no batter. Of course the best part of this dish had really nothing to do with the chicken, it was the dipping sauce they provided. If you've been to El Pollo Loco and you've had their house salsa, this is what its richer more endowed older sibling would taste like. Since I love El Pollo Loco as much as I love Chick Fil -a (RIP) I found this sauce amazing. No one else seemed to share this enthusiastic joy with me, but when did I care about other people's opinions (just kidding).

(by the way, i love sliced red onions, i love them so so so very much. Especially if they are a little sour with marinade? Man oh man)

athy's choice was inspired by what I had ordered at the Peruvian restaurant a few months ago, essentially steak and fries, Lomo Saltodo. This version of the dish is significantly less oily than the one we ate previously. The beef is also of finer quality (since the dish is nearly 3x the price) , it might actually be steak opposed to just some sort of beef chunk. But I'm not sure why I liked the other version so much more. I think the oiliness and the grease really brings out of the flavors! I also think they didn't cook the tomatoes long enough at Limon because I was expecting a hint of tomato behind every bite.. which didn't happen (/tear!).
I took pictures of the other items that were ordered but i didn't really have an opportunity to try them. So i'll give you the people's impressions.
Churrasco a la Parilla, Very simple steak, nothing to write home about. Like a majority of restaurants when a medium rare is requested.. it comes as medium. But from my own personal view, they did a very good job with the grill marks! Look at how defined and pretty it is? This steak should be a professional steak model. "What's for dinner? Beef.. *cue steak from limon with its pretty grill marks*".

Vegetable Risotto. I had an opportunity to take a bite of this. Nice crisp vegetables in the risotto. Good creamy texture for the rice, but it seemed a bit too sticky. I like mine creamy yet not so clumped together. The green sauce was a vegetable puree which added a lighter flavor to the risotto. I've had better.. or i will have better (hint of what's to come!).

Would i go here again? Probably not... considering i have a hankering for cheap Peruvian food. There are so many other restaurants to explore in San Francisco, so not coming back here will definitely not be a loss. But i am kind of surprised at the amount of people that suggested this restaurant to me. My food was good, but the overall experience or the QPR (quality price ratio) just wasn't there.
author: Charlie F.

description: Swell ceviche-laden Peruvian fare, undiminished by their move to larger quarters.
author: Gabriel S.

description: Limon has moved to 524 Valencia Street ... a bigger and better location. They have the best Ceviche ever! I love that it comes with crunchy Peruvian corn, sweet potato and spicy salsa criolla. I also highly recommend the Tartara de Atun -- a tower of diced ahi tuna served with tasty wonton points (you'll be fighting your dinner partner for these, trust me!). My only disappointment was that I didn't have room for dessert, but that was my fault. Next time ...
author: Katie B.

description:
get the ceviche limon.  to die for, in its balanced perfection.   foie gras and scallops was good, well put together in spices and other balance, but not as good as foie gras I've had elsewhere.  Still, get it before it's outlawed (damn animal rights people).

I can't remember what else I got, but I remember everything was gorgeously presented, well prepared, and just good in general.  I'd say portions were a little small for the price, making it just shy of 5 stars for me. I need to go again to see if it's worthy of the full 5.
author: Fong L.

description: A great dining experience.  Peruvian food is definitely not something I have everyday, it was verrrrry good.
author: Debbie Y.

description: If you are going to San Francisco, you have to go to Limón. The food and the service are out of this world! I went with two friends, and we tried a total of ten dishes, each of them presented so beautifully and the flavors worked so well together. Even now writing this review I salivate thinking of the food: I felt back at home in Peru, the best cebiche ever; the ravioli filled with butternut squash and a cream of ají amarillo, yummy! The lomo saltado, with the onions crunchy and delicious, and properly flamed. Well, you have to go. The people who work there looked so happy and were all very nice. By the way, I'm hard of hearing and had no problems keeping up with conversation at my table.
author: CLAUDIA S.

description: Both the 17th st and the Valencia St restaurants are great. The Picante de Mariscos is smooth, rich and incredibly flavorful. All for only $15.95. Seriously though, you'll find reasonable prices throughout and the sangria, while pushed hard, is worth it. Also, try the Cusqueno Malta, probably only available at the 17th st location. It's like chocolate beer. I've never had anything like it.
author: Phil M.

description: Fun restaurant done up in citrus colors with exceptionally professional service.  We started off with a couple of glasses of  yummy sangria at the bar, then had a couple more glasses with dinner.  The food was quite good-- I had a potatoes with cheese sauce app. (just ok) and a filling veggie plate (yummy).  The best part of the meal was the tres leches cake we had for dessert.
author: shoba d.

description: Really delicious food and sangria.  Been here a few times, for lunch and dinner.  All times were excellent.  Once as a couple when it was around the corner in a much smaller place, once in a small group and the other a large one.  The ceviche is really really good.  The service was great and I dig the new decor and dimly lit dining area.  We did make reservations in advance and I highly recommend it.  I also love the location as many of my favorite bars are in the area.
author: Adrian N.

description: I went here at 9:15 on a Monday night.  It was packed!  I order the fried snapper and it took about 45 minutes for our food to get to our table.  I was starting to get frustrated because our waiter wasn't really paying attention to us or bringing us enough bread to stave off our hunger.  But then the food came and after my first bite, I was in heaven.  The presentation is beautiful and the flavours really complement each other.  I would definitely come back here again and I'm pretty picky about the restaurants where you spend over $20/plate.
author: Mahogany G.

description: Great ambiance- we sat on the 2nd floor. I had the ceviche, empanadas, and Churrasco a la Parrilla (steak). Everything was good and the steak was so amazing.  I would definitely go back. Oh, the sangria was pretty good also.
author: N A.

description: I've been craving this place for awhile and just got that craving satisfied on a date.  It's the pan-seared scallops that put me over the edge - amazing!!!  Def. mouthgasmic as Sarah says.  And the Ahi Tuna Tartare with roasted red peppers and pine nuts is just so yummy!!!  The wait staff is fantastic - very helpful and cheerful and helped us pick the perfect wine.  My only issue is that it's a bit loud if you're trying to get to know someone, but it'll certainly be a memorable meal.
author: kerry l.

description: Food is good there, but i think we are paying more for the ambience. It is at a happening area of mission with other busy bar/restaurant like Luna park just around the corner. It is a place you want to try at least once, perhaps having a drink with your friends couple more times (nice decor) , zipping cocktail while having some appetizers, but i don't remember the food being so outstanding  to keep calling me back. They are very good nevertheless. I guess if it is priced a little lower, i would be more up for going back. I won't rate it as a "special occassion" place,  (there are so many in the city to choose from) - the price is higher than other popular restaurants in the neighborhood. So i easily go for other ones or try out new ones than going back there....But arent' they all getting more expensive these days in San Francisco anyway?
author: Angela H.

description: Really, really good ceviche. The stuffed, braised, calamari is also tops. Tasty salads. I ordered the whole fried snapper, but was unimpressed wtih its flavor (although the presentation was very impressive). Over all, I really like this place, and next time I go back, I'm seriously gonna chow on just a ton of ceviche.
author: Sunny Y.

description: The ceviche is wonderful (and I don't even like ceviche), the sangria just perfect, and the duck is my favorite dish - I was full but kept eating as it was so delicious! The service was great although it can get a little loud!
author: Mi M.

description: Ok, so it took me two locations, forever & a decade to get to Limon. I forget what my ambivilence was. Had (yet another) going away work luncheon here last week. It was really good. I liked the chicken appetizer the best, what the hell was it called? Two pitchers of sangria...sorry. The calamari was about the freshest, melt in your mouth goodness that I've had in awhile. I wasn't stoked on the ceviche de camarone, but everything else was tops. Service was great for our party of 10 at noon, which is always a sign of a good server.
author: Colleen B.

description: Limon is fantabulous!!  I had the Lomo Saltodo, Peruvian-style steak, delicious.  I think my friend had the pork chop which was also yummy.  For dessert we had the chocolate cake, which was decadent.   This place is always packed so my advice is to make reservations before hand.  Our big mistake was not making reservations but we just dined at the bar (or you could also dine in their lounge area), that was fine with me b/c I was preoccupied with the great-tasting food.
author: Belle M.

description: I came here years ago and decided to take some out of town friends here last week. We had a 9pm reso and didn't get seated til 9:45pm. The place is very cramped and super loud. I started with the "ensalada mixta". It was very salty and the lettuce was drowning in the amount of dressing they put on it. I ate it but didn't like it at all. Then I had the anticucho de pulpito, the marinated baby octopus. There were 3-4 pieces, they were good but still, there was a heavy dose of salt on the food. Why? I didn't like that at all.
author: Vivian L.

description:
When I am in the mood to pay more for Peruvian food... this is the place to go! (You do pay for presentation, ambiance, etc... worth it!) Needless to say... of course this is not 100% Peruvian home cooked style, but it is pretty darn good in my tummy! Besides... they do call themselves Nuevo Latino Fusion. I usually rate my Peruvian restaurants by their Lomo Saltado. This is a dish you can commonly find at most Peruvian restaurants and happens to be my fave. Yes, it is simple... yet I have seen it go wrong before.  The flavor of my Lomo (Steak) was delish... I went here for lunch with my old boss and we were both delighted by the food. And hello... can we say yum yum Ceviche Limon!?!?!?  Made with the right fish!!!! (Ok, I am biased... my family makes ceviche with Sea Bass (Corvina)... always a highlight for me.  I give you 2 thumbs up Limon... and why do I not grant thee a 5? Because we had a run-in with the hostess who seemed to be having a bad day. 

Oh... and why do I come off talking about Peruvian food like this? I am part Peruvian... so, there... Membership has it's privileges! But I loves Limon!
author: Amelia M.

description: I really like this place.  The food is pretty good and the service is absolutely wonderful.  I seriously have never had better service in my life. The ceviche there is yummy; they have so many kinds and they are all tasty.  Somtimes ceviche can be too citrusy, but they have perfected it here.  I ordered a seafood dish for my entree and there was more than enough food to fill my tummy and it completely satisfied my tastebuds.  Also the chocolate souffle is delicious....and with my sweet tooth....any place that has great dessert is a-okay in my book!!  I highly recommend this place.
author: Neety P.

description: Limon is nothing but the best!  Took some out-of-town friends here and everyone loved it.  The food is hot, fresh and so flavorful!  You have to get a glass (or 4) of sangria.  I had the Lomo Saltado and thoroughly enjoyed it!!
author: Joe U.

description: Uninspiring wine list / annoyingly authentic beer list. Food ranged from unremarkable (ceviche and chicken) to bad (steak, ribs, lomo saltado). Truffle mac n' cheese was good, but even more dubiously Peruvian than the rest of the menu. Nice space though.
author: Stephan M.

description: 3.5 stars.  The chicken was pretty delicious, especially with the sauces.  Better than Costco chicken.  They undercooked our hanger steak, but I still ate it, shrug.  Yucca fries were nothing special.  I'd go back for some chicken and sauce.
author: Derk C.

description: I will never set foot in this place again. Two of us arrived there on a weekday evening shortly after it opened. It was quiet, hardly anyone there and the evening started out somewhat well. Our server forgot the wine I ordered when first seated, but that was I found that forgivable. We ordered appetizers (ceviche trio, very good, but Fresca, is better). and kept thinking someone would come back to take our dinner order, but after finishing the apps, drinking the glass of wine and water still no one returned.   Mid-way through eating apps we had tried to make eye contact with our waiter to ask him for more water, but he made a bee line for the front door where we watched him walk across the street, grab a latte, and hang out on the sidewalk in front of the restaurant. We thought, he must be off for the evening and another waiter would help us. Finally, we asked the hostess for help. She said another waiter will be taking over. Still, no one came to our table. We finally asked for a manager. The manager was dressed as a busser. Apparently, he was acting in both capacities! He said he was sorry and would buy us a round of drinks. At this point, we were not interested, we just wanted to leave. We were presented with the check. I would have expected that at the very least my companion's $2.00 soda would have been taken off the bill, but no such luck. Angry, I returned the bill and told the manager that if they are sorry they certainly did not show it. At that point, they took $10 off.  What a train wreck of a restaurant, worst dining experience of my life.
author: Red H.

description: I love the new location, the food is tasty, and the sangria is right up there with the best in town (though the little snippets of apple make it hard to drink).  The ceviche Limon is wonderful, but there are plenty others to choose from on the menu!  The foie gras and scallop appetizer was absolutely mouthgasmic...surrounded by a wonderful fig/balsamic sauce/reduction...whoa!  Definitely not to be missed!  The entrees were a bit less excited.  The pork chop has great flavor, but it was a titch over cooked, and the picante seafood dish was just alright.  I'm pretty torn between 3 and four stars, but I liked the atmosphere, service was good...and it was a fun night, so what the heck!  4 it is!
author: Sarah D.

description: The food is good. I wanted to try Peruvian food before I went to Cusco. The food is very similar, and they don't serve cuy.
author: Gilbert D.

description: "I will go back again" that's my friend's comment on Limon after we had a great meal there. Limom has good food, food wine and good service. Waiters and Waitresses are very friendly and helpful. So, if you are planning a medium budget, good food party, you got it.
author: Yina M.

description: The service here is so attentive, it borders on stalking.  But the food is excellent, if a bit pricey, and the wine selection is good.  Arrive early if you're driving because parking is difficult and there's no valet.
author: Helen C.

description: Good ambience (was the original location for Slanted Door, I think) and food, great service, nice wine list. We had the Tartara de Atun (chopped raw tuna) to start - it was fresh, tasty and prettily presented. I had the lamb with lentil tacu-tacu --- lamb was great and so was its jus, lentil cake was too salty for me. My friend had the Peruvian Bouillabaisse --- very good, but not outstanding. The dessert was a special --- a tres leches sort of cake and was excellent. I think some of the popularity is trendiness - if you're in that neighborhood and want similar food, but with better value for your money, I would suggest going to Platanos (Guerrero at 18th).
author: Dana B.

description: Excellent food, the pork chop was fab as was the skirt steak and sangria!
author: Amber N.

description: I really enjoyed the stuffed calamari here...I was just thinking about it and needed to put a review in!  Overall, our dinner was great and the calamari is what will bring me back.  Will return for the squid and great service!
author: Jeff A.

description:
we went here on a wednesday night for a girl's dinner.  albeit there were 6 of us, however the waitstaff graciously accomodated our every whim.  we did have to wait about 15-20 for our 7pm reservations while we waited for them to decide where to seat us which was a little annoying, but we ordered a drink at the bar.  there was a nice ambiance & the decor was well thought out.    

the ceviche was excellent & fresh.  the salads were flavorful.  some of us got entrees while others continued to order from the appetizers.  we ordered a few pitchers of sangria to start the night, then switched to wine & cocktails.  the service was excellent throughout the entire meal.   

we thought it was a little pricy at approximately $50/person, but we'd all come back again.
author: kristen h.

description: Limon has been one of my favorite restaurants in SF since it was just a baby around the corner.  I have yet to get something here that isn't top notch.  The ceviche is bomb, the sangria is some of the most delicious social lubricant around and every single one of their main dishes rocks the hizzy fo' shizzy.  Great wine selection too.
author: Chard M.

description: I've been here two times now. While I definitely think the food is great, I just don' t think it's that much better than other peruvian joints where you don't have to wait as long or spend as much. Plus their menu is pretty small. Last time we went the waiter told us to order apps because the food would take 40 minutes. Since it was a Sunday and not terribly crowded I asked why that was. His response was that it's always like that, regardless of the crowd. To me, that means they are creating a situation where we are forced to order apps or go hungry. Even though they can easily do something about that. Bad, bad Limon!!
author: Riz N.

description:
GABRIEL
Jer, so I took this girl here the other night.  It's Peruvian food.
JERRY
What's that?
GABRIEL
Well, it has a mix of Japanese influence with Latin America -- like the house Ceviche -- it's awesome.
JERRY
No, I meant, like what is it -- a place?
GABRIEL
Peru.  You've heard of the country right.
JERRY
I thought it was  verb.  You know: I didn't have enough time to read, so I just Peru it.
GABRIEL
Anyway.  Who would've imagined yam and corn could work with ceviche. You know what ceviche is, right?
JERRY
Duh!  It's what you say what you understand.  Ceviche?
GABRIEL
Lomo Saltodo is excellent -- top sirloin -- very traditional.
JERRY
Is it loud?
GABRIEL
Well, you don't have to shout.
JERRY
But it's not too quiet, right?  Because that's just waay to much pressure when you're with a woman.  Because sometimes you just want to stare at your food and eat.
GABRIEL
Right.  Anyway, we got a seat right away without reservations, but I would NOT recommend that on a Saturday night.  Service was excellent as well.  Wine was good -- expensive for what we had.  But -- hey.
author: T. F.

description: I'm still contemplating on 3 1/2 stars to a 4 star for my taste buds.  However, I will say, the ceviche was quite tastey.  The entrees were a little on the salty side, and the dishes are petite in portions.  It was quite crowded when we dined here and the table seating are a bit too close together.  However the colors were pleasant and the view of the open kitchen was cool.  I do give this place credit for creativity.
author: Jenn C.

description: In my search for real Peruvian food in San Francisco I decided to give Limon a shot even though I knew I would be paying a pretty penny for my food. What bothered me off the bat was Peruvian food is all about variety yet there really weren't that many choices. Also they are missing some classic Peruvian dishes like pollo a la brasa, although they did have something called a pollo latino, and also there was sadly no papa a la huancaina in sight. I must say the food we did have was really tasty and worth the wait we went through. They had really good chichi morada and the aiji was nice and spicy!
author: kArlos A.

description: The creviches are awesome.  I went with two friends who spent some time growing up in South America, they endorsed Limon heavily.  The seating is a little cramped and the neighborhood made me want to quickly return to the suburbs, but the food was great.
author: Marc M.

description: Yup got to go here!  Make it tops in the mission district well maybe besides Foreign Cinema but really good, no seriously good!
author: Bruce_ B.

description: I want to eat here every night!!! The sangria... YYYUUUUUMMMMMYYYY!!! But too much of it kills your appetite or so it did mine. We started with macaroni and cheese (too die for!!! ABSOLUTLY TO DIE FOR), and the empanadas (YUM)... our entrees took a little too long, by the time they came out we were too stuffed from all the sangria.... but me and my friend shared a prawn ceviche... it was average... but i m not a fan of prawns... some fresh fish might have been a little better, and we shared the red snapper.... WOW, i still dream about it, starting with the fact that its my favorite fish, and the crispy fried spinach sprinkled with lemon lime juice, (my mouth is watering), and the side of coconut curry rice... ok i m thinking dinner there tonite.... oh do make reservations we went on a saturday at 9:30 and didn't get seated till ten.... oh and i still have to try their deserts....
author: yana Z.

description: It's all about the ceviche. Minus 1 star for prices 'cus not all of us have 6 figure jobie-jobs.
author: Cristian M.

description: 8 of us came to hear for dinner because 2 people recommended this place to me (I am glad they did).  We ordered 6 appetizers, 7 main dishes, and 3 desserts (practically everything on the menu).  My favorites were the Vieres con Foie Gras, Arroz con Mariscos, Pargo Rojo, and truffle oil mac and cheese.  Everything was eaten and everything was soooooooooooo delicious.  I am giving it a 4 stars rating because the service wasn't top rated.  We paid $114 per couple and that was with only 1 bottle of sake.
author: Anna S.

description: I have been to Limon 4 times over the past 2 years, while the service and food was still solid, it just didn't have that great, fun vibe it used to have. We were there on a Thursday night and the place was empty by 9:30pm.
author: Anna R.

description: This place is pretty expensive.  The food is pretty good.  I love their ceviche (raw fish appetizer).  The fried fish is pretty good as well.  This place could get pretty crowded at night be sure to make reservation.
author: Lily K.

description: Fulfilled my craving for ceviche and yummy lamb. My only complaint is that the tables are pretty packed right next to each other.
author: vicki c.

description: One word: Ceviche.  Try them all!  They are magnificent!  The desert that took 20 minutes to cook was over rated.  What was it called?  It wasn't worth remembering!
author: sam t.

description: The food is amazing, but the service is pretty bad. I was at a dinner party for approximately 12 people. They forgot to make one persons dinner. They were not very apologetic about it and were annoyed that we got mad about this. Their way to 'comp' us was to bring a piece of cake for the bday girl to be split by the 12 of us. Pretty pathetic. So, there steak is amazing, but not worth the poor service.
author: Wendi K.

description: Super tasty food.  Nice scene.  Upscale without being stuffy or trying to hard to be "cool".  The food was sublime.  Ceviche de pescado was tasty, as was my chicken with truffled mac and cheese (I'm a sucker for mac and cheese).  Everyone at my table raved about their meal.
author: Margaret B.

description:
i've been to this restaurant twice. (almost 3 times if i got there on time because of critical mass!) both times have been really really good.

i just recently came back from a trip to peru and this place is like gourmet peruvian food. i had peruvian cravings for such a long time and this is the place i went! SOOO happy to go.

i totally recommend the empanada, lomo saltado, and any ceviche. i felt like i was back in peru, if only for like an hour and half. their chicha morada (purple corn sweet drink) comes out in the same cup their cocktails are in. i was so happy to get a drink since you can't get this anywhere in the bay area (well i haven't really looked).
