people say peruvian food is one of the best south american cuisines because of the influx of different cultures into the country. everywhere i went there was japanese and chinese food (chifas), so it seems like their food has an infusion of so many tastes. another reason is their accessibility of different types of food. potatoes originated from peru (check it out on wikipedia, it's totally true). it's near the ocean and the andes, so you have your meats and seafood. i'm a big peruvian food fan now.

the only problem i have about this place is that's it's nearly impossible to get reservations or find parking in the mission. it's like you're stuck with a 5pm or a 9pm reservation and once you do have reservations, you need to really get to the mission district at least an hour early. it'll take that long to find street parking if you're not willing to pay 20 bucks for a parking spot 6 blocks away. i suggest BART it or cab it. it's not worth your sanity to drive around for 45 minutes (which i did the second time i went to limon).

i suggest book on opentable, it's great and easy and get there early! i took my friend to dinner here but she was running late. they won't seat you unless EVERYBODY from your party shows up. it there are 8 seats, they want 8 people to show up.
author: Ivy C.

description: Just answer one question.  What the hell is Latin American about mac and cheese?  This place suffers from an identity crisis.  Not to mention hot as hell too.  Food is OK.
author: Michael E.

description: Finally had a chance to eat here, and had a nice experience. The word of the evening was ceviche, ceviche, ceviche... Our ceviches (the cream based & classic one) were a perfect balance of tender seafood, coupled with the right hit of acid (citrus that is). It was perfect. I washed it down with a crisp glass of white. I have scheming plans to come back to Limon, just sit at the bar with a nice drink, noshing on ceviche. Otherwise, the dining room was loud -- not the best for a hot date, but if you're in a social mood, it's no bother. Must add service was great, with the right balance of attention.
author: Antoi C.

description: Went here for NYE. The only miss was waiting 20 mins for our table and that the women's and men's restroom had only one stall each. Other than that the food and staff were terrific. We enjoyed the crab bisque, tuna tartar, grilled marinated octopus, the mixed cerviche, the rib eye and the chocolate cake. Granted the portions were small, but you will get full. The other nice thing is that they had a small nye's party for all their employees and guests after dinner. So we were able to enjoy the nye count down as well as a little dancing afterwards.
author: Andrenaline R.

description: Hmmm...565 reviews and counting. That says a lot. I finally got to try Limon tonight with my siblings and...WOW. This is one of the most outstanding dinners I've ever had in the city. Not perfect (despite my rating), but pretty high up there. The Limon Ceviche is the best I've ever had, and I had to try the Foie Gras (also damn good) before this cruel dish gets banned. The main courses, a seafood rice dish and a seafood stew, plus a roast chicken with truffled mac n' cheese...good grief!!! Topped off with an excellent glass of sangria and the most decadent ever flourless chocolate cake called a Bandito. Great atmosphere and service as well. Highly recommended.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Solid four star experience.  Lots and lots of energy in the place from all the sangrias sloshing around in people's estomagos.  The lomo saltado is solid -- maybe not as good as Fresca's -- but, nothing to complain about.  Everyone working there is nice - from the greeter to the busboys.
author: Tim G.

description: I went to this place a while ago after a friend made a good recommendation.  The food was not bad, and the sangria was not bad either.  However, it wasn't good enough to make me return either.
author: Vivian H.

description: It's all sauced up!  I love the food, but fine diners might take rise that many of the dishes are still swimming... not in the ocean but in some kind of sauce.  However, for those of us who love salty, spicy, or sweet fatty concoctions adorning our meats, it isn't a problem.  I will say that some things should have been tested before being sent out.  The yucca pure was so salty that I think it gave me premature heart disease.  Padma would have definitely sent that stuff back.  The ahi tuna poke on the other hand was beyond my expectations.  The service could have used some help given that nothing came out in the order they said it would, and on several occasions they tried to bring us dishes that were meant to go to other tables.  However, all in all, I'd say it was a fun and tasty meal... but my experience didn't propel me to join the "Limon is one of the cities top restaurants" group.
author: Dubs W.

description:
hmmmm, the first time i went to limon, the food was just so-so....took me a few years to come back, but i'm glad i did.  the empanadas were very good.....maybe i'll double-order that next time.  i do want to try that fried chicken appetizer too.  yup, i'm not hugely into ceviche, so this review is probably lame...oh, well....

the snapper....really good...i didn't even mind it staring at my dinner companion, but she probably did....of course, when it was placed on the table, the tail was situated right in front of my face, just mocking me.  oh why, oh why, mr. red snapper, do you mock me?  nevertheless, i turned the plate and dug in.  the coconut rice was excellent as well.  my dining companion had the steak thing...that was good too, although i'm not entirely sold on soggy freedom fries unless there's fake cheez on it, but that's another story....
author: Miss P.

description: i like the ceviche, is great, it reminds me of  the north west of Peru, where they have the best fresh fish. I did not like the chicharron de pollo, it just wasn't what i expecteted, but i will totally recomend the ceviche. the service was friendly and great, i have a good time every time i go back.
author: Karen P.

description: The "causa de vegetales" was incredible. Beet/Potato mash topped with avocado and a different type of potato salad and celery greens. Totally delicious. My dining partners had the whole deep fried red snapper and it looked gorgeous. Our bottle of 2006 Malbec was great too.
author: Molly N.

description: I was invited to Limon by some prospective clients for my a company I help run. I was a tab bit hesitant on going here because I had never had Peruvian food before. Boy oh boy was I all wrong about this place. We walked in sat in a booth and discussed figures over lunch. I had this luscious steak over fries deal and it was delicious.  They have a great atmosphere and sweet martini's.... This place is worth a drive. This restaurant is NOT CLOSED!!
author: Carolina H.

description: Came here for lunch. Pretty meh. what saved it however, was the Best. Ceviche. Ever. Swooooooon.
author: Melanie D.

description: I want to make a note of saying that the service at Limon is second to none. A group of my friends got together on a Friday night for Thai and instead we would up walking over towards Limon and without reservations on a Friday night we got a table for 7 out of pure sympathy. The host created a table for us out of nowhere, and were immediately treated with prompt friendly service that executed our various orders perfectly despite the packed restaurant, no easy feat. The food was simply Delicious mouth watering and every eye full was tasty fresh and satisfying. The wine was very complimentary to both the meat and fish dishes. Unlike several places around the city where I spent good money on a meal, I remember how much I enjoyed a very special night with friends where everything was good and worth every penny.
author: crystal j.

description: We're Asians (you'll know why i had to include that!).  Our family of 4 enjoy eating out and trying different food .... it was our first time to try Peruvian food.... food was delicious and flavorful but not sure if this is what the authentic Peruvian food taste like as it seems to be more of a modern flair.  We had an annoying experience with the hostess (pretty, chubby with curly long hair).  We got there around 5:15p for an early dinner.  We were asked if we had reservations and we did not.  We were asked if the 4th person joining was just parking.  We told her he's on his way.  She responded that we had to wait.  The restaurant was practically empty at that time with only 3-4 tables occupied.  So that was annoying but that was not the worse part.  She finally decided to seat us but she seated us on the far end right beside the bathrooms.  I asked nicely if we could have one of the tables that were empty.  She answered abruptly that this was the best she can do for us and that she might need those empty tables to be combined for big groups later and walked away.  It took a good ten minutes before the waiter came.  By then, i was already annoyed and decided to leave.  One of the managers asked if everything was okay and i told him no and explained the seating problem.  The gentleman was kind enough and told us we can sit anywhere we want and we did.  Guess who the hostess seated on the table by the bathroom?.... a group of Chinese ladies.  Hopefully, it was just a coincidence.  In addition, by the time we left 2 hours later, the 2 other tables i had wanted to sit were never occupied.  I explained to my teenage kids that as a paying customer, it is our right and privilege to speak up.  And that if the place was super busy and that was the only table available and you really want to eat there, then we have the choice to take it or leave.  Management should have a talk with the hostess.  With that, i am only giving the place a 3 star.  But food and drinks are good.  Lengua was tops!
author: Gina U.

description: Very good food.  Been there a few times and never dissappoints.  If your in the mood for peruvian food, this is the place.  You wont regret it.
author: Richard E.

description: I had their $15 luncheon special which is amazing.  The quality of the food, portion size and service were all outstanding.  It seems a bit pricey for dinner, but what a great find for lunch.
author: Jeff R.

description: Let me just start off by saying this place is awesome! It has a good size menu packed with flavor. Definitely get some rotisserie chicken - worth it! I have to admit, I'm not the most adventurous person when it comes to food, and I probably would not normally have gone here by myself,  but I went with a group and am so glad I did. The food is loaded with taste. I'm also not a huge fish person, but the combination plate that included calamari was amazing. The service was prompt and the food is essentially already made, so you get it quick, It's also moderately priced I thought. It was about $80 for four people, and we ordered a lot of food! I love this place and can't wait to go back! Highly recommended.
author: Austin S.

description: The service was very good and fast, and food came out right away.  Seems like things were already made before the order, so food was a little lukewarm.  We ordered paella, empanadas and fries.  Wow, another overpriced restaurant in SF.  For $50, it barely fed one person.  We had to go get some pizza after leaving the restaurant.  It is a busy and happening restaurant, so I was disappointed in the food, qty, and cost.  We were literally in and out in less than 45 minutes.
author: N B.

description: I hadn't been to Limon in ages, and when my group of 3 were looking for an after-theater place for drink and late dinner last night, I was thrilled to find we could get in.  Our very friendly and helpful waiter rushed our order in before the kitchen closed.  We ordered various cold and hot small plates.  Maybe because of the rush, or because I had in my mind Limon's inventive combinations of earlier days and I didn't choose carefully, I was very disappointed in the food.  Everything was fresh, but all the hot dishes were fried and dry, with boring dipping sauces and goopy shredding cabbage and/or some grated carrots as the only vegetables.  Ceviche was fresh, but not a vegetable in sight - just rather large slices of fish.  The Peruvian salad was swimming in a goopy creamy sauce, and not at all refreshing as I had hoped.  I'm so disappointed, as the place has such great energy, full of people having a good time, but not so loud that you can't have a conversation.  I would love to see more interesting and plentiful use of vegetables and flavorful, less creamy sauces, and grilled preparations on the menu.  I'll come back if the menu changes!
author: Jil G.

description: I definitely recommend this place.  I went here after Best of the Bay rated it the Best Peruvian Restaurant in the city.  Not to be missed.  It was wonderful.  Be sure to make a reservation though.
author: Joanna S.

description: Words cannot describe.  Only thing I have to note that I was disappointed by was the fact that reservations were hard to come by, but you can always just show up and hope. That's what we did the last time and got lucky enough to eat in the front area.
author: Jolsna J.

description:
i went for dinner with a group of friends long ago. i remember the meal itself being surprisingly good and obviously...memorable. 
it was a great experience. everything we tried was top-notch, tasty, and well-executed. i just recently went back for lunch, and was not disappointed. you'd think that a restaurant that serves both lunch and dinner would eventually implode, but even the lunch was delicious and tenderly made. so glad to know it hasn't deteriorated or lost its mojo, as many restaurants do when they try to bite off more than they can chew.
author: jennifer y.

description: This was exceptional peruvian, the ceviche was nice and citrusy, the pork chop great and the empanadas tasty.  Service was good.  I would recommend going on a week night, the wait is not long and the service was more specific.  I didn't get the foie gras and scallops but will definitely do so next time.
author: Kim N.

description:
Wow! SO great!  Peruvian? Who knew?!  
Love the decor-- it's got that dark, industrial yet upscale and clean look that I am so into right now. I went the first time on a Monday night with a group of 8 (really fun, big, international group) with no reservation but waiting was fine because we sat at/near the bar and had a couple pitchers of Sangria, which was perfect.  Had the duck.  To die for. 
I just went back last night and had such a good repeat visit that I had to write a review.  Calamari, like none other.  Ceviche, cool and crisp just like you'd want it. The Latino Chicken was tender, moist, and the mushroom potatoes-- wow.  We also had a bottle of Malbec that was so good...I'm telling everyone they need to go here, it's my new favorite place to eat in the city. All of you reviewers that said you left are tripping, you need to come back, because the food was amazing-- definitely worth the wait!
author: rachel l.

description: I was very excited to try this place after all the wonderful things that I've heard, but I was a little disappointed.  The much talked-about ceviche was okay, not sublime as I had been lead to believe.  The service was great, especially since they put us in a corner table on the top floor (which was empty).  I had the snapper, which was yummy, although the curry dipping sauce could have had a little more flavor.  I'm not really sure what the ambience is really like since we were upstairs, but the downstairs seemed good.  I think I'll have to go back to try it again since everyone seems to think it's one of the best.
author: Christina S.

description: Fantastic! Highly recommended. I fell in love with the tomato-based sofrito adresso sauce; a bouillabaisse with red pepper, wine and tomato broth. Sometimes I still dream about it.
author: Morty P.

description: Ceviche Limon was awesome! Especially washed down with some cerveza. And their cream of mushroom soup was to die for! Only problem was that even though we didn't have resos on a Mon Night,  there were majorly free tables, but they made us sit at the stools with the short tables on the second floor? What up with that?? Go for the food, not the for hostessing service!
author: Kara L.

description: The food was very good - I order by the sides.. so the mashed potatoes had me at hello.   But what was stellar, was the service.  Everyone from the bartender to the hostess to the waitress were super friendly (not overly friendly or fake) - Excellent service.  I wouldn't bring the kids but this is a great place otherwise.
author: Rick L.

description: Another place I have been multiple times, and I can't believe I haven't written about it! Every time it has been excellent. From small dinners with just a friend or two, to large group parties they really do a great job! As everyone said...the sangria! I love that you can get a bunch of plates to share so everyone can try. This really is a great spot all around!
author: Lisa K.

description: Back when they were at their old location they'd serve you twice as much ceviche, but even now it's still good. If you're a fan of ceviche you have to try this place, but even if you're not the rest of the dishes are very tasty as well. Decor is clean but still warm and comfortable, and the service is great.
author: Hamid M.

description: Only tried a few Peruvian restaurants and so far, Limon tops them.  Their ceviche trio is very good.  Also great sangrias...on the sweet side, which is how I like it. 3.5 stars
author: Will I A m.

description: Ate at this spot on a busy Thursday night (reservations are a must btw).  I've been to Peru over a dozen times (mom was born there), so I'm pretty familiar with the delicious cuisine the country has to offer.  Limon did a real good job of replicating the cuisine.  Started off with the ceviche platter and had arroz con mariscos as my entree.  Both were outstanding, the arroz con mariscos in particular.  I just wish the portions were a little bigger.  It did takes us a long time to get our entrees.  The bar area is really small, so it's an ideal place to wait unless you can snag a chair.  Also, the place does not serve hard liquor so you can't experience the national cocktail, the pisco sour.  Good selection of peruvian beers though, which are really underrated.  Cusquena & Pilsen...mmmm.  Try one!
author: Mike I.

description: The red snapper (I had it taken out of the fish shell) with coconut rice was SOOOO good.  I had day dreams about it the next day.   The ceviches and sangria were excellent as well.   The ceviches had the perfect tanginess to it and the sangria doesn't have that red Kool-aid wine taste to it.  This is a good spot for a group or a date.  I really liked the modern and simple decor.
author: Peggy G.

description: Excellent Food... Excellent Sangria.... Excellent Service... but... it's freakin loud and hot upstairs!  Seriously, the Ribeye is fantastic and the ceviche is mouth watering good.  Everyone I've taken there has agreed, it really is good.  They just need to do something about the acoustics and the lack of air upstairs when they're busy.
author: Alex S.

description:
my sister and i went; she'd be before and had great things to say and i was pretty excited after reading the reviews here.

needless to say, it was one of the best dining experiences i've had in a long while...  

it's low key but a nice place...  jeans are a-ok.

the entire staff was super nice, and our meal service was as good as you'd expect from a really nice restaurant.  our table was swept after each course and all new dishware and untensils were given to us.

the food and drink were excellent:  the calamari was good (but not great), but the snapper ceviche and ribeye brought home the bacon.  all of this went incredibly well with our two pitchers of sangria (woot!).

i'm planning on going back as soon as i can.
author: shane k.

description: I really love this place.  They have fantastic ceviche.  They really go above and beyond with the service.  It's delicious.  Yum.
author: Melissa Y.

description:
went here last night with 4 friends.  we had no reservation, but the hostess was so nice and sat us 5 minutes later since there was a no show - score!

the bread and butter was so very good (especially in quenching my hunger from happy hour on an empty stomach).  I thought the cerviche was good too, but it was literally just shrimp or halibut -i prefer cerviche to have other things in it besides just the actual pieces of seafood.

the rib eye was perfect!  And it came with delicious sauce for dipping - so good!  so the service was great, the atmosphere was lively, and the food was pretty yummy.
author: Ali G.

description: Had dinner here with friends last week and it was amazing. The service was spot on, the food delicious and the sangria was some of the best I've ever had. I had the Churasco which was cooked and seasoned perfectly, my friend had the Lomo Saltado which was equally impressive but the dish that blew us away the most was the Limon ceviche. It was possibly the best I've ever had. My friend Carlos who is the chef on a TV show ( www.offshoreadventures.com ) makes the best I've ever had but this was a close second. Thank you Limon for being awesome.
author: Bill H.

description: The Picante de Mariscos is something to savor in this trendy, Latino fusion cuisine restarant. In fact, that particular dish, with its sweet and tangy sauce, is probably some of the best seafood I have tasted in a long time. Combine that amazing entree with a hip, modern ambiance, pleasant service, and outstanding appetizers of fois gras and "Calamares Fritos", and you got yourself a place that many can enjoy.
author: Steven S.

description: Sexy owners/hosts but they are secondary to the tasty sangria and awesome pork chop served over bacon and red cabbage. Welcoming interior  that can get quite loud. Wasn't overwhelmed by the lomo saltado (beef served over french fries with out of season tomatoes). The meat wasn't very tender (medium rare) served with a side of rice.  I will return for the scallop and foie appetizer, the pork chop and sangria.
author: Hannah K.

description: Yum yum yum!  My most recent visit was my second trip and I was still very pleased.  I wasn't as impressed with the Corvino ceviche I had this time as I was with the Aji Amarillo ceviche , but it was still quite good.  I highly recommend the sea bass appetizer with miso - it is excellent!  Seafood here is the specialty, come with an empty pescatarian belly!
author: Elaine U.

description:
I really wanted to give the re-opened Limon a good review. I enjoy the Limon on S. Van Ness because it is consistent and friendly.
We were seated upstairs and waited at least 15 minutes before a waiter approached us. Obviously, they don't have enough staff to provide service. Our food was brought to us approximately 10 minutes after the table that arrived  after us was served.  We ordered seviche, grilled octopus the quinoa salad and the steak. The best dish was the seviche. All the others were incredibly over salted and unremarkable. The octopus was 4 small pieces of  huge tentacles and was tender but not of the highest quality. Try the grilled Octopus at Kokkari if you want 
to enjoy top notch grilled octopus. I have to add that we love octopus and have grown up eating. 
Given that service was practically non existent we decided to skip dessert. 
All in all this was a very stressful experience for us. 
My suggestion to the owners is that they work on their over salting and 
their staff problem. Given their good location they will probably have no problem staying busy but in San Francisco this diner has many other positive restaurant choices. Good luck.
author: Jeffrey G.

description: surprisingly terrific brunch! let me just cut to the chase here. you must get: the empanadas (veggie or meat) and the truffled mac and cheese (best mac and cheese i have EVER had. honestly). the drinks are great. i can always go for a pitcher of their sangria or any of the mojitos. the actual brunch food (e.g., omelettes) was good but nothing special. stick with the peruvian dishes. no clue how authentic Limon is but god its delicious.
author: Ami V.

description: This restaurant has moved to a wonderfully chic modern and larger location right around the corner from the old location. It's on Valencia near the corner of 16th. The sangria is to die for and the ceviche is heavenly. The shrmip ceviche is enough to eat as a main course! Service is attentive and overall it is a very happy place to dine.
author: Monika S.

description: I wasnt impressed on my first visit to the old location, although the Ceviche was good.  But the new location has my vote.  We opted for appetizers only.  The ceviche Limon is awesome as is the Papa a la Huancaina and the Causa de Cangrejo y Camarones.  Great atmosphere, very hip Mission.
author: Christine E.

description: Everyone loves this place.  I loved the appetizer - a calamari tube, very tasty - but my meal, the Snapper, was just alright.  Maybe I'm just still high from the amazing fish I ate in Hawaii, but I was disappointed.
author: Ravi C.

description:
i came here for lunch, and it was PHENOMINAL!! i ordered a seafood chowder that was all sorts of creamy and delicious. can't wait to go back and try the dinner menu.

UPDATE 4/24/06
went back last night with a party of seven. the food was overly  salted (but still tasty), and the service was extreeeeeemeeely sloooooow. i don't know what happened?? minus a star for crappy service. bad, waiter! (although shatangi seemed to be quite fond of him....)
author: eve l.

description: My first introduction to Peruvian food...and it was awesome. The ceviche was delicious and the service was great.  Most memorable...the sangria
author: Karin C.

description: Como se dice "Slamming"?  Limon is my FAVORITE restaurant these days.  Great energy/ambiance, fabulous food and a legion of handsome Latino men pouring sangria and serving me dinner...how could I not love it?  The ceviche is outstanding, probably the best in SF.  No matter how busy this place gets, the service is impeccable which is great as it is always packed.  Fabulous place for a dinner date as long as you requests a quiet corner (it's pretty loud in there.)  I also admire the fact that their kitchen is visible, spotless and very organized...brownie points as I have worked in a couple of less than stellar commercial kitchens myself.  Go...go as soon as you can (but make reservations unless you are willing to wait around awhile.)
author: Cynthia B.

description: I was pleasantly surprised with this hip Mission restaurant.  Normally I'm not a huge fan of ceviche but ceviche I had here was delicious.  I had the Lomo Saltado for an entree, it was very tender and it was very flavorful.  The Sangria was probably the best Sangria, I had ever had.
author: Brent G.

description: This used to be one of my favorite places when it was in it's old location in that tiny tiny tiny space!  I was so happy to see them do well and get a bigger place, but now I pay the price with it being so popular.  It doesn't feel as special when I go there anymore because everyone and their brother is in there.  I guess it is like watching your kid grow up, eventually they spite you, even though you still love them.  The food is still consistantly good, and the space has some personality to it with the multiple levels and the big front bar.
author: Pele N.

description:
the seviches are pretty good but quite pricey.  i did not like the mushroom soup.  i wasn't crazy about the cooked dishes i ordered - scallop and this mushroom plate and some other dish i cant recall.

the sangria was good, too bad they only serve red but not white.   ii would just stick w/ the raw dishes - seviches and this mussel dish.  another friend who went recommended their lobster bisque and their chocolate cake.
author: Dorothy L.

description: Egh. The food is decent enough, but the haughty hostess and long wait make it a rough experience. I honestly liked the restaurant better when it was in its old location- it was much more intimate and real.  Now, I feel like I'm in LA.....If you do go, get the Lomo Saltado, it's good. Although, we've managed to make a mean version of this at home too.
author: Dana K.

description: Any place that makes you wait 1 hour for your reservation should never be patronized again, in my opinion. I can't bring myself to give only 1 star because the ceviche (and other menu items) are quite good. But still, there are plenty of good Peruvian restaurants that aren't nearly as fancy (or expensive) in the Mish-- Mi Lindo Peru comes to mind. You could also do Fresca (which has gotten poor reviews for service in Yelp, but I've always had a fine time there). So back to the hour wait... screw that! That's just a straight up logistical error, if you ask me. They need to re-evaluate how long people take for their meals... Do people linger? Build time in for that. I don't run a restaurant, but I could certainly figure it out after being open for a few years now.
author: Ann F.

description: Peruvian restaurants  keep on popping up and I'm glad this one did.  It smokes Fresca all the way in the whole dining experience.
author: Food F.

description: Very good food. Loved the kitchen theatrics! Totally recommended!
author: Simon S.

description:
The ceviche appetizer was great.  It seems to be their specialty.  There's about 8 different ceviches, including some with cream sauces which I'd never seen before.  Yummy.  If you have 3-4 people, get the ceviche sampler.

It was not authentic Peruvian.  Not that it claims to be, but it does say it's a Peruvian restaurant.  Having had authentic Peruvian in Peru, I have to say Limon is better, but I would have liked to have seen guinea pig on the menu.  The one downside, it's a little overpriced.
author: Jennifer M.

description: Really Yummy!  The sangria is soo delicious.  And the lomo Saltado was even more satisfying.  The presentation of some of the dishes like the red snapper was cool.  I was also impressed with our service.  The only thing I did not like was how close all the tables were put together.  You could hear other people's conversation easily and vice verse.  And there was only four beers on their menu (but good wine selection).  I look forward to going back so I can drink more of their sangria and try more tantalizing treats on the menu.
author: Micaela M.

description: Came here by chance. My friend and I were planning to get some burritos across the street, when I wanted to check out this place.  Went in to check the menu and decided to eat here. Got seat upstairs and order a some friut drinks which were pretty good. My friend had the berry corn and I had the passion fruit, both refreshing. For dinner, we had the ceviche(forgot which one) and the crispy red snapper. Both very good taste. The ceviche excellent! The snapper a little salty, but still very appetitizing. The service very prompt and nice. We sat upstairs, and a party of ladies came in and was heck of loud. All very pretty, but incredible loud, the manager or owner apologize for their loudness. This place is pricey however, but I would come back.
author: Leon C.

description: This place is quite the eclectic place to go if you like to try SF's different fusions.  When we visited, the ambience was one of a classy-mature vibe, yet casual.  There aren't too many veg options, but I tried the truffled mac n cheese, and had the restaurant's daily special of risotto with shrooms and some other ingredients.  Both were heavily buttered, but yummy.  We also shared this red tinged drink (don't remember what it was called, but it had a pomegranate base) from Chile, which was superb!
author: Megha S.

description: I don't care what people say, I like Limon!  I have tried the ceviche here, and found it to be delicious.  Also, I really enjoyed the paella.  The sangria is addicting to say the least.  Last time I was there I ordered roasted chicken and that was quite tasty.  Maybe it's that every time I leave Limon I'm intoxicated... but I always have fond memories of this place.
author: Sarah F.

description: I was here last weekend 4/4. The services is good the sangria is great. The main entrees -- pork chops and steak were excellent. The service was ok. I would not say great and I would not go back again to order it. Everything else was good.
author: Kimberly C.

description: So, I went to Peru last year, and was not at all a fan of the food.  Then, when I moved to San Francisco, people kept trying to convince me to try these Peruvian restaurants.  Of the ones I've been to, all of which I've loved, Limon is my favorite.  I've never had a dish that wasn't absolutely divine, and the atmosphere is fun and lively.  The staff has always been  helpful and accommodating.  It's one of my go-to spots when I have guests in town and want to take them for a great meal and fun drinks, though I don't know how authentically Peruvian the food is.
author: Cindy M.

description: We went with my two friends as they are bolivian and love this place. They tried hard to be nice to the waiter speaking Spanish with him, but he was still so grumpy. He took the plate while my friend was eating his food, literally holding his fork on it. The ceviche was good and everything else we tried (sweet potato fries, some chicken dishes) were "OK". BUT the service was just horrible.
author: Liza A.

description: Really, really unimpressed.  We had a 5:30 reservation on a Tuesday, and although the restaurant was almost entirely empty they made us wait until the entire party was present before being seated.  The hostess was nothing short of surly.  When seated, the waiter was gruff and unfriendly.  A truly humorless, unfriendly staff all around (with the exception of the bartender, who was just your run-of-the-mill unfriendly for an SF bartender).  The food was average & unmemorable.  The entire experience was unsatisfying and overpriced.  With so many options in the neighborhood, there is absolutely no reason to go back to Limon.
author: Patricia F.

description: While a great place for dinner, the customer service associated with their care of special requests was far from adequate. More specifically,  after numerous efforts to make arrangements for payment for dinner for a business associate that was visiting from out of town (I e-mailed first and got no response, I finally called and gave them my amex. information and was told that it was taken care of. NOT!!) My colleague showed up for dinner with his wife and was charged after the clear assurance that everything was taken care of. I then called to speak to someone about it and was assured that a manager would telephone me to discuss the problem. Another no-go! Sorry Limon, I nor my associates will be returning!
author: Lance P.

description: gotta have the Yuca delishhhhhhhhhhhh I ordered like 2 of them
author: Dhwipa P.

description: sangria was too sweet and everything we ate was salty, except for the bottled wine of course... the service was mediocre.  a friend had ask for butter 3 times before she got it, twice for another napkin.  the place felt very crowded - but the place had a clean, newer restroom which is harder to find in the city.  if i had a choice, i'd rather spend my money somewhere else.......
author: k y.

description: Great place to go with friends or on date. The food is very good but somewhat pricey. I would recommend sharing since the appetizers adn ceviches are large. They have a  great wine list and awesome sangria
author: Michelle M.

description: This is easily one of my favorite restaurants in the city. I usually end up sitting at the bar or upstairs. Not quite a fan of the upstairs, but it'll do. The sangria goes down fast, so beware! The wine list is strong too. I usually get one of two entrees--the ceviche (any of them) b/c I like the super-sized corn kernels. I'm also a big fan of the pollo saltado--sauteed chicken breast with onions and peppers and fries over rice. So good. The decor is modern and clean, and the servers are right on!
author: sarah s.

description: Great food, great ambience HOWEVER for such a busy place only 1 loo.  Spent 15 minutes lining for the toilet wasn't really how I planned on spending the night!
author: JBO ..

description: SInce 'The Mission' is  one of  the "it" places to eat/ go out please remember to make a reservation for this Peruvian restaurant. I went on a Tuesday night around 7 and had no problem getting a table, but most are not as lucky.  The food was tasty and the drinks were good! Do not come here if you are starving and skipped lunch as the the plates are often more decoration than heaping full o' food.My husband was bitter about this! Love the warm decor and the ambiance. Definitely a place to take out of town guests or your posh friends.
author: Stephany M.

description: Love this place, great wine, fried calamari and ceviches! Its a great date place! Some of the tables are little cramped but taking in the atmosphere and the food flying out of the open kitchen can make you forget that!
author: Megan B.

description: Limon definitely has good food and a spirit lifting decor. Its citrus colored walls are paired perfectly with its lemon and lime infused specialties. Although not the best ceviche I have ever had, their ceviche de camarones is tasty and refreshing. Pair that with their yummy sangria and Lomo Saltodo and you'll be a happy camper. Definitely worth it for the Sangria alone!
author: Sugey G.

description:
I came here to celebrate a friend's b-day about a week ago. This place was a little less than I expected, with all the crave about this place on yelp. 

The food was a more on the sour side for my taste buds, but I can not complain about the foie gras over a seared scallop. One of the best I tasted in the city. 

The service could of been better, our waiter was unattentive all night. We did not receive out bread, until our apettizer came out. (I was starving) Our waiter did not check on us about the food, and only came by to drop off the check. We also waited 30 mins after we finsihed our appetizers before our entrees came out.

The food was great, but service could of been better.
author: Gin L.

description:
Truly amazing. The sangria and Ceviche are to die for. The empanadas were delightful and Pollo Solatado good. Service is fairly good for such a busy place. The desserts were excellent as well. 

Another place I will most probably visit again soon.
author: Arun R.

description: My new favorite.  Check out the red snapper and truffled mac and cheese.  They say it is loud later in the evening but I am an early dinner.
author: Forrest G.

description: While I am not a huge fan of their style of  "ceviche", I love everything else about this restaurant. The ambiance is fun but classy. The wait staff is friendly and knowledgeable. The sangria is simple, but delicious. And the food is full of tremendous flavors. I've yet to have a single bad dish at Limon. If you've never been here before the one ABSOLUTE MUST on the menu is the White Truffle Macaroni & Cheese. Trust me...
author: Michael K.

description:
What is all the hype about??? I went to Limon with my friend's recommendation that this place is better than Fresca! So I went there for a friend's birthday.... Boy that was disappointing! We had a table right smack in the middle of the first level- with the open kitchen behind us and waiters and people walking around our table. I had to yell to to talk to the person across the table from me (I really had a sore throat the next morning).
The appetizers were good- I had the salad and my fiance had the ceviche which was so yummy in the lime marinade. But that was about it- the sangria was too sweet, the empandas were tiny and main course (lomo salta- spelling??) was just ok. the wait staff was pretty nice though.
I think that I am a little hard on this place because there was too much hype and I was let down. 
at those prices- I don't think that I would give it another chance.
author: Ofelia S.

description: This place was amazing.  We took friends there last week, and had a great time.  While I think it was a little pricey and the wine list might have been a little lacking, the food was great - both creative and flavorful.  All the fish dishes were fantastic!!!!  They had a kinda goofy corkage fee that limits corkage to two bottles but the food makes it overlookable .... overal well worth it.
author: WW R.

description: Food was pretty good, but maybe I was just that hungry. Seriously, our meal took about 3 hours and about 3 trips to feed the parking meter until our meals were finally served. Granted we did have a party of about 20, but we were the only people there.
author: Brian L.

description: I went to this restaurant for a birthday with a group of people.  We had Tartar, ceviche, empanada. The empanada was OK. The best place for that is actually in LA, Bolivian empanada. Yummy!!! The ceviche was good, fresh. I ordered what I would always order at a Peruvian restaurant and that is Lomo Saltaldo. It was salty the sauce, could not eat it. The fried fish was real good. the best Lomo Saltado was on Geneva, they closed down but they had the best food. I will go back there but not any time soon.
author: Ge I.

description: Please note that I went to Limon for drinks and did not eat there. Regardless, the cocktails were good and reasonable priced. The mojito was flavorful and had a reasonable alcohol content; if I could point to a flaw, it would be that the lime was a bit overpowering. Also, the service was excellent. I would certainly consider returning here.
author: Arun J.

description: This had been a favorite restaurant when I came to San Francisco. Something has changed significantly. The menu is reduced. The fine presentation is non existent, the drinks are watered down, and the flavors are pedestrian. What happened?
author: Mary Catherine K.

description: We went to Limon against our will, I warned our friends that this was a place that DO NOT HONOR RESERVATION, NO EVEN FROM OPEN TABLE, well was no surprise that they didn't  after 40 minutes waiting at the door, the hostess showed us to our table, no apology, no nothing...  We tried to talk to the manager but our server told us that they had no manager, we asked for the chef and he said that he was very bussy and  did not have the time to talked to us by the way he referred  to him as Alex and he did not speak english.       We order some ceviche and let me tell you my friends, IT IS NOT RED SNAPPER, maybe some basa fish from restaurant depot but for sure not red snapper.....  The Ceviche was super salty, fish was soggy, when we asked the server about it was not red snapper, he responded that the owners just recently got a full liquor lic, and they needed to make up for the expense   What????? He just smiled and simply asked us if we were ready for the check because they needed the table, I will never go back there again and I will tell my experience to all my friends...  As a courtesy of all of you my Yelp fellow friends, Don't let this kind of  improvised restaurants surprise you... Demand they honor their menu, and demand good service at all times, after all we are paying the bill and remember Tips are earned after excellent,25% good20%, fair15% or bad service $1
author: Lorena G.

description: My friend took me out to dinner here and we splurged and got everything we wanted and then some.  Everything was so delicious from our appetizers to the deserts we ordered, everything was just perfect.
author: Amber R.

description: Ceviche was the best thing on the menu.  Churrasco was perfection.  Many of the appetizers were lackluster though.  The waitstaff was friendly and knowlegable, but they were shadow training the night I went, which was a bit distracting.  Seating upstairs is loud, and smoky, but overall the atmosphere was fine.
author: Teresa H.

description: I really had the best time here on Wed. night. Hubby and I were celebrating our two year anniversary and we canceled dinner reservations elsewhere because we were craving the seafood at Limon.  AND we love the bar and the sangria (?I think that was sangria...a little love in a glass? Yummmm.) We hung out at the bar for, uh, three rounds? before we opted for a table to commence the eating of the chow. Our server was awesome...totally putting up with our silliness. We shared everything and had a wonderful time. It always feels like it is a sure thing when I go to Limon. Love it.
author: Kris K.

description:
two friends and i had a lovely dinner here on a recent sunday.  it was a ladies'  only evening and those of who are married left our husbands at home to fend for themselves (well sort of - i brought something back for my man - more later).  we started out with a pitcher of sangria - it was very yummy.  my "i'm cutting down on alcohol consumption to lose weight" plan was quickly abandoned.  we also shared the house ceviche and chicarron of chicken.  both very good.  for our main courses, we had the lomo saltodo, chicken breast and rib-eye.  all were very good, though my favorite part of my meal (the chicken) was the truffled mac and cheese.  decadent and delicious.  the tres leches cake was also very good for dessert.

all in all, an excellent meal and very good service.  i would give the food 5 stars but the prices were a little steep  in my opinion and so i have to knock off a star.  

oh, and i brought home the arroz con mariscos for my husband which he proceeded to devour in a matter of minutes.  it smelled heavenly and my man gave his stamp of approval.  i do plan to go back for another meal - this time with my husband - to sample some of the other ceviches and have more sangria.
author: Jeannie L.

description:
Went on a Friday at around 6:00pm.  Decor of restaurant was upscale modern, but with a very warm feel to it.  Great vibe.  Waiters were very polite and attentive.  

Waiter recommended the ceviche platter, which consisted of 4 different types of ceviche, which we enjoyed greatly.  Especially the halibut ceviche limon, which was top notch.

Next, we had the sauteed scallops were topped with foie gras.  Scallops were cooked perfectly and the foie gras added a nice deep, rich, buttery flavor that did not  overwhelming the flavor of the scallops.  

We then split a pan roasted chicken breast with a side of truffled macaroni and cheese.  The chicken was flavorful, moist, and seasoned very nicely, but ultimately forgettable.  However, what really made the dish memorable was the truffled mac and cheese which was absolutely fantastic.  The flavor of the truffles added a richness and depth that I have never experienced in a mac and cheese;  we devoured it completely, then used the side of bread to mop up the sauce afterwards.

Limon is a great restaurant, that I would definitely go to again, if I were in a mood for ceviche or a nice sangria.  I enjoyed it a lot.
author: Shaun O.

description:
Three because it's good food. Would I go there again? Only to try the ceviche, which I've heard is good. While their food was good, something was lacking that I can't put my finger on.

Noise: Loud. We sat upstairs, because they said it was quieter, butit was still loud, so I don't want to imagine what it was like downstairs. The tables, while modern, cool, and made of wood, are too deep, so my friends and I were leaning uncomfortable over it to try and hear each other talk.

Service: Good, but not super fast. Our dinner lasted 2.5 hours. Now don't get me wrong, I love long dinners, but I feel a place like Limon shouldn't take that long.

Food: Fairly good. Nothing amazing (that I would go back for). For an appetizer we shared the calamari. It's OK... it smelled too much like sea food, and they over-used a spice making it overpowering. For a main course I got the Lomo Saltodo... Top Sirloin. It's good and the sauce is great, but there's not enough steak. It's mixed w/ fries, onions and tomatoes and served with a huge side of rice (which I think was unnecessary b/c of the fries). My friends got Picante de Mariscos and the Parihuela, both were a seafood melody, both very good. Sauces were great. For dessert we got the flourless chocolate cake and tres leches. Both great, although the tres leches isn't super traditional b/c the cake is a little more dense than usual.
author: Sarah K.

description: The food was certainly tasty here, but in light of the price, we felt that it could have been so much more.  I forget the exact name of the dish I ordered, but it was a seafood dish with peruvian sauce which was very very good.  Also, the dip that accompanies the bread they first bring out is very addictive.  But for a $60 dinner for two (without any wine or drinks), my husband and I expected to be a little more impressed.
author: Christine L.

description: Excellent food, great wine and impecable service. I was even walked to the ladies room to make sure I would find it okay and when I came back my napkin was folded and placed off the side for me. First time I was asked what type of wine we were feeling like,  for ex: bold, medium bodied, etc. Definetly worth going to. For a starter try the trio of ceviches (Especially the Ceviche Rocotto). For the main, the Pork is to die for.
author: Lori O.

description:
This is definitely the best Peruvian/Nuevo Latino restaurant in the Bay Area.  I have been going to Limon, since they first opened on 17th.  I have yet to have a less than great dining experience.  

My favorites are the ceviches, Lomo Saltado, Churrasco, empanadas, chicharron depollo, and Pollo Latino.  They have a great wine selection and their sangria is great.

The service is good.
author: C B.

description: My favorite Latin american restaurant in SF. Can be a bit loud, but who cares. The food is great. My favorites - the chicken and steak dishes. Loved the calamari and baby octopus.
author: Jay S.

description: This place has a fun and upbeat feel to it.  Some of the dishes are superb, like the melt-in-your-mouth seabass appetizer.  The ceviche was quite like the real thing from Peru with crisp onions and corn kernals the size of a thumb tip..but the shrimp was questionable smelling and tasting...wasn't sure I should eat it.  The red snapper was all fried up,  and served whole with two tasty sauces.  We had a nice Spanish wine with a blank finish that you don't see on many menus here.  The flourless chocolate cake with gooey senter and spiced ice cream was incredible.  The atmo was totally Valencia street.  Our waiter was a big cutie pie too!
author: Laura C.

description: think this place burned and it's closed, cerrado. Enjoy the fire insurance benefits.
author: Tony A.

description: This trendy place isn't good for large groups. The food was very tasty and flavorful, however portions are small. The service also sucks when you are in a large group. A few of us got our food AFTER almost everyone else had finished eating. (I think it was the wait staff that caused this problem) Staff also kept saying that our food would come out shortly, but that obviously wasn't the case. I think if you go as a couple or group of 4,  you should be ok.
author: Danny Y.

description: Limon has really good food, on the other hand they need to work on their service. Our reservations were at 8pm and we were not seated until half an hour later, and that was because we pushed the unfriendly hostess for our table. Waitress had a bad attitude, she forgot one of our entrees, and she had the nerve to argue with us. We spoke to the manager, and he was not very nice either. I'm very disappointed, they ruined my birthday dinner, and most of the people in my party were very unhappy with their service....
author: Claudia R.

description: Whoa that was a good dinner.  We shared a bunch of tapas and sangria.  The sangria was perfect with nice little bite sized pieces of fruit.  The stars of the show were the veggie empanadas, truffle mac n cheese and the broth our mussels were swimming in....I literally started scooping up the broth with the empty shells.  Service was great especially for a party of six.  Great place, glad we finally checked it out!
author: Lori S.

description: I love the food here - well the non-seafood, which I am sure makes no sense to most based on the menu...but the other dishes are wonderful.  They are full of flavor and are very simple.  I never see this place as a scene - I like to go earlier than later and that may be why I miss that...or maybe I am just missing something.  The service is also very good - attentive but not overwhelming.
author: Deanna H.

description:
some of the best sangria i've ever had.  the ceviche is unbelievable.  in fact, everything i've had at limon has been outstanding.

don't go with old people who hate noisy restaurants.  limon is loud.

it's also pricey.
author: Eric L.

description: Booked a Friday evening reservation and was seated immediately on the mezzanine.  Although the place is very cramped and noisy it's welcoming!  I was pleased with both the food and service.  We ordered the Top Sirloin Slices w/fries and the Arroz con Mariscos.  The steak was tender with a well balanced sauce that wasn't too salty.  I wasn't a big fan of the Arroz con Mariscos because it was a little too fishy for me.  Other than that I had a great time!
author: chris c.

description:
The Sangria and ceviche are second to none in the city.  Period.  DEFINITELY get reservations and plan for a designated driver (that stuff sneaks up on ya).  The rest of the food is quite good, a little variable, and can be a little expensive for the quality depending on the aforementioned variability.  The variability/price combo is the reason for no 5th star.  

It is small, and I actually don't recommend for parties of larger than 4 unless you make sure to go off peak hours.  They will slam you with the "your whole party has to be here" schtick, which I never understand (don't you want the $$ from the first folks slurping Sangria 'til their bud shows up?).  The "scene"-ness of it is not as bad as some places in, say, the Marina.  I am not a "scene" kinda guy, and I'm totally comfortable here.   And the ceviche and sangria will NEVER disappoint!
author: Chris W.

description: This place is loud as hell inside.  which i don't really mind.  the food is f-in delicious.  looking forward to going back there.  love the Peruvian beer as well.  although that's not saying much.  I'm easily swayed by suds.  The red snapper made my tummy smile huge.
author: jefferson h.

description: Excellent sangria is always a good start.  We loved the calamari, and the ceviche was delicious.  The lomo saltado was very good, but not truly any better than at Destino or other great places around town.  The pork chop was incredible.  Definitely try the mac and cheese (although it is clearly not Peruvian).
author: E M.

description: i went there one night, late, to get dessert with gf and i got nicely surprised.  Peruvian food is not the finest food around but lots of effort is put into the dishes and make it for a good experience.  so a few weeks after when i was looking for a restaurant worth bringing my date, i went back for it!  i wouldn't order the ceviche anymore, i could still taste it the day after.  The main dishes were good but gargantuesc, so dessert would have been kinda over the top at that point, but then the bartender hooked us up with some freshly made sangria, yummy, which we used to time ourselves down.  Part of the restaurant's charm is that it is in the heart of the Mission, so it's easy to go out after.
author: Damien J.

description: Great food. Ceriche is awesome.  Was there on a friday ight (4-4-08) and parking was difficult (no valet).  Had to park like 6 blocks away on 21st in a parking garage ($5, not bad).  Even the parking garage was overfull.  Restaurant is crowded, but very nice inside.  This is a restaurant to remember.
author: steve t.

description: We sat at a little tiny table that didn't really fit our tapas dishes very well. The service wasn't the timeliest, but the food was fantastic! My taste buds were delighted to have such wonderful tasting food. The ceviche and the cream of asparagus soup were scrumptious. I hope this place hasn't closed I still want to go back for more.
author: Mary D.

description: My favorite restaurant!  Make sure you try the ceviche - it is the best that I have tried.  Top notch restaurant.  I am a definite foodie - try it!
author: Will S.

description:
first of all, parking is pain in the ass....took me 30min to find a parking spot.

second of all, if you have question about the menu, always talk to waittress and/or manager because some waiter, bus boy and food server on that night doesn't understand english.....I had to point them to my neighbor foods.  

and last-is a little crowded but its totally worth it.  Love the chicken and tuna, the fries and beef.  They taste so good, soft and tender.  The price is reasonable.

I enjoy here more than cha cha.
author: food lover t.

description: Limon used to be one of my favorites but since they reopened it seems quite different, as if they are trying just a bit too hard.  The prices are higher and the menu has changed, eliminating what used to be my favorite dishes (the marisco plates).  Prices are higher and although the sashimi selection I tried was fresh and had good flavors, I wouldn't return as there are so many better Peruvian venues out there--Destino, La Mar, etc.  I still like the Rotisserie though.
author: David T.

description: Food at this place is top notch.  The service, notably of management, is the extreme opposite.  Having recently reopened after a fire that put them out of commission for a while, the kitchen experienced an issue that leads me to believe they haven't solved all their issues.  Our birthday dinner in the mezzanine was interrupted by heat and smoke wafting up from the kitchen while the restaurant encountered electrical issues.  We wrapped up our meal as quickly as possible and when seeking some compensation for the incredibly uncomfortable dinner.  The most the manager was willing to do was comp us one round of drinks.  I've had complimentary round because my appetizer was tardy...I expect much more for having literally been smoked out of a restaurant.  They gave me no incentive to return under "normal" conditions and every incentive to steer myself and others away.  Get your Peruvian fix elsewhere....
author: Kris H.

description: Nice place, but it was not for me.  I love Peruvian food and decided to try this restaurant.   It was crowded and very noisy inside.  We had to shout each other to have a conversation.   Food was not bad, but my side dish --- Mac'n'Cheese was too oily to eat and made me sick later.
author: K K.

description:
Limon is a lively restaurant on the weekends perhaps too busy.  I went with 3 others and was seated next to a walk way between our table and the bar.   We had a hard time enjoying our table conversation because we were literally sitting down in a heard of people getting beverages at the bar and waiting for tables.  Not a bad view really when I had a chance to turn around now that I think about it.  Perhaps they could use a little more control / authority at the door to keep the main floor open?

 The big shock  came when the waiter wouldn't accept our order unless we ordered everything at once.  My GF was very disappointed as we were really looking forward to eating at here.  Waiter (bouncer ?) guy informed us that Limon did not allow patrons to order in courses or a few dishes at a time.  We pushed back on this rule quite hard; however, he was adamant that Limon's policy was that we'd have to order (tapas!) all at once.   Of course, in informing the table about the policy the waiter was unapologetic, caustic, and snooty.  WTF.  Why not just tell us how quickly we need to wolf down our grub before you're going to take our plates?  Why even bring food to the table when you can charge by the song like a strip club?  Anyway, after this terse exchange it didn't really matter much what came out of the kitchen because apparently we weren't having a meal.  What we were waving was a seat in a meat market bar that serves good looking snacks.  May be that is what we should call this place?  "Snacks"  I'll have to go back sometime and sit there with a bag of Cheetos.
author: Thomas D.

description: Had dinner on a Monday night and walked right in, sweet.  Service and food were good.  Nice flavors, portions a bit small.  Good wines.  I'll return.
author: chris a.

description:
While visiting our daughter over the Christmas holiday we ended up at Limon for lunch one day.  Like too many places in San Francisco the parking is terrible, although there is a pay lot a block away .

First off the place was cold.  Everyone was wearing their coats.  Is management so oblivious to their clientle, or is it just a lack of caring.  I'm going with they know it's uncomfortable and they don't care.  They could place a door at the sidewalk to make an airlock, which they said they plan to do, but since they've been there several years what's stopping them from getting on with it?

Now the really bad news.  We watched several people come in, order, and eat while we  were waiting for our lunch.  Some even eating the same things we ordered.  The host noticed this, as did the waiter.  Both said that they'd take care of the problem.  Minutes, promised by the host, turned into another 20-30 minutes. 

I can understand that if you eat out regularly that your order is going to get lost.  What I can't understand is why they can't take care of it in the bill.  Their response was to give us deserts we said we didn't want, which included ice cream which they knew my wife couldn't eat.

The food was good but not worth waiting, in the cold, for close to an hour.  After all, the frozen lamb shanks we get at Costco are pretty much the same thing that I ordered.
author: Randy G.

description: I used to love this place back when it was on 17th where mavericks is now.  Weh they moved up the street they were movin on up.  I went once and was a bit disapointed but thenm returned for lucnch not too long ago and had a delicioius meal.  I know liquor licenses are hard to come by but at a peruvian restaruant I want a pisco sour.  Fesca's got em.
author: James S.

description:
I can't say enough about the Picante de Mariscos.  It is delicious!!!   I couldn't stop eating it.  It's a mixed seafood dish in a orange colored cream sauce.  The sauce was amazing!  (I wonder how much butter was in it...)  I ate a ton of bread so that I could dip it in the sauce.

We also ate the Ceviche Limon, and the Pargo Rojo (crispy whole red snapper), which were both good...but I still liked the Picante de Mariscos the best.  The crisy whole fish was impressive to look at, but the fish pieces weren't as crispy as we would have liked.  They used to use monk fish instead, and that was much better.

The atmosphere is nice, and it can get pretty crowded in the small bar area.  Even though it was busy, the service was exceptional.  Our water glasses were always filled.  Our table crumbs were cleared off after each course.  When we went to the bathroom and left our napkins on the chair, someone would always come around and fold it properly and place it on the table.  Our waiter was very attentive.  I would definitely come back again.
author: Howard-Daisy L.

description: Excellent food and great service. The cerviche was on par with the best I had in Lima
author: Lee R.

description: We arrived 15 minutes early for our reservation and were met with a 40 minutes wait.  No apology, no comp'ed drinks nor reparations, nada.  Very, very lame.  The hostess casually shrugged and indicated this was pretty typical.  What's the point of a frickin' reservation then?  The food was fine but not worth the hassle.  The servers didn't do anything particularly wrong but weren't all that sharp nor friendly, just seemed to be in a hurry.  The food's presentation was probably the best part, and I can get that elsewhere.
author: YrMama Y.

description: Food is good but I would have liked a couple more empanadas.  The red snapper and ribeye steak were delicious.  The atmosphere was a little too foofy though and the prices were a little on the high side for what you got.  The street was also under construction while we were there so it was tough to get to.
author: Jason M.

description: Had a very nice dinner for 5 at Limon last weekend.  It's a nice space, our server was super nice, and she was very helpful with menu suggestions.  The sangria was a tasty start.  Off the ceviche menu, the Ceviche de Camarones and Tiradito de Atun were both great.  On the apps menu, the Empanadas de Carne was good.  For entrees, the Seco de Cordero was great if you like lamb, the Pargo Rojo was good if you prefer fish, and the Lomo Saltado was pretty good if you like beef.  I enjoyed Limon and would go back.
author: Scott C.

description: was small portion tapas style good  for lunch...be back again for some vino and other tapas...had the ceviche,lomo and ribs..yum!
author: cecille p.

description: came here for brunch...food was very flavorful...loved the lomo saltado...and the sorbet trio was definitely a treat! could use bottomless mimosas...but maybe that's just my alcoholism talking...
author: Sancho P.

description: I'm so impressed with this place.  My brother/wife and I came in a "hurry."  We were running late for a show at the Red Poppy House and found this place on Yelp based on its close location.  I groaned as I walked in and the entire place looked packed (we didn't have reservations).  To my surprise - the hostess asked us to come in right away for seating - We went to the downstairs which I found cozy and intimate and more quiet.  We ordered and it came in like 5 minutes - just what we need when rushing.  To make the place even more perfect the tri tips/chicken soup and cerviche was great!! The waiters were also phenomenal and efficient.  My only regret was not having time to eat and enjoy the dinner at a more leisurely pace.  Kudos - I am definitely coming again to this gem I found in the Mission.
author: Booboo S.

description: Deciding that we were too hungry to continue waiting for the continuous Carnival procession to pass by, we headed down Valencia to find a restaurant.  After a losing battle to find a table at the Taqueria, we came upon Limon. Tobias had a welcoming smile and was great at making suggestions for the best dishes to share. We began with the Calamares Fritos, the Empanadas, and Ceviche Limon for appetizers and went on to the Vegetable Risotto and Arroz Mariscos. Seafood is a good tester when trying out a new restaurant, and they passed with flying colors. The Calamares were tender & light without being greasy. The Ceviche is one of the most unique I've ever had, making my taste buds zing with fresh halibut, mixed seafood marinated in lime juice, and served with yam, Peruvian corn and mussels in a salsa criolla. The vegetable Risotto special of the day was my favorite of all. It was topped with a Sage cream that tied all of the flavors together. If this wasn't enough, we shared a Tres Leches for dessert. The presentation was matched by the taste. Convenient location near the 16th Street BART station, so what's your excuse for not coming here yet?
author: Arlene C.

description:
I have been in the city for most of my life, (unlike some of the people that yelp about the fine restaurant industry of this city) and I have to be honest about something: Peruvian Cuisine in this city has a name,and it is Limon.
You don't think so? Well I was there on saturday 4th, the place was packed! Servers and managers dutifully running left and right, up and down, trying to accommodate demanding customers (my friends and I included).
The day was warm enough so we started with cocktails and ceviche (sorry, Peruvian beer doesn't do much for us) and we were impressed with the quality and boldness of the flavors. The Tuna Nikkei and Shrimp ceviches are the bomb!
One of my friends at the party (Peruvian born) often criticizes its native cuisine but even him was trying to lick the plate up. We move to the Choros Limon and the Chicharron de pollo. The smokiness and spiciness of the mussels married beautifully; it was a better marriage than the one the Clintons have, hehe just kidding. But seriously, we could not get enough of the flavors and the crispness of the chicharron di pollo. 
There were four of us sitting close to the main door, you could see people waiting and we figure, they must know how popular this place is if they are willing to wait. 
More cocktails and then we had empanadas (both veggie and beef) and decided to share some entrees.
The lomo saltado with the egg on top reminded me of the american steak and fries with a certain asian twist. We also had the quinnotto which was good, I certainly enjoyed it and I think it is a good vegetarian option.
Our server was busy but she was trying to make us feel good so, points for her good attitude!
Their chimichurri fries are awesome, how do they do that?
I have been to this restaurant with my girlfriend before and they keep having a balance, consistent menu. I usually read yelp, hardly ever write, but after having a while eating and enjoying this place, I figure, I should give them the props they deserve.
Good job guys! and keep it up! Most of us in the city love you and that is all that matters. 
Keep the choros and the ribs guys!! I will definitely be back for more cocktails and good food. If anything, you may wanna increase your beer inventory.
author: arthur b.

description: It took us a while to find parking on the street and I was almost ready to turn back and look for food elsewhere. Thank god Jonathan convinced me to look one more time.  I had my first taste of ceviche in this place and I must say they had instantly made ceviche a favorite dish. I got the platter with 4 types of ceviche, 2 with the creamy sauce and I don't know what else was on the rest but they were all delicious. I agree that you must have sangria, it makes it all an experience.  Also had the calamares fritos and that was good too. Ultimately, I give them the 5 stars for the great service. We came on a busy night (must not have been that busy because there were no lines as everybody described but it was still a full house), and we were seated immediately and on the second floor too. We had a view of the kitchen, which at first I thought would completely gross me out since I don't really like watching people prepare my food (I have illusions of them coming from the food fairy) but it just got me hungrier and more excited for my food. Although it's in Mission it attracts quite the hipster crowd which I am not really into but I'd totally come back for more ceviche. Umm... now I want some =)
author: Chriselle R.

description: maybe not a popular review but this place is just too over rated and not worth the price. Made early reservations on a weekday for a friend's birthday and it took over an hour for the food to arrive, this included an hour for the ceviche to arrive and another hour for our dishes to arrive. The ceviche was good, but the lomo saltado dish was over salted. How salty was it? I kept looking for the tomatoes in my dish to relieve the saltiness and I asked for water twice. I remember going to limon when it was a little hole-in-the-wall mission spot. The food back then was memorable, now that the restaurant has expanded it has sadly lost it's magic for me. My friend, a true tres leches aficionado ordered that as her dessert, and was also unimpressed. She claims that the tres leches cake was nowhere near as good as the one she tried from Dianda's bakery(they have a tres leches with fresh strawberries). So limon gets two stars from me: one for the ceviche, the other for it's excellent dessert wines, the wine list in general. Service needs improvement, and food needs to be cooked with some love. I don't mind waiting an hour for great food, but an hour for a mediocre experience? I think in the future I willl check out the other peruvian restaurants in the city.
author: X marks the spot ..

description:
Let's start: I'm Peruvian so believe me, I'm picky when it comes to food from my country. I've been at Limon twice in the last month and I love it.  I finally tried it and I was not disappointed.  I've tried the Ceviche Limon (in Peru, it's called ceviche mixto).  Really good, you can actually taste the lime. And don't forget the drink the lime juice once you're done.  It's called Leche de Tigre (Tiger's mik) because it's spicy, lime-ny and strong so what they do in Peru, is the pour that in a shot glass and you shoot it in.  Once all is in, it'll make you feel like a tiger, will cure your hangover and hey, they say it's a good aphrodisiac!
The anticuchos de pollo were fantastic.  The chicken was moist and savory.  It comes with fried sweet potatoes (sooo good!!).  The lomo saltado was good too - just wished the pieces of meat were a bit smaller.  And the Pargo Rojo (fish), oh wow!! What a dish! Delicious. Try it!! The fish is cooked to perfection.  The sauce is is great and the coconut rice is one of the best ones I have had.  If you have space in your stomach, order the Mac&Cheese - yum! For dessert, go with Panna Cotta de Mango.  The profiteroles were good but wish the lucuma flavor was stronger.  Lucuma is a fruit that grows only in Peru and we make dessert of it. 
Next time, I'm trying the Arroz con Mariscos, Tiradito de pescado, empanada vegetariana y Limon Flambee.  Yes! I like it so much I already know what I'm getting next time! 
Enjoy!!!
author: Monica C.

description:
the food was very simple and good.

service was nice and helpful

drinks here are GREAT!

overall great experience!
author: Nicoline B.

description: I was once  walking over to  Puerto Allegre and came upon Limon. It looked really cool and I decided I would come back and try it out. I decided to bring my parents with me, and we came on a Sunday night. The place was very crowded and loud. Luckily we had reservations. We were seated on the upstairs balcony, away from the crowds. The lighting is quite dim, and candles glow from the tables. My dad ordered a roasted corn soup. It was to die for and I kid you not. This soup was so deliciously sweet it could have passed for a dessert. My mom had some ceviche which was apparently good, but as I don't eat fish, I cannot comment. For dinner I had the roasted chicken with truffled macaroni and cheese. Now as to how puruvian this is, I cannot say, but what I can say is that this was probably one of the tastiest dinners I have ever had at a restaurant aside from Rivoli in Berkeley. The chicken was crispy and flavorful with a delightful sauce. And the truffled macaroni, mmmmmmm heaven. My dad had a dish with french fries and strips of beef. It was really good as well, but I personally would go with the chicken and macaroni. If I go back again, and I most definitely will, I would be hard pressed to order anything except this amazing bird and macaroni. It was just that good.
author: Kate A.

description: I usually avoid popular places at 8pm on a Saturday night but decided to give it a go since a couple of seats were open for Walk-ins....and we are glad we did!! noisy but nice room.great service(Kudos to Jesus our waiter)and solid,nicely presented food.Ceviches very good and you could leave with your wallet intact!! I was very impressed plus the hostess was sweet and cute!!
author: james m.

description: It took them some time to get us our cava's (they arrived together with the appetizers although we ordered them first), and the dessert was not great (maybe we were expecting too much), but everything else was fantastic.  I really liked the space, the service was friendly and knowledgeable, and the food was yummy (especially the calamares and fried chicken).
author: Marijke D.

description: Limon is one of my top 3 favorite restaurants in SF... maybe even my fav and that is why I'm absolutely compelled to write a review even though there are now over 200 reviews of the place. I first went to Limon way back in the day when it was a small operation on 17th and have been hooked since. I went there again last night with three close friends and had an amazing time! For appetizers, we ordered the scallops with foie Gras and the beef empanadas. Both were extremely delicious and just filling enough to leave ample room for the main dishes. I had a nibble of the red snapper and rib eye steak from my friends but can really only give a fair review for my dish - the Seco de Costilla, or the slow braised shortrib served over herb mashed potatoes. Pure Heaven! The meat was so soft it practically fell off the bone and just had incredible flavor. All I know is if I were on death row and asked for my last meal, I would ask for Seco de Costilla. The mashed potato was extremely flavorful and provided the perfect combination with the short rib. Before I finish, I have to also recommend the Malbec on the wine "by the glass" list - fruity and went very well with the short rib. Overall, an amazing experience!
author: Amyn S.

description: My roommate and I went to Limon last night for dinner. The setup of the restaurant is adorable, with two levels and lots of seating. It is slightly upscale and pricey especially for the neighborhood, but we had SUCH a good time, and it is well worth the price. The manager or owner (I'm not sure which)  sat us at our table immediately although we were over 15 minutes late for our reservations. We ordered shortly after and got a half carafe of sangria. Although our appetizers came quickly, the entrees took well over 25 minutes or so to come out. In the meantime we had ordered 2 more glasses of wine, and the manager very kindly comped them and 2 additional glasses once our entrees came. We both ordered the chicken and mashed potatoes, and it was DELICIOUS! The chicken was cooked perfectly and the mashed potatoes were salty and very flavorful. The only thing undercooked was the few pieces of broccoli accompanying the meal. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our experience and will be returning soon!
author: Rachel G.

description: This place has slowly slid down hill since it opened 5 or 6 years ago.  It used to be one of my favorite places in the city.  Had dinner there, tonight, though, probably for the last time.  The ceviche is still excellent.  If I ever go back, that's all I'll have.  My "picante fish and camarones" was ok but way, way too salty.  The same was true for both the short ribs and the steak that my companions had.  Service was excellent, as always.  But between the sort-of-indifferent food and the loud, loud atmosphere, I won't be going back.
author: Jim B.

description: I would give this place zero stars if I could.  Looooooonnnnnnngggg story short - we had a reservation at 8:30 for a party of 7 this past Saturday night (8/31) .  Most of us were there early, 3 were about 10 min late, but they didn't seat us until 9. We were forced to stand in the teeny space between the bar and the tables, being bumped into, jostled, etc, and unable to even speak to each other due to the cacophony of restaurant noise. Don't they know if they hung some curtains from the ceiling it would help? Please, Limon management, consult an interior designer and do something about the noise - it's awful.
