We got our appetizer at 10, and our food at 10:30. Though since most of our party didn't order an appetizer, they were forced to sit hungry the whole time. No one even bothered to check on us. We sent emissaries up to the hostess several times and it didn't help much.  It was so loud we couldn't even enjoy conversation as we had to shout at each other. It was so cramped, hot, and loud, that when I finally "escaped" I felt so relieved - I didn't realize how much tension had built up in my body and my spirit from being forced to stay in that horrible place for 3 frigging hours. Oh yeah, the food was good, and they gave us some free stuff for the wait - it didn't make it worth the LITERAL torture i was put through.  I will never go back again.
author: Shelly H.

description: I've seen good reviews for Limon, so I decided to take my sister there for her 23rd birthday.  I called the day of the dinner, to see if it was possible to add to my reservation of 8.  The host could not find my reservation.  He was not apologetic.  He was not polite.  He did not offer to accommodate us another night. If this was a precursor to our service I am glad they lost the reservation!  I discussed the lost reservation with several of my friends and they've also had their reservations "lost".  Thankfully, I was able to get a reservation some where else for dinner.  I am so upset that Limon almost ruined my sister's special day; I will NEVER eat at Limon.  If you insist on eating here I recommend you call to make sure your reservation wasn't "lost".
author: Tabitha S.

description:
The food is ok - nothing has fancy as i heard some people say for the price you pay. The presentation of the plates is excellent though (especially the red snapper).  The service is average.
Beware though that when i went there, i forgot a cachemire sweater on my chair. As i was out in the street, i just thought i would call them to pick it up the day after (we left a message the same night). Well, they never found it it seems (and i can even tell you where i left it in the restaurant). The sad thing about all this is not that i lost (or someone there stole it) the sweater, it's the way they treated me. I called at least 5 times to know if they had found it, and every time they would tell me they're going to call me back, which they never did. I even had to go there to still hear that they would call me back because they have to check another office where they may have it. I called again, and i was told to f.. off.
author: alex d.

description:
i was recommended this place by a fellow chef friend of mine who worked the hotline here. the decor was super modern and very out of place for its location. the wait staff was ok just a little snooty, the door man sucked. me and my girlfriend got to sit at the balcony which was kind of cool because we got to look down into the kitchen.

now the food...it gets a 1 for all the above i mentioned. it gets a zero for the food.
first off for what we got the bill was ridiculous.
between the two of us we had 1 order of calamari, 1 order of this ceviche thing that seemed to be drenched in a spicy marinara sauce and 4 glasses of wine(not high end stuff mind you)

82 bucks without tip

no entrees
no dessert
just 2 apps and some wine

awful
author: deef d.

description: i like the lomo saltado at fresca better, but definitely get the pargo rojo and chocolate bandido here.  you will not be disappointed!!  the sangria here is so good and fruity that i forgot that there was alcohol in it...until i had to stand up and leave the restaurant!
author: Helen T.

description: i expected a major scene, snobby waitstaff, mediocre food, and a crazy bill.  in reality, the only thing mediocre was my date.  granted, it was loud and the tables were stacked on each other, but the food was very good and the service was its equal.  in fact, the waiter admitted that the chef didn't like how he'd prepared my date's entree, so he had to re-do it.  as a token of goodwill, he brought us the mixed greens while we waited.  i simply didn't expect that at a place like this.  also, i had a great beaf dish with peppers and fries mixed in and rice on the side.  highly recommended!
author: schnarf-a-larf a.

description: I've been wanting to try this place for quite a while now...I would have to say that it was definitely worth the wait.  I was quite pleased that even without reservations we were seated immediately.  The restaurant is not very big, but is comfy.  The food was delicious!!  The Ceviche Limon( halibut with mixed seafoods)...oh soooo good!  It had enough tang and spicy-ness that complimented each other...it went so well with the bottle of cabernet that we ordered. For the main course....Arroz con mariscos.  Ahhhhhh...soooooo good!  I was (again) surprised at the quantity of food, it didn't look a lot but I was stuffed by the time I was finished.  The mixed seafoods (shrimp, clams, mussles, calamari and scallop) tasted so fresh, the mix laid over rice, which tasted oh so rich and creamy with its saffron and (according to the menu) pepper shrimp sauce. To top it off, not only was the food delicious, but the service was great! Never was my glass of water empty ;). Despite the busy-ness, our waiter checked on us every so often.  I had a great experience at Limon, and I will certainly go back!
author: Dhory S.

description: i like this place alot.  the food is excellent.  drinks are great and they are served quick so you can have a couple before the meal comes out.  service is very helpful and will recommend dishes that are featured items.  4 stars because it is on the pricy side.
author: brian l.

description: Brunch with the girls....reservations at noon...get there...got seated right away, GREAT!  Ordered the food, which was delicious......45 mins into our brunch, as we were getting ready to order more food....one of the hostess comes up to us to let us know that she needs the table at 1:30 for another reservation (mine you, it's only 12:45...and we've only been dining for 45 mins with another 45 mins to spare before 1:30)...and then she had the nerves to say, "oh no rush and no offense!!!"  First of all, I've never been so appalled in my life at such service....and it ruined the rest of our girls brunch!  We left immediately since we didn't want to patronize such an establishment...and when i got home to call the manager....the same hostess answered and didn't want to put the manager on the phone....made all these excuses....and reluctantly went to get him...but supposedly he was busy and never came on the phone....food was good but I will NEVER go back...and I will be sure to let all my friends know of the crappy service I got!!  It's a shame to loose customers over bad service!!  To the owners/managers of the restaurant, make sure you train your employees better!!
author: Sun Y.

description: Seriously, go here. This place rocks. We need more restaurants like this, an obvious devotion to quality and service.
author: Josh R.

description: this place was unbelievable! we came on a saturday night so place was packed! we started with some of the cebiches which were fresh and delicious. also had the empanadas which were these little pockets of meaty goodness. the highlight of the meal had to be the whole fried snapper! the curry sauce that came along with it was rich in flavor and the fish was fried, but still had a nice light texture. we washed it all down with a couple pitchers of sangria. this was definitely a great meal. will be back soon.
author: Chris O.

description: VERY good Peruvian restaurant!  The only reason it didn't get a fifth star is because it was so expensive, the portions a bit small, desserts not great, and the atmosphere noisy.  I am a huge Peruvian fan (my fav restaurant in LA is Peruvian) so I was very happy to find this one in the city close-by a BART stop.   We ordered the Ceviche Limon, which was quite good, the Vieres con Foie Gras, which was amazing, and the Tatara de Atun, which was also quite good.  We split the Lomo Saltada which was VERY impressive.  This is my benchmark, and it surpassed it.  Very tender steak and the fries were not too mushy.  I had the sangria which was very sweet (but I like it that way) and my buddy had the saki, which he really liked.   The only disappointment were the desserts.  The bread pudding was a bit flavorless and the tres leches was good, but not great.  We should have gotten the chocolate...  Our bill, with tax and tip was about $140 which, for small portions but getting seafood, wasn't too horrible.  I would go back but just not very often.
author: Erick Z.

description: while our waiter was very nice and helpful, this place is definitely not worth the hype.  Fresca (on fillmore) puts this place to shame.  ceviche is so so and the rest of the menu is completely unmemorable.
author: M D.

description: food is great, atmosphere is lively, host(ess) can be a bit surly - come on, smile a bit people.
author: hunter w.

description: I had first heard about Limon through a tv show. It sounded interesting and since I've never had Peruvian/Latin American food, I thought I'd give it a try. I asked my mom to bring me there for my birthday dinner and I've been going there every birthday since. The atmosphere is nice, dim lighting and modern pieces, but it gets really loud and crowded especially at the bar on the weekends. Now onto the important stuff, the food. We ordered three different ceviches, all prepared differently. One word, WONDERFUL. Tangy, acidic, moist and fresh. Be warned, too much of the stuff will leave your tongue feeling fuzzy. I ordered the snapper and it is everything they said on the tv show. First of all, it is impressive to look at, the fish is suspended in air, captured in movement. Not only is it cool to look at, it tastes great! The pieces of fish are cut out for you, so no bones to worry about and it is soft and flaky. The rice that comes with it is made with some coconut milk and some kind of nut but its is super! It has a comfy home feeling and the coconut taste is not overwhelming but just a hint. As for drinks, I'd recommend their sangria and their mojitos are fantastic. If you don't want alcohol, they have this lemon spritzer (I don't remember the name) and I think it is infused with ginger, which is yummy too.
author: Vanessa T.

description: Came into the night with mixed expectations.. word of mouth said to expect great food but slow service... food quality lived up to and beyond expectations..  Went for several small plates.. Cerviche Cameron was extremely fresh and zesty..  Anticucho Beef Skewers were perfect buttery tenderness..  the stuffed Calimari was another excellent choice... I'm a non-drinker so used to water or soda but was glad to try the Chica Morada.. some sort of purple corn drink that was unexpectantly sweet.. and contrary  to what i'd heard, the service was quick and prompt. our entrees were quick to arrive and extremely hot.. had myself all psyched to write a perfect review.. and then the dessert time came.. extremely delicious..but SLOW!!! to arrive.. surprising because our fast served entrees came at a busy time.. dessert was when the restaurant had cleared out.. plus, $5.oo for a bad double espresso? ouch!...... but in the end.. excellent night out!! will go back for more..
author: miqual c.

description: I had the Pollo Latino and it was sooo soo yummy!!! The Chiche Morreno was the best I've ever had and they had a great selection of wines as well. We had a reservation so we didn't have to worry about waiting-others weren't so lucky that night. The big problem was the long wait time between appetizers and our entrees-we waited about 45 minutes. Be prepared to pay up for the great food!!!
author: Mandi A.

description: Went with a group of friends. Service was phenomenal! Food was spectacular! The shrimp ceviche is a must!!!
author: Jennifer D.

description:
pretty average, don't waste your time.

1. We had a reservation for 9 and we didn't get seated until 9:45 ish, at least we could pop down to the elbo room for some lowlife specials.
2. Risotto dish (Quinoto de Hongos) was slightly more food than we feed our cat, for lunch. honestly this is an entree? 
3. We sampled quite a few other dishes, they were pretty average... chicken was pretty dry.. is chicken with mac n cheese actually peruvian??? 
4. Service was ok, nice enough. They added 19% service charge onto the bill for a party of 6. 
5. Sangria was sangria, not particularly special or tasty. 

on a positive note: Churrasco a la Parrilla was really good.

Overall... had we not been to the Elbo room for a couple drinks before hand, we probably would have been a bit more annoyed with the experience.  The only reason I would come here is to sit at the bar and order the Churrasco a la Parrilla... but really, how hard is it to get a big piece of meat right?
author: Ralfa R.

description: make a reservation!!!  we didn't and ended up sitting in this cramped lounge area in the front.  the food was fantastic and the restaurant has a great ambience for a nice evening out.
author: Roshni R.

description: Very good Peruvian--I like it less than La Mar, but Limon is still great in its own right.  For food alone, I would give it 4 stars.  But I have to take off another star for the constant wait times.  It reminds me of that episode of Seinfeld "you know how to take the reservation, you just don't know how to hold the reservation -- and that's really the most important part of the reservation, the holding. Anybody can just take them."  Whether it's French Laundry or a chain in a strip mall, I don't think it's unreasonable that when you make a reservation, your table will be ready when you arrive, or at least ready within a few minutes.  Twice now, in spite of having a reservation, I've been made to wait in excess of half an hour, once, nearly an hour.  I know it's a popular place, and I know that waitstaff hates trying to push people away from their tables, but if the tables aren't going to be there, then they should not be put on Opentable.
author: Ty D.

description: went here with a friend a couple weeks ago, and it was solid. the bookends to the meal -- appetizers and dessert -- were way more impressive than the entree we chose (it was sort of like paella, but i can't remember the name). we shared everything and that worked out great -- lots of tastes, the perfect amount of food *and* we had room for dessert. my friend ordered a glass of yummy dessert wine after the meal, and generously, the waiter brought one for me as well, complimentary. thumbs up.
author: Elizabeth S.

description: One of my dining faves in the Mission.  I must have had good karma working for me on my latest visit as I arrived around prime time and didn't have reservations but got seated immediately! The dining room was packed but they had a nice table for 2 upstairs overlooking the main dining floor and kitchen.  The Peruvian fare (steaks and seafood with a latin flair) is well prepared and very tasty.  I'm a big fan of the Lomo Saltado (top sirloin pan fried with tomatoes, onions, and fries) and it appears that everyone else is a fan too, given the number of Lomo Saldados the kitchen was cranking out over the course of the night as I got a bird's eye view of the talented chefs work 10 pans at once.  The empanadas are a definite must for an appetizer (what you eat before you eat, to make your more hungry).  The Arroz con Mariscos (paella) is flavorful and loaded with fresh shrimp, calamari, clams, and mussels, but could probably use a little more rice.  The sangria is good and not diluted, so drink up!  For dessert, I recommend the Budin con manzanas y coco, which is like an apple bread pudding with mango and coconut ice cream.  Service was attentive at first and then slowly dissipated after we got our food.   If you're not lucky enough to get seated right away after arriving without reservations, you can eat at the bar but it's usually crowded.
author: Andrew C.

description: The first time i went to this place was when it was in its first tiny location on 17th street.  I remember that we had to use the table candles to read our menus because the place was so dark, and it was teenier than harry potter's closet.  However, once our food came out, I was WOWED.  I am a serious peruvian food lover and this place really takes the cake for flavor, presentation, portion, and creativity.  I loved every single one of the dishes that my party got (including the dessert, a chocolate cake).  The second time I visited was at the new location which of course is a lot trendier, more crowded, and MUCH louder, but i guess that's what happens when you offer amazing food.
author: M K.

description: This place is so overrated.  I had high expectations based on many good reviews, but the food was just so-so, and service was OK but not great.  I really wanted to like the ceviche, but it was nothing to call home about.  My husband had some chicken dish, which he thought was "eh."  I didn't care for the space, either.  It gets very loud, and you cannot have a normal conversation.  In the end, I left wondering, "what's all the fuss?"  There are so many other restaurants in San Francisco with much better food where I'd rather spend my money.
author: Bo K.

description: The food was great, but too bad..it was really really "SALTY" I had to drink THREE cups of iced water just to finish my entree. There's no need to put so much salt just because it's inexpensive!!! Two words...possible DIABETES if I continue to go there! actually the waiter wasn't that polite, not very attentive. I'm giving him the benefit of the doubt that he was having a crazy night!  And I feel like I'm paying $$$ for salt. Will NOT go back.
author: mark h.

description:
I had my birthday dinner at Limon based on all the glowing reviews. I don't know if they were having an off night, but I did not have a  good dining experience. There were 5 of us dining at 8 PM on a Sunday. 

When we sat down, we ordered a pitcher of sangria ($30). When the  waiter returned 15 minutes later (without our sangria), we ordered the ceviche platter ($24) and tuna tartar (I think around $13) to start. I ordered the chicken with truffle mac and cheese ($20) and my friend ordered a seafood dish with  Peruvian sauce ($22). Three people ordered soup and salad, which they specified very clearly three times that they wanted served as an entree, since they had been eating appetizers at the bar prior to our arrival. The waiter stated that that would be fine. 

The soup came out first. Unbelievable, considering how many times it was  stated that they wanted it as an entree. They told the waiter that, and he said, "Oh, sorry. Can you eat it now?" So, they just ate it then, even though that meant that two of us would be eating alone later in the meal. Next came out the salad (again, unbelievable, since we had shown our displeasure with the soup coming out early). When we said something about it, the waiter argued back, saying that these were appetizer dishes, so they had to come out first (huh? they can't be brought out later?). Both the soup and salad were mediocre, certainly not worth their price. At this point, we asked where our sangria was, and it was brought out. 

The ceviche came out next (which we had wanted first). This was the highlight of the meal. Very tasty. Made me want to experiment with making ceviche. However, again the service ruined our experience, as the platter was literally whisked off the table by the busboy with my friend's fork poised above the corn, about to take a bite. Completely blatant. So, next my chicken appears, along with the tuna tartar!!! I was incredulous. I said to the waiter, "Excuse me, but I am not really into eating tuna tartar alongside my hot chicken. I also would like  to eat my entree along with my friend's entree (the seafood dish)", since the others now would not have soup and salad while I ate as planned. He very begrudgingly took my chicken back  to be  kept warm. He definitely made us feel we were high maintenance and a bother, which became the focus/tension, rather than my birthday. We aren't really the kind to make waves, and we were uncomfortable with the situation. We did feel, however, if you are at a fairly expensive restaurant, that the meal should be served as specified, and this  was exceedingly bad service. The tuna tartar was not my favorite. Doesn't hold a candle to the tuna tartar at Yabbies (YUM). But it was fairly good. 

Finally, my friend's seafood dish was brought. I had to remind them that my chicken was  still being kept warm, and that was brought. At this point, the manager stopped by our table to ask how things were going. We explained the situation, and to his credit, he  sent us a half pitcher of sangria on the house. 

So, two of us ate entrees while the others sat idly by. The busboy had cleared their plates, and it was a bit awkward. The chicken was mediocre, in my opinion. Very dry (this may have been from keeping it warm, though). The truffle mac and cheese was divine, though! If you go there, order it as a side and skip the chicken. But the topper of the service fiasco is that my friend's dish was not what she ordered! She told the waiter and he acknowledged he had made a mistake, but he literally said, "Oh my God, after everything. They are going to kill me. (yes, he said that). Can you eat it, please? It's very good. I think it's better than what you ordered." He begged her, and she actually consented and ate what was put in front of her, the seafood and rice dish, which she said was definitely not worth $22. 

The manager, knowing how sorely disappointed we were in this disastrous- and expensive- meal, sent me out a dessert (some sort of cake with caramel sauce) with a candle on the house. That was tasty. When we left, he was apologizing profusely (as well he should). But I wouldn't go back or recommend Limon to people, because the poor service will overshadow any gastronomic enjoyment, and I found the dishes to be hit or miss, and overpriced for what they offered.
author: M E.

description: I've heard good things about Limon, but I'll be honest, I've never had such a poor restaurant experience in SF.  We had a big group of ten of us, so I know that can be tough, but it's big enough that it should have been accommodating.  We had a reservation, showed up on time with our full party together, and still weren't seated for 30 minutes.  After finally being seated, we drank some wine and ordered food.  We waited literally for over an hour before we received something other than bread.  With empty stomachs, most of the table was pretty much done drinking by the time we were served.  Luckily the food slightly validated the service, but most of us weren't even hungry by the time it came.  I'd be willing to give Limon another try, but I wouldn't dare go with more than one other person.
author: Beth S.

description:
rude waiter, insincere manager, i don't care what the food is like, if i can't feel comfortable or welcome, no thanks.  
we were seated upstairs, alone, - while they prepped the area for a large party.  the waiter couldn't have cared less, and made it  plain.  obviously, we were just in the way of his big money-making party.  
i give zero stars for the snotty hostess, the rude waiter, and the manager who said he wanted to make it right, but didn't give me one reason to stay.  could not get out of there fast enough.
we crossed the street to ramblas - perhaps the food isn't as fancy, but the people are nice.
author: l. c.

description: just had a prix fix 3 course vegetarian meal: a small plate of leaves, two mashed potato filled hot pockets, bunch of mushrooms & peas wrapped in a cabbage leaf then boiled acccompanied with hot pocket filling also wrapped in cabbage, one small piece of potato, three small bits of beet. $40 plus tax & tip - should have been about $7.50. Terrible place not to eat meat, service was good though.
author: Matchak R.

description: We had reservations and we still had to wait an hour to be seated.  After sitting forever someone finally came.  We ordered a pitcher of Sangria for two of us and I really don't think there was any wine in it because neither one of us felt a thing.  The place was so loud I couldn't hear my boyfriend from across the tiny table.  The service was slow, but the food was pretty good.  I'd come back on a week night maybe if I knew it wasn't going to be crowded but I probably wouldn't order the sangria again.
author: Nicole P.

description: The food is always good here, but the service sucks.  I just ate their for the third time, but refuse to go back.  200 bucks for four people, and it was probably the worst all around service I've received at any restaurant.  It took 45 minutes to get a diet coke, no joke.  The reservationist told me over the phone they take Discover card, but they do not.  Its a very misinformed, unknowledgable staff, and I do not recommend eating here.  Not worth the price.  Go to Fresca, same quality food but they take care of you there instead of ignore you.
author: Louis D.

description: yes, very good. nice staff, good service. i had chicken soup and tuna tartare, husband had chiccharones (sp? ie, fried chicken) and empanadas.  it was all v delicious.
author: mad m.

description: Came here for dinner last night with a fella I used to date.  We thought parking would be a pain, but luckily, we got rock star parking and hardly had to look at all.  No wait, but we had reservations.  My only big qualm about the place was the table we were at.  It was near the front by the windows.  This little corner kind of table that looked like it should be a table for one, but they just stuck a chair on the corner of it to make it a table for two.  The fella kept getting his chair bumped into by people coming and going from the neighboring table.  The service was pretty quick and they were friendly - a definite plus.  I loved the atmosphere.  It was very lively and PACKED for a Thursday night.  We started off with glasses of sangria.  We contemplated getting a pitcher, but didn't think we'd be able to finish it.  Skipped appetizers and went straight to the main course.  I had the Churrasco a la Parilla (grilled 12oz. ribeye steak with roasted red potatoes, grilled vegetables, and chimichurri mustard sauce).  My steak was sooo good!  Very filling though.  I couldn't finish it.  The fella had the Arroz con Mariscos (clams, scallops, mussels, shrimp and calamari cooked with saffron rice in a pepper shrimp sauce).  I tried a little bit of his and it was really good too.  Of course, afterward, he was wishing he had the snapper - it looked yum!  We saved a little bit of room and split dessert.  I can't for the life of me remember what it was (and it's not on their website!) but I'd definitely order it again.
author: Kris L.

description: the food at Limon is so damn tasty.  it's hard to steer away from the Tartara de Atun (ahi tun) appetizer and the Churrasco ala Parilla (rib eye steak) entree each time i go.
author: Vic A.

description: yum! great service, tasty food stuffs. it's very pricey with very very small portions though.
author: NF T.

description: yeah yeah yeah i know everyone loves limon, the ceviche is "amaaazing" and the waitstaff are flirty... but we were crammed into a corner upstairs, and while the food was good, a bit overpriced in my opinion. too trendy for me, thanks very much.
author: jenna p.

description: i loved this place - great location on valencia and such great food.  i only had a bunch of appetizers but the dinner choices looked great too, i will have to go back!  it was a little noisy but i still think its a great place for a dinner with friends or a date.  and the chocolate cake is awesome - yes please!!
author: Carolyn B.

description: Went to Limon for the 1st time and I have heard a lot of great things, so a couple of friends and I need to find out for ourselves.  The restaurant didn't disappoint.  For starters, we had the calamari, fried chicken, and ahi tartar.  Calamari was crisp and the sauce was slightly spicy, but we should have asked for the sauce on the side because they drizzled it all over the plate.  The chicken was off the hook, but avoid the dipping sauce, it was too tangy for my taste.  The tartar was perfect except that 3 chips aren't enough.  We shared 2 Main dishes- the top sirlon steak (medium) and the seafood platter with saffron rice.  I can't say any bad about either of them.  Both were well balanced and not too much of anything.  For dessert, we dove into the coffee creme brulee and chocolate dulce de leche.  Not too sweet and not too bland.  Overall, the prices were fair and I didn't feel cheated.  The sangria is one of the better ones in SF, although don't get carried away at $25 a pitcher.  Limon is a great place to go on a date or to chill with friends because everything is so damn good that you can't go wrong.
author: Jason A.

description: i went here before it moved to its current location.  the old restaurant was nice and quaint w/ a pleasant staff that was willing to help out at a moment's notice.  the restaurant was a haven for seafood eaters.  alas it is hard to go here if you have non-fishies in your group as the pickings are slim beyond fish (at least they were when i last went).  overall a top notch choice here in our fine city!
author: Swarup B.

description: Peruvian cuisine is not necessarily tapas.  So you won't find the small plates that are served at the Timo's or Cha (3x) of the Mission District.  Instead, the new location of Limon still boasts some of the tastiest Latin American dishes.  For starters, step up to the bar and get your fill on sangria.  One of the sweetest ones I've tasted.  Then begin your food quest with an appetizer. perhaps the Camarones (shrimp) or even a slight twist on a common classic, Fried Calamari.  The sauce has a little, but pleasant kick to it. Order another sangria at this point. Then for entrees. My favorite is the Lomo Saltamo (yikes! can be off on the spelling here).  Top Sirloin mixed in with potatoes and onions.  Dump parts of your bowl of rice and enjoy every little morsel of this hearty plate.  The sole (pan-seared) is quite a treat as well.  Ask for another sangria to wash down the meal.  Finally, ask to see if they have the profiteroles that come with the lucama ice cream. what's lucama you ask?  A peruvian fruit found only in Peru and very sweet.  It's a bit noisy, so don't be afraid to speak up (to be heard).  Polish off your last sangria, and look forward to your next visit.
author: Dale K.

description: Very good cheviche and sangria!  Upstair seating is bit loud and you have to yell across the table and their service is slow but good food.  Get there early or make a reservation.  Wait can be long.
author: Su Kyeong K.

description: nice place, great staff, good food but not as great as the hype.  worth checking out though.
author: Alan N.

description: the waitstaff was one of the most attentive i have ever seen EVER, in any restaurant. the service was impeccable. they made you feel very cared for and that your dinner was the most importent one in the whole place, but they did that for everyone, which is what makes this place great. the food was also good. we had the traditional ceviche, yummy. and the Pargo Rojo, which was so fun to eat. i love that they fry animals whole. i find it amusing when i can see the face of what i'm eating. drinks are tasty as well. sangria is a must. great date spot.
author: Lorraine T.

description: We were there to celebrate my husband & cousin's birthday with a group of 20.   After circling forever for a space, a few of us found yellow 30 minute meters.   The restaurant was pretty empty except for our large party so I thought we'd get quick service and be out in an hour and a half.   Man, was I wrong.  We were there for close to 3 hours...that's 6 trips to the meter.    The food was so-so.  Someone in our group said that the top sirloin was their signature dish, so half of the group ordered it, including my husband.   Sadly, the best part of the dish was not the meat but the white rice infused with saffron.   The top sirloin was not top grade so it was a bit on the chewy side...pretty pathetic if that's their signature dish.  Luckily, I ordered the fish but my 5 year old ate half of it leaving me with the potatoes and spinach to fill up on.   It was pretty tasty though and the 5 year old is a really picky eater so if he liked it, it must be pretty darn good.   The service was so incredibly slow but I can't put it all on the wait staff.  They made sure our water glasses were full and brought anything else (other than the food) we needed quickly to the table.   The kitchen was extremely slow which is worrisome since we were the only people in the restaurant except for another table of 4.   This probably isn't the best place for large groups unless you have time for a long, leisurely meal and parked at a regular meter.
author: Christina L.

description: great date place. Awesome yucca-I just want to order mass quantities and eat every day as well as their sauteed veges.
author: Batia L.

description: super tasty ceviche, friendly waitstaff.. melikes this place :o)
author: monkey l.

description: Good thing the food here is so delicious or the unfriendly hostess and pushy waiter (mostly absent except to ask repeatedly if we wanted more alcohol even after many "no's") simply aren't worth a return.  The sangria is a bit too sweet and bar/wait space is tight.  But the Pargo Rojo is out-of-this-world, especially the coconut stir-fried rice that comes with it and its unique presentation (served with its skeleton as a "basket").  The Pollo Latino was also delicious and the Ceviche Sampler is the way to go if you are a fan:  you get to choose the four that you'd like to sample.  We were celebrating a girlfriend's birthday on the night we were there, and noticed that they didn't comp the dessert (Tres Leches--not recommended since it was quite bland), even though they stuck in a candle.  Too bad, since a small gesture like that could have mollified us after the long wait and lack of customer service.
author: Vivien W.

description: Service is half the dining experience and the manager and I had a great chat to make my night after a fantastic meal.  Order the Caballero for dessert-- 5 for 5 stars.
author: Victory V.

description: yes, it's trendy, fusion-y, can be a scene, but food is great.  went here with a huge group, we arrived late but they managed to fit us in.  we got great service and had a wonderful meal.  we took our time eating and talking, and we closed the place down.
author: Nana S.

description: Great Peruvian in the Mission.  Same physical layout as the original Slanted Door.  Sit downstairs as the upstairs is too loud.  We actually sat at the bar and had dinner. Try the tuna appetizer and the chicken skewers -- YUMMY!  The warm chocolate flourless cake is also decadent.  We had a great bottle of Malbec as well.  Good service, Great atmosphere, and Good overall menu selection.
author: kimberly t.

description: I know- everyone loves this place!! But I have to disagree. I don't know if it's b/c I hyped Limon so much in my head that it bombed, or it really is just mediocre. Hubby and I brought the baby here. We weren't the only people to bring kids, although there's a definite, "what the hell are kids?" vibe to the place. If you're young, with a cute purse, expensive shoes, out with girlfriends/friends, and drinking expensive drinks will not bankrupt you, or you have no mortgage, this could possibly be a good place to blow a percentage of your paycheck. Because the atmosphere is urban, bustling, and so so cool. However, if you're born and raised in SF, like my hubby, you could possibly get a sick feeling in your stomache knowing that this same trendiness is gentrifying and overrunning the city with the ever multiplying non native species of  "urbanians." Also, if you have no sense of style, shop at Lane Bryant or JCPenney, like I do, you will feel aesthetically out of place. I am not hatin', I'm just sayin'. I got the coconut rice and fried fish in the basket. The coconut rice was on hit, however, the fried fish tasted similar to how my mom makes hers. You could also go to Pacific Super on Alemany in the Excelsior and pick your own fish and get it fried for much cheaper and get the same food experience. It's not hip and trendy, but its fried fish. w/o the hecka good coconut rice. But after paying close to $100 for dinner, I think I can make my own rice. I don't see this restaurant in my future.
author: rb r.

description: I didn't realize how ceviche could be this delicious. A bit pricey but a nice mix of people.  The staff is friendly. Try the mac and cheese people!
author: Lina L.

description: Nice place, good food, and very reasonable prices.  What more can you ask for?  Well, maybe you could ask for more space in the restaurant.  It is CROWDED.  They crammed a chair into every possible space.  It's also very loud.  Not recommended for a romantic dinner, but a loud boisterous gathering of friends.
author: Chris C.

description: 3 of us went there for dinner recently.    Prior to being seated, we asked about the allergic needs of one of our guests and discussed with the host @8 options that he said could be prepared to meet her needs.    After confirming the allergies again with the waiter, her food arrived with one of the allergic items in clear view.    The other 2 of us had already begun to eat, as our food arrived first.    The waiter then said that there was only one item on the menu that met her needs, and the chef was not willing to alter any of his dishes otherwise.    When asked to speak to the manager, he was not available.    After explaining the entire situation to another man on staff who came over, he was not willing to do anything to solve our situation.    The manager came over, said nothing as we explained it all a THIRD time, all while our food became cold.      It was not acceptable to us that their staff wouldn't back up what we were originally told by their host.  We would have gone to a different restaurant.   Worst staff that I have experienced in a very long time!   My first and last visit to this establishment.
author: Ann B.

description: had a great meal here last night.  starters included tnua tartare (good and basically what you can get almost anywhere), and octopus ceviche, also good.  main courses were excellent, i had the short rib as i saw everyone here was raving about it and they were right.  meat fell right off the bone.  we also got a side of the truffle mac and that was delicious, although it didn't realy go well beside others' more seafoody entrees.  overall great experince and also great service.
author: e w.

description: Totally disappointing - overpriced ($100 for 2) and mediocre food.  Ceviche was okay.  For great South American, go to Destino.
author: Kristi S.

description: After experiencing Limon, sushi sounds so boring!
author: Chris R.

description: Finally after lots of talking about it and then forgetting about it, we had dinner at Limon, and definitely will go again.  My favorite part of dinner was the ceviche (standard Limon ceviche) - it was the perfect balance of citrus for my taste, delicious.  The truffled mac and cheese was also too good, although I probably won't be eating that too often or I won't be able to walk home from the restaurant.  I was a little disappointed by the empanadas, the flavors just didn't work for me and the pastry was a little soggy.  Every single table near us seemed to be ordering them so maybe that is just me?  Next time I would also skip the sangria, it was fun, but it was full of fruit with just a few sips of wine.  Next time - champagne and ceviche!
author: Jessica T.

description: Decent Ceviche, service is good.  A bit overpriced for flavorless cusine.
author: Mike O.

description: Very good sangria and tuna tar tar.  The chicken was also excellent.  Had a really good meal at Limon.
author: Richard C.

description: I used to really like this restaurant and was excited to hear it had reopened (I was skeptical that the "closed for remodeling" line was code for "never reopening"). I was walking through the mission looking for a last minute dinner with minimal wait for party of 5 on a Sat night- a tall order I know, but luckily came upon Limon! The hosts and wait staff were very nice and accommodating which I truly appreciate. The remodel looks good as well. Why only 2 stars? Well, maybe my expectations were too high or maybe I'm just not a fan of the new menu. We ordered a bunch of ceviche, appetizers and sangria following recommendations from our sprightly waiter, but unfortunately nothing really wowed us. Hopefully this was just a little reopening hitch and things will come together nicely once they hit their groove. I'll be back to check in on them again soon since the setting, waitstaff and sangria left such positive impressions.
author: Jennifer E.

description: I like the ambiance here - I've always had great service and have never waited for a table (of course I've only been on week nights).  The food is delicious, reasonably priced, and portion sizes are just right!  The picante de mariscos is to die for...
author: Lindsay C.

description: i ordered the steak with rice.  that was yummy.  the ceviche sampler was pretty good too. reasonably priced
author: Huy Z.

description: A very trendy and popular fusion spot, but it seems that some of the basics have suffered as a result. Service was slow and confused and the food was incredibly inconsistent. Ceviche was delicious but we should have stopped right there and gone elsewhere for the bulk of our dinner. A steak and potatoes dish was tough and chewy with very little kick to it. Empanadas were bland. Our pork was essentially raw, somehow none of the kitchen or wait staff who handled the plate thought this was a problem. By the time they brought it back we were more than ready to leave. Prices were too high given the quality and the amount of food we received. On the walk back, we looked jealously in the window at the people who had chosen to go to a cheap burrito joint instead.
author: Annemarie F.

description: I've been to Limon just once so far, but will definitely be going back. Peruvian cuisine is a nice change from the usual choices and pretty much everything on the menu was tempting. Not necessarily inexpensive but much less than the top-end SF places, and with food every bit as good. Good location too for heading out after.
author: Joe F.

description: Love this place ... met some friends there on Sunday night.   It has real soul ... real folks who seem to really enjoy what they do.   The food was good ... try the pollo chicharron!   The red snapper "basket" was so-so ... could have been fresher ... but it was a Sunday night so I'll be forgiving.  The Limon ceviche was also stellar.
author: David M.

description: Excellent ceviche!  This is a great place to go w/ a couple of friends...sharing the various ceviche dishes together works out well.  THe wine list is not bad and the prices are reasonable.  Can't wait to go back and try an entre.  Recomend this place for sure =)
author: K Y.

description: I had a seafood dish here that was awful. I love great food and am not picky if it's not the best, but this was so bad. I couldn't eat it. Maybe the chef had a bad day, but I'm certainly not going back. For that price you should be able to rely on good food - especially in San Francisco.
author: v h.

description: We visited Limon this past weekend and found the food and service to be superb. We had a group of 12 which can always be tricky, but they made it so easy by giving us a pre fix menu. For $55 we started out with a seafood ceviche that came with roasted corn nuts, followed by the hit of the night which was the most delicious beef empanadas. I think Mark ate everyones left over empanadas. I had the chicken which was like no other chicken I have ever tasted. It was so tender and flavor full and the macaroni and cheese to accompany the dish was orgasmic. Yes you heard me. It was THAT good. Mark had the flank steak which he seemed to devour so I think he liked it. They ended the night with a type of mango flan, fresh mango's and a mango gelato. It was so nice to have something beside your typical dessert on a pri fix menu. It was light and refreshing after a somewhat heavy meal. All in all we loved it. However after speaking with the group, there were more than a few that were popping tums like they were candy. So beware, although the meal is great, your stomach may not agree so much after the fact.
author: Melissa P.

description: so i ended up giving this place a try last night after a FULL day of watching football and drinking. so yeah, my friends and i were pretty tanked. why i haven't given this place a try before this and while in a sober state baffles me. this place was seriously some good eats. we started off with a couple of appetizers: calamari fritos (with chipotle aioli) which was very good. my mind went blank ... i can't remember the other appetizer but it was good too! for my main course, i got the pollo latino. yeah, i hate ordering chicken at a nice restaurant, but i was really craving chicken last night! anyways, the highlight of the dish was the truffle infused mashed potatoes. BUT the highlight of the dinner was my friend's dish ... he got the steak ... and the sauce/gravy was amazing. read mark c.'s review (see below) to get his take on it and how his friends dipped anything and everything in it! so good! in wrap up, despite my slight drunkeness, this place kicked ass. i will definately be back and try some other things on the menu. it's also conveniently located to a lot of my favourite mission bars so you can get tanked after your dinner.
author: James J.

description: Limon restaurant. It is nice place to talk loud. Food was OK but was salty though. Our waiter was a guy who named Mike. He was unprofessional. He should not be working at that nice restaurant. Only one bad person can make restaurant look bad. He was not that friendly. He was just waiting to get his tips. First he added drinks on the bill which we did not have then we asked politely if he could fix it... He didn`t even say sorry. All he said was I will call the manager. Manager fixed the bill. Then when we pay Mike came back with another bill. He could not even explain what is he doing. We were tired, so just wanna get out. We gave him our cards. And he came back with over charged bill... he charged from one of our card over 30 bucks. He didn`t apologize or anything. He took the card back... bla bla bla.  6 people, we all think he is not the kind of guy who can work with customers. We were so patient... ONLY ONE ASS HOLE CAN MAKE THE PLACE LOOK BAD ... we liked the restaurant but definitely not coming back or never gonna recommend to anyone.
author: Sassy S.

description: What a bummer!The sauces served with the bread were divine, so were the empanadas, potato terrine, mac 'n cheese,and sweet potato fries.Service was mediocre but what was unforgiveable was the treatment we suffered at the hands of the manager, Enrique.We were a party of 5 and while our plates were still in front of us, I ordered another sangria. No one brought it, they gave us dessert menus, still no Sangria.We opted out of dessert, still no Sangria. Enrique gave us the bill and I was charged for the Sangria which I never received. He asked us to leave.He said he'd take it off the bill and I said no, if someone had brought the Sangria when I ordered it, 15 minutes earlier, we'd be long gone.Someone finally brought it. As it was, we had the table only about an hour and a half.The waiter was apologetic but Enrique's behaviour was unforgivable and he acted like he could care less if we came back! Well guess what, we won't, ever!
author: Shelly E.

description: On Saturday, October 24, my party of 4 had a birthday dinner at Limon.  We had a reservation, and were immediately seated downstairs.  The wait staff was very attentive without hovering.  For each course, the waiter was always ready to take our orders, and the food arrived quickly, except for a little longer wait before dessert arrived, which was fine.  We all agreed that the portions were plenty. The noise level was low enough for us to very easily carry on a conversation.  One of us ordered the red snapper.  The other three each ordered the chicken with macaroni and cheese.  He raved about the red snapper.  We all raved about the chicken (though a little too much salt) and the macaroni and cheese.  A variety of appetizers were excellent.  The desserts were excellent.  We also had a large carafe of sangria, which was very good (though not the best I've ever had).  We all agreed that it was a wonderful evening, and we would certainly dine at Limon  again, as well as recommend it to others.
author: Eddie W.

description: i was here on the 31st and found a hair in my salad i called the waiter and told him what happen. he took the plate and ask me if i wanted another salad....he was mad at me...this restaurant is not all that
author: gerardo g.

description: this place is okay. they have a mushroom app. that is to die for. other than that. probably wouldn't go back.
author: Miss O.

description: Yum!  Good food and a fun atmosphere with very attentive and super hot waiters (if you like Latin men).  We had a reservation for 7:30 but were not seated until 8pm as everyone has to be present to be seating and parking in that area is super tough.  The lime and orange walls make it seem cozy but it is very loud and could use some fabric or something on the walls to absorb the noise.  There were 4 of us and we shared 3 appetizers of calamari, ok but not too unique or memorable, empanada, very good flaky crust not at all bready we each were able to taste a half since it came with 2 medium sized empanadas they were very tasty & the tuna tartate very good and a big portion but the sesame oil made it pretty rich and I think it would be too salty and richto eat a whole plate by yourself.  For dinner my mom and I had the snapper fish basket.  It was excellent with a unique presentation and the fish and coconut rice were very tasty.  My brother had the lomo not a very big portion but the meat was tender and marniated in delicious spices.  My dad had the mixed seafood with a sauce and he liked it.  The wine list is pretty pricey (the chepaest bottle with $40) considering the cost of entrees but we brought our own wine & paid the $15 corkage.
author: Melanie -.

description: fantastic food, great decor, amazing ambiance, very good service and oh the best eye candy ever..:) would go here again and again..
author: Aditi M.

description: everyone raves about this place, and i had wanted to try it for awhile.........but what a dissapointment. the service was horrible and the food, while good, was luke warm. a poor effort
author: steve s.
